His legs, tightly pressing against his shiny boots, looked as if they might burst the laces at the top, and one could see the rippling muscles moving each time his shoulders shifted beneath the thin coat. This was a body capable of tremendous strength, a brutal body.
tr_translation: New Haven had changed a lot since we last met. In front of me stood an arrogant man in his thirties, with bright blonde hair, looking down on others. His shining, insolent eyes spread a sense of dominance across his face, and his posture gave the impression that he was leaning forward in anger at something. Even the feminine appearance of his riding outfit couldn't hide the immense power of his body. His feet filled his shiny boots so much that the laces on top could barely be tied. When he moved his shoulders under his thin garment, the massive muscles beneath could be felt. It was a body full of great strength, and at the same time, cruel.
es_translation: He had changed since the days of New Haven. Now he was a thirty-year-old man, strong, blond like straw, with a hard set to his mouth and an air of self-sufficiency. His eyes, shining with arrogance, dominated his face and gave him the appearance of always being aggressively forward. Not even the ostentatious and effeminate elegance of the riding suit could hide the enormous vigor of that body: it seemed to fill those gleaming boots to the point of straining the laces that topped them, and the reaction of the imposing muscle mass was perceptible when the shoulder moved under the light jacket. It was a body capable of developing enormous strength: a cruel body.

en: His speaking voice, a gruff husky tenor, added to the impression of fractiousness he conveyed. There was a touch of paternal contempt in it, even toward people he liked—and there were men at New Haven who had hated his guts.
vi: Giọng nam khan cao cộc lốc của Tom càng làm tăng vẻ cau có trong lối diễn đạt. Cộng thêm lối khinh người kẻ cả n gay cả đối cả với những người anh thích, khi còn trong trường ở New Haven đã không thiếu người ghét Tom cay đắng.
tr: Konuşurken çıkardığı tenor tonundaki boğuk sesi, hırçın görüntüsünü daha da güçlendiriyordu. Sesinde -sevdiği kişiler de buna dahildi- zorbaca bir küçümsemenin izleri vardı. New Haven’da ondan nefret eden bir sürü insan olduğu geldi aklıma.
es: Cuando hablaba, su voz de tenor, ronca y bronca, aumentaba la impresión de displicencia que transmitía. Aquella voz tenía un dejo de desprecio paternal, incluso hacia la gente que le caía simpática. Había hombres en New Haven que lo detestaban.
vi_translation: Tom's high-pitched, hoarse voice further accentuated the gruffness in his manner of speaking. Adding to that was his condescending attitude. Even with those he liked, when he was still in school in New Haven, there was no shortage of people who bitterly hated Tom.
tr_translation: The husky tenor tone of his voice when he spoke further reinforced his fierce appearance. There were traces of a bullying disdain in his voice - even towards those he loved. I remembered that there were a lot of people in New Haven who hated him.
es_translation: When he spoke, his tenor voice, hoarse and rough, increased the impression of indifference that he conveyed. That voice had a hint of paternal disdain, even towards people he liked. There were men in New Haven who detested him.

en: We talked for a few minutes on the sunny porch.
vi: Chúng tôi đứng hàn huyên với nhau vài phút trước hiên nhà ngập nắng.
tr: Güneşli taraçada birkaç dakika sohbet ettik.
es: Hablamos unos minutos en el porche, al sol.
vi_translation: We stood chatting with each other for a few minutes on the sunlit porch.
tr_translation: We chatted for a few minutes on the sunny terrace.
es_translation: We talked for a few minutes on the porch, in the sun.

en: “I’ve got a nice place here,” he said, his eyes flashing about restlessly.
vi: "Tôi kiếm được nơi này ở tuyệt quá." Tom nói, đôi mắt mang đầy nét phô trương di động không ngừng.
tr: “Güzel bir yer yaptım burayı” dedi parıldayan gözlerini etrafta gezdirirken.
es: —Está bien este sitio —dijo, mirando a todas partes con ojos inquietos.
vi_translation: "I found this place to be amazing." Tom said, his eyes full of ostentatiousness, constantly moving.
tr_translation: "I made this place beautiful," he said while his sparkling eyes wandered around.
es_translation: —This place is fine —he said, looking around with restless eyes.

en: Turning me around by one arm, he moved a broad flat hand along the front vista, including in its sweep a sunken Italian garden, a half acre of deep, pungent roses, and a snub-nosed motorboat that bumped the tide offshore.
vi: Tom đưa một tay xoay mình tôi lại, sau đó chìa bàn tay bè rộng chỉ ra phía trước để khoe. Nhìn theo vòng đảo của bàn tay tôi thấy gồm có một khu vườn chìm kiểu Ý, nửa mẫu hoa hồng loại gắt hương và một chiếc tàu máy mũi hếch đang bồng bềnh trên sóng nước ngoài khơi.
tr: Bir taraftan kolumdan tutup beni yönlendirirken, diğer taraftan da geniş, yassı eliyle önümüzdeki manzara boyunca, çukurda kalmış İtalyan tarzı bahçeyi, yarım dönümlük alandaki güzel kokulu gülleri, kıyıdan biraz açıkta dalgaların üzerinde seken kalkık burunlu motoru gösteriyordu.
es: Hizo que me volviera, cogiéndome del brazo, y fue señalando con la mano grande y abierta el panorama que se extendía ante nosotros, incluyendo en su recorrido un jardín a la italiana, dos mil metros cuadrados de rosales de penetrante e intenso olor, y una lancha motora, chata de proa, a la que zarandeaba la marea a poca distancia de la costa.
vi_translation: Tom used one hand to turn me around, then extended his broad hand forward to show off. Following the sweep of his hand, I saw an Italian-style sunken garden, half an acre of intensely fragrant roses, and a motorboat with a raised bow bobbing on the offshore waves.
tr_translation: While he was guiding me by holding my arm with one hand, with his other broad, flat hand, he was pointing out the Italian-style garden sunk in the hollow, the fragrant roses in the half-acre area, and the upturned-nose motorboat bouncing on the waves a little off the shore.
es_translation: He made me turn around, grabbing me by the arm, and pointed with his large, open hand at the panorama that stretched out before us, including in his sweep an Italian garden, two thousand square meters of roses with a penetrating and intense fragrance, and a motorboat, flat at the bow, which the tide was rocking a short distance from the shore.

en: “It belonged to Demaine, the oil man.” He turned me around again, politely and abruptly. “We’ll go inside.”
vi: "Nhà này trước của Demain, vua giầu hỏa." Tom xoay người tôi thêm một lần nữa, một cách lịch sự nhưng đột ngột. "Mình hãy vào trong nhà đi."
tr: “Bu arazi şu petrol zengini Demaine’e aitmiş” cümlesini söylemesiyle kolumdan tutarak çevirdi ve kibar bir tavırla “İçeri girelim” dedi.
es: —Era de Demaine, el del petróleo —otra vez me obligó a volverme, brusco y cortés—. Entremos.
vi_translation: "This house used to belong to Demain, the king of wealth." Tom turned me around once more, politely but abruptly. "Let's go inside."
tr_translation: As he said the sentence, "This land belongs to that oil tycoon Demaine," he turned me around by grabbing my arm and politely said, "Let's go inside."
es_translation: —It was Demaine, the one from the oil —once again he forced me to turn around, brusque and courteous—. Let's go in.

en: We walked through a high hallway into a bright rosy-coloured space, fragilely bound into the house by French windows at either end. The windows were ajar and gleaming white against the fresh grass outside that seemed to grow a little way into the house. A breeze blew through the room, blew curtains in at one end and out the other like pale flags, twisting them up toward the frosted wedding-cake of the ceiling, and then rippled over the wine-coloured rug, making a shadow on it as wind does on the sea.
vi: Chúng tôi đi ngang qua một hành lang cao vào tới một căn phòng màu hồng phấn tươi, hai đầu căn phòng được nối dính vào căn nhà một cách thanh tú bởi những cửa sổ kính. Những cửa sổ này đang hé mở, màu trắng chiếu lấp lánh tương phản với màu thảm cỏ tươi bên ngoài và đám cỏ dường như đang muốn mọc lấn cả vào bên trong. Một làn gió nhẹ hiu hiu thổi qua căn phòng làm những tấm màn cửa bay lên như những lá cờ, gió xoắn chúng lại rồi thổi phồng lên trên trần nhà được trang trí theo kiểu mặt kem bánh cưới, sau đó gió tiếp tục thổi lướt qua tấm thảm màu rượu vang tạo thành những vết gợn trên mặt thảm giống như gió gợn trên mặt biển.
tr: Yüksek tavanlı, geniş bir holden ilerleyerek Fransız tarzı pencerelerinin olduğu gül renkli, aydınlık bir odaya vardık. Hafif aralık duran camların yansımaları taze çimenlerin üzerine düşüyordu. Perdeler odayı dolduran esinti ile soluk bayraklar gibi dalgalanıyor, bazen süslü bir düğün pastasına benzeyen tavana doğru yükseliyor, kıvrılıp bükülerek şarap rengi halının üzerinde denizi ürperten rüzgar gibi gölgeler oluşturuyorlardı.
es: Atravesamos un vestíbulo de techo muy alto hasta un espacio rosa y luminoso, que se unía frágilmente a la casa por dos puertas de cristales. Las cristaleras estaban entreabiertas y brillaban, blancas, en contraste con la hierba fresca del exterior, que casi parecía entrar dentro de la casa. En la habitación soplaba una brisa ligera: agitaba las cortinas como banderas pálidas y divididas entre el interior y el exterior, las retorcía hacia el techo, una especie de tarta de boda, y rizaba el tapiz de color vino, oscureciéndolo, como el viento oscurece el mar.
vi_translation: We walked through a tall corridor into a room of bright pink, with both ends of the room elegantly connected to the house by glass windows. These windows were slightly open, their white frames sparkling in contrast to the fresh green grass outside, which seemed to be trying to grow into the room. A gentle breeze blew through the room, lifting the curtains like flags, twisting them and then inflating them against the ceiling decorated like wedding cake frosting, before continuing to ripple across the wine-colored carpet, creating waves on its surface like the wind on the sea.
tr_translation: We proceeded through a high-ceilinged, spacious hall and arrived at a bright, rose-colored room with French-style windows. The reflections of the slightly ajar windows were falling onto the fresh grass. The curtains were fluttering like pale flags with the breeze filling the room, sometimes rising towards the ceiling that resembled an ornate wedding cake, curling and twisting to create shadows on the wine-colored carpet like the wind rippling the sea.
es_translation: We crossed a high-ceilinged lobby to a pink and luminous space, which was tenuously connected to the house by two glass doors. The glass doors were ajar and shone, white, in contrast with the fresh grass outside, which almost seemed to enter the house. A light breeze blew in the room: it fluttered the curtains like pale flags divided between the inside and the outside, twisted them towards the ceiling, a sort of wedding cake, and rippled the wine-colored tapestry, darkening it, like the wind darkens the sea.

en: The only completely stationary object in the room was an enormous couch on which two young women were buoyed up as though upon an anchored balloon. They were both in white, and their dresses were rippling and fluttering as if they had just been blown back in after a short flight around the house. I must have stood for a few moments listening to the whip and snap of the curtains and the groan of a picture on the wall. Then there was a boom as Tom Buchanan shut the rear windows and the caught wind died out about the room, and the curtains and the rugs and the two young women ballooned slowly to the floor.
vi: Chỉ có một vật đứng yên không di động trong phòng là chiếc ghế dựa dài to khổng lồ với hai thiếu nữ đang ngồi ở trên, họ trông giống như đang thả nổi lơ lửng trên chiếc bong bóng bị cột neo bên dưới. Cả hai đều mặc áo đầm trắng, áo của họ uốn lượn phập phồng giống như cả hai vừa được thổi về lại chỗ cũ sau một chuyến bay ngắn chung quanh căn nhà. Tôi chắc hẳn đã đứng đó yên một lát để lắng nghe tiếng quật đập phành phạch của tấm màn cửa và tiếng rên rỉ kẽo kẹt của tấm tranh treo trên tường. Một tiếng đập sầm thật to khi Tom đóng cánh cửa sổ bên hông lại, thế là gió tắt hẳn, kể cả những tấm màn cửa, kể cả những tấm thảm, và chiếc bong bóng chứa hai thiếu nữ cũng từ từ hạ xuống dưới đất.
tr: Salondaki tek hareketsiz nesne iki genç kadının, üzerinde çapaya bağlı şamandıralar gibi kımıldanıp durduğu heybetli bir kanepeydi. İkisi de beyazlar içindeydi. İncecik giysileri evin içinde uçuştuktan sonra oldukları yere gelip konmuşlar gibi titreşiyorlardı. Bir süre perdelerin çıkardığı kırbaç seslerini ve duvardaki tablonun iniltisini dinlemek için orada öylece durmuş olmalıyım. Sonra Tom Buchanan arka pencereleri gürültüyle kapattı ve odayı dolduran esinti içeride sönüp gitti. Perdeler, halı ve iki genç kadının giysileri yavaşça hareketsizleştiler.
es: El único objeto que permanecía absolutamente inmóvil en la habitación era un enorme sofá en el que dos jóvenes flotaban como sobre un globo sujeto a tierra. Las dos iban de blanco y sus vestidos ondeaban y aleteaban como recién llegados de un vuelo fugaz alrededor de la casa. Tuve que permanecer de pie un rato, escuchando los latigazos de las cortinas y el chirriar de un cuadro en la pared. Entonces se oyó una explosión: Tom Buchanan había cerrado las ventanas traseras, y cesó el viento atrapado en la habitación, y las cortinas, los tapices y los vestidos de las dos mujeres volvieron a posarse lentamente en el suelo.
vi_translation: The only thing that remained stationary in the room was the enormous long chair with two young women sitting on it, looking as if they were floating on a balloon tethered below. Both were wearing white dresses, their clothes billowing as if they had just been blown back to their original spot after a short flight around the house. I must have stood there quietly for a moment, listening to the flapping sound of the curtains and the creaking groan of the picture hanging on the wall. A loud bang occurred when Tom closed the side window, and the wind ceased entirely, along with the curtains, the rugs, and the balloon containing the two young women slowly descended to the ground.
tr_translation: The only motionless object in the living room was a majestic sofa on which two young women were moving about like buoys tied to an anchor. Both were dressed in white. Their delicate clothes seemed to flutter around the house and then settle where they were, trembling. I must have stood there for a while, listening to the whip-like sounds of the curtains and the moaning of the painting on the wall. Then Tom Buchanan noisily closed the back windows, and the breeze that filled the room died down inside. The curtains, the carpet, and the clothes of the two young women slowly became still.
es_translation: The only object that remained absolutely still in the room was a huge sofa on which two young women floated as if on a balloon tethered to the ground. Both were dressed in white, and their dresses billowed and fluttered as if they had just arrived from a fleeting flight around the house. I had to stand for a while, listening to the whipping of the curtains and the creaking of a picture on the wall. Then there was an explosion: Tom Buchanan had closed the rear windows, and the trapped wind in the room ceased, and the curtains, tapestries, and the dresses of the two women slowly settled back to the floor.

en: The younger of the two was a stranger to me. She was extended full length at her end of the divan, completely motionless, and with her chin raised a little, as if she were balancing something on it which was quite likely to fall. If she saw me out of the corner of her eyes she gave no hint of it—indeed, I was almost surprised into murmuring an apology for having disturbed her by coming in.
vi: Trong hai người, tôi không quen biết người thiếu nữ trẻ tuổi hơn. Cô ta nằm duỗi người bên một đầu chiếc ghế hoàn toàn không cử động, cằm hơi nhếch lên một chút làm như đang cố thăng bằng vật gì đó trên cằm đang sắp rớt. Thật ra nếu cô gái đó có nhìn thấy tôi qua khóe mắt của mình hay không thì tôi cũng không biết, bởi vì cô chẳng biểu lộ một biểu hiện gì cả. Tôi ngạc nhiên đến nỗi gần như tính lầm bầm nói câu xin lỗi vì sự xuất hiện của mình đã làm phiền họ.
tr: İki kadından, daha genç olanı tanımıyordum. Divanın bir ucuna uzanmış, hiç hareket etmeden duruyor, çenesini sanki bir şeyi dengede tutuyor gibi hafif yukarda tutuyordu. Bana göz ucuyla bakıyorsa bile anlaşılmıyordu. Neredeyse içeri girip onu rahatsız ettiğim için özür dileyecektim.
es: No conocía a la más joven. Se había tendido en la parte que ocupaba en el sofá, completamente quieta, con el mentón un poco levantado, como si mantuviera en equilibrio algo que estaba a punto de derrumbarse. Si me había visto de reojo, no lo demostró, y casi me sorprendí murmurando una disculpa por haberla molestado al entrar en la habitación.
vi_translation: Of the two people, I was not acquainted with the younger woman. She lay stretched out at one end of the bench, completely motionless, her chin slightly raised as if trying to balance something on it that was about to fall. In fact, whether she saw me through the corner of her eye or not, I couldn't tell, because she didn't show any expression at all. I was so surprised that I almost mumbled an apology for my presence disturbing them.
tr_translation: I did not know the younger of the two women. She was lying at one end of the divan, staying completely still, holding her chin slightly up as if balancing something. Even if she was glancing at me from the corner of her eye, it was not noticeable. I was almost going to apologize for disturbing her by entering.
es_translation: I didn't know the youngest one. She had lain down in the part of the sofa she occupied, completely still, with her chin slightly raised, as if balancing something that was about to collapse. If she had seen me out of the corner of her eye, she didn't show it, and I almost found myself murmuring an apology for having disturbed her by entering the room.

en: The other girl, Daisy, made an attempt to rise—she leaned slightly forward with a conscientious expression—then she laughed, an absurd, charming little laugh, and I laughed too and came forward into the room.
vi: Người thứ hai, Daisy ít ra cũng có cố gắng nhổm lên. Nàng hơi nghiêng mình tới trước với vẻ mặt cẩn trọng, sau đó bật lên tiếng cười nhỏ, một cái cười lố bịch duyên dáng. Tôi cũng cười theo và sau đó bước vào phòng.
tr: Öteki, yani Daisy kalkacakmış gibi hareketlendi –yüzünde özenli bir ifadeyle hafifçe eğildi- sonra tuhaf ama çekici bir kahkaha attı. Ben de güldüm ve ona doğru yürüdüm.
es: La otra chica, Daisy, hizo ademán de levantarse —se inclinó hacia delante con expresión decidida—, y entonces se rió, con una risilla absurda y encantadora, y yo también me reí y me acerqué.
vi_translation: The second person, Daisy, at least made an effort to sit up. She leaned slightly forward with a cautious expression, then let out a small, charmingly ridiculous laugh. I laughed along and then stepped into the room.
tr_translation: The other one, that is, Daisy, moved as if she was about to get up – slightly bending with a careful expression on her face – then she let out a strange but charming laugh. I laughed too and walked towards her.
es_translation: The other girl, Daisy, made a motion to get up —she leaned forward with a determined expression—, and then she laughed, with an absurd and charming giggle, and I laughed too and moved closer.

en: She laughed again, as if she said something very witty, and held my hand for a moment, looking up into my face, promising that there was no one in the world she so much wanted to see. That was a way she had. She hinted in a murmur that the surname of the balancing girl was Baker. (I’ve heard it said that Daisy’s murmur was only to make people lean toward her; an irrelevant criticism that made it no less charming.)
vi: Daisy nắm tay tôi một chặp, sau đó ngước mắt lên nhìn vào mặt tôi như cam đoan nàng không mong gặp ai hơn ngoài tôi ra; cách thức của Daisy xưa nay luôn như vậy. Nàng thì thầm giới thiệu cho tôi biết họ của cô gái đang làm động tác cân bằng kia là Baker. (Tôi nghe người ta đồn rằng Daisy hay nói thì thầm chỉ cố ý để người ta nghiêng lại gần nàng hơn. Một câu trỉ chích không chính đáng như vậy không làm giảm đi nét duyên dáng của nàng).
tr: Sonra nükteli bir şey söylemişçesine yeniden güldü. Elimi tutarken, dünyada en çok görmek istediği kişi benmişim gibi yüzüme bakıyordu. O her zaman böyleydi. Biraz yaklaşıp, çenesinde bir şeyleri dengelemeye uğraşan kızın adının Baker olduğunu fısıldadı. (Daisy’nin fısıldama alışkanlığının insanların ona doğru eğilmelerini sağlamak için olduğunu duymuştum. Bu yersiz eleştiri onun çekiciliğini hiçbir zaman azaltmıyordu elbette.
es: Volvió a reírse, como si hubiera dicho algo muy ingenioso, y retuvo mi mano un instante, mirándome a los ojos, prometiendo que no había nadie en el mundo a quien deseara ver más. Así era ella. Me dijo en un susurro que el apellido de la joven equilibrista era Baker. (He oído decir que el único fin del susurro de Daisy era que la gente se inclinara hacia ella: una crítica irrelevante que no disminuía su encanto.)
vi_translation: Daisy held my hand for a moment, then looked up at my face as if to assure me that she didn't wish to meet anyone more than me; Daisy's manner has always been like that. She whispered to introduce me to the girl performing the balancing act, whose last name was Baker. (I heard rumors that Daisy often whispered just to make people lean closer to her. Such an unjust criticism did not diminish her charm).
tr_translation: Then she laughed again as if she had said something witty. While holding my hand, she was looking at my face as if I were the person she wanted to see most in the world. She was always like this. She leaned in a bit and whispered that the girl trying to balance something on her chin was named Baker. (I had heard that Daisy’s habit of whispering was to make people lean towards her. This unfounded criticism never diminished her charm, of course.)
es_translation: She laughed again, as if she had said something very clever, and held my hand for a moment, looking into my eyes, promising that there was no one in the world she wished to see more. That was how she was. She whispered to me that the young acrobat's last name was Baker. (I have heard it said that the only purpose of Daisy's whisper was to make people lean towards her: an irrelevant criticism that did not diminish her charm.)

en: At any rate, Miss Baker’s lips fluttered, she nodded at me almost imperceptibly, and then quickly tipped her head back again—the object she was balancing had obviously tottered a little and given her something of a fright. Again a sort of apology arose to my lips. Almost any exhibition of complete self-sufficiency draws a stunned tribute from me.
vi: Đôi môi của Baker bắt đầu mấp máy. Cô gật đầu chào tôi, nhẹ đến nỗi khó có thể nhìn ra, sau đó lại nhanh chóng ngửa đầu đầu ra sau như cũ. Vật mà Baker đang cân bằng rõ ràng như sắp rớt khiến cô sợ hãi. Một lần nữa tôi lại xém thốt thoát ra những lời giống như xin lỗi. Tôi quay lại nhìn Daisy khi cô em họ bắt đầu hỏi han với giọng nói trầm trầm đầy truyền cảm.
tr: Nasıl olduysa, Bayan Baker’in dudakları kımıldamıştı. Belli belirsiz bir hareketle beni selamladıktan sonra başını geriye attı. Dengede tutmaya çalıştığı nesne biraz sarsılmış olmalı ki irkilivermişti. Ondan yine özür dileyecek oldum. Nedense kendine yeten böylesi insanlar her zaman için takdirimi toplamıştır.
es: Pero los labios de miss Baker se movieron, se inclinó casi imperceptiblemente para saludarme, e inmediatamente volvió a erguirse: el objeto que mantenía en equilibrio se había tambaleado y le había dado un susto. Otra vez me vino a los labios una especie de disculpa. Ante las demostraciones de suficiencia absoluta casi siempre me rindo, anonadado.
vi_translation: Baker's lips began to move. She nodded to me, so slightly that it was barely noticeable, then quickly tilted her head back as before. The object that Baker was balancing seemed about to fall, making her anxious. Once again, I almost blurted out words that sounded like an apology. I turned back to look at Daisy as my cousin began to ask questions in a deep, resonant voice.
tr_translation: Somehow, Mrs. Baker's lips had moved. After greeting me with a barely perceptible motion, she threw her head back. The object she was trying to balance must have wobbled a bit, as she started slightly. I was about to apologize to her again. For some reason, I have always admired such self-sufficient people.
es_translation: But Miss Baker's lips moved, she leaned almost imperceptibly to greet me, and immediately straightened up again: the object she was balancing had wobbled and given her a fright. Once again, a sort of apology came to my lips. In the face of displays of absolute self-sufficiency, I almost always surrender, stunned.

en: I looked back at my cousin, who began to ask me questions in her low, thrilling voice. It was the kind of voice that the ear follows up and down, as if each speech is an arrangement of notes that will never be played again. Her face was sad and lovely with bright things in it, bright eyes and a bright passionate mouth, but there was an excitement in her voice that men who had cared for her found difficult to forget: a singing compulsion, a whispered “Listen,” a promise that she had done gay, exciting things just a while since and that there were gay, exciting things hovering in the next hour.
vi: Tôi quay lại nhìn Daisy khi cô em họ bắt đầu hỏi han với giọng nói trầm trầm đầy truyền cảm. Đó là loại giọng nói khiến cho tai người nghe phải hướng theo lên xuống, làm như mỗi lời nói là mỗi sắp xếp của những nốt nhạc sẽ không bao giờ được đánh thêm lần nữa. Khuôn mặt của Daisy mang nét trầm buồn xinh đẹp, trên nó có chứa đựng những cái tươi sáng rực rỡ - đó là đôi mắt tươi sáng long lanh và chiếc miệng tươi nồng nàn quyến rũ. Tuy nhiên, sự quyến rũ nhất của Daisy chính là giọng nói, nó chứa đựng một sự sống động khiến cho những người đàn ông đang yêu nàng sẽ rất khó có thể quên: chẳng hạn như lời nài nỉ du dương, lời thì thầm "hãy lắng nghe em nói", lời kể lể thiết tha rằng mình mới vừa trải qua những giây phút vui tươi và rằng còn nhiều chuyện vui hơn nữa đang chuẩn bị tới trong vòng một giờ đồng hồ.
tr: O boğuk, titrek sesiyle sorular soran kuzenime döndüm tekrar. İnsanın kulak kesildiği, bir daha duyamayacağı bir melodiyi dinliyormuş gibi iniş çıkışlarını takip ettiği bir sesti bu. Yüzü sevimli ve hüzünlü, parıldayan gözleri ve şehvetli ıslak dudakları dikkat çekiciydi ama ona ilgi duyan erkeklerin unutamadığı asıl, insana heyecan veren sesiydi. Cezbeden bir şarkı, “dinle” diye fısıldayan, az önce coşkulu ve kışkırtıcı şeyler yaptığına, bir saat içinde yine coşkulu ve kışkırtıcı şeyler yapacağına dair bir vaatti.
es: Miré de nuevo a mi prima, que empezó a hacerme preguntas con voz grave, perturbadora. Era una de esas voces que el oído sigue en sus descensos y subidas, como si cada frase fuera una sucesión de notas que jamás volverán a sonar juntas. Tenía una cara triste y deliciosa, con detalles luminosos —los ojos luminosos y la luz apasionada de la boca— y había en su voz una emoción que los hombres que la habían querido no podían olvidar: una vehemencia cantarina, un «óyeme» susurrado, la promesa de que acababa de vivir momentos felices y vibrantes y que momentos felices y vibrantes esperaban en la próxima hora.
vi_translation: I turned back to look at Daisy as my cousin began to ask questions in a deep, resonant voice. It was the kind of voice that made the listener's ears follow its rise and fall, as if each word was an arrangement of musical notes that would never be played again. Daisy's face bore a beautiful melancholy, containing radiant brightness - those were her sparkling bright eyes and her passionately charming mouth. However, the most captivating thing about Daisy was her voice, which held a liveliness that made it very difficult for the men who loved her to forget: for instance, the melodious pleading, the whisper "listen to me," the earnest recounting that she had just experienced joyful moments and that even more joy was coming within the next hour.
tr_translation: I turned again to my cousin, who was asking questions with his hoarse, trembling voice. It was a voice that one would follow its ups and downs as if listening to a melody they would never hear again, a melody that made people perk up their ears. His face was cute and sad, his sparkling eyes and sensual wet lips were noticeable, but what men who were interested in him could never forget was his voice that excited people. It was an enticing song, a promise that whispered "listen," suggesting that he had just done something enthusiastic and provocative, and that he would do something enthusiastic and provocative again within an hour.
es_translation: I looked again at my cousin, who began asking me questions in a deep, disturbing voice. It was one of those voices that the ear follows in its descents and ascents, as if each phrase were a succession of notes that would never sound together again. She had a sad and delightful face, with luminous details —the luminous eyes and the passionate light of the mouth— and there was an emotion in her voice that the men who had loved her could not forget: a singing vehemence, a whispered "hear me," the promise that she had just lived happy and vibrant moments and that happy and vibrant moments awaited in the next hour.

en: I told her how I had stopped off in Chicago for a day on my way East, and how a dozen people had sent their love through me.
vi: Tôi kể cho Daisy nghe chuyện trên đường đi qua miền Đông tôi đã ghé ngang qua Chicago như thế nào, và đã có khoảng một chục người nhắn gửi tình cảm của họ tới Daisy ra sao.
tr: Buraya gelirken bir günlüğüne Chicago’ya uğradığımı ve bir düzine insanın ona selamlarını ilettiğini söyledim.
es: Le conté que había pasado un día en Chicago, camino del Este, y que todo el mundo me había dado besos para ella.
vi_translation: I told Daisy about how on my way through the East I had stopped by Chicago, and how about a dozen people had sent their regards to Daisy.
tr_translation: I told him that I had stopped by Chicago for a day on my way here and that a dozen people had sent their regards to him.
es_translation: I told her that I had spent a day in Chicago, on my way to the East, and that everyone had sent kisses for her.

en: “Do they miss me?” she cried ecstatically.
vi: "Bọn họ nhớ em thật sao?" Daisy ngây ngất reo lên.
tr: “Beni özlemişler mi?” diye sordu heyecanla.
es: —¿Me echan de menos? —exclamó extasiada.
vi_translation: "Do they really miss me?" Daisy exclaimed in ecstasy.
tr_translation: “Did they miss me?” he asked excitedly.
es_translation: —Do you miss me? —she exclaimed, ecstatic.

en: “The whole town is desolate. All the cars have the left rear wheel painted black as a mourning wreath, and there’s a persistent wail all night along the north shore.”
vi: "Nguyên cả thành phố đều sầu não. Tất cả mọi chiếc xe đều cho sơn đen chiếc bánh bên trái phía sau để tượng trưng cho vòng hoa tang, và có những tiếng than van thương khóc dai dẳng suốt đêm trường dọc theo bờ bắc biển hồ."
tr: “Şehir perişan halde. Arabaların sol arka tekerlerini matem çelengi niyetine siyaha boyamışlar. Kuzey sahilinde de ağıtlar hiç dinmiyor.
es: —La ciudad entera está desolada. Todos los coches llevan la rueda izquierda trasera pintada de negro en señal de luto y, de noche, nunca se acaba el llanto en la orilla septentrional del lago[4].
vi_translation: "The entire city was in mourning. All the cars had their left rear wheel painted black to symbolize a mourning wreath, and there were continuous sounds of lamentation throughout the night along the northern shore of the lake."
tr_translation: "The city is in a miserable state. They have painted the left rear wheels of the cars black, as if in mourning. On the northern coast, the laments never cease."
es_translation: —The entire city is desolate. All the cars have the left rear wheel painted black as a sign of mourning, and at night, the weeping on the northern shore of the lake never ends[4].

en: “How gorgeous! Let’s go back, Tom. Tomorrow!” Then she added irrelevantly: “You ought to see the baby.”
vi: "Tuyệt quá! Hãy quay về đó đi, Tom. Ngày mai!" Sau đó Daisy nói thêm chẳng ăn nhằm gì tới chuyện đang nói. "Anh muốn gặp con của em không?"
tr: “Harika! Hadi dönelim, Tom. Hemen yarın!” Sonra hiç yeri değilken “Bebeği görmelisin” deyiverdi.
es: —¡Es maravilloso! ¡Tenernos que volver, Tom! ¡Mañana! —e incoherentemente añadió—. Tienes que ver a la niña.
vi_translation: "Great! Let's go back there, Tom. Tomorrow!" Then Daisy added something that had nothing to do with the ongoing conversation. "Do you want to meet my child?"
tr_translation: "Great! Let's go back, Tom." “Right away, tomorrow!” Then, quite out of place, she suddenly said, "You should see the baby."
es_translation: —It's wonderful! We have to go back, Tom! Tomorrow! —and incoherently added—. You have to see the girl.

en: “I’d like to.”
vi: "Anh muốn lắm."
tr: “Çok isterim.
es: —Me encantaría.
vi_translation: "I really want to."
tr_translation: “I would love to.”
es_translation: —I would love to.

en: “She’s asleep. She’s three years old. Haven’t you ever seen her?”
vi: "Con bé ngủ mất rồi. Nó lên ba tuổi. Anh chưa bao giờ gặp nó phải không?"
tr: “Şimdi uyuyor. Üç yaşına girdi. Daha önce görmemiş miydin?
es: —Está durmiendo. Tiene tres años. ¿No la has visto nunca?
vi_translation: "The little girl has fallen asleep." "She is three years old." "You have never met her, have you?"
tr_translation: “She is sleeping now. She turned three. Hadn't you seen her before?”
es_translation: —She is sleeping. She is three years old. Have you never seen her?

en: “Never.”
vi: "Chưa bao giờ."
tr: “Hayır.
es: —Nunca.
vi_translation: "Never."
tr_translation: "No."
es_translation: —Never.

en: “Well, you ought to see her. She’s—”
vi: "Thế thì anh nên gặp nó. Con bé..."
tr: “Öyleyse mutlaka görmelisin. O-”
es: —Bueno, tienes que verla. Es…
vi_translation: "Then you should meet her. The girl..."
tr_translation: "Then you absolutely must see it. He-"
es_translation: —Well, you have to see it. It's…

en: Tom Buchanan, who had been hovering restlessly about the room, stopped and rested his hand on my shoulder.
vi: Tom Buchanan nãy giờ vẫn cứ không ngừng lượn qua lượn lại trong căn phòng, bây giờ đứng lại và đặt tay lên vai tôi.
tr: Odanın içinde huzursuz adımlarla dolanan Tom Buchanan yanıma gelip elini omzuma koydu.
es: Tom Buchanan, que no había parado de rondar por la habitación, se detuvo y me apoyó una mano en el hombro.
vi_translation: Tom Buchanan had been pacing back and forth in the room, now he stopped and placed his hand on my shoulder.
tr_translation: Tom Buchanan, who was pacing restlessly inside the room, came up to me and put his hand on my shoulder.
es_translation: Tom Buchanan, who had not stopped pacing around the room, stopped and put a hand on my shoulder.

en: “What you doing, Nick?”
vi: "Nick, bây giờ anh đang làm nghề gì?"
tr: “Ne işle uğraşıyorsun, Nick?
es: —¿A qué te dedicas, Nick?
vi_translation: "Nick, what are you doing for a living now?"
tr_translation: “What do you do for a living, Nick?”
es_translation: —What do you do for a living, Nick?

en: “Who with?”
vi: "Với công ty nào?"
tr: “Kimin yanındasın?
es: —¿Con quiénes?
vi_translation: "With which company?"
tr_translation: "Whose side are you on?"
es_translation: —With whom?

en: I told him.
vi: Tôi đưa câu trả lời.
tr: Ona söyledim.
es: Se lo dije.
vi_translation: I give the answer.
tr_translation: I told her.
es_translation: I told him/her.

en: “Never heard of them,” he remarked decisively.
vi: "Chưa bao giờ nghe tới tên những công ty này." Tom trả lời một cách quả quyết.
tr: “Adını hiç duymadım” dedi kesin bir ifadeyle.
es: —Es la primera vez que oigo esos nombres —señaló tajantemente.
vi_translation: "I've never heard of these companies." Tom replied decisively.
tr_translation: "I've never heard of it," he said with a definitive tone.
es_translation: —It's the first time I've heard those names —he pointed out bluntly.

en: This annoyed me.
vi: Cách nói này khiến tôi bực mình.
tr: Bu biraz canımı sıkmıştı.
es: Me molestó.
vi_translation: This way of speaking annoyed me.
tr_translation: This had bothered me a bit.
es_translation: It bothered me.

en: “You will,” I answered shortly. “You will if you stay in the East.”
vi: Tôi trả lời cộc lốc. "Anh sẽ biết nếu như anh ở lại miền Đông này."
tr: “Duyarsın” diye yanıtladım kısaca. “tabii eğer Doğuda kalırsan.
es: —Los oirás —lo corté—. Los oirás si te quedas en el Este.
vi_translation: I responded curtly. "You would know if you stayed in the East." "Oh, don't worry, I will definitely stay in the East."
tr_translation: “You will hear,” I answered briefly. “of course, if you stay in the East.”
es_translation: —You will hear them —I cut him off—. You will hear them if you stay in the East.

en: “Oh, I’ll stay in the East, don’t you worry,” he said, glancing at Daisy and then back at me, as if he were alert for something more. “I’d be a God damned fool to live anywhere else.”
vi: "Ổ, anh đừng lo, tôi đương nhiên sẽ ở lại miền Đông này." Tom nói, liếc nhìn Daisy rồi lại quay sang nhìn tôi hình như đang cảnh giác cho những phản ứng khác. "Tôi có ngốc mới đi ở nơi khác."
tr: “Kalacağım merak etme” dedi önce Daisy’e, sonra bana bakarak. İtiraz gelmesini bekliyor gibiydi. “Başka bir yere gidecek kadar aptal değilim.
es: —Me quedaré en el Este, sí, no te preocupes —dijo, mirando a Daisy y luego otra vez a mí, como si esperara que añadiéramos algo—. Sería un imbécil de mierda si viviera en cualquier otra parte.
vi_translation: Tom said, glancing at Daisy and then back at me, seemingly wary of other reactions. "I would be foolish to go anywhere else."
tr_translation: “I will stay, don't worry,” he said first to Daisy, then looking at me. He seemed to be expecting an objection. “I'm not foolish enough to go somewhere else.”
es_translation: —I will stay in the East, yes, don't worry —he said, looking at Daisy and then at me again, as if he expected us to add something—. I would be a fucking idiot if I lived anywhere else.

en: At this point Miss Baker said: “Absolutely!” with such suddenness that I started—it was the first word she had uttered since I came into the room. Evidently it surprised her as much as it did me, for she yawned and with a series of rapid, deft movements stood up into the room.
vi: Ngay lúc đó đó Baker lên tiếng "Đương nhiên rồi!" Lời nó đột ngột này làm tôi giật mình. Đây là lời đầu tiên cô thốt lời kể từ lúc tôi bước vào phòng. Rõ ràng, điều này cũng gây ngạc nhiên ngay cả cho chính Baker chắng kém gì cho tôi. Cô ngáp dài và đứng lên sau một loạt những cử động khéo léo nhanh nhẹn.
tr: Tam o anda Bayan Baker öyle çabuk “Kesinlikle!” diye bağırdı ki irkildim. Odaya girdiğimden beri ilk kez konuşuyordu. Onun da en az benim kadar şaşırdığı belliydi. Esnedi ve çevik bir hareketle yerinden kalktı.
es: Entonces miss Baker soltó un «¡Por supuesto!» tan inesperado que me sobresalté: eran las primeras palabras que pronunciaba desde que yo había entrado en la habitación. Aquello la sorprendió tanto como a mí, evidentemente, porque bostezó y con una serie de movimientos ágiles y rápidos se puso de pie.
vi_translation: At that moment, Baker spoke up, "Of course!" This sudden statement startled me. These were the first words she had uttered since I entered the room. Clearly, this surprised Baker herself just as much as it did me. She yawned and stood up after a series of graceful, swift movements.
tr_translation: Just then, Mrs. Baker shouted "Absolutely!" so quickly that I was startled. It was the first time she had spoken since I entered the room. It was clear that she was at least as surprised as I was. She yawned and got up from her seat with a swift movement.
es_translation: Then Miss Baker let out a "Of course!" so unexpected that it startled me: they were the first words she had spoken since I had entered the room. That surprised her as much as it did me, evidently, because she yawned and with a series of quick and agile movements stood up.

en: “I’m stiff,” she complained, “I’ve been lying on that sofa for as long as I can remember.”
vi: "Người em tê cứng cả lên, em đã nằm đó không biết từ thủa nào." Baker than phiền.
tr: “Her yanım tutulmuş” diye yakındı, “ne kadardır şu kanepede yattığımı hatırlamıyorum.
es: —No puedo moverme —se quejó—. Llevo tumbada en ese sofá desde que tengo uso de razón.
vi_translation: "My body is completely numb, I've been lying here for who knows how long." Baker complained.
tr_translation: "I'm all stiff," she complained, "I don't remember how long I've been lying on this couch."
es_translation: —I can't move —she complained—. I've been lying on that couch since I can remember.

en: “Don’t look at me,” Daisy retorted, “I’ve been trying to get you to New York all afternoon.”
vi: "Đừng đổ lỗi cho chị, chị đã gắng sức rủ em đi New York nguyên cả chiều nay." Daisy đối đáp lại.
tr: “Hiç bana bakma” dedi Daisy, “sabahtan beri seni New York’a götürmeye uğraşıyorum.
es: —A mí no me mires —replicó Daisy—. Llevo toda la tarde intentando llevarte a Nueva York.
vi_translation: "Don't blame me, I tried my best to persuade you to go to New York all afternoon." Daisy retorted.
tr_translation: “Don’t look at me,” said Daisy, “I’ve been trying to take you to New York since morning.
es_translation: —Don't look at me —replied Daisy—. I've been trying to take you to New York all afternoon.

en: “No, thanks,” said Miss Baker to the four cocktails just in from the pantry. “I’m absolutely in training.”
vi: "Cám ơn không uống." Baker từ chối khi bốn ly cocktail vừa mới được đưa lên từ phòng ăn. "Em đang trong thời gian huấn luyện."
tr: Bayan Baker mutfaktan getirilen dört kokteyl kadehine göz atıp, “Hayır istemem” dedi, “antrenman yapıyorum.
es: —No, gracias —dijo miss Baker, a la vista de los cuatro cócteles que llegaban de la cocina en aquel preciso instante—. Estoy en pleno periodo de entrenamientos.
vi_translation: "No, thank you. I don't drink." Baker declined as four cocktails were just brought up from the dining room. "I'm in training."
tr_translation: Miss Baker glanced at the four cocktail glasses brought from the kitchen and said, “No, I don’t want any, I’m training.”
es_translation: —No, thank you —said Miss Baker, at the sight of the four cocktails arriving from the kitchen at that precise moment—. I am in the middle of training.

en: “You are!” He took down his drink as if it were a drop in the bottom of a glass. “How you ever get anything done is beyond me.”
vi: Người chủ nhà nhìn Baker một cách hoài nghi. "Vậy à?" Sau đó Tom cầm nốc cạn ly rượu của mình làm giống như nó chỉ có một giọt dưới đáy. "Tôi không biết cô làm sao có thể thực hiện được mọi chuyện của mình."
tr: “Sen mi!” dedi Tom kendi ka­dehini kafasına dikerken, “İşlerini nasıl hallettiğine aklım hiç ermiyor.
es: —¡Entrenamientos! —Tom se bebió el cóctel como si fuera una gota en el fondo de un vaso—. No entiendo cómo consigues lo que consigues.
vi_translation: "Really?" Then Tom drained his glass of wine as if there was only a drop left at the bottom. "I don't know how you manage to get everything done."
tr_translation: “Is it you!” said Tom as he downed his glass, “I can never understand how you manage your affairs.”
es_translation: —Trainings! —Tom drank the cocktail as if it were a drop at the bottom of a glass—. I don't understand how you achieve what you achieve.

en: I looked at Miss Baker, wondering what it was she “got done.” I enjoyed looking at her. She was a slender, small-breasted girl, with an erect carriage, which she accentuated by throwing her body backward at the shoulders like a young cadet. Her grey sun-strained eyes looked back at me with polite reciprocal curiosity out of a wan, charming, discontented face. It occurred to me now that I had seen her, or a picture of her, somewhere before.
vi: Tôi nhìn Baker tự hỏi việc mà cô có thể làm được là việc gì. Tôi thích ngắm nhìn Baker. Cô có thân người mảnh dẻ, bộ ngực nhỏ nhắn, dáng đi thẳng đứng. Baker cố làm nổi bật dáng người mình lên hơn nữa bằng cách ưỡn vai ra sau như một thiếu sinh quân. Đôi mắt mang vẻ kém tươi sáng vì mỏi nắng trên một khuôn mặt duyên dáng nhưng uể oải và khó chịu. Baker lịch sự đáp trả lại tôi cũng bằng một cái nhìn tò mò. Tôi nhận ra rằng hình như tôi đã gặp cô hay đã nhìn thấy hình của cô trước đây ở đâu rồi.
tr: Bayan Baker’a baktım, neyi “hallettiğini” merak etmiştim doğrusu. Ona bakmak hoşuma gidiyordu. Zayıftı, göğüsleri ufaktı. Askeri okul öğrencileri gi­bi omuzlarını geriye atarak dik yürüyordu. Solgun yüzünde, güneşten kamaşan gri gözlerinde kibar bir ifadeyle bana bakıyordu. Onu ya da fotoğrafını bir yerlerde gördüğümü düşündüm.
es: Miré a miss Baker, preguntándome qué sería lo que conseguía. Disfrutaba mirándola. Era una chica delgada, de pechos pequeños, que andaba muy derecha, algo que acentuaba echando los hombros hacia atrás como un cadete. Los ojos, grises, irritados por el sol, me correspondieron con igual curiosidad desde una cara triste, simpática, insatisfecha. Entonces me di cuenta de que la había visto antes en alguna parte, en persona o en una foto.
vi_translation: I looked at Baker, wondering what she could possibly do. I liked watching Baker. She had a slender body, small breasts, and a straight posture. Baker tried to accentuate her figure even more by pushing her shoulders back like a cadet. Her eyes had a less bright look due to sun fatigue on a charming but weary and irritable face. Baker politely returned my gaze with a curious look of her own. I realized that I had seen her or her picture somewhere before.
tr_translation: I looked at Bayan Baker, I was genuinely curious about what she had "handled". I enjoyed looking at her. She was thin, her breasts were small. She walked upright, throwing her shoulders back like a military school student. She looked at me with a polite expression on her pale face, her gray eyes dazzled by the sun. I thought I had seen her or her photograph somewhere.
es_translation: I looked at Miss Baker, wondering what she was achieving. I enjoyed watching her. She was a slim girl, with small breasts, who walked very upright, something she accentuated by throwing her shoulders back like a cadet. Her eyes, gray and irritated by the sun, met mine with equal curiosity from a sad, friendly, unsatisfied face. Then I realized that I had seen her somewhere before, in person or in a photo.

en: “You live in West Egg,” she remarked contemptuously. “I know somebody there.”
vi: "Anh ở bên West Egg hả, tôi cũng có quen vài người bên đó".
tr: “West Egg’de oturuyormuşsunuz galiba” dedi küçümseyen bir ifadeyle. “Orada oturan birini tanıyorum.
es: —Usted vive en West Egg —sentenció con desprecio—. Conozco a uno de allí.
vi_translation: "You live in West Egg, right? I know a few people there."
tr_translation: “I suppose you live in West Egg,” he said with a disdainful expression. “I know someone who lives there.”
es_translation: —You live in West Egg —he stated with disdain—. I know someone from there.

en: “I don’t know a single—”
vi: Baker hỏi một cách khinh khỉnh. "Tôi không quen một ai."
tr: “Ben kimseyi ta—”
es: —Yo no conozco a una sola…
vi_translation: Baker asked disdainfully. "I don't know anyone."
tr_translation: “I didn't—”
es_translation: —I don't know a single one...

en: “You must know Gatsby.”
vi: "Anh chắc phải biết Gatsby." "Gatsby?
tr: “Gatsby’i tanıdığınıza eminim.
es: —Tiene que conocer a Gatsby.
vi_translation: "You must know Gatsby."
tr_translation: “I'm sure you know Gatsby.””
es_translation: —You have to meet Gatsby.

en: “Gatsby?” demanded Daisy. “What Gatsby?”
vi: "Gatsby?
tr: “Hangi Gatsby?” diye sordu Daisy.
es: —Tiene que conocer a Gatsby. —¿Gatsby? —preguntó Daisy—. ¿Qué Gatsby?
vi_translation: "You must know Gatsby." "Gatsby?" "Which Gatsby?"
tr_translation: “Which Gatsby?” asked Daisy.
es_translation: —Gatsby? —asked Daisy—. Which Gatsby?

en: Before I could reply that he was my neighbour dinner was announced; wedging his tense arm imperatively under mine, Tom Buchanan compelled me from the room as though he were moving a checker to another square.
vi: Gatsby nào?" Daisy gặng hỏi. Trước khi tôi có dịp trả lời rằng người đó là hàng xóm của tôi thì mọi người đã được thông báo cho biết bữa ăn chiều đã sẵn sàng. Đưa cánh tay cứng ngắc của mình ra nắm chặt lấy cánh tay tôi, Tom Buchanan đẩy tôi ra khỏi căn phòng giống như đang đẩy một con cờ từ ô này sang ô khác.
tr: Komşum olduğu söylemeye fırsat bulamadan, akşam yemeğinin hazır olduğu duyuruldu. Tom Buchanan buyurgan bir tavırla gergin kolunu benim kolumun altına koydu ve satranç tahtasında bir piyonu başka bir kareye taşır gibi beni odadan çıkardı.
es: Antes de que pudiera contestarle que era mi vecino, fue anunciada la cena; entrelazando fuerte y perentoriamente su brazo con el mío, Tom Buchanan me arrastró fuera de la habitación como si moviera una pieza en un tablero de ajedrez.
vi_translation: Daisy asked insistently. Before I had a chance to reply that the person was my neighbor, everyone was informed that dinner was ready. Extending his stiff arm to grip mine tightly, Tom Buchanan pushed me out of the room as if moving a chess piece from one square to another.
tr_translation: Before I had a chance to say he was my neighbor, it was announced that dinner was ready. Tom Buchanan, with a commanding demeanor, placed his tense arm under mine and moved me out of the room as if moving a pawn to another square on a chessboard.
es_translation: Before I could tell him that he was my neighbor, dinner was announced; forcefully and peremptorily intertwining his arm with mine, Tom Buchanan dragged me out of the room as if moving a piece on a chessboard.

en: Slenderly, languidly, their hands set lightly on their hips, the two young women preceded us out on to a rosy-coloured porch, open toward the sunset, where four candles flickered on the table in the diminished wind.
vi: Thong thả, chậm chạp, hai tay chống nhẹ lên hai bên hông, hai phụ nữ trẻ dẫn đầu đi trước chúng tôi bước ra ngoài hàng hiên nhà sơn màu hồng phấn hướng nhìn ra cảnh chiều tà hoàng hôn. Trên bàn, bốn ngọn nến đã được thắp sáng lung linh trong làn gió nhẹ.
tr: Ellerini kalçalarına dayayarak ağır ağır yürüyen iki genç, narin kadın önümüz sıra salınarak günbatımına bakan gül renkli taraçaya ilerliyordu. Hafifleyen rüzgar masada duran dört mumun alevini titretiyordu.
es: Delgadas y lánguidas, con las manos posadas sin peso en las caderas, las dos jóvenes nos precedieron en el porche rosa, abierto a la puesta de sol, donde, sobre la mesa, un viento apacible hacía temblar la luz de cuatro velas.
vi_translation: Leisurely, slowly, with their hands lightly resting on their hips, two young women led the way ahead of us, stepping out onto the pink-painted porch facing the evening sunset. On the table, four candles had been lit, flickering gently in the light breeze.
tr_translation: Two young people, walking slowly with their hands on their hips, were moving towards the rose-colored terrace overlooking the sunset, with a delicate woman swaying ahead of us. The lightening wind was flickering the flames of the four candles on the table.
es_translation: Thin and languid, with their hands resting weightlessly on their hips, the two young women preceded us onto the pink porch, open to the sunset, where, on the table, a gentle breeze made the light of four candles tremble.

en: “Why candles?” objected Daisy, frowning. She snapped them out with her fingers. “In two weeks it’ll be the longest day in the year.” She looked at us all radiantly. “Do you always watch for the longest day of the year and then miss it? I always watch for the longest day in the year and then miss it.”
vi: "Tại sao lại thắp nến?" Daisy nhăn mặt phản đối rồi búng ngón tay tắt chúng đi. "Hai tuần nữa sẽ là ngày dài nhất trong năm. Có phải mọi người ai cũng mong đợi cho đến ngày dài nhất trong năm nhưng sau đó thì lại lỡ để nó trôi qua không biết đến?
tr: “Bu mumlar da nesi” diye söylendi Daisy kaşlarını çatarak. Sonra parmaklarını fitile bastırıp mumları söndürdü. “İki hafta sonra yılın en uzun günü olacak.” Neşe içinde bize baktı. “Sizin de en uzun günü bekleyip sonra kaçırdığınız oluyor mu? Ben hep bekler, hep de kaçırırım.
es: —¿Por qué velas? —protestó Daisy, frunciendo las cejas. Las apagó con los dedos—. El día más largo del año será dentro de dos semanas —nos miró radiante—. ¿No os pasáis el año esperando la llegada del día más largo y luego, cuando llega, ni os dais cuenta? Yo me paso el año esperando la llegada del día más largo y cuando llega ni me doy cuenta.
vi_translation: "Why light the candles?" Daisy frowned in protest and then snapped her fingers to extinguish them. "In two weeks, it will be the longest day of the year. Does everyone look forward to the longest day of the year but then let it pass by unnoticed? I always wait for the longest day of the year but then let it slip away."
tr_translation: “What are these candles?” Daisy muttered, frowning. Then she pressed her fingers to the wick and extinguished the candles. “In two weeks, it will be the longest day of the year.” She looked at us cheerfully. “Do you also wait for the longest day and then miss it? I always wait, and I always miss it.”
es_translation: —Why candles? —protested Daisy, frowning. She extinguished them with her fingers—. The longest day of the year will be in two weeks —she looked at us radiantly—. Don’t you spend the whole year waiting for the longest day to come and then, when it arrives, you don’t even notice? I spend the whole year waiting for the longest day to come and when it arrives, I don’t even notice.

en: “We ought to plan something,” yawned Miss Baker, sitting down at the table as if she were getting into bed.
vi: Em lúc nào cũng chờ đợi cho tới ngày dài nhất trong năm nhưng rồi lại để nó lỡ trôi qua." Daisy nhìn chúng tôi khuôn mặt tươi tắn rạng rỡ. "Chúng ta nên tổ chức làm cái gì đi." Baker ngáp dài, ngồi xuống bàn cách thức giống như đang chuẩn bị nằm xuống giường ngủ.
tr: “Birlikte bir şeyler yapabiliriz” dedi Bayan Baker esneyerek, sandalyesinde yatağında otururmuş gibi oturuyordu.
es: —Tenemos que planear algo —bostezó miss Baker, sentándose a la mesa como si se metiera en la cama.
vi_translation: Daisy looked at us with a bright, radiant face. "We should organize to do something." Baker yawned, sitting at the table in a manner that resembled preparing to lie down on a bed.
tr_translation: “We can do something together,” said Mrs. Baker, yawning as she sat in her chair as if she were sitting in her bed.
es_translation: —We have to plan something —yawned Miss Baker, sitting at the table as if she were getting into bed.

en: “All right,” said Daisy. “What’ll we plan?” She turned to me helplessly: “What do people plan?”
vi: "Đúng đó. Mình nên tổ chức cái gì đây?" Daisy nói, quay lại tôi hỏi. "Người ta thường tổ chức gì nhỉ?"
tr: “Olur” dedi Daisy. “Peki ne yapalım?” Çaresiz bir ifadeyle bana döndü. “İnsanlar ne yapmak ister acaba?
es: —Estupendo —dijo Daisy—. ¿Qué podemos planear? —se volvió hacia mí, insegura—. ¿Qué planea la gente?
vi_translation: "That's right." "What should we organize?" Daisy said, turning to ask me. "What do people usually organize?"
tr_translation: “Okay,” said Daisy. “So, what should we do?” She turned to me with a helpless expression. “I wonder what people would like to do?”
es_translation: —Wonderful —said Daisy—. What can we plan? —she turned to me, uncertain—. What do people plan?

en: Before I could answer her eyes fastened with an awed expression on her little finger.
vi: Trước khi tôi có thể trả lời, đôi mắt Daisy đã dán chặt vào ngón tay út của mình với nét mặt kinh sợ.
tr: Ben tam yanıt verecekken bakışlarını küçük parmağına yöneltti.
es: Antes de que pudiera contestarle, se quedó mirándose el dedo meñique con expresión de espanto.
vi_translation: Before I could answer, Daisy's eyes were fixed on her little finger with a look of horror.
tr_translation: Just as I was about to respond, he directed his gaze to his little finger.
es_translation: Before he could answer, he stared at his pinky finger with an expression of horror.

en: “Look!” she complained; “I hurt it.”
vi: "Trông nè, ngón tay em bị đau." Daisy phàn nàn.
tr: “Şuraya bak!” diye yakındı; “parmağımı incittim.
es: —¡Mira! —se quejó—. Me he hecho daño.
vi_translation: "Look, my finger hurts." Daisy complained.
tr_translation: "Look over there!" he complained; "I hurt my finger."
es_translation: —Look! —he complained—. I've hurt myself.

en: We all looked—the knuckle was black and blue.
vi: Mọi người chúng tôi quay sang nhìn, khớp đốt tay đã tím bầm.
tr: Hepimiz baktık. Boğumları morarmıştı.
es: Todos miramos. Tenía un cardenal en el nudillo.
vi_translation: We all turned to look, the knuckles were already bruised.
tr_translation: We all looked. Its joints were bruised.
es_translation: We all looked. He had a bruise on his knuckle.

en: “You did it, Tom,” she said accusingly. “I know you didn’t mean to, but you did do it. That’s what I get for marrying a brute of a man, a great, big, hulking physical specimen of a—”
vi: "Anh làm đó Tom" Daisy đổ lỗi. "Em biết anh không cố ý, nhưng chính anh đã gây nên. Đó là cái giá mà em phải trả cho việc kết hôn với một người đàn ông thô bạo, một thứ người to xác."
tr: “Bunu sen yaptın, Tom” dedi suçlayarak. “Belki isteyerek yapmadın ama yine de sen yaptın. Senin gibi azmanın biriyle, cüsseli hantalın tekiyle evlenirsen olacağı bu…
es: —Has sido tú, Tom —dijo, acusando a su marido—. Sé que ha sido sin querer, pero has sido tú. Eso me pasa por haberme casado con un bruto, con una mole, con un grandísimo, inconmensurable ejemplar de…
vi_translation: "You did that, Tom," Daisy blamed. "I know you didn't mean to, but it was you who caused it." "That's the price I have to pay for marrying a brute of a man, a hulking specimen."
tr_translation: “You did this, Tom,” she said accusingly. “Maybe you didn't do it on purpose, but you still did it. This is what happens when you marry a brute like you, a big clumsy oaf...”
es_translation: —It was you, Tom —she said, accusing her husband—. I know it was unintentional, but it was you. That's what I get for marrying a brute, a hulk, an enormous, immeasurable specimen of a…

en: Sometimes she and Miss Baker talked at once, unobtrusively and with a bantering inconsequence that was never quite chatter, that was as cool as their white dresses and their impersonal eyes in the absence of all desire. They were here, and they accepted Tom and me, making only a polite pleasant effort to entertain or to be entertained. They knew that presently dinner would be over and a little later the evening too would be over and casually put away. It was sharply different from the West, where an evening was hurried from phase to phase towards its close, in a continually disappointed anticipation or else in sheer nervous dread of the moment itself.
vi: Đôi khi cả Daisy và Baker đều cùng nói một lúc những câu nói diễu cợt, không quấy rầy ai, không huyên thuyên nhưng trầm tĩnh mát mẻ như những chiếc áo đang mặc trên người và như những đôi mắt trống rỗng thiếu vắng ham muốn của họ. Hai thiếu nữ họ ngồi đây, chấp nhận sự có mặt của Tom và tôi, cố gắng lịch sự để nói chuyện giải trí cho chúng hoặc tự giải trí cho chính mình. Cả hai đều biết bữa ăn chiều rồi cũng sẽ chấm dứt, chẳng bao lâu buổi chiều rồi cũng sẽ qua đi. Đời sống ở nơi đây toàn toàn khác biệt so với đời sống ở miền Tây, nơi mà những buổi chiều lúc nào cũng vội vã đi hết từ giai đoạn này đến giai đoạn kia cho đến khi chấm dứt trong một đoán biết trước đầy thất vọng hay trong niềm hoàn toàn kinh sợ chính giây phút hiện tại.
tr: Arada o ve Bayan Baker aynı anda konuşup şakalar yapıyor, konudan konuya atlıyorlardı. Sohbetleri de üzerlerindeki beyaz giysiler ve baygın gözleri gibi sakindi. Tom ve benimle birlikte burada olmayı kabullenmiş, fazla bir çaba göstermeden hem eğleniyor, hem de eğlendiriyorlardı. Yemeğin yakında bi­teceğini, gecenin birazdan sona ereceğini ve her şeyin geride kalacağını biliyorlardı. Burası Batı’dan çok farklıydı. Orada akşamlar, durmadan hayal kırıklığı yaratan tahminler ya da anın kendisinin endişe verici dehşeti içinde kendi sonlarına doğru hızla ilerlerdi.
es: A veces miss Baker y ella hablaban a la vez, sin levantar la voz, con una incoherencia bromista que jamás caía en el simple parloteo, tan imperturbable como sus vestidos blancos, como sus ojos impersonales y libres de todo deseo. Allí estaban las dos, y nos aceptaban a Tom y a mí, esforzándose si acaso, por educación y amabilidad, en entretenernos o entretenerse. Sabían que pronto acabaría la cena, como también acabaría la velada, que sería olvidada sin mayor importancia. Era muy distinto en el Oeste, donde una velada se precipitaba de fase en fase hacia su final en una sucesión de expectativas siempre defraudadas o en la pura angustia del momento.
vi_translation: Sometimes both Daisy and Baker would speak at the same time with sarcastic remarks, not disturbing anyone, not chattering but calm and cool like the clothes they were wearing and like their empty eyes devoid of desire. The two young women sat there, accepting the presence of Tom and me, trying politely to make conversation to entertain us or to entertain themselves. Both knew that dinner would eventually end, and soon the afternoon would pass by as well. Life here was completely different from life in the West, where afternoons always rushed from one stage to another until ending in a predictable disappointment or in complete terror of the present moment.
tr_translation: From time to time, he and Mrs. Baker would talk and joke simultaneously, jumping from one topic to another. Their conversation was as calm as their white clothes and languid eyes. They had accepted being here with Tom and me, and without much effort, they were both having fun and entertaining us. They knew that the meal would soon be over, the night would soon end, and everything would be left behind. This place was very different from the West. There, the evenings would rapidly progress towards their end, constantly filled with disappointing predictions or the alarming terror of the moment itself.
es_translation: Sometimes Miss Baker and she would talk at the same time, without raising their voices, with a playful incoherence that never descended into mere chatter, as unperturbed as their white dresses, as their impersonal eyes free of any desire. There they were, and they accepted Tom and me, making an effort, perhaps out of politeness and kindness, to entertain us or entertain themselves. They knew that dinner would soon end, as would the evening, which would be forgotten without much importance. It was very different in the West, where an evening would rush from phase to phase towards its end in a succession of always disappointed expectations or in the pure anguish of the moment.

en: “You make me feel uncivilized, Daisy,” I confessed on my second glass of corky but rather impressive claret. “Can’t you talk about crops or something?”
vi: "Daisy, em làm cho anh cảm thấy mình giống như người không văn minh." Tôi thú n hận sau khi uống ly rượu vang đỏ thứ hai nồng mùi nút chai. "Em có thể nói về đồng ruộng, vụ mùa hay đề tài nào khác được không?"
tr: Mantar kokusu sinmiş ama kaliteli bir Bordo şarabından ikinci kadehi içerken, “Bende medenileşmediğim hissi uyandırıyorsun Daisy” diye itirafta bulundum, “bari hububatlardan filan konuş da tam olsun!
es: —Haces que me sienta un ser incivilizado, Daisy —confesé al segundo vaso de un clarete con ligero sabor a corcho, pero impresionante—. ¿No puedes hablar de cosechas o algo por el estilo?
vi_translation: "Daisy, you make me feel like an uncivilized person." I confided regret after drinking the second glass of red wine with a strong cork smell. "Can you talk about the fields, the harvest, or any other topic?"
tr_translation: While drinking the second glass of a high-quality Bordeaux wine that had absorbed the smell of cork, I confessed, "You make me feel uncivilized, Daisy," "at least talk about cereals or something to complete the picture!"
es_translation: —You make me feel like an uncivilized being, Daisy —I confessed over the second glass of a claret with a slight cork taste, but impressive—. Can’t you talk about harvests or something like that?

en: I meant nothing in particular by this remark, but it was taken up in an unexpected way.
vi: Tôi không có ẩn ý gì trong câu nói này, nhưng nó đã được tiếp nhận một cách khác.
tr: Bunu belli bir amaçla söylememiştim ama hiç beklemedi­ğim bir tepkiyle karşılaştım.
es: No quería decir nada en especial con mi observación, pero fue recibida de un modo inesperado.
vi_translation: I have no hidden meaning in this statement, but it was received differently.
tr_translation: I didn't say this with a specific purpose, but I encountered a reaction I never expected.
es_translation: I didn't mean anything in particular with my observation, but it was received in an unexpected way.

en: “Civilization’s going to pieces,” broke out Tom violently. “I’ve gotten to be a terrible pessimist about things. Have you read The Rise of the Coloured Empires by this man Goddard?”
vi: Tom thốt lên một cách mạnh bạo dữ tợn. "Nền văn minh sẽ tan thành từng mảnh, tôi thật cảm thấy bi quan về sự việc này. Anh đã đọc qua quyển "Sự hưng thịnh của các đế quốc da màu" do ông Goddard nào đó viết chưa?"
tr: “Medeniyet yok oluyor” diye bağırdı Tom öfkeyle, “Ben artık bu konuda çok karamsarım. Şu Goddard denen adamın yazdığı The Rise of the Colored Empires adlı kitabı okudun mu?
es: —La civilización se derrumba —estalló Tom—. Me he vuelto terriblemente pesimista. ¿Has leído El ascenso de los imperios de color, de un tal Goddard?[5]
vi_translation: Tom exclaimed fiercely. "Civilization will shatter into pieces, I truly feel pessimistic about this matter." "Have you read the book 'The Rise of the Colored Empires' written by some Mr. Goddard?"
tr_translation: “Civilization is collapsing,” Tom shouted angrily, “I am very pessimistic about this matter now. Have you read the book called The Rise of the Colored Empires by that man named Goddard?”
es_translation: —Civilization is collapsing —Tom burst out—. I've become terribly pessimistic. Have you read The Rise of the Colored Empires, by a certain Goddard?[5]

en: “Why, no,” I answered, rather surprised by his tone.
vi: "Chưa, thì sao?" Tôi trả lời, cảm thấy ngạc nhiên vì giọng nói của Tom.
tr: “Hayır, okumadım” dedim, ses tonu beni şaşırtmıştı.
es: —La verdad es que no —respondí sorprendido por su tono.
vi_translation: "Not yet, so what?" I replied, feeling surprised by Tom's tone.
tr_translation: "No, I haven't read it," I said, the tone of my voice surprising me.
es_translation: —The truth is, no —I replied, surprised by his tone.

en: “Well, it’s a fine book, and everybody ought to read it. The idea is if we don’t look out the white race will be—will be utterly submerged. It’s all scientific stuff; it’s been proved.”
vi: "Đó là một quyển sách hay mà mọi người nên đọc. Ý tưởng của quyển sách là nếu ta không cẩn trọng thì giống dân da trắng sẽ bị nhấn chìm hoàn toàn. Những ý kiến đó hoàn toàn khoa học và đã được chứng minh."
tr: “Çok İyi bir kitap, herkes okumalı. Dikkatli olunmazsa beyaz ırkın –yanlış duymadınız beyaz ırkın- yok olacağını savunuyor. Epey bilimsel bir kitap, her söylediğinin kanıtını da sunuyor.
es: —Bueno, es un gran libro, y debería leerlo todo el mundo. Su tesis es que, si no nos mantenemos en guardia, la raza blanca acabará… acabará hundiéndose completamente. Es un hecho científico, comprobado.
vi_translation: "It is a good book that everyone should read. The idea of the book is that if we are not careful, the white race will be completely submerged. Those opinions are completely scientific and have been proven."
tr_translation: “A very good book, everyone should read it. It argues that if we are not careful, the white race – you heard it right, the white race – will disappear. It is quite a scientific book, providing evidence for everything it claims.”
es_translation: —Well, it's a great book, and everyone should read it. Its thesis is that, if we don't stay on guard, the white race will end up... will end up completely sinking. It's a scientific fact, proven.

en: “Tom’s getting very profound,” said Daisy, with an expression of unthoughtful sadness. “He reads deep books with long words in them. What was that word we—”
vi: "Tom càng lúc càng uyên bác." Daisy nói với vẻ mặt buồn bã không sâu sắc lắm. "Anh ấy đọc những quyển sách thâm sâu đầy những từ ngữ dài. Có nhớ cái từ gì mà chúng ta..."
tr: “Tom derin mevzulara girmeye başladı” dedi Daisy umursamaz bir kederle, “İçinde uzun cümleler olan epey derin kitaplar okuyor. Ne deniyordu ona, şey...
es: —Tom se está volviendo muy profundo —dijo Daisy, con un despreocupado aire de tristeza—. Lee libros profundos, llenos de palabras larguísimas. ¿Qué palabra era esa que…?
vi_translation: "Tom is becoming more and more erudite." Daisy said with a not very deeply sad expression. "He reads profound books full of long words. Do you remember that word we..."
tr_translation: “Tom has started getting into deep subjects,” said Daisy with a careless sorrow, “He’s reading quite deep books with long sentences in them. What was it called, um...”
es_translation: —Tom is becoming very profound —said Daisy, with a careless air of sadness—. He reads profound books, full of very long words. What was that word that…?

en: “Well, these books are all scientific,” insisted Tom, glancing at her impatiently. “This fellow has worked out the whole thing. It’s up to us, who are the dominant race, to watch out or these other races will have control of things.”
vi: "Thật ra những quyển sách này đều là sách khoa học." Tom khăng khăng, liếc nhìn vợ một cách thiếu kiên nhẫn. "Tác giả này đã nghiên cứu mọi thứ cẩn trọng. Mọi thứ giờ đang nằm trong tay của chúng ta là giống dân thống trị, chúng ta cần canh chừng những giống người khác, nếu không họ sẽ ngoi lên nắm quyền điều khiển mọi thứ."
tr: “Neyse ne! O kitaplar bütünüyle bilimsel” dedi Tom sabırsızla­narak, “Adam meseleyi iyi çözmüş. Her şey egemen ırk olan bizlere bağlı. Ya dikkatli oluruz ya da öteki ırkların hegemonyası altına gireriz “
es: —Bueno, son libros científicos —insistió Tom, mirándola con impaciencia—. Ese Goddard ha entrado a fondo en el asunto. A nosotros, que somos la raza dominante, nos toca mantenernos vigilantes para que las otras razas no se hagan con el control de todo.
vi_translation: "Actually, these books are all science books." Tom insisted, glancing at his wife impatiently. "This author has researched everything carefully. Everything is now in our hands as the dominant race, we need to keep an eye on other races, otherwise, they will rise up and take control of everything."
tr_translation: “Whatever! Those books are entirely scientific,” said Tom impatiently, “The man has figured out the issue well. Everything depends on us, the dominant race. Either we are careful, or we fall under the hegemony of other races.”
es_translation: —Well, they are scientific books —insisted Tom, looking at her impatiently—. That Goddard has delved deeply into the matter. It is up to us, as the dominant race, to remain vigilant so that the other races do not take control of everything.

en: “We’ve got to beat them down,” whispered Daisy, winking ferociously toward the fervent sun.
vi: "Chúng ta phải đánh bại họ." Daisy thì thầm, nháy mắt một cách dữ tợn về phía mặt trời nóng bỏng.
tr: “Onları yenmemiz gerek” diye fısıldayan Daisy, gü­neş ışınlarından doğru bakarak gözlerini kırpıyordu.
es: —Tenemos que aplastarlos —murmuró Daisy, guiñándole feroz al sol ardiente.
vi_translation: "We have to defeat them." Daisy whispered, glaring fiercely towards the scorching sun.
tr_translation: "We need to defeat them," whispered Daisy, blinking her eyes as she looked directly at the sun's rays.
es_translation: —We have to crush them —murmured Daisy, winking fiercely at the blazing sun.

en: “You ought to live in California—” began Miss Baker, but Tom interrupted her by shifting heavily in his chair.
vi: "Hai người nên sống ở California." Baker lên tiếng nhưng Tom đã cắt lời cô bằng cách xoay người nặng nề trên ghế.
tr: Bayan Baker, “Kaliforniya’da yaşamanız lazım” diye söze başlamıştı, ama Tom koltuğunda gürültüyle kımıldanarak lafını kesti, “Bu görüşe göre hepimiz Norman soyundanız.
es: —Deberíais vivir en California —empezó miss Baker, pero Tom la interrumpió, agitándose pesadamente en su silla.
vi_translation: "You two should live in California." Baker spoke up, but Tom interrupted her by turning heavily in his chair.
tr_translation: Bayan Baker had started by saying, "You have to live in California," but Tom interrupted her noisily, shifting in his seat, "According to this view, we are all of Norman descent.
es_translation: —You should live in California —started Miss Baker, but Tom interrupted her, stirring heavily in his chair.

en: There was something pathetic in his concentration, as if his complacency, more acute than of old, was not enough to him any more. When, almost immediately, the telephone rang inside and the butler left the porch Daisy seized upon the momentary interruption and leaned towards me.
vi: Có cái gì đó thật tội nghiệp trong lối Tom gắng óc suy nghĩ, làm như tính tự mãn của Tom tuy bây giờ còn cao độ hơn xưa nữa, nhưng nó cũng vẫn không đủ sức cho Tom suy nghĩ. Đúng ngay lúc đó có tiếng chuông điện thoại reo trong nhà, người quản gia rời hiên nhà đi vào trong. Daisy nhân cơ hội gián đoạn này nghiêng mình về phía tôi nói.
tr: Es­kiden beri aşırıya kaçan kibri artık ona yetmez olmuş gibiydi. Tam o sırada telefonun çalmasıyla birlikte uşak içeriye girince Daisy bu fırsattan yararlanarak bana doğru eğildi.
es: Había algo patético en su concentración, como si su suficiencia, más profunda que nunca, ya no le bastara. Cuando, casi inmediatamente, sonó el teléfono dentro de la casa y el mayordomo salió del porche, Daisy aprovechó el momento de pausa y se inclinó hacía mí.
vi_translation: There was something truly pitiable in the way Tom strained his mind, as if Tom's self-satisfaction, now even higher than before, still wasn't enough to help him think. Just at that moment, the telephone rang inside the house, and the butler left the porch to go inside. Daisy took advantage of this interruption to lean towards me and speak.
tr_translation: His arrogance, which had always been excessive, seemed no longer sufficient for him. Just then, when the phone rang and the servant entered, Daisy took advantage of the opportunity to lean towards me.
es_translation: There was something pathetic in his concentration, as if his self-sufficiency, deeper than ever, was no longer enough for him. When, almost immediately, the phone rang inside the house and the butler stepped out of the porch, Daisy took advantage of the pause and leaned towards me.

en: “I’ll tell you a family secret,” she whispered enthusiastically. “It’s about the butler’s nose. Do you want to hear about the butler’s nose?”
vi: "Em sẽ tiết lộ cho anh nghe một bí mật của gia đình." Daisy thì thầm một cách hăng hái. "Chuyện về cái mũi của ông quản gia. Anh có muốn nghe chuyện cái mũi ông quản gia không?"
tr: “Sana bir aile sırrı vereyim” dedi alçak sesle, “Şu bizim uşağın burnu var ya, onun hikayesini duymak ister misin?
es: —Voy a contarte un secreto de familia —murmuró con entusiasmo—. Es sobre la nariz del mayordomo. ¿Quieres saber la historia de la nariz del mayordomo?
vi_translation: "I will reveal to you a family secret." Daisy whispered eagerly. "The story about the butler's nose. Do you want to hear the story about the butler's nose?"
tr_translation: "Let me tell you a family secret," he said in a low voice, "You know our servant's nose, right? Would you like to hear its story?"
es_translation: —I'm going to tell you a family secret —he murmured enthusiastically—. It's about the butler's nose. Do you want to know the story of the butler's nose?

en: “That’s why I came over tonight.”
vi: "Thì anh đến đây chính là vì muốn nghe chuyện đó."
tr: “Buraya bunun için geldim zaten.
es: —Para eso he venido esta noche.
vi_translation: "Well, I came here precisely because I wanted to hear that story."
tr_translation: “That's why I came here anyway.”
es_translation: —That's why I've come tonight.

en: “Well, he wasn’t always a butler; he used to be the silver polisher for some people in New York that had a silver service for two hundred people. He had to polish it from morning till night, until finally it began to affect his nose—”
vi: "Thật ra trước kia ông ta không phải là làm nghề quản gia mà làm nghề đánh bóng đồ bạc cho người nào đó có tiệm khoảng hai trăm khách hàng ở New York. Ông ta phải đánh bóng đồ bạc từ sáng mãi cho tới tối cho đến khi mũi ông ta bị nhiễm độc."
tr: New York’ta iki yüz daimi müşterisi olan bir şirkette gümüş parlatıcısıymış. Sabahtan akşama kadar gümüş parlatmak en sonunda burnuna zarar vermeye başlamış.
es: —Bueno, no ha sido siempre mayordomo: solía limpiarle la plata a cierta gente de Nueva York que tenía una cubertería de plata para doscientas personas. Se pasaba limpiándola de la mañana a la noche, hasta que empezó a afectarle a la nariz…
vi_translation: "In fact, he was not a butler before, but worked as a silver polisher for someone who had a shop with about two hundred customers in New York. He had to polish silver from morning until night until his nose got poisoned."
tr_translation: He was a silver polisher at a company in New York with two hundred regular customers. Polishing silver from morning till night eventually started to damage his nose.
es_translation: —Well, he hasn't always been a butler: he used to clean the silverware for certain people in New York who had silverware for two hundred people. He spent all day cleaning it from morning till night, until it started affecting his nose...

en: “Things went from bad to worse,” suggested Miss Baker.
vi: "Bịnh tình càng lúc càng tệ." Baker tiếp lời gợi ý.
tr: “Durumu da gittikçe kötüleşmiş” diye söze karıştı Bayan Baker.
es: —Las cosas fueron de mal en peor —sugirió miss Baker.
vi_translation: "The illness is getting worse and worse." Baker continued the suggestion.
tr_translation: “And his condition has been getting worse,” Mrs. Baker interjected.
es_translation: —Things went from bad to worse —suggested Miss Baker.

en: “Yes. Things went from bad to worse, until finally he had to give up his position.”
vi: "Đúng như vậy. Càng lúc càng tệ cho đến cuối cùng ông ta phải bỏ việc đang làm."
tr: “Evet. O kadar kötüleşmiş ki, sonunda işinden ayrılmak zorunda kalmış.
es: —Sí. Las cosas fueron de mal en peor, hasta que por fin tuvo que dejar el trabajo.
vi_translation: "That's right. It kept getting worse until he eventually had to quit what he was doing."
tr_translation: “Yes. It had gotten so bad that he finally had to quit his job.”
es_translation: —Yes. Things went from bad to worse, until finally he had to leave the job.

en: For a moment the last sunshine fell with romantic affection upon her glowing face; her voice compelled me forward breathlessly as I listened—then the glow faded, each light deserting her with lingering regret, like children leaving a pleasant street at dusk.
