vi: Trong một khoẳng khắc, giọt nắng cuối cùng rơi một cách lãng mạn lên khuôn mặt rạng ngời của Daisy. Giọng nói của nàng khiến tôi phải chồm người tới trước và nín thở mới nghe được. Sau đó vẻ rạng ngời này bớt dần khi từng giọt nắng thay phiên nhau giã từ bỏ đi trong nuối tiếc, giống như đám trẻ nhỏ phải ngừng chơi để rời khỏi con đường tràn đầy vui thú khi trời chạng vạng tối.
tr: Batan güneşin son ışınları bir an için parlayan yüzünü hafifçe okşadı. Ben nefesim kesilerek onu dinlerken güneş tümüyle battı ve ışıklar, karanlık basınca sokaktaki oyunlarını bitirmek zorunda kalan çocuklar gibi gönülsüzce yüzünü terk etti.
es: Por un instante, con romántico afecto, la última luz del sol le dio en la cara, resplandeciente: su voz me obligó a inclinarme hacia ella mientras la escuchaba sin respirar. Y luego el resplandor desapareció, cada una de las luces la fue abandonando con pesar, sin querer irse, como esos niños que tienen que dejar al anochecer el placer de la calle.
vi_translation: In a moment, the last drop of sunlight romantically fell on Daisy's radiant face. Her voice made me lean forward and hold my breath just to hear it. Then this radiance gradually faded as each drop of sunlight took turns to bid farewell regretfully, like children having to stop playing and leave the joy-filled street at twilight.
tr_translation: The last rays of the setting sun gently caressed her face, which shone for a moment. As I listened to her breathlessly, the sun completely set, and the lights reluctantly left her face, like children who had to end their games on the street as darkness fell.
es_translation: For an instant, with romantic affection, the last light of the sun shone on her face, radiant: her voice made me lean towards her as I listened without breathing. And then the radiance disappeared, each of the lights left her with sorrow, unwilling to go, like those children who have to leave the pleasure of the street at dusk.

en: The butler came back and murmured something close to Tom’s ear, whereupon Tom frowned, pushed back his chair, and without a word went inside. As if his absence quickened something within her, Daisy leaned forward again, her voice glowing and singing.
vi: Người quản gia quay trở lại và thì thầm điều gì đó vào sát tai Tom. Nghe xong Tom nhăn mặt, xô ghế ra sau, đứng lên bỏ vào trong nhà mà không mói một lời nào. Sự vắng mặt của Tom khiến Daisy nhanh chóng nắm lấy cơ hội, nàng nghiêng người tới phía trước lần nữa, giọng rạng rỡ và du dương.
tr: Geri gelen uşak eğilip Tom’un kulağına bir şeyler fısıldadı. Tom’un kaşları çatıldı. İskemlesini geriye ittiği gibi kalktı, tek kelime etmeden içeri girdi. O gidince Daisy canlanır oldu. Etkileyici sesiyle şarkı söyler gibi neşe içinde eğildi:
es: El mayordomo volvió y murmuró unas palabras al oído de Tom, que frunció las cejas, apartó la silla de la mesa y, sin una palabra, se metió en la casa. Como si aquella ausencia hubiera acelerado algo en su interior, Daisy volvió a acercárseme, y su voz se iluminaba, cantaba.
vi_translation: The butler returned and whispered something into Tom's ear. Upon hearing it, Tom frowned, pushed his chair back, stood up, and went inside without saying a word. Tom's absence quickly gave Daisy an opportunity; she leaned forward once more, her voice radiant and melodious.
tr_translation: The returning servant bent down and whispered something into Tom's ear. Tom's eyebrows furrowed. He pushed his chair back and stood up, entering inside without saying a word. After he left, Daisy became lively. With her impressive voice, she leaned in cheerfully as if singing a song:
es_translation: The butler returned and whispered a few words into Tom's ear, who frowned, pushed the chair away from the table, and without a word, went into the house. As if that absence had accelerated something inside her, Daisy came closer to me again, and her voice lit up, it sang.

en: “I love to see you at my table, Nick. You remind me of a—of a rose, an absolute rose. Doesn’t he?” She turned to Miss Baker for confirmation: “An absolute rose?”
vi: "Nick, em rất thích anh đến đây dùng bữa với em. Anh làm em liên tưởng tới một đóa hồng, một đóa hồng thuần túy. Phải vậy không?" Daisy quay qua Baker chờ câu xác nhận. "Phải một đóa hồng thuần túy không?"
tr: “Seni görmek çok hoşuma gidiyor Nick” dedi, “Bana gülleri anımsatıyorsun biliyor musun? Evet güle benziyorsun. Öyle değil mi?” Bayan Baker’a soruyor, onay bekliyordu, “Sence de benzemiyor mu?
es: —Qué alegría verte en mi mesa, Nick. Me recuerdas a… una rosa, exactamente una rosa. ¿No? —se volvió hacia miss Baker en busca de confirmación—. Exactamente una rosa, ¿verdad?
vi_translation: "Nick, I really like you coming here to have a meal with me. You remind me of a rose, a pure rose. Isn't that right?" Daisy turned to Baker waiting for confirmation. "Isn't it a pure rose?"
tr_translation: "I really enjoy seeing you, Nick," she said, "You remind me of roses, you know? Yes, you resemble a rose. Don't you think so?" she asked Mrs. Baker, seeking confirmation, "Don't you think he resembles one?"
es_translation: —What a joy to see you at my table, Nick. You remind me of... a rose, exactly a rose. Don't you think? —he turned to Miss Baker for confirmation—. Exactly a rose, right?

en: This was untrue. I am not even faintly like a rose. She was only extemporizing, but a stirring warmth flowed from her, as if her heart was trying to come out to you concealed in one of those breathless, thrilling words. Then suddenly she threw her napkin on the table and excused herself and went into the house.
vi: Điều này không đúng. Tôi chẳng có chút xíu gì giống một đoá hồng. Daisy thật là chỉ tùy hứng ứng khẩu, thế nhưng làn hơi ấm áp tỏa ra từ cơ thể của nàng làm như trái tim của nàng đang muốn thổ lộ tới người nghe bằng cách ẩn núp dưới dạng những lời nói không vương hơi thở, truyền ra làm rung cảm lòng người. Thế rồi, đột nhiên Daisy ném khăn chùi miệng lên bàn và xin lỗi mọi người rồi bỏ vào trong nhà.
tr: Elbette doğru değildi bu. Güllere uzaktan yakından benzemiyordum. Aklına estiği gibi konuşmuştu. Yine de içinden taşan bu sıcaklık karşısında, heyecanlı sözlerin ardında, gizli kalmış duyguların açığa çıktığı gibi duyguya kapılıyordunuz. Birden peçetesini masaya fırlatarak kalktı, özür dileyip içeri gitti.
es: No era verdad. Ni de lejos parezco una rosa. Daisy sólo estaba improvisando, pero desprendía una calidez excitante, como si su corazón quisiera escapar y entregarse oculto en una de aquellas palabras entrecortadas, perturbadoras. Entonces, de pronto, lanzó la servilleta a la mesa y entró en la casa.
vi_translation: This is not true. I am not even a little bit like a rose. Daisy was really just speaking on a whim, yet the warm breath emanating from her body seemed as if her heart was trying to reveal itself to the listener by hiding under words that carried no breath, transmitting out to touch the hearts of others. Then, suddenly Daisy threw her napkin onto the table, apologized to everyone, and went inside the house.
tr_translation: Of course, this wasn't true. I didn't resemble roses in the slightest. He had spoken impulsively. Still, faced with this warmth overflowing from within, behind the excited words, you were swept away by the feelings that emerged as hidden emotions came to light. Suddenly, he threw his napkin on the table, stood up, apologized, and went inside.
es_translation: It wasn't true. I don't look anything like a rose. Daisy was just improvising, but she exuded an exciting warmth, as if her heart wanted to escape and hide in one of those broken, disturbing words. Then, suddenly, she threw the napkin onto the table and went into the house.

en: Miss Baker and I exchanged a short glance consciously devoid of meaning. I was about to speak when she sat up alertly and said “Sh!” in a warning voice. A subdued impassioned murmur was audible in the room beyond, and Miss Baker leaned forward unashamed, trying to hear. The murmur trembled on the verge of coherence, sank down, mounted excitedly, and then ceased altogether.
vi: Baker và tôi liếc nhẹ mắt nhìn nhau cố tình không để lộ ý tưởng gì. Khi tôi chuẩn bị lên tiếng thì Baker đã nhanh nhẹn đứng lên một và nói "Shuỵt" với một giọng cảnh giác. Những tiếng nói chuyện rì rầm cố dằn nhỏ giọng có thể nghe được từ căn phòng bên kia. Baker chẳng xấu hổ gì nghiêng người về phía trước cố lắng nghe. Tiếng rì rầm vang to lên gần như có thể hiểu được, sau đó lại hạ thấp xuống, rồi lại nổi nên sôi nổi và sau đó thì hoàn toàn im lặng.
tr: Bayan Baker ile göz göze geldik. Ben konuşmaya hazırlanırken, doğruldu ve “Şışşt” diye uyardı beni. Arkamızdaki odada alçak sesle bir şeyler konu­şuluyordu. Bayan Baker neler olup bittiğini daha iyi duymak için çekinmeden eğildi. Sesler bir an yükselir gibi ol­du, sonra hafifledi. Bir an bağrışmalar, sonra yine sessizlik.
es: Miss Baker y yo intercambiamos una mirada relámpago, premeditadamente desprovista de significado. Iba a hablar cuando ella se irguió en la silla, alerta, y dijo «Shhh», avisándome. De la habitación contigua llegaban murmullos apagados y apasionados, y miss Baker se adelantó, sin ninguna vergüenza, para intentar oír. El murmullo vibró en los límites de la coherencia, se hizo más débil, se elevó en una especie de arrebato, y cesó definitivamente.
vi_translation: Baker and I exchanged a quick glance, deliberately not revealing any ideas. As I was about to speak, Baker swiftly stood up and said "Shh" in a cautious tone. The murmured conversations, trying to be kept low, could be heard from the next room. Without any shame, Baker leaned forward to try to listen. The murmuring grew louder, almost understandable, then lowered again, then rose to an animated level, and finally fell completely silent.
tr_translation: I made eye contact with Ms. Baker. As I was preparing to speak, she straightened up and warned me with a "Shh." In the room behind us, something was being discussed in low voices. Ms. Baker leaned in without hesitation to hear better what was going on. The voices seemed to rise for a moment, then softened. A moment of shouting, then silence again.
es_translation: Miss Baker and I exchanged a lightning glance, deliberately devoid of meaning. I was about to speak when she straightened up in her chair, alert, and said "Shhh," warning me. From the adjoining room came muffled and passionate murmurs, and Miss Baker leaned forward, without any shame, to try to listen. The murmur vibrated on the edge of coherence, grew weaker, rose in a kind of outburst, and ceased definitively.

en: “This Mr. Gatsby you spoke of is my neighbour—” I began.
vi: "Ông Gatsby mà cô đã nhắc qua là hàng xóm của tôi.." Tôi gợi chuyện.
tr: “Az önce bahsettiğiniz Bay Gatsby komşum olur...” diyerek söze başlamak istedim.
es: —Ese mister Gatsby del que usted habla es vecino mío —dije.
vi_translation: "Mr. Gatsby, whom you mentioned, is my neighbor.."
tr_translation: “The Mr. Gatsby you just mentioned happens to be my neighbor...” I wanted to start the conversation.
es_translation: —That Mr. Gatsby you talk about is my neighbor —I said.

en: “Is something happening?” I inquired innocently.
vi: "Có chuyện gì đang xẩy ra sao?" Tội dò hỏi một cách ngây thơ.
tr: “Bir sorun mu var?” diye sordum saf saf.
es: —¿Pasa algo? —pregunté inocentemente.
vi_translation: "Is something happening?" I asked innocently.
tr_translation: “Is there a problem?” I asked innocently.
es_translation: —Is something wrong? —I asked innocently.

en: “You mean to say you don’t know?” said Miss Baker, honestly surprised. “I thought everybody knew.”
vi: "Anh bộ không biết thật hả? Tôi tưởng ai cũng biết rồi." Baker nói một cách ngạc nhiên thật sự.
tr: “Yoksa bilmiyor musunuz?” diye sordu Bayan Baker, gerçekten şaşırmıştı “Herkesin bildiğini sanıyordum.
es: —¿Está diciéndome que no lo sabe? —dijo miss Baker, sorprendida de verdad—. Yo creía que lo sabía todo el mundo.
vi_translation: "You really don't know? I thought everyone knew already." Baker said with genuine surprise.
tr_translation: “Or don't you know?” asked Mrs. Baker, genuinely surprised. “I thought everyone knew.”
es_translation: —Are you telling me that you don't know? —said Miss Baker, genuinely surprised—. I thought everyone knew.

en: “I don’t.”
vi: "Tôi không hề biết gì cả."
tr: “Ben bilmiyorum.
es: —Yo no.
vi_translation: "I didn't know anything at all."
tr_translation: “I don't know.”
es_translation: —Not me.

en: “Why—” she said hesitantly. “Tom’s got some woman in New York.”
vi: "Vậy sao..." Baker ngập ngừng, "Tom có người đàn bà khác ở New York."
tr: “Şey” dedi biraz duraksayarak, “Tom’un New York’ta bir metresi var
es: —Ah… —dijo, dubitativa—. Tom tiene una mujer, en Nueva York.
vi_translation: "Really..." Baker hesitated, "Tom has another woman in New York."
tr_translation: “Well,” he said, pausing a bit, “Tom has a mistress in New York”
es_translation: —Ah… —she said, hesitantly—. Tom has a wife, in New York.

en: “Got some woman?” I repeated blankly.
vi: "Có người đàn bà khác?" Tôi ngây người lập lại
tr: “Metresi mi?” diye yineledim safça.
es: —¿Una mujer? —repetí sin comprender.
vi_translation: "Is there another woman?" I repeated in a daze
tr_translation: “His mistress?” I repeated naively.
es_translation: —A woman? —I repeated, not understanding.

en: Miss Baker nodded.
vi: Baker gật đầu
tr: Bayan Baker başıyla onayladı.
es: Miss Baker asintió.
vi_translation: Baker nodded
tr_translation: Mr. Baker nodded.
es_translation: Miss Baker nodded.

en: “She might have the decency not to telephone him at dinner time. Don’t you think?”
vi: "Nếu cô đó là người biết điều thì không nên gọi điện thoại cho Tom ngay giữa bữa ăn chiều như vậy. Anh nghĩ đúng không?"
tr: “Yemek vakti telefon etmeyecek kadar nazik olması gerekir ama değil mi?
es: —Podría tener la decencia de no llamarlo a la hora de la cena. ¿No cree?
vi_translation: "If she were a considerate person, she shouldn't call Tom right in the middle of dinner like that. Don't you think so?"
tr_translation: “He should be polite enough not to call during mealtime, right?”
es_translation: —You could have the decency not to call him at dinner time. Don't you think?

en: Almost before I had grasped her meaning there was the flutter of a dress and the crunch of leather boots, and Tom and Daisy were back at the table.
vi: Trước khi tôi kịp thấu hiểu ý nghĩa câu nói của Baker thì đã nghe tiếng áo đầm phần phật và tiếng nghiến giày, cả Tom và Daisy đều quay trở lại bàn ăn.
tr: Söylediklerini anlamama zaman kalmadan kumaş hışırtıları ve deri çizmelerin gıcırtısı duyuldu ve Tom ile Daisy masaya döndü.
es: Casi antes de que captara el sentido de sus palabras, nos llegó el frufrú de un vestido y el crujir de unas botas de cuero, y Tom y Daisy estaban de vuelta a la mesa.
vi_translation: Before I could grasp the meaning of Baker's words, I heard the rustling of a dress and the sound of shoes scraping; both Tom and Daisy had returned to the dining table.
tr_translation: Before I had time to understand what they were saying, the rustle of fabric and the creaking of leather boots were heard, and Tom and Daisy returned to the table.
es_translation: Almost before I grasped the meaning of his words, we heard the rustle of a dress and the creak of leather boots, and Tom and Daisy were back at the table.

en: “It couldn’t be helped!” cried Daisy with tense gaiety.
vi: "Em không thể cưỡng nổi!" Daisy nói lớn với giọng nói tươi vui không tự nhiên.
tr: Daisy neşeli görünmeye çabalıyordu ama sesi gergindi. “Kusura bakmayın” dedi.
es: —¡Era inevitable! —exclamó Daisy con una alegría forzada.
vi_translation: "I can't resist!" Daisy said loudly with an unnaturally cheerful voice.
tr_translation: Daisy was trying to appear cheerful, but her voice was tense. “Sorry” he said.
es_translation: —It was inevitable! —exclaimed Daisy with forced cheerfulness.

en: She sat down, glanced searchingly at Miss Baker and then at me, and continued: “I looked outdoors for a minute, and it’s very romantic outdoors. There’s a bird on the lawn that I think must be a nightingale come over on the Cunard or White Star Line. He’s singing away—” Her voice sang: “It’s romantic, isn’t it, Tom?”
vi: Daisy ngồi xuống, sau khi hết liếc nhìn Baker rồi lại liếc nhìn tới tôi, nàng nói tiếp. "Em mới vừa ra ngoài ngắm một phút, cảnh trí ngoài trời thật là nên thơ. Có một con chim đậu trên bãi cỏ mà em đoán là chim sơn ca đã theo con con tàu Cunard hay tàu Starline đến đây. Chú chim vừa bay vừa hót.." Giọng của Daisy thánh thót. " Đúng là lãng mạn phải không Tom?"
tr: Yerine oturdu, soru dolu bakışlarla önce Bayan Baker’a sonra bana baktı. “Şöyle bir dışarı baktım da!” dedi, sonra, “Gerçekten de çok romantik bir manzara var. Çimlerin üzerinde bir kuş vardı. Cunard ya da White Star şirketlerine ait gemilerden biriyle buraya kadar gelmiş bir bülbül sanı­rım. Nasıl da ötüyor” diye sürdürdü konuşmasını. Kendisi de adeta şakıyordu, “Ne romantik, değil mi Tom?
es: Se sentó, miró escrutadoramente a miss Baker y luego a mí, y continuó: —Me he asomado un momento al jardín. ¡Qué romántico! Hay un pájaro en el césped que debe de ser un ruiseñor llegado en un transatlántico de la compañía Cunard o de la White Star Line. Está cantando… —y su voz cantó—. ¿No te parece romántico, Tom?
vi_translation: Daisy sat down, after glancing at Baker and then at me, she continued speaking. "I just went outside for a minute, the scenery is truly poetic. There was a bird perched on the lawn that I guessed was a lark that had followed the Cunard or Starline ship here. The bird was flying and singing.." Daisy's voice was melodious. "Isn't it romantic, Tom?"
tr_translation: He sat down, looking at first Mrs. Baker and then me with questioning eyes. “I just looked outside!” he said, then, “There really is a very romantic view. There was a bird on the grass. I think it’s a nightingale that came here on one of the ships belonging to the Cunard or White Star lines. How it sings,” he continued his speech. He himself was almost warbling, “How romantic, isn’t it Tom?”
es_translation: He sat down, looked scrutinizingly at Miss Baker and then at me, and continued: —I peeked into the garden for a moment. How romantic! There is a bird on the lawn that must be a nightingale arrived on a transatlantic ship from the Cunard or White Star Line company. It is singing… —and her voice sang—. Don't you think it's romantic, Tom?

en: “Very romantic,” he said, and then miserably to me: “If it’s light enough after dinner, I want to take you down to the stables.”
vi: "Thật là lãng mạn." Tom trả lời, sau đó quay sang tôi một cách khổ sở. "Sau bữa ăn chiều, nếu trời còn sáng, tôi muốn dẫn anh đi xuống chuồng ngựa."
tr: “Ya, evet öyle” diyen Tom bıkkın bir tavırla bana dönerek, “Yemek bitince hava kararmamış olursa seni ahırlara götüreyim” dedi.
es: —Muy romántico —respondió Tom antes de dirigirse a mí con tono abatido—. Si todavía hay luz después de la cena, me gustaría llevarte a las cuadras.
vi_translation: "It's so romantic." Tom replied, then turned to me miserably. "After dinner, if it's still light out, I want to take you down to the stables."
tr_translation: "Yes, that's right," said Tom, turning to me with a weary attitude, "If it hasn't gotten dark by the time we finish eating, I'll take you to the barns."
es_translation: —Very romantic —replied Tom before addressing me in a dejected tone—. If there's still light after dinner, I'd like to take you to the stables.

en: The telephone rang inside, startlingly, and as Daisy shook her head decisively at Tom the subject of the stables, in fact all subjects, vanished into air. Among the broken fragments of the last five minutes at table I remember the candles being lit again, pointlessly, and I was conscious of wanting to look squarely at everyone, and yet to avoid all eyes. I couldn’t guess what Daisy and Tom were thinking, but I doubt if even Miss Baker, who seemed to have mastered a certain hardy scepticism, was able utterly to put this fifth guest’s shrill metallic urgency out of mind. To a certain temperament the situation might have seemed intriguing—my own instinct was to telephone immediately for the police.
vi: Chuông điện thoại trong nhà lại reo lên làm mọi người giật mình. Trong khi Daisy nhìn Tom lắc đầu một cách kiên quyết thì đề tài của những chuồng ngựa, đúng ra mà nói tất cả mọi đề tài, đều tan biến vào không gian. Trong khoảng khắc đứt đoạn năm phút đó, tôi nhớ rằng ở trên bàn những ngọn nến đã được thắp sáng trở lại, lạc lõng vô nghĩa. Tôi có ý muốn nhìn thẳng vào khuôn mặt của mỗi người nhưng lại tránh không muốn nhìn vào mọi cặp mắt. Tôi không có thể suy đoán xem Daisy và Tom đang nghĩ gì, nhưng tôi cho rằng ngay chính cả Baker, người dường như rất tài giỏi về nghi ngờ, có thể hoàn toàn xua đuổi khỏi đầu tiếng kêu lanh lảnh dục dã của người khách thứ năm này. Tùy tính tình, hoàn cảnh này có thể sẽ khiến cho vài người cảm thấy thích thú. Nhưng với bản năng của tôi, thì tôi sẽ gọi điện thoại ngay cho cảnh sát.
tr: Telefon bir kez daha çalınca hepimiz birden irkildik. Daisy, Tom’a bakıp ke­sin bir ifadeyle başını sallayınca tüm sohbet konuları aniden kayboluverdi. Masadaki son beş dakikanın parçalarından, gerekmediği halde mumların yeniden ya­kılması kaldı aklımda ve herkesin çekinmeden bakmak istediğim halde bakışlarından kaçıyordum. Tom ve Daisy’in neler düşündüklerini bilemiyordum ama o umursamaz tavırlarına rağmen Bayan Baker’ın bile davet­ edilmeden gelen beşinci kişinin o keskin çınlamalarını görmezden gelmesi imkansızdı. Farklı yapıdaki insanlara bu durum merak uyandırıcı gelse de benim içimden derhal polisi aramak geçiyordu.
es: El teléfono sonó dentro de la casa como una alarma y, mientras Daisy negaba rotundamente con la cabeza mirando a Tom, la idea de las cuadras, y todas las ideas, se desvanecieron en el aire. Entre los fragmentos rotos de los últimos cinco minutos en la mesa, recuerdo que habían vuelto a encender las velas, quién sabe para qué, y que tenía conciencia de querer mirar a fondo a todos, y que, sin embargo, evitaba mirar a nadie. Era incapaz de adivinar lo que pensaban Daisy y Tom, pero tampoco estaba seguro de que miss Baker, que parecía en posesión de un escepticismo inquebrantable, pudiera obviar la perentoriedad estridente y metálica de la quinta comensal. Para ciertos temperamentos la situación quizá resultara sugestiva. Mi instinto me pedía llamar inmediatamente a la policía.
vi_translation: The phone in the house rang again, startling everyone. While Daisy looked at Tom and shook her head resolutely, the topic of the stables, or rather all topics, vanished into thin air. In that five-minute interruption, I remembered that the candles on the table had been relit, lost and meaningless. I had the urge to look directly at each person's face but avoided looking into anyone's eyes. I couldn't guess what Daisy and Tom were thinking, but I believed that even Baker, who seemed very skilled at suspicion, could completely dismiss the shrill, urgent call of this fifth guest from his mind. Depending on one's temperament, this situation might amuse some people. But with my instincts, I would immediately call the police.
tr_translation: When the phone rang once again, we all suddenly flinched. When Daisy looked at Tom and shook her head with a definite expression, all the conversation topics suddenly disappeared. From the fragments of the last five minutes at the table, what stuck in my mind was the unnecessary relighting of the candles, and although I wanted to look without hesitation, I was avoiding everyone's gaze. I couldn't know what Tom and Daisy were thinking, but despite their indifferent demeanor, it was impossible for even Mrs. Baker, who usually didn't care, to ignore the sharp ringing of the uninvited fifth person. While this situation might have aroused curiosity in people of different dispositions, I felt an immediate urge to call the police.
es_translation: The phone rang inside the house like an alarm and, while Daisy shook her head emphatically looking at Tom, the idea of the stables, and all ideas, vanished into the air. Among the broken fragments of the last five minutes at the table, I remember that they had relit the candles, who knows why, and that I was aware of wanting to look deeply at everyone, and yet, I avoided looking at anyone. I was unable to guess what Daisy and Tom were thinking, but I wasn't sure that Miss Baker, who seemed to possess an unbreakable skepticism, could overlook the shrill and metallic urgency of the fifth diner. For certain temperaments, the situation might have been suggestive. My instinct urged me to call the police immediately.

en: The horses, needless to say, were not mentioned again. Tom and Miss Baker, with several feet of twilight between them, strolled back into the library, as if to a vigil beside a perfectly tangible body, while, trying to look pleasantly interested and a little deaf, I followed Daisy around a chain of connecting verandas to the porch in front. In its deep gloom we sat down side by side on a wicker settee.
vi: Những con ngựa, khỏi cần nói, đương nhiên đã không còn được nhắc tới nữa. Cách nhau vài bước trong bóng tối chiều tà, Tom và Baker thong thả đi vào thư viện, làm như để đi canh gác một thi thể bằng xương bằng thịt. Còn tôi cố gắng làm ra vẻ thú vị và hơi có chút giả điếc, theo gót Daisy đi ngang qua dãy hàng hiên nối dài ra tới hiên nhà trước. Trong bóng tối dày đặc, chúng tôi ngồi xuống cạnh nhau trên chiếc ghế mây.
tr: Atlar konusuna bir daha dö­nülmediğini söylememe gerek yok. Tom ve Bayan Baker baş ve ayakucundan tutup bir ölüyü taşıyormuş gibi aralarında akşamın alacasından bir iki metre bırakarak ağır ağır kütüphaneye doğru yürüdü. Ben ise hiçbir şey duymamışım gibi çevreyle ilgileniyor görünmeye çabaladım ve birbirine bağlı ve­randalar zinciri boyunca Daisy’i izleyerek taraçaya çıktım. Loş bahçede hasır bir kanepeye yan yana oturduk.
es: Nadie, es innecesario decirlo, volvió a mencionar los caballos. Tom y miss Baker, separados por un metro de crepúsculo, se dirigieron a la biblioteca, como a velar un cadáver perfectamente tangible, mientras, intentando parecer gratamente interesado y un poco sordo, yo seguía a Daisy a través de una serie de galerías que partían del porche. Nos sentamos en la penumbra, en un sofá de mimbre.
vi_translation: Needless to say, the horses were, of course, no longer mentioned. A few steps apart in the twilight, Tom and Baker leisurely walked into the library, as if to guard a flesh-and-blood corpse. As for me, I tried to appear interesting and slightly feigned deafness, following Daisy across the veranda that extended to the front porch. In the thick darkness, we sat down next to each other on the wicker chair.
tr_translation: Needless to say, the subject of horses was never brought up again. Tom and Mrs. Baker, holding it by the head and feet as if carrying a corpse, walked slowly towards the library, leaving a couple of meters between them in the evening twilight. As for me, I tried to appear interested in the surroundings as if I hadn't heard anything, and followed Daisy onto the terrace along the chain of interconnected verandas. We sat side by side on a wicker sofa in the dim garden.
es_translation: Nobody, it goes without saying, mentioned the horses again. Tom and Miss Baker, separated by a meter of twilight, headed to the library, as if to keep vigil over a perfectly tangible corpse, while I, trying to appear pleasantly interested and a bit deaf, followed Daisy through a series of galleries that branched off from the porch. We sat in the dim light, on a wicker sofa.

en: Daisy took her face in her hands as if feeling its lovely shape, and her eyes moved gradually out into the velvet dusk. I saw that turbulent emotions possessed her, so I asked what I thought would be some sedative questions about her little girl.
vi: Daisy lấy hai tay chống mặt như để cảm giác được đường nét yêu kiều xinh đẹp của nó. Đôi mắt của nàng thong thả hướng nhìn vào trong bóng hoàng hôn mượt mà như nhung. Tôi thấy nàng đang bị xúc cảm dữ dội cho nên gợi hỏi vài câu về đứa con gái để nàng được dịu lại.
tr: Daisy güzel hatlarını yoklar gibi yüzünü elleri arasına alarak bakışlarını kadife rengi alacakaranlığa çevirmişti. İçinde fırtınalar koptuğunu görebiliyordum. Sakinleşmesi için küçük kızı hakkında sorular sormaya başladım.
es: Daisy puso la cara entre las manos como para sentir sus rasgos perfectos, y su mirada se perdió poco a poco en la oscuridad de terciopelo. Me di cuenta de que la dominaba la fuerza de sus emociones y, pensando que así la tranquilizaría, le pregunté por la niña.
vi_translation: Daisy placed her hands on her face as if to feel its graceful and beautiful contours. Her eyes slowly gazed into the velvety twilight. I saw that she was overwhelmed with emotions, so I asked a few questions about the girl to help her calm down.
tr_translation: Daisy, as if feeling her beautiful features, took her face in her hands and turned her gaze to the velvet-colored twilight. I could see that storms were raging inside her. To calm her down, I started asking questions about her little girl.
es_translation: Daisy put her face in her hands as if to feel her perfect features, and her gaze gradually lost itself in the velvet darkness. I realized that she was overwhelmed by the strength of her emotions and, thinking it would calm her, I asked about the child.

en: “We don’t know each other very well, Nick,” she said suddenly. “Even if we are cousins. You didn’t come to my wedding.”
vi: "Nick, tuy hai chúng ta là anh em họ nhưng thật ra chúng ta không hiểu nhau nhiều lắm." Daisy đột ngột nói. "Anh đã không đi dự đám cưới của em."
tr: “Farkında mısın Nick, birbirimizi pek iyi tanımıyoruz” deyiverdi birden, “düğünüme de gelmemiştin.
es: —Tú y yo no nos conocemos demasiado, Nick —dijo de pronto—. Aunque seamos primos. No fuiste a mi boda.
vi_translation: "Nick, although we are cousins, we actually don't understand each other very well." Daisy suddenly said. "You didn't attend my wedding."
tr_translation: “Are you aware, Nick, we don't know each other very well,” she suddenly said, “you didn't even come to my wedding.”
es_translation: —You and I don't know each other very well, Nick —he said suddenly—. Even though we are cousins. You didn't come to my wedding.

en: “I wasn’t back from the war.”
vi: "Lúc đó còn chiến tranh anh đi trận chưa về."
tr: “Cepheden dönmemiştim.
es: —No había vuelto de la guerra.
vi_translation: "At that time, there was still war, and you hadn't returned from the battle."
tr_translation: “I hadn't returned from the pole.”
es_translation: —He had not returned from the war.

en: “That’s true.” She hesitated. “Well, I’ve had a very bad time, Nick, and I’m pretty cynical about everything.”
vi: "Đúng rồi." Daisy ngập ngừng. "Thật ra em đã trải qua một thời gian đau khổ. Bây giờ thì em cay cú với hết tất cả mọi thứ."
tr: “Cepheden dönmemiştim. “Doğru” biraz durdu, “çok kötü günler geçirdim Nick. Her şeye şüpheyle bakar oldum.
es: —Es verdad —dudó—. Bueno, lo he pasado mal, Nick, y me he vuelto una cínica.
vi_translation: "That's right." Daisy hesitated. "Actually, I went through a painful time. Now I'm bitter about everything."
tr_translation: “I hadn't returned from the pole.” “Right,” he paused, “I went through very bad days, Nick. I started to look at everything with suspicion.”
es_translation: —It's true —she hesitated—. Well, I've had a hard time, Nick, and I've become a cynic.

en: Evidently she had reason to be. I waited but she didn’t say any more, and after a moment I returned rather feebly to the subject of her daughter.
vi: Đương nhiên Daisy có lý do để suy nghĩ như vậy. Tôi đợi cho Daisy nói tiếp nhưng nàng không nói gì thêm. Sau một lúc tôi rụt rè quay lại gợi chuyện đứa con gái nhỏ.
tr: Bakmakta da haklıydı. Bekledim ama başka bir şey söylemedi. Ben de epey cılız bir sesle tekrar kı­zından bahsetmeye başladım.
es: Tenía, evidentemente, razones para serlo. Esperé, pero no dijo nada más, y al cabo de un momento volví sin demasiada convicción al tema de su hija.
vi_translation: Of course, Daisy had a reason to think that way. I waited for Daisy to continue, but she didn't say anything more. After a while, I timidly turned back to bring up the topic of the little girl.
tr_translation: He was right to look. I waited, but he didn't say anything else. In a rather feeble voice, I started talking about his daughter again.
es_translation: He evidently had reasons to be so. I waited, but he said nothing more, and after a moment I returned without much conviction to the subject of his daughter.

en: “I suppose she talks, and—eats, and everything.”
vi: "Anh đoán con gái em đã biết nói, biết ăn và biết làm nhiều thứ rồi."
tr: “Herhalde artık konuşuyordur, ye­meğini yiyordur, her şeyi yapıyordur.
es: —Supongo que habla y… come, y esas cosas.
vi_translation: "I guess your daughter can already talk, eat, and do many things."
tr_translation: “She must be talking by now, eating her meals, doing everything.”
es_translation: —I suppose it talks and… eats, and those things.

en: “Oh, yes.” She looked at me absently. “Listen, Nick; let me tell you what I said when she was born. Would you like to hear?”
vi: "Dạ, đúng như vậy." Daisy nhìn thẫn thờ. "Nghe đây Nick. Để em kể cho anh nghe em đã nói gì lúc con gái của em mới sanh. Anh có muốn nghe không?"
tr: “Ya, evet!” dalgın dalgın yüzüme baktı, “Dinle Nick, doğduğunda neler söylediğimi bilmek ister misin?
es: —Ah, sí —me miró, ausente—. Oye, Nick: deja que te cuente lo que dije cuando nació. ¿Quieres saberlo?
vi_translation: "Yes, that's right." Daisy looked dazed. "Listen, Nick. Let me tell you what I said when my daughter was just born. Do you want to hear it?"
tr_translation: “Yes, indeed!” he looked at my face absentmindedly, “Listen Nick, do you want to know what I said when you were born?”
es_translation: —Ah, yes —he looked at me, absent-mindedly—. Hey, Nick: let me tell you what I said when she was born. Do you want to know?

en: “Very much.”
vi: "Anh muốn nghe lắm."
tr: “Hem de çok.
es: —Por supuesto.
vi_translation: "I really want to listen."
tr_translation: “A lot, indeed.”
es_translation: —Of course.

en: “It’ll show you how I’ve gotten to feel about—things. Well, she was less than an hour old and Tom was God knows where. I woke up out of the ether with an utterly abandoned feeling, and asked the nurse right away if it was a boy or a girl. She told me it was a girl, and so I turned my head away and wept. ‘All right,’ I said, ‘I’m glad it’s a girl. And I hope she’ll be a fool—that’s the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool.’
vi: "Nghe xong anh sẽ biết tại sao em lại có cách suy nghĩ về cuộc đời như bây giờ. Chuyện như thế này, con bé sanh ra chưa được một giờ thì Tom đã đi đâu mất biệt chỉ có trời mới biết anh ở đâu. Sau khi tan thuốc mê, em thức dậy với cảm giác mình đã bị ruồng bỏ. Em ngay lập tức hỏi người y tá xem đứa bé sơ sanh là trai hay gái. Cô y tá trả lời con em là con gái, nghe xong em quay mặt đi không cầm được nước mắt. Em nói, "Cũng được, cũng mừng nó là con gái. Em hy vọng nó sẽ trở thành một đứa con gái ngu ngốc. Trên đời, điều tốt nhất cho một đứa con gái là trở thành một con ngốc xinh đẹp."
tr: “Olaylara nasıl baktığımı anlarsın belki böylece. Doğum yapalı bir saat bile olmamıştı. Tom’un nerede olduğunu Tanrı bilir. Narkozdan çıkınca yoğun bir terk edilmişlik hissi içimi kapladı ve hastabakıcıya kız mı oğlan mı diye sordum. Kız olduğunu öğrenince de, arkamı döndüm ve ağladım, ‘pekala’ dedim kendime ‘kız olduğuna sevindim. Umarım aptal olur. Çünkü bu dünyada bir kız için en iyisi aptal ve güzel olmak.
es: —Eso te demostrará lo que he llegado a sentir acerca de… todo. Bueno, la niña tenía menos de una hora y Tom estaba Dios sabe dónde. Me desperté de la anestesia con una sensación de profundo abandono, y le pregunté a la enfermera si era niño o niña. Me dijo que era una niña, y volví la cabeza y me eché a llorar. «Estupendo», dije, «me alegra que sea una niña. Y espero que sea tonta. Es lo mejor que en este mundo puede ser una chica: una tontita preciosa».
vi_translation: "After listening, you will know why I have the perspective on life that I do now. The story goes like this: the baby was born less than an hour when Tom disappeared to who knows where, only God knows where he was. After the anesthesia wore off, I woke up with the feeling of being abandoned. I immediately asked the nurse whether the newborn was a boy or a girl. The nurse replied that my child was a girl, and upon hearing that, I turned away, unable to hold back my tears. I said, "That's fine, I'm glad it's a girl. I hope she will become a foolish girl. In this world, the best thing for a girl is to become a beautiful fool."
tr_translation: “Maybe this way you will understand how I view things. It hadn't even been an hour since I gave birth. God knows where Tom was. When I came out of anesthesia, a deep sense of abandonment filled me, and I asked the nurse whether it was a girl or a boy. When I learned it was a girl, I turned my back and cried, 'Alright,' I said to myself, 'I'm glad it's a girl.' I hope she will be a fool. Because in this world, the best thing for a girl is to be a fool and beautiful.”
es_translation: —That will show you what I have come to feel about… everything. Well, the girl was less than an hour old and Tom was God knows where. I woke up from the anesthesia with a feeling of deep abandonment, and I asked the nurse if it was a boy or a girl. She told me it was a girl, and I turned my head and started to cry. “Great,” I said, “I’m glad it’s a girl. And I hope she’s a fool. That’s the best thing a girl can be in this world: a beautiful little fool.”

en: “You see I think everything’s terrible anyhow,” she went on in a convinced way. “Everybody thinks so—the most advanced people. And I know. I’ve been everywhere and seen everything and done everything.” Her eyes flashed around her in a defiant way, rather like Tom’s, and she laughed with thrilling scorn. “Sophisticated—God, I’m sophisticated!”
vi: "Anh thấy đó, em cho rằng mọi thứ trên đời đều là khủng khiếp." Daisy nói tiếp giọng quả quyết. "Ai cũng nghĩ như vậy, ngay cả những người tiến bộ nhất. Em thực sự biết mà. Em đã từng đi mọi nơi, từng chứng kiến đủ mọi thứ và từng làm đủ mọi điều." Đôi mắt của Daisy lóe lên niềm thách thức, đảo nhìn chung quanh trông giống như ánh mắt của Tom, sau đó Daisy bật lên cười khanh khách một giọng cười đầy khinh bỉ xúc động. "Khôn ngoan tinh tế, trời ơi, em thật quá khôn ngoan tinh tế."
tr: “Her şeyin kötü yanından gördüğümü sen de anlamışsındır” diye devam etti kararlı bir sesle, “herkes de öyle düşünüyor. En eği­timli olanlar bile. Bense buna eminim. Her yere gittim, her şeyi gördüm, her istediğimi yaptım.” Gözleri dünyaya meydan okuyor tıpkı Tom gibi bakıyordu. Küçümseme dolu bir kahkaha attı, “Sofistike bir insanım ben. Tanrım, ne sofistikeyim ama”
es: Ya ves, creo que la vida es terrible —continuó, muy convencida—. Todo el mundo lo piensa, las personas de ideas más avanzadas. Y yo lo sé. He estado en todas partes, he visto todo y he hecho todo —lanzó una mirada desafiante a su alrededor, a la manera de Tom, y se echó a reír con impresionante desprecio—. Sofisticada… Dios mío, ¡qué sofisticada soy!
vi_translation: "You see, I think everything in the world is terrible." Daisy continued with a determined voice. "Everyone thinks so, even the most progressive people. I really know it. I've been everywhere, seen everything, and done everything." Daisy's eyes flashed with a challenging look, glancing around like Tom's eyes, then Daisy burst into a mocking, emotional laugh. "Wise and sophisticated, oh my, I'm so wise and sophisticated."
tr_translation: “You must have realized that I always see the bad side of everything,” he continued in a determined voice, “everyone thinks that way. Even the most educated ones. And I am sure of it. I have been everywhere, seen everything, done whatever I wanted.” His eyes challenged the world, looking just like Tom. He let out a laugh full of contempt, “I am a sophisticated person. God, how sophisticated I am.”
es_translation: You see, I think life is terrible —she continued, very convinced—. Everyone thinks so, the people with the most advanced ideas. And I know it. I’ve been everywhere, I’ve seen everything and I’ve done everything —she cast a defiant look around, in Tom’s manner, and laughed with impressive disdain—. Sophisticated… My God, how sophisticated I am!

en: The instant her voice broke off, ceasing to compel my attention, my belief, I felt the basic insincerity of what she had said. It made me uneasy, as though the whole evening had been a trick of some sort to exact a contributory emotion from me. I waited, and sure enough, in a moment she looked at me with an absolute smirk on her lovely face, as if she had asserted her membership in a rather distinguished secret society to which she and Tom belonged.
vi: Ngay sau khi giọng nói của Daisy đã ngưng lại không còn khiến tôi phải chú tâm nghe và tin theo nữa thì tôi bắt đầu nhận ra sự không chân thật trong những điều nàng vừa nói. Nó khiến tôi cảm thấy khó chịu, làm như nguyên cả buổi chiều nay đều là một trò đùa nhắm vào khai thác cảm giác của tôi để đóng góp vào trò chơi đó. Tôi chờ đợi, và đúng y như thế, chỉ trong chốc lát Daisy đã lại nhìn tôi với một nụ cười điệu và hoàn toàn tự mãn trên khuôn mặt xinh đẹp, làm như Daisy đã khẳng định được địa vị của mình trong một xã hội ưu tú kín mà nàng và Tom đang là hội viên.
tr: İlgi ve inancımı üzerine çeken sesi sustuğu anda, söylediklerinin aslında ne kadar samimiyetsiz olduğunu anlamıştım. Bu beni epey rahatsız etmişti. Akşam olanların tü­mü bende ona yandaş duygular uyandırmak üzere çevrilen dolaplar gibi gelmişti. Sessizce bekledim. Birkaç dakika son­ra sevimli yüzünde alaycı bir gülüş belirdi. Sanki o ve Tom çok önemli bir gizli örgütün üyesiymiş de kimse bunu bilmiyormuş gibi baktı bana.
es: En cuanto la voz se apagó y dejó de exigirme atención y confianza, tuve conciencia de la insinceridad básica de todo lo que había dicho. Y me sentí incómodo, como si toda la velada hubiera sido una trampa para extraer de mí una contribución sentimental. Esperé y, en efecto, al momento me miró con una espléndida sonrisa de satisfacción, como si me hubiera confesado su pertenencia a una distinguida sociedad secreta a la que tanto ella como Tom estaban afiliados.
vi_translation: Right after Daisy's voice stopped compelling me to listen and believe, I began to realize the insincerity in what she had just said. It made me feel uncomfortable, as if the entire afternoon had been a joke aimed at exploiting my feelings to contribute to that game. I waited, and sure enough, in just a moment Daisy looked at me again with a smug smile on her beautiful face, as if she had confirmed her status in an exclusive elite society of which she and Tom were members.
tr_translation: The moment the voice that had drawn my interest and belief fell silent, I realized how insincere its words actually were. This had disturbed me quite a bit. Everything that happened in the evening seemed to me like schemes designed to evoke sympathetic feelings towards him. I waited silently. A few minutes later, a mocking smile appeared on his charming face. He looked at me as if he and Tom were members of a very important secret organization that no one knew about.
es_translation: As soon as the voice faded and stopped demanding my attention and trust, I became aware of the basic insincerity of everything that had been said. And I felt uncomfortable, as if the whole evening had been a trap to extract a sentimental contribution from me. I waited and, indeed, at that moment she looked at me with a splendid smile of satisfaction, as if she had confessed to me her membership in a distinguished secret society to which both she and Tom were affiliated.

en: Inside, the crimson room bloomed with light. Tom and Miss Baker sat at either end of the long couch and she read aloud to him from the Saturday Evening Post—the words, murmurous and uninflected, running together in a soothing tune. The lamplight, bright on his boots and dull on the autumn-leaf yellow of her hair, glinted along the paper as she turned a page with a flutter of slender muscles in her arms.
vi: Bên trong nhà, căn phòng đỏ thẫm đã được bừng sáng dưới ánh đèn. Tom và Baker mỗi người ngồi một đầu của chiếc ghế dựa dài, Baker đang đọc tin tức trên tờ báo Saturtday Evening Post cho Tom nghe với giọng đọc rì rầm không biến đổi, những lời đọc quyện lẫn lấy nhau tạo thành một âm thanh như vuốt v e xoa dịu. Ánh đèn chiếu sáng loáng trên đôi ủng của Tom, mờ đục trên mái tóc vàng màu lá úa của Bakey và phản chiếu ánh lấp lánh dọc theo trang giấy khi Baker đưa tay giở trang bằng những bắp tay thon thả rung nhẹ.
tr: İçerde, kırmızı oda ışıkla dolmuştu. Tom ve Bayan Ba­ker uzun kanepenin iki ucuna oturmuşlar, genç kadın yüksek sesle Saturday Evening Post dergisini okuyordu. Tom birbirine eklenip sakinleştirici bir mırıltıya dönüşen sözcükleri dinliyordu. Tavandaki ışıklar çizmelerinde ışıldıyor, kızın sonbahar-yaprağı ren­gindeki saçlarında matlaşıyor, kol kaslarını oynatarak çevirdiği sayfalar üzerinde dolaşıyordu.
es: Dentro de la casa, el salón carmesí florecía de luz. Tom y miss Baker se sentaban en los extremos del amplio sofá, y miss Baker leía en voz alta un artículo del Saturday Evening Post: las palabras, en un susurro, sin inflexiones, se fundían en una melodía de efectos sedantes. La luz de la lámpara resplandecía en las botas de montar, perdía brillo en el pelo amarillo otoñal de miss Baker, y destellaba en el papel cada vez que pasaba la página y palpitaba la delicada musculatura de sus brazos.
vi_translation: Inside the house, the crimson room was illuminated under the light. Tom and Baker each sat at one end of the long bench, with Baker reading the news from the Saturday Evening Post to Tom in a monotonous murmur, the words blending together to form a sound like a caress to soothe. The light shone on Tom's boots, dulled on Bakey's pale yellow hair, and reflected a sparkle along the page as Baker turned it with slender, slightly trembling arms.
tr_translation: Inside, the red room was filled with light. Tom and Mrs. Baker were sitting at the two ends of the long couch, the young woman was reading the Saturday Evening Post magazine aloud. Tom was listening to the words that joined together and turned into a soothing murmur. The lights on the ceiling were shining on his boots, dimming in the girl's autumn-leaf-colored hair, and moving over the pages she turned with her arm muscles.
es_translation: Inside the house, the crimson living room bloomed with light. Tom and Miss Baker sat at the ends of the wide sofa, and Miss Baker read aloud an article from the Saturday Evening Post: the words, in a whisper, without inflections, blended into a melody of soothing effects. The lamp light gleamed on the riding boots, lost its shine in Miss Baker's autumn yellow hair, and flashed on the paper every time she turned the page and the delicate muscles of her arms pulsed.

en: When we came in she held us silent for a moment with a lifted hand.
vi: Khi hai chúng tôi bước vào, Baker dơ tay lên ra hiệu cho chúng tôi giữ im lặng.
tr: İçeri girdiğimizde konuşmadan yüzümüze baktı, eli hava­da bir süre bekledi.
es: Cuando entramos, nos obligó, alzando una mano, a mantener silencio unos segundos.
vi_translation: When the two of us walked in, Baker raised his hand to signal us to keep quiet.
tr_translation: When we entered, he looked at our faces without speaking, his hand suspended in the air for a while.
es_translation: When we entered, he made us, raising a hand, keep silent for a few seconds.

en: “To be continued,” she said, tossing the magazine on the table, “in our very next issue.”
vi: "Còn tiếp, xin đón đọc số báo kế tiếp." Cuối cùng Baker nói, vứt tờ tạp chí lên trên bàn
tr: “Arkası yarın” dedi dergiyi masaya fırlatırken.
es: —Continuará —dijo, y arrojó la revista sobre la mesa— en nuestro próximo número.
vi_translation: "To be continued, please read the next issue." Baker finally said, throwing the magazine onto the table
tr_translation: "To be continued," he said as he tossed the magazine onto the table.
es_translation: —To be continued —he said, and threw the magazine onto the table— in our next issue.

en: Her body asserted itself with a restless movement of her knee, and she stood up.
vi: Baker lắc đầu gối chỉnh lại tứ thế mình cho thẳng rồi đứng lên.
tr: Sonra bacağını diğerinin üzerinden telaşla indirerek ayağa fırladı.
es: El cuerpo impuso su poder con un movimiento impaciente de las rodillas, y miss Baker se puso de pie.
vi_translation: Baker shook his knee to adjust his posture, then stood up straight.
tr_translation: Then, hurriedly lowering his leg from over the other, he jumped to his feet.
es_translation: The body asserted its power with an impatient movement of the knees, and Miss Baker stood up.

en: “Ten o’clock,” she remarked, apparently finding the time on the ceiling. “Time for this good girl to go to bed.”
vi: "Mười giờ rồi, con gái nết na thì nên đi ngủ vào giờ này." Baker nói, dáng điệu giống như đang coi giờ trên trần nhà.
tr: “Saat on olmuş” dedi, tavandaki bir saate bakarmış gibi, “İyi kızların yatma zamanı.
es: —Las diez —señaló, como si comprobara la hora en el techo—. Es hora de que esta niña buena se acueste.
vi_translation: "It's ten o'clock already, a well-behaved girl should go to bed at this hour." Baker said, his demeanor resembling someone checking the time on the ceiling.
tr_translation: “It is ten o'clock,” she said, as if looking at a clock on the ceiling, “It's time for good girls to go to bed.”
es_translation: —Ten o'clock —he noted, as if checking the time on the ceiling—. It's time for this good girl to go to bed.

en: “Jordan’s going to play in the tournament tomorrow,” explained Daisy, “over at Westchester.”
vi: "Jordan sẽ đi tranh giải vào ngày mai ở Westchester." Daisy giải thích.
tr: “Jordan yarın Westchester’deki turnuvaya katılacak” dedi Daisy.
es: —Jordan participa mañana en el torneo de Westchester —explicó Daisy.
vi_translation: "Jordan will compete tomorrow in Westchester," Daisy explained.
tr_translation: “Jordan will participate in the tournament in Westchester tomorrow,” said Daisy.
es_translation: —Jordan is participating in the Westchester tournament tomorrow —explained Daisy.

en: “Oh—you’re Jordan Baker.”
vi: "Ồ, thế ra cô là Jordan Baker."
tr: “Demek siz Jordan Baker’sınız.
es: —Ah, ¡eres Jordan Baker!
vi_translation: "Oh, so you are Jordan Baker."
tr_translation: “So you are Jordan Baker.””
es_translation: —Ah, you are Jordan Baker!

en: I knew now why her face was familiar—its pleasing contemptuous expression had looked out at me from many rotogravure pictures of the sporting life at Asheville and Hot Springs and Palm Beach. I had heard some story of her too, a critical, unpleasant story, but what it was I had forgotten long ago.
vi: Bây giờ tôi mới biết tại sao khuôn mặt của cô ta trông quen thuộc như vậy. Cái vẻ mặt khinh khỉnh đáng yêu đó đã từng nhìn thẳng vào tôi từ trong những bức hình chụp đăng trên báo thể thao ở những thành phố như Asheville, Hot Springs và Palm Beach. Tôi cũng đã từng nghe đồn đại về cô ta, toàn là những lời phê bình chỉ trích về một chuyện không được hay ho thú vị, nhưng là chuyện gì thì tôi đã quên mất tiêu rồi.
tr: Yüzünün neden tanıdık geldiğini şimdi anlamıştım. Ashville, Hot Springs ve Palm Beach gibi yerlerdeki spor haberlerini okurken biraz kibirli duran, bu güzel yüze çok rastlamıştım. Uzun zaman önce onunla ilgili pek de hoş olmayan bir hikaye de duymuştum ama o an pek hatırlamadım.
es: Ahora sabía por qué su cara me resultaba familiar: aquella expresión agradable y desdeñosa me había mirado desde muchas fotografías en huecograbado en las paginas de noticias sobre la vida deportiva en Asheville, Hot Springs y Palm Beach. También me habían llegado chismes sobre ella, una historia negativa y desagradable, de la que me había olvidado hacía tiempo.
vi_translation: Now I understand why her face looks so familiar. That adorable disdainful expression had once looked straight at me from photographs published in sports newspapers in cities like Asheville, Hot Springs, and Palm Beach. I had also heard rumors about her, all critical comments about something not very pleasant, but what it was, I had completely forgotten.
tr_translation: Now I understood why his face looked familiar. I had often come across this beautiful face, which looked a bit arrogant, while reading sports news from places like Ashville, Hot Springs, and Palm Beach. Long ago, I had also heard a rather unpleasant story about him, but I didn't quite remember it at that moment.
es_translation: Now I knew why her face seemed familiar to me: that pleasant and disdainful expression had looked at me from many photogravure pictures in the news pages about the sporting life in Asheville, Hot Springs, and Palm Beach. Gossip about her had also reached me, a negative and unpleasant story that I had long forgotten.

en: “Good night,” she said softly. “Wake me at eight, won’t you.”
vi: "Chúc ngủ ngon.
tr: “İyi geceler” dedi alçak sesle, ‘beni saat sekizde uyandırır mısın?
es: —Buenas noches —dijo en voz baja—. ¿Te importaría despertarme a las ocho?
vi_translation: "Good night. Remember to wake me up at eight o'clock tomorrow morning."
tr_translation: “Good night,” he said in a low voice, “will you wake me up at eight o'clock?””
es_translation: —Good night —he said in a low voice—. Would you mind waking me up at eight?

en: “I will. Good night, Mr. Carraway. See you anon.”
vi: "Nếu mà em dậy được thì chị cũng sẽ làm." "Dậy được mà. Chúc anh ngủ ngon, anh Carraway. Mong sớm có dịp gặp lại anh."
tr: “Uyanırım. İyi geceler Bay Carraway, yakında görüşürüz.
es: —Pienso levantarme. Buenas noches, mister Carraway. Nos veremos pronto.
vi_translation: "If you can wake up, then I will do it too." "You can get up." "Good night, Mr. Carraway. Hope to see you again soon."
tr_translation: “I will wake up. Good night Mr. Carraway, see you soon.”
es_translation: —I plan to get up. Good night, Mister Carraway. We will see each other soon.

en: “Of course you will,” confirmed Daisy. “In fact I think I’ll arrange a marriage. Come over often, Nick, and I’ll sort of—oh—fling you together. You know—lock you up accidentally in linen closets and push you out to sea in a boat, and all that sort of thing—”
vi: "Em chắc chắc sẽ có dịp gặp lại mà." Daisy xác nhận." Thật ra chị sẽ sắp xếp làm mai cho hai người. Nick, anh nhớ đến đây thường xuyên và em sẽ làm mai cho hai người, kiểu như tình cờ nhốt hai người vào trong một tủ quần áo rồi đẩy lên trên một chiếc tàu đưa ra biển, đại khái những mánh khóe như thế."
tr: “Tabii ki görüşeceksiniz” dedi Daisy. “Bakarsın sizi evlendiririm. Bize sık sık uğra Nick. Ben de bu arada –hani- ikinizi bir araya toplarım. Belki çamaşır dolabına filan kilitlerim ya da sandala bindirip uzak denizlere açılırım. Bir şeyler yaparım işte.
es: —Claro que os veréis pronto —confirmó Daisy—. E incluso pienso organizar una boda. Ven a menudo, Nick, y ya veré yo…, ay, cómo juntaros. Ya sabes… Encerraros sin querer en un armario, o lanzaros al mar en un bote, cosas así…
vi_translation: "You will definitely have a chance to meet again." Daisy confirmed. "Actually, I will arrange a matchmaking for you two." "Nick, you should come here often and I will set you two up, like accidentally locking you both in a closet and then pushing it onto a ship heading out to sea, you know, tricks like that."
tr_translation: “Of course you will meet,” said Daisy. “Maybe I'll get you two married. Visit us often, Nick. In the meantime, I’ll –you know– bring you two together. Maybe I'll lock you in the laundry closet or put you on a boat and set sail for distant seas. I'll do something.”
es_translation: —Of course, you will see each other soon —confirmed Daisy—. And I even plan to organize a wedding. Come often, Nick, and I will see to it… oh, how to bring you together. You know… Accidentally lock you in a closet, or throw you into the sea in a boat, things like that…

en: “Good night,” called Miss Baker from the stairs. “I haven’t heard a word.”
vi: "Chúc ngủ ngon, em không nghe thấy gì đâu nhé." Baker nói vọng xuống từ trên cầu thang.
tr: “İyi geceler” dedi Bayan Baker merdivenlerden çıkarken, “bunları duymamış olayım.
es: —Buenas noches —dijo miss Baker desde la escalera—. No he oído ni una palabra.
vi_translation: "Good night, you won't hear anything." Baker called down from the stairs.
tr_translation: “Good night,” said Mrs. Baker as she walked up the stairs, “I will pretend I didn't hear this.”
es_translation: —Good evening —said Miss Baker from the stairs—. I haven't heard a single word.

en: “She’s a nice girl,” said Tom after a moment. “They oughtn’t to let her run around the country this way.”
vi: "Cô ấy là một cô gái dễ thương. Người ta không nên để cô đi lung tung như vậy." Sau một hồi Tom nói.
tr: “Tatlı bir kız” dedi Tom o gittikten sonra, “böy­le ortalığa salıp durmasalar iyi olur.
es: —Es una chica estupenda —dijo Tom al cabo del rato—. No deberían dejarla viajar así por el país.
vi_translation: "She is a cute girl. People shouldn't let her wander around like that," Tom said after a while.
tr_translation: “Sweet girl,” said Tom after she left, “it would be better if they didn't let her wander around like that.”
es_translation: —She is a wonderful girl —said Tom after a while—. They shouldn't let her travel around the country like that.

en: “Who oughtn’t to?” inquired Daisy coldly.
vi: "Người nào không nên làm vậy?" Daisy lạnh lùng hỏi.
tr: “Kimler?” diye sordu Daisy soğuk bir sesle.
es: —¿Quién no debería? —preguntó Daisy, fría.
vi_translation: "Who shouldn't do that?" Daisy asked coldly.
tr_translation: “Who?” Daisy asked in a cold voice.
es_translation: —Who shouldn't? —asked Daisy, coldly.

en: “Her family is one aunt about a thousand years old. Besides, Nick’s going to look after her, aren’t you, Nick? She’s going to spend lots of weekends out here this summer. I think the home influence will be very good for her.”
vi: "Baker chỉ còn có một người dì đã khoảng một ngàn tuổi là người thân. Nhưng mà Nick sẽ chăm sóc cho cô ta, phải vậy không Nick? Mùa hè này Baker sẽ ở đây nhiều cuối tuần với chúng ta. Em nghĩ khung cảnh gia đình sẽ có ảnh hưởng tốt cho Baker."
tr: “Ailesi dediğin yüz yaşına gelmiş teyzesi. Hem artık Nick onunla ilgilenir, değil mi Nick? Jordan bu yaz pek çok hafta sonu burada olacak. Bu yuvanın havası ona çok iyi gelecek.
es: —Su familia es una tía que debe de tener mil años. Además, Nick la va a cuidar, ¿verdad, Nick? Jordan va a pasar con nosotros este verano bastantes fines de semana. Creo que tener un hogar le hará mucho bien.
vi_translation: "Baker only has one aunt who is about a thousand years old as a relative. But Nick will take care of her, won't you Nick? This summer Baker will be here many weekends with us. I think the family atmosphere will have a good influence on Baker."
tr_translation: “The family you mentioned is his hundred-year-old aunt. Besides, Nick will take care of her now, right Nick? Jordan will be here many weekends this summer. The atmosphere of this home will do her a lot of good.”
es_translation: —His family is an aunt who must be a thousand years old. Besides, Nick is going to take care of her, right, Nick? Jordan is going to spend quite a few weekends with us this summer. I think having a home will do him a lot of good.

en: Daisy and Tom looked at each other for a moment in silence.
vi: Daisy và Tom nhìn nhau một lúc trong im lặng.
tr: İkisi de susup birbirlerine baktı.
es: Daisy y Tom se miraron un momento en silencio.
vi_translation: Daisy and Tom looked at each other for a moment in silence.
tr_translation: They both fell silent and looked at each other.
es_translation: Daisy and Tom looked at each other in silence for a moment.

en: “Is she from New York?” I asked quickly.
vi: "Có phải cô ta nhà ở New York không?" Tôi hỏi nhanh.
tr: “New York’lu mu?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Es de Nueva York? —pregunté inmediatamente.
vi_translation: "Does she live in New York?" I asked quickly.
tr_translation: "Are you from New York?" I asked.
es_translation: —Are you from New York? —I asked immediately.

en: “From Louisville. Our white girlhood was passed together there. Our beautiful white—”
vi: "Từ Louisville. Thời thiếu nữ thơ ngây trong trắng chúng em đã lớn lên ở đó. Thời trong trắng xinh tươi..."
tr: “Louisville’li. Genç kızlığımızın masum yıllarını orada geçirdik. O masum...
es: —De Louisville. Allí pasamos juntas la adolescencia inmaculada. La adolescencia inmaculada y maravillosa…
vi_translation: "From Louisville. In our innocent and pure youth, we grew up there. The time of fresh purity..."
tr_translation: "From Louisville." "We spent the innocent years of our youth there." "That innocence...""
es_translation: —From Louisville. There we spent our immaculate adolescence together. The immaculate and wonderful adolescence…

en: “Did you give Nick a little heart to heart talk on the veranda?” demanded Tom suddenly.
vi: "Em đã tâm sự nhiều với Nick ở hiên nhà rồi phải không?" Tom đột nhiên tra hỏi.
tr: “Taraçada otururken Nick’e dert mi yandın yoksa?” diye sordu Tom birden.
es: —¿Le has estado contando secretos a Nick en la terraza? —preguntó Tom de repente.
vi_translation: "You've been confiding a lot with Nick on the porch, haven't you?" Tom suddenly interrogated.
tr_translation: “Did you complain to Nick while sitting on the terrace?” Tom suddenly asked.
es_translation: —Have you been telling secrets to Nick on the terrace? —asked Tom suddenly.

en: “Did I?” She looked at me. “I can’t seem to remember, but I think we talked about the Nordic race. Yes, I’m sure we did. It sort of crept up on us and first thing you know—”
vi: "Phải vậy không?" Daisy nhìn tôi. "Em cũng không nhớ rõ nữa nhưng em nghĩ tụi em đã nói chuyện về giống người Bắc Âu. Đúng rồi, em nhớ chắc chắc là tụi em đã nói về chuyện đó. Thì cũng là do câu chuyện tự đưa đẩy, đến lúc nhận ra..."
tr: “Öyle mi yaptım?” yüzüme baktı. “Gerçi pek hatırlamıyorum ama Normanlardan bahsettik galiba. Evet, öyleydi eminim. Birden aklımıza geliverdi işte, sonra birde baktık ki...
es: —¿Te he contado secretos? —me miró Daisy—. No me acuerdo, pero creo que hemos hablado de la raza nórdica. Sí, estoy segura. Casi sin darnos cuenta, ya sabes, lo primero que…
vi_translation: "Is that so?" Daisy looked at me. "I don't remember clearly, but I think we talked about the Nordic people. Yes, I definitely remember we talked about that. It was just the way the conversation flowed, and then we realized..."
tr_translation: "Did I do that?" he looked at my face. “Although I don't quite remember, I think we talked about the Normans. Yes, I'm sure it was like that. It suddenly came to our minds, and then we looked and saw that...”
es_translation: —Have I told you secrets? —Daisy looked at me—. I don't remember, but I think we have talked about the Nordic race. Yes, I am sure. Almost without realizing it, you know, the first thing that…

en: “Don’t believe everything you hear, Nick,” he advised me.
vi: "Đừng tin vào hết những gì cậu nghe Nick ạ." Tom khuyên tôi.
tr: “Her duyduğuna inanma Nick” diye nasihat etti Tom.
es: —No te creas todo lo que te cuenten, Nick —me aconsejó Tom.
vi_translation: "Don't believe everything you hear, Nick." Tom advised me.
tr_translation: "Don't believe everything you hear, Nick," Tom advised.
es_translation: —Don't believe everything they tell you, Nick —Tom advised me.

en: I said lightly that I had heard nothing at all, and a few minutes later I got up to go home. They came to the door with me and stood side by side in a cheerful square of light. As I started my motor Daisy peremptorily called: “Wait!
vi: Tôi nhẹ nhàng trả lời rằng tôi chưa nghe gì hết cả. Vài phút sau tôi đứng dậy cáo từ ra về. Hai vợ chồng họ tiễn chân tôi ra cửa, đứng cạnh nhau trong khoảng ánh sáng tươi vui. Khi tôi vừa rồ máy xe thì Daisy gọi giật tôi lại. "Đợi một lát."
tr: Bir şey duymadığımı söyledim sessizce. Birkaç dakika sonra da gitmek üzere kalktım. Beni uğurlamak için kapıya kadar gelip üstlerine yağan ışıkta yan yana durdular. Arabama binip motoru çalıştırdığımda Daisy’den buyurgan bir, “Bekle!” sesi geldi.
es: Dije despreocupadamente que no me habían contado nada, y pocos minutos después me levanté para irme a casa. Me acampanaron a la puerta y se detuvieron, juntos, en un radiante cuadrado de luz. Cuando arrancaba el coche, Daisy gritó perentoriamente: «¡Espera!»
vi_translation: I gently replied that I hadn't heard anything at all. A few minutes later, I stood up to take my leave. The couple saw me off to the door, standing next to each other in the cheerful light. Just as I started the car, Daisy called me back. "Wait a moment."
tr_translation: I said quietly that I didn't hear anything. A few minutes later, I got up to leave. They stood side by side in the light that rained down on them as they came to the door to see me off. When I got into my car and started the engine, a commanding "Wait!" came from Daisy.
es_translation: I said nonchalantly that they hadn't told me anything, and a few minutes later I got up to go home. They accompanied me to the door and stopped, together, in a radiant square of light. As I started the car, Daisy shouted peremptorily: "Wait!"

en: “I forgot to ask you something, and it’s important. We heard you were engaged to a girl out West.”
vi: "Khoan đã, em quên hỏi anh một điều quan trọng. Tụi em nghe nói anh đã đính hôn với một thiếu nữ ở miền Tây."
tr: “Sana önemli bir şey soracak­tım, unutmuşum. Batı’dan bir kızla nişanlandığını duyduk.
es: —Se me ha olvidado preguntarte algo importante. Nos han llegado noticias de que te has prometido con una chica del Oeste.
vi_translation: "Wait a minute, I forgot to ask you something important. We heard that you got engaged to a young woman in the West."
tr_translation: “I was going to ask you something important, but I forgot. We heard that you got engaged to a girl from the West.
es_translation: —I forgot to ask you something important. We have received news that you got engaged to a girl from the West.

en: “That’s right,” corroborated Tom kindly. “We heard that you were engaged.”
vi: Tụi em nghe nói anh đã đính hôn với một thiếu nữ ở miền Tây." "Đúng rồi." Tom phụ hoạ giọng thân mật. "Chúng tôi nghe nói anh đã đính hôn."
tr: “Doğru” dedi Tom destek vererek, “nişanlandığını duyduk.
es: —Es verdad —corroboró Tom con calor—. Nos han dicho que te habías prometido.
vi_translation: "That's right." Tom chimed in with a friendly tone. "We heard that you got engaged."
tr_translation: “Right,” said Tom in agreement, “we heard you got engaged.””
es_translation: —It's true —Tom corroborated warmly—. They told us that you had gotten engaged.

en: “It’s a libel. I’m too poor.”
vi: "Đó chỉ là tin bôi nhọ thôi. Tôi nghèo quá mà."
tr: “İftira atmışlar. Evlenecek kadar param yok.
es: —Es mentira. Soy demasiado pobre.
vi_translation: "That's just slander. I'm too poor."
tr_translation: “They have slandered me. I don't have enough money to get married.”
es_translation: —It's a lie. I am too poor.

en: “But we heard it,” insisted Daisy, surprising me by opening up again in a flower-like way. “We heard it from three people, so it must be true.”
vi: "Nhưng đúng là tụi em đã nghe được như vậy." Daisy vẫn khăng khăng. Tôi ngạc nhiên thấy Daisy đã nói cười trở lại như một bông hoa. "Tụi em đã được nghe lại từ ba người, như vậy nó phải là sự thật."
tr: “Ama biz öyle duyduk” diye üsteledi Daisy. Durgun halinin geçip birden çiçek açmasına şaşırmıştım. “Ayrı ayrı üç kişiden duyduk, doğru olmalı.
es: —Pues nos lo han dicho —insistió Daisy y, para mi sorpresa, volvía a abrirse como una flor—. Nos lo han dicho tres personas, así que tiene que ser verdad.
vi_translation: "But we really did hear it that way." Daisy insisted. I was surprised to see Daisy talking and laughing again like a flower. "We heard it from three people, so it must be true."
tr_translation: “But that's what we heard,” insisted Daisy. I was surprised by her sudden blossoming from her previously calm state. “We heard it from three different people, it must be true.”
es_translation: —Well, they told us —insisted Daisy and, to my surprise, she was opening up again like a flower—. Three people told us, so it must be true.

en: Of course I knew what they were referring to, but I wasn’t even vaguely engaged. The fact that gossip had published the banns was one of the reasons I had come East. You can’t stop going with an old friend on account of rumours, and on the other hand I had no intention of being rumoured into marriage.
vi: Đương nhiên tôi hiểu họ đang ám chỉ gì nhưng tôi chưa hề đính hôn dù chỉ là mập mờ. Thật ra những lời đồn nhảm đó đã được lan tới cả công bố nhà thờ và đã là một trong những lý do khiến tôi dọn về miền Đông. Ta không thể không giao thiệp với một người bạn lâu năm chỉ vì những lời đồn đại. Mặt khác tôi không có ý định lấy người ấy vì muốn biến lời đồn thành sự thật.
tr: Neden bahsettiklerini anlamıştım elbette ama nişanlanmanın kıyısına bile yaklaşmamıştım aslında. Evlilik işlemlerini başlattığıma dair ortalıkta gezen dedikodular Doğu’ya geliş nedenlerinden biriydi zaten. Dedikodular yüzünden eski bir dostunuzla görüşmeyi bırakamazsınız ama sırf dedikodu oluyor diye de evlenecek değildim.
es: Yo sabía, por supuesto, a qué se referían, pero no estaba ni vagamente prometido. El hecho de que los cotilleos hubieran dado por publicadas las amonestaciones fue una de las razones de que me fuera al Este. No se puede dejar de salir con una vieja amiga por culpa de las habladurías, y, por otra parte, tampoco tenía intención de casarme por lo que dijeran unos y otros.
vi_translation: Of course, I understand what they are implying, but I have never been engaged, even ambiguously. In fact, those rumors had spread to the church announcements and were one of the reasons I moved to the East. One cannot avoid interacting with a long-time friend just because of rumors. On the other hand, I have no intention of marrying that person just to make the rumors come true.
tr_translation: Of course, I understood what they were talking about, but I hadn't even come close to getting engaged. The rumors circulating about me starting the marriage procedures were one of the reasons I came to the East anyway. You can't stop seeing an old friend because of rumors, but I wasn't going to get married just because there were rumors.
es_translation: Of course, I knew what they were referring to, but I was not even vaguely engaged. The fact that the gossip had announced the banns was one of the reasons I went East. You can't stop seeing an old friend because of rumors, and, on the other hand, I had no intention of getting married just because of what people said.

en: Their interest rather touched me and made them less remotely rich—nevertheless, I was confused and a little disgusted as I drove away. It seemed to me that the thing for Daisy to do was to rush out of the house, child in arms—but apparently there were no such intentions in her head. As for Tom, the fact that he “had some woman in New York” was really less surprising than that he had been depressed by a book. Something was making him nibble at the edge of stale ideas as if his sturdy physical egotism no longer nourished his peremptory heart.
vi: Sự quan tâm của hai vợ chồng Tom khiến tôi cảm động và khiến khoảng cách giàu sang của họ với tôi được thu ngắn lại. Dù sao đi nữa, lúc chia tay họ ra về tôi vẫn cảm thấy bối rối, lẫn lộn, pha chút phẩn nộ. Với tôi, dường như việc Daisy có thể làm bây giờ là nên ôm con trong tay chạy cho nhanh ra khỏi nhà. Nhưng trong đầu Daisy dường như không có ý tưởng đó. Về phần Tom, chuyện anh ta thật sự "có một người đàn bà khác ở New York" có lẽ còn ít ngạc nhiên hơn chuyện anh ta bị chán nản sau khi đọc một quyển sách. Không biết cái gì đó đã khiến Tom phải chịu gặm nhấm những tư tưởng cũ rích nhàm chán, làm như cái sự tự đại về thân thể cường tráng của mình đã không còn đủ sức nuôi trái tim quyết đoán của anh ta.
tr: Tom ve Daisy’nin bu ilgisi beni çok etkilemiş ve aramızdaki, zenginliklerinden doğan mesafeyi biraz olsun azaltmıştı. Eve dönüş yolunda kafam biraz karışıktı ve öfkeliydim. Daisy’nin tek yapması gereken kızını kucakladığı gibi evi terk etmekti. Ama aklında böyle bir şey olmadığı belliydi. Tom içinse, ‘New York’ta bir metresi olması’ okuduğu bir kitap yüzünden bunalıma girmesinden daha az şaşırtıcıydı. Gösterişli beden gücü artık o buyurgan ruhunu beslemeye yetmiyor olacak ki, bayat bazı fikirlerin sağını solunu kemirmekle uğraşıyordu.
es: El interés de Tom y Daisy me conmovió bastante: me parecieron más cercanos, menos remotamente ricos. Sin embargo, ya en el coche, me sentía confuso y un poco disgustado. Pensaba que la obligación de Daisy era salir corriendo de la casa con la niña en brazos, aunque, por lo visto, no tenía la menor intención de hacer tal cosa. En cuanto a Tom, que tuviera «una mujer en Nueva York» era menos sorprendente que el hecho de que un libro lo hubiera deprimido tanto. Algo lo llevaba a roer lo más superficial de unas cuantas ideas rancias como si su egoísmo, físico, rotundo, ya no bastara para alimentar a su corazón apremiante.
vi_translation: The concern of Tom and his wife moved me and shortened the distance of their wealth from me. Anyway, when they left, I still felt confused, mixed, with a bit of indignation. To me, it seemed like what Daisy should do now was to quickly run out of the house with her child in her arms. But in Daisy's mind, that idea didn't seem to exist. As for Tom, the fact that he truly "had another woman in New York" was perhaps less surprising than him being bored after reading a book. Something had caused Tom to chew on old, boring ideas, as if his pride in his strong physique was no longer enough to sustain his decisive heart.
tr_translation: Tom and Daisy's interest in me had greatly affected me and had somewhat reduced the distance between us, born of their wealth. On the way back home, my mind was a bit confused and I was angry. All Daisy had to do was leave the house as she embraced her daughter. But it was clear that she had no such intention. For Tom, having a mistress in New York was less surprising than getting depressed over a book he read. His ostentatious physical strength was no longer sufficient to nourish that domineering spirit of his, so he was busy gnawing at some stale ideas.
es_translation: The interest of Tom and Daisy moved me quite a bit: they seemed closer, less remotely rich. However, already in the car, I felt confused and a little disgusted. I thought that Daisy's duty was to run out of the house with the child in her arms, although, apparently, she had no intention of doing such a thing. As for Tom, that he had "a woman in New York" was less surprising than the fact that a book had depressed him so much. Something drove him to gnaw at the most superficial aspects of a few stale ideas as if his physical, resounding selfishness was no longer enough to feed his pressing heart.

en: Already it was deep summer on roadhouse roofs and in front of wayside garages, where new red petrol-pumps sat out in pools of light, and when I reached my estate at West Egg I ran the car under its shed and sat for a while on an abandoned grass roller in the yard. The wind had blown off, leaving a loud, bright night, with wings beating in the trees and a persistent organ sound as the full bellows of the earth blew the frogs full of life. The silhouette of a moving cat wavered across the moonlight, and, turning my head to watch it, I saw that I was not alone—fifty feet away a figure had emerged from the shadow of my neighbour’s mansion and was standing with his hands in his pockets regarding the silver pepper of the stars. Something in his leisurely movements and the secure position of his feet upon the lawn suggested that it was Mr. Gatsby himself, come out to determine what share was his of our local heavens.
vi: Mùa hè đến cũng đã lâu rồi trên mái của những quán ăn và phía trước của những tiệm sửa xe dọc đường, nơi những máy bơm xăng màu đỏ mới toanh đứng sững trong vũng ánh đèn rọi sáng chan hoà. Khi về tới nhà ở West Egg, tôi đậu cất xe và ngồi xuống một lát trên chiếc máy cắt cỏ bỏ phế trên sân. Gió đã ngừng thổi, chừa lại một đêm trăng sáng với tiếng những cánh chim đập vào những tàng lá cây và tiếng kêu la không dứt từ bầy ếch nhái đang được lòng đất thổi hơi căng phồng sứs sống. Có chiếc bóng lung linh của con mèo đang trườn mình ngang qua bóng trăng, khi tôi quay đầu nhìn theo con mèo, tôi thấy mình thật ra không lẻ loi. Cách tôi khoảng năm mươi thước là một dáng người vừa mới hiện ra từ chiếc bóng đen của toà lâu đài hàng xóm bên cạnh. Anh ta đang đứng với hai tay thọc trong túi quần, ngắm nhìn những ngôi sao lấm tấm như bạc rắc trên bầu trời. Có cái vẻ gì đó nhàn nhã ung dung trong dáng điệu của anh ta và cách anh đặt chân kiên cố vững chắc trên thảm cỏ căn nhà cho tôi thấy anh chính là Gatsby. Anh đang ra ngoài để khẳng định xem giữa hai khu cư trú của chúng tôi, sở hữu nào là thuộc về của anh.
tr: Yol kenarındaki lokantalar ve önlerinde ışıl ışıl kırmızı benzin pompaları duran tamirhanelerde yaz havası iyiden iyiye hissediliyordu. West Egg’deki malikaneme varınca arabayı garaja park edip bah­çedeki terk edilmiş çim biçme makinesinin kenarına oturdum. Rüzgardan geriye ağaçlarda çırpılan kanatların, toprağın vargücüyle üflediği körüklerin yorulmak bilmez kurbağalardan çıkardığı ısrarlı org seslerinin duyulduğu gürültülü, parlak bir gece kalmıştı. Bir kedi ayışığı altında aniden sendeledi. Ona bakmak için başımı çevirince yalnız olmadığı­mı fark ettim. On beş metre ilerde, yandaki malikanenin gölgesinden ayırt edilen bir şekil, elleri cebinde, yıldızların gümüş serpintilerini izliyordu. Rahat tavırları ve çimenleri güvenle adımlayışı bana, onun etrafımızdaki cennetin ne kadarına sahip olduğunu hesaplamak üzere yürüyüşe çıkan Bay Gatsby olduğunu düşündürmüştü.
es: Se notaba el verano en los tejados de los hoteles de carretera y en las estaciones de servicio, donde los surtidores rojos, nuevos, se levantaban sobre charcos de luz, y cuando llegué a mi casa en West Egg aparqué el coche en el cobertizo y me senté un rato en el jardín, en un cortacésped abandonado. Ya no soplaba el viento, que había dejado una noche clara y ruidosa, con alas que batían en los árboles y el sonido persistente de un órgano, como si el fuelle poderoso de la tierra insuflara vida a las ranas. La silueta de un gato se movió vacilante a la luz de la luna y, al volver la cabeza para mirarlo, vi que no estaba solo: a unos quince metros de distancia una figura había surgido de la sombra de la mansión de mi vecino y de pie, con las manos en los bolsillos, contemplaba la pimienta plateada de las estrellas. Algo en la lentitud de sus movimientos y en la seguridad con que apoyaba los pies en el césped me sugirió que se trataba de mister Gatsby, que había salido a calcular qué parte le correspondía del firmamento local.
vi_translation: Summer had long arrived on the roofs of eateries and in front of roadside repair shops, where brand-new red gas pumps stood tall in pools of bright, all-encompassing light. When I got home to West Egg, I parked the car and sat for a moment on the abandoned lawn mower in the yard. The wind had stopped blowing, leaving a bright moonlit night with the sound of birds' wings flapping against the tree leaves and the incessant croaking of frogs, whose life force was being inflated by the earth's breath. There was the shimmering shadow of a cat slinking across the moonlight, and as I turned my head to follow the cat, I realized I was not alone.
