Tuy nhiên nếu nhìn từ một khoảng cách xa thì con gà mái sẽ được nhìn ra thành một cái mũ và khuôn mặt của một bà già mập đang tươi cười nhìn xuống căn phòng. Nhiều tờ báo Town Tattle cũ nằm trên bàn cùng với một quyển tiểu thuyết SIMON CALLED PETER và vài tờ báo lá cải nhỏ chuyên moi móc những tin đồn ở sân khấu Broadway. Vào tới nhà, việc trước tiên Myrtle làm là lo lắng cho con chó. Thằng nhỏ gác cầu thang máy tỏ vẻ miễn cưỡng khi bị sai đi mua một thùng rơm và một ít sữa. Lúc mua xong, nó tự ý mua thêm một hộp thiếc loại bánh bự và cứng dành cho chó ăn. Một miếng bánh còn sót lại trong đĩa sữa nằm rửa nát hờ hững nguyên cả buổi tối. Tom mở khóa chiếc tủ kiếng lấy ra một chai rượu whiskey.
tr: Küçük bir oturma odası, küçük bir ye­mek odası, küçük bir yatak odası ve küçük bir de banyodan oluşan daire en üst kattaydı. Oturma odası, goblenle kaplı ve odaya göre fazla büyük olan mobilyalarla öylesine doluydu ki; Versay Sarayı’nın bahçesinde resmedilmiş neşeli hanımefendilerden bir kaçına tökezlemeden hareket etmek mümkün olmuyordu. Duvarda asılı tek resim, fazlasıyla büyütülmüş olan bir fo­toğraftı. İlk bakışta belli belirsiz bir kayanın üzeri­ne tünemiş bir tavuğa benzese de, biraz uzaktan tekrar bakıldığında tavuk bir boneye dönüşüyor ve gülümse­yen yaşlı bir bayanın tombul yüzü tüm odayı dolduruyordu. Masada “Kent Dedikodularının” eski sayılarından birkaçı, Robert Keable’ın gözde romanı Simon Called Peter ve Broadway’in dedikodu dergilerinden bazıları duruyordu. Bayan Wilson öncelikle köpekle ilgilendi. Asansörcü çocuk, gönülsüz olduğu her halinden belli olsa da, içi samanla dolu bir kutu ile biraz süt getirmesi için gönderildi. Çocuk dönerken siparişe kendisinin akıl etmiş olduğu kocaman bir kutu köpek bisküvisi eklemekten çekinmemişti, oysa bu bisküviler bütün öğleden sonra sütle dolu bir kasenin içinde öylece eriyecekti. Bu esnada Tom da kilitli bir dolaptan bir şişe viski çıkarmıştı.
es: El apartamento estaba en el ático: una pequeña sala de estar, un pequeño comedor, un pequeño dormitorio y un cuarto de baño. Hasta la puerta del cuarto de estar se acumulaban los muebles, tapizados y demasiado grandes, y dar un paso significaba tropezarse con escenas de damas columpiándose en los jardines de Versalles. El único cuadro era una fotografía muy ampliada, desenfocada, de lo que parecía ser una gallina posada en una piedra. Mirada desde lejos, sin embargo, la gallina se convertía en una cofia, y el semblante de una dama anciana y corpulenta resplandecía en la habitación. Había encima de la mesa varios números atrasados de Town Tattle, un ejemplar de Simón, llamado Pedro[7] y algunas revistas de cotilleos de Broadway. Mistress Wilson se preocupó del perro ante todo. Un ascensorista fue de mala gana a por leche y un cajón con paja, a lo que añadió por iniciativa propia una lata de galletas para perro grandes y duras, una de las cuales pasó la tarde deshaciéndose apáticamente en el cuenco de leche. Y, mientras, Tom sacó una botella de whisky de una cómoda cerrada con llave.
vi_translation: The apartment is located on the topmost floor, consisting of a small living room, a small dining room, a small bedroom, and a bathroom. A set of sofas lined with rugs depicting large, cumbersome decorative scenes stretched from inside to the door, making the room feel cramped. As a result, everyone frequently tripped over the rug with scenes of girls swinging in the gardens of Versailles whenever they walked through the room. On the wall, there was only one oversized picture, depicting a hen standing on a vague rock. However, when viewed from a distance, the hen appeared to be a hat and the face of a plump old lady smiling down at the room. Several old issues of Town Tattle lay on the table along with a novel titled SIMON CALLED PETER and a few small tabloids specializing in digging up Broadway gossip. Upon entering the house, the first thing Myrtle did was take care of the dog. The little boy guarding the elevator reluctantly went to buy a box of straw and some milk when asked. After buying them, he took it upon himself to buy an additional tin box of large, hard biscuits meant for dogs. A piece of biscuit left in the milk dish lay soaking indifferently throughout the entire evening. Tom unlocked the glass cabinet and took out a bottle of whiskey.
tr_translation: A small living room, a small dining room, a small bedroom, and a small bathroom made up the apartment, which was on the top floor. The living room was so filled with furniture that was too large for the room and covered with tapestries that it was impossible to move without stumbling over a few cheerful ladies depicted in the gardens of the Palace of Versailles. The only picture hanging on the wall was an overly enlarged photograph. At first glance, it vaguely resembled a chicken perched on a rock, but upon looking again from a distance, the chicken turned into a bonnet, and the chubby face of a smiling old lady filled the entire room. On the table were a few old issues of “Town Tattler,” Robert Keable's popular novel Simon Called Peter, and some of Broadway's gossip magazines. Mrs. Wilson first attended to the dog. Although it was clear from his demeanor that he was reluctant, the elevator boy was sent to fetch a box filled with straw and some milk. When the boy returned, he had not hesitated to add a large box of dog biscuits, which he had thought of himself, even though these biscuits would just dissolve in a bowl of milk all afternoon. Meanwhile, Tom had taken a bottle of whiskey out of a locked cabinet.
es_translation: The apartment was in the attic: a small living room, a small dining room, a small bedroom, and a bathroom. Up to the door of the living room, the furniture, upholstered and too large, accumulated, and taking a step meant stumbling over scenes of ladies swinging in the gardens of Versailles. The only picture was a very enlarged, blurred photograph of what seemed to be a hen perched on a rock. Viewed from afar, however, the hen turned into a bonnet, and the countenance of an elderly and corpulent lady shone in the room. On the table were several back issues of Town Tattle, a copy of Simon Called Peter[7], and some Broadway gossip magazines. Mistress Wilson took care of the dog first of all. A reluctant elevator operator went to get milk and a crate with straw, to which he added on his own initiative a can of large, hard dog biscuits, one of which spent the afternoon dissolving apathetically in the bowl of milk. And meanwhile, Tom took a bottle of whiskey from a locked dresser.

en: I have been drunk just twice in my life, and the second time was that afternoon; so everything that happened has a dim, hazy cast over it, although until after eight o’clock the apartment was full of cheerful sun. Sitting on Tom’s lap Mrs. Wilson called up several people on the telephone; then there were no cigarettes, and I went out to buy some at the drugstore on the corner. When I came back they had both disappeared, so I sat down discreetly in the living-room and read a chapter of Simon Called Peter—either it was terrible stuff or the whisky distorted things, because it didn’t make any sense to me.
vi: Trong đời, tôi đã từng bị say rượu hai lần tất cả, và buổi chiều ngày hôm đó chính là lần say thứ hai. Mọi việc xẩy ra với tôi đều trông rất mập mờ như sương phủ, mặc dù đã khoảng sau tám giờ rồi mà căn phòng vẫn còn ngập nắng tươi sáng. Ngồi trên đùi của Tom, cô vợ Wilson gọi điện thoại đến cho nhiều người. Khi nhận ra không có thuốc lá, tôi bỏ ra ngoài để mua ở một tiệm thuốc góc đường. Khi tôi quay trở lại, hai người họ đã biến mất. Tôi dè dặt ngồi trong phòng khách đọc một chương trong quyển Simon Called Peter. Hoặc là quyển sách đã được viết quá tệ, hoặc là rượu whiskey đã làm méo mó hết mọi thứ, tôi thấy những gì viết trong sách chẳng có chút nào hợp lý.
tr: Hayatımda yalnızca iki defa sarhoş olmuşumdur, işte bu ikincisi de o gün başıma gelmiştir. Bu yüzden, dairenin içini saat sekize kadar pırıl pırıl güneş ışınları doldurmuş olsa da, olup bitenler sanki loş ve buğulu bir sisle kaplıydı. Bayan Wilson, Tom’un kucağına oturup sağa sola telefon açtı. Derken sigaramızın bittiğini anladık; köşe başındaki tütüncüye kadar gitmek üzere evden ayrıldım. Geri döndüğümde ortada kimsecikler yoktu. Ben de oturma odasında, bir kenara oturup sessizce Simon Called Peter’den bir bölüm okudum; kitap mı çok berbattı, içtiğim viskiler mi kafamı bulandırmıştı bilmem, okuduğumdan pek bir şey anlayamadım.
es: Sólo me he emborrachado dos veces en mi vida, y la segunda fue aquella tarde, así que una confusa capa de niebla empaña todo lo que pasó, aunque un sol espléndido iluminó el apartamento hasta pasadas las ocho. Sentada encima de Tom, mistress Wilson llamó por teléfono a varias personas, y luego se acabaron los cigarrillos, y bajé a comprar a la tienda de la esquina. Cuando volví, los amantes habían desaparecido, y yo me senté prudentemente en el cuarto de estar y leí un capítulo de Simón, llamado Pedro: o era infame o el whisky distorsionaba las cosas, porque aquello no tenía ningún sentido.
vi_translation: In my life, I have been drunk twice in total, and that afternoon was the second time. Everything that happened to me seemed very vague like it was covered in fog, even though it was already past eight o'clock and the room was still filled with bright sunlight. Sitting on Tom's lap, Wilson's wife was calling many people. When I realized there were no cigarettes, I went out to buy some at a corner drugstore. When I returned, the two of them had disappeared. I cautiously sat in the living room and read a chapter from the book Simon Called Peter. Either the book was terribly written, or the whiskey had distorted everything, I found that nothing written in the book made any sense.
tr_translation: I have only been drunk twice in my life, and the second time happened to me that day. Therefore, even though the apartment was filled with bright sunlight until eight o'clock, everything seemed to be covered in a dim and misty haze. Mrs. Wilson sat on Tom's lap and made phone calls here and there. Then we realized we were out of cigarettes; I left the house to go to the tobacconist at the corner. When I returned, there was no one around. So I sat quietly in the living room and read a section from Simon Called Peter; I don't know if the book was terrible or if the whiskey I drank had muddled my mind, but I couldn't make much sense of what I read.
es_translation: I've only gotten drunk twice in my life, and the second time was that afternoon, so a confusing layer of fog clouds everything that happened, although a splendid sun illuminated the apartment until past eight. Sitting on top of Tom, Mistress Wilson called several people on the phone, and then the cigarettes ran out, so I went down to buy some at the corner store. When I came back, the lovers had disappeared, and I prudently sat in the living room and read a chapter of Simon, called Peter: it was either infamous or the whiskey was distorting things, because it made no sense at all.

en: Just as Tom and Myrtle (after the first drink Mrs. Wilson and I called each other by our first names) reappeared, company commenced to arrive at the apartment door.
vi: Khi Tom và Myrtle xuất hiện trở lại, (sau ly rượu đầu tiên, cô vợ Wilson và tôi đã bắt đầu gọi nhau bằng t ên gọi thân mật), những khách khứa được mời cũng đã tới cửa.
tr: Tom’la Mrytle (ilk kadehin ardından, Bayan Wilson ile senli benli olmuştuk) ortaya çıktıktan hemen sonra, misafirler de birer ikişer damlamaya başladı.
es: En el momento en que Tom y Myrtle (después de la primera copa mistress Wilson y yo nos tuteamos) reaparecieron, los invitados empezaron a llegar al apartamento.
vi_translation: When Tom and Myrtle reappeared, (after the first glass of wine, Mrs. Wilson and I had started calling each other by t (term of endearment), the invited guests had also arrived at the door.
tr_translation: Just after Tom and Myrtle (after the first drink, I had become quite familiar with Mrs. Wilson) appeared, guests started trickling in one by one.
es_translation: At the moment when Tom and Myrtle (after the first drink, Mistress Wilson and I were on a first-name basis) reappeared, the guests started to arrive at the apartment.

en: The sister, Catherine, was a slender, worldly girl of about thirty, with a solid, sticky bob of red hair, and a complexion powdered milky white. Her eyebrows had been plucked and then drawn on again at a more rakish angle, but the efforts of nature toward the restoration of the old alignment gave a blurred air to her face. When she moved about there was an incessant clicking as innumerable pottery bracelets jingled up and down upon her arms. She came in with such a proprietary haste, and looked around so possessively at the furniture that I wondered if she lived here. But when I asked her she laughed immoderately, repeated my question aloud, and told me she lived with a girl friend at a hotel.
vi: Cô em Catherine là một người mảnh mai, tân thời, vào khoảng chừng ba mươi tuổi, mái tóc hung đỏ búi chặt, khuôn mặt trét phấn trắng như sữa. Đôi lông mày của cô ta đã được nhổ sạch và được vẽ lại cho thanh hơn, thế nhưng khi những sợi lông mày thật cố mọc lên trở lại theo như tự nhiên thì chúng nhìn giống như hai vết mờ trên mặt. Khi Catherine di chuyển chung quanh, vô số những vòng đeo tay bằng đá nung của cô không ngừng di động lên xuống, chạm vào nhau tạo nên những âm thanh leng keng. Cô ta đến với dáng điệu chủ nhà, vội vàng hấp tấp rồi đảo nhìn chung quanh làm như mình là sở hữu của mọi thứ, khiến tôi có cảm tưởng như cô đang cư trú ở đây. Thế nhưng khi tôi lên tiếng hỏi thì Catherine cười thái quá, lớn tiếng lập lại câu hỏi của tôi rồi trả lời rằng cô hiện đang sống chung với một bạn gái ở khách sạn.
tr: Kız kardeş Catherine’in yağlı, gür ve kısa kızıl saçları vardı; pudrayı fazla kaçırdığından yüzü süt beyaz, ince yapılı, dünya zevklerinde fazlaca düşkün, otuz yaşlarında bir hanımdı. Tüm kaşları yolunmuş, yerine kalemle kavisi daha gösterişli olan yeni bir çift kaş çizilmişti, ancak tabiatın eski çizgiyi yeniden canlandırma gayreti, yüzündeki ifadeyi de donuklaştırmıştı. Takıp takıştırdığı bilezikleri her hareketinde birbirine çarpıyor, ortalığı bir şıngırtıdır götürüyordu. İçeriye ev sahibi havalarında girmiş, eşyaları öylesine sahiplenici bakışlarla süzmüştü ki, orada yaşadığını sanmıştım. Bunu kendisine sorduğumda, bir kahkaha patlatarak önce sorumu yüksek sesle tekrar etmiş, sonra da bir kız arkadaşıyla birlikte bir otelde kaldığını söylemişti.
es: La hermana, Catherine, era una chica delgada y con mucho mundo de unos treinta años, pelirroja, pelada como un muchacho y peinada con brillantina, y de una blancura láctea, cosmética. Se había depilado las cejas y se las había repintado en un ángulo más elegante, pero los esfuerzos de la naturaleza para restaurar la línea antigua le daban a la cara una expresión incoherente. Cuando Catherine se movía, el cascabeleo en sus brazos de las innumerables pulseras baratas producía un tintineo incesante. Entró con tal ansiedad de propietaria, y miró el mobiliario tan posesivamente, que pensé que quizá fuera aquélla su casa. Pero se lo pregunté y se echó a reír de un modo exagerado, repitiendo mi pregunta en voz alta. Me dijo que vivía con una amiga en un hotel.
vi_translation: My sister Catherine is a slim, modern person, around thirty years old age, her red hair tightly bunned, her face smeared with milk-white powder. Her eyebrows had been completely plucked and redrawn to appear more refined, but as the real hairs naturally grew back, they looked like two faint smudges on her face. As Catherine moved around, her numerous baked clay bracelets continuously shifted up and down, clinking together to create jingling sounds. She approached with the demeanor of a host, hurriedly glancing around as if she owned everything, giving me the impression that she resided here. However, when I asked her, Catherine laughed exaggeratedly, loudly repeating my question before answering that she was currently living with a girlfriend at a hotel.
tr_translation: Catherine, the sister, had oily, thick, and short red hair; her face was milk white due to excessive powder, she was slender, overly fond of worldly pleasures, and a woman in her thirties. All her eyebrows were plucked, and a new pair of more arched eyebrows were drawn with a pencil, but nature's effort to revive the old line had dulled the expression on her face. The bracelets she wore clinked together with every movement, creating a constant jingling sound. She had entered with the airs of a hostess, eyeing the belongings so possessively that I thought she lived there. When I asked her about it, she burst into laughter, first repeating my question out loud, and then said she was staying at a hotel with a girlfriend.
es_translation: The sister, Catherine, was a thin and worldly woman of about thirty years, red-haired, shaved like a boy and styled with hair gel, and of a milky, cosmetic whiteness. She had plucked her eyebrows and repainted them at a more elegant angle, but nature's efforts to restore the old line gave her face an incoherent expression. When Catherine moved, the jingling of the numerous cheap bracelets on her arms produced an incessant tinkling. She entered with such an anxious proprietorial air, and looked at the furniture so possessively, that I thought perhaps it was her house. But I asked her and she laughed exaggeratedly, repeating my question out loud. She told me she lived with a friend in a hotel.

en: Mr. McKee was a pale, feminine man from the flat below. He had just shaved, for there was a white spot of lather on his cheekbone, and he was most respectful in his greeting to everyone in the room. He informed me that he was in the “artistic game,” and I gathered later that he was a photographer and had made the dim enlargement of Mrs. Wilson’s mother which hovered like an ectoplasm on the wall. His wife was shrill, languid, handsome, and horrible. She told me with pride that her husband had photographed her a hundred and twenty-seven times since they had been married.
vi: Anh chàng Mckee nhà ở tầng dưới thì xanh xao ẻo lả giống phụ nữ. Trông hình như anh ta mới vừa cạo râu xong bởi vì trên má vẫn còn dính một vệt kem cạo râu trắng toát. McKee tỏ lễ độ cung kính chào hỏi hết mọi người trong phòng. Anh cho tôi hay anh đang chơi một "trò chơi nghệ thuật". Mãi sau đó tôi mới biết được anh ta là một nhiếp ảnh gia, là tác giả đã phóng lớn bức ảnh lờ mờ bà mẹ của cô vợ Wilson hiện đang treo lơ lửng giống như bóng ma trên tường. Vợ của McKee có tiếng nói lanh lảnh, người thiếu sinh khí, làm dáng và thật khủng khiếp. Cô ta hãnh diện khoe với tôi rằng chồng của cô đã chụp hình cho cô tất cả một trăm hai mươi bẩy lần kể từ khi họ kết hôn.
tr: Alt katta oturan BayMcKee, soluk benizli ve biraz da efemine bir adamdı. Elmacık kemiğinin üstünde kalmış olan beyaz köpük lekesinden, yeni tıraş olduğu anlaşılıyordu. Odada bulunanları büyük bir saygıyla selamladı. Bana ‘sanat camiasından” olduğunu söylemişti; sonradan fotoğrafçı olduğunu ve duvarda bir ektoplazmik tezahürmüşçesine duran, Bayan Wilson’un annesinin fotoğrafını büyütenin de bizzat kendisi olduğunu öğrendim. Karısı cırtlak sesli, uyuşuk, hoş ve dehşet verici bir kadındı. Evlendikle­rinden bu yana kocasının yüz yirmi yedi kez kendisinin fotoğrafını çekmiş oldu­ğunu büyük bir kıvançla anlatmıştı.
es: Mister McKee era un hombre femenino, pálido, el vecino del piso de abajo. Acababa de afeitarse, porque tenía una mancha blanca de espuma en la mejilla, y mostró un extraordinario respeto al saludar a cada uno de los presentes. Me informó de que trabajaba «en el mundillo artístico», y más tarde me enteré de que era fotógrafo y de que había hecho la borrosa ampliación de la madre de mistress Wilson que flotaba en la pared como un ectoplasma. Su mujer era estridente, lánguida, bella y horrible. Me dijo con orgullo que su marido la había fotografiado ciento veintisiete veces desde el día de la boda.
vi_translation: The young man McKee, who lived downstairs, was pale and effeminate like a woman. He looked as if he had just shaved because there was still a streak of white shaving cream on his cheek. McKee politely greeted everyone in the room. He informed me that he was playing an "artistic game." It was only later that I learned he was a photographer, the author who had enlarged the blurry photo of Wilson's wife's mother, which now hung like a ghost on the wall. McKee's wife had a shrill voice, a lifeless demeanor, was pretentious, and quite terrifying. She proudly boasted to me that her husband had photographed her a total of one hundred and twenty-seven times since they got married.
tr_translation: Mr. McKee, who was sitting downstairs, was a pale and somewhat effeminate man. From the white foam mark left on his cheekbone, it was clear that he had just shaved. He greeted those in the room with great respect. He had told me that he was “from the art world”; later, I learned that he was a photographer and that he was the one who enlarged the photo of Mrs. Wilson's mother, which stood on the wall like an ectoplasmic manifestation. His wife was a shrill-voiced, sluggish, pleasant, and terrifying woman. She had proudly recounted that since they got married, her husband had taken her photograph one hundred and twenty-seven times.
es_translation: Mister McKee was a feminine, pale man, the neighbor from the floor below. He had just shaved, because he had a white spot of foam on his cheek, and he showed extraordinary respect when greeting everyone present. He informed me that he worked "in the artistic world," and later I found out that he was a photographer and that he had made the blurry enlargement of Mrs. Wilson's mother that floated on the wall like an ectoplasm. His wife was shrill, languid, beautiful, and horrible. She told me proudly that her husband had photographed her one hundred and twenty-seven times since their wedding day.

en: Mrs. Wilson had changed her costume some time before, and was now attired in an elaborate afternoon dress of cream-coloured chiffon, which gave out a continual rustle as she swept about the room. With the influence of the dress her personality had also undergone a change. The intense vitality that had been so remarkable in the garage was converted into impressive hauteur. Her laughter, her gestures, her assertions became more violently affected moment by moment, and as she expanded the room grew smaller around her, until she seemed to be revolving on a noisy, creaking pivot through the smoky air.
vi: Cô vợ Wilson đã thay áo sang mặc một chiếc áo đầm dành cho buổi tối cầu kỳ vải the màu kem, phát ra những tiếng kêu sột soạt không ngừng khi cô ta bước qua lại trong phòng. Chiếc áo đã khiến thái độ của cô ta thay đổi hẳn. Cái sức sống mãnh liệt từ cơ thể cô ta lúc ở tiệm sửa xe giờ đã biến thành thái độ kiêu kỳ rõ rệt. Giọng cười, dáng điệu, lời nói của cô mỗi lúc mỗi trở nên hung tợn mạnh bạo. Cô ta chiếm cứ hết cái không gian chung quanh khiến căn phòng trở nên nhỏ hẹp. Rồi cô ta còn xoay mình vòng chung quanh giống như một trụ quay kẽo kẹt trong không gian mịt mờ khói thuốc.
tr: Bayan Wilson bir süre önce kıyafetini değiştirmişti, üzerinde şimdi gösterişli, krem rengi şifondan, yürüdükçe odayı hışırtıyla dolduran bir kokteyl elbisesi vardı; elbisenin etkisiyle sanki kişiliği de değişmiş gibiydi. Tamirhanedeyken çevresine saçtığı o yoğun hayat enerjisi yerini muazzam bir kibre bırakmıştı. Her geçen an gülüşü, jestleri ve konuşması daha da yapmacık bir hal alıyor; o şişip kabardıkça odadaki alan daraldıkça daralıyordu. En nihayetindeyse kadın, duman altı odadaki bir eksen üzerinde gıcırdayarak dönüyormuş gibi görünür olmuştu.
es: Mistress Wilson se había cambiado de ropa poco antes, y ahora lucía un complicado vestido de tarde de gasa color crema que dejaba a su paso un frufrú permanente cuando se movía por la habitación. Bajo la influencia del vestido su personalidad también experimentó un cambio. La intensa vitalidad del garaje, tan perceptible, se había transformado en una impresionante fatuidad. Su risa, sus gestos, sus afirmaciones fueron volviéndose más afectados por momentos, y, conforme ella se expandía, la habitación menguaba a su alrededor, hasta que, ruidosa y chirriante, mistress Wilson pareció girar sobre una peana en el aire lleno de humo.
vi_translation: Mrs. Wilson had changed into an elaborate evening dress made of cream-colored tulle, which emitted a constant rustling sound as she moved back and forth in the room. The dress had completely altered her demeanor. The vibrant energy from her body at the garage had now transformed into a distinctly haughty attitude. Her laughter, gestures, and words became increasingly fierce and aggressive. She dominated the space around her, making the room feel cramped. Then she even spun around like a creaking pillar in the hazy, smoke-filled air.
tr_translation: Mrs. Wilson had changed her outfit a while ago; she was now wearing a flamboyant, cream-colored chiffon cocktail dress that filled the room with a rustling sound as she walked; it was as if her personality had changed with the dress. The intense life energy she exuded in the workshop had given way to an immense arrogance. With each passing moment, her laughter, gestures, and speech became more and more artificial; as she puffed up, the space in the room seemed to shrink. Finally, the woman appeared to be revolving on an axis in the smoke-filled room, creaking as she turned.
es_translation: Mistress Wilson had changed clothes shortly before, and now she was wearing a complicated cream-colored chiffon evening dress that left a constant rustle in its wake as she moved around the room. Under the influence of the dress, her personality also underwent a change. The intense vitality of the garage, so perceptible, had transformed into an impressive fatuity. Her laughter, her gestures, her statements became more affected by the moment, and, as she expanded, the room shrank around her, until, noisy and creaking, Mistress Wilson seemed to spin on a pedestal in the smoke-filled air.

en: “My dear,” she told her sister in a high, mincing shout, “most of these fellas will cheat you every time. All they think of is money. I had a woman up here last week to look at my feet, and when she gave me the bill you’d of thought she had my appendicitis out.”
vi: "Em ơi." Cô vợ Wilson lớn tiếng cao giọng nhẽo nhẹt nói với cô em. "Những người ở đây lúc nào cũng chỉ muốn lừa lọc mình. Họ chỉ nghĩ tới tiền. Tuần trước chị có gọi một người đàn bà lên đây chăm sóc chân cho chị. Khi bà ta đưa giấy tính tiền, nếu em nhìn thấy thì sẽ tưởng bà ta đã cắt ruột thừa của chị."
tr: “Hayatım,” diye seslendi kız kardeşine, yüksek ancak işveli bir sesle, “İnsanlar resmen dolandırıcı; dinleri imanları para olmuş. Geçen hafta buraya pedikür için bir kadın çağırmıştım; bana çıkardığı faturayı bir duysan, pedikür yapmamış da apandisitimi almış sanırsın.
es: —Tesoro —le gritó a su hermana, con voz remilgada y aguda—, toda esa gentuza te engañará siempre. Sólo piensan en el dinero. Vino una mujer la semana pasada a arreglarme los pies y, cuando me dio la cuenta, era como si me hubiera operado de apendicitis.
vi_translation: "Hey, sis." Mrs. Wilson loudly and whiningly said to her younger sister. "The people here always just want to deceive us. They only think about money. Last week, I called a woman up here to take care of my feet. When she handed me the bill, if you had seen it, you would have thought she had performed an appendectomy on me."
tr_translation: “My dear,” she called out to her sister in a loud yet coquettish voice, “People are practically swindlers; all they care about is money. Last week, I called a woman here for a pedicure; if you heard the bill she gave me, you'd think she performed an appendectomy instead of a pedicure.”
es_translation: —Darling —she shouted to her sister, with a prim and sharp voice—, all those people will always deceive you. They only think about money. A woman came last week to fix my feet and, when she gave me the bill, it was as if I had had an appendectomy.

en: “What was the name of the woman?” asked Mrs. McKee.
vi: "Tên của bà đó là gì?" Cô vợ Mckee hỏi.
tr: “Adı neydi bu kadının” diye sordu Bayan McKee.
es: —¿Cómo se llamaba? —preguntó mistress McKee.
vi_translation: "What is that woman's name?" Mrs. McKee asked.
tr_translation: “What was this woman's name?” asked Mrs. McKee.
es_translation: —What was her name? —asked Mistress McKee.

en: “Mrs. Eberhardt. She goes around looking at people’s feet in their own homes.”
vi: "Eberhardt. Bà ta chuyên chăm sóc chân cho thân chủ tại gia."
tr: “Bayan Ebenhardt. Evlere pediküre gidiyor.
es: —Mistress Eberhardt. Se dedica a arreglar pies a domicilio.
vi_translation: "Eberhardt." "She specializes in home foot care for clients."
tr_translation: “Mr. Ebenhardt. He goes to houses for pedicures.”
es_translation: —Mistress Eberhardt. She dedicates herself to fixing feet at home.

en: “I like your dress,” remarked Mrs. McKee, “I think it’s adorable.”
vi: "Tôi thích chiếc áo đầm chị đang mặc. Nó dễ thương lắm." Cô vợ McKee khen ngợi.
tr: “Bu elbisene bayıldım doğrusu,” dedi Bayan McKee, “Bir harika!
es: —Me encanta tu vestido —observó mistress McKee—. Me parece maravilloso.
vi_translation: "I like the dress you are wearing." "It's very cute," Mrs. McKee complimented.
tr_translation: “I absolutely love your dress,” said Mrs. McKee, “It's wonderful!”
es_translation: —I love your dress —observed Mistress McKee—. I think it's wonderful.

en: Mrs. Wilson rejected the compliment by raising her eyebrow in disdain.
vi: Cô vợ Wilson từ chối lời khen bằng cách nhướng mày lên khinh khỉnh.
tr: Bayan Wilson kaşlarını kaldırdı ve küçümsercesine iltifatı geri çevirdi, “Aman bu eski püskü şey mi?
es: Mistress Wilson rechazó el cumplido levantando desdeñosamente una ceja.
vi_translation: Mrs. Wilson rejected the compliment by raising her eyebrows disdainfully.
tr_translation: Mr. Wilson raised his eyebrows and dismissively rejected the compliment, "Oh, this old rag?
es_translation: Mistress Wilson rejected the compliment by disdainfully raising an eyebrow.

en: “It’s just a crazy old thing,” she said. “I just slip it on sometimes when I don’t care what I look like.”
vi: "Nó là áo cũ thôi mà. Tôi chỉ xỏ vào mặc khi nào tôi không chú tâm đến bề ngoài của mình."
tr: Bayan Wilson kaşlarını kaldırdı ve küçümsercesine iltifatı geri çevirdi, “Aman bu eski püskü şey mi? Özenmediğim zamanlarda üzerime öylece geçiriveriyorum canım.
es: —Está viejísimo —dijo—. Sólo me lo pongo cuando no me importa la pinta que llevo.
vi_translation: "It's just an old shirt." "I only put it on when I don't care about my appearance."
tr_translation: Mr. Wilson raised his eyebrows and dismissively rejected the compliment, "Oh, this old rag? I just throw it on when I don't care about my appearance."
es_translation: —It's really old —he said—. I only wear it when I don't care about how I look.

en: “But it looks wonderful on you, if you know what I mean,” pursued Mrs. McKee. “If Chester could only get you in that pose I think he could make something of it.”
vi: "Nhưng chị mặc vào trông rất đẹp, nếu chị hiểu ý tôi nói." Cô vợ McKee tiếp tục theo đuổi đề tài. "Nếu Chester có thể chụp hình chị trong dáng điệu lúc này, tôi nghĩ anh ta sẽ có một tác phẩm giá trị."
tr: “Ama gerçekten üzerinde bir harika durmuş” diye ısrar etti Bayan McKee. “Chester senin şu pozunu yakalayabilse, nefis bir fotoğraf olur.
es: —Pues te sienta de maravilla, no sé si me entiendes —continuó mistress McKee—. Si Chester te fotografiara en esa pose, haría algo aprovechable.
vi_translation: "But you look very beautiful in it, if you understand what I mean." Mrs. McKee continued to pursue the topic. "If Chester could take a picture of you in this pose, I think he would have a valuable piece."
tr_translation: “But it really looks wonderful on you,” insisted Mrs. McKee. “If Chester could capture this pose of yours, it would make a splendid photograph.”
es_translation: —Well, it suits you wonderfully, I don't know if you understand me —continued Mistress McKee—. If Chester photographed you in that pose, he would make something worthwhile.

en: We all looked in silence at Mrs. Wilson, who removed a strand of hair from over her eyes and looked back at us with a brilliant smile. Mr. McKee regarded her intently with his head on one side, and then moved his hand back and forth slowly in front of his face.
vi: Tất cả mọi người chúng tôi im lặng nhìn cô vợ Wilson, cô ta vén lọn tóc che trên mắt và quay nhìn chúng tôi với với một nụ cười rạng rỡ. Anh chàng Mckee đầu nghẹo sang một bên ngắm nhìn cô ta chăm chú, sau đó đưa tay qua lại trước mặt đo lường một cách thật chậm.
tr: Sessizlik içinde Bayan Wilson’a baktık; yüzüne düşmüş bir tutam saçı geriye savurarak tatlılıkla gülümsedi. Bay McKee başını yana eğerek kadını dikkatle inceledi, ardından göz hizasında tuttuğu elini ileri geri hareket ettirmeye başladı.
es: Todos miramos en silencio a mistress Wilson, que se apartó de los ojos un mechón de pelo y nos devolvió la mirada con una sonrisa radiante. Mister McKee la estudió con atención, ladeando la cabeza, y luego se puso la mano delante de la cara y la movió hacia atrás y hacia delante.
vi_translation: All of us silently watched Mrs. Wilson; she brushed a lock of hair from her eyes and turned to look at us with a radiant smile. Mr. McKee tilted his head to one side, gazing at her intently, then slowly moved his hand back and forth in front of her face, measuring carefully.
tr_translation: We looked at Mrs. Wilson in silence; she sweetly smiled, tossing back a lock of hair that had fallen on her face. Mr. McKee tilted his head to the side and carefully examined the woman, then began to move his hand back and forth at eye level.
es_translation: We all looked silently at Mistress Wilson, who brushed a lock of hair away from her eyes and returned our gaze with a radiant smile. Mister McKee studied her attentively, tilting his head, and then put his hand in front of his face and moved it back and forth.

en: “I should change the light,” he said after a moment. “I’d like to bring out the modelling of the features. And I’d try to get hold of all the back hair.”
vi: Một lát sau anh ta nói. "Tôi nên thay ánh đèn. Tôi muốn làm nổi bật nét mặt của cô và muốn làm sao lấy được hết mái tóc phía sau."
tr: “Işığın değişmesi lazım” dedi bir an sonra, “yüz hatlarını öne çıkarmak isterim, arka plandaki saçların da görüntüye girmesi lazım.
es: —Cambiaría la luz —dijo al cabo de un momento—. Me gustaría resaltar el modelado de las facciones, e intentaría captar el pelo de la nuca.
vi_translation: After a moment, he spoke. "I should change the light." "I want to highlight her facial features and capture all the hair in the back."
tr_translation: “The light needs to change,” he said after a moment, “I want to bring out the facial features, and the hair in the background needs to be in the frame as well.”
es_translation: —I would change the light —he said after a moment—. I would like to highlight the modeling of the features, and I would try to capture the hair at the nape of the neck.

en: “I wouldn’t think of changing the light,” cried Mrs. McKee. “I think it’s—”
vi: "Tôi nghĩ không nên thay ánh đèn." Cô vợ McKee la lên. "Tôi nghĩ nó..."
tr: “Bana sorarsanız ışığın değişmesine hiç lüzum yok” diye haykırdı Bayan McKee, “hem zaten-”
es: —Yo no cambiaría la luz —proclamó mistress McKee—. Me parece que es…
vi_translation: "I don't think we should change the light." Mrs. McKee shouted. "I think it..."
tr_translation: “If you ask me, there's no need to change the light at all,” cried Mrs. McKee, “besides-”
es_translation: —I wouldn't change the light —proclaimed Mistress McKee—. It seems to me that it is…

en: Her husband said “Sh!” and we all looked at the subject again, whereupon Tom Buchanan yawned audibly and got to his feet.
vi: Ông chồng "suỵt" bà vợ và chúng tôi quay lại nhìn người mẫu lần nữa. Ngay lúc đó Tom Buchanan ngáp to tiếng và đứng lên.
tr: Adam “Şşşt!” diyerek susturdu kadını, biz de dönüp yeniden modele baktık. O anda Tom Buchanan sesli biçimde esneyerek ayağa kalktı.
es: Su marido dijo «Shsss» y todos volvimos a mirar a la modelo, cuando Tom bostezó audiblemente y se puso de pie.
vi_translation: The husband "shushed" the wife and we turned back to look at the model once more. At that moment Tom Buchanan yawned loudly and stood up.
tr_translation: Adam silenced the woman by saying "Shhh!", and we turned back to look at the model again. At that moment, Tom Buchanan stood up, yawning loudly.
es_translation: Her husband said "Shhh" and we all turned to look at the model again, when Tom yawned audibly and stood up.

en: “You McKees have something to drink,” he said. “Get some more ice and mineral water, Myrtle, before everybody goes to sleep.”
vi: "Hai anh chị McKee có muốn uống gì không." Tom hỏi. "Myrtle, đi lấy thêm đá và nước suối tới đây, trước khi mọi người đi ngủ."
tr: “Hadi ama McKee’ler, gelin birer kadeh bir şeyler içelim. Myrtle konuklarımız uykuya dalmadan biraz daha buz ve soda getirsene.
es: —Beban algo, pareja —les dijo a los McKee—. Trae más hielo y más agua mineral, Myrtle, antes de que se duerma todo el mundo.
vi_translation: "Do you two, Mr. and Mrs. McKee, want something to drink?" Tom asked. "Myrtle, get some more ice and spring water here before everyone goes to bed."
tr_translation: “Come on, McKees, let's have a drink. Myrtle, could you bring some more ice and soda before our guests fall asleep?”
es_translation: —Have a drink, folks —he said to the McKees—. Bring more ice and mineral water, Myrtle, before everyone falls asleep.

en: “I told that boy about the ice.” Myrtle raised her eyebrows in despair at the shiftlessness of the lower orders. “These people! You have to keep after them all the time.”
vi: "Em đã sai thằng nhỏ đi lấy đá rồi." Myrtle nhướng lông mày thất vọng vì sự lười nhác của kẻ dưới. "Mấy hạng người này! Mình lúc nào cũng phải phải canh chừng để ý họ suốt ngày."
tr: “Çocuğa buz getirmesini söylemiştim zaten,” dedi Myrtle alt tabakadakilerin beceriksizliği karşısında duyduğu hayal kırıklığı ile kaşlarını kaldırmıştı, “Ah bu insanlar! Bir an için gözünüzü üzerlerinden ayırmaya gelmiyor!
es: —Mira que le dije al chico que trajera hielo —Myrtle levantó las cejas, desesperada por la holgazanería de las clases bajas—. ¡Qué gente! Tienes que estar detrás de ellos todo el tiempo.
vi_translation: "I sent the boy to get some ice." Myrtle raised her eyebrows in disappointment at the laziness of the subordinate. "These kinds of people! I always have to keep an eye on them all day long."
tr_translation: “I had already told the child to bring ice,” said Myrtle, raising her eyebrows in frustration at the incompetence of the lower class, “Ah, these people! You can't take your eyes off them for a moment!”
es_translation: —Look, I told the boy to bring ice —Myrtle raised her eyebrows, desperate over the laziness of the lower classes—. What people! You have to be behind them all the time.

en: She looked at me and laughed pointlessly. Then she flounced over to the dog, kissed it with ecstasy, and swept into the kitchen, implying that a dozen chefs awaited her orders there.
vi: Myrtle nhìn tôi và cười một cách vô cớ, sau đó đi vội tới bên con chó, hôn nó mê mẩn rồi lướt thướt kéo lê áo đi vào trong nhà bếp làm như có cả chục đầu bếp đang chờ lịnh của cô ta ở đó.
tr: Bana bakarak hiç yoktan bir kahkaha attı. Derken köpeğe doğru atılarak hayvanı sarıp sarmaladı, öpücüklere boğdu; hemen sonra ise, sanki onun emirleri için bir düzine aşçı bekliyormuşçasına, bir hışımla mutfağa gitti.
es: Me miró y se rió sin motivo. Luego cogió y besó al perro en un arrebato y entró majestuosamente en la cocina como si un equipo de cocineros estuviera esperando sus órdenes.
vi_translation: Myrtle looked at me and smiled for no reason, then hurried over to the dog, kissed it passionately, and then dragged her dress into the kitchen as if there were a dozen chefs waiting for her orders there.
tr_translation: He looked at me and burst into laughter out of nowhere. Then, he lunged towards the dog, wrapping it up in his arms, smothering it with kisses; immediately after, as if a dozen chefs were waiting for his orders, he stormed into the kitchen.
es_translation: He looked at me and laughed for no reason. Then he picked up and kissed the dog in a fit of passion and entered the kitchen majestically as if a team of cooks were waiting for his orders.

en: “I’ve done some nice things out on Long Island,” asserted Mr. McKee.
vi: "Tôi đã chụp được vài cảnh đẹp ở Long Island." McKee nói.
tr: “Long Island’da çok güzel çalışmalarım olmuştu,” dedi Bay McKee, kendini savunurcasına.
es: —En Long Island he hecho cosas muy interesantes —declaró mister McKee.
vi_translation: "I captured some beautiful scenes in Long Island." McKee said.
tr_translation: "I had some very nice work on Long Island," said Mr. McKee, defensively.
es_translation: —In Long Island, I have done very interesting things —declared Mr. McKee.

en: Tom looked at him blankly.
vi: Tom nhìn anh ta một cách vô thần.
tr: Tom adamın yüzüne boş boş baktı.
es: Tom lo miró sin entenderlo.
vi_translation: Tom looked at him blankly.
tr_translation: Tom stared blankly at the man's face.
es_translation: Tom looked at him without understanding.

en: “Two of them we have framed downstairs.”
vi: "Hai bức đã được tôi lên khung treo ở tầng dưới nhà."
tr: “İki tanesini çerçevelettik, aşağıdalar.
es: —Dos las tenemos enmarcadas abajo.
vi_translation: "Two paintings have been framed and hung on the ground floor of the house."
tr_translation: “We had two of them framed, they are downstairs.
es_translation: —We have two of them framed downstairs.

en: “Two what?” demanded Tom.
vi: "Hai bức gì?' Tom hạch hỏi.
tr: “İki dediğin ne?” diye sordu Tom.
es: —¿Dos qué? —preguntó Tom.
vi_translation: "Which two letters?" Tom asked.
tr_translation: “What do you mean by two?” asked Tom.
es_translation: —Two what? —asked Tom.

en: “Two studies. One of them I call Montauk Point—The Gulls, and the other I call Montauk Point—The Sea.”
vi: "Hai bức hình mặc tưởng. Một bức tôi đặt tên Mũi MONTAUK - Hải Âu. Còn bức kia tôi đặt tên Mũi MONTAUK - Biển cả."
tr: “İki dediğin ne?” diye sordu Tom. “İki çalışmam elbette ki: Birine Montauk Burnu-Martılar, diğerine ise Montauk Burnu - Deniz adını verdim.
es: —Dos estudios. Uno lo he titulado Montauk Point: las gaviotas, y el otro Montauk Point: el mar.
vi_translation: "Two contemplative pictures. One I named Montauk Point - Seagull. The other I named Montauk Point - The Sea."
tr_translation: “What do you mean by two?” asked Tom. “Of course, I have two works: I named one Montauk Point - Seagulls, and the other Montauk Point - Sea.”
es_translation: —Two studies. One I have titled Montauk Point: the seagulls, and the other Montauk Point: the sea.

en: The sister Catherine sat down beside me on the couch.
vi: Catherine ngồi xuống cạnh tôi trên chiếc ghế dựa dài.
tr: Kız kardeş Catherine kanepeye, yanıma oturdu.
es: Catherine, la hermana, se sentó a mi lado en el sofá.
vi_translation: Catherine sat down next to me on the long bench.
tr_translation: My sister Catherine sat on the couch next to me.
es_translation: Catherine, the sister, sat next to me on the sofa.

en: “Do you live down on Long Island, too?” she inquired.
vi: "Anh cũng ở Long Island à?" Cô ta hỏi.
tr: “Siz de mi Long Island’da yaşıyorsunuz?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Tú también vives en Long Island? —me preguntó.
vi_translation: "Are you also in Long Island?" she asked.
tr_translation: “Do you also live in Long Island?” he asked.
es_translation: —Do you also live in Long Island? —she asked me.

en: “I live at West Egg.”
vi: "Tôi ở West Egg."
tr: “Hayır, West Egg’deyim.
es: —Vivo en West Egg.
vi_translation: "I live in West Egg."
tr_translation: “No, I am in West Egg.”
es_translation: —I live in West Egg.

en: “Really? I was down there at a party about a month ago. At a man named Gatsby’s. Do you know him?”
vi: "Vậy sao? Tôi mới tới đó dự tiệc tháng trước ở nhà một người tên Gatsby. Anh có biết anh ta không?"
tr: “Sahi mi? Yaklaşık bir ay önce, Gatsby adında bir adamın evindeki bir parti için gitmiştim oraya. Tanır mısınız?
es: —¿Sí? Estuve allí en una fiesta, hace un mes más o menos. En casa de un tal Gatsby. ¿Lo conoces?
vi_translation: "Really? I just attended a party there last month at the house of a man named Gatsby. Do you know him?"
tr_translation: “Really? About a month ago, I went there for a party at a man named Gatsby's house. Do you know him?”
es_translation: —Yes? I was there at a party, about a month ago. At the house of a certain Gatsby. Do you know him?

en: “I live next door to him.”
vi: "Tôi là hàng xóm ở sát bên nhà anh ta."
tr: “Bitişik komşum olur.
es: —Vive al lado de mi casa.
vi_translation: "I am the neighbor right next to his house."
tr_translation: “He is my next-door neighbor.”
es_translation: —He/She lives next to my house.

en: “Well, they say he’s a nephew or a cousin of Kaiser Wilhelm’s. That’s where all his money comes from.”
vi: "Chà, người ta nói anh ta là cháu trai hay anh em họ gì đó của hoàng đế Đức Willhelm. Tất cả tiền của anh ta từ đó mà ra cả."
tr: “Adamın Kaiser Wilhelm’in yeğeni ya da kuzeni olduğunu söyleniyor. Servetinin kaynağı da oymuş.
es: —Dicen que es sobrino o primo del káiser Guillermo. Que por eso tiene tanto dinero.
vi_translation: "Well, they say he is a grandson or some kind of cousin of the German Emperor Wilhelm. All his money comes from there."
tr_translation: “It is said that the man is the nephew or cousin of Kaiser Wilhelm. The source of his wealth is also him.”
es_translation: —They say he is the nephew or cousin of Kaiser Wilhelm. That's why he has so much money.

en: “Really?”
vi: "Vậy sao?"
tr: “Öyle mi?
es: —¿Sí?
vi_translation: "Really?"
tr_translation: “Is that so?”
es_translation: —Yes?

en: She nodded.
vi: Cô ta gật đầu.
tr: Kız başını sallayarak devam etti.
es: Asintió.
vi_translation: She nodded.
tr_translation: The girl nodded her head and continued.
es_translation: He nodded.

en: “I’m scared of him. I’d hate to have him get anything on me.”
vi: "Tôi sợ anh ta lắm. Tôi chúa ghét anh ta đụng chạm tới tôi."
tr: “Korktum doğrusu. Hakkımda bir şey bilmesini istemem.
es: —Me da miedo. No me gustaría nada que la tomara conmigo.
vi_translation: "I am very afraid of him. I absolutely hate it when he touches me."
tr_translation: “I was really scared. I don't want him to know anything about me.”
es_translation: —I'm scared. I wouldn't like it at all if he/she took it out on me.

en: This absorbing information about my neighbour was interrupted by Mrs. McKee’s pointing suddenly at Catherine:
vi: Tin tức hấp dẫn về người hàng xóm của tôi bị cắt ngang khi cô vợ McKee bất ngờ chỉ tay vào Catherine.
tr: Komşum hakkındaki bu ilginç bilgiler, Bayan McKee’nin müdahalesiyle kesildi, Catherine’i eliyle göstererek: “Baksana Chester, bu kızla güzel bir iş çıkarabilirsin,” diye bağırmıştı.
es: Esta apasionante información sobre mi vecino fue interrumpida por mistress McKee, que de repente señalaba a Catherine con el dedo.
vi_translation: The intriguing news about my neighbor was interrupted when Mrs. McKee suddenly pointed at Catherine.
tr_translation: The interesting information about my neighbor was interrupted by Mrs. McKee's intervention, pointing at Catherine with her hand and shouting: "Look Chester, you could do a good job with this girl."
es_translation: This fascinating information about my neighbor was interrupted by Mistress McKee, who suddenly pointed at Catherine with her finger.

en: “Chester, I think you could do something with her,” she broke out, but Mr. McKee only nodded in a bored way, and turned his attention to Tom.
vi: "Anh Chester, em nghĩ anh có thể chụp vài kiểu cho cô đó." Cô ta kêu to lên, nhưng Mckee chỉ gật đầu một cách thờ ơ và sau đó dồn sự chú tâm của mình qua Tom.
tr: Ancak Bay McKee bıkkın bir tavırla başını sallayarak onu geçiştirdi ve yeniden Tom’a döndü:
es: —Chester, creo que podrías hacer algo con ella —proclamó, pero el señor McKee se limitó a asentir con aire de aburrimiento, y volvió a concentrar su atención en Tom.
vi_translation: "Mr. Chester, I think you could take a few shots for her." She shouted loudly, but Mckee just nodded indifferently and then turned his attention to Tom.
tr_translation: However, Mr. McKee dismissed her with a weary nod and turned back to Tom:
es_translation: —Chester, I think you could do something with her —he proclaimed, but Mr. McKee just nodded with a bored air and turned his attention back to Tom.

en: “I’d like to do more work on Long Island, if I could get the entry. All I ask is that they should give me a start.”
vi: "Tôi muốn chụp thêm hình ở Long Island, nếu như tôi có thể kiếm được sự giúp đỡ lúc đầu. Tôi chỉ cần giúp đỡ lúc đầu thôi."
tr: “Şayet giriş imkanım olsa, Long Island’da başka çalışmalar da yapmak isterim. Tek istediğim bana bir fırsat verilmesi.
es: —Si pudiera introducirme, me gustaría trabajar más en Long Island. Lo único que pido es que me dejen empezar.
vi_translation: "I want to take more pictures in Long Island, if I can get some help at the beginning. I just need help at the beginning."
tr_translation: “If I had the opportunity to enter, I would like to do other studies in Long Island. All I want is to be given a chance.”
es_translation: —If I could introduce myself, I would like to work more in Long Island. The only thing I ask is that they let me start.

en: “Ask Myrtle,” said Tom, breaking into a short shout of laughter as Mrs. Wilson entered with a tray. “She’ll give you a letter of introduction, won’t you, Myrtle?”
vi: "Hỏi Myrtle đi." Tom nói, sau đó bật lên cười khi cô vợ Wilson mang khay nước uống bước vào. "Cô ta sẽ cho anh một lá thư giới thiệu, phải không Myrtle?"
tr: “Bunu Myrtle’a söyle” dedi Tom, ardından da kahkahayı bastı, tam o esnada Bayan Wilson elinde tepsiyle içeri girmişti, “senin için bir tavsiye mektubu yazsın söyle de, yazarsın değil mi Myrtle?
es: —Hable con Myrtle —dijo Tom, soltando una risotada y aprovechando que mistress Wilson llegaba de la cocina con una bandeja—. Ella le dará una carta de presentación, ¿verdad, Myrtle?
vi_translation: "Ask Myrtle." Tom said, then burst out laughing as Mrs. Wilson walked in with a tray of drinks. "She'll give you a letter of recommendation, won't she Myrtle?"
tr_translation: “Tell this to Myrtle,” said Tom, then burst into laughter, just as Mrs. Wilson entered with a tray in her hand, “tell her to write a letter of recommendation for you, won't you write it, Myrtle?”
es_translation: —Talk to Myrtle —said Tom, letting out a laugh and taking advantage of mistress Wilson arriving from the kitchen with a tray—. She will give you a letter of introduction, right, Myrtle?

en: “Do what?” she asked, startled.
vi: "Làm chuyện gì?" Myrtle ngơ ngác hỏi.
tr: “Ne yazacakmışım?” diye sordu kadın, irkilmişti.
es: —¿Dar qué? —preguntó, sorprendida.
vi_translation: "Doing what?" Myrtle asked, bewildered.
tr_translation: “What am I supposed to write?” the woman asked, startled.
es_translation: —Give what? —she asked, surprised.

en: “You’ll give McKee a letter of introduction to your husband, so he can do some studies of him.” His lips moved silently for a moment as he invented, “ ‘George B. Wilson at the Gasoline Pump,’ or something like that.”
vi: "Em sẽ cho anh Mckee một lá thư giới thiệu tới chồng của em, để anh McKee có thể lấy đề tài nhiếp ảnh về chồng em." Tom cố tìm chữ, đôi môi mấp máy không phát ra âm thanh, sau đó anh nghĩ ra. "Đề tài là George B. Wilson ở trạm xăng, hay đề tài tên gì tương tự như vậy cũng được."
tr: “Kocana, diyorum, McKee için bir tanıtım mektubu yazsan, böylece onunla çalışabilir.” Sonra sessizce mırıldanarak bir başlık uydurdu, “Benzin Pompasının Başındaki George B. Wilson, veya buna benzer bir şeyler işte.
es: —Le darás a McKee una carta de presentación para tu marido, para que haga unos cuantos estudios suyos —siguió moviendo los labios, en silencio, mientras inventaba—. George B. Wilson en el surtidor de gasolina, o algo así.
vi_translation: "I will give Mr. McKee a letter of introduction to my husband, so Mr. McKee can get a photography subject about my husband." Tom tried to find the words, his lips moving without making a sound, then he thought of it. "The subject is George B. Wilson at the gas station, or any subject with a similar name will do."
tr_translation: "Honey, I’m saying, if you could write a letter of introduction for McKee, so he can work with him." Then he quietly muttered a title, "George B. at the Gas Pump Wilson, or something like that."
es_translation: —You will give McKee a letter of introduction to your husband, so he can do a few studies of him —he kept moving his lips, silently, as he made it up—. George B. Wilson at the gas pump, or something like that.

en: Catherine leaned close to me and whispered in my ear:
vi: Catherine nghiêng người về phía tôi và thì thầm vào tai tôi.
tr: Catherine eğilip kulağıma fısıldadı, “İkisi de eşlerine katlanamıyor,”
es: Catherine se inclinó sobre mí, muy cerca, y me murmuró al oído:
vi_translation: Catherine leaned towards me and whispered in my ear.
tr_translation: Catherine leaned in and whispered in my ear, "Neither of them can stand their spouses."
es_translation: Catherine leaned over me, very close, and whispered in my ear:

en: “Neither of them can stand the person they’re married to.”
vi: "Cả hai người họ đều không thể chịu đựng được người mà họ đã lấy."
tr: Catherine eğilip kulağıma fısıldadı, “İkisi de eşlerine katlanamıyor,”
es: —Ninguno de los dos soporta a la persona con la que están casados.
vi_translation: "Neither of them can stand the person they married."
tr_translation: Catherine leaned in and whispered in my ear, "Neither of them can stand their spouses."
es_translation: —Neither of them can stand the person they are married to.

en: “Can’t stand them.” She looked at Myrtle and then at Tom. “What I say is, why go on living with them if they can’t stand them? If I was them I’d get a divorce and get married to each other right away.”
vi: "Không chịu đựng được." Cô ta nhìn Myrtle và sau đó nhìn Tom. "Ý tôi muốn nói, tại sao họ lại cứ tiếp tục sống đời sống làm vợ hay làm chồng nếu như đã không thể chịu đựng được người phối ngẫu của mình nữa? Nếu tôi là họ, tôi đã ly dị và kết hôn với nhau ngay rồi."
tr: “Sahiden!” Önce Myrtle’a sonra da Tom’a bak­tı, “Madem katlanamıyorsunuz, ne diye hala sürdürüyorsunuz, değil mi? Onların yerinde olsam hiç beklemez boşanır, sonra da sevdiğim kişiyle evlenirdim.
es: —No los aguantan —miró a Myrtle y luego a Tom—. Y digo yo: ¿por qué siguen viviendo con esas personas si no las aguantan? Si yo fuera ellos, me divorciaría y volvería a casarme inmediatamente.
vi_translation: "Can't stand it." She looked at Myrtle and then at Tom. "I mean, why do they keep living as husband and wife if they can't stand their spouse anymore? If I were them, I would have divorced and married each other right away."
tr_translation: “Really!” He looked first at Myrtle and then at Tom, “If you can't stand it, why do you keep it up, right? If I were in their place, I wouldn't wait at all, I would get divorced and then marry the person I love.”
es_translation: —They can't stand them —he looked at Myrtle and then at Tom—. And I say: why do they keep living with those people if they can't stand them? If I were them, I would get a divorce and remarry immediately.

en: “Doesn’t she like Wilson either?”
vi: "Bộ không phải Myrtle cũng yêu Wilson sao?"
tr: “Mrytle, Wilson’u hiç sevmiyor mu?
es: —¿Ella tampoco quiere a Wilson?
vi_translation: "Didn't Myrtle also love Wilson?"
tr_translation: “Doesn't Myrtle love Wilson at all?”
es_translation: —Does she not want Wilson either?

en: The answer to this was unexpected. It came from Myrtle, who had overheard the question, and it was violent and obscene.
vi: Câu trả lời cho câu hỏi của tôi đã bất ngờ được trả lời từ Myrtle. Cô ta nghe lóm được câu hỏi và đã trả lời nó một cách thô bạo tục tĩu.
tr: Sorumun yanıtı hiç beklemediğim bir şekilde geldi. Kulak misafiri olmuş olan Myrtle, soruma ağız dolusu bir küfürle yanıt vermişti.
es: La respuesta fue inesperada, porque vino de Myrtle, que había oído mi pregunta. Y fue violenta y obscena.
vi_translation: The answer to my question was unexpectedly provided by Myrtle. She eavesdropped on the question and answered it in a crude and vulgar manner.
tr_translation: The answer to my question came in a way I never expected. Myrtle, who had been eavesdropping, responded to my question with a mouthful of curses.
es_translation: The response was unexpected, because it came from Myrtle, who had heard my question. And it was violent and obscene.

en: “You see,” cried Catherine triumphantly. She lowered her voice again. “It’s really his wife that’s keeping them apart. She’s a Catholic, and they don’t believe in divorce.”
vi: "Anh thấy đó." Catherine thốt lên một cách chiến thắng, sau đó hạ giọng xuống một lần nữa. "Thật ra vợ của Tom mới là người cản lối hai người họ. Cô ta là đạo thiên chúa giáo, không tin vào ly dị."
tr: “Görüyorsun ya!” diye haykırdı Catherine zafer kazanmışçasına. Sonra yeniden sesini alçalttı. “Aslında kavuşamamalarının nedeni Tom’un karısı. Katolik’miş, bilirsin onların boşanmaları yasaktır.
es: —Ya ves —exclamó Catherine triunfalmente. Volvió a bajar la voz—. Es la mujer de él la que los separa. Es católica, y los católicos no creen en el divorcio.
vi_translation: "You see." Catherine exclaimed triumphantly, then lowered her voice again. "Actually, Tom's wife is the one blocking their way. She is a Catholic and does not believe in divorce."
tr_translation: “You see!” cried Catherine triumphantly. Then she lowered her voice again. “Actually, the reason they can't be together is Tom's wife. She's Catholic, you know their divorces are forbidden.”
es_translation: —You see —exclaimed Catherine triumphantly. She lowered her voice again—. It's his wife who separates them. She's Catholic, and Catholics don't believe in divorce.

en: Daisy was not a Catholic, and I was a little shocked at the elaborateness of the lie.
vi: Daisy không phải theo đạo thiên chúa giáo. Tôi thấy hơi sửng sốt về lời nói láo thêm thắt này.
tr: Daisy’nin Katolik olmadığını bildiğimden, bu büyük ya­lan karşısında biraz sarsılmıştım.
es: Daisy no era católica, y me impresionó un poco lo rebuscado de la mentira.
vi_translation: Daisy is not a Christian. I felt a bit surprised by this embellished lie.
tr_translation: Since I knew Daisy wasn't Catholic, I was a bit shaken by this big lie.
es_translation: Daisy wasn't Catholic, and the elaborate nature of the lie impressed me a bit.

en: “When they do get married,” continued Catherine, “they’re going West to live for a while until it blows over.”
vi: "Khi nào họ thực sự lấy nhau." Catherine tiếp tục. "Họ sẽ dọn về miền Tây ở một thời gian, chờ cho sóng gió qua đi."
tr: “Evlenir evlenmez,” diye sürdürdü, “Batıya gidecek, ortalık duruluncaya kadar da orada yaşayacaklar.
es: —Cuando se casen —continuó Catherine— se irán al Oeste por un tiempo, hasta que todo haya pasado.
vi_translation: "When will they actually get married?" Catherine continued. "They will move to the West for a while, waiting for the storm to pass."
tr_translation: “As soon as they get married,” he continued, “they will go to the West and live there until things settle down.”
es_translation: —When they get married —continued Catherine— they will go West for a while, until everything has passed.

en: “It’d be more discreet to go to Europe.”
vi: "Đi châu Âu có lẽ sẽ biệt lập kín đáo hơn."
tr: “Avrupa’ya gitseler ya!”
es: —Sería más discreto irse a Europa.
vi_translation: "Going to Europe might be more discreetly isolated."
tr_translation: “Why don't they go to Europe!”
es_translation: —It would be more discreet to go to Europe.

en: “Oh, do you like Europe?” she exclaimed surprisingly. “I just got back from Monte Carlo.”
vi: "Ồ, anh thích châu Âu à?" Cô ta reo lên ngạc nhiên. "Tôi mới quay trở về từ Monte Carlo."
tr: “Demek siz de Avrupa’yı seviyorsunuz?” diye haykırdı heyecanla, “Ben de Monte Carlo’dan yeni döndüm.
es: —Ah, ¿te gusta Europa? —exclamó, sorprendiéndome—. Acabo de volver de Montecarlo.
vi_translation: "Oh, you like Europe?" She exclaimed in surprise. "I just returned from Monte Carlo."
tr_translation: “So, you like Europe too?” he exclaimed excitedly, “I just returned from Monte Carlo.”
es_translation: —Ah, do you like Europe? —he exclaimed, surprising me—. I just returned from Monte Carlo.

en: “Just last year. I went over there with another girl.”
vi: "Mới năm ngoái thôi. Tôi tới đó với một người bạn gái."
tr: “Daha doğrusu geçen sene oradaydım. Bir kız arkadaşımla gitmiştik.
es: —El año pasado. Fui con otra chica.
vi_translation: "Just last year." "I went there with a girlfriend."
tr_translation: “More precisely, I was there last year. I had gone with a female friend.”
es_translation: —Last year. I went with another girl.

en: “Stay long?”
vi: "Cô ở đó có lâu không?"
tr: “Çok kaldınız mı?
es: —¿Estuvisteis mucho tiempo?
vi_translation: "Have you been there long?"
tr_translation: "Did you stay long?""
es_translation: —Were you there for a long time?

en: “No, we just went to Monte Carlo and back. We went by way of Marseilles. We had over twelve hundred dollars when we started, but we got gyped out of it all in two days in the private rooms. We had an awful time getting back, I can tell you. God, how I hated that town!”
vi: "Không lâu, chỉ tới Monte Carlo rồi về. Chúng tôi đi ngã Marseilles. Lúc đi chúng tôi có hơn một ngàn hai, nhưng sau đó chỉ trong vòng hai ngày thì bị người ta lừa đảo lấy cắp hết tại những căn phòng trọ. Anh phải biết chúng tôi khốn khổ lắm mới kiếm được cách về. Trời ơi, tôi căm ghét cái thành phố đó."
tr: “Hayır, Monte Carlo’ya gitmemizle dönmemiz bir oldu diyebilirim. Marsilya üzerinden gitmiştik. Yola çıktığımızda üzerimizde bin iki yüz dolar vardı; ancak o özel odalara kanıp iki güç içinde beş parasız kaldık. Geri dönene kadar neler çektik anlatamam. Tanrım, oradan nefret ediyorum!
es: —No, fuimos a Montecarlo y volvimos. Fuimos vía Marsella. Teníamos más de mil doscientos dólares cuando empezamos, y en dos días nos habían desplumado hasta el último centavo. Lo pasamos fatal en el viaje de regreso, te lo puedo asegurar. ¡Dios mío, qué ciudad tan aborrecible!
vi_translation: "Not long, just to Monte Carlo and back." "We went via Marseilles." "When we left, we had more than twelve hundred, but within just two days, we were swindled and robbed of everything at the lodging houses." "You must know we were in a miserable state trying to find a way back." "Oh my God, I hate that city."
tr_translation: “No, I can say that our trip to Monte Carlo was as good as our return. We had gone via Marseille. When we set out, we had twelve hundred dollars with us; but we fell for those special rooms and within two days we were penniless. I can't describe what we went through until we returned. My God, I hate that place!”
es_translation: —No, we went to Monte Carlo and came back. We went via Marseille. We had over twelve hundred dollars when we started, and in two days we were fleeced down to the last cent. We had a terrible time on the way back, I can assure you. My God, what a dreadful city!

en: The late afternoon sky bloomed in the window for a moment like the blue honey of the Mediterranean—then the shrill voice of Mrs. McKee called me back into the room.
vi: Bầu trời xế chiều rọi những tia nắng qua cánh cửa sổ, trong một khoảnh khắc trông giống như màu mật ong xanh của miền Địa Trung Hải. Giọng nói the thé của cô vợ McKee kéo tôi trở về với hiện tại trong căn phòng.
tr: Bir anlığına pencereden dışarı, canım Akdeniz mavisine çalan gökyüzüne dalmıştım ki Bayan McKee’nin cırtlak sesi beni kendime getirdi:
es: El cielo del atardecer, semejante a la miel azul del Mediterráneo, resplandeció un instante en la ventana, y entonces la voz estridente de mistress McKee me devolvió a la habitación.
vi_translation: The late afternoon sky cast rays of sunlight through the window, for a moment resembling the blue honey color of the Mediterranean. The shrill voice of Mrs. McKee pulled me back to the present in the room.
tr_translation: For a moment, I was lost in the sky outside the window, which was tinged with the beloved Mediterranean blue, when Mrs. McKee's shrill voice brought me back to reality:
es_translation: The evening sky, resembling the blue honey of the Mediterranean, shone for a moment in the window, and then the shrill voice of Mistress McKee brought me back to the room.

en: “I almost made a mistake, too,” she declared vigorously. “I almost married a little kike who’d been after me for years. I knew he was below me. Everybody kept saying to me: ‘Lucille, that man’s way below you!’ But if I hadn’t met Chester, he’d of got me sure.”
vi: "Tôi xém nữa đã lầm lỡ." Cô ta tuyên bố một cách mạnh mẽ. "Tôi xém chút lấy phải một anh chàng Do Thái thấp hèn, người đã từng theo đuổi tôi bao nhiêu năm. Tôi biết rằng anh ta thấp hèn hơn tôi. Mọi người ai cũng nó: 'Lucille, anh chàng đó so ra quá thấp kém cho cô.' Nếu như tôi không gặp được Chester, tôi chắc chắn đã lấy anh chàng đó rồi."
tr: “Neredeyse ben de başımı yakacaktım” dedi heyecanla, “yıllarca peşimde koşmuş bir köpekle evlenmeme ramak kalmıştı, hem de hiç dengim olmamasına rağmen. Çevremdeki herkes, ‘Lucille, bu adam sana layık değil’ diye uyarıyordu. Şayet Chester’le karşılaşmasaydım, kesin beni ikna ederdi.
es: —También yo estuve a punto de cometer un error —afirmaba con energía—. Estuve a punto de casarme con un judío insignificante que llevaba años detrás de mí. Yo sabía que no estaba a mi altura. Y todos me decían: «Lucille, ese hombre no está a tu altura». Pero se habría salido con la suya, seguro, si no hubiera conocido a Chester.
vi_translation: "I almost made a mistake." She declared forcefully. "I almost married a lowly Jewish guy who had been pursuing me for many years. I knew that he was inferior to me. Everyone said: 'Lucille, that guy is way too inferior for you.' If I hadn't met Chester, I would have definitely married that guy."
tr_translation: “I almost got myself into trouble,” she said excitedly, “I was this close to marrying a man who had been chasing after me for years, even though he was not my equal at all. Everyone around me was warning, ‘Lucille, this man is not worthy of you.’ If I hadn't met Chester, he would have definitely convinced me.”
es_translation: —I also almost made a mistake —she asserted energetically—. I was about to marry an insignificant Jew who had been after me for years. I knew he was not up to my standards. And everyone told me: "Lucille, that man is not up to your standards." But he would have gotten his way, for sure, if I hadn't met Chester.

en: “Yes, but listen,” said Myrtle Wilson, nodding her head up and down, “at least you didn’t marry him.”
vi: "Đúng, nhưng nghe đây." Myrtle gục gặc đầu nói.
tr: “Ama bak,” dedi Myrtle Wilson, başını sallayarak, “hiç olmazsa sen evlenmemişsin onunla.
es: —Sí, pero escucha —dijo Myrtle Wilson, moviendo la cabeza arriba y abajo—, tú por lo menos no te casaste.
vi_translation: "Yes, but listen here." Myrtle nodded her head and said.
tr_translation: “But look,” said Myrtle Wilson, shaking her head, “at least you didn't marry him.”
es_translation: —Yes, but listen —said Myrtle Wilson, nodding her head up and down—, at least you didn't get married.

en: “I know I didn’t.”
vi: "Ít ra chị đã không lấy anh chàng đó."
tr: “Evet, neyse ki.
es: —Por supuesto.
vi_translation: "At least I didn't marry that guy."
tr_translation: “Yes, fortunately.””
es_translation: —Of course.

en: “Well, I married him,” said Myrtle, ambiguously. “And that’s the difference between your case and mine.”
vi: "Đúng vậy, tôi đã không lấy." "Còn tôi thì đã lấy người như vậy." Myrtle nói, một cách mơ hồ không rõ ràng. "Đó là sự khác biệt giữa trường hợp của chị và của tôi."
tr: “işte ben evlendim!” dedi sonra imalı, “aramızdaki fark da bu.” ,
es: —Yo sí me casé —dijo Myrtle, en un tono de ambigüedad.
vi_translation: "That's right, I didn't take it." "And I have married someone like that." Myrtle said, in a vague and unclear manner. "That is the difference between your case and mine."
tr_translation: “Well, I got married!” he then said suggestively, “and that's the difference between us.”
es_translation: —I did get married —said Myrtle, in a tone of ambiguity. —Why did you get married, Myrtle?

en: “Why did you, Myrtle?” demanded Catherine. “Nobody forced you to.”
vi: "Sao chị lại làm vậy, Myrtle, đâu ai ép buộc chị. " Catherine tra hỏi.
tr: “Fakat neden, Myrtle?” diye sordu Catherine, “Kimse seni zorlamamıştı ki!
es: —¿Por qué te casaste, Myrtle? —preguntó Catherine—. Nadie te obligó.
vi_translation: "Why did you do that, Myrtle? No one forced you."
tr_translation: “But why, Myrtle?” asked Catherine, “No one had forced you!”
es_translation: —asked Catherine—. No one forced you.

en: “I married him because I thought he was a gentleman,” she said finally. “I thought he knew something about breeding, but he wasn’t fit to lick my shoe.”
vi: "Chị đã lấy anh ta vì chị nghĩ anh ta là một người hào hoa phong nhã. Chị cứ tưởng anh ta là người con nhà giòng dõi. Nhưng thật ra anh ta không đáng để liếm giầy cho chị."
tr: Myrtle biraz düşündü, “Aslında onunla, bir beyefendi olduğunu düşündüğüm için evlenmiştim. İyi terbiye görmüş biri olduğunu sanmıştım, oysa pabuçlarımı yalamaya bile layık değilmiş.
es: —Me casé porque creí que era un caballero —dijo por fin—. Creí que sabía lo que es una buena educación, pero no valía ni para limpiarme los zapatos con la lengua.
vi_translation: "I married him because I thought he was a charming and elegant man. I believed he came from a noble family. But in reality, he isn't even worthy to lick my shoes."
tr_translation: Myrtle thought for a moment, "Actually, I married him because I thought he was a gentleman. I believed he was well-mannered, but he wasn't even worthy of licking my shoes.
es_translation: —I got married because I thought he was a gentleman —she finally said—. I thought he knew what a good upbringing was, but he wasn't even worth cleaning my shoes with his tongue.

en: “You were crazy about him for a while,” said Catherine.
vi: "Có một thời chị đã từng yêu anh ta đến điên cuồng." Catherine nói.
tr: “Eskiden ona delicesine aşıktın,” dedi Catherine.
es: —Pues durante un tiempo estuviste loca por él —dijo Catherine.
vi_translation: "There was a time when she loved him madly." Catherine said. "Madly in love with him!"
tr_translation: “You used to be madly in love with her,” said Catherine.
es_translation: —Well, for a while you were crazy about him —said Catherine.

en: “Crazy about him!” cried Myrtle incredulously. “Who said I was crazy about him? I never was any more crazy about him than I was about that man there.”
vi: "Điên cuồng vì anh ta!" Myrtle thốt lên đầy ngờ vực. "Ai nói chị đã yêu anh ta điên cuồng? Chị chưa bao giờ yêu anh ta điên cuồng hơn như chị đã yêu người đàn ông kia."
tr: “Ben mi aşıktım?” diye haykırdı Myrtle. Duyduklarına inanamıyor gibiydi, “Bunu da nereden çıkardın? Şurada oturan adamı ne kadar seviyorsam onu da ancak o kadar seviyordum.
es: —¡Loca por él! —exclamó Myrtle con incredulidad—. ¿Quién ha dicho que estaba loca por él? Jamás he estado más loca por él que por ese hombre.
vi_translation: Myrtle exclaimed incredulously. "Who said you were madly in love with him? You have never loved him as madly as you loved that other man."
tr_translation: “Was I in love?” Myrtle cried. She seemed unable to believe what she was hearing, “Where did you get that from? I loved him only as much as I love the man sitting over there.”
es_translation: —Crazy about him! —exclaimed Myrtle incredulously—. Who said I was crazy about him? I've never been crazier about him than about that man.

en: She pointed suddenly at me, and everyone looked at me accusingly. I tried to show by my expression that I expected no affection.
vi: Myrtle đột nhiên chỉ vào tôi khiến mọi người đều hướng về nhìn tôi như kết tội. Tôi cố gắng tỏ dáng điệu như mình không có dính dáng gì tới quá khứ của Myrtle.
tr: Beni gösteriyor olması herkesin bir suçluymuşum gibi kınarcasına yüzüme bakmasına neden olmuştu, bense yüz ifademle, onun geçmişinde kesinlikle yerim olmadığımı göstermeye çalıştım.
es: De repente me señaló con el dedo, y todos me miraron acusadoramente. Intenté que mi expresión dejara claro que yo no aspiraba a ningún tipo de aprecio.
vi_translation: Myrtle suddenly pointed at me, causing everyone to turn and look at me as if accusing. I tried to appear as though I had nothing to do with Myrtle's past.
tr_translation: The fact that he was pointing at me had caused everyone to look at me as if I were a criminal, while I tried to show with my facial expression that I definitely had no place in his past.
es_translation: Suddenly, he pointed at me with his finger, and everyone looked at me accusingly. I tried to make my expression clear that I did not aspire to any kind of appreciation.

en: “The only crazy I was was when I married him. I knew right away I made a mistake. He borrowed somebody’s best suit to get married in, and never even told me about it, and the man came after it one day when he was out: ‘Oh, is that your suit?’ I said. ‘This is the first I ever heard about it.’ But I gave it to him and then I lay down and cried to beat the band all afternoon.”
vi: "Chỉ có mỗi một việc đáng được coi là điên rồ là chuyện chị lấy anh ta. Chị ngay lập tức biết rằng mình đã làm một chuyện lầm lẫn. Anh ta đã đi mượn bộ đồ vest đẹp nhất để mặc cho đám cưới nhưng lại không hề cho chị hay chuyện này. Một ngày sau, khi anh ta không có nhà, một người đàn ông đã đến tìm để lấy bộ quần áo đó lại. Chị hỏi, 'Ồ thì ra bộ quần áo đó là của anh à, đây là lần đầu tiên tôi nghe nói về chuyện này.' Chị trả bộ đồ cho người đó, rồi nằm vật xuống giường khóc thảm thiết nguyên buổi chiều hôm đó."
tr: “Benim delicesine davrandığım tek zaman, onunla evlendiğim o andı. Evlenir evlenmez de bunun çok büyük bir hata olduğunu fark etmiştim. Meğer kendi nikah töreni için bir ahbabının takım elbisesini ödünç almış, ba­na bu konuda tek bir şey olsun söylememişti. Derken bir gün, bizimki evde yokken bu adam çıkageldi, ‘Ya! Demek takım elbise sizin?” dedim, “Bunu şu an ilk sizden duyuyorum! ’ Yine de adama takımı verdim, sonra da yatağa kapanıp akşama kadar hıçkıra hıçkıra ağladım.
es: —Mi única locura fue casarme. E inmediatamente supe que me había equivocado. Él le pidió prestado a no sé quién su mejor traje para la boda, y no me dijo ni una palabra, y el hombre vino a por su traje un día que mi marido no estaba. «Ah, ¿el traje es suyo?», dije, «pues ahora me entero». Se lo di y luego me eché en la cama y me pasé la tarde llorando sin parar.
vi_translation: "The only thing that could be considered crazy was that she married him. She immediately knew that she had made a mistake. He had borrowed the nicest suit to wear for the wedding but didn't tell her about it. A day later, when he wasn't home, a man came to retrieve the suit. She asked, 'Oh, so that suit belongs to you? This is the first time I've heard about this.' She returned the suit to the man, then collapsed on the bed and cried her heart out the entire afternoon."
tr_translation: “The only time I acted insanely was the moment I married him. As soon as we got married, I realized it was a huge mistake. It turned out he had borrowed a friend's suit for his own wedding ceremony and hadn't told me a single thing about it. Then one day, while he was not at home, this man showed up, ‘Oh! So the suit is yours?” I said, “This is the first time I'm hearing this from you!’ Still, I gave the suit to the man, then shut myself in the bedroom and cried my heart out until evening.”
es_translation: —My only madness was getting married. And I immediately knew that I had made a mistake. He borrowed his best suit from I don't know who for the wedding, and he didn't say a word to me, and the man came for his suit one day when my husband wasn't home. "Ah, the suit is yours?" I said, "well, now I know." I gave it to him and then I lay on the bed and spent the afternoon crying nonstop.

en: “She really ought to get away from him,” resumed Catherine to me. “They’ve been living over that garage for eleven years. And Tom’s the first sweetie she ever had.”
vi: "Chị ấy đáng lẽ ra nên bỏ chồng ngay lúc đó." Catherine tiếp tục nói với tôi. "Hai người họ đã sống ở cái tiệm sửa xe đó mười một năm rồi. Anh Tom là người tình đầu tiên mà chị đã từng có."
tr: “O adamdan gerçekten de ayrılması lazım” diyerek hikayeye kaldığı yerden devam etti Catherine, “Tam on bir yıldır o tamirhanenin üst katında yaşıyorlar, zaten Tom da onun ilk aşığı.
es: —Tendría que separarse —me resumió Catherine—. Llevan once años viviendo en el altillo de ese garaje. Y Tom es el primer amigo que ha tenido.
vi_translation: "She should have left her husband right then." Catherine continued to tell me. "The two of them have lived at that auto repair shop for eleven years already. Tom is the first lover she has ever had."
tr_translation: "She really needs to leave that man," Catherine continued the story from where she left off, "They have been living in that apartment above the repair shop for exactly eleven years, and Tom is her first lover anyway."
es_translation: —He would have to separate —Catherine summarized to me—. They have been living in the attic of that garage for eleven years. And Tom is the first friend he has had.

en: The bottle of whisky—a second one—was now in constant demand by all present, excepting Catherine, who “felt just as good on nothing at all.” Tom rang for the janitor and sent him for some celebrated sandwiches, which were a complete supper in themselves. I wanted to get out and walk eastward toward the park through the soft twilight, but each time I tried to go I became entangled in some wild, strident argument which pulled me back, as if with ropes, into my chair. Yet high over the city our line of yellow windows must have contributed their share of human secrecy to the casual watcher in the darkening streets, and I saw him too, looking up and wondering. I was within and without, simultaneously enchanted and repelled by the inexhaustible variety of life.
vi: Chai rượu whiskey thứ hai được mọi người liên lục truyền tay nhau uống ngoại trừ Catherine, cô ta cảm thấy "không cần uống gì cũng vẫn vui". Tom rung chuông cho gọi người hầu và sai anh ta đi mua bánh mì kẹp thịt loại nổi tiếng dùng cho bữa chiều. Lúc đó tôi chỉ muốn rời khỏi nơi này để được dạo bộ về hướng nam phía công viên dưới ánh hoàng hôn êm dịu. Nhưng cứ mỗi lần tôi dợm bước chân đi thì tôi lại bị kéo lại vướng víu vào những cuộc tranh luận dữ dội giống như những sợi dây thừng cột tôi vào g hế. Trên cái khoảng không gian cao phía trên thành phố nơi những ô cửa vàng màu chúng tôi đang ở, chúng tôi chắc chắn đang góp thêm chuyện vào cho cái kho tàng bí mật của nhân loại, và tới cho người bộ hành đang đi phía dưới trên những con đường đang từ từ sạm tối. Tôi trông thấy anh ta ngước nhìn lên tò mò. Tôi như vừa ở bên trong mà cũng như vừa ở bên ngoài, không ngừng vừa say mê vừa chán ghét những biến cải vô lường của đời sống.
tr: İkinci viski şişesi artık elden ele dolaşıyor, ‘içme­den de iyi hissettiğini’ söyleyen Catherine dışında herkes kadehlerini dolduruyordu. Tom kapıcıyı çağırıp, yakındaki büfeden tek başına bir öğün kadar doyurucu olmalarıyla ün kazanmış olan sandviçlerden getirmesini istedi. Akşam çökerken dışarı çıkıp, o tatlı serinlikte doğuya, parka doğru biraz yürümek istiyordum.
