vi: "Có lẽ chị không biết chúng tôi là ai, nhưng chúng tôi đã gặp chị ở đây vào khoảng tháng trước." Một trong hai cô áo vàng nói.
tr: “Bizi hatırlamadınız galiba. Bir ay kadar önce burada tanışmıştık” dedi sarı elbiselilerden biri.
es: —No sabes quiénes somos —dijo una de las chicas de amarillo—, pero te conocimos aquí hace cosa de un mes.
vi_translation: "Perhaps you don't know who we are, but we met you here about a month ago." One of the two girls in yellow said.
tr_translation: "I guess you don't remember us. We met here about a month ago," said one of the people in yellow dresses.
es_translation: —You don't know who we are —said one of the girls in yellow—, but we met you here about a month ago.

en: “You’ve dyed your hair since then,” remarked Jordan, and I started, but the girls had moved casually on and her remark was addressed to the premature moon, produced like the supper, no doubt, out of a caterer’s basket. With Jordan’s slender golden arm resting in mine, we descended the steps and sauntered about the garden. A tray of cocktails floated at us through the twilight, and we sat down at a table with the two girls in yellow and three men, each one introduced to us as Mr. Mumble.
vi: "Từ hôm đó đến nay trông ra các chị đã nhuộm tóc thành màu khác rồi." Lời nhận xét của Jordan làm tôi ngỡ ngàng, nhưng hai cô gái vẫn thản nhiên tiếp tục bước đi, làm như lời nhận xét của Jordan là để nói với mảnh trăng mọc sớm, hay với bữa ăn chiều đang được bày ra từ giỏ đồ ăn của người phục vụ ẩm thực. Cánh tay vàng thon thả của Jordan đặt nhẹ trên cánh tay tôi, chúng tôi thả bộ xuống những bậc thang dạo đi thơ thẩn trong vườn. Một khay những ly cocktai lượn đến bên chúng tôi dưới ánh đèn mờ mờ, thế rồi chúng tôi ngồi xuống chung bàn với hai cô gái mặc áo vàng lúc nãy và ba người đàn ông khác mà ông nào cũng đều tự giới thiệu với chúng tôi tên mình là ông Lầm Bầm.
tr: “Saçlarını boyamışsın ondandır” dedi Jordan. Ben irkilmiştim ama kızlar çoktan uzaklaştığından, söylediklerini zamanından önce doğan aydan başka duyan olmadı. Bu sahte ayın da yemekleri hazırlayan şirketin marifeti olduğuna şüphe yoktu. Jordan’ın narin, altın rengi kolu kolumda merdivenlerden inip bahçede yürümeye başladık. Alacakaranlıkta bir tepsi kokteyl önümüzden geçtikten sonra sarı elbiseli o iki kız ve üç erkekle birlikte bir masaya oturduk. Erkeklerin her biri de kendini Bay Mumble olarak tanıtmıştı.
es: —Os habéis teñido el pelo —contestó Jordan, y yo me sobresalté, pero las chicas habían seguido despreocupadamente su camino y las palabras las oyó la luna prematura, salida como la cena, sin duda, de la cesta del proveedor. Con el brazo delgado y dorado de Jordan descansando en el mío, bajamos la escalinata y deambulamos por el jardín. Una bandeja de cócteles se nos acercó flotando en el crepúsculo y nos sentamos a una mesa con las dos chicas de amarillo y tres hombres, que se presentaron, los tres, como mister Mmmm.
vi_translation: "Since that day, it seems the ladies have dyed their hair a different color." Jordan's comment left me astonished, but the two girls nonchalantly continued walking, as if Jordan's remark was meant for the early-rising moon or the dinner being laid out from the food basket by the catering staff. Jordan's slender golden arm rested lightly on mine, and we strolled down the steps, wandering leisurely through the garden. A tray of cocktails floated over to us under the dim lights, and then we sat down at the same table with the two girls in yellow dresses from earlier and three other men, each of whom introduced himself to us as Mr. Mumble.
tr_translation: “You must have dyed your hair, that’s why,” said Jordan. I was startled, but since the girls had already walked away, no one but the prematurely born moon heard what was said. There was no doubt that this fake moon was also the handiwork of the company that prepared the meals. With Jordan’s delicate, golden arm in mine, we descended the stairs and began walking in the garden. After a tray of cocktails passed in front of us in the twilight, we sat at a table with those two girls in yellow dresses and three men. Each of the men introduced himself as Mr. Mumble.
es_translation: —You have dyed your hair —replied Jordan, and I was startled, but the girls had continued on their way carelessly, and the words were heard by the premature moon, which had undoubtedly come out, like dinner, from the supplier's basket. With Jordan's slender, golden arm resting on mine, we descended the staircase and wandered through the garden. A tray of cocktails floated towards us in the twilight, and we sat at a table with the two girls in yellow and three men, who all introduced themselves as mister Mmmm.

en: “Do you come to these parties often?” inquired Jordan of the girl beside her.
vi: "Các chị có hay đến dự những bữa tiệc này thường xuyên không?" Jordan hỏi cô gái đang ngồi cạnh mình.
tr: “Bu partilere sık gelir misiniz?”diye sordu Jordan yanındaki kıza.
es: —¿Venís mucho a estas fiestas? —preguntó Jordan a la chica que tenía al lado.
vi_translation: "Do you often attend these parties?" Jordan asked the girl sitting next to him.
tr_translation: "Do you come to these parties often?" Jordan asked the girl next to him.
es_translation: —Do you come to these parties often? —Jordan asked the girl next to him.

en: “The last one was the one I met you at,” answered the girl, in an alert confident voice. She turned to her companion: “Wasn’t it for you, Lucille?”
vi: "Lần trước đến là lần tôi đã gặp chị." Cô gái trả lời bằng giọng sống động. Sau đó quay qua người đi chung, "Chị cũng vậy phải không Lucille?"
tr: “En son sizinle tanıştığım partiye gelmiştim” diye yanıtladı kız, güven dolu bir sesle. “Senin de öyle değil mi Lucille?” diye sordu.
es: —La última fue en la que te conocí —respondió la chica con voz segura, enérgica. Se volvió a su amiga—.
vi_translation: "The last time I came was when I met you." The girl replied in a lively voice. Then she turned to her companion, "You too, right Lucille?"
tr_translation: “I last came to the party where I met you” the girl replied, with a voice full of confidence. “Isn't it the same for you, Lucille?” he asked.
es_translation: —The last one was when I met you —replied the girl with a confident, energetic voice. She turned to her friend—.

en: “I like to come,” Lucille said. “I never care what I do, so I always have a good time. When I was here last I tore my gown on a chair, and he asked me my name and address—inside of a week I got a package from Croirier’s with a new evening gown in it.”
vi: Cô nói thêm. "Tôi thích đến đây. Tôi không bao giờ cần biết mình sẽ làm gì, bởi vậy tôi lúc nào cũng được vui vẻ. Lần trước ở đây tôi đã làm rách áo mình trên một chiếc ghế. Anh ta đã hỏi tên và địa chỉ của tôi, chỉ trong vòng một tuần thì tôi nhận được một gói quà từ tiệm Croirer gửi tới với một chiếc áo dạ hội còn mới nguyên bên trong."
tr: “Gelmek hoşuma gidiyor” diyordu Lucille, “yaptıklarımı hiç umursamam. O yüzden de iyi vakit geçiririm. Son gelişimde tuvaletim bir iskemleye takılıp yırtılmıştı. O zaman bana adımı ve adresimi sordu. Bir haftaya kalmadan eve Courier mağazasından, içinde yepyeni bir tuvalet olan paket geldi.
es: —Me encanta venir —dijo Lucille—. Me da lo mismo hacer lo que sea, así que siempre me lo paso bien. La última vez se me rompió el vestido con una silla, y él me pidió mi nombre y dirección, y, antes de que pasara una semana, recibí un paquete de Croirier con un traje de noche nuevo.
vi_translation: She added. "I like coming here. I never need to know what I will do, so I am always happy. Last time I was here, I tore my shirt on a chair. He asked for my name and address, and within a week, I received a package from Croirer’s shop with a brand new evening gown inside."
tr_translation: “I like coming here,” said Lucille, “I don't care about what I do. That's why I have a good time. Last time I came, my dress got caught on a chair and tore. Then he asked me for my name and address. Within a week, a package from the Courier store arrived at my house with a brand new dress inside.”
es_translation: —I love coming here —said Lucille—. I don't mind doing anything, so I always have a good time. Last time, my dress got torn by a chair, and he asked for my name and address, and before a week had passed, I received a package from Croirier with a new evening gown.

en: “Did you keep it?” asked Jordan.
vi: "Chị nhận chiếc áo đó không?" Jordan hỏi.
tr: “Peki kabul ettin mi?” diye sordu Jordan
es: —¿Te quedaste con él? —preguntó Jordan.
vi_translation: "Did you take that shirt?" Jordan asked.
tr_translation: “So, did you accept?” asked Jordan
es_translation: —Did you stay with him? —asked Jordan.

en: “Sure I did. I was going to wear it tonight, but it was too big in the bust and had to be altered. It was gas blue with lavender beads. Two hundred and sixty-five dollars.”
vi: "Chắc chắn là nhận chứ. Đáng lẽ tôi đã mặc nó tối nay rồi nhưng cái ngực áo quá rộng cần phải sửa cho vừa. Chiếc áo màu xanh lam có gắn chuỗi hạt, giá hai trăm sáu mươi lăm đô la."
tr: “Elbette ettim. Bu gece giyecektim ama göğüs kısmı büyük geldi. Değiştirilmesi gerekecek. Gaz alevi renginde, üzeri de efla­tun boncuklarla işli. Tamı tamına iki yüz altmış beş dolar.
es: —Por supuesto. Me lo iba a poner esta noche, pero me queda ancho de pecho y me lo tengo que arreglar. Es azul gas con adornos lavanda. Doscientos sesenta y cinco dólares.
vi_translation: "Of course, I will accept it. I was supposed to wear it tonight, but the chest area is too wide and needs to be adjusted to fit. The blue dress with beads costs two hundred and sixty-five dollars."
tr_translation: “Of course I did. I was going to wear it tonight, but the chest part was too big. It will need to be altered. It's the color of gas flame, adorned with lilac beads. Exactly two hundred sixty-five dollars.”
es_translation: —Of course. I was going to wear it tonight, but it's too loose in the chest and I need to fix it. It's gas blue with lavender decorations. Two hundred sixty-five dollars.

en: “There’s something funny about a fellow that’ll do a thing like that,” said the other girl eagerly. “He doesn’t want any trouble with anybody.”
vi: "Có cái gì đó khác lạ về anh chàng này khiến anh ta làm một việc như vậy." Cô gái kia nói một cách hăm hở. "Làm như anh ta không muốn có chuyện rắc trối với bất cứ ai."
tr: “Böyle şeyler yapan birinde bir gariplik olmalı” dedi öteki kız, içinden gelerek, “Anlaşılan kimseyle arası bozulsun istemiyor.
es: —Un tipo que hace esas cosas no es normal —dijo la otra chica con vehemencia—. No quiere tener problemas con nadie.
vi_translation: "There's something unusual about this guy that makes him do such a thing." The girl said eagerly. "It's like he doesn't want any trouble with anyone."
tr_translation: “There must be something strange about someone who does such things,” said the other girl, sincerely, “Apparently, she doesn't want to fall out with anyone.”
es_translation: —A guy who does those things is not normal —said the other girl vehemently—. He doesn't want to have problems with anyone. —Who doesn't want to have problems?

en: “Who doesn’t?” I inquired.
vi: "Ai không muốn?" Tôi hỏi dò.
tr: “Kim istemiyor?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Quién no quiere tener problemas? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "Who doesn't want to?" I asked cautiously.
tr_translation: "Who doesn't want it?" I asked.
es_translation: —I asked.

en: “Gatsby. Somebody told me—”
vi: "Gatsby. Có người kể cho tôi..."
tr: “Gatsby. Biri bana demişti ki...
es: —Gatsby. Alguien me dijo…
vi_translation: "Gatsby. Someone told me..."
tr_translation: “Gatsby. Someone told me that...”
es_translation: —Gatsby. Someone told me...

en: The two girls and Jordan leaned together confidentially.
vi: Hai cô gái và Jordan nghiêng người lại gần nhau tỏ vẻ bí mật.
tr: İki kız ve Jordan öne eğilip birbirlerine sokuldular.
es: Las dos chicas y Jordan acercaron la cabeza confidencialmente.
vi_translation: The two girls and Jordan leaned in close to each other, appearing secretive.
tr_translation: Two girls and Jordan leaned forward and huddled together.
es_translation: The two girls and Jordan brought their heads together confidentially.

en: “Somebody told me they thought he killed a man once.”
vi: "Có người kể cho tôi nghe họ nghĩ rằng anh đã giết một người đàn ông."
tr: “Biri bana onun zamanında birini öldürdüğünü söylemişti.
es: —Alguien me dijo que una vez mató a un hombre.
vi_translation: "Someone told me they think you killed a man."
tr_translation: “Someone had told me that he killed someone in his time.”
es_translation: —Someone told me that he once killed a man.

en: A thrill passed over all of us. The three Mr. Mumbles bent forward and listened eagerly.
vi: Một sự rùng mình truyền qua tất cả chúng tôi. Ba ông Lầm Bầm nghiêng tới trước háo hức lắng nghe.
tr: Hepimizi heyecan sarmıştı. Üç Bay Mumble da eğilip merakla dinlemeye koyuldu.
es: Todos sentimos un escalofrío. Los tres mister Mmmm acercaron también la cabeza, ansiosos de oír.
vi_translation: A shiver ran through all of us. Mr. Grumble leaned forward eagerly to listen.
tr_translation: We were all filled with excitement. The three Mr. Mumbles bent down and started listening with curiosity.
es_translation: We all felt a shiver. The three Mister Mmmm also leaned in, eager to listen.

en: “I don’t think it’s so much that,” argued Lucille sceptically; “It’s more that he was a German spy during the war.”
vi: "Tôi thì không nghĩ ghê gớm đến như thế." Lucille bác bẻ một cách hoài nghi. "Anh ta giống như gián điệp của Đức trong chiến tranh hơn."
tr: “O kadar ileri gittiğini sanmam” dedi Lucille şüphe içinde, “ama savaş sırasında Alman casusluğu yaptığı doğru olabilir.
es: —No creo que llegue a tanto —respondió Lucille, escéptica—. Es más probable que fuera espía de los alemanes durante la guerra.
vi_translation: "I don't think it's that serious." Lucille refuted skeptically. "He is more like a German spy during the war."
tr_translation: "I don't think he went that far," said Lucille doubtfully, "but it might be true that he engaged in German espionage during the war."
es_translation: —I don't think it will go that far —replied Lucille, skeptical—. It's more likely that he was a spy for the Germans during the war.

en: One of the men nodded in confirmation.
vi: Một trong những người đàn ông gật đầu xác nhận.
tr: Adamlardan biri başını sallayarak onayladı.
es: Uno de los hombres lo confirmó:
vi_translation: One of the men nodded in confirmation.
tr_translation: One of the men nodded in approval.
es_translation: One of the men confirmed it:

en: “I heard that from a man who knew all about him, grew up with him in Germany,” he assured us positively.
vi: "Tôi nghe lại được từ một người biết rành về anh ta, đã cùng lớn lên với anh ta ở Germany." Người đàn ông này khẳng định một cách chắc chắn.
tr: “Gatsby’i çok iyi tanıyan birinden duydum. Çocukluk­ yılları birlikte Almanya’da geçmiş” diyerek bizi inan­dırmaya çalıştı.
es: —Se lo oí a un hombre que lo conocía bien. Se había criado con él en Alemania —nos aseguró categóricamente.
vi_translation: "I heard it again from someone who knows him well, who grew up with him in Germany." This man asserted confidently.
tr_translation: “I heard from someone who knows Gatsby very well. They tried to convince us by saying their childhood years were spent together in Germany.”
es_translation: —I heard it from a man who knew him well. He had grown up with him in Germany —he assured us categorically.

en: “Oh, no,” said the first girl, “it couldn’t be that, because he was in the American army during the war.” As our credulity switched back to her she leaned forward with enthusiasm. “You look at him sometimes when he thinks nobody’s looking at him. I’ll bet he killed a man.”
vi: "Ô, không đâu." Cô gái thứ nhất nói. "Không thể như vậy được, bởi vì anh ta đang ở trong quân đội Mỹ trong thời gian chiến tranh." Thấy chúng tôi lại quay sang tin theo những gì mình nói, cô gái nhướng ngưới về phía trước hào hứng nói tiếp. "Hãy thỉnh thoảng quan sát anh ta những khi anh ta nghĩ rằng không có ai đang nhìn mình. Tôi cam đoan anh ta đã giết người."
tr: “Yok canım!” dedi ilk konuşan kadın, “doğru değildir çünkü savaşta Amerikan ordusunda görevliymiş. İlgi ve bakışlarımız tekrar ona yönelince sırrını paylaşıyormuş gibi biraz da­ha eğildi, “Kimsenin bakmadığını düşündüğü zamanlarda ona dikkat edin. Birini öldürdüğüne bahse girerim.
es: —No —dijo la primera chica—, eso es imposible, porque hizo la guerra en el ejército americano —viendo que volvía a ganarse nuestra credulidad, se inclinó hacia nosotros con entusiasmo—. Fijaos en él cuando crea que nadie lo mira. Estoy segura de que mató a un hombre.
vi_translation: "Oh, no." The first girl said. "It can't be like that, because he was in the U.S. military during the war." Seeing that we were starting to believe what she was saying, the girl leaned forward excitedly and continued. "Occasionally observe him when he thinks no one is watching. I guarantee he has killed someone."
tr_translation: “No way!” said the first woman, “it can't be true because he was supposedly serving in the American army during the war.” When our attention and gazes turned back to him, he leaned in a bit more as if sharing a secret, "Pay attention to him when he thinks no one is watching. I bet he has killed someone."
es_translation: —No —said the first girl—, that's impossible, because he fought in the American army —seeing that she was regaining our belief, she leaned towards us with enthusiasm—. Watch him when he thinks no one is looking. I'm sure he killed a man.

en: She narrowed her eyes and shivered. Lucille shivered. We all turned and looked around for Gatsby. It was testimony to the romantic speculation he inspired that there were whispers about him from those who had found little that it was necessary to whisper about in this world.
vi: Cô gái nhíu mắt và rùng mình, Lucille cũng rùng mình. Tất cả chúng tôi đều quay nhìn chung quanh tìm kiếm Gatsby. Điều này như để kiểm chứng cho những lời đồn đại đầy ảo tưởng mà Gatsby đã gây cảm hứng cho những người thích to nhỏ thầm thì mọi chuyện trên đời.
tr: Gözlerini kıstı ve titredi, Lucille de titriyordu. Hepimiz etrafta Gatsby’i aramaya koyulduk. Bu dünyada fısıldayacak konu bulmakta güçlük çekenler için Gatsby böyle romantik ve gizemli söylentilere ilham kaynağı oluyordu.
es: Entornó los ojos y se estremeció. Lucille se estremeció. Todos nos volvimos a mirar donde estaba Gatsby. Prueba de las románticas especulaciones que inspiraba era que murmuraran a su costa aquellos que habían encontrado en este mundo poco sobre lo que poder murmurar.
vi_translation: The girl squinted and shivered, Lucille also shivered. All of us turned to look around for Gatsby. This was as if to verify the fanciful rumors that Gatsby had inspired among those who loved to whisper about everything in the world.
tr_translation: He squinted his eyes and shivered, Lucille was also shivering. We all started looking around for Gatsby. For those who find it difficult to find topics to whisper about in this world, Gatsby was an inspiration for such romantic and mysterious rumors.
es_translation: He half-closed his eyes and shivered. Lucille shivered. We all turned to look where Gatsby was. Proof of the romantic speculations he inspired was that those who had found little to gossip about in this world murmured at his expense.

en: The first supper—there would be another one after midnight—was now being served, and Jordan invited me to join her own party, who were spread around a table on the other side of the garden. There were three married couples and Jordan’s escort, a persistent undergraduate given to violent innuendo, and obviously under the impression that sooner or later Jordan was going to yield him up her person to a greater or lesser degree. Instead of rambling, this party had preserved a dignified homogeneity, and assumed to itself the function of representing the staid nobility of the countryside—East Egg condescending to West Egg and carefully on guard against its spectroscopic gaiety.
vi: Bữa ăn tối đầu tiên được bắt đầu, sẽ còn một bữa nữa vào khoảng nửa đêm. Jordan mời tôi ngồi cùng bàn với nhóm người đi chung với cô, lúc đó đang ngồi quanh một chiếc bàn tròn phía bên kia khu vườn, gồm ba cặp vợ chồng và một anh chàng là người hò hẹn của Jordan. Anh ta là một sinh viên bằng cử nhân chưa tốt nghiệp, thường xuyên đưa ra những lời nói bóng gió mạnh bạo, rõ ràng đang có cảm tưởng cho rằng chẳng sớm thì muộn, không ít thì nhiều, Jordan sẽ dâng hiến cho mình. Thay vì nói chuyện dông dài, nhóm người này đều như nhau giữ gìn tư cách trang nghiêm, tự đặt cho mình chức năng đại diện cho tính cách thanh cao điềm đạm của dân vùng East Egg đến chiếu cố dân vùng West Egg. Họ luôn cẩn trọng đề phòng không muốn tham dự tới cuộc vui chơi đình đám.
tr: İlk yemek servisi -gece yarısından sonra bir tane daha vardı- başlamıştı. Jordan beni kendi grubuyla oturmaya davet etti. Bahçenin öteki yanındaki masalardan birine yayılmışlardı. Grupta evli üç çift ve Jordan’ın refakatçisi bulunuyordu. Bu sonuncusu ateşli konuşmalar yapmakta ısrarlı, genç bir üniversite öğrencisiydi. Her tavrı ile er ya da geç Jordan’ın vücudunu elde edeceğine dair inancını belli ediyordu. Gruptakiler sağda solda dolaşmak yerine birlikte kal­mayı yeğlemiş ve bir bütün olarak ağırbaşlı banliyö sosyetesi­nin temsilcisi olmayı seçmişti. East Egg’liler lütfedip West Egg’lilere yakınlaşmışlardı ama buraların renkli ve hareketli ha­vasına kapılmamaya da dikkat ediyorlardı.
es: Habían empezado a servir la primera cena (servían otra después de medianoche), y Jordan me invitó a reunirme con su grupo, en una mesa al otro lado del jardín. Eran tres matrimonios y el acompañante de Jordan, un estudiante insistente, aficionado a las indirectas desagradables, y con la obvia impresión de que, antes o después, Jordan iba a entregarle su persona en mayor o menor grado. En vez de desperdigarse, el grupo había conservado una homogeneidad honorable, asumiendo la representación de la muy seria nobleza rural: East Egg manifestaba su condescendencia hacia West Egg, pero no bajaba la guardia contra su alegría espectroscópica.
vi_translation: The first dinner began, and there would be another one around midnight. Jordan invited me to sit at the table with the group she was with, who were sitting around a round table on the other side of the garden, consisting of three couples and a guy who was Jordan's date. He was an undergraduate student who frequently made bold insinuations, clearly under the impression that sooner or later, more or less, Jordan would offer herself to him. Instead of engaging in lengthy conversations, this group of people all maintained a dignified demeanor, assuming for themselves the role of representing the noble and calm character of the East Egg residents to look after the West Egg residents. They were always cautious, not wanting to participate in the boisterous festivities.
tr_translation: The first meal service had started - there was another one after midnight. Jordan invited me to sit with her group. They had spread out at one of the tables on the other side of the garden. The group consisted of three married couples and Jordan's companion. This latter was a young university student, insistent on making passionate speeches. With every gesture, he made it clear that he believed he would eventually win over Jordan's body. The group preferred to stay together rather than wander around and chose to represent the dignified suburban society as a whole. The East Eggers had graciously approached the West Eggers but were careful not to get caught up in the colorful and lively atmosphere of the place.
es_translation: They had started serving the first dinner (they served another after midnight), and Jordan invited me to join her group at a table on the other side of the garden. There were three married couples and Jordan's date, an insistent student who was fond of unpleasant insinuations and had the obvious impression that, sooner or later, Jordan was going to give herself to him to a greater or lesser degree. Instead of scattering, the group had maintained an honorable homogeneity, assuming the representation of the very serious rural nobility: East Egg showed its condescension towards West Egg but did not lower its guard against its spectroscopic joy.

en: “Let’s get out,” whispered Jordan, after a somehow wasteful and inappropriate half-hour; “this is much too polite for me.”
vi: Sau chừng nửa giờ lãng phí thời giờ ngồi ở đó cảm thấy không hợp, Jordan thì thầm. "Mình đi thôi. Ở đây đạo mạo quá không thích hợp với tôi."
tr: “Haydi kalkalım” diye fısıldadı Jordan, epey sıkıcı geçen yarım saatin ardından, “burası bana fazla kibar.
es: —Vámonos —murmuró Jordan al cabo de media hora más bien insípida y desperdiciada—; esto es demasiado fino para mí.
vi_translation: After about half an hour of wasting time sitting there feeling out of place, Jordan whispered. "Let's go. This place is too solemn, it doesn't suit me."
tr_translation: “Let's get up,” Jordan whispered after a rather boring half hour, “this place is too fancy for me.”
es_translation: —Let's go —murmured Jordan after a rather insipid and wasted half hour—; this is too fancy for me.

en: We got up, and she explained that we were going to find the host: I had never met him, she said, and it was making me uneasy. The undergraduate nodded in a cynical, melancholy way.
vi: Chúng tôi đứng lên, Jordan giải thích với mọi người rằng chúng tôi sẽ đi tìm chủ nhà. "Tôi chưa từng bao giờ gặp mặt anh ta." Jordan nói làm tôi hơi ngượng ngùng. Anh chàng sinh viên gật đầu một cách yếm thế u sầu.
tr: Masadan ayrılırken davetin sahibini bulmaya gittiğimizi açıkladı. Onu hiç tanımıyordu ve bundan rahatsızlık duyuyordu. Üniversiteli, alayla karışık hüzünlü bir halde başıyla onayladı.
es: Nos levantamos, y explicó al grupo que íbamos a buscar al anfitrión; yo no lo conocía, dijo, y eso hacía que me sintiera incómodo. El estudiante asintió con un gesto melancólico, cínico.
vi_translation: We stood up, and Jordan explained to everyone that we were going to find the host. "I have never met him before." Jordan said, making me a bit embarrassed. The student nodded in a melancholic and gloomy manner.
tr_translation: As we were leaving the table, he explained that we were going to find the host of the invitation. He didn't know him at all and felt uneasy about it. The university student nodded with a mix of irony and sadness.
es_translation: We got up, and he explained to the group that we were going to look for the host; I didn't know him, he said, and that made me feel uncomfortable. The student nodded with a melancholic, cynical gesture.

en: The bar, where we glanced first, was crowded, but Gatsby was not there. She couldn’t find him from the top of the steps, and he wasn’t on the veranda. On a chance we tried an important-looking door, and walked into a high Gothic library, panelled with carved English oak, and probably transported complete from some ruin overseas.
vi: Trước tiên chúng tôi đảo ngang qua quầy rượu, nơi này thật là đông đảo nhưng Gatsby không có ở đó. Từ trên những bậc thang trên cùng, Jordan không tìm được Gatsby, cũng chẳng thấy and ta ở ngoài hàng hiên. Rồi tình cờ chúng tôi mở thử một cánh cửa trông có vẻ đặc biệt, và sau đó đi vào trong một thư viện kiến trúc theo kiểu Gothic, cao, viền cửa bằng gỗ ốc Anh trạm trổ, có lẽ đã được gỡ ra nguyên miếng từ một di tích nào đó ở nước ngoài.
tr: Baktığımız ilk yer bar oldu. Kalabalıktı ama Gatsby orada değildi. Onu merdivenlerin başında ya da verandada da bulamadı. Şansımızı karşımıza çıkan ihtişamlı kapıda denemeye karar verdik. Kendimizi, oymalarla süslü, İngiliz meşesinden mobilyalarla Gotik tarzda döşenmiş –muhtemelen içindekiler savaş sırasında zarar gören Avrupa’daki bir binadan getirilmişti- bir kütüphanede bulduk.
es: Había mucha gente en el bar, donde miramos primero, pero Gatsby no estaba. Jordan no lo vio desde lo alto de la escalinata, y tampoco estaba en la galería. Abrimos al azar una puerta que parecía importante y entramos en una biblioteca gótica, de techos altos y paredes recubiertas de roble inglés tallado, probablemente transportada completa desde alguna ruina de ultramar.
vi_translation: First, we passed by the bar, which was very crowded, but Gatsby was not there. From the top steps, Jordan couldn't find Gatsby, nor did she see him outside on the porch. Then, by chance, we tried opening a door that looked peculiar, and subsequently entered a Gothic-style library, tall, with door frames made of intricately carved English oak, perhaps taken whole from some relic abroad.
tr_translation: The first place we looked was the bar. It was crowded, but Gatsby wasn't there. We didn't find him at the top of the stairs or on the veranda either. We decided to try our luck at the grand door we came across. We found ourselves in a library decorated in Gothic style with English oak furniture adorned with carvings – likely brought from a building in Europe that was damaged during the war.
es_translation: There were many people in the bar, where we looked first, but Gatsby was not there. Jordan did not see him from the top of the staircase, and he was not in the gallery either. We randomly opened a door that seemed important and entered a Gothic library, with high ceilings and walls covered in carved English oak, probably transported whole from some overseas ruin.

en: A stout, middle-aged man, with enormous owl-eyed spectacles, was sitting somewhat drunk on the edge of a great table, staring with unsteady concentration at the shelves of books. As we entered he wheeled excitedly around and examined Jordan from head to foot.
vi: Một người đàn ông trung niên mập mạp, đeo cặp mắt kiếng to chảng hình dạng mắt cú vọ, đang ngồi với vẻ say rượu trên mép bàn, mắt ngây nhìn những kệ sách. Khi hai chúng tôi bước vào, ông ta xoay tròn người người lại mang vẻ thích thú, mắt nhìn khảo sát Jordan từ đầu tới chân.
tr: Koca, kalın gözlükleriyle orta yaşlı, iri yapılı bir adam bir masanın kenarına oturmuş raflardaki kitaplara bakıyordu. Hafif sarhoştu. Girdiğimizi fark edince heyecanla arkasına dönerek Jordan’ı baştan aşağı süzdü.
es: Un individuo corpulento, de mediana edad, con gafas enormes y ojos de búho, algo borracho, se sentaba en el filo de una mesa grande y, titubeante, se concentraba en mirar los anaqueles de libros. Cuando entramos, giró sobre sí mismo, nervioso, y examinó a Jordan de pies a cabeza.
vi_translation: A chubby middle-aged man, wearing large owl-shaped glasses, was sitting drunkenly on the edge of the table, staring blankly at the bookshelves. When the two of us walked in, he spun around with a look of interest, his eyes scanning Jordan from head to toe.
tr_translation: A large, middle-aged man with thick glasses and a sturdy build was sitting at the edge of a table, looking at the books on the shelves. He was slightly drunk. When he noticed us entering, he turned around excitedly and scrutinized Jordan from head to toe.
es_translation: A corpulent individual, middle-aged, with enormous glasses and owl-like eyes, somewhat drunk, was sitting on the edge of a large table and, hesitantly, was concentrating on looking at the bookshelves. When we entered, he turned around nervously and examined Jordan from head to toe.

en: “What do you think?” he demanded impetuously.
vi: "Hai người nghĩ thế nào?" Ông ta hỏi một cách hăng say.
tr: “Ne düşünüyorsunuz?” diye sordu birden.
es: —¿Qué les parece? —preguntó con verdadero ímpetu. —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "What do you two think?" he asked eagerly.
tr_translation: “What are you thinking?” he suddenly asked.
es_translation: —What do you think? —he asked with genuine fervor.

en: “About what?”
vi: "Về cái gì?"
tr: “Ne hakkında?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "About what?"
tr_translation: “What about?”
es_translation: —What?

en: He waved his hand toward the bookshelves.
vi: Ông ta giơ tay chỉ về những kệ sách.
tr: Eliyle kitap dolu rafları gösterdi.
es: Señaló hacia los libros con la mano.
vi_translation: He raised his hand and pointed to the bookshelves.
tr_translation: He pointed to the shelves full of books with his hand.
es_translation: He pointed towards the books with his hand.

en: “About that. As a matter of fact you needn’t bother to ascertain. I ascertained. They’re real.”
vi: "Về chúng. Sự thật mà nói hai người không cần phải đi tìm hiểu để xác định. Tôi đã làm rồi. Chúng đều là thật."
tr: “Bunlar” dedi, “gerçi bir şey demenize gerek yok. Ben inceledim. Hepsi de hakiki.
es: —Eso. Y no tienen que molestarse en comprobarlo. Lo he comprobado yo. Son de verdad.
vi_translation: "About them. Truth be told, you two don't need to investigate to confirm it. I've already done it. They are all real."
tr_translation: “These,” he said, “although you don't need to say anything. I have examined them. They are all genuine.”
es_translation: —That. And you don't have to bother checking it. I've checked it myself. They are real.

en: “The books?”
vi: "Những quyển sách?"
tr: “Kitaplar mı?
es: —¿Los libros?
vi_translation: "The books?"
tr_translation: “The books?”
es_translation: —The books?

en: He nodded.
vi: Anh ta gật đầu.
tr: Başını salladı.
es: Asintió.
vi_translation: He nodded.
tr_translation: He nodded.
es_translation: He nodded.

en: “Absolutely real—have pages and everything. I thought they’d be a nice durable cardboard. Matter of fact, they’re absolutely real. Pages and—Here! Lemme show you.”
vi: "Hoàn toàn là sách thật, có trang có tờ hẳn hoi và cả mọi thứ. Tôi cứ tưởng chúng là những miếng giấy bìa đẹp loại lâu hư. Thật ra, chúng hoàn toàn là sách thiệt. Có trang và.. Đây này, để tôi chỉ cho hai người coi."
tr: “Bütünüyle gerçek: Sayfaları, yazıları, her şey­leri var. Sadece dayanıklı, süslü karton ciltler olduklarını san­mıştım ama değillermiş. Hepsi hakiki. Durun size göstereyim. Kuşku duyduğumuzdan neredeyse emindi.
es: —Absolutamente de verdad: tienen páginas y todas esas cosas. Pensé que serían de cartón hueco, resistente. Pero son absolutamente de verdad. Páginas y… Fíjense, déjenme que se lo demuestre.
vi_translation: "They are completely real books, with pages and everything. I thought they were just beautiful cardboard pieces that last long. In fact, they are entirely real books. With pages and.. Here, let me show you both."
tr_translation: "Completely real: They have pages, writings, everything. I thought they were just durable, decorative cardboard covers, but they aren't. They are all genuine. Wait, let me show you." He was almost certain that we had doubts.
es_translation: —Absolutely true: they have pages and all those things. I thought they would be hollow, sturdy cardboard. But they are absolutely real. Pages and… Look, let me show you.

en: Taking our scepticism for granted, he rushed to the bookcases and returned with Volume One of the Stoddard Lectures.
vi: Tin chắc rằng chúng tôi vẫn còn nghi ngờ, ông ta bước nhanh đến kệ sách, sau đó quay trở lại với bộ sách số một của "Stoddard Lectures."
tr: Raflara doğru ilerledi Stoddard Lectures kitabın birinci cildi ile geri döndü.
es: Dando por sentado nuestro escepticismo, se precipitó hacia los estantes y volvió con el primer volumen de las Conferencias de Stoddard[10].
vi_translation: Convinced that we were still in doubt, he quickly walked to the bookshelf, then returned with the first volume of "Stoddard Lectures."
tr_translation: He moved towards the shelves and returned with the first volume of the Stoddard Lectures book.
es_translation: Taking our skepticism for granted, he rushed to the shelves and returned with the first volume of Stoddard's Lectures[10].

en: “See!” he cried triumphantly. “It’s a bona-fide piece of printed matter. It fooled me. This fella’s a regular Belasco. It’s a triumph. What thoroughness! What realism! Knew when to stop, too—didn’t cut the pages. But what do you want? What do you expect?”
vi: "Thấy chưa."Ông ta hân hoan thốt lên. "Nó là một bản in thật sự. Nó thật đã làm tôi tưởng lầm. Anh chàng này là đúng là một nhà giàn dựng chuyên nghiệp. Quá hay. Thật là tỷ mỉ. Giống y như thật. Đã vậy còn biết đến chỗ nào thì ngừng lại nữa, không cắt trang. Nhưng ta còn đòi gì nữa? Còn mong gì nữa?"
tr: “Görüyor musunuz!” diye bağırdı muzaffer bir edayla, “İşte hakiki bir kitap. Ne kadar yanılmışım. Bu adam tam bir Belasco!1 Bu büyük bir zafer. Ne zevkli, ne güzel bir seçim! Hem haddini bilip sayfaları da kesip azaltmamış. Daha ne istenir ki? 1 David Belasco (1853 – 1931) Amerikalı Oyun yazarı.
es: —¡Miren! —exclamó triunfalmente—. Es una pieza auténtica de material impreso. Había conseguido engañarme. Este tipo es un verdadero Belasco[11]. ¡Qué triunfo! ¡Qué meticulosidad! ¡Qué realismo! Y también supo dónde pararse: las páginas están sin cortar, sin abrir. ¿Pero qué esperaban ustedes? ¿Qué querían?
vi_translation: "See that." He exclaimed joyfully. "It is a real print. It really fooled me. This guy is truly a professional stage manager. So good. It's so meticulous. Just like the real thing. Moreover, it even knows where to stop, without cutting the page. But what more can I ask for? What more can I hope for?
tr_translation: “Do you see!” he shouted triumphantly, “This is a real book. How wrong I was. This man is a true Belasco! This is a great victory. What a delightful, what a beautiful choice! And he didn't even cut and reduce the pages, knowing his place. What more could one ask for?” 1 David Belasco (1853 – 1931) American playwright.
es_translation: —Look! —he exclaimed triumphantly—. It is an authentic piece of printed material. He had managed to deceive me. This guy is a true Belasco[11]. What a triumph! What meticulousness! What realism! And he also knew where to stop: the pages are uncut, unopened. But what did you expect? What did you want?

en: He snatched the book from me and replaced it hastily on its shelf, muttering that if one brick was removed the whole library was liable to collapse.
vi: Anh ta giật lấy quyển sách từ tay tôi và vội vàng đặt nó lại trên kệ, lẩm bẩm nói rằng nếu một viên gạch bị lấy ra thì nguyên cả cái thư viện sẽ có cơ nguy bị xụp đổ.
tr: Devasa bir kütüphaneye sahipti. ÇN Kitabı elimden kapıp yerine koyarken bir yandan da bir tuğla eksilirse tüm kitaplığın çökeceği gibilerden bir şeyler mırıldanıyordu.
es: Me arrebató el libro y lo devolvió corriendo a su estante, murmurando que si quitáramos un ladrillo toda la biblioteca podría venirse abajo.
vi_translation: He snatched the book from my hand and hurriedly placed it back on the shelf, muttering that if one brick was taken out, the entire library could be at risk of collapsing.
tr_translation: He had a massive library. Translator's Note While snatching the book from my hand and putting it back in its place, he was muttering something about how the entire bookshelf would collapse if a single brick were missing.
es_translation: He snatched the book from me and hurriedly returned it to its shelf, muttering that if we removed one brick, the entire library might collapse.

en: “Who brought you?” he demanded. “Or did you just come? I was brought. Most people were brought.”
vi: "Ai dẫn các người tới đây?" Ông ta hỏi. "Hay các người tự đến? Tôi được người ta dẫn đến đây. Hầu hết những người ở đây là được dẫn lại."
tr: “Sizi kim getirdi?’ diye sordu birden, “Yoksa öylece mi geldiniz? Mesela beni biri getirdi. Buradakilerin çoğu da öyle gelmiştir zaten.
es: —¿Quién les ha traído? —preguntó—. ¿O ustedes han venido por su cuenta? A mí me han traído. A casi todo el mundo lo traen.
vi_translation: "Who brought you here?" he asked. "Or did you come on your own? I was brought here by someone." "Most of the people here were brought."
tr_translation: “Who brought you here?” he suddenly asked, “Or did you just come on your own? For example, someone brought me. Most of the people here came that way too.”
es_translation: —Who brought you here? —he asked—. Or did you come on your own? I was brought here. Almost everyone is brought here.

en: Jordan looked at him alertly, cheerfully, without answering.
vi: Jordan nhìn ông ta một cách sống động tươi vui nhưng không trả lời.
tr: Jordan onu yüzünde gülümseme ile dinliyordu ama ya­nıt vermedi.
es: Jordan lo miraba muy atenta, feliz, sin responder.
vi_translation: Jordan looked at him with a lively, cheerful expression but did not respond.
tr_translation: Jordan was listening to him with a smile on his face but did not respond.
es_translation: Jordan watched him very attentively, happy, without responding.

Multiple_ents: ['claud roosevelt', 'bayan roosevelt', 'roosevelt', 'mistress claud roosevelt', 'bayan claud roosevelt']
en: “I was brought by a woman named Roosevelt,” he continued. “Mrs. Claud Roosevelt. Do you know her? I met her somewhere last night. I’ve been drunk for about a week now, and I thought it might sober me up to sit in a library.”
vi: "Tôi được dẫn đến đây bởi một bà tên Roosevelt." Ông ta tiếp tục. "Bà Claud Roosevelt. Hai người có biết bà ta không? Tôi gặp bà ta ở đâu đó tối qua. Tôi đã say sưa như vầy cả tuần rồi, tôi nghĩ rằng ngồi ở phòng sách sẽ làm cho mình tỉnh rượu lại."
tr: “Beni Bayan Roosevelt getirdi. Bayan Claud Roosevelt. Onu tanır mısınız? Dün gece tanıştık. Bir hafta­dır sarhoş dolaşıyorum da belki bir kütüphanede oturursam ayılırım diye düşündüm.
es: —A mí me ha traído una mujer que se llama Roosevelt —continuó—. Mistress Claud Roosevelt. ¿No la conocen? Yo la conocí anoche, no sé dónde. Llevo casi una semana borracho, y pensé que sentarme un rato en una biblioteca a lo mejor me despejaba.
vi_translation: "I was brought here by a lady named Roosevelt." He continued. "Mrs. Claud Roosevelt. Do you two know her? I met her somewhere last night. I've been drunk like this all week, I thought sitting in the study would sober me up."
tr_translation: “Mrs. Roosevelt brought me. Mrs. Claud Roosevelt. Do you know her? We met last night. I've been wandering around drunk for a week and thought maybe if I sat in a library, I might sober up.”
es_translation: —A woman named Roosevelt brought me here —he continued—. Mistress Claud Roosevelt. Don't you know her? I met her last night, I don't know where. I've been drunk for almost a week, and I thought sitting in a library for a while might clear my head.

en: “Has it?”
vi: "Có không?"
tr: “Ayıldınız mı peki?
es: —¿Ha funcionado?
vi_translation: "Is there?"
tr_translation: “Did you come to your senses?”
es_translation: —Has it worked?

en: “A little bit, I think. I can’t tell yet. I’ve only been here an hour. Did I tell you about the books? They’re real. They’re—”
vi: "Tôi nghĩ cũng đỡ một chút xíu. Cũng chưa biết hẳn, tôi chỉ mới ở đây được một giờ. Tôi đã nói cho hai người nghe về những quyển sách chưa nhỉ. Chúng đều là sách thật. Chúng..."
tr: “Eh, biraz. Yine de pek emin değilim Yani henüz değilim. Çünkü buraya geleli bir saat oldu. Size bu kitaplardan söz ettim mi? Tümü de hakiki kitap. Üstelik-”
es: —Un poco, sí, creo. Todavía es pronto para decirlo. Sólo llevo aquí una hora. ¿Les he dicho lo de los libros? Son de verdad. Son…
vi_translation: "I think it has improved a little bit. It's not certain yet, I've only been here for an hour. I have told you two about the books, haven't I? They are all real books. They...
tr_translation: “Eh, a little. Still, I'm not quite sure. I mean, not yet. Because I've only been here for an hour. Did I tell you about these books? They are all genuine books. Moreover-”
es_translation: —A little, yes, I think. It's still early to say. I've only been here for an hour. Did I tell you about the books? They are real. They are...

en: We shook hands with him gravely and went back outdoors.
vi: "Ông đã nói cho chúng tôi nghe rồi." Tôi và Jordan trang trọng bắt tay ông ta rồi bước ra ngoài.
tr: Ciddiyet içinde elini sıktıktan sonra oradan çıktık.
es: Le estrechamos la mano solemnemente y salimos.
vi_translation: Jordan and I solemnly shook his hand and then stepped outside.
tr_translation: After shaking hands seriously, we left the place.
es_translation: We shook his hand solemnly and left.

en: There was dancing now on the canvas in the garden; old men pushing young girls backward in eternal graceless circles, superior couples holding each other tortuously, fashionably, and keeping in the corners—and a great number of single girls dancing individually or relieving the orchestra for a moment of the burden of the banjo or the traps. By midnight the hilarity had increased. A celebrated tenor had sung in Italian, and a notorious contralto had sung in jazz, and between the numbers people were doing “stunts” all over the garden, while happy, vacuous bursts of laughter rose toward the summer sky. A pair of stage twins, who turned out to be the girls in yellow, did a baby act in costume, and champagne was served in glasses bigger than finger-bowls. The moon had risen higher, and floating in the Sound was a triangle of silver scales, trembling a little to the stiff, tinny drip of the banjoes on the lawn.
vi: Mọi người đang khiêu vũ trên những tấm vải bạt trải trong vườn, mấy ông già đưa đẩy mấy cô gái trẻ ngược chiều trong những vòng quay tròn vô duyên trơ tráo không dứt. Những cặp khá hơn thì tránh vào trong những góc dìu nhau uốn nhảy đúng kiểu đúng mốt. Một số lớn các cô gái còn độc thân thì chỉ nhảy riêng rẻ một mình, hoặc ra đỡ cho băng nhạc được nghỉ trong chốc lát bằng cách thay họ đánh đàn banjo hay đánh trống. Đến khoảng nửa đêm sự náo nhiệt càng tăng lên. Một nam ca sĩ lừng danh cất giọng cao hát bài nhạc bằng tiếng Ý, một nữ ca sĩ có tiếng tăm với giọng trầm thì hát nhạc Jazz. Xen giữa các tiết mục là những màn biểu diễn nhào lộn ở khắp nơi trong vườn trong khi sự vui vẻ và những tiềng cười ngây dại tiếp tục vang lừng khắp bầu trời mùa hạ. Một cặp diễn viên song sinh, hóa ra là hai cô áo vàng lúc nẫy, biểu diễn một màn trẻ con hóa trang. Rượu Champage giờ đây đã được đưa ra mời từ những chiếc ly miệng bè như cái chén rửa tay. Mặt trăng đã lên cao hơn. Chùm sao Thiên Xứng hình tam giác màu bạc nằm trôi lơ lửng trên mặt nước ngoài eo biển, nhẹ nhàng run rẩy theo tiếng nhạc thánh thót mỏng manh rỉ rả vọng ra từ những chiếc đàn banjo trong vườn.
tr: Bahçede, branda bezinin üzerinde dans etme faslı başlamıştı. Yaşlı baylar kaba saba figürlerle genç kızları ileri geri çekiştirip daireler çizerken, uyumlu çiftler moda hareketlerle eğilip bükülüyor, bezin dışına çıkmamaya çalışıyorlardı. Çok sayıda genç kadın yalnız dans ediyor ya da bazen orkestradakilerin banjo veya davullarını devralarak onların dinlenmesini sağlıyordu. Gece yarısına doğru eğlence doruktayken ünlü bir tenor İtalyanca bir konser verdi, kötü şöhretli bir kontralto ise caz parçaları söyledi. İki konser arasında neşeli, boş kahkahalar yaz gecesinde havada çınlarken bahçenin dört bir yanı marifetlerini sergilemek isteyenlerle doluydu. İkiz bebek kılığına gir­miş iki kız -sonradan bizim sarı elbiseliler olduklarını anladım- kendi gösterilerini sundular. Kase büyüklüğündeki kadehlerde şampanyalar ikram ediliyordu. Ay iyice yükselmişti. Boğaz’da yüzen üçgen şekilli, gümüş pullar bahçede çalan banjonun sert, tenekemsi sesiyle titreşiyordu.
es: Ahora bailaban en la pista del jardín: viejos que empujaban a las chicas en desangelados círculos eternos, parejas de clase alta que se abrazaban tortuosamente, a la moda, sin salir nunca de los rincones, y muchas chicas que bailaban solas y de vez en cuando relevaban al banjo o al percusionista de la orquesta. A medianoche había aumentado la alegría. Un famoso tenor cantó en italiano, una contralto muy conocida cantó jazz, y entre número y número la gente montaba su propio espectáculo sensacional en cualquier sitio del jardín, mientras estallaban las risas y, vacías y felices, subían al cielo de verano. Dos actrices gemelas, que resultaron ser las chicas de amarillo, se disfrazaron de niñas para su actuación, y el champagne fue servido en copas más grandes que lavafrutas. La luna estaba más alta y sobre el estrecho flotaba un triángulo de escamas de plata, que temblaba ligeramente con el repiqueteo seco y metálico de los banjos en el jardín.
vi_translation: Everyone was dancing on the tarps spread out in the garden, the old men were pushing the young girls in the opposite direction in endless, shameless, awkward spins. The better couples moved into the corners, guiding each other in stylish, proper dances. A large number of single girls danced alone or took over for the band, giving them a short break by playing the banjo or drums. Around midnight, the excitement increased. A The renowned singer raised his high voice to sing a song in Italian, while a famous female singer with a deep voice sang Jazz music. Interspersed between the acts were acrobatic performances all over the garden, while joy and wild laughter continued to echo throughout the summer sky. A pair of twin actors, who turned out to be the two girls in yellow from earlier, performed a children's costume act. Champagne was now being served from wide-mouthed glasses resembling hand-washing bowls. The moon had risen higher. The silver triangular constellation of Libra floated above the water off the coast, gently trembling to the delicate, thin strains of music emanating from the banjos in the garden.
tr_translation: The dancing session on the canvas tarp in the garden had begun. While the elderly gentlemen were pulling and pushing the young girls with rough movements and drawing circles, the harmonious couples were bending and twisting with fashionable moves, trying not to step outside the tarp. Many young women were dancing alone or occasionally taking over the banjos or drums from the orchestra members to let them rest. As the entertainment peaked around midnight, a famous tenor gave a concert in Italian, and a notorious contralto sang jazz pieces. Between the two concerts, cheerful, empty laughter echoed in the night air, and the garden was filled with people eager to showcase their talents. Two girls dressed as twin babies - I later realized they were our friends in yellow dresses - performed their own show. Champagne was being served in bowl-sized glasses. The moon had risen high. The triangular, silver scales floating on the Bosphorus shimmered with the sharp, tinny sound of the banjo playing in the garden.
es_translation: Now they danced on the garden floor: old men who pushed the girls in desolate eternal circles, high-class couples who embraced tortuously, fashionably, never leaving the corners, and many girls who danced alone and occasionally took over for the banjo or the percussionist of the orchestra. At midnight the joy had increased. A famous tenor sang in Italian, a well-known contralto sang jazz, and between numbers people put on their own sensational show anywhere in the garden, while laughter burst out and, empty and happy, rose to the summer sky. Two twin actresses, who turned out to be the girls in yellow, dressed up as little girls for their performance, and champagne was served in glasses larger than fruit bowls. The moon was higher and over the strait floated a triangle of silver scales, which trembled slightly with the dry and metallic tapping of the banjos in the garden.

en: I was still with Jordan Baker. We were sitting at a table with a man of about my age and a rowdy little girl, who gave way upon the slightest provocation to uncontrollable laughter. I was enjoying myself now. I had taken two finger-bowls of champagne, and the scene had changed before my eyes into something significant, elemental, and profound.
vi: Lúc đó tôi vẫn ở bên cạnh Jordan Baker. Chúng tôi ngồi chung bàn với một người đàn ông vào khoảng tuồi tôi và một cô gái nhỏ huyên náo ồn ào hễ có gì chút xíu cũng cười ngặt ngẽo. Tôi bây giờ mới cảm thấy được thoải mái. Tôi uống hai ly rượu champagne to bằng hai cái tô, chúng khiến cảnh vật trước mắt tôi đổi sang thành những cảnh có ý nghĩa, có căn bản và thâm thúy sâu sắc hơn.
tr: Hala Jordan Baker ile birlikteydim. Ben yaşlarda bir adam ve kabadayı tavırlı ufak tefek bir kızla aynı masadaydık. Kız her fırsatını bulduğunda delice kahkahalar atıyordu. Artık biraz eğlenmeye başlamıştım. İki kadeh şampanya içtiğimden gördüklerim anlamlı, gerekli ve derin geliyordu.
es: Yo seguía con Jordan Baker. Estábamos en una mesa con un hombre más o menos de mi edad y una chiquilla que armaba mucho ruido y a la menor provocación daba rienda suelta a unas carcajadas incontrolables. Me divertía. Me había bebido dos lavafrutas de champagne y la escena se había convertido ante mis ojos en algo importante, elemental y profundo.
vi_translation: At that time, I was still beside Jordan Baker. We were sitting at the same table with a man around my age and a small, noisy girl who would burst into laughter at the slightest thing. Now I finally felt comfortable. I drank two large glasses of champagne, each as big as a bowl, and they made the scenes before my eyes transform into ones that were more meaningful, fundamental, and profoundly deep.
tr_translation: I was with Hala Jordan Baker. We were at the same table with a man around my age and a petite girl with a tough demeanor. The girl was laughing wildly at every opportunity she got. I had started to have a bit of fun. Since I had drunk two glasses of champagne, what I saw seemed meaningful, necessary, and profound.
es_translation: I was still with Jordan Baker. We were at a table with a man roughly my age and a girl who made a lot of noise and at the slightest provocation would burst into uncontrollable laughter. I was amused. I had drunk two champagne cocktails and the scene had transformed before my eyes into something significant, elemental, and profound.

en: At a lull in the entertainment the man looked at me and smiled.
vi: Khi cuộc vui đã lắng xuống, người đàn ông nhìn tôi mỉm cười.
tr: Eğlencenin durduğu bir anda bana birinin gülümsediğini gördüm.
es: En un momento de respiro en la fiesta el hombre me miró y sonrió.
vi_translation: When the fun had died down, the man looked at me and smiled.
tr_translation: At a moment when the fun had stopped, I saw someone smiling at me.
es_translation: In a moment of respite at the party, the man looked at me and smiled.

en: “Your face is familiar,” he said politely. “Weren’t you in the First Division during the war?”
vi: Anh ta nói một cách lịch sự. "Anh trông quen quá. Có phải anh đã từng ở trong sư đoàn ba trong thời gian chiến tranh?"
tr: “Yüzünüz hiç yabancı gelmiyor” dedi kibarca, “savaşta birinci tümende miydiniz?
es: —Su cara me resulta familiar —dijo, muy educado—. ¿No estuvo en la Tercera División durante la guerra?
vi_translation: He spoke politely. "You look familiar. Were you in the third division during the war?"
tr_translation: “Your face doesn't look unfamiliar at all,” he said politely, “were you in the first division during the war?”
es_translation: —Your face looks familiar to me —he said, very politely—. Weren't you in the Third Division during the war?

en: “Why yes. I was in the Twenty-eighth Infantry.”
vi: "Đúng vây. Tôi đã từng ở trong tiểu đoàn chín súng trường."
tr: “Evet. Yirmi sekizinci piyade alayı.
es: —Sí, sí. Estuve en el Veintiocho de Infantería.
vi_translation: "That's right." "I used to be in the Ninth Rifle Battalion."
tr_translation: “Yes. The twenty-eighth infantry regiment.”
es_translation: —Yes, yes. I was in the Twenty-Eighth Infantry.

en: “I was in the Sixteenth until June nineteen-eighteen. I knew I’d seen you somewhere before.”
vi: "Còn tôi thì ở sư đoàn bẩy bộ binh cho tới tháng Sáu năm 1918. Tôi biết ngay tôi đã gặp anh ở đâu."
tr: “1918 Haziranı’na kadar on altıncı alaydaydım. Sizi daha önce gördüğümden emindim.
es: —Yo estuve en el Dieciséis hasta junio del año 18. Sabía que te había visto en alguna parte.
vi_translation: "As for me, I was with the seventh infantry division until June 1918. I knew right away where I had met you."
tr_translation: “I was in the sixteenth regiment until June 1918. I was sure I had seen you before.”
es_translation: —I was in the Sixteenth until June of the year '18. I knew I had seen you somewhere.

en: We talked for a moment about some wet, grey little villages in France. Evidently he lived in this vicinity, for he told me that he had just bought a hydroplane, and was going to try it out in the morning.
vi: Chúng tôi trò chuyện một chốc lát nhắc về những ngôi làng ẩm ướt xám xịt ở Pháp. Hiển nhiên anh ta đang sinh sống ở chung quanh đây bởi vì anh ta kể cho tôi nghe anh mới mua hai chiếc thủy phi cơ và sẽ mang chúng ra bay thử vào buổi sáng.
tr: Kısa bir süre Fransa’nın gri, yağmurlu ve küçük köyle­rinden söz ettik. Buralarda oturduğunu an­lamıştım. Çünkü bir deniz uçağı aldığını ve yarın sabah deneyeceğini söylemişti.
es: Charlamos un rato de las aldeas húmedas y grises de Francia. Evidentemente vivía en el vecindario, porque me dijo que acababa de comprarse un hidroplano y que iba a probarlo por la mañana.
vi_translation: We chatted for a while, reminiscing about the damp, gray villages in France. Obviously, he is living around here because he told me that he just bought two seaplanes and will take them out for a test flight in the morning.
tr_translation: We talked briefly about France's gray, rainy, and small villages. I had understood that he lived there. Because he had said that he bought a seaplane and would try it out tomorrow morning.
es_translation: We chatted for a while about the damp and gray villages of France. Evidently, he lived in the neighborhood because he told me that he had just bought a hydroplane and was going to test it in the morning.

en: “Want to go with me, old sport? Just near the shore along the Sound.”
vi: "Anh có muốn đi với tôi không anh bạn già. Gần ngay bãi biển dọc theo eo biển."
tr: “Benimle gelmek ister misin ahbap? Boğazda bir gezinti yaparız.
es: —¿Vienes conmigo, compañero? Sólo en la orilla, por el estrecho.
vi_translation: "Do you want to go with me, old friend?" "It's right near the beach along the strait."
tr_translation: "Would you like to come with me, buddy? We can take a stroll by the Bosphorus."
es_translation: —Are you coming with me, buddy? Only to the shore, through the strait.

en: “What time?”
vi: "Mấy giờ?"
tr: “Kaçta?
es: —¿A qué hora?
vi_translation: "What time is it?"
tr_translation: "What time?""
es_translation: —What time?

en: “Any time that suits you best.”
vi: "Bất cứ giờ nào miễn sao tiện cho anh."
tr: “Sana en uygun saatte.
es: —A la que prefieras.
vi_translation: "Any time that is convenient for you."
tr_translation: "At the time that suits you best.""
es_translation: —Whichever one you prefer.

en: It was on the tip of my tongue to ask his name when Jordan looked around and smiled.
vi: Tôi sắp sửa buột miệng lên hỏi tên của anh ta thì Jordan nhìn chung quanh, mỉm cười hỏi tôi.
tr: Tam adını sormak üzereyken Jordan bana bakarak gülümsedi.
es: Iba a preguntarle su nombre, tenía la pregunta en la punta de la lengua, cuando Jordan miró a su alrededor y sonrió.
vi_translation: I was about to blurt out and ask his name when Jordan looked around and smiled, asking me.
tr_translation: Just as I was about to ask for his full name, Jordan looked at me and smiled.
es_translation: I was about to ask her name, I had the question on the tip of my tongue, when Jordan looked around and smiled.

en: “Having a gay time now?” she inquired.
vi: "Bây giờ đã vui hơn rồi phải không?"
tr: “Bakıyorum artık eğleniyorsun” dedi.
es: —¿Te lo pasas bien por fin?
vi_translation: "It's more fun now, isn't it?" "Feeling better now."
tr_translation: “I see you are having fun now,” he said.
es_translation: —Are you finally having a good time?

en: “Much better.” I turned again to my new acquaintance. “This is an unusual party for me. I haven’t even seen the host. I live over there—” I waved my hand at the invisible hedge in the distance, “and this man Gatsby sent over his chauffeur with an invitation.”
vi: "Đỡ hơn rồi." Trả lời xong tôi quay sang người mới quen lần nữa. "Bữa tiệc ở đây hơi lạ lùng đối với tôi. Tôi chưa được gặp chủ nhà.
tr: “Hem de çok. ” Sonra yeni arkadaşıma döndüm. “Benim adıma sıradışı bir parti. Daha davet sahibini bile görmedim. Aslında evim de şurası” diyerek karanlıkta pek se­çilmeyen az ötedeki çiti gösterdim. “Gatsby denen adam şoförüyle bir davetiye göndermiş.
es: —Mucho mejor —me volví otra vez a mi nuevo amigo—. Esta fiesta me parece rarísima. Ni siquiera he visto al anfitrión. Yo vivo ahí —moví la mano hacia el seto, invisible en la distancia—, y ese Gatsby me mandó una invitación con el chófer.
vi_translation: After replying, I turned to the new acquaintance again. "The party here is a bit strange for me. I haven't met the host yet. I live in the house over there." I gestured towards the barely visible fence in the distance. "Then this guy Gatsby had his driver send me an invitation."
tr_translation: “Quite a lot, actually. ” Then I turned to my new friend. “An extraordinary party for me. I haven't even seen the host yet. Actually, my house is right over there,” I said, pointing to the barely visible fence in the dark. “A man named Gatsby sent an invitation with his chauffeur.”
es_translation: —Much better —I turned again to my new friend—. This party seems very strange to me. I haven't even seen the host. I live over there —I waved my hand towards the hedge, invisible in the distance—, and that Gatsby sent me an invitation with the chauffeur.

en: “I’m Gatsby,” he said suddenly.
vi: "Tôi là Gatsby." Anh ta đột nhiên nói.
tr: Bir an hiçbir şey anlamamış gibi yüzüme baktı, sonra birden, “Gatsby benim” dedi.
es: —Gatsby soy yo —dijo de pronto.
vi_translation: "I am Gatsby." He suddenly said.
tr_translation: For a moment, he looked at me as if he didn't understand anything, then suddenly said, "I am Gatsby."
es_translation: —I am Gatsby —he said suddenly.

en: “What!” I exclaimed. “Oh, I beg your pardon.”
vi: "Thật sao!" Tôi sửng sốt "Tôi thật tình xin lỗi."
tr: “Ne?” diye bağırdım, “çok özür dilerim.
es: —Perdona —exclamé—. Te ruego que me perdones.
vi_translation: "Really!" I was astonished. "I truly apologize."
tr_translation: “What?” I shouted, “I am very sorry.”
es_translation: —Sorry —I exclaimed—. I beg you to forgive me.

en: “I thought you knew, old sport. I’m afraid I’m not a very good host.”
vi: "Tôi tưởng anh đã biết, anh bạn già. Đáng tiếc tôi đã không làm một chủ nhà tốt."
tr: “Biliyorsun sanıyordum ahbap. Korkarım pek de iyi bir ev sa­hibi değilim.
es: —Pensaba que lo sabías, compañero. Creo que no soy un buen anfitrión.
vi_translation: "I thought you already knew, old friend. Unfortunately, I have not been a good host."
tr_translation: “I thought you knew, buddy. I'm afraid I'm not a very good host.”
es_translation: —I thought you knew, buddy. I think I'm not a good host.

en: He smiled understandingly—much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced—or seemed to face—the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favour. It understood you just so far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey. Precisely at that point it vanished—and I was looking at an elegant young roughneck, a year or two over thirty, whose elaborate formality of speech just missed being absurd. Some time before he introduced himself I’d got a strong impression that he was picking his words with care.
vi: Gatsby mỉm cười một cách thông cảm, thật ra còn nhiều hơn thông cảm nữa. Nó là một trong những nụ cười hiếm hoi có khả năng làm cho ta mãi mãi cảm thấy yên tâm, một nụ cười mà ta chỉ có thể gặp qua bốn năm lần trong đời. Nó được đối diện, hay dường như đang đối diện, với toàn bộ cái thế giới bên ngoài trong một khoảng khắc, sau đó quay sang chú tâm tới chúng ta với chủ quan không cưỡng bức có lợi cho ta. Nó hiểu thấu chúng ta đúng như ta muốn được hiểu thấu, tin tưởng vào ta như ta muốn tin tưởng vào chính mình, và nó đảm bảo với ta rằng ấn tượng của nó đối với ta sẽ đúng như những gì ta mong muốn người khác nghĩ về ta. Ngay đúng vào cái thời điểm đó thì nụ cười biến mất và tôi đang nhìn trước mặt mình một tên lưu manh trẻ tuổi thanh lịch, ba mươi mốt hay ba mươi hai tuổi gì đó, cách nói trang trọng màu mè gần như ngớ ngẩn đến lố bịch. Trước lúc Gatsby tự giới thiệu tên mình, tôi có một cảm tường mạnh mẽ rằng những lời lẽ anh ta nói ra đều được cẩn thận lựa chọn.
tr: Dudaklarında anladığını belli eden samimi bir gülücük dolaştı. Aslında anlayışlı olmaktan öte bir gülüştü. Hayatta dört ya da beş kez görebileceğiniz ender gülüşlerden biri. Karşısındakini sonsuza dek rahatlatabilirdi. Bir an sonsuzlukla yüz yüze gelmiş ve tüm gördükleri içinde sizi seçip, size yönelmiş duygusu veriyordu insana. Sizi, istediğiniz ölçüde anlayan, size kendiniz kadar inanan ve karşınızdakine en iyi halinizle göründüğünüzü kabul eden bir gülüş! Ben bunları düşünürken gülümseme yok oldu. Otuzlu yaşlarda, şık giyimli, genç görü­nüşlü bir adam duruyordu karşımda. Konuşması fazla gösterişli hatta abartılıydı. Kendini tanıtmadan önce, sözcüklerini özenle seçtiği izlenimi bırakıyordu.
es: Me miró con comprensión, mucho más que con comprensión. Era una de esas raras sonrisas capaces de tranquilizarnos para toda la eternidad, que sólo encontramos cuatro o cinco veces en la vida. Aquella sonrisa se ofrecía —o parecía ofrecerse— al mundo entero y eterno, para luego concentrarse en ti, exclusivamente en ti, con una irresistible predisposición a tu favor. Te entendía hasta donde querías ser entendido, creía en ti como tú quisieras creer en ti mismo, y te garantizaba que la impresión que tenía de ti era la que, en tus mejores momentos, esperabas producir. Y entonces la sonrisa se desvaneció, y yo miraba a un matón joven y elegante, uno o dos años por encima de los treinta, con un modo de hablar tan ceremonioso y afectado que rozaba el absurdo. Ya antes de que se presentara, me había dado la sensación de que elegía las palabras con cuidado.
vi_translation: Gatsby smiled sympathetically, in fact, it was more than just sympathy. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced—or seemed to face—the whole external world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey. Precisely at that point, the smile vanished—and I was looking at an elegant young rough-neck, a year or two over thirty, whose elaborate formality of speech just missed being absurd. Before he introduced himself, I’d got a strong impression that he was picking his words with care.
tr_translation: A sincere smile that indicated understanding played on his lips. In fact, it was more than just an understanding smile. It was one of those rare smiles you might see four or five times in your life. It could comfort the person in front of him forever. For a moment, it gave the feeling of having faced eternity and, among all it saw, choosing you and turning towards you. A smile that understands you as much as you want, believes in you as much as you do, and accepts that you appear to others in your best form! While I was thinking about these, the smile disappeared. A man in his thirties, stylishly dressed, and youthful-looking was standing in front of me. His speech was overly showy, even exaggerated. Before introducing himself, he gave the impression that he chose his words carefully.
es_translation: He looked at me with understanding, much more than with understanding. It was one of those rare smiles capable of calming us for all eternity, which we only encounter four or five times in life. That smile was offered —or seemed to be offered— to the entire and eternal world, only to then focus on you, exclusively on you, with an irresistible predisposition in your favor. He understood you as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you wanted to believe in yourself, and guaranteed that the impression he had of you was the one that, in your best moments, you hoped to produce. And then the smile vanished, and I was looking at a young and elegant thug, one or two years over thirty, with a way of speaking so ceremonious and affected that it bordered on the absurd. Even before he introduced himself, I had the feeling that he chose his words carefully.

en: Almost at the moment when Mr. Gatsby identified himself a butler hurried toward him with the information that Chicago was calling him on the wire. He excused himself with a small bow that included each of us in turn.
vi: Ngay sau khi Gatsby xác nhận danh tánh của mình, người quản gia đến bên anh vội vã, thông báo rằng có điện thoại gọi từ Chicago. Gatsby cáo lỗi bằng cái nghiêng đầu nhẹ tới từng người chúng tôi.
tr: Bay Gatsby kendini tanıtırken kahyası telaşla yanına ge­lerek Chicago’dan arandığını söyledi. Hepimizi ufak bir baş ha­reketiyle tek tek selamlayarak yanımızdan ayrılırken, “Bir şey gerekirse hemen haber ver ahbap” diye tembihledi, “özür dilerim, az sonra yeniden size katılırım.
es: Casi en el mismo instante en que Gatsby se identificaba, el mayordomo se le acercó corriendo para decirle que tenía una llamada de Chicago. Se disculpó con una ligera inclinación ante cada uno de nosotros.
vi_translation: As soon as Gatsby confirmed his identity, the butler hurried to his side, informing him that there was a phone call from Chicago. Gatsby excused himself with a slight nod to each of us.
tr_translation: While Mr. Gatsby was introducing himself, his butler hurriedly came up to him and said that he was being called from Chicago. As he left us, greeting each of us with a slight nod, he instructed, "If you need anything, let me know, buddy," and added, "I apologize, I will join you again shortly."
es_translation: Almost at the same moment that Gatsby identified himself, the butler came running up to tell him that he had a call from Chicago. He excused himself with a slight bow to each of us.

en: When he was gone I turned immediately to Jordan—constrained to assure her of my surprise. I had expected that Mr. Gatsby would be a florid and corpulent person in his middle years.
vi: Sau khi Gatsby đã đi rồi, tôi lập tức quay sang Jordan, kìm hãm không nói về sự ngạc nhiên của tôi. Tôi đã tưởng Gatsby là một người hồng hào to béo đang ở tuổi trung niên.
tr: O gider gitmez hemen Jordan’a döndüm. Ne denli şaşkın olduğumu açıklamam gerektiğini düşündüm. Bay Gatsby’nin orta yaşlı, kırmızı yüzlü, tıknaz biri olduğunu sanıyordum nedense.
es: En cuanto se fue, me volví a Jordan, porque necesitaba comentarle mi sorpresa. Me esperaba que mister Gatsby fuera un señor de mediana edad, gordo y colorado.
vi_translation: After Gatsby had left, I immediately turned to Jordan, restraining myself from speaking about my surprise. I had thought Gatsby was a rosy, stout man in his middle age.
tr_translation: As soon as he left, I immediately turned to Jordan. I thought I needed to explain how astonished I was. For some reason, I had thought Mr. Gatsby was a middle-aged, red-faced, stout man.
es_translation: As soon as he left, I turned to Jordan because I needed to share my surprise with her. I expected Mr. Gatsby to be a middle-aged man, fat and ruddy.

en: “Who is he?” I demanded. “Do you know?”
vi: "Anh ta là ai vậy? Cô biết không?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “Kim bu adam? Sen tanıyor musun?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Quién es? —pregunté—. ¿Lo sabes?
vi_translation: "Who is he?" "Do you know?" I asked.
tr_translation: "Who is this man?" "Do you know him?" I asked.
es_translation: —Who is it? —I asked—. Do you know?

en: “He’s just a man named Gatsby.”
vi: "Anh ta chỉ là người tên Gatsby."
tr: “Gatsby diye biri işte.
es: —Sólo es uno que se llama Gatsby.
vi_translation: "He is just a man named Gatsby."
tr_translation: “That's someone called Gatsby.”
es_translation: —It's just someone named Gatsby.

en: “Where is he from, I mean? And what does he do?”
vi: "Ý tôi hỏi anh ta từ đâu tới? Anh ta làm gì?"
tr: “Nereli olduğunu kastettim? Ve ne iş yapar?
es: —Sí, pero ¿de dónde es? ¿A qué se dedica?
vi_translation: "I asked him where he was from? What did he do?"
tr_translation: “Where is he from? And what does he do?”
es_translation: —Yes, but where is he from? What does he do?

en: “Now you’re started on the subject,” she answered with a wan smile. “Well, he told me once he was an Oxford man.”
vi: "Bây giờ thì chính anh là người mở đề trước." Jordan trả lời với một nụ cười mệt mỏi. "Có một lần anh ta kể cho tôi nghe anh đã từng học ở Oxford." Một quá khứ lờ mờ không rõ ràng đang bắt đầu có được hình ảnh rõ ràng phía sau Gatsby, thế nhưng câu nói kế tiếp của Jordan lại làm cho nó mờ dần đi.
tr: “Şimdi de sen kendini kaptırdın bakıyorum” dedi belli belirsiz bir gülümseyişle, “bir keresinde bana Oxford’da okuduğunu söylemişti.
es: —A ti también te ha dado ya por el asunto —contestó con una sonrisa desvaída—. Bueno, un día me dijo que había estudiado en Oxford.
vi_translation: "Now it's you who starts the conversation first." Jordan replied with a weary smile. "Once he told me he had studied at Oxford."
tr_translation: "Now, I see that you have also gotten carried away," he said with a faint smile, "once he told me that he studied at Oxford."
es_translation: —You have also gotten into the matter —he replied with a faint smile—. Well, one day he told me that he had studied at Oxford.

en: “However, I don’t believe it.”
vi: "Tuy nhiên tôi không tin."
tr: “Ama ben pek inanmadım.
es: —Pero no me lo creo.
vi_translation: "However, I do not believe."
tr_translation: "But I didn't quite believe it."
es_translation: —But I don't believe it.

en: “Why not?”
vi: "Tại sao?"
tr: “Neden?
es: —¿Por qué no?
vi_translation: "Why?" "I don't know."
tr_translation: “Why?”
es_translation: —Why not?

en: “I don’t know,” she insisted, “I just don’t think he went there.”
vi: "Tôi không biết." Jordan quả quyết. "Nhưng tôi không nghĩ anh ta đã từng học ở đó."
tr: “Bilmiyorum” dedi kararlı bir sesle, “orada okuduğuna inanmıyorum işte.
es: —No lo sé —insistió—. Pero no me creo que fuera a Oxford.
vi_translation: Jordan asserted. "But I don't think he ever studied there."
tr_translation: “I don't know,” he said with a determined voice, “I just don't believe what you read there.”
es_translation: —I don't know —he insisted—. But I don't believe he went to Oxford.

en: Something in her tone reminded me of the other girl’s “I think he killed a man,” and had the effect of stimulating my curiosity. I would have accepted without question the information that Gatsby sprang from the swamps of Louisiana or from the lower East Side of New York. That was comprehensible. But young men didn’t—at least in my provincial inexperience I believed they didn’t—drift coolly out of nowhere and buy a palace on Long Island Sound.
vi: Có cái gì đó trong giọng nói của Jordan khiến tôi nghĩ tới câu "Tôi nghĩ anh ta đã giết người" của cô gái lúc nãy và nó đã kích thích trí tò mò của tôi. Có lẽ tôi đã chấp nhận không chút nghi ngờ gì nếu như nghe ai nói Gatsby xuất thân từ những vùng đầm lầy Louisiana hay vùng bình dân East Side của New York. Như vậy có lẽ dễ hiểu hơn. Chuyện những thanh niên trẻ không biết phiêu lãng từ đâu đến để mua một lâu đài trên eo biển Long Island thì không thể có, ít nhất theo như kinh nghiệm tỉnh lẻ kém từng trải của mình tôi nghĩ họ sẽ không làm như vậy.
tr: Bunu söylerken ses tonundaki bir şey bana diğer kızın ‘birini öldürmüş’ deyişini hatırlatmıştı. Bu ise merakımı büsbütün artırmıştı. Hiç düşünmeden, Gatsby’nin Louisiana bataklıklarından ya da New York’un doğusundaki varoşlardan çıktığını söyleyebilirdim. Ama ne idüğü belirsiz bir genç aniden ortaya çıkıp Long Island Boğazı gibi bir yerde bir malikane satın alamazdı. En azından benim gibi, insanları pek de iyi tanımayan, tecrübesiz bir taşralı için buna inanmak zordu.
es: Algo en su tono me recordó a la otra chica, «Creo que mató a un hombre», y tuvo el efecto de estimular mi curiosidad. Hubiera aceptado sin problemas la información de que Gatsby había surgido de los pantanos de Louisiana o del East Side de Nueva York. Eso era comprensible. Pero —por lo que mi experiencia provinciana me permitía suponer— un hombre joven no sale de la nada con toda tranquilidad y se compra un palacio en Long Island.
vi_translation: There was something in Jordan's voice that made me think of the girl's earlier statement, "I think he killed someone," and it piqued my curiosity. Perhaps I would have accepted without a doubt if I had heard someone say Gatsby came from the swamps of Louisiana or the working-class East Side of New York. That would have been more understandable. The idea of young men drifting in from who knows where to buy a castle on the Long Island Sound seemed impossible, at least according to my provincial and inexperienced perspective; I didn't think they would do such a thing.
tr_translation: When she said this, something in her tone reminded me of the other girl saying 'he had killed someone.' This, however, had completely piqued my curiosity. Without thinking, I could have said that Gatsby had emerged from the swamps of Louisiana or the suburbs east of New York. But an obscure young man could not suddenly appear and buy a mansion in a place like Long Island Sound. At least for someone like me, an inexperienced provincial who doesn't know people very well, it was hard to believe this.
es_translation: Something in her tone reminded me of the other girl, "I think he killed a man," and it had the effect of piquing my curiosity. I would have easily accepted the information that Gatsby had emerged from the swamps of Louisiana or the East Side of New York. That was understandable. But —as far as my provincial experience allowed me to suppose— a young man does not calmly come out of nowhere and buy a palace in Long Island.

en: “Anyhow, he gives large parties,” said Jordan, changing the subject with an urban distaste for the concrete. “And I like large parties. They’re so intimate. At small parties there isn’t any privacy.”
vi: "Dù sao, anh ta thường tổ chức những bữa tiệc lớn." Jordan nói, thay đổi đề tài với một thái độ dân thành thị không ưa những chuyện cụ thể. "Tôi thích những bữa tiệc lớn. Ở đó mình được kín đáo không ai để ý. Còn ở những bữa tiêc nhỏ thì không được riêng tư."
tr: “Neyse ne işte, böyle büyük partiler veren biri” dedi Jordan somutluktan hoşlanmayan medenilerin o gamsızlığıyla konuyu değiştirirken, “ben de o büyük partileri çok severim. Çok da samimi bulurum. Küçük davetlerde rahat olamazsın, herkesin gözü üzerindedir.
es: —El caso es que da fiestas muy concurridas —dijo Jordan, cambiando de tema con un educado fastidio ante lo concreto—. Y a mí me gustan las fiestas con mucha gente. Son muy íntimas. En las fiestas con poca gente la intimidad es nula.
vi_translation: "Anyway, he often throws big parties." Jordan said, changing the subject with a city dweller's distaste for specifics. "I like big parties. At those, you can be discreet and no one pays attention. But at small parties, you don't get any privacy."
tr_translation: “Anyway, someone who throws such big parties,” said Jordan, changing the subject with the nonchalance of those civilized people who dislike concreteness, “I also love those big parties. I find them very sincere. You can't be comfortable at small gatherings; everyone's eyes are on you.”
