es_translation: —The thing is, he throws very crowded parties —said Jordan, changing the subject with a polite annoyance at the specifics—. And I like parties with lots of people. They are very intimate. At parties with few people, intimacy is nonexistent.

en: There was the boom of a bass drum, and the voice of the orchestra leader rang out suddenly above the echolalia of the garden.
vi: Một hồi trống ùm ùm đánh lên, giọng của người điều khiển giàn nhạc đột nhiên vang lên dội đi khắp khu vườn.
tr: Birden beş davulun birden çıkardığı gürültü duyuldu. Orkestra şefinin sesi bahçedeki sohbetleri aşarak ortalıkta çınladı.
es: Retumbó el bombo, y la voz del director de orquesta se elevó de pronto entre la ecolalia del jardín.
vi_translation: A drum roll thundered, and the voice of the orchestra conductor suddenly echoed throughout the garden.
tr_translation: The noise of five drums being played at once was suddenly heard. The voice of the orchestra conductor rang out, surpassing the conversations in the garden.
es_translation: The drum boomed, and the voice of the orchestra conductor suddenly rose among the echolalia of the garden.

en: “Ladies and gentlemen,” he cried. “At the request of Mr. Gatsby we are going to play for you Mr. Vladmir Tostoff’s latest work, which attracted so much attention at Carnegie Hall last May. If you read the papers you know there was a big sensation.” He smiled with jovial condescension, and added: “Some sensation!” Whereupon everybody laughed.
vi: "Kính thưa quý vị quan khách." Anh ta lớn tiếng. "Thể theo lời yêu cầu của ngài Gatsby chúng tôi sẽ trình diễn tác phẩm mới nhất của Vladimir Tostoff, tác phẩm này đã thu hút được rất nhiều chú ý tại thính đường Carnegie tháng Năm vừa qua. Nếu quý vị đã đọc qua báo chí, quý vị hẳn đã biết nó là một tin giật gân lớn." Anh ta mỉm cười một cách nhã nhặn vui vẻ, nói thêm "một giật gân ra trò". Mọi người ồ lên cười.
tr: “Bayanlar baylar” diye bağırdı. “Bay Gatsby’nin isteği üzerine sizlere mayıs ayında Carnegie Hall’da büyük ilgi gören Bay Vladmir Tostoff’un en son eserini çalacağız. Yarattığı büyük heyecanı gazetelerden okumuşsunuzdur.” Hepimize biraz tepeden bakarak, “o ne coşkuydu, Tanrım!” diye ekleyince herkes güldü.
es: —Señoras y señores —gritó—. A petición de mister Gatsby vamos a tocar para todos ustedes la última obra de mister Vladimir Tostoff, que tanta atención mereció en el Carnegie Hall el pasado mayo. Si leen los periódicos sabrán que causó auténtica sensación —sonrió con jovial condescendencia, y añadió—. ¡Y qué sensación! —y todo el mundo se echó a reír.
vi_translation: "Ladies and gentlemen." He shouted. "At the request of Mr. Gatsby, we will be performing the latest work of Vladimir Tostoff, a piece that has garnered much attention at Carnegie Hall this past May." "If you have read the newspapers, you must know it was a major sensation." He smiled politely and cheerfully, adding, "a real sensation." Everyone burst out laughing.
tr_translation: “Ladies and gentlemen,” he shouted. “At the request of Mr. Gatsby, we will play for you the latest work of Mr. Vladimir Tostoff, which received great acclaim at Carnegie Hall in May. You must have read about the excitement it caused in the newspapers.” Looking down on all of us a bit, he added, “what enthusiasm it was, my God!” and everyone laughed.
es_translation: —Ladies and gentlemen —he shouted—. At the request of Mr. Gatsby, we are going to play for all of you the latest work of Mr. Vladimir Tostoff, which garnered so much attention at Carnegie Hall last May. If you read the newspapers, you will know that it caused a real sensation —he smiled with jovial condescendence, and added—. What a sensation! —and everyone burst into laughter.

en: “The piece is known,” he concluded lustily, “as ‘Vladmir Tostoff’s Jazz History of the World!’ ”
vi: "Và bản nhạc đó có tên là." Anh ta kết thúc bằng một lời hô to mạnh mẽ. "Lịch sử thế giới bằng nhạc Jazz, của Vladimir Tostoff."
tr: “Eser ‘Vladmir Tostoff’un, Dünya Caz Tarihi’ adını taşıyor” diye tamamladı tutkulu bir sesle.
es: —La pieza —concluyó con energía— se titula La historia del mundo en jazz, según Vladimir Tostoff.
vi_translation: "And that piece of music is called." He concluded with a strong, loud exclamation. "The History of the World in Jazz, by Vladimir Tostoff."
tr_translation: “The work is called 'Vladmir Tostoff's World Jazz History,'” he concluded with a passionate voice.
es_translation: —The piece —he concluded energetically— is titled The History of the World in Jazz, according to Vladimir Tostoff.

en: The nature of Mr. Tostoff’s composition eluded me, because just as it began my eyes fell on Gatsby, standing alone on the marble steps and looking from one group to another with approving eyes. His tanned skin was drawn attractively tight on his face and his short hair looked as though it were trimmed every day. I could see nothing sinister about him. I wondered if the fact that he was not drinking helped to set him off from his guests, for it seemed to me that he grew more correct as the fraternal hilarity increased. When the “Jazz History of the World” was over, girls were putting their heads on men’s shoulders in a puppyish, convivial way, girls were swooning backward playfully into men’s arms, even into groups, knowing that someone would arrest their falls—but no one swooned backward on Gatsby, and no French bob touched Gatsby’s shoulder, and no singing quartets were formed with Gatsby’s head for one link.
vi: Tôi chưa kịp thưởng thức cái tinh túy của bài nhạc mà Tostoff đã sáng tác bởi vì đôi mắt của tôi bất chợt trông thấy Gatsby lúc đó đang đứng một mình trên những bậc thang đá hoa cương, ngắm nhìn hết nhóm người này đến nhóm người kia với ánh mắt hài lòng. Nước da nâu rạm nắng căng quyến rũ trên khuôn mặt, mái tóc cắt ngắn nhìn giống như được chăm sóc tỉa gọn mỗi ngày. Tôi không thấy có điểm gì hung ác ở Gatsby. Tôi tự hỏi có phải vì Gatsby không uống rượu đã khiến cho anh trở nên khác biệt giữa những người khách. Tôi thấy dường như khi cuộc vui càng nhộn nhịp thì Gatsby càng trở nên đứng đắn chừng mực. Khi bản nhạc "Lịch sử thế giới bằng nhạc Jazz" chấm dứt, những cô gái dựa đầu mình lên vai những chàng trai âu yếm như những chú chó con. Những cô gái giả vờ ngất đi ngã ngửa về phía sau vào trong vòng tay những anh con trai hay ngay cả vào giữa những đám đông, trong lòng họ biết rằng thế nào cũng có người đỡ mình.
tr: Gözüm Gatsby’e takıldığından, Bay Tostoff’un kompozisyonuna kendimi pek veremedim. Mermer merdivenlerde durmuş bir gruptan diğerine beğeniyle bakmaktaydı. Bronzlaşmış teni, düzgün yüz hatlarını daha da belirginleştiriyordu. Kısa saçlarına her gün şekil verildiği belliydi. İnsanı hiç de korkutan bir tarafı yoktu. Onu konuk­larından ayıran tek şey içki içmemesi olduğunu düşünmekten kendimi alamadım. Çünkü etraftaki şamata arttıkça Gatsby daha da ağırbaşlı görünüyordu. ‘Dünya Caz Tarihi’ konseri bitince kızlardan bazıları erkeklere kedi yavruları gibi sokulup neşe içinde başlarını omuzlarına yaslıyor, bazılarıysa nasılsa bir tutan olur diye kendilerini geriye bırakıp bayılma numarası yapıyordu. Ama kimse kendini Gatsby’nin kollarına bırakmıyor, Fransız buklelerini onun omzuna dokundurmuyor, hep bir ağızdan şarkılar söylenen gruplarda ise ona rastlanmıyordu.
es: Se me escapó la naturaleza de la composición de mister Tostoff porque, en el momento en que empezaba, vi a Gatsby, que, solo, iba mirando con aprobación a los distintos grupos desde la escalinata de mármol. Tenía la cara bronceada, tersa la piel, atractiva, y parecía que le arreglaban todos los días el pelo, muy corto. No encontré nada siniestro en él. Me pregunté si el hecho de que no bebiera lo ayudaba a distinguirse de sus invitados, pues me dio la impresión de que se volvía cada vez más correcto conforme la alegría fraternal aumentaba. Cuando La historia del mundo en jazz acabó, las chicas apoyaron la cabeza en el hombro de los hombres como adolescentes, las chicas caían de espaldas, desmayadas, de broma, en brazos de los hombres, o entre el grupo, sabiendo que alguien detendría su caída. Pero nadie se dejaba caer en brazos de Gatsby, y ningún corte de pelo a la francesa tocó el hombro de Gatsby y ningún cuarteto lo incluyó entre sus cantantes.
vi_translation: I had not yet had the chance to savor the essence of the music that Tostoff had composed because my eyes suddenly caught sight of Gatsby standing alone on the marble steps, looking from one group of people to another with a satisfied gaze. His sun-tanned skin was alluringly taut on his face, and his short-cropped hair looked as if it were meticulously trimmed every day. I did not see anything sinister in Gatsby. I wondered if Gatsby's abstinence from alcohol made him stand out among the guests. It seemed to me that the more lively the party became, the more composed and dignified Gatsby appeared. When the piece "The History of the World in Jazz" ended, the girls rested their heads affectionately on the shoulders of the boys like little puppies. The girls pretended to faint, falling backward into the arms of the boys or even into the crowd, knowing in their hearts that someone would catch them.
tr_translation: Since my eyes were fixed on Gatsby, I couldn't really focus on Mr. Tostoff's composition. He was standing on the marble stairs, looking appreciatively from one group to another. His tanned skin made his well-defined facial features even more prominent. It was obvious that his short hair was styled every day. There was nothing intimidating about him at all. I couldn't help but think that the only thing that set him apart from his guests was that he didn't drink. Because as the commotion around increased, Gatsby seemed even more composed. When the 'World Jazz History' concert ended, some of the girls snuggled up to the men like kittens and joyfully rested their heads on their shoulders, while others pretended to faint, hoping someone would catch them. But no one threw themselves into Gatsby's arms, no French curls touched his shoulder, and he was not found in the groups singing songs in unison.
es_translation: The nature of mister Tostoff's composition escaped me because, just as it was starting, I saw Gatsby, who, alone, was looking approvingly at the various groups from the marble staircase. His face was tanned, his skin smooth, attractive, and it seemed that his hair, very short, was groomed every day. I found nothing sinister about him. I wondered if the fact that he didn't drink helped him stand out from his guests, as it seemed to me that he became more and more proper as the fraternal joy increased. When The History of the World in Jazz ended, the girls rested their heads on the men's shoulders like teenagers, the girls fell backward, fainting, jokingly, into the men's arms, or among the group, knowing that someone would catch their fall. But no one let themselves fall into Gatsby's arms, and no bobbed haircut touched Gatsby's shoulder and no quartet included him among their singers.

en: Gatsby’s butler was suddenly standing beside us.
vi: Người quản gia của Gatsby đột ngột xuất hiện bên cạnh chúng tôi, lên tiếng hỏi.
tr: Gatsby’nin hizmetçisi yanımızda bitivermişti.
es: El mayordomo de Gatsby estaba de repente a nuestro lado.
vi_translation: Gatsby's butler suddenly appeared beside us and spoke up.
tr_translation: Gatsby's servant had suddenly appeared beside us.
es_translation: Gatsby's butler was suddenly at our side.

en: “Miss Baker?” he inquired. “I beg your pardon, but Mr. Gatsby would like to speak to you alone.”
vi: "Có phải cô là cô Baker? Tôi xin lỗi, ngài Gatsby muốn được phép nói chuyện riêng với cô."
tr: “Bayan Baker siz misiniz?” diye sordu, “Rahatsız ettim ama Bay Gatsby sizinle yalnız görüşmek istiyor.
es: —¿Miss Baker? —preguntó—. Perdone que la moleste, pero mister Gatsby quisiera hablar a solas con usted.
vi_translation: "Are you Miss Baker? I'm sorry, Mr. Gatsby would like to have a private conversation with you."
tr_translation: "Are you Mrs. Baker?" he asked, "I'm sorry to bother you, but Mr. Gatsby wants to see you alone."
es_translation: —Miss Baker? —he asked—. Sorry to bother you, but Mister Gatsby would like to speak with you alone.

en: “With me?” she exclaimed in surprise.
vi: "Với tôi?" Jordan ngạc nhiên.
tr: “Benimle mi?” dedi kız şaşkın şaşkın.
es: —¿Conmigo? —exclamó Jordan, sorprendida.
vi_translation: "For me?" Jordan was surprised.
tr_translation: “With me?” said the girl in astonishment.
es_translation: —With me? —exclaimed Jordan, surprised.

en: “Yes, madame.”
vi: "Thưa cô đúng vậy."
tr: “Evet madam.
es: —Sí, madame.
vi_translation: "Yes, ma'am, that's correct."
tr_translation: “Yes madam.”
es_translation: —Yes, madame.

en: She got up slowly, raising her eyebrows at me in astonishment, and followed the butler toward the house. I noticed that she wore her evening-dress, all her dresses, like sports clothes—there was a jauntiness about her movements as if she had first learned to walk upon golf courses on clean, crisp mornings.
vi: Jordan chậm rãi đứng lên, nhướng lông mày về phía tôi tỏ vẻ ngạc nhiên, sau đó đi theo người quản gia vào trong nhà. Tôi chú ý thấy Jordan đang mặc trên người chiếc áo dạ hội. Hình như tất cả những áo đầm của Jordan đều có điểm tương tự như áo thể thao, chúng đều làm lộ vẻ kiêu hãnh nào đó trong dáng đi của cô, làm như lần đầu tiên Jordan tập bước đi là ở trên sân golf trong một buổi sáng tươi mát trong lành.
tr: Jordan yavaşça kalkarken, kaşlarını şaşkınlıkla kaldırıp bana baktı, sonra kahyanın peşi sıra yürüdü. Giderken gece elbisesini de spor kıyafetleri gibi taşıdığını fark ettim. Yürüyüşü ve tavırları sabahın serin, taze havasında golf sahasında dolaşıyormuş gibi rahattı.
es: Se levantó despacio, me miró y enarcó las cejas en señal de asombro, y siguió al mayordomo hacia la casa. Me di cuenta de que llevaba el traje de noche, y todos sus vestidos, como si fueran prendas deportivas. Sus movimientos tenían una gracia especial: parecía haber aprendido a andar en las mañanas frescas y despejadas de los campos de golf.
vi_translation: Jordan slowly stood up, raised an eyebrow at me in surprise, and then followed the butler into the house. I noticed that Jordan was wearing an evening gown. It seemed that all of Jordan's dresses had some similarities to sportswear; they all revealed a certain pride in her gait, as if the first time Jordan learned to walk was on a golf course on a fresh and clear morning.
tr_translation: Jordan slowly stood up, raised his eyebrows in surprise, and looked at me, then walked after the butler. As he left, I noticed that he carried his evening dress as if it were sportswear. His walk and demeanor were as relaxed as if he were strolling on a golf course in the cool, fresh morning air.
es_translation: He got up slowly, looked at me, and raised his eyebrows in astonishment, then followed the butler towards the house. I noticed that he was wearing evening attire, and all his clothes, as if they were sportswear. His movements had a special grace: it seemed as if he had learned to walk on the fresh and clear mornings of the golf courses.

en: I was alone and it was almost two. For some time confused and intriguing sounds had issued from a long, many-windowed room which overhung the terrace. Eluding Jordan’s undergraduate, who was now engaged in an obstetrical conversation with two chorus girls, and who implored me to join him, I went inside.
vi: Tôi ngồi một mình, lúc đó đã khoảng hai giờ sáng. Một lúc nào đó bỗng có những tiếng động như mơ hồ, như gợi sự tò mò, phát ra từ căn phòng dài có nhiều cửa sổ nhìn ra bậc thềm. Anh chàng sinh viên của Jordan lúc này đang chuyện trò về nghành sản khoa với hai cô gái ca sĩ trong ban nhạc đồng ca, nài tôi tham gia với anh anh. Tôi từ trối, né tránh bỏ vào trong nhà.
tr: Tek başıma kalmıştım. Saat sabahın ikisiydi. Bir süre taraçaya bakan çok pencereli, uzunca odadan gelen anlaşılmaz ama ilginç seslere kulak verdim. Jordan’ın, iki dansçı kızla obstetrik konular konuşan üniversitelisi beni de onlara katılmaya davet etti. Ama ben kaçıp içeri girdim.
es: Estaba solo y eran casi las dos. Confusos y enigmáticos ruidos salían desde hacía un rato de un salón con muchas ventanas que se abrían a la terraza. Eludiendo al estudiante de Jordan, en ese momento enfrascado en una conversación sobre obstetricia con dos coristas, y que suplicaba mi compañía, entré en la casa.
vi_translation: I sat alone; it was around two in the morning. At some point, there were faint noises, almost evoking curiosity, coming from the long room with many windows overlooking the steps. The Jordanian student was chatting about obstetrics with two female singers from the choir, urging me to join him. I declined, avoiding them and going inside the house.
tr_translation: I was left alone. It was two in the morning. For a while, I listened to the incomprehensible but interesting sounds coming from the long room with many windows overlooking the terrace. Jordan’s university student, who was discussing obstetric topics with two dancer girls, invited me to join them. But I escaped and went inside.
es_translation: He was alone and it was almost two o'clock. Confusing and enigmatic noises had been coming for a while from a room with many windows that opened onto the terrace. Eluding Jordan's student, who was at that moment engrossed in a conversation about obstetrics with two chorus girls and was begging for my company, I entered the house.

en: The large room was full of people. One of the girls in yellow was playing the piano, and beside her stood a tall, red-haired young lady from a famous chorus, engaged in song. She had drunk a quantity of champagne, and during the course of her song she had decided, ineptly, that everything was very, very sad—she was not only singing, she was weeping too. Whenever there was a pause in the song she filled it with gasping, broken sobs, and then took up the lyric again in a quavering soprano. The tears coursed down her cheeks—not freely, however, for when they came into contact with her heavily beaded eyelashes they assumed an inky colour, and pursued the rest of their way in slow black rivulets. A humorous suggestion was made that she sing the notes on her face, whereupon she threw up her hands, sank into a chair, and went off into a deep vinous sleep.
vi: Căn phòng lớn đầy ắp người. Một trong hai cô gái áo vàng đang biểu diễn đàn piano, đứng hát bên cạnh là một thiếu nữ trẻ của một băng nhạc hợp ca nổi tiếng, dáng cao, tóc hung đỏ. Cô ta đã uống quá nhiều rượu champagene cho nên khi hát nửa chừng bài hát thì cô ta tự quyết định một cách dớ dẩn vô lý rằng mọi thứ phải trở nên rất buồn. Do đó cô ta không những chỉ hát mà còn rơi nước mắt khóc nữa. Mỗi khi đến chỗ nghỉ của bài hát cô ta lại điền vào đấy bằng những tiếng thở lấy hơi, những tiếng khóc thổn thức nghẹn ngào đứt đoạn và sau đó lại tiếp tục lời hát bằng giọng cao rung rung. Những giọt nước mắt lăn tròn trên má, nhưng lại không được rơi thoải mái, khi đụng tới hai hàng lông mi tô đậm màu thì chúng biến thành màu mực, sau đó tiếp tục rơi chậm chạp xuống thành những dòng nước đen. Có người khôi hài đề nghị cô ta hãy hát những nốt nhạc ghi trên khuôn mặt, ngay khi đó cô ta dơ tay lên trời, vật mình xuống ghế và ngủ thiếp đi trong hơi men.
tr: Geniş salon insanlarla doluydu. Sarı elbiseli iki kızdan biri piyano çalıyor, yanındaki uzun boylu, kızıl saçlı genç kadın şarkı söylüyordu. Çokça şampanya içmişti ve söylediği şarkının ortasında, her şeyin onu çok üzdüğüne karar verdiğinden olacak, yerli yersiz ağlıyor, eseri iç çekmeler ve hıçkırıklarla dolduruyor, sonra soprano sesi titreyerek kaldığı yerden söylemeye devam ediyordu. Gözyaşları yanaklarında çizgiler oluşturuyor, hemen akıp gitmeden önce boncuklarla dolu kirpiklerinde mürekkep rengini alıyor, sonra ince siyah derecikler şeklinde yollarına devam ediyorlardı. Birileri muzipçe, yüzünde oluşan notalara bakarak söylemesini teklif ettiğinde kollarını kaldırıp en yakın koltuğa kendini bıraktı. Oracıkta sızdı. Derin bir uykuya dalmıştı.
es: El salón estaba lleno de gente. Una de las chicas de amarillo tocaba el piano, y a su lado, de pie, una señora joven y pelirroja, miembro de una famosa compañía de revistas, entonaba una canción. Había bebido una dosis considerable de champagne y, de modo poco profesional, en el curso de la canción decidió que todo era muy triste, muy triste: no sólo cantaba, lloraba también. Introducía en cada pausa de la canción hipidos y sollozos entrecortados, antes de volver a la letra con voz temblorosa de soprano. Las lágrimas le corrían por las mejillas; no con total libertad, sin embargo, pues cuando entraban en contacto con las pestañas, muy pintadas, tomaban un color de tinta y seguían su camino en lentos riachuelos negros. Alguien sugirió con humor que cantara las notas que se le escribían en la cara, momento en el que levantó las manos, se derrumbó en un sillón y se hundió en el profundo sueño del vino.
vi_translation: The large room was packed with people. One of the two girls in yellow was playing the piano, while a young woman from a famous choir band, tall with red hair, stood beside her singing. She had drunk too much champagne, so halfway through the song, she irrationally decided that everything had to become very sad. As a result, she not only sang but also cried. Whenever there was a pause in the song, she filled it with gasping breaths, sobbing, and then continued singing in a high, trembling voice. Tears rolled down her cheeks but did not fall freely; when they reached her heavily mascaraed eyelashes, they turned into ink, then slowly continued down as black streaks. Someone jokingly suggested she sing the notes written on her face, at which point she raised her hands to the sky, collapsed onto a chair, and fell asleep in a drunken stupor.
tr_translation: The spacious hall was filled with people. One of the two girls in yellow dresses was playing the piano, while the tall, red-haired young woman next to her was singing. She had drunk a lot of champagne and, in the middle of the song she was singing, perhaps because she decided that everything was making her very sad, she was crying inappropriately, filling the piece with sobs and hiccups, then continuing to sing from where she left off with her soprano voice trembling. Tears were forming lines on her cheeks, taking on the color of ink on her bead-filled eyelashes before flowing away, then continuing their path as thin black streams. When someone mischievously suggested that she sing by looking at the notes forming on her face, she raised her arms and let herself fall into the nearest chair. She passed out right there. She had fallen into a deep sleep.
es_translation: The living room was full of people. One of the girls in yellow was playing the piano, and beside her, standing, a young red-haired lady, a member of a famous revue company, was singing a song. She had drunk a considerable amount of champagne and, quite unprofessionally, during the course of the song decided that everything was very sad, very sad: not only was she singing, she was also crying. She introduced sobs and broken hiccups into each pause of the song, before returning to the lyrics with a trembling soprano voice. Tears ran down her cheeks; not with complete freedom, however, because when they came into contact with her heavily painted eyelashes, they took on an inky color and continued their path in slow black streams. Someone humorously suggested that she sing the notes written on her face, at which point she raised her hands, collapsed into an armchair, and sank into the deep sleep of wine.

en: “She had a fight with a man who says he’s her husband,” explained a girl at my elbow.
vi: "Cô ta mới gây lộn với một người đàn ông tự xưng là chồng của cô ta." Người con gái đứng sát bên cùi chỏ của tôi giải thích.
tr: Yanı başımda beliren bir başka kız. “Az önce, kocası olduğunu söyleyen biriyle tartıştılar” diyerek beni bilgilendirdi.
es: —Se ha peleado con un hombre que dice ser su marido —explicó una chica a mi lado.
vi_translation: "She just had a quarrel with a man claiming to be her husband." The girl standing close to my elbow explained.
tr_translation: Another girl appeared beside me. “Just now, she had an argument with someone who said he was her husband,” she informed me.
es_translation: —She fought with a man who claims to be her husband —explained a girl next to me.

en: I looked around. Most of the remaining women were now having fights with men said to be their husbands. Even Jordan’s party, the quartet from East Egg, were rent asunder by dissension. One of the men was talking with curious intensity to a young actress, and his wife, after attempting to laugh at the situation in a dignified and indifferent way, broke down entirely and resorted to flank attacks—at intervals she appeared suddenly at his side like an angry diamond, and hissed: “You promised!” into his ear.
vi: Tôi nhìn chung quanh. Hầu hết những người phụ nữa còn lại đang gây gỗ với những người đàn ông tự xưng là chồng của họ. Ngay cả nhóm người đi chung với Jordan, bốn người từ East Egg cũng đang chia rẽ vì bất đồng. Một trong những người đàn ông đó đang nói chuyện một cách chăm chú lạ thường với một diễn viên trẻ tuổi, trong khi vợ của ông ta dù đã cố gắng gượng cười một cách có phẩm cách và dửng dưng cũng hoàn toàn không chống gượng nổi nữa và tìm cách tấn công bên hông. Chốc chốc, bà ta lại đột ngột xuất hiện bên ông chồng như một viên kim cương tóe lửa, rít lên vào tai ông chồng, "Ông đã hứa với tôi."
tr: Etrafıma baktım. Orada bulunan kadınların çoğu, kocaları olduğunu iddia eden adamlarla tartışıyordu. Jordan’ın grubunda bile –şu East Egg’liler dörtlüsü- münakaşa çıkmıştı. Adamlardan biri genç bir aktrisle hararetli bir sohbete dalmış, karısı durumu bir süre umursamadan, mağrur bir gülümsemeyle karşıladıktan sonra, saldırıya geçmişti. Öfkeli bir yılan gibi adama sokulup, durmadan “Söz vermiştin!” diyerek tıslıyordu.
es: Miré a mi alrededor. La mayoría de las mujeres que quedaban se estaban peleando con hombres que decían ser sus maridos. Incluso el grupo de Jordan, el cuarteto de East Egg, se había roto, dividido por la disensión. Uno de los hombres hablaba con inusitada intensidad con una actriz muy joven, y su mujer, después de intentar reírse de la situación haciéndose la digna y la indiferente, perdió completamente el control y recurrió a los ataques por los flancos. Aparecía de repente una y otra vez como un diamante enfadado y decía al oído del marido: «¡Me lo prometiste!»
vi_translation: I looked around. Most of the remaining women were quarreling with the men who claimed to be their husbands. Even the group that came with Jordan, four people from East Egg, were also divided due to disagreements. One of those men was talking unusually attentively to a young actress, while his wife, despite trying to smile with dignity and indifference, could no longer hold back and tried to attack from the side. From time to time, she would suddenly appear beside her husband like a sparkling diamond, hissing into his ear, "You promised me."
tr_translation: I looked around. Most of the women there were arguing with men who claimed to be their husbands. Even in Jordan's group – that East Egg foursome – a quarrel had broken out. One of the men had engaged in a heated conversation with a young actress, and after his wife initially ignored the situation with a proud smile, she had launched an attack. She slithered up to the man like an angry snake, hissing incessantly, "You promised!"
es_translation: I looked around. Most of the women who remained were fighting with men who claimed to be their husbands. Even Jordan's group, the East Egg quartet, had broken up, divided by dissension. One of the men was talking with unusual intensity to a very young actress, and his wife, after trying to laugh off the situation with dignity and indifference, completely lost control and resorted to flanking attacks. She would suddenly appear again and again like an angry diamond and whisper in her husband's ear: "You promised me!"

en: The reluctance to go home was not confined to wayward men. The hall was at present occupied by two deplorably sober men and their highly indignant wives. The wives were sympathizing with each other in slightly raised voices.
vi: Miễn cưỡng chưa muốn về không phải chỉ hạn chế ở những đàn ông bướng bỉnh. Trong sảnh đường lúc này còn có hai ông không say rượu và hai người vợ đầy phẫn nộ của họ. Hai người vợ lớn tiếng than thở thương h ại lẫn nhau.
tr: Eve gitmedeki isteksizlik sadece sarhoş erkeklere mahsus değildi. Salon bir anda acınacak ölçüde ayık iki adam ve öfkeli eşleri tarafından işgal edilmişti. Kadınlar olanca sesleriyle birbirlerine acımakla meşguldü.
es: La resistencia a irse a casa no era exclusiva de los hombres desobedientes. El vestíbulo lo ocupaban ahora dos hombres lamentablemente sobrios y sus mujeres absolutamente indignadas. Las mujeres habían congeniado y hablaban levantando ligeramente la voz.
vi_translation: Reluctance to go home is not limited to stubborn men. In the hall at this moment, there were two men who were not drunk and their two wives who were full of indignation. The two wives loudly lamented their misfortune harm each other.
tr_translation: The reluctance to go home was not exclusive to drunk men. The salon was suddenly occupied by two pitifully sober men and their angry wives. The women were busy commiserating with each other at the top of their voices.
es_translation: The resistance to going home was not exclusive to the disobedient men. The lobby was now occupied by two lamentably sober men and their absolutely indignant wives. The women had hit it off and were speaking slightly louder.

en: “Whenever he sees I’m having a good time he wants to go home.”
vi: "Bất cứ khi nào anh ta thấy tôi có được niềm vui thì lại muốn xách tôi về".
tr: “Ne zaman eğlendiğimi görse bizimki eve gitmek ister.
es: —Siempre que ve que me lo estoy pasando bien quiere irse a casa.
vi_translation: "Whenever he sees me having fun, he wants to take me away."
tr_translation: “Whenever he sees me having fun, he wants to go home.”
es_translation: —Whenever she sees that I'm having a good time, she wants to go home.

en: “Never heard anything so selfish in my life.”
vi: "Trong đời tôi chưa bao giờ nghe thấy có người ích kỷ như vậy"
tr: “Ömrümde böyle bencilce bir şey duymadım.
es: —No he conocido nunca a nadie tan egoísta.
vi_translation: "In my life, I have never heard of someone as selfish as that"
tr_translation: “I have never heard something so selfish in my life.”
es_translation: —I have never met anyone so selfish.

en: “We’re always the first ones to leave.”
vi: "Chúng tôi lúc nào cũng phải là người về sớm nhất."
tr: “Her partiden ilk çıkan biz oluruz.
es: —Siempre nos vamos los primeros.
vi_translation: "We always have to be the ones to leave the earliest."
tr_translation: “We are the first to leave every party.”
es_translation: —We always leave first.

en: “Well, we’re almost the last tonight,” said one of the men sheepishly. “The orchestra left half an hour ago.”
vi: "Chà ơi, tối nay chúng ta gần như là người cuối cùng ở đây rồi." Một ông chồng nói một cách bẻn lẻn. "Dàn nhạc cũng đã về nửa giờ trước rồi."
tr: “Neyse ki bu gece en son biz çıkıyoruz” dedi adamlardan biri utangaçça, “orkestra gideli bile yarım saat oldu.
es: —Bueno, esta noche somos casi los últimos —dijo uno de los hombres tímidamente—. La orquesta se fue hace media hora.
vi_translation: "Oh dear, tonight we are almost the last ones here." A husband said sheepishly. "The orchestra left half an hour ago too."
tr_translation: “Fortunately, we are the last ones leaving tonight,” said one of the men shyly, “the orchestra left half an hour ago.”
es_translation: —Well, tonight we are almost the last ones —one of the men said timidly—. The orchestra left half an hour ago.

en: In spite of the wives’ agreement that such malevolence was beyond credibility, the dispute ended in a short struggle, and both wives were lifted, kicking, into the night.
vi: Mặc dù hai bà vợ đều đồng ý rằng hành động ác ôn như vậy thật là không thể tin được, cuộc cãi cọ chấm dứt bằng một cuộc vật lộn ngắn, hai bà vợ đều bị nhấc bổng lên, chân đá lung tung, rồi bị vác đi vào trong bóng đêm.
tr: Böylesi bir kötülüğe dayanılamayacağı konu­sunda anlaşmalarına karşın, kadınların tartışması kısa süreli bir boğuşmayla son buldu. Kocaları ikisini de yerden kaldırırken, gecenin karanlığına tekmeler savuruyorlardı.
es: A pesar de que las mujeres coincidieran en que tanta malevolencia resultaba inconcebible, la discusión terminó en un breve cuerpo a cuerpo, y las dos mujeres fueron levantadas en volandas y, pataleando, desaparecieron en la noche.
vi_translation: Although both wives agreed that such a heinous act was truly unbelievable, the quarrel ended with a brief scuffle, both wives were lifted up, their legs kicking wildly, and then carried off into the darkness.
tr_translation: Despite agreeing that such evil could not be endured, the women's argument ended with a brief scuffle. As their husbands lifted them off the ground, they were kicking into the darkness of the night.
es_translation: Despite the women agreeing that such malevolence was inconceivable, the discussion ended in a brief scuffle, and the two women were lifted off their feet and, kicking, disappeared into the night.

en: As I waited for my hat in the hall the door of the library opened and Jordan Baker and Gatsby came out together. He was saying some last word to her, but the eagerness in his manner tightened abruptly into formality as several people approached him to say goodbye.
vi: Trong khi tôi đang đứng chờ lấy nón ở sảnh đường thì cánh cửa phòng sách mở ra, Jordan và Gatsby cùng bước ra. Gatsby nói vài lời cuối cùng tới Jordan, nhưng thái độ sôi nổi của anh ta đột ngột đổi sang trang trọng khi nhiều người bước đến nói lời chào từ giã.
tr: Salonda uşağın şapkamı getirmesini beklerken kü­tüphanenin kapısı açıldı. Jordan Baker ile Gatsby birlikte çıktılar. Gatsby kıza son birkaç şey söylerken, veda etmek için yanlarına gelenler olunca tavırlarındaki yakındık aniden resmiyete dönüşüverdi.
es: Mientras esperaba en el vestíbulo a que me dieran el sombrero, la puerta de la biblioteca se abrió y Jordan Baker y Gatsby salieron juntos. Él decía una última frase, pero la ansiedad que demostraba se ciñó precipitadamente al más estricto formalismo cuando varias personas se le acercaron para despedirse.
vi_translation: While I was standing in the hall waiting to get my hat, the door to the study opened, and Jordan and Gatsby stepped out together. Gatsby said a few final words to Jordan, but his enthusiastic demeanor suddenly shifted to a more formal tone as several people approached to say their goodbyes.
tr_translation: While I was waiting for the child to bring my hat in the living room, the library door opened. Jordan Baker and Gatsby came out together. As Gatsby was saying the last few things to the girl, their intimate demeanor suddenly turned formal when people came over to bid farewell.
es_translation: While I was waiting in the lobby to be given my hat, the library door opened and Jordan Baker and Gatsby came out together. He was saying a final sentence, but the anxiety he showed quickly turned into the strictest formality when several people approached him to say goodbye.

en: “Why, about an hour.”
vi: "Sao? Khoảng chừng một tiếng."
tr: “Bir saat kadar.
es: —Una hora, más o menos.
vi_translation: "What?" "About an hour."
tr_translation: “About an hour.”
es_translation: —One hour, more or less.

en: “It was… simply amazing,” she repeated abstractedly. “But I swore I wouldn’t tell it and here I am tantalizing you.” She yawned gracefully in my face. “Please come and see me… Phone book… Under the name of Mrs. Sigourney Howard… My aunt…” She was hurrying off as she talked—her brown hand waved a jaunty salute as she melted into her party at the door.
vi: "Chuyện này thật quá kinh ngạc." Jordan lập lại một cách lơ đãng. "Nhưng tôi thề tôi sẽ không kể ra đâu để trêu tức anh." Jordan ngáp một cách duyên dáng vào ngay mặt tôi. "Khi nào rảnh thì đến thăm tôi... Niên giám điện thoại.. Dưới tên của bà Sigourney Howard.. dì của tôi.." Jordan vừa vội vã đi ra cửa vừa nói. Bàn tay nâu hồng vẫy nhanh chào tạm biệt rồi tan lẫn vào trong nhóm người đi chung với cô ở cửa.
tr: “Gerçekten inanılmaz” diye yineledi dalgın dalgın, “ama söylemeyeceğime yemin ettim. Seni de boş yere umutlandırmış oldum işte. Yüzüme karşı nazikçe esnedi, “Lütfen beni ara…telefon rehberi…teyzemin adına kayıtlı. Bayan Sigourney Howard” Konuşurken bir yandan da hızlı hızlı yürüyordu. Kapıda bekleyen arkadaşlarına karışırken bronzlaşmış eliyle gösterişli bir selam verdi.
es: —Ha sido… simplemente asombroso —repitió, abstraída—. Pero he jurado no decírselo a nadie, y aquí me tienes, tentándote con lo que no puedo darte —me bostezó en la cara con mucha elegancia—. Ven a verme, por favor… Guía de teléfonos… El número de mistress Sigourney Howard… Mi tía… —se iba deprisa mientras hablaba, y su mano morena me hizo un alegre saludo cuando en la puerta se fundió con el grupo.
vi_translation: "This is truly astonishing." Jordan repeated absentmindedly. "But I swear I won't tell anyone to tease you." Jordan yawned gracefully right in my face. "When you have time, come visit me... The phone directory... Under the name of Mrs. Sigourney Howard... my aunt..." Jordan said as she hurried out the door. Her rosy brown hand waved a quick goodbye and then blended into the group of people she was with at the door.
tr_translation: “Really unbelievable,” he repeated absentmindedly, “but I swore I wouldn’t tell. I’ve just gotten your hopes up for nothing.” She yawned gently in my face, "Please call me...phone directory...registered under my aunt's name. Mrs. Sigourney Howard" While talking, he was also walking quickly. As he mingled with his friends waiting at the door, he gave a grand salute with his tanned hand.
es_translation: —It has been… simply amazing —she repeated, distracted—. But I have sworn not to tell anyone, and here I am, tempting you with what I cannot give you —she yawned in my face very elegantly—. Come see me, please… Phone book… The number of mistress Sigourney Howard… My aunt… —she was leaving quickly as she spoke, and her tanned hand gave me a cheerful wave as she melted into the group at the door.

en: Rather ashamed that on my first appearance I had stayed so late, I joined the last of Gatsby’s guests, who were clustered around him. I wanted to explain that I’d hunted for him early in the evening and to apologize for not having known him in the garden.
vi: Cảm thấy hơi mắc cở vì đã ở lại quá trễ trong lần đầu tham dự của mình, tôi nhập chung với những người khách cuối của Gatsby đứng vây quanh anh ta. Tôi muốn cho Gatsby hay rằng tôi đã đi tìm kiếm anh hồi sớm chiều để xin lỗi việc đã không nhận ra anh ta lúc ở khu vườn.
tr: İlk kez geldiğim bir evde bu kadar çok kaldığım için utanmıştım. Gatsby’nin çevresinde toplanmış son konuklara ben de katıldım. Partiye geldiğimde kendisini bulamadığımı söylemek ve bahçedeyken onu tanımadığım için özür dilemek istiyordum.
es: Un poco avergonzado por haberme quedado hasta tan tarde en mi primera visita, me reuní con los últimos invitados de Gatsby, que se congregaban a su alrededor. Quería explicarle que había estado buscándolo al principio de la fiesta y disculparme por no haberlo reconocido en el jardín.
vi_translation: Feeling a bit embarrassed for staying too late on my first attendance, I joined the last guests of Gatsby standing around him. I wanted to let Gatsby know that I had been looking for him earlier in the evening to apologize for not recognizing him in the garden.
tr_translation: I was embarrassed for staying so long at a house I had come to for the first time. I joined the last guests gathered around Gatsby. I wanted to say that I couldn't find him when I came to the party and apologize for not recognizing him when I was in the garden.
es_translation: A little embarrassed for having stayed so late on my first visit, I joined Gatsby's last guests, who were gathering around him. I wanted to explain that I had been looking for him at the beginning of the party and apologize for not having recognized him in the garden.

en: “Don’t mention it,” he enjoined me eagerly. “Don’t give it another thought, old sport.” The familiar expression held no more familiarity than the hand which reassuringly brushed my shoulder. “And don’t forget we’re going up in the hydroplane tomorrow morning, at nine o’clock.”
vi: "Không có gì phải ngại." Gatsby sốt sắng đáp lại. "Đừng nghĩ về chuyện đó nữa anh bạn già." Khuôn mặt thân thiện của Gatsby cũng thân thiện như bàn tay anh đang đặt lên vai tôi để tôi yên tâm. "Và đừng quên sáng mai chúng ta có hẹn sẽ cùng nhau lái chiếc thủy phi cơ lúc chín giờ sáng."
tr: “Hiç önemi yok” dedi hemen, “kafanı bunlara yorma ahbap” sözleri de, omzumu sıvazlayan eli de samimi olmaktan öte sıradan bir nezaket gösterisi gibi gelmişti bana. “Sabah dokuzdaki geziyi unutma.
es: —No te preocupes —me ordenó categóricamente—. No le des más vueltas, compañero —no había en aquella expresión familiar más familiaridad que en la mano reconfortante que me pasó por el hombro—. Y no olvides que mañana por la mañana probamos el hidroplano, a las nueve.
vi_translation: "There's nothing to worry about." Gatsby eagerly responded. "Don't think about it anymore, old sport." Gatsby's friendly face was as reassuring as his hand on my shoulder. "And don't forget we have an appointment to fly the seaplane together at nine o'clock tomorrow morning."
tr_translation: “It doesn't matter at all,” he said immediately, “don't bother your head with these things, buddy,” both his words and the hand patting my shoulder felt more like a routine gesture of politeness than genuine sincerity to me. “Don't forget the tour at nine in the morning.”
es_translation: —Don't worry —he ordered me categorically—. Don't overthink it, buddy —there was no more familiarity in that familiar expression than in the comforting hand he placed on my shoulder—. And don't forget that tomorrow morning we test the hydroplane at nine.

en: Then the butler, behind his shoulder:
vi: Ngay lúc đó người quản gia đến sau lưng anh ta: "Thưa ngài có điện thoại gọi từ Philadelphia."
tr: O sırada uşak geldi, “Philadelphia’dan arıyorlar efendim” dedi.
es: Y el mayordomo, a su espalda:
vi_translation: At that moment, the butler came up behind him: "Sir, there's a phone call from Philadelphia."
tr_translation: At that moment, the servant came and said, "They are calling from Philadelphia, sir."
es_translation: And the butler, behind him:

en: “Philadelphia wants you on the phone, sir.”
vi: Ngay lúc đó người quản gia đến sau lưng anh ta: "Thưa ngài có điện thoại gọi từ Philadelphia."
tr: O sırada uşak geldi, “Philadelphia’dan arıyorlar efendim” dedi.
es: —Lo llaman de Filadelfia, señor.
vi_translation: At that moment, the butler came up behind him: "Sir, there's a phone call from Philadelphia."
tr_translation: At that moment, the servant came and said, "They are calling from Philadelphia, sir."
es_translation: —They are calling you from Philadelphia, sir.

en: “All right, in a minute. Tell them I’ll be right there… Good night.”
vi: "Được rồi, chờ một lát. Nói với họ tôi sẽ tới nghe ngay.... Chúc ngủ ngon" "Chúc ngủ ngon."
tr: “Tamam. Bir dakika. Hemen geliyorum… İyi geceler” “İyi geceler.
es: —Sí, ahora mismo. Diga que ahora mismo me pongo… Buenas noches.
vi_translation: "Alright, wait a moment. Tell them I will listen right away.... Good night"
tr_translation: “Okay. One minute. I'll be right back… Good night”
es_translation: —Yes, right away. Say that I'll be right there... Good night.

en: “Good night.” He smiled—and suddenly there seemed to be a pleasant significance in having been among the last to go, as if he had desired it all the time. “Good night, old sport… Good night.”
vi: "Chúc ngủ ngon" Gatsby cười. Đột nhiên tôi cảm thấy dường như việc tôi là một trong những người ra về cuối cùng là một điều thú vị, giống như đó là điều mà Gatsby khao khát suốt buổi nay. "Chúc ngủ ngon, anh bạn già... Chúc ngủ ngon."
tr: “İyi geceler” diyerek gülümsedi. Birden oradan son ayrılanlardan biri olmamın kendisi için önem taşıdığını ve bunu istemiş olduğunu düşündüm, “İyi geceler ahbap... iyi geceler.
es: —Buenas noches. —Buenas noches —sonrió, y de pronto pareció que el estar entre los últimos que se iban tenía un significado entrañable, como si eso fuera lo que Gatsby había deseado desde el principio—. Buenas noches, compañero… Buenas noches.
vi_translation: "Good night," Gatsby smiled. Suddenly I felt as if being one of the last people to leave was something special, as if it was what Gatsby had been longing for all evening. "Good night, old sport... Good night."
tr_translation: “Good night,” he said with a smile. Suddenly, I thought that being one of the last to leave from there was important to him and that he had wanted it, “Good night, buddy... good night.”
es_translation: —Good evening. —Good night —he smiled, and suddenly it seemed that being among the last to leave had a heartfelt significance, as if that was what Gatsby had wished for from the beginning—. Good night, buddy… Good night.

en: But as I walked down the steps I saw that the evening was not quite over. Fifty feet from the door a dozen headlights illuminated a bizarre and tumultuous scene. In the ditch beside the road, right side up, but violently shorn of one wheel, rested a new coupé which had left Gatsby’s drive not two minutes before. The sharp jut of a wall accounted for the detachment of the wheel, which was now getting considerable attention from half a dozen curious chauffeurs. However, as they had left their cars blocking the road, a harsh, discordant din from those in the rear had been audible for some time, and added to the already violent confusion of the scene.
vi: Thế nhưng khi tôi bước xuống những bậc cửa, tôi trông thấy buổi tối hình như chưa hoàn toàn qua hết. Cách cánh cửa chừng năm mươi thước có khoảng một chục ánh đèn xe rọi sáng chiếu một cảnh tượng kỳ quái và ồn ào huyên náo. Chiếc xe hơi hai chỗ mới nguyên vừa mới rời nhà Gatsby cách đây chưa đầy hai phút bây giờ đang nằm kẹt mương bên đường, phía bên phải xe nhếch lên để lộ thấy một bánh xe đã bị hoàn toàn đứt lìa. Phần nhô ra đột ngột của bức tường là nguyên do làm xe gẫy bánh. Sự việc này đã gây tò mò không ít đến cho khoảng nửa chục tài xế, họ ngừng xe bước ra ngoài nhìn để xe nằm chắn hết cả đường. Tiếng huyên náo la hét cục cằn và tiếng kèn chói tai từ những chiếc xe kẹt ở phía sau nổi lên cũng khá lâu, càng làm cho cảnh tượng thêm hỗn độn.
tr: Merdivenlerden inerken partinin henüz sona ermediğini anladım. Kapıdan birkaç metre ötede bir düzine otomobil farı kargaşa dolu ve tuhaf bir manzarayı aydınlatıyordu. Tekerleklerinden biri yolun yanındaki kanala girerek kırılmış yepyeni, spor bir araba sol tarafına yatmıştı. Gatsby’nin evinden iki dakika önce ayrılan davetlilerden biriydi bu. Tekerleğin fırlamasına duvarın sivri çıkıntısı neden olmuş, yarım düzine kadar meraklı sürücü topluluğu durumu dikkatle incelemeye koyulmuştu. Hepsi arabalarını yolun ortasına bıraktığından ar­ada kalanların kornalarından çıkan akortsuz, tiz sesler kulak tırmalıyor, karmaşayı iyiden iyiye artırıyordu.
es: Pero mientras bajaba las escaleras vi que la fiesta no había terminado todavía. A unos quince metros de la puerta los faros de los coches iluminaban una escena rara y tumultuosa. En la carretera, en la cuneta, sin haber llegado a volcar, pero habiendo perdido una rueda por la violencia del golpe, yacía un cupé nuevo que había salido del camino de entrada a la casa de Gatsby menos de dos minutos antes. Un pronunciado saliente en la pared explicaba la pérdida de la rueda, que ahora atraía toda la atención de un grupo de chóferes curiosos. Pero, como habían bloqueado la carretera con sus coches, llevaba oyéndose un rato la ruidosa y disonante protesta de los que venían detrás, y eso aumentaba la violenta confusión de la escena.
vi_translation: However, when I stepped down the stairs, I saw that the evening seemed not to be completely over yet. About fifty meters away from the door, there were about a dozen car lights illuminating a bizarre and noisy scene. A brand new two-seater car that had just left Gatsby's house less than two minutes ago was now stuck in a ditch by the roadside, with its right side lifted up, revealing a wheel that had been completely severed. The sudden protrusion of the wall was the cause of the broken wheel. This incident had piqued the curiosity of about half a dozen drivers, who stopped their cars and got out to look, blocking the entire road. The coarse shouting and the blaring horns from the cars stuck behind had been going on for quite a while, adding to the chaos of the scene.
tr_translation: As I was coming down the stairs, I realized the party was not over yet. A few meters away from the door, a dozen car headlights were illuminating a chaotic and strange scene. A brand new sports car, with one of its wheels broken after falling into the ditch beside the road, was lying on its side. It was one of the guests who had left Gatsby's house two minutes earlier. The wheel had come off due to a sharp protrusion on the wall, and about half a dozen curious drivers had gathered to carefully examine the situation. Since they had all left their cars in the middle of the road, the discordant, high-pitched sounds of the horns from those stuck in between were grating on the ears, further adding to the chaos.
es_translation: But as I was going down the stairs, I saw that the party hadn't ended yet. About fifteen meters from the door, the headlights of the cars illuminated a strange and tumultuous scene. On the road, in the ditch, without having overturned but having lost a wheel due to the violence of the impact, lay a new coupe that had left the driveway of Gatsby's house less than two minutes before. A pronounced protrusion on the wall explained the loss of the wheel, which now attracted the full attention of a group of curious chauffeurs. But, as they had blocked the road with their cars, the loud and dissonant protest of those coming behind had been heard for a while, and that increased the violent confusion of the scene.

en: A man in a long duster had dismounted from the wreck and now stood in the middle of the road, looking from the car to the tyre and from the tyre to the observers in a pleasant, puzzled way.
vi: Một người đàn ông trong chiếc áo khoác dài bước ra khỏi chiếc xe bị nạn ra đứng ngay giữa đường. Ông ta nhìn một cách khôi hài và bối rối hết từ chiếc xe tới chiếc bánh xe rồi nhìn từ chiếc bánh xe tới những người đang đứng quan sát.
tr: Enkazdan, üzerinde uzunca bir tozluk olan bir adam çıkıp yolun ortasında durdu. Hoşnut ama şaşkın bakan gözleri arabadan tekere tekerden izleyicilere dönüyordu.
es: Un hombre con un guardapolvo muy largo se había bajado del coche siniestrado y, en mitad de la carretera, sus ojos iban del coche a la rueda y de la rueda a los espectadores, afable y perplejo a la vez.
vi_translation: A man in a long coat stepped out of the wrecked car and stood right in the middle of the road. He looked humorously and confusedly from the car to the wheel and then from the wheel to the people standing and watching.
tr_translation: From the wreckage, a man wearing a long duster coat emerged and stood in the middle of the road. His eyes, looking pleased but bewildered, shifted from the car to the wheel and then to the onlookers.
es_translation: A man with a very long coat had gotten out of the wrecked car and, in the middle of the road, his eyes went from the car to the wheel and from the wheel to the spectators, friendly and perplexed at the same time.

en: “See!” he explained. “It went in the ditch.”
vi: Ông ta giải thích. "Thấy đó. Nó đã rơi xuống rãnh."
tr: “Görüyorsunuz ya” diye açıklıyordu, “kanala girdi. Olaya çok şaşırdığı belliydi.
es: —Fíjense, se ha metido en la cuneta.
vi_translation: He explained. "See that. It has fallen into the ditch."
tr_translation: "You see," he was explaining, "it entered the channel." It was obvious that she was very surprised.
es_translation: —Look, it has gone into the ditch.

en: The fact was infinitely astonishing to him, and I recognized first the unusual quality of wonder, and then the man—it was the late patron of Gatsby’s library.
vi: Trông như sự việc đã gây một kinh ngạc vô bờ đến cho ông ta. Tôi trước tiên nhận ra cái sự ngạc nhiên không bình thường này, sau đó thì nhận ra ông ta là người khách đã ở trong thư viện nhà Gatsby lúc nãy.
tr: Önce bu aşırı şaşkın tepkiyi sonra da adamı tanıdığımı fark ettim. Gatsby’nin kütüphanesinin geç saatteki müdavimiydi.
es: El hecho le producía verdadero asombro, y reconocí primero aquel inusitado sentido de lo maravilloso, y luego al individuo: era el usuario de la biblioteca de Gatsby.
vi_translation: It seemed like the event had caused him immense astonishment. At first, I noticed this unusual surprise, and then I recognized him as the guest who had been in Gatsby's library earlier.
tr_translation: First, I noticed this extreme reaction of surprise, and then I realized that I knew the man. He was a late-night regular of Gatsby's library.
es_translation: The fact genuinely astonished him, and I first recognized that unusual sense of wonder, and then the individual: it was the user of Gatsby's library.

en: “How’d it happen?”
vi: "Sao nó bị như vậy?"
tr: “Nasıl oldu bu?
es: —¿Cómo ha sido?
vi_translation: "Why is it like that?" "I don't know anything about machinery."
tr_translation: “How did this happen?”
es_translation: —How has it been?

en: He shrugged his shoulders.
vi: "Tôi không biết một chút gì về máy móc cả." Ông ta nhún vai quả quyết nói.
tr: Omuzlarını silkti.
es: Se encogió de hombros.
vi_translation: He shrugged and said firmly.
tr_translation: He shrugged his shoulders.
es_translation: He shrugged.

en: “I know nothing whatever about mechanics,” he said decisively.
vi: "Tôi không biết một chút gì về máy móc cả." Ông ta nhún vai quả quyết nói.
tr: “Ben makinelerden hiç anlamam” diye kestirip attı.
es: —No tengo ni idea de mecánica —dijo rotundamente.
vi_translation: He shrugged and said firmly.
tr_translation: "I don't understand machines at all," he said curtly.
es_translation: —I have no idea about mechanics —he said emphatically.

en: “But how did it happen? Did you run into the wall?”
vi: "Thế nhưng sao nó lại bị như vậy? Ông chạy tông vào tường à
tr: “Peki kaza nasıl oldu? Duvara mı tosladınız?
es: —Pero ¿cómo ha sido? ¿Ha chocado con la pared?
vi_translation: "But why did it end up like this? Did you run into a wall?"
tr_translation: “So, how did the accident happen? Did you crash into the wall?”
es_translation: —But how did it happen? Did he crash into the wall?

en: “Don’t ask me,” said Owl Eyes, washing his hands of the whole matter. “I know very little about driving—next to nothing. It happened, and that’s all I know.”
vi: "Đừng hỏi tôi." Ông mắt cú vọ nói, phủi tay khỏi mọi chuyện. "Tôi không biết lái xe gì mấy, gần như là không biết lái. Tôi chỉ biết là nó đã bị hư, thế thôi."
tr: “Bana sormayın” dedi Baykuş gözlü durumdan sıyrılmaya çalışarak, “araba kullanmayı pek bilmem, hatta hiç bilmem. Bir kazadır oldu işte. Tüm bildiğim bu.
es: —No me lo pregunte —dijo Ojos de Búho, lavándose las manos a propósito del accidente—. No tengo mucha idea de lo que es conducir, casi ninguna. Ha sido, y eso es todo lo que sé.
vi_translation: "Don't ask me." The sharp-eyed man said, brushing off everything. "I don't really know how to drive, almost not at all. I just know that it was broken, that's all."
tr_translation: "Don't ask me," said the Owl-eyed man, trying to extricate himself from the situation, "I don't really know how to drive, in fact, I don't know at all. It was just an accident. That's all I know."
es_translation: —Don't ask me —said Owl Eyes, washing his hands of the accident—. I don't have much idea about driving, almost none. It happened, and that's all I know.

en: “Well, if you’re a poor driver you oughtn’t to try driving at night.”
vi: "Nếu như ông là tài xế tồi, thì đừng nên cố lái xe vào ban tối."
tr: “Kötü bir sürücüyseniz, gece kullanmayı denemeyin.
es: —Pues si no conduce bien, no debería conducir de noche.
vi_translation: "If you are a bad driver, then you shouldn't try to drive at night."
tr_translation: “If you are a bad driver, do not try driving at night.”
es_translation: —Well, if they don't drive well, they shouldn't drive at night.

en: “But I wasn’t even trying,” he explained indignantly, “I wasn’t even trying.”
vi: "Nhưng tôi đâu có cố lái đâu." Ông ta giải thích một cách căm phẩn "Tôi đâu phải đang cố đâu."
tr: “Ben kullanıyordum ki” dedi biraz kırgın, “kullanan ben değildim.
es: —Pero si no sé conducir —respondió, indignado—. No he conducido en mi vida.
vi_translation: "But I wasn't trying to drive." He explained indignantly, "I wasn't trying."
tr_translation: “I was using it,” he said a bit hurt, “I wasn't the one using it.”
es_translation: —But I don't know how to drive —he responded, indignant—. I have never driven in my life.

en: “Do you want to commit suicide?”
vi: "Anh may mắn lắm nó chỉ là cái bánh xe.
tr: “Canından olmak mı istiyorsun?
es: —¿Quiere suicidarse?
vi_translation: "You are very lucky, it's just a tire.
tr_translation: “Do you want to lose your life?”
es_translation: —Do you want to commit suicide?

en: “You’re lucky it was just a wheel! A bad driver and not even trying!”
vi: "Anh may mắn lắm nó chỉ là cái bánh xe. Đã là một tài xế tồi vậy mà còn không nghĩ cả tới chuyện cố gắng."
tr: “Şansın varmış ki yalnızca teker çıkmış! Hem kötü sürücü, hem de kullanmıyormuş
es: —¡Tiene suerte de que sólo haya sido una rueda! ¡No sabe conducir! ¡Ni siquiera había cogido un coche en su vida!
vi_translation: "You are very lucky, it's just a tire. Being a bad driver and not even thinking about trying."
tr_translation: "You're lucky that only the wheel came off! Not only was he a bad driver, but he also wasn't using it"
es_translation: —You're lucky it was only a wheel! You don't know how to drive! You had never even driven a car in your life!

en: “You don’t understand,” explained the criminal. “I wasn’t driving. There’s another man in the car.”
vi: "Các anh không hiểu." Tội phạm giải thích. "Không phải tôi đang lái xe. Còn có người khác ở trong xe."
tr: “Anlamıyorsunuz” dedi suçlu suçlu, “arabayı kullanan ben değildim. İçerde biri daha var.
es: —No me entienden —explicó el criminal—. Yo no conducía. Hay otro hombre en el coche.
vi_translation: "You don't understand." The criminal explained. "I wasn't the one driving. There was someone else in the car."
tr_translation: “You don't understand,” he said guiltily, “I wasn't the one driving the car. There's someone else inside.”
es_translation: —They don't understand me —explained the criminal—. I wasn't driving. There is another man in the car.

en: The shock that followed this declaration found voice in a sustained “Ah-h-h!” as the door of the coupé swung slowly open. The crowd—it was now a crowd—stepped back involuntarily, and when the door had opened wide there was a ghostly pause. Then, very gradually, part by part, a pale, dangling individual stepped out of the wreck, pawing tentatively at the ground with a large uncertain dancing shoe.
vi: Những tiếng kêu "Aaaa..." kéo dài bày tỏ nỗi kinh ngạc của mọi người sau khi nghe lời giải thích này. Rồi thì cánh cửa của chiếc xe hai chỗ đó từ từ mở ra. Đám đông, bây giờ thì đã thành đám đông rồi, tự giác bước lùi ra sau. Sau khi cánh cửa xe được mở rộng hẳn thì nó ngừng lại đứng yên một lát trông như ma quái. Từng phần từng phần từ từ nhô ra khỏi chiếc xe là một người mặt xanh mét, lảo đảo bước ra, chân trong chiếc giày khổ lớn ngập ngừng qua lại dò dẫm trên mặt đất.
tr: Bu itirafın neden olduğu şaşkınlık, “Aaa!” sesleriyle canlanırken spor arabanın kapısı yavaşça aralandı. Kalabalık -et­rafımız iyice dolmuştu- gönülsüzce geri çekildi. Kapı açıldığında tuhaf bir durgunluk oldu. Soluk yüzlü, cılız bir adam, elinde tuttuğu koca bir dans ayakkabısıyla, sağa sola tutunarak enkazdan adeta parça parça çıktı.
es: La impresión que provocó esta declaración se dejó oír en un «Ahhh» inacabable mientras la puerta del coche se abría muy despacio. La multitud —era ya una multitud— retrocedió instintivamente, y cuando la puerta acabó de abrirse se produjo un silencio espectral. Entonces, muy poco a poco, por partes, un individuo pálido y bamboleante salió del coche siniestrado, tanteando sin mucha seguridad el suelo con un descomunal zapato de baile.
vi_translation: The prolonged cries of "Aaaa..." expressed everyone's astonishment after hearing this explanation. Then the door of the two-seater car slowly opened. The crowd, now indeed a crowd, instinctively stepped back. Once the car door was fully open, it paused for a moment, looking eerie. Bit by bit, a person with a pale face slowly emerged from the car, staggering out, their large shoes hesitantly feeling the ground.
tr_translation: The astonishment caused by this confession came to life with exclamations of "Aaa!" as the door of the sports car slowly opened. The crowd - we were completely surrounded - reluctantly pulled back. There was a strange stillness when the door opened. A pale-faced, frail man, holding a large dance shoe in his hand, emerged from the wreckage almost piece by piece, clinging to anything he could.
es_translation: The impression caused by this statement was heard in an endless "Ahhh" as the car door opened very slowly. The crowd—it was already a crowd—instinctively stepped back, and when the door finished opening, an eerie silence ensued. Then, very slowly, bit by bit, a pale and staggering individual emerged from the wrecked car, tentatively feeling the ground with an enormous dancing shoe.

en: Blinded by the glare of the headlights and confused by the incessant groaning of the horns, the apparition stood swaying for a moment before he perceived the man in the duster.
vi: Bị chói mắt vì những ánh đèn xe rọi và bối rối bởi những tiếng còi xe rền la không ngớt, cái hình người mới xuất hiện đó đứng lảo đảo một lát trước khi nhận ra người đàn ông trong chiếc áo khoác dài.
tr: Farlardan gözü kamaşan, aralıksız öten kornalardan şaşkına dönen hayalet kılıklı kişi, uzun tozluklu adamı fark etmeden önce olduğu yerde bir süre sallandı.
es: Cegada por el resplandor de los faros y confundida por el incesante gemir de las bocinas, la aparición se tambaleó unos segundos antes de reparar en el hombre del guardapolvo.
vi_translation: Dazzled by the car headlights and confused by the incessant blaring of car horns, the newly appeared figure staggered for a moment before recognizing the man in the long coat.
tr_translation: The ghostly figure, dazzled by the headlights and bewildered by the incessant honking of horns, swayed in place for a while before noticing the man with the long gaiters.
es_translation: Blinded by the glare of the headlights and confused by the incessant wailing of the horns, the apparition staggered for a few seconds before noticing the man in the lab coat.

en: “Wha’s matter?” he inquired calmly. “Did we run outa gas?”
vi: "Có chuyện gì? Chúng ta hết xăng hả?" Ông ta hỏi một cách điềm tĩnh.
tr: “Ne oldu” diye sordu sakince “benzin mi bitti?
es: —¿Qué pasa? —preguntó muy tranquilo—. ¿Nos hemos quedado sin gasolina?
vi_translation: "What's the matter? Are we out of gas?" he asked calmly.
tr_translation: “What happened,” he asked calmly, “did we run out of gas?”
es_translation: —What's wrong? —he asked very calmly—. Have we run out of gas?

en: Half a dozen fingers pointed at the amputated wheel—he stared at it for a moment, and then looked upward as though he suspected that it had dropped from the sky.
vi: Khoảng nửa chục ngón tay chỉ vào chiếc bánh xe đã bị đứt lìa. Ông ta nhìn trừng nó một lát sau đó ngước nhìn lên cao làm như đang nghi ngờ có phải nó đã rớt từ trên trời xuống.
tr: Yarım düzine işaret parmağı kopmuş tekerleği gösteriyordu. Adam bir süre baktıktan sonra, yukarıdan düştüğünü sanmış olacak ki kafasını kaldırıp gökyüzüne baktı.
es: Media docena de dedos señalaron hacia la rueda amputada. La miró fijamente un momento y luego miró hacia arriba como si sospechara que había llovido del cielo.
vi_translation: About half a dozen fingers pointed at the wheel that had been severed. He stared at it for a moment, then looked up as if suspecting it had fallen from the sky.
tr_translation: Half a dozen index fingers were pointing at the broken wheel. After looking for a while, the man must have thought it fell from above, so he lifted his head and looked at the sky.
es_translation: Half a dozen fingers pointed towards the amputated wheel. He stared at it for a moment and then looked up as if he suspected it had rained down from the sky.

en: “It came off,” someone explained.
vi: "Nó bị rớt ra." Người nào đó giải thích.
tr: “Teker fırlamış” diye bir açıkladı biri.
es: —Se ha desprendido.
vi_translation: "It fell off." Someone explained.
tr_translation: "The wheel has come off," someone explained.
es_translation: —It has come loose.

en: He nodded.
vi: Ông ta gật đầu.
tr: Adama başını salladı.
es: Asintió.
vi_translation: He nodded.
tr_translation: The man nodded his head.
es_translation: He nodded.

en: “At first I din’ notice we’d stopped.”
vi: "Tôi đã không để ý xe chúng tôi đã ngừng lại."
tr: “Durduğumuzu fark etmedim.
es: —Al principio no me di cuenta de que nos habíamos parado.
vi_translation: "I didn't notice that our car had stopped."
tr_translation: “I didn't realize we had stopped.”
es_translation: —At first, I didn't realize that we had stopped.

en: A pause. Then, taking a long breath and straightening his shoulders, he remarked in a determined voice:
vi: Ngừng một lát, sau đó hít một hơi dài và ưỡn thẳng vai lên, ông ta nói với giọng kiên quyết.
tr: Yeniden sessizlik. Adam derin bir nefes alarak omuzlarını dikleştirdikten sonra kararlı bir sesle, “Bana benzin istasyonunun yerini söyleyecek biri var mı?” dedi
es: Silencio. Luego, tomando aire y poniéndose muy derecho, preguntó con decisión:
vi_translation: Pausing for a moment, then taking a deep breath and straightening his shoulders, he spoke with a determined voice.
tr_translation: Silence again. After taking a deep breath and straightening his shoulders, the man said in a determined voice, "Is there anyone who can tell me where the gas station is?"
es_translation: Silence. Then, taking a breath and standing up very straight, he asked decisively:

en: “Wonder’ff tell me where there’s a gas’line station?”
vi: "Không biết có ai có thể cho tôi hay trạm xăng ở đâu không?"
tr: Adam derin bir nefes alarak omuzlarını dikleştirdikten sonra kararlı bir sesle, “Bana benzin istasyonunun yerini söyleyecek biri var mı?” dedi
es: —¿Podrían decirme dónde hay una gasolinera?
vi_translation: "Does anyone know where the gas station is?"
tr_translation: After taking a deep breath and straightening his shoulders, the man said in a determined voice, "Is there anyone who can tell me where the gas station is?"
es_translation: —Could you tell me where there is a gas station?

en: At least a dozen men, some of them a little better off than he was, explained to him that wheel and car were no longer joined by any physical bond.
vi: Ít nhất có khoảng một chục người đàn ông, vài người trong số họ tỉnh táo hơn ông ta, giải thích cho ông ta hiểu rằng không còn mảnh gì nối dính giữa bánh và xe nữa.
tr: Ondan biraz daha ayık, en az bir düzine insan, tekerlekle otomobil arasında artık fiziksel bir bağ olmadığını anlatmaya çalıştı.
es: Por lo menos una docena de hombres, algunos apenas en mejor estado que él, le explicaron que la rueda y el coche ya no estaban unidos por ningún tipo de vínculo material.
vi_translation: At least about a dozen men, some of whom were more alert than he was, explained to him that there was no longer any piece connecting the wheel to the vehicle.
tr_translation: A dozen or so people, slightly more sober than him, tried to explain that there was no longer a physical connection between the wheel and the car.
es_translation: At least a dozen men, some barely in better condition than him, explained to him that the wheel and the car were no longer connected by any kind of material bond.

en: “Back out,” he suggested after a moment. “Put her in reverse.”
vi: "De lại." Sau một lát ông ta đưa ý kiến. "Sang số de lại."
tr: Aradan bir dakika geçti. “Geri çekilin” dedi adam, “arabayı çevirip eski haline getirelim.
es: —Salir marcha atrás —sugirió al cabo de un momento—. Meter la marcha atrás.
vi_translation: "Reverse." After a moment, he suggested. "Shift to reverse."
tr_translation: A minute passed. “Step back,” said the man, “let's turn the car around and restore it to its original state.”
es_translation: —Back out —he suggested after a moment—. Put it in reverse.

en: He hesitated.
vi: Ôg ta hơi ngập ngừng.
tr: Biraz durdu.
es: El hombre dudó.
vi_translation: He hesitated slightly.
tr_translation: He paused for a moment.
es_translation: The man hesitated.

en: “No harm in trying,” he said.
vi: "Có thử cũng chẳng nguy hại gì."
tr: “Denemekten zarar gelmez.
es: —No se pierde nada con probar —dijo.
vi_translation: "There's no harm in trying."
tr_translation: “There's no harm in trying.
es_translation: —Nothing is lost by trying —he said.

en: The caterwauling horns had reached a crescendo and I turned away and cut across the lawn toward home. I glanced back once. A wafer of a moon was shining over Gatsby’s house, making the night fine as before, and surviving the laughter and the sound of his still glowing garden. A sudden emptiness seemed to flow now from the windows and the great doors, endowing with complete isolation the figure of the host, who stood on the porch, his hand up in a formal gesture of farewell.
vi: Tiếng còi xe kêu như mèo gào đã lên tới cực độ, tôi quay lưng bước tắt ngang bãi cỏ đi về nhà, chỉ ngoảnh lại liếc nhìn thêm một lần. Mảnh trăng tròn mỏng manh đang lung linh tỏa ánh sáng lên trên nhà Gatsby tạo ra một buổi tối trăng thanh xinh đẹp giống như những đêm trăng trước, làm như trăng không bị hề hấn gì bởi những tiếng cười và những tiếng động phát ra từ khu vườn vẫn còn rực rỡ. Một nỗi trống trải đột nhiên tràn ra từ những cửa sồ và những của lớn, bủa vây cô lập hoàn toàn hình dáng người chủ nhà đang đừng trước hiên với cánh tay giơ cao vẫy chào tạm biệt một cách trang trọng.
tr: Kornaların viyaklamaları dayanılmaz hale gelmişti. Oradan uzaklaşıp aradaki yeşil alanı geçerek evin yolunu tuttum. Varmadan, dönüp bir kez daha baktım. Gatsby’nin evi üzerinde parlayan ay geceyi daha da güzelleştiriyor, kahkaha ve seslerin dindiği, parlak bahçeye hala hayat veriyordu. Pencere ve görkemli kapılardan dışarı zamansız bir boşluk taşıyor, o boşluk terasta durup elini resmi bir veda için kaldıran sahibine büyük bir yalnızlık bahşediyordu.
es: El aullido de las bocinas iba in crescendo. Di media vuelta y, pisando el césped, me fui a casa. Me volví a mirar una vez. La luna, como una hostia, brillaba sobre la casa de Gatsby para que la noche fuera tan hermosa como antes: había sobrevivido a las risas y a los ruidos del jardín, todavía iluminado. Un vacío repentino parecía fluir ahora de las ventanas y las puertas inmensas, envolviendo en un aislamiento absoluto al anfitrión, que seguía en el porche, con la mano levantada en un protocolario gesto de despedida.
vi_translation: The car horn sounded like a cat's wail, reaching its peak, I turned my back and walked across the lawn to go home, only glancing back one more time. A thin, full moon was shimmering, casting its light over Gatsby's house, creating a beautiful moonlit evening just like the previous moonlit nights, as if the moon was unaffected by the laughter and noises emanating from the still vibrant garden. A sudden emptiness poured out from the windows and the large doors, completely enveloping and isolating the figure of the host standing on the porch, with his arm raised in a solemn farewell wave.
tr_translation: The blaring of the horns had become unbearable. I moved away from there, crossed the green area in between, and headed home. Before reaching, I turned and looked back once more. The moon shining over Gatsby's house made the night even more beautiful, still giving life to the bright garden where laughter and voices had ceased. An untimely emptiness emanated from the windows and grand doors, bestowing a great loneliness upon the owner standing on the terrace, raising his hand for a formal farewell.
es_translation: The howl of the horns was increasing. I turned around and, stepping on the grass, went home. I turned back to look once. The moon, like a host, shone over Gatsby's house so that the night was as beautiful as before: it had survived the laughter and the noises of the garden, still illuminated. A sudden emptiness now seemed to flow from the immense windows and doors, enveloping the host in absolute isolation, who remained on the porch, with his hand raised in a formal gesture of farewell.

en: Reading over what I have written so far, I see I have given the impression that the events of three nights several weeks apart were all that absorbed me. On the contrary, they were merely casual events in a crowded summer, and, until much later, they absorbed me infinitely less than my personal affairs.
vi: Đọc lại những gì tôi đã viết cho tới giờ, tôi nghĩ tôi đã tạo cho người đọc có cảm giác như những sự việc xẩy ra trong ba đêm, cách nhau nhiều tuần, đều là những việc mà tôi miệt mài chăm chú. Trái ngược lại, chúng chỉ là những sự việc thông thường trong một mùa hè bận rộn, và mãi sau này chúng mới khiến tôi quan tâm một cách vô hạn còn hơn cả những vấn đề cá nhân của tôi.
tr: Şimdiye dek yazdıklarıma bakınca, dikkatimin birkaç hafta arayla üç ayrı gecede toplandığını anlıyorum. Oysa bunlar hareketli bir yaz mevsiminin olağan etkinlikleriydi ve üzerinden çok zaman geçene kadar, kendi gönül işlerimden çok daha az meşgul ediyorlardı beni.
es: Al releer lo que llevo escrito, creo haber dado la impresión de que los acontecimientos de tres noches separadas entre sí por varias semanas me absorbieron por completo. Todo lo contrario: sólo fueron acontecimientos sin importancia en un verano muy ajetreado, y, hasta mucho después, me absorbieron infinitamente menos que mis propios asuntos.
vi_translation: Reading again what I have written so far, I think I have given the reader the impression that the events occurring over three nights, spaced weeks apart, were things I was diligently focused on. On the contrary, they were just ordinary events in a busy summer, and only later did they infinitely capture my interest, even more than my personal issues.
tr_translation: When I look at what I have written so far, I realize that my attention was gathered on three separate nights, spaced a few weeks apart. Yet these were the usual activities of a lively summer season, and until much time had passed, they occupied me far less than my own matters of the heart.
es_translation: Upon rereading what I have written, I believe I may have given the impression that the events of three nights, separated by several weeks, completely absorbed me. Quite the opposite: they were merely insignificant events in a very busy summer, and, until much later, they absorbed me infinitely less than my own affairs.

en: Most of the time I worked. In the early morning the sun threw my shadow westward as I hurried down the white chasms of lower New York to the Probity Trust. I knew the other clerks and young bond-salesmen by their first names, and lunched with them in dark, crowded restaurants on little pig sausages and mashed potatoes and coffee. I even had a short affair with a girl who lived in Jersey City and worked in the accounting department, but her brother began throwing mean looks in my direction, so when she went on her vacation in July I let it blow quietly away.
vi: Tôi dành hầu hết thời giờ của mình vào cho làm việc. Vào mỗi buổi sáng sớm trong lúc nắng mặt trời chiếu ngã chiếc bóng của tôi về phía tây, thì lúc đó tôi đang vội vã đi trong lòng những vực thẳm trắng của phố dưới New York tới chỗ làm việc tên Probity Trust. Tôi quen thân với những thư ký và những nhân viên bán chứng khoán trẻ khác trong sở, gọi họ bằng tên gọi thân mật. Chúng tôi cùng nhau ăn trưa trong những quán ăn tối tăm đông đúc với những món như xúc xích heo, khoai tây nghiền và cà phê. Tôi còn có một mối tình ngắn ngủi với một cô làm trong phòng kế toán, nhà ở thành phố New Jersey. Thế nhưng khi anh trai của cô ta bắt đầu ném cho tôi những cái nhìn dữ tợn hung ác thì tôi lặng lẽ dứt bỏ mốt tình này vào tháng Bảy khi cô ta đi nghỉ mát.
tr: Zamanımın çoğunu çalışarak geçiriyordum. Sabahın erken saatlerinde güneş gölgemi batı yönünde uzatırken, New York’un aşağı mahallelerinin beyaz vadilerinden geçerek Probity Şirketi’ne doğru koşturuyordum. Şirketteki katiplerin ve senet satıcısı gençlerin hepsinin adını bilirdim. Birlikte loş ve kalabalık lokantalarda oturur sosis ve patates püresi yer kahve içerdik. Hatta muhasebe bölümünde çalışan Jersey City’de oturan bir kızla ufak bir gönül ilişkim bile olmuştu. Ağabeyinin bana manidar baktığını fark edince, kızın temmuzda izin alıp tatile çıkmasını fırsat bilerek işin peşini sessiz sedasız bıraktım.
es: Pasé trabajando la mayor parte del tiempo. A primera hora de la mañana, el sol proyectaba mi sombra hacia el oeste y yo descendía a toda prisa los blancos abismos que llevan de la zona baja de Nueva York al Probity Trust. Conocía por sus nombres a los otros empleados y a los jóvenes vendedores de bonos, y en restaurantes atestados y oscuros comía con ellos salchichas de cerdo, puré de patatas y café. Incluso tuve una breve aventura con una chica que vivía en Jersey City y trabajaba en el departamento de contabilidad, pero su hermano empezó a mirarme con malos ojos, y cuando la chica se fue de vacaciones en julio, di por terminado el asunto.
vi_translation: I spend most of my time working. Every early morning, as the sunlight casts my shadow towards the west, I am hurrying through the white canyons of downtown New York to my workplace called Probity Trust. I am familiar with the secretaries and the young stockbrokers in the office, calling them by their nicknames. We have lunch together in dark, crowded diners with dishes like pork sausages, mashed potatoes, and coffee. I also had a brief romance with a girl who worked in the accounting department and lived in New Jersey. However, when her brother started giving me fierce, hostile looks, I quietly ended this relationship in July when she went on vacation.
tr_translation: I spent most of my time working. In the early hours of the morning, as the sun stretched my shadow westward, I would rush towards Probity Company, passing through the white valleys of New York's lower neighborhoods. I knew the names of all the clerks and young bond sellers at the company. We would sit together in dim and crowded diners, eating sausages and mashed potatoes, and drinking coffee. I even had a small romantic affair with a girl who worked in the accounting department and lived in Jersey City. When I noticed her brother giving me meaningful looks, I quietly let the matter drop, taking advantage of the girl's vacation in July.
es_translation: I spent most of the time working. Early in the morning, the sun cast my shadow to the west as I hurriedly descended the white abysses that lead from the lower part of New York to the Probity Trust. I knew the other employees and the young bond salesmen by their names, and in crowded, dark restaurants, I ate with them pork sausages, mashed potatoes, and coffee.
