tr: Sıkıcı bir yolculuk olacak, diye düşünüyordum. Ancak West Egg’e daha varmadan, Gatsby o süslü cümleleri kullanmayı bırakmış, karamel rengi pantolonunun dizine kararsızca vurmaya başlamıştı.
es: Y entonces llegó aquel viaje desconcertante. No habíamos pasado todavía West Egg Village cuando Gatsby empezó a dejar sin terminar sus elegantísimas frases y a golpearse con la palma de la mano, inseguro, la rodilla del traje color caramelo.
vi_translation: And then this trip turned my thoughts upside down. When we had not yet reached the village of West Egg, Gatsby began to trail off his elegant and graceful sentences, hesitantly patting his knee in his light brown suit.
tr_translation: I was thinking it was going to be a boring journey. But before we even reached West Egg, Gatsby had stopped using those fancy phrases and had started tapping his caramel-colored trousers indecisively.
es_translation: And then came that bewildering trip. We hadn't yet passed West Egg Village when Gatsby began to leave his most elegant sentences unfinished and to slap his caramel-colored suit's knee uncertainly with the palm of his hand.

en: “Look here, old sport,” he broke out surprisingly, “what’s your opinion of me, anyhow?”
vi: "Nghe đây anh bạn già." Gatsby đột ngột nói.
tr: Derken bir anda bana döndü ve “Benim hakkımda ne düşünüyorsun, ahbap?” diye soruverdi.
es: —Dime, compañero —soltó de pronto—, ¿qué piensas de mí?
vi_translation: "Listen here, old sport." Gatsby suddenly said. "What do you think of me?"
tr_translation: Then suddenly he turned to me and asked, "What do you think of me, buddy?"
es_translation: —Tell me, comrade —he suddenly blurted out—, what do you think of me?

en: A little overwhelmed, I began the generalized evasions which that question deserves.
vi: "Anh nghĩ sao về tôi?" Hơi bị chưng hửng, tôi bắt đầu đưa ra những câu trả lời tránh né chung chung dành để trả lời cho loại câu hỏi này.
tr: Afallamıştım, böylesi bir soruya uygun düşecek genellemelerle onu geçiştirmeyi denedim.
es: Un poco abrumado, recurrí a las evasivas y generalidades que merece esa pregunta.
vi_translation: Slightly taken aback, I began to give evasive, general answers typically reserved for such questions.
tr_translation: I was stunned and tried to brush him off with generalities that would fit such a question.
es_translation: A bit overwhelmed, I resorted to the evasions and generalities that such a question deserves.

en: “Well, I’m going to tell you something about my life,” he interrupted. “I don’t want you to get a wrong idea of me from all these stories you hear.”
vi: "Được, tôi sẽ kể cho anh nghe một chút ít về cuộc đời của tôi." Gatsby cắt ngang. "Tôi không muốn anh hiểu lầm tôi qua những chuyện anh đã từng nghe được."
tr: “En iyisi sana hayatım hakkında birkaç hakikat anlatayım,” diyerek sözümü kesti. “Hakkımda anlatılan zırvalıklara kapılıp beni yanlış tanımanı istemem.
es: —Bien, voy a contarte algo de mi vida —me interrumpió—. No quiero que te hagas una idea equivocada sobre mí con todas esas historias que habrás oído.
vi_translation: "Alright, I'll tell you a little bit about my life." Gatsby interrupted. "I don't want you to misunderstand me because of the things you've heard."
tr_translation: “It's best if I tell you a few truths about my life,” he interrupted me. “I don't want you to be misled by the nonsense told about me and get the wrong impression.”
es_translation: —Well, I'm going to tell you something about my life —he interrupted me—. I don't want you to get the wrong idea about me with all those stories you must have heard.

en: So he was aware of the bizarre accusations that flavoured conversation in his halls.
vi: Thì ra Gatsby đã biết được những lời vu khống kỳ quái từng làm đậm đà những mẫu chuyện ở trong những gian phòng nhà anh ta.
tr: Demek partilerini renklendiren, hakkındaki o ilginç dedikodulardan kendisi de haberdardı.
es: Así que conocía todas las acusaciones disparatadas que sazonaban la conversación en sus salones.
vi_translation: It turns out that Gatsby had learned about the bizarre slanders that had spiced up the conversations in the rooms of his house.
tr_translation: So, the one who enlivened their parties was also aware of those interesting rumors about themselves.
es_translation: So he knew all the absurd accusations that seasoned the conversation in their salons.

en: “I’ll tell you God’s truth.” His right hand suddenly ordered divine retribution to stand by. “I am the son of some wealthy people in the Middle West—all dead now. I was brought up in America but educated at Oxford, because all my ancestors have been educated there for many years. It is a family tradition.”
vi: "Tôi sẽ kể cho anh nghe sự thật." Cánh tay phải của Gatsby đột ngột đưa lên tỏ vẻ thề thốt. "Tôi là con trai của một gia đình giàu có miền Trung Tây, nhà tôi ai cũng qua đời cả rồi. Tôi đã được nuôi lớn lên ở nước Mỹ nhưng lại theo học ở trường Oxford bởi vì tổ tiên của tôi đều được giáo dục ở trường đó qua nhiều thế hệ. Đó là truyền thống của giòng họ tôi.
tr: “Tanrı şahidimdir, sana anlatacaklarım harfiyen doğru,” derken sağ elini de kaldırarak yeminini pekiştirdi. Orta Batılı zengin bir ailenin oğluyum, şimdi hiçbiri hayatta değiller. Amerika’da büyüdüm ancak tüm atalarım gibi ben de Oxford’da gittim, bu bizde bir aile geleneğidir.
es: —Juro por Dios que te diré la verdad —su mano derecha ordenó inmediatamente que estuviera preparado el castigo divino—. Soy hijo de una familia acomodada del Medio Oeste. Todos los míos han muerto. Crecí en América pero me eduqué en Oxford, porque, desde hace muchos años, todos mis antepasados se han educado allí. Es una tradición familiar.
vi_translation: "I will tell you the truth." Gatsby's right arm suddenly raised as if to swear. "I am the son of a wealthy family from the Midwest, all of my family members have passed away. I was raised in America but went to school at Oxford because my ancestors have been educated there for many generations. It is a tradition of my family line.
tr_translation: "God is my witness, what I'm about to tell you is absolutely true," he said, raising his right hand to reinforce his oath. I am the son of a wealthy Middle Western family, now none of them are alive. I grew up in America, but like all my ancestors, I also went to Oxford; it is a family tradition for us.”
es_translation: —I swear to God that I will tell you the truth —his right hand immediately commanded that divine punishment be prepared—. I am the son of a well-off family from the Midwest. All of my relatives have died. I grew up in America but was educated at Oxford, because, for many years, all my ancestors have been educated there. It is a family tradition.

en: He looked at me sideways—and I knew why Jordan Baker had believed he was lying. He hurried the phrase “educated at Oxford,” or swallowed it, or choked on it, as though it had bothered him before. And with this doubt, his whole statement fell to pieces, and I wondered if there wasn’t something a little sinister about him, after all.
vi: Gatsby liếc mắt ngang nhìn tôi, và bây giờ thì tôi biết tại sao Jordan Baker lại nghĩ rằng anh ta đã nói láo. Gatsby nói lướt nhanh câu "theo học tại Oxford" làm như nuốt chửng những chữ đó, làm như chúng đã mắc nghẹn trong cổ và làm anh khó chịu từ lâu. Với nỗi nghi ngờ này, tất cả những lời nói của Gatsby như vỡ tan từng mảnh, và tôi tự hỏi cuối cùng phải chăng anh không mang chút gì nham hiểm.
tr: Yan gözle baktı; o anda neden Jordan Baker’ın onun yalan söylediğini düşündüğünü anlamıştım: “Oxford’a gittim” derken, bu onun canını sıkmıyormuşçasına, sözcükleri ağzında boğarak yutarcasına gevelemişti. Şüphem yüzünden, anlattıkları da anlamını yitiriyor, hayatında sahiden de, biraz olsun tekinsiz bir şeyler olup olmadığı konusunda meraklanıyordum.
es: Me miró de reojo, y comprendí por qué Jordan Baker creía que Gatsby mentía. Pronunció deprisa la frase «me eduqué en Oxford», o casi se la tragó, o se le atragantó, como si ya le hubiera dado problemas antes. Con esta duda toda su declaración se vino abajo, y me pregunté si, al fin y al cabo, no había en él algo siniestro.
vi_translation: Gatsby glanced sideways at me, and now I knew why Jordan Baker thought he was lying. Gatsby quickly said the phrase "studied at Oxford" as if swallowing the words, as if they had been stuck in his throat and had long caused him discomfort. With this doubt, all of Gatsby's words seemed to shatter into pieces, and I wondered if, in the end, he wasn't harboring something sinister.
tr_translation: He looked with a blank stare; at that moment, I understood why Jordan Baker thought he was lying: when he said, "I went to Oxford," he mumbled the words as if it didn't bother him, swallowing them as if choking on them. Because of my suspicion, what he was saying lost its meaning, and I wondered if there was indeed something a little unsettling in his life.
es_translation: He looked at me out of the corner of his eye, and I understood why Jordan Baker believed that Gatsby was lying. He hurriedly pronounced the phrase "I was educated at Oxford," or almost swallowed it, or it got stuck in his throat, as if it had already caused him trouble before. With this doubt, his entire statement fell apart, and I wondered if, after all, there wasn't something sinister about him.

en: “What part of the Middle West?” I inquired casually.
vi: "Phần nào của miền Trung Tây?" tôi hỏi một cánh thản nhiên.
tr: Sırf sormak için, “Orta Batı’nın neresindensin?” diye sordum.
es: —¿De qué parte del Medio Oeste? —pregunté sin mucho interés.
vi_translation: "Which part of the Midwest?" I asked casually.
tr_translation: Just to ask, I said, "Where in the Midwest are you from?"
es_translation: —Which part of the Midwest? —I asked without much interest.

en: “San Francisco.”
vi: "San Francisco"
tr: “San Francisco.
es: —De San Francisco.
vi_translation: "San Francisco"
tr_translation: “San Francisco.”
es_translation: —From San Francisco.

en: “I see.”
vi: "Vậy à."
tr: “Demek öyle.
es: —Ya.
vi_translation: "Is that so."
tr_translation: “So that's how it is.”
es_translation: —Okay.

en: “My family all died and I came into a good deal of money.”
vi: "Cả gia đình tôi đều qua đời và tôi được hưởng một gia sản kếch sù."
tr: “Ailemdeki herkesi kaybedince bana büyük bir miras kaldı.
es: —Mi familia murió y heredé una buena cantidad de dinero.
vi_translation: "My entire family passed away, and I inherited a vast fortune."
tr_translation: “When I lost everyone in my family, I inherited a large fortune.”
es_translation: —My family died and I inherited a good amount of money.

en: His voice was solemn, as if the memory of that sudden extinction of a clan still haunted him. For a moment I suspected that he was pulling my leg, but a glance at him convinced me otherwise.
vi: Giọng nói của Gatsby rất trang nghiêm làm như cái ký ức về sự đột nhiên tiêu vong của giòng họ vẫn còn ám ảnh mình. Trong giây lát tôi nghi ngờ Gatsby đang đùa cợt với tôi, nhưng khi liếc nhìn anh thì tôi lại tin tưởng hoàn toàn.
tr: Aniden tüm ailesini kaybetmiş oluşunun ona hala ıstırap verdiği sesindeki kederden de belli oluyordu. Hatta bir an, benimle kafa bulduğunu sanmış, ancak yüzüne baktığımda şaka yapmadığını anlamıştım.
es: Su voz era solemne, como si el recuerdo de aquella repentina extinción del clan todavía le pesara en el alma. Por un momento sospeché que me estaba tomando el pelo, pero me bastó mirarlo para convencerme de lo contrario.
vi_translation: Gatsby's voice was very solemn, as if the memory of the sudden demise of his family still haunted him. For a moment, I suspected Gatsby was joking with me, but when I glanced at him, I completely believed him again.
tr_translation: It was evident from the sorrow in his voice that the sudden loss of his entire family still caused him anguish. For a moment, I thought he was joking with me, but when I looked at his face, I realized he wasn't.
es_translation: His voice was solemn, as if the memory of that sudden extinction of the clan still weighed heavily on his soul. For a moment I suspected he was pulling my leg, but a single look at him was enough to convince me otherwise.

en: “After that I lived like a young rajah in all the capitals of Europe—Paris, Venice, Rome—collecting jewels, chiefly rubies, hunting big game, painting a little, things for myself only, and trying to forget something very sad that had happened to me long ago.”
vi: "Sau đó tôi đã sống như một tiểu vương tôn khắp các thủ đô ở châu Âu như Paris, Venice, Rome - Sưu tầm nữ trang chủ yếu là hồng ngọc, đi săn các thú lớn, cũng có vẽ tranh một chút - chỉ toàn những việc cho cá nhân để cố quên đi những đau buồn đã xẩy ra cho tôi trong quá khứ."
tr: “Sonra, Paris, Venedik, Roma ve Avrupa’nın bütün büyük kentlerinde, bir prens misali yaşadım; yakut başta olmak üzere değerli taşlar toplayarak, av partilerine katılarak ve yalnız kendim için de olsa, resim yaparak, uzun zaman önce yaşadığım o elem verici olayı unutma arzusuyla oyalandım durdum.
es: —Entonces viví como un joven rajá en todas las capitales de Europa: París, Venecia, Roma, coleccionando joyas, principalmente rubíes, practicando la caza mayor, pintando un poco, exclusivamente para mí, e intentando olvidar algo muy triste que me había pasado hacía mucho tiempo.
vi_translation: "After that, I lived like a young prince across the capitals of Europe such as Paris, Venice, Rome - Collecting jewelry, mainly rubies, hunting big game, also doing a bit of painting - all personal activities to try to forget the sorrows that had happened to me in the past."
tr_translation: “Then, in Paris, Venice, Rome, and all the great cities of Europe, I lived like a prince; collecting precious stones, especially rubies, participating in hunting parties, and painting, even if only for myself, all the while trying to distract myself with the desire to forget that sorrowful event I experienced long ago.”
es_translation: —Then I lived like a young rajah in all the capitals of Europe: Paris, Venice, Rome, collecting jewels, mainly rubies, practicing big-game hunting, painting a little, exclusively for myself, and trying to forget something very sad that had happened to me a long time ago.

en: With an effort I managed to restrain my incredulous laughter. The very phrases were worn so threadbare that they evoked no image except that of a turbaned “character” leaking sawdust at every pore as he pursued a tiger through the Bois de Boulogne.
vi: Tôi phải cố gắng kìm hãm để khỏi phá lên cười hoài nghi. Những ngôn từ xử dụng quá cũ rích khiến cho chúng không gợi nên hình ảnh gì hơn ngoài hình ảnh của một nhân vật đầu đội khăn vấn kiểu Ả Rập, mùn cưa rơi rớt từ mỗi lỗ chân lông khi anh ta đang đuổi rượt theo một con cọp trong rừng cây công viên Bois de Boulogne phía tây Paris.
tr: Gülmemek için kendimi zor zapt ediyordum. Anlattıkları öylesine bilindik hikayelerdi ki, ister istemez gözümün önüne, her tarafından bıçkı talaşı saçılarak Boulogne Ormanı’nda bir kaplanın izini sürmekte olan, kafası sarıklı bir tip geliyordu.
es: A duras penas pude contener una carcajada incrédula. Aquellas frases eran tan tópicas y tan poco convincentes que la única imagen que conseguían evocar era la de un monigote con turbante que sudaba serrín mientras perseguía a un tigre por el Bois de Boulogne.
vi_translation: I had to try hard to keep myself from bursting into skeptical laughter. The words used were so outdated that they evoked no image other than that of a character wearing an Arab-style turban, sawdust falling from every pore as he chased a tiger through the trees of Bois de Boulogne park in western Paris.
tr_translation: I was struggling hard not to laugh. The stories they told were so familiar that, inevitably, a turbaned figure tracking a tiger in the Boulogne Forest, with sawdust flying everywhere, came to mind.
es_translation: With great difficulty, I managed to contain an incredulous laugh. Those phrases were so clichéd and so unconvincing that the only image they managed to evoke was that of a puppet with a turban sweating sawdust while chasing a tiger through the Bois de Boulogne.

en: “Then came the war, old sport. It was a great relief, and I tried very hard to die, but I seemed to bear an enchanted life. I accepted a commission as first lieutenant when it began. In the Argonne Forest I took the remains of my machine-gun battalion so far forward that there was a half mile gap on either side of us where the infantry couldn’t advance. We stayed there two days and two nights, a hundred and thirty men with sixteen Lewis guns, and when the infantry came up at last they found the insignia of three German divisions among the piles of dead. I was promoted to be a major, and every Allied government gave me a decoration—even Montenegro, little Montenegro down on the Adriatic Sea!”
vi: "Thế rồi chiến tranh đã xẩy ra, anh bạn già. Lúc đó tôi cảm thấy đó là một giải thoát lớn, tôi đã cố gắng làm mọi cách để mình được chết, thế nhưng cuộc đời của tôi hình như đã được ban phép mầu nhiệm. Lúc mới nhập ngũ tôi được mang chức Trung Úy. Ở rừng Argonne Forest tôi đã chỉ huy hai chi đội súng máy tiến sâu phía trước cách xa cả nửa dặm giữa quân đội hai bên, nơi mà quân bộ binh không thể tiến tới được. Chúng tôi đã ở đó trong hai ngày hai đêm với một trăm ba mươi quân và mười sáu khẩu đại liên Lewis. Khi quân bộ binh tiến được tới đó thì họ tìm ra huy hiệu của ba sư đoàn lính Đức nằm trong số những đám tử thi. Tôi được thăng cấp thiếu tá và mọi chính quyền đồng minh đều tặng tôi huân chương, ngay cả Montenegro, quốc gia Montenegro nhỏ bé nằm bên bờ biển Adriatic Sea."
tr: “Sonra savaş patlak verdi. Bu aslında benim için büyük bir teselliydi; ölmek için elimden geleni yaptım, ancak sanki yaşamım bir tılsımla korunuyordu. Savaş başladığında teğmendim. Argonne Ormanı’ndayken, iki makineli tüfek tugayını cephede öyle ilerletmiştim ki, arayı kapatamayan iki yanımızdaki piyade bölüklerine olan mesafemiz birer kilometreyi geçmişti. Tam yüz otuz asker ve on altı Lewis tüfeği ile iki gün iki gece bölgede kaldık; en nihayetinde piyadeler ulaştığında ceset yığınlarının arasında üç Alman tümeninin nişanını buldular. Binbaşılığa terfi edildim ve tüm müttefik ülkelerden, hatta şu Karadağ’dan bile onur nişanı aldım. Düşünsene, Adriyatik’teki o küçük Karadağ’dan!
es: —Luego llegó la guerra, compañero. Fue un gran alivio, y puse todo mi empeño en morir, pero era como si un encantamiento protegiera mi vida. Recibí la graduación de primer teniente al comienzo de la guerra. En el bosque de Argonne conduje adelante a lo que quedaba de mi batallón de ametralladoras hasta que, a un flanco y a otro, despejamos un espacio de cerca de un kilómetro por el que la infantería no podía avanzar. Resistimos allí dos días y dos noches, ciento treinta hombres con dieciséis ametralladoras Lewis, y cuando por fin llegó la infantería encontró las enseñas de tres divisiones alemanas entre los montones de muertos. Me ascendieron a mayor, y todos los gobiernos aliados me condecoraron, incluso Montenegro, ¡el pequeño Montenegro, a orillas del mar Adriático!
vi_translation: "Then the war broke out, my old friend. At that time, I felt it was a great liberation, I tried everything to die, but it seemed my life had been granted a miraculous blessing. When I first enlisted, I was given the rank of Lieutenant. In the Argonne Forest, I commanded two machine gun squads to advance half a mile ahead between the two armies, where the infantry couldn't reach. We stayed there for two days and two nights with one hundred and thirty soldiers and sixteen Lewis machine guns. When the infantry managed to reach there, they found the insignia of three German divisions among the corpses. I was promoted to Major and all the Allied governments awarded me medals, even Montenegro, the small country on the Adriatic Sea."
tr_translation: “Then the war broke out. This was actually a great consolation for me; I did everything I could to die, but it was as if my life was protected by a charm. I was a lieutenant when the war started. While in the Argonne Forest, I had advanced two machine gun brigades so far at the front that the distance to the infantry companies on either side of us, who couldn't catch up, had exceeded a kilometer each. We stayed in the area for two days and two nights with one hundred and thirty soldiers and sixteen Lewis guns; when the infantry finally arrived, they found the insignia of three German divisions among the piles of corpses. I was promoted to major and received honors from all allied countries, even from that Montenegro. Imagine, from that little Montenegro in the Adriatic!”
es_translation: —Then the war came, comrade. It was a great relief, and I put all my effort into dying, but it was as if a spell protected my life. I received the rank of first lieutenant at the beginning of the war. In the Argonne Forest, I led what was left of my machine gun battalion forward until, on one flank and the other, we cleared a space of about a kilometer through which the infantry could not advance. We held out there for two days and two nights, one hundred and thirty men with sixteen Lewis machine guns, and when the infantry finally arrived, they found the insignia of three German divisions among the heaps of dead. I was promoted to major, and all the allied governments decorated me, even Montenegro, the little Montenegro, on the shores of the Adriatic Sea!

en: Little Montenegro! He lifted up the words and nodded at them—with his smile. The smile comprehended Montenegro’s troubled history and sympathized with the brave struggles of the Montenegrin people. It appreciated fully the chain of national circumstances which had elicited this tribute from Montenegro’s warm little heart. My incredulity was submerged in fascination now; it was like skimming hastily through a dozen magazines.
vi: Quốc gia Montenegro nhỏ bé! Gatsby lên giọng và gục gặc đầu khi nhắc những chữ này kèm theo một nụ cười. Nụ cười như cảm thông cái lịch sử rối răm của Montenegro và nỗi thương cảm cho cuộc chiến đấu dũng cảm của người dân quốc gia Montenegro. Sự hoài nghi của tôi đã hoàn toàn bị nhận chìm vào sự khâm phục, tôi thấy mình dường như đang vội vã đọc lướt qua hàng chục tờ tạp chí.
tr: O küçük Karadağ’dan! Sözcükleri yüceltircesine, üzerlerine basa basa söylemişti, gülümsedi. Bu gülümsemeden, Karadağ’ın tarihindeki acılara ve halkının kahramanca mücadelesine yakınlık duyduğu anlaşılıyordu. Bu aynı zamanda onun, Karadağlıların sevgi dolu küçük gönüllerinden kopmuş olan bu nişanı, onların içinde bulunduğu koşulları dikkate alarak değerlendirdiğinin de bir göstergesiydi. Kuşkularım artık büyük bir merakın içinde dağılıyor, bu ise bana onlarca dergiyi aceleyle karıştırmak gibi bir his veriyordu.
es: ¡El pequeño Montenegro! Resaltaba las palabras y las confirmaba con una sonrisa. La sonrisa se hacía cargo de la turbulenta historia de Montenegro y apoyaba las luchas heroicas del pueblo montenegrino. Apreciaba en su conjunto la cadena de circunstancias nacionales que habían desembocado en la condecoración concedida por el pequeño y ardiente corazón de Montenegro. Mi incredulidad fue superada por la fascinación: era como ojear a toda prisa un montón de revistas baratas.
vi_translation: The small country of Montenegro! Gatsby raised his voice and nodded as he mentioned these words with a smile. A smile that seemed to sympathize with the tangled history of Montenegro and the brave struggle of its people. My skepticism was completely submerged in admiration, and I found myself seemingly rushing through dozens of magazine pages.
tr_translation: Oh, from little Montenegro! He had spoken the words with such elevation, emphasizing each one, and smiled. From this smile, it was understood that he felt a closeness to the pains in Montenegro's history and the heroic struggle of its people. This was also an indication that he evaluated this medal, which had come from the loving little hearts of Montenegrins, considering the conditions they were in. My doubts were now dispersing in a great curiosity, which gave me the feeling of hastily flipping through dozens of magazines.
es_translation: The little Montenegro! He emphasized the words and confirmed them with a smile. The smile took charge of Montenegro's turbulent history and supported the heroic struggles of the Montenegrin people. He appreciated as a whole the chain of national circumstances that had led to the decoration granted by the small and ardent heart of Montenegro. My disbelief was overcome by fascination: it was like hastily flipping through a pile of cheap magazines.

en: He reached in his pocket, and a piece of metal, slung on a ribbon, fell into my palm.
vi: Gatsby thọc tay vào trong túi lấy ra một miếng huy chương cột bằng sợi dây ruy băng đặt vào lòng bàn tay tôi.
tr: Elini cebine attı, ucunda bir kurdele bağlı olan bir madeni avucumun içine bıraktı.
es: Se metió la mano en el bolsillo, y un trozo de metal atado a una cinta me cayó en la palma.
vi_translation: Gatsby reached into his pocket, took out a medal tied with a ribbon, and placed it in my palm.
tr_translation: He put his hand in his pocket and dropped a coin with a ribbon tied to it into my palm.
es_translation: He put his hand in his pocket, and a piece of metal tied to a ribbon fell into my palm.

en: “That’s the one from Montenegro.”
vi: "Món này do Montenegro tặng."
tr: “İşte, Karadağ’ın verdiği nişan bu” dedi.
es: —Es la condecoración de Montenegro.
vi_translation: "This dish is a gift from Montenegro."
tr_translation: “Here, this is the medal given by Montenegro,” he said.
es_translation: —It is the decoration of Montenegro.

en: To my astonishment, the thing had an authentic look. “Orderi di Danilo,” ran the circular legend, “Montenegro, Nicolas Rex.”
vi: Tôi lấy làm kinh ngạc vì vật đó trông rất thật, có in dòng chữ chạy theo vòng tròn quanh. "Orderi di Danilo, Montenegro, Nicolas Rex."
tr: Gördüğümün hakiki bir nişana benzemesi karşısında afallamıştım. Üzerinde daire biçiminde ‘Orderi di Danilo. Montenegro Nicolas Rex’ yazıyordu.
es: Para mi asombro, la medalla parecía auténtica. «Orderi di Danilo», se leía en círculo, «Montenegro, Nicolas Rex».
vi_translation: I was amazed because that object looked very real, with text printed in a circle around it. "Order of Danilo, Montenegro, King Nicholas."
tr_translation: I was astonished to see that it resembled a real medal. On it, in a circular shape, it read ‘Orderi di Danilo. Montenegro Nicolas Rex’.
es_translation: To my astonishment, the medal seemed authentic. "Order of Danilo," it read in a circle, "Montenegro, Nicholas Rex."

en: “Turn it.”
vi: "Lật bên kia coi."
tr: “Arkasına da baksana.
es: —Dale la vuelta.
vi_translation: "Flip to the other side and see."
tr_translation: “Look behind you too.”
es_translation: —Turn it around.

en: “Major Jay Gatsby,” I read, “For Valour Extraordinary.”
vi: "Trung tá Gatsby. Tượng trưng cho lòng dũng cảm phi thường." Tôi đọc thấy.
tr: ‘Binbaşı Jay Gatsby’e – Gösterdiği Üstün Kahramanlık için’
es: «Mayor Jay Gatsby», leí: «Por su extraordinario valor».
vi_translation: "Lieutenant Colonel Gatsby. Symbolizes extraordinary courage." I read.
tr_translation: ‘To Major Jay Gatsby – For Displaying Exceptional Heroism’
es_translation: “Major Jay Gatsby,” I read: “For his extraordinary valor.”

en: “Here’s another thing I always carry. A souvenir of Oxford days. It was taken in Trinity Quad—the man on my left is now the Earl of Doncaster.”
vi: "Còn một vật nữa mà tôi lúc nào cũng mang bên người. Một kỷ vật của những ngày ở Oxford. Hình được chụp ở sân Trinity Quad - người đứng bên trái cạnh tôi bây giờ là Bá Tước của Dorcaster."
tr: “Bir de şu var,” diyerek bir fotoğraf çıkardı cebinden “bunu da Oxford günleri­min anısına hep yanımda taşırım, Trinity Avlusunda çekildi. Solumdaki genç şuan Doncaster Kontu’dur.
es: —Hay otra cosa que siempre me acompaña. Un recuerdo de los días de Oxford. Está hecha en el patio del Trinity. El que aparece a mi izquierda es ahora conde de Doncaster.
vi_translation: "There is one more thing that I always carry with me. A memento from the days in Oxford. The picture was taken at Trinity Quad - the person standing to the left next to me is now the Earl of Dorcaster."
tr_translation: “There is also this,” he said, taking a photo out of his pocket, “I always carry this with me in memory of my Oxford days. It was taken in the Trinity Courtyard. The young man on my left is now the Earl of Doncaster.”
es_translation: —There is something else that always accompanies me. A memory from the days of Oxford. It was taken in the courtyard of Trinity. The one who appears to my left is now the Earl of Doncaster.

en: It was a photograph of half a dozen young men in blazers loafing in an archway through which were visible a host of spires. There was Gatsby, looking a little, not much, younger—with a cricket bat in his hand.
vi: Nó là một tấm hình chụp khoảng năm sáu thanh niên trong áo khoác đồng phục đứng dưới một cửa cổng hình cung, qua cái cổng ta có thể thấy rõ ràng một dãy những tháp chuông. Trong hình có Gatsby, trông trẻ hơn bây giờ nhưng không trẻ hơn bao nhiêu, tay cầm cây gậy chơi cricket.
tr: Fotoğrafta, arka fonda bir dizi kulenin göründüğü kemerli bir geçitte, spor ceketleri içinde altı genç adam vardı. Elinde bir kriket sopasıyla Gatsby de fotoğraftaydı; şimdiki halinden nispeten daha genç olsa da pek değişmemiş görünüyordu.
es: Era la foto de un grupo de jóvenes con la chaqueta de la universidad: perdían el tiempo bajo una arcada a través de la que se veía un ejército de chapiteles. Allí estaba Gatsby, que parecía un poco más joven, aunque no mucho. Tenía un bate de críquet en la mano.
vi_translation: It is a picture of about five or six young men in uniform jackets standing under an arched gate, through which one can clearly see a row of bell towers. In the picture, there is Gatsby, looking younger than he does now but not by much, holding a cricket bat.
tr_translation: In the photograph, there were six young men in sports jackets at an arched passageway with a series of towers visible in the background. Gatsby was also in the photograph with a cricket bat in his hand; although he looked relatively younger than he does now, he didn't seem to have changed much.
es_translation: It was a photo of a group of young people with the university jacket: they were wasting time under an arcade through which an army of spires could be seen. There was Gatsby, who looked a little younger, though not much. He had a cricket bat in his hand.

en: Then it was all true. I saw the skins of tigers flaming in his palace on the Grand Canal; I saw him opening a chest of rubies to ease, with their crimson-lighted depths, the gnawings of his broken heart.
vi: Như thế đúng là sự thật. Tôi như trông thấy những bộ da cọp đang được trưng bày rực rỡ trong lâu đài của anh ta ở trên kinh Grand Canal. Tôi còn như thấy anh ta đang mở một hộp đầy những viên hồng ngọc chiếu ánh sáng đỏ thắm để làm dịu đi những day dứt trong trái tim vỡ nát của mình.
tr: Demek anlattıkları doğruydu. Bu defa gözlerimin önünde, Venedik’te Büyük Kanal’ın kıyı­sındaki kaplan postlarıyla bezenmiş sarayında, parıldayan bir yakut sandığının kızıl derinliklerine yüreğini kemiren ıstırabı gömmeye çalışan bir adam canlanmıştı.
es: Así que todo era verdad. Vi la piel de los tigres, flamantes trofeos en su palacio sobre el Gran Canal. Lo vi abriendo un cofre de rubíes para aliviar en las profundidades de su fulgor carmesí el dolor de su corazón roto.
vi_translation: That is indeed the truth. I seem to see the tiger skins being splendidly displayed in his castle on the Grand Canal. I also seem to see him opening a box full of rubies emitting a deep red light to soothe the anguish in his broken heart.
tr_translation: So what they said was true. This time, before my eyes, a man trying to bury the agony gnawing at his heart in the crimson depths of a sparkling ruby chest in his palace adorned with tiger skins on the shores of the Grand Canal in Venice had come to life.
es_translation: So it was all true. I saw the tiger skins, splendid trophies in his palace on the Grand Canal. I saw him opening a chest of rubies to soothe the pain of his broken heart in the depths of their crimson glow.

en: “I’m going to make a big request of you today,” he said, pocketing his souvenirs with satisfaction, “so I thought you ought to know something about me. I didn’t want you to think I was just some nobody. You see, I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.” He hesitated. “You’ll hear about it this afternoon.”
vi: "Hôm nay tôi có chuyện to tát muốn nhờ anh giúp." Gatsby nói, cất vào túi những kỷ vật của mình một cách hài lòng mãn nguyện. "Bởi vậy tôi cho rằng anh cần được hiểu biết thêm về tôi. Tôi không muốn anh nghĩ rằng tôi chỉ là một người tầm thường nào đó. Anh thấy đó, chung quanh tôi lúc nào cũng toàn những người xa lạ bởi vì tôi thường phiêu bồng khắp nơi để cố quê đi câu chuyện đau buồn đã xẩy ra cho tôi." Gatsby ngập ngừng. "Anh sẽ được nghe câu chuyện chiều hôm nay."
tr: Kıymetli hatıralarını gururla cebine koyarken, “Senden önemli bir ricam olacak,” dedi, “zaten bu yüzden beni biraz olsun tanıman gerektiğini düşündüm. Alelade bir insan olduğumu sanmanı istemem. Senin de anlayacağın üzere, aslında başıma gelen o acı olayı unutmak adına oradan oraya böyle dolaşıp durduğumdan, kendimi çoğunlukla tanımadığım yabancıların arasında buluyorum.” Duraksadı, çok geçmeden “Ricamı ise sana öğleden sonra ileteceğim,” dedi.
es: —Voy a pedirte hoy un gran favor —dijo, mientras volvía a meterse sus recuerdos en el bolsillo con satisfacción—, y por eso he creído que debías saber algo sobre mí. No quería que pensaras que soy un don nadie. Ya ves, suelo mezclarme con desconocidos porque voy de un sitio a otro intentando olvidar eso tan triste que me pasó una vez —titubeó—. Esta tarde sabrás qué fue.
vi_translation: "Today I have something important I need your help with." Gatsby said, putting his mementos into his pocket with a satisfied and contented look. "Therefore, I think you need to know more about me. I don't want you to think that I'm just some ordinary person. You see, I'm always surrounded by strangers because I often wander around to try to forget the sad story that happened to me." Gatsby hesitated. "You will hear the story this afternoon."
tr_translation: While proudly putting his precious memories into his pocket, he said, "I have an important request from you," "that's why I thought you should get to know me a little." I don't want you to think that I am an ordinary person. As you can understand, since I have been wandering around like this to forget that painful event that happened to me, I often find myself among strangers I don't know." He paused, then soon said, "I will convey my request to you in the afternoon."
es_translation: —I'm going to ask you for a big favor today —he said, while he put his memories back into his pocket with satisfaction—, and that's why I thought you should know something about me. I didn't want you to think that I'm a nobody. You see, I usually mingle with strangers because I go from one place to another trying to forget that very sad thing that happened to me once —he hesitated—. This afternoon you will know what it was.

en: “At lunch?”
vi: "Ở bữa trưa hả?"
tr: “Yemekte mi?
es: —¿En la comida?
vi_translation: "At lunch?"
tr_translation: “At dinner?”
es_translation: —At lunch?

en: “No, this afternoon. I happened to find out that you’re taking Miss Baker to tea.”
vi: "Không, chiều nay. Tôi tình cờ biết được anh có hẹn với cô Baker đi uống trà."
tr: “Hayır, yemekten sonra. Bu arada Bayan Baker’ı çaya davet ettiğini duymadığımı sanma.
es: —No, esta tarde. Me he enterado por casualidad de que tomas el té con miss Baker.
vi_translation: "No, this afternoon." "I happened to find out that you have an appointment with Miss Baker to have tea."
tr_translation: “No, after dinner. In the meantime, don't think I didn't hear you invite Mrs. Baker for tea.”
es_translation: —No, this afternoon. I found out by chance that you are having tea with Miss Baker.

en: “Do you mean you’re in love with Miss Baker?”
vi: "Có phải ý anh nói là anh đang yêu cô Baker?"
tr: “Yoksa, Bayan Baker’a aşık olduğunu mu söylemeye çalışıyorsun?
es: —¿Quieres decirme que te has enamorado de miss Baker?
vi_translation: "Do you mean that you are in love with Miss Baker?"
tr_translation: “Or are you trying to say that you are in love with Miss Baker?”
es_translation: —Do you mean to tell me that you have fallen in love with Miss Baker?

en: “No, old sport, I’m not. But Miss Baker has kindly consented to speak to you about this matter.”
vi: "Không phải, anh bạn già. Tôi không có. Thế nhưng cô Baker đã tốt bụng đồng ý để cho tôi được nói chuyện với anh về vần đề này."
tr: “Ah ahbap, kesinlikle hayır! Lakin Bayan Baker incelik göstererek bu mesele ile ilgili seninle konuşmayı kabul etti.
es: —No, compañero, no. Pero miss Baker ha accedido amablemente a hablarte del asunto.
vi_translation: "No, my old friend. I don't have it. However, Miss Baker has kindly agreed to let me talk to you about this matter."
tr_translation: "Ah buddy, definitely no! However, Miss Baker graciously agreed to talk to you about this matter."
es_translation: —No, comrade, no. But Miss Baker has kindly agreed to talk to you about the matter.

en: I hadn’t the faintest idea what “this matter” was, but I was more annoyed than interested. I hadn’t asked Jordan to tea in order to discuss Mr. Jay Gatsby. I was sure the request would be something utterly fantastic, and for a moment I was sorry I’d ever set foot upon his overpopulated lawn.
vi: Tôi không có mộy tý xíu khái niệm gì về "vấn đền này", thế nhưng tôi cảm thấy mình bị làm phiền nhiều hơn là thích thú muốn biết. Không phải tôi mời Jordan đi uống trà để mà thảo luận chuyện của ông Gatsby. Tôi tin chắc lời thỉnh cầu sẽ phải là cho một chuyện ly kỳ lắm, trong một giây lát tôi cảm thấy đáng tiếc tôi đã từng đặt chân lên trên thảm cỏ quá đông người của anh ta.
tr: ‘Meselenin’ ne olduğu konusunda hiçbir bir fikrim olmasa da o an meraklanmaktan çok öfkelendiğimi söylemeliyim. Benim Jordan’ı davet etme maksadım Gatsby ile ilgili konuşmak değildi. Üstelik nedense Gatsby’nin ricasının oldukça tuhaf olacağından neredeyse emindim. Bir an için, onun o kalabalık bahçesine hiç adım atmamış olmayı diledim.
es: Yo no tenía la menor idea de la naturaleza «del asunto», pero me sentía más contrariado que interesado. No había invitado a Jordan a tomar el té para hablar de mister Jay Gatsby. Estaba seguro de que iba a pedirme algo absolutamente fantástico y, por un momento, lamenté haber pisado alguna vez su césped superpoblado.
vi_translation: I have not the slightest idea about "this matter", but I feel more bothered than curious to know. It's not that I invited Jordan for tea to discuss Mr. Gatsby's affairs. I am sure the request must be for something very thrilling, and for a moment I regretted ever stepping onto his crowded lawn.
tr_translation: Although I had no idea what the 'matter' was, I must say that at that moment I felt more anger than curiosity. My intention in inviting Jordan was not to talk about Gatsby. Moreover, for some reason, I was almost certain that Gatsby's request would be quite strange. For a moment, I wished I had never set foot in his crowded garden.
es_translation: I had no idea whatsoever about the nature "of the matter," but I felt more annoyed than interested. I had not invited Jordan for tea to talk about the mysterious Jay Gatsby. I was sure he was going to ask me for something absolutely fantastic and, for a moment, I regretted ever stepping on his overcrowded lawn.

en: He wouldn’t say another word. His correctness grew on him as we neared the city. We passed Port Roosevelt, where there was a glimpse of red-belted oceangoing ships, and sped along a cobbled slum lined with the dark, undeserted saloons of the faded-gilt nineteen-hundreds. Then the valley of ashes opened out on both sides of us, and I had a glimpse of Mrs. Wilson straining at the garage pump with panting vitality as we went by.
vi: Gatsby không nói thêm một tiếng. Anh ta trông càng trở nên nghiêm chỉnh chừng mực khi chúng tôi vào gần đến phố. Chúng tôi đi ngang qua cảng Roosevelt nơi chúng tôi có thể thoáng thấy những con tàu viễn dương với vành đai đỏ sơn bên hông. Xe lứớt nhanh dọc theo một khu phố đường lát đá cuội tồi tàn. Hai bên đường là những quán rượu tối tăm nhưng không vắng khách của thời đại vàng son đã phai tàn, những năm thập niên một ngàn chín trăm. Thung lũng tro tàn bắt đầu hiện ra hai bên đường, tôi có thể thoáng trông thấy cô vợ Wilson đang làm việc cật lực ở bên trạm bơm xăng dáng điệu thở hổn hển đầy sinh lực khi xe chúng tôi chạy ngang qua.
tr: Başka bir şey söylemeden konuyu kapatmıştı. Şehre yaklaşırken sessizliği büsbütün ağırlaştı. Roosevelt Limanı’ndan geçerken okyanusta ilerleyen kırmızı kemerli gemiler bir anlığına göründü, sonra 1900’lerden kalma, yaldızları solmuş ancak terk edilmemiş olan karanlık barlarının sıralandığı, Arnavut kaldırımlı izbe kenar mahallelerin içinden hızla geçtik. İki yanımızda uzanan Küller Vadisi’nden geçerken, büyük bir azimle ve canlılıkla pompa ile boğuşmakta olan Bayan Wilson’ı şöyle bir görebildim.
es: No volvió a pronunciar una palabra. Su corrección crecía a medida que nos acercábamos a la ciudad. Pasamos Port Roosevelt y la visión de sus transatlánticos pintados con una franja roja, y aceleramos en las calles pobres, adoquinadas, flanqueadas por los bares oscuros, con clientes todavía, de los dorados y desvaídos primeros años del siglo XX. Entonces el valle de cenizas se abrió a derecha e izquierda, y, al cruzarlo, durante unos segundos vislumbré a mistress Wilson, afanándose en el surtidor de gasolina con jadeante vitalidad.
vi_translation: Gatsby did not say another word. He looked even more serious and composed as we approached the street. We passed by Roosevelt Harbor where we could catch a glimpse of the ocean liners with red bands painted on their sides. The car sped quickly along a shabby cobblestone street. On both sides of the road were dimly lit but not empty taverns from the bygone golden era of the early 1900s. The valley of ashes began to appear on either side of the road, and I could catch a glimpse of Wilson’s wife working hard at the gas station, her figure breathing heavily with energy as our car passed by.
tr_translation: He had closed the subject without saying anything else. As we approached the city, the silence grew even heavier. While passing through Roosevelt Harbor, ships with red belts moving forward in the ocean appeared for a moment, then we quickly passed through the cobblestone slums lined with dark bars from the 1900s, whose gilding had faded but had not been abandoned. As we passed through the Valley of Ashes stretching on both sides of us, I caught a glimpse of Mrs. Wilson struggling with the pump with great determination and vigor.
es_translation: He did not speak another word. His correctness grew as we approached the city. We passed Port Roosevelt and the sight of its ocean liners painted with a red stripe, and sped through the poor, cobbled streets, flanked by dark bars, still with customers, from the golden and faded early years of the 20th century. Then the valley of ashes opened to the right and left, and, as we crossed it, for a few seconds I glimpsed Mrs. Wilson, bustling at the gas pump with panting vitality.

en: With fenders spread like wings we scattered light through half Astoria—only half, for as we twisted among the pillars of the elevated I heard the familiar “jug-jug-spat!” of a motorcycle, and a frantic policeman rode alongside.
vi: Với những miếng cảng xòe ra như những chiếc cánh, xe chúng tôi lướt vút đi như rải ánh sáng ngang qua nửa thành phố Long Island. Chỉ mới nửa đường, trong khi xe chúng tôi còn đang xoắn lượn vòng vèo giữa những cột trụ cầu cao tôi nghe tiếng nổ bành bặt quen thuộc của xe gắn máy cảnh sát, một cảnh sát viên đang hùng hổ chạy ngang bên hông.
tr: Long Island yolunu, Otomobilin çamurlukları kanat misali açılmış, ışık saçarak uçarcasına yarıladık. Ancak yarı yolda, köprü yolunun sütunlu virajlarını alırken, önce arkamızdan yaklaşmakta olan bir motosikletin o bilindik “pat-pat” sesleri duyuldu, sonra da öfkeden deliye dönmüş bir polis memuru yanımızda beliriverdi.
es: Con guardabarros que sobresalían como alas, salpicamos luz a través de media Astoria, sólo media, porque, mientras zigzagueábamos entre los pilares del tren elevado, oí el conocido petardeo de una motocicleta, y un policía frenético corría a nuestro lado.
vi_translation: With the fenders flaring out like wings, our car sped along as if scattering light across half of Long Island City. Only halfway there, while our car was still weaving through the high bridge pillars, I heard the familiar explosive sound of a police motorcycle, and a police officer was aggressively riding alongside.
tr_translation: We sped down the Long Island road, the car's fenders spread like wings, cutting through the air as if flying and radiating light. However, halfway there, while navigating the columned curves of the bridge road, we first heard the familiar "pat-pat" sounds of a motorcycle approaching from behind, and then an enraged police officer suddenly appeared beside us.
es_translation: With fenders that stuck out like wings, we splashed light through half of Astoria, only half, because, while we zigzagged between the pillars of the elevated train, I heard the familiar sputtering of a motorcycle, and a frantic policeman was running alongside us.

en: “All right, old sport,” called Gatsby. We slowed down. Taking a white card from his wallet, he waved it before the man’s eyes.
vi: "Được rồi, anh bạn già." Gatsby nói to, cho xe chạy chậm lại. Lấy ra một tấm thẻ màu trắng từ trong túi, Gatsby giơ lên vẫy nó trước mặt viên cảnh sát.
tr: Gatsby “Tamam, anlaşıldı ahbap” diye seslendi, kenara çekti ve cüzdanından çıkardığı beyaz bir kartviziti adamın burnuna dayadı.
es: —¡Muy bien, compañero! —gritó Gatsby. Redujimos la velocidad. Sacó una tarjeta blanca de la cartera y la agitó ante los ojos del motorista.
vi_translation: "Alright, old sport." Gatsby said loudly, slowing down the car. Taking out a white card from his pocket, Gatsby held it up and waved it in front of the policeman.
tr_translation: Gatsby called out, "Alright, got it buddy," pulled over, and shoved a white business card from his wallet under the man's nose.
es_translation: —Very well, old sport! —shouted Gatsby. We reduced the speed. He took a white card out of his wallet and waved it in front of the driver's eyes.

en: “Right you are,” agreed the policeman, tipping his cap. “Know you next time, Mr. Gatsby. Excuse me!”
vi: "Được rồi." Viên cảnh sát ưng thuận, đưa tay chạm nhẹ lên nón chào. "Lần sau tôi sẽ nhận ra ông, thưa ông Gatsby. Xin lỗi."
tr: “Anlıyorum efendim,” dedi polis, şapkasına dokunup selam verdi, “Bir dahaki sefere sizi tanıyacağımdan kuşkunuz olmasın Bay Gatsby, affedersiniz. “O da neydi öyle? Oxford’dan bir resim mi gösterdin yoksa?” dedim.
es: —Todo en orden —admitió el policía, llevándose la mano a la gorra—. Le reconoceré la próxima vez, mister Gatsby. ¡Discúlpeme!
vi_translation: "Alright." The police officer agreed, lightly touching his hat in salute. "Next time I will recognize you, Mr. Gatsby. Sorry."
tr_translation: “I understand, sir,” said the policeman, touching his hat and saluting, “Rest assured that I will recognize you next time, Mr. Gatsby, my apologies.” “What was that?” “Did you show a picture from Oxford or something?” I said.
es_translation: —Everything is in order —admitted the policeman, taking his hand to his cap—. I will recognize you next time, Mister Gatsby. Excuse me!

en: “What was that?” I inquired. “The picture of Oxford?”
vi: "Cái đó là cái gì vậy?" Tôi dạn hỏi. "Bức hình của Oxford hả?"
tr: Oxford’dan bir resim mi gösterdin yoksa?” dedim.
es: —¿Qué le has enseñado? ¿La foto de Oxford?
vi_translation: "What is that?" I boldly asked. "Is that a picture of Oxford?"
tr_translation: “What was that?” “Did you show a picture from Oxford or something?” I said.
es_translation: —What have you shown him? The photo of Oxford?

en: “I was able to do the commissioner a favour once, and he sends me a Christmas card every year.”
vi: "Tôi đã từng giúp ủy viên hội đồng cảnh sát một lần và anh ta gửi cho tôi thiệp giáng sinh mỗi năm."
tr: “Emniyet müdürüne vaktiyle bir iyiliğim dokunmuştu, o da sağ olsun, her Noel’de bana tebrik kartı yollamayı ihmal etmez.
es: —Una vez tuve ocasión de hacerle un favor al jefe de la policía, y me manda todos los años una felicitación de Navidad.
vi_translation: "I once helped a councilman and he sends me a Christmas card every year."
tr_translation: “I once did a favor for the chief of police, and he, bless him, never fails to send me a greeting card every Christmas.”
es_translation: —Once I had the chance to do a favor for the chief of police, and he sends me a Christmas card every year.

en: Over the great bridge, with the sunlight through the girders making a constant flicker upon the moving cars, with the city rising up across the river in white heaps and sugar lumps all built with a wish out of nonolfactory money. The city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, in its first wild promise of all the mystery and the beauty in the world.
vi: Đi ngang qua chiếc cầu lớn, ánh nắng chiếu qua rầm cầu tạo thành những tia sáng nhảy nhót lung linh liên tục trên những chiếc xe đang di chuyển. Bên kia sông, thành phố đang từ từ mọc lên trước mắt như những khối trắng và như những viên đường thẻ được xây dựng lên qua một lời ước từ những đồng tiền vô khứu giác. Thành phố khi nhìn từ cầu Queensboro lúc nào cũng giống như mới được nhìn lần đầu tiên với lời hứa hẹn điên cuồng nó sẽ hiến dâng cho ta những bí ẩn và những nét đẹp của thế giới.
tr: Büyük köprünün kirişlerin arasından süzülen gün ışığı, üzerinde ilerleyen otomobillere vurup titreşirken, nehrin öte yakasında kesme şeker öbeklerine benzeyen beyaz binalarıyla şehir beliriverdi. Bu binaların hangi parayla yapıldığı meçhuldü, ne de olsa paranın kokusu yoktu2. 2 Yazar metinde, “non-olfactory money (kokmayan para)” deyişini kullanarak Latince “para kokmaz” anlamına gelen kalıplaşmış “Pecunia non olet” deyişine gönderme yapıyor. Bu deyiş, paranın kendi değerini kaynağından bağımsız olarak koruduğunu vurgular. Bazen de şaibeli kazançlara gönderme yapar. ÇN Queensboro Köprüsü’nden her geçişimde New York’a, sanki şehri ilk kez görüyormuşum gibi bakarım; manzarası adeta dünyanın bütün gizemleri ve güzelliklerinin orada sizi beklediğini vaat eder.
es: En el gran puente la luz del sol parpadeaba sin fin a través de las vigas sobre los coches en movimiento, y la ciudad se alzaba al otro lado del río en blancas aglomeraciones, en terrones de azúcar construidos, como por un deseo, con dinero inodoro. La ciudad vista desde el puente de Queensboro es siempre la ciudad vista por primera vez, virgen en su primera promesa de todo lo misterioso y maravilloso del mundo.
vi_translation: Walking across the large bridge, sunlight streamed through the beams, creating shimmering, dancing rays continuously on the moving vehicles. On the other side of the river, the city slowly rose before the eyes like white blocks and like sugar cubes built up through a wish from scentless coins. The city, when viewed from the Queensboro Bridge, always seemed like it was being seen for the first time, with a wild promise to offer us the mysteries and beauties of the world.
tr_translation: The city appeared on the other side of the river with its white buildings resembling piles of sugar cubes, as the sunlight filtered through the beams of the large bridge and shimmered on the cars moving over it. It was unknown with what money these buildings were constructed, after all, money has no smell. 2 The author uses the phrase "non-olfactory money" to reference the Latin saying "Pecunia non olet," which means "money does not smell." This saying emphasizes that money retains its value regardless of its source. Sometimes, it also alludes to dubious earnings. Translator's Note Every time I cross the Queensboro Bridge, I look at New York as if I am seeing the city for the first time; its view promises that all the mysteries and beauties of the world are waiting for you there.
es_translation: On the great bridge, the sunlight flickered endlessly through the beams over the moving cars, and the city rose on the other side of the river in white clusters, in sugar lumps built, as if by a wish, with odorless money. The city seen from the Queensboro Bridge is always the city seen for the first time, virgin in its first promise of all the mysterious and wonderful things in the world.

en: A dead man passed us in a hearse heaped with blooms, followed by two carriages with drawn blinds, and by more cheerful carriages for friends. The friends looked out at us with the tragic eyes and short upper lips of southeastern Europe, and I was glad that the sight of Gatsby’s splendid car was included in their sombre holiday. As we crossed Blackwell’s Island a limousine passed us, driven by a white chauffeur, in which sat three modish negroes, two bucks and a girl. I laughed aloud as the yolks of their eyeballs rolled toward us in haughty rivalry.
vi: Đám tang một người đi ngang qua trong một chiếc xe tang chất đầy hoa, theo sau bởi hai chiếc xe ngựa che rèm kín, nối tiếp là những chiếc xe ngựa chở bạn bè tươi vui hơn. Những người bạn này ngước nhìn lên chúng tôi bằng những đôi mắt bi ai, những chiếc môi trên ngắn của dân miền Đông Nam Âu. Tôi cũng mừng là hình ảnh chiếc xe lộng lẫy của Gatsby đã được ghép chung vào trong ngày tang lễ u sầu ảm đạm này của họ. Khi chúng tôi đi ngang qua đảo Blackwell, một chiếc xe limousine chạy lướt ngang qua xe chúng tôi. Tài xế là một người da trắng, trong xe gồm có ba người da đen ăn mặc đúng mốt, hai công tử bột và một cô gái. Tôi phá lên cười khi trông thấy những con mắt của họ trợn tròn nhìn chúng tôi một cách ghanh đua ngạo mạn.
tr: Yanımızdan çiçeklere bezenmiş bir cenaze aracı geçti, sonra perdeleri kapalı iki araba ve hemen ardından, diğerleri kadar yaslı görünmeyen taşıtlar. Yolcuları acıklı gözlerle ve Güneydoğu Avrupa’ya has dar üst dudaklarıyla dönüp bize baktı. Bu kederli sahneye, Gatsby’nin görkemli arabasının da dahil olmasına sevinmiştim. Blackwell Adası’nı geçerken yanımızdan, beyaz bir şoförün kullandığı ve arkada son moda kıyafetleriyle ikisi kadın, biri erkek, üç siyahinin oturduğu bir limuzin geçti. Bizimle yarışmak istercesine, kibirli bakışlarını bize çevirdiklerinde, yüksek sesle bir kahkaha patlattım.
es: Un muerto nos adelantó en un coche fúnebre cubierto de flores, seguido por dos carrozas con las cortinas echadas, y por carrozas más animadas para los amigos. Los amigos, que tenían el labio superior propio del sureste de Europa, muy fino, nos dirigieron miradas trágicas, y me alegré de que la visión del espléndido coche de Gatsby estuviera incluida en su fiesta sombría. Cuando cruzábamos Blackwell’s Island, nos adelantó una limusina conducida por un chófer blanco, en la que viajaban tres negros muy a la moda, dos chicos y una chica. Me reí a carcajadas cuando sus ojos giraron como huevos hacia nosotros con orgullosa rivalidad.
vi_translation: A funeral procession passed by in a hearse filled with flowers, followed by two horse-drawn carriages with closed curtains, and then more carriages carrying friends who seemed more cheerful. These friends looked up at us with sorrowful eyes, their short upper lips characteristic of the people from Southeastern Europe. I was also glad that the image of Gatsby's splendid car was included in their somber and gloomy funeral day. As we passed by Blackwell's Island, a limousine sped past our car. The driver was a white man, and inside were three black people dressed in the latest fashion, two young men and a girl. I burst out laughing when I saw their eyes glaring at us with envious arrogance.
tr_translation: A funeral vehicle adorned with flowers passed by us, followed by two cars with closed curtains, and immediately after, vehicles that did not appear as mournful as the others. The passengers turned to look at us with sorrowful eyes and the narrow upper lips characteristic of Southeastern Europe. I was glad that Gatsby’s magnificent car was included in this sorrowful scene. As we passed Blackwell Island, a limousine driven by a white chauffeur and carrying three Black individuals—two women and one man—dressed in the latest fashion, passed by us. When they turned their haughty gazes towards us, as if wanting to race, I burst into loud laughter.
es_translation: A dead man passed us in a flower-covered hearse, followed by two carriages with drawn curtains, and by more lively carriages for the friends. The friends, who had the very thin upper lip typical of southeastern Europe, gave us tragic looks, and I was glad that the sight of Gatsby's splendid car was included in their somber procession. When we were crossing Blackwell’s Island, a limousine driven by a white chauffeur passed us, carrying three very fashionable black people, two boys and a girl. I laughed out loud when their eyes turned towards us like eggs with proud rivalry.

en: “Anything can happen now that we’ve slid over this bridge,” I thought; “anything at all…”
vi: "Bây gi ờ xe của mình đã đi qua cầu rồi thì chuyện gì cũng có thể xẩy ra." Tôi nghĩ. "Bất cứ chuyện gì..."
tr: “Şu köprüyü de uçarcasına geçmiştik ya,” diye düşündüm içimden, “artık her şey olabilirdi… Hem de her şey!”
es: «Todo es posible ahora que hemos cruzado este puente», pensé; «absolutamente todo».
vi_translation: "Now Once my car has crossed the bridge, anything can happen." I thought. "Anything at all..."
tr_translation: “Remember how we crossed that bridge as if we were flying,” I thought to myself, “now anything could happen... Absolutely anything!”
es_translation: "Everything is possible now that we have crossed this bridge," I thought; "absolutely everything."

en: Even Gatsby could happen, without any particular wonder.
vi: "Dù ngay cả Gatsby, không có điều gì là phi thường đặc biệt cả."
tr: Gatsby gibi bir adam bile olabiliyordu, artık ne şaşırtırdı ki.
es: Incluso Gatsby era posible, sin especial asombro.
vi_translation: "Even Gatsby, there was nothing particularly extraordinary."
tr_translation: Even becoming a man like Gatsby was possible, nothing would surprise me anymore.
es_translation: Even Gatsby was possible, without any particular astonishment.

en: Roaring noon. In a well-fanned Forty-second Street cellar I met Gatsby for lunch. Blinking away the brightness of the street outside, my eyes picked him out obscurely in the anteroom, talking to another man.
vi: Vào buổi trưa ồn ào náo nhiệt, dưới hầm đường Forty-second thoáng gió, tôi hẹn gặp Gatsby ăn trưa. Chợp mắt cho tan đi ánh nắng sáng chói mắt bên ngoài, cặp mắt của tôi nhận ra anh ta trong bóng tối lờ mờ ở phòng ngoài, đang nói chuyện với một người đàn ông khác.
tr: Gürültülü öğlen saatlerinde, Gatsby ile 42’nci Cadde’deki, havalandırması iyi olan bir lokantanın bodrum katında öğle yemeği için buluştuk. Aydınlık caddeden içeri girdiğimde, gözlerimi kırpıştırarak etrafıma bakınırken onu hemen girişte gördüm, biriyle konuşmaktaydı.
es: Mediodía excelente. En una bodega bien ventilada de la calle Cuarenta y dos me reuní con Gatsby para comer. Parpadeando para quitarme de los ojos la luz de la calle, lo entreví en la antesala. Hablaba con otro hombre.
vi_translation: In the noisy and bustling noon, under the breezy Forty-second Street tunnel, I arranged to meet Gatsby for lunch. After blinking away the dazzling sunlight outside, my eyes adjusted to recognize him in the dim outer room, conversing with another man.
tr_translation: During the noisy lunchtime hours, I met Gatsby for lunch in the basement of a well-ventilated restaurant on 42nd Street. As I entered from the bright street, blinking my eyes and looking around, I saw him right at the entrance, talking to someone.
es_translation: Excellent noon. In a well-ventilated cellar on Forty-second Street, I met Gatsby for lunch. Blinking to get the street light out of my eyes, I glimpsed him in the anteroom. He was talking to another man.

en: “Mr. Carraway, this is my friend Mr. Wolfshiem.”
vi: "Anh Carraway, đây là bạn của tôi, ông Wolfsheim."
tr: “Bay Carraway, bu arkadaşım Bay Wolfshiem.
es: —Mister Carraway, le presento a mi amigo mister Wolfshiem.
vi_translation: "Mr. Carraway, this is my friend, Mr. Wolfsheim."
tr_translation: “Mr. Carraway, this is my friend Mr. Wolfshiem.”
es_translation: —Mr. Carraway, let me introduce you to my friend Mr. Wolfshiem.

en: A small, flat-nosed Jew raised his large head and regarded me with two fine growths of hair which luxuriated in either nostril. After a moment I discovered his tiny eyes in the half-darkness.
vi: Một người đàn ông Do Thái nhỏ bé, mũi tẹt, ngẩng chiếc đầu bự lên chào tôi với hai chùm lông mũi xum xuê thò ra từ hai lỗ mũi. Mãi một lát tôi mới nhìn ra cặp mắt bé tý của ông ta trong bóng nửa sáng nửa tối.
tr: Yassı ve küçük burunlu Yahudi, irice kafasını kaldırdığında, ilk dikkatimi çeken burun deliklerinden taşmakta olan kıl yumakları olmuş, o loş ışıkta ancak bir süre sonra gözlerini ayırt edebilmiştim.
es: Un judío menudo y chato levantó su gran cabeza y me miró con dos estupendas matas de pelo que le crecían generosamente en los orificios de la nariz. Tardé unos segundos en descubrir sus ojillos en la semioscuridad.
vi_translation: A small Jewish man, with a flat nose, raised his big head to greet me with two tufts of lush nose hair sticking out from his nostrils. It took me a while to see his tiny eyes in the half-light, half-darkness. ".. Then I watched him."
tr_translation: When the flat and small-nosed Jew lifted his rather large head, the first thing that caught my attention were the tufts of hair protruding from his nostrils, and in that dim light, it was only after a while that I could distinguish his eyes.
es_translation: A small and stocky Jewish man lifted his large head and looked at me with two impressive tufts of hair that grew generously in his nostrils. It took me a few seconds to discover his little eyes in the semi-darkness.

en: “What?” I inquired politely.
vi: "Và anh có biết tôi đã nghĩ gì không?" "Nghĩ gì?" Tôi hỏi một cách lịch sự.
tr: “Ne yaptınız?” diye sordum nazikçe.
es: —¿Qué? —pregunté por cortesía.
vi_translation: "And do you know what I thought?" "What are you thinking?" I asked politely.
tr_translation: “What did you do?” I asked politely.
es_translation: —What? —I asked out of courtesy.

en: But evidently he was not addressing me, for he dropped my hand and covered Gatsby with his expressive nose.
vi: Rõ ràng là ông ta không phải đang nói chuyện với tôi, bởi vì ông buông tay tôi ra và hướng cái mũi đầy diễn đạt của mình về phía Gatsby.
tr: Ancak o benimle konuşmadığını, elimi bırakıp da görkemli burnunu Gatsby’e çevirerek belli etmişti.
es: Pero era evidente que no se dirigía a mí, porque me soltó la mano y apuntó a Gatsby con su nariz, muy expresiva.
vi_translation: It was clear that he was not talking to me, because he let go of my hand and directed his highly expressive nose towards Gatsby.
tr_translation: However, she made it clear that she was not talking to me by letting go of my hand and turning her magnificent nose towards Gatsby.
es_translation: But it was evident that he wasn't addressing me, because he let go of my hand and pointed at Gatsby with his very expressive nose.

en: “I handed the money to Katspaugh and I said: ‘All right, Katspaugh, don’t pay him a penny till he shuts his mouth.’ He shut it then and there.”
vi: "Tôi giao tiền cho Katspaugh và tôi nói: 'Được rồi, Katspaugh, không trả cho hắn một xu teng cho đến khi hắn chịu câm miệng.' Thế lá hắn câm miệng ngay lập tức ngay tại chỗ."
tr: “Parayı Katspaugh’a verdikten sonra, ‘Tamam Katspaugh’ dedim, ‘o zaman adam ağzını sıkıca kapatmadan, sakın ola ona tek kuruş verme!’ O da, o anda, oracıkta sesini kesti.
es: —Le di el dinero a Katspaugh y le dije: «Muy bien, Katspaugh, no le pagues ni un centavo hasta que cierre la boca». La cerró en el acto.
vi_translation: "I handed the money to Katspaugh and I said, 'Alright, Katspaugh, don't give him a single penny until he shuts up.' So he shut up immediately, right on the spot."
tr_translation: “After giving the money to Katspaugh, I said, ‘Alright Katspaugh, then don't give him a single penny unless he keeps his mouth shut tight!’ And at that moment, right there, he fell silent.”
es_translation: —I gave the money to Katspaugh and told him, "Alright, Katspaugh, don't pay him a cent until he shuts his mouth." He shut it immediately.

en: Gatsby took an arm of each of us and moved forward into the restaurant, whereupon Mr. Wolfshiem swallowed a new sentence he was starting and lapsed into a somnambulatory abstraction.
vi: Gatsby cầm cánh tay của hai chúng tôi dẫn vào bên trong nhà hàng. Khi đó ông Wolfsheim phải nuốt đi một câu đang sắp nói và thả mình vào trong trạng thái như mộng du.
tr: Bay Wolfsheim yeni bir cümleye başlamak üzereydi ki, Gatsby ikimizin de koluna girerek bizi lokantanın iç kısımlarına doğru yönlendirdi, bunun üzerine adam söyleyeceğini yuttu ve yüzü bir uyurgezerin dalgın ifadesine büründü.
es: Gatsby nos cogió del brazo y nos llevó hacia el comedor, y mister Wolfshiem, tragándose una frase que acababa de empezar, se quedó ensimismado, como un sonámbulo.
vi_translation: Gatsby took both our arms and led us inside the restaurant. At that moment, Mr. Wolfsheim had to swallow a sentence he was about to say and let himself fall into a state like sleepwalking.
tr_translation: Bay Wolfsheim was about to start a new sentence when Gatsby took both of us by the arm and led us towards the inner parts of the restaurant, upon which the man swallowed his words and his face took on the absent expression of a sleepwalker.
es_translation: Gatsby took us by the arm and led us toward the dining room, and Mr. Wolfshiem, swallowing a phrase he had just begun, remained lost in thought, like a sleepwalker.

en: “Highballs?” asked the head waiter.
vi: "Rượu Whiskey sô đa?" Người hầu bàn hỏi.
tr: Şef garson yaklaşıp, “Viski alır mısın?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Whisky con soda y hielo? —preguntó el maître.
vi_translation: "Whiskey soda?" the waiter asked.
tr_translation: The head waiter approached and asked, "Would you like some whiskey?"
es_translation: —Whiskey with soda and ice? —asked the maître d'.

en: “This is a nice restaurant here,” said Mr. Wolfshiem, looking at the presbyterian nymphs on the ceiling. “But I like across the street better!”
vi: "Quán ăn này đẹp đấy." Wolfsheim nói, ngước nhìn những bước tranh của những nữ thần trong tôn giáo vẽ trên trần nhà. "Nhưng tôi thích quán ở bên kia đường hơn!"
tr: “Burası güzel bir mekan” dedi Bay Wolfsheim, tavandaki kadın resimlerine bakarak, “yine de ben caddenin karşısındaki yeri tercih ederim,’
es: —Está bien este restaurante —dijo mister Wolfshiem, mirando las ninfas presbiterianas del techo—. Pero me gusta más el de enfrente.
vi_translation: "This restaurant is beautiful." Wolfsheim said, looking up at the paintings of goddesses from the religion depicted on the ceiling. "But I prefer the restaurant across the street!" "Yes, give me a whiskey soda."
tr_translation: “This is a nice place,” said Mr. Wolfsheim, looking at the pictures of women on the ceiling, “still, I prefer the place across the street.”
es_translation: —This restaurant is fine —said Mr. Wolfshiem, looking at the Presbyterian nymphs on the ceiling—. But I like the one across the street better.

en: “Hot and small—yes,” said Mr. Wolfshiem, “but full of memories.”
vi: "Đúng vậy, nóng và nhỏ." Wolfsheim nói. "Nhưng tràn đầy những kỷ niệm."
tr: “Evet, viski” dedikten sonra Bay Wolfsheim’e döndü; “Orası çok sıcak olmuyor mu? “Haklısın, sıcak ve küçük” dedi adam, “ancak hatıralarla dolu.
es: —Hace calor y es pequeño, sí —dijo mister Wolfshiem—, pero está lleno de recuerdos.
vi_translation: "That's right, hot and small." Wolfsheim said. "But full of memories."
tr_translation: “Yes, whiskey,” he said, then turned to Mr. Wolfsheim; “Isn't it very hot there?” “You are right, it is warm and small,” said the man, “but it is filled with memories.”
es_translation: —It's hot and small, yes —said Mr. Wolfshiem—, but it's full of memories.

en: “What place is that?” I asked.
vi: "Quán đó là quán nào?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “Bu sözünü ettiğiniz yer neresi?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Qué sitio es? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "Which restaurant is that?" I asked.
tr_translation: "Where is this place you mentioned?" I asked.
es_translation: —What place is this? —I asked.

en: “The old Metropole,” brooded Mr. Wolfshiem gloomily. “Filled with faces dead and gone. Filled with friends gone now forever. I can’t forget so long as I live the night they shot Rosy Rosenthal there. It was six of us at the table, and Rosy had eat and drunk a lot all evening. When it was almost morning the waiter came up to him with a funny look and says somebody wants to speak to him outside. ‘All right,’ says Rosy, and begins to get up, and I pulled him down in his chair.
vi: "Quán cổ Metropole." Wolfsheim nghiền ngẫm một cách u sầu. "Chứa đầy hình ảnh những khuôn mặt đã khuất và không còn. Chứa đựng đầy hình bóng của những người bạn đã vĩnh viển ra đi. Ngày nào tôi còn sống trên đời, tôi không thể nào quên được cái đêm mà họ bắn chết Rosy Rosenthal ở đó. Lúc đó sáu đứa chúng tôi đang ngồi ở bàn, Rosy đã ăn uống rất nhiều tối hôm đó. Khi trời sắp sửa sáng, người hầu bàn đi lại bên anh ta với một cái nhìn kỳ lạ và nói rằng có ai đó muốn nói chuyện với anh ta bên ngoài. "Được rồi." Rosy nói và bắt đầu đứng lên. Tôi kéo anh ta ngồi trở lại ghế."
tr: “Eski Metropole” dedi Bay Wolfsheim kendi ken­dine, “Ayrılıklarla dolu… Sonsuzluğa uğurladığımız nice dostların hatıralarıyla… Rosy Rosenthal’ın vurulduğu geceyi hiç unutamam. Altı kişiydik. Rosenthal gece boyu yiyip içmişti, neredeyse sabah olurken, garson ona yaklaştı ve tuhaf bir yüz ifadesiyle, dışarıda kendisiyle görüşmek isteyen birinin beklemekte oluğunu söyledi. Rosenthal, ‘Peki,’ diyerek kalkmaya yeltendiğinde, koluna yapıştığım gibi onu yerine oturttum ve ‘O it herifler seni çok istiyorsa ayağına gelsin, benim hatırım için, sen bir yere çıkma!’ dedim.
es: —El viejo Metropole —repitió triste y meditabundo mister Wolfshiem—. Lleno de caras muertas y desaparecidas. Lleno de amigos que se han ido para siempre. No olvidaré mientras viva la noche que mataron a Rosy Rosenthal. Éramos seis a la mesa, y Rosy había comido y bebido mucho aquella noche. Cuando ya era casi de día, el camarero se le acercó con un gesto raro y le dijo que alguien quería hablar con él en la calle. «Muy bien», dijo Rosy, y empezó a levantarse.
vi_translation: Wolfsheim pondered sadly. "Filled with images of faces long gone. Filled with the shadows of friends who have departed forever. As long as I live, I can never forget the night they shot Rosy Rosenthal there. There were six of us sitting at the table, and Rosy had eaten and drunk a lot that night. As dawn was approaching, the waiter came over to him with a strange look and said that someone wanted to talk to him outside. "Alright." Rosy said and began to stand up. I pulled him back into his seat."
tr_translation: “Old Metropole,” said Mr. Wolfsheim to himself, “Full of partings... With memories of many friends we have bid farewell to for eternity... I can never forget the night Rosy Rosenthal was shot. There were six of us. Rosenthal had been eating and drinking all night, and just as it was almost morning, a waiter approached him with a strange expression on his face and told him that someone was waiting outside to see him. When Rosenthal said, ‘Okay,’ and tried to get up, I grabbed his arm and sat him back down, saying, ‘If those bastards want you so much, let them come to you, for my sake, don’t go anywhere!’
es_translation: —The old Metropole —repeated Mr. Wolfshiem sadly and pensively—. Full of dead and disappeared faces. Full of friends who are gone forever. I will never forget the night they killed Rosy Rosenthal as long as I live. There were six of us at the table, and Rosy had eaten and drunk a lot that night. When it was almost daylight, the waiter approached him with a strange gesture and told him that someone wanted to talk to him outside. “Very well,” said Rosy, and began to get up.

en: “ ‘Let the bastards come in here if they want you, Rosy, but don’t you, so help me, move outside this room.’
vi: "Hãy để những tên khốn nạn đó vào đây nếu chúng muốn anh, Rosy, nhưng làm ơn giúp tôi, đừng ra khỏi căn phòng này."
tr: Rosenthal, ‘Peki,’ diyerek kalkmaya yeltendiğinde, koluna yapıştığım gibi onu yerine oturttum ve ‘O it herifler seni çok istiyorsa ayağına gelsin, benim hatırım için, sen bir yere çıkma!’ dedim.
es: Yo lo obligué a sentarse: «Que vengan aquí esos hijos de puta si quieren verte, Rosy, pero no se te ocurra salir de esta habitación».
vi_translation: "Let those bastards in if they want, Rosy, but please help me, don't leave this room."
tr_translation: When Rosenthal said, ‘Okay,’ and tried to get up, I grabbed his arm and sat him back down, saying, ‘If those bastards want you so much, let them come to you, for my sake, don’t go anywhere!’
es_translation: I forced him to sit down: “Let those sons of bitches come here if they want to see you, Rosy, but don’t you dare leave this room.”

en: “It was four o’clock in the morning then, and if we’d of raised the blinds we’d of seen daylight.”
vi: "Lúc đó là bốn giờ sáng và nếu như chúng tôi có vén màn cửa lên nhìn, chúng tôi cũng có thể thấy ánh sáng mặt trời."
tr: “Saat dördü geçmişti; perdeler açılsa belki neredeyse havanın aydınlandığını görecektik.
es: Eran las cuatro de la mañana, y si hubiéramos levantado las persianas habríamos visto la luz del día.
vi_translation: "It was four in the morning, and if we had drawn the curtains to look, we could have seen the sunlight."
tr_translation: “It was past four o'clock; if the curtains were opened, we might have seen that it was almost daylight.”
es_translation: It was four in the morning, and if we had raised the blinds, we would have seen the daylight.

en: “Did he go?” I asked innocently.
vi: "Anh ta có đi ra ngoài không?" Tôi hỏi một cách ngây thơ.
tr: “Peki Rosenthal çıktı mı?” diye sordum safça.
es: —¿Y salió? —pregunté inocentemente.
vi_translation: "Did he go outside?" I asked innocently.
tr_translation: “So, has Rosenthal left?” I asked innocently.
es_translation: —And did he leave? —I asked innocently.

en: “Sure he went.” Mr. Wolfshiem’s nose flashed at me indignantly. “He turned around in the door and says: ‘Don’t let that waiter take away my coffee!’ Then he went out on the sidewalk, and they shot him three times in his full belly and drove away.”
vi: "Anh ta chắc chắc là đi chứ." Chiếc mũi của Wolfsheim hỉnh về phía tôi một cách căm phẫn. "Lúc ra đến cửa anh ta còn quay người lại nói: "Đừng để người hầu bàn dọn ly cà phê của tôi đi!" Sau đó anh ta đi ra ngoài hè đường, bọn chúng đã bắn anh ta ba phát ngay giữa chiếc bụng no nê của anh ta rồi lái xe chạy mất."
tr: “Çıktı ya!” Bay Wolfsheim’ın burnu bir hışımla bana döndü. “Hatta kapıya yaklaştığında bize dönerek, ‘Kahveme sahip çıkın, garson geri götürmesin!’ demişti. Sonra dışarıya çıkıp kaldırımdan indi, işte o anda adamlar karnına üç kurşun sıkıp tüydüler.
es: —Por supuesto que salió —la nariz de mister Wolfshiem se dirigió fulminante hacia mí, indignada—. Se volvió en la puerta y dijo: «¡Que el camarero no se lleve mi café!» Luego salió a la acera, le pegaron tres tiros en la barriga y se dieron a la fuga.
vi_translation: "He definitely left, didn't he." Wolfsheim's nose turned towards me indignantly. "When he reached the door, he turned around and said, 'Don't let the waiter take my coffee cup away!' Then he went out onto the sidewalk, and they shot him three times right in his full belly before driving away."
tr_translation: “He went out!” Mr. Wolfsheim's nose turned to me in a fury. “In fact, as he approached the door, he turned to us and said, ‘Watch my coffee, don't let the waiter take it back!’ Then he went outside and stepped off the sidewalk, and at that moment, the men shot him three times in the stomach and fled.”
es_translation: —Of course he went out —Mr. Wolfshiem's nose pointed sharply at me, indignant—. He turned at the door and said: "Don't let the waiter take my coffee!" Then he went out to the sidewalk, got shot three times in the belly, and they fled.

en: “Four of them were electrocuted,” I said, remembering.
vi: "Bốn người bọn họ sau này đã bị xử tử bằng ghế điện." Tôi kể tiếp lời, nhớ lại chuyện.
tr: “Ama dördü de yakalanıp elektrikli sandalyede idam edildi” dedim, anımsayarak.
es: —Electrocutaron a cuatro —dije, haciendo memoria.
vi_translation: "The four of them were later executed by electric chair." I continued, recalling the story.
tr_translation: “But all four were caught and executed in the electric chair,” I said, recalling.
es_translation: —They electrocuted four —I said, trying to remember.

en: “Five, with Becker.” His nostrils turned to me in an interested way. “I understand you’re looking for a business gonnegtion.”
vi: "Năm, có cả Becker." Hai lỗ mũi của ông ta hướng về tôi một cách quan tâm. "Theo như tôi biết anh đang tìm đường dây làm ăn."
tr: “Becker’i de sayarsak beş” dedi, burun deliklerini bana doğru çevirerek, “Anladığım kadarıyla bir takım iş bağlantıları kurmaya çalışıyormuşsunuz.
es: —A cinco, contando a Becker —las ventanas de la nariz se abrieron ante mí con interés—. Tengo entendido que busca usted coneggsiones para sus negocios.
vi_translation: "Yes, including Becker." His nostrils flared towards me with interest. "As far as I know, you're looking for a business connection."
tr_translation: “Including Becker, that makes five,” he said, turning his nostrils towards me, “As far as I understand, you are trying to establish some business connections.”
es_translation: —Five, counting Becker —the nostrils flared with interest before me—. I understand that you are looking for connections for your business.

en: The juxtaposition of these two remarks was startling. Gatsby answered for me:
vi: Hai câu nói liền nhau này khiến tôi ngạc nhiên. Gatsby trả lời dùm cho tôi.
tr: Bu iki cümleyi birbirine bağlama tarzına doğrusu şaşırmıştım. Ancak bu soruyu benim yerime Gatsby yanıtladı, “Hayır, o bir başkası.
es: La yuxtaposición de aquellas dos frases me dejó perplejo. Gatsby respondió por mí.
vi_translation: These two consecutive sentences surprised me. Gatsby answered for me.
tr_translation: I was truly surprised by the way these two sentences were connected to each other. However, Gatsby answered this question in my place, "No, it's someone else."
es_translation: The juxtaposition of those two sentences left me perplexed. Gatsby answered for me.

en: “No?” Mr. Wolfshiem seemed disappointed.
vi: "Không phải à?" Wolfsheim tỏ vẻ thất vọng.
tr: “Öyle mi?” Hayal kırıklığına uğramışa benzi­yordu.
es: —¿No? —Mister Wolfshiem parecía desilusionado.
vi_translation: "Isn't it?" Wolfsheim looked disappointed.
tr_translation: He seemed disappointed.
es_translation: —No? —Mr. Wolfshiem seemed disappointed.

en: “This is just a friend. I told you we’d talk about that some other time.”
vi: "Anh này chỉ là bạn. Tôi đã nói với anh, chúng ta sẽ nói chuyện đó lúc khác."
tr: “Bu beyefendi benim bir dostum. O meseleyi daha sonra konuşacağımızı söylemiştim sana.
es: —Es sólo un amigo. Ya te dije que hablaríamos de eso en otro momento.
