vi: Thế rồi, khoảng cách đây sáu tuần chị ấy đã nghe lại được cái tên Gatsby lần đầu tiên sau bao năm. Đó là lúc em hỏi anh, anh còn nhớ không? Em hỏi rằng nếu anh biết Gatsby ở bên West Egg. Sau khi anh đã ra về rồi, Daisy đến phòng em đánh thức em dậy, chị hỏi: 'Gatsby nào vậy?' Lúc đó em đang nửa ngủ nửa tỉnh. Sau khi nghe en diễn tả, chị ấy đã nói bằng một giọng khác lạ nhất rằng người đó có lẽ là người chị đã từng quen. Mãi đến lúc đó em mới nhận ra Gatbsy là người sĩ quan hôm nào trong chiếc xe trắng của Daisy.
tr: “Uzatmayalım, altı hafta kadar önce yıllardan sonra ilk kez Gatsby adını işitti. Hani sana West Egg’den Gatsby’i tanıyıp tanımadığını sormuştum, hatırladın mı? İşte o gün sen ayrıldıktan sonra Daisy odama geldi, beni uyandırarak “Hangi Gatsby?” diye sordu. Uyku sersemi adamı tarif ettiğimde, esrarengiz bir tavırla onun eski bir tanıdığı olabileceğini söyledi. İşte ancak o zaman, Gatsby ile onun beyaz arabasında görmüş olduğum teğmeni ilişkilendirebilmiştim!
es: Y, bueno, hace unas seis semanas, oyó el nombre de Gatsby por primera vez al cabo de los años. Fue cuando te pregunté en West Egg —¿te acuerdas?— si conocías a Gatsby. Después de que te fueras, Daisy entró en mi habitación, me despertó y dijo: «¿Qué Gatsby?». Y cuando se lo describí —yo estaba medio dormida— dijo con una voz rarísima que debía de ser el hombre que ella conocía. Hasta ese momento no había relacionado a aquel Gatsby con el oficial del descapotable blanco.
vi_translation: Then, about six weeks ago, she heard the name Gatsby again for the first time in many years. That was when I asked you, do you remember? I asked if you knew Gatsby over in West Egg. After you had left, Daisy came to my room and woke me up, she asked: 'Which Gatsby?' At that time, I was half asleep, half awake. After hearing my description, she said in the strangest voice that it might be someone she used to know. It wasn't until then that I realized Gatsby was the officer from that day in Daisy's white car.
tr_translation: "Let's not prolong it, about six weeks ago, for the first time in years, I heard the name Gatsby. Remember when I asked you if you knew Gatsby from West Egg? Well, that day after you left, Daisy came to my room, woke me up, and asked, 'Which Gatsby?' When I described the man in my sleepy state, she said with a mysterious air that he could be an old acquaintance. It was only then that I could relate the lieutenant I had seen with Gatsby in his white car!"
es_translation: And, well, about six weeks ago, she heard Gatsby's name for the first time in years. It was when I asked you in West Egg — do you remember? — if you knew Gatsby. After you left, Daisy came into my room, woke me up, and said: "Which Gatsby?" And when I described him — I was half asleep — she said in a very strange voice that it must be the man she knew. Until that moment, she hadn't connected that Gatsby with the officer in the white convertible.

en: When Jordan Baker had finished telling all this we had left the Plaza for half an hour and were driving in a victoria through Central Park. The sun had gone down behind the tall apartments of the movie stars in the West Fifties, and the clear voices of children, already gathered like crickets on the grass, rose through the hot twilight:
vi: Khi Jordan đã kết thúc câu chuyện thì chúng tôi cũng đã rời khách sạn Plaza chừng nửa giờ và đang lái trên chiếc xe mui trần ngang qua công viên Central Park. Mặt trời đã lặn xuống phía sau những dãy nhà chung cư cao ngất của những minh tinh điện ảnh ở đường West Fifties. Những đứa bé gái đã tập họp với nhau như những con dế mèn trên đám cỏ, cất giọng hát trong trẻo bay cao vượt qua ánh chiều chạng vạng nóng bức.
tr: “Jordan Baker hikayesini bitirdiğinde Plaza’dan ayrılalı yarım saat olmuş; faytonla Central Park’tan geçiyorduk. Gü­neş, sinema yıldızlarının yaşadığı West Fifties’in yüksek binaların ardından batmaktaydı. Çimenlerde ağustos böcekleri gibi çoktan toplaşmış olan kızların neşeli cıvıltıları, o sıcak alacakaranlıkta yükseliyordu.
es: Cuando Jordan Baker terminó de contármelo todo hacía media hora que nos habíamos ido del Plaza y cruzábamos Central Park en una victoria, uno de esos coches de caballos para turistas. El sol se había hundido detrás de los edificios de apartamentos de las estrellas de cine en las calles Cincuenta de la zona oeste, y en el calor del crepúsculo se elevaban voces claras e infantiles, como una reunión de grillos en la hierba:
vi_translation: When Jordan had finished the story, we had already left the Plaza Hotel about half an hour ago and were driving in the convertible past Central Park. The sun had set behind the towering apartment buildings of movie stars on West Fifties Street. Little girls had gathered together like crickets on the grass, their clear voices rising above the hot twilight.
tr_translation: “When Jordan Baker finished her story, it had been half an hour since we left the Plaza; we were passing through Central Park by carriage. The sun was setting behind the tall buildings of the West Fifties, where movie stars lived. The cheerful chirping of the girls, who had already gathered on the grass like cicadas, was rising in that warm twilight.
es_translation: When Jordan Baker finished telling me everything, it had been half an hour since we had left the Plaza and were crossing Central Park in a victoria, one of those horse-drawn carriages for tourists. The sun had sunk behind the movie stars' apartment buildings on the West Fifties streets, and in the heat of the twilight, clear and childlike voices rose, like a gathering of crickets in the grass:

en: Your love belongs to me.
vi: Tình yêu của em vốn thuộc về ta.
tr: Kalbin artık benim
es: Tu amor me pertenece.
vi_translation: Your love originally belongs to me.
tr_translation: Your heart is now mine
es_translation: Your love belongs to me.

en: At night when you’re asleep
vi: Đêm đến khi em chìm trong giấc ngủ
tr: Sen uyurken geceleyin
es: De noche cuando duermas
vi_translation: At night when you fall into sleep
tr_translation: While you were sleeping at night
es_translation: At night when you sleep

en: Into your tent I’ll creep—”
vi: Ta bò vào trong lều ta tìm em"
tr: Çadırına geleceğim...
es: me arrastraré a tu tienda[13].
vi_translation: He crawled into my tent looking for you"
tr_translation: I will come to your tent...
es_translation: I will crawl to your tent[13].

en: “It was a strange coincidence,” I said.
vi: "Đây đúng là một chuyện tình cờ lạ lùng." Tôi nói.
tr: “Tuhaf rastlantı,” dedim.
es: —Ha sido una coincidencia curiosa. —No.
vi_translation: "This is indeed a strange coincidence." I said.
tr_translation: “Strange coincidence,” I said.
es_translation: —It has been a curious coincidence. —No.

en: “But it wasn’t a coincidence at all.”
vi: "Thật ra nó không tình cờ chút nào cả?"
tr: “Aslında rastlantı değil!
es: No ha sido una coincidencia.
vi_translation: "Actually, it wasn't a coincidence at all?"
tr_translation: "Actually, it's not a coincidence!""
es_translation: It has not been a coincidence.

en: “Why not?”
vi: "Tại sao không?"
tr: “Nasıl yani?
es: —¿Cómo que no?
vi_translation: "Why not?"
tr_translation: “What do you mean?”
es_translation: —What do you mean, no?

en: “Gatsby bought that house so that Daisy would be just across the bay.”
vi: "Gatsby mua căn nhà đó để được ở cách Daisy một vịnh nước."
tr: “Gatsby zaten o malikaneyi, koyun diğer yakasındaki Daisy’nin evinin tam karşısına rastladığı için bilerek almış.
es: —Gatsby compró esa casa porque Daisy vivía al otro lado de la bahía.
vi_translation: "Gatsby bought that house to be across the bay from Daisy."
tr_translation: “Gatsby deliberately bought that mansion because it was directly across the bay from Daisy's house.”
es_translation: —Gatsby bought that house because Daisy lived on the other side of the bay.

en: Then it had not been merely the stars to which he had aspired on that June night. He came alive to me, delivered suddenly from the womb of his purposeless splendour.
vi: Nếu đúng như thế thì cái đêm tháng Sáu vừa qua Gatsby không phải ra ngoài chỉ để mà ngắm sao trời. Bây giờ thì tôi đã cảm nhận được anh ta. Gatsby đã đột nhiên được lột thoát ra từ trong cái vỏ huy hoàng rực rỡ không mục đích của mình.
tr: “Demek o Haziran gecesinde karanlıkta uzanmaya çalıştığı sadece yıldızlar değildi.” Birden Gatsby, o amaçsız ihtişamın içinden sıyrılarak, yaşam bulmuş gibi göründü gözüme.
es: Así que no sólo suspiraba por las estrellas aquella noche de junio. Y entonces Gatsby cobró vida para mí: de repente salió del útero de su esplendor inútil.
vi_translation: If that is true, then that June night Gatsby did not go out just to look at the stars. Now I can feel him. Gatsby had suddenly been stripped out of his magnificent, purposeless shell.
tr_translation: “So it wasn't just the stars he was reaching for in the dark that June night.” Suddenly, Gatsby emerged from that aimless splendor, appearing as if he had come to life.
es_translation: So he was not just sighing for the stars that June night. And then Gatsby came to life for me: suddenly he emerged from the womb of his futile splendor.

en: “He wants to know,” continued Jordan, “if you’ll invite Daisy to your house some afternoon and then let him come over.”
vi: "Anh ta muốn biết." Jordan tiếp tục. "Nếu anh có thể mời Daisy tới nhà của anh buổi chiều nào đó và sau đó để anh ta sang."
tr: “Senden ricasına gelince,” diye devam etti Jordan, “tek istediği bir gün Daisy’i evine davet etmen ve tabi kendisini de kabul etmen.
es: —Quiere saber —continuó Jordan— si invitarías a Daisy a tu casa una tarde para que luego se presentara él.
vi_translation: "He wants to know," Jordan continued. "If you could invite Daisy to your house some afternoon and then let him come over."
tr_translation: “As for his request from you,” Jordan continued, “all he wants is for you to invite Daisy to your house one day and, of course, to accept him as well.”
es_translation: —He wants to know —Jordan continued— if you would invite Daisy to your house one afternoon so that he could then show up.

en: The modesty of the demand shook me. He had waited five years and bought a mansion where he dispensed starlight to casual moths—so that he could “come over” some afternoon to a stranger’s garden.
vi: Lời đòi hỏi quá khiêm tốn này khiến tôi rung động. Anh ta đã chờ đợi năm năm trời, mua một tòa lâu đài đồ sộ nơi anh có thể phân phát ánh sao trời tới cho những con bướm đêm, chỉ để mà có thể một chiều nào đó được "ghé ngang" vườn nhà một người xa lạ.
tr: Ricasındaki tevazu beni hayrete düşürmüştü: Beş yıl boyunca beklemiş, ardından yıldızlar misali parıldayan ışığıyla gece pervanelerini başına üşüştürecek olan o ihtişamlı malikaneyi almıştı. Bütün bunlar sırf onunla, bir yabancının bahçesinde bir öğle vaktini geçirmek için miydi?
es: La modestia de la petición me desconcertó. Había esperado cinco años y había comprado una mansión donde repartía luz de estrellas entre polillas que acudían al azar, sólo para poder «presentarse» una tarde en el jardín de un extraño.
vi_translation: This overly modest request moved me. He had waited five long years, bought a massive castle where he could distribute starlight to the moths, just so that one day he might "drop by" the garden of a stranger.
tr_translation: His humility in his request had astonished me: He had waited for five years, and then he had acquired that magnificent mansion, which with its light shining like stars would attract the night moths to it. Was all this just to spend an afternoon with him in a stranger's garden?
es_translation: The modesty of the request puzzled me. He had waited five years and had bought a mansion where he spread starlight among moths that came by chance, just to be able to "show up" one afternoon in a stranger's garden.

en: “Did I have to know all this before he could ask such a little thing?”
vi: "Tôi có phải cần biết hết mọi chuyện như thế này trước khi anh ta có thể nhờ cậy một chuyện nhỏ mọn như vậy?"
tr: “Böylesi küçük bir isteği yanıtlamak için, tüm bunları öğrenmeme ne gerek vardı?
es: —¿Y tenía yo que saber toda la historia antes de que me pidiera algo tan insignificante?
vi_translation: "Do I need to know everything like this before he can ask for a small favor like that?"
tr_translation: “To answer such a small request, what was the need for me to learn all this?”
es_translation: —And did I have to know the whole story before you asked me for something so insignificant?

en: “He’s afraid, he’s waited so long. He thought you might be offended. You see, he’s regular tough underneath it all.”
vi: "Anh ta lo sợ, anh ta đã chờ đợi đã quá lâu. Anh ta nghĩ anh sẽ phật lòng. Anh thấy đó, dưới cái lớp cứng rắn mạnh mẽ bên ngoài anh ta chỉ là người bình thường.
tr: “Korkuyor. Öyle çok beklemiş ki. Senin güceneceğinden çekiniyor. Sonuçta tüm o davranışlarının ardında, nihayetinde o da bir delikanlı.
es: —Está asustado. Ha esperado mucho tiempo. Pensaba que podías molestarte. En el fondo, ya ves, no es tan duro como parece.
vi_translation: "He is afraid, he has waited too long. He thinks you will be displeased. You see, beneath that tough and strong exterior, he is just an ordinary person."
tr_translation: “He is afraid. He has waited so long. He is worried that you will be offended. After all, behind all those behaviors, ultimately he is also a young man.”
es_translation: —He is scared. He has waited a long time. He thought you might get upset. Deep down, you see, he is not as tough as he seems.

en: Something worried me.
vi: Có cái gì đó khiến tôi lo ngại.
tr: Aklıma bir şey takılmıştı.
es: Algo me preocupaba.
vi_translation: There is something that makes me uneasy.
tr_translation: Something was on my mind.
es_translation: Something was worrying me.

en: “Why didn’t he ask you to arrange a meeting?”
vi: "Tại sao anh ta không hỏi em để sắp đặt cho cuộc gặp gỡ?"
tr: “Neden bu buluşmayı senin ayarlamanı istemedi ki?
es: —¿Por qué no te pide que le prepares una cita?
vi_translation: "Why didn't he ask me to arrange the meeting?"
tr_translation: “Why didn't they want you to arrange this meeting?”
es_translation: —Why doesn't he ask you to set up a date for him?

en: “He wants her to see his house,” she explained. “And your house is right next door.”
vi: "Anh ta muốn Dasisy nhìn thấy nhà của anh ta." Jorsan giải thích. "Mà nhà của anh thì ở kế ngay bên cạnh."
tr: “Çünkü Daisy’nin, evini görmesini istiyor,” diye izah etti, “senin evin de onunkine bitişik.
es: —Quiere que Daisy vea su casa —me explicó—. Y tu casa está al lado.
vi_translation: "He wants Daisy to see his house." Jorsan explained. "And his house is right next door."
tr_translation: "Because he wants Daisy to see his house," he explained, "and your house is next to his.""
es_translation: —He wants Daisy to see his house —he explained to me—. And your house is next door.

en: “I think he half expected her to wander into one of his parties, some night,” went on Jordan, “but she never did. Then he began asking people casually if they knew her, and I was the first one he found. It was that night he sent for me at his dance, and you should have heard the elaborate way he worked up to it. Of course, I immediately suggested a luncheon in New York—and I thought he’d go mad:
vi: "Em nghĩ anh ta mong đợi vào một tối nào đó Daisy sẽ lai vãng tới một trong những bữa tiệc ở nhà mình." Jordan tiếp tục. "Nhưng chị ấy đã chưa bao giờ tới. Sau đó anh ta làm như vô tình, thường hỏi thăm người khác nếu họ có quen biết Daisy. Em là người đầu tiên anh ta tìm được. Đó là cái đêm ở dạ vũ anh ta cho người mời em vô gặp mặt. Anh nên nghe cách anh ta rào trước đón sau như thế nào. Đương nhiên ngay lập tức em đề nghị một bữa ăn trưa ở New York, em tưởng anh ta đã nổi khùng:
tr: “Muhtemelen vermiş olduğu partilerden birine, Daisy’nin kendiliğinden çıkıp gelmesini umuyordu,” diye devam etti Jordan, ‘ Fakat bu hiç olmadı. Sonra hislerini gizlemeye çalışarak etrafa onu tanıyıp tanımadığını sormaya başladı. Bulduğu ilk kişi de bendim. O gün seninle rastlaştığımız partide, benimle özel olarak görüşmek is­tediğini anımsarsın. Halini görmeliydin, lafa girmek için geveleyip durdu. Durumu anladığımda, New York’ta bir öğle yemeği ayarlamayı önerdim, ancak küplere bindi.
es: —Creo que abrigaba cierta esperanza de ver a Daisy alguna noche en una de sus fiestas —continuó Jordan—. No fue así. Entonces empezó a preguntarle a la gente, como por casualidad, si la conocían, y yo fui la primera con la que dio. Fue la noche que me llamó durante la fiesta y tendrías que haber oído de qué manera tan rebuscada y estudiada me habló del asunto. Sugerí inmediatamente, como es natural, un almuerzo en Nueva York, y creí que iba a perder los nervios: «¡No quiero hacer nada incorrecto!
vi_translation: "He thought that one evening Daisy might wander into one of his parties." Jordan continued. "But she never did. After that, he would casually ask others if they knew Daisy. You were the first person he found. That was the night at the ball when he had someone invite you in to meet him. You should have heard how he beat around the bush. Of course, I immediately suggested a lunch in New York, and I thought he had gone mad:
tr_translation: “He was probably hoping that Daisy would show up to one of the parties he threw,” Jordan continued, “But that never happened. Then he started asking around if anyone knew her, trying to hide his feelings. The first person he found was me. You remember the party where we ran into each other that day, he wanted to talk to me privately. You should have seen him, he was stammering just to get a word in. When I understood the situation, I suggested arranging a lunch in New York, but he was furious.
es_translation: —I think he harbored some hope of seeing Daisy some night at one of his parties —continued Jordan—. It didn't happen. Then he started asking people, as if by chance, if they knew her, and I was the first one he came across. It was the night he called me during the party and you should have heard how convoluted and studied his talk about the matter was. I immediately suggested, naturally, a lunch in New York, and I thought he was going to lose his nerves: «I don't want to do anything improper!

en: “ ‘I don’t want to do anything out of the way!’ he kept saying. ‘I want to see her right next door.’
vi: 'Tôi không muốn phải làm bất cứ việc gì phiền phức đi xa xôi như vậy' Anh ta cứ nói 'Tôi chỉ muốn gặp cô ấy ở ngay bên cạnh nhà thôi.
tr: ‘Onunla o kadar uzakta, kuytu köşelerde buluşmak istemiyorum,’ diye çıkışmıştı, ‘onunla bitişiğimdeki, hemen yanı başımdaki evde görüşmek istiyorum.
es: Sugerí inmediatamente, como es natural, un almuerzo en Nueva York, y creí que iba a perder los nervios: «¡No quiero hacer nada incorrecto! Quiero verla en la casa de al lado».
vi_translation: 'I don't want to have to do anything troublesome that involves going so far away' He kept saying, 'I just want to meet her right next to my house.''
tr_translation: ‘I don’t want to meet her in some far-off, secluded place,’ he had burst out, ‘I want to meet her in the house right next to mine, just beside me.’
es_translation: I immediately suggested, naturally, a lunch in New York, and I thought he was going to lose his nerves: «I don't want to do anything improper! I want to see her in the house next door».

en: “When I said you were a particular friend of Tom’s, he started to abandon the whole idea. He doesn’t know very much about Tom, though he says he’s read a Chicago paper for years just on the chance of catching a glimpse of Daisy’s name.”
vi: "Khi nghe em nói anh là bạn đặc biệt của Tom, thì anh ta bỏ hết mọi toan tính. Anh ta không biết nhiều lắm về Tom, tuy rằng anh ta đã từng đọc báo Chicago nhiều năm chỉ để mong có cơ hội tìm được tên của Daisy đăng trên báo."
tr: “Senin Tom’un ahbabı olduğunu öğrendiğinde, planından cayar gibi oldu. Her ne kadar Daisy ile ilgili bir haber vardır umuduyla yıllardır Chicago’nun tüm gazetelerini okuyor olsa da; Tom’u pek tanımıyor.
es: Cuando le dije que eras amigo íntimo de Tom, estuvo a punto de abandonar la idea. No sabe mucho de Tom, aunque dice que ha leído durante años un periódico de Chicago sólo con la esperanza de ver el nombre de Daisy.
vi_translation: "When he heard you say that you were a special friend of Tom, he abandoned all his schemes. He didn't know much about Tom, although he had read the Chicago newspapers for many years just hoping to find Daisy's name mentioned."
tr_translation: “When he learned that you were Tom's friend, he seemed to back out of his plan. Even though he has been reading all the Chicago newspapers for years in the hope of finding news about Daisy, he doesn't know Tom very well.”
es_translation: When I told him you were a close friend of Tom's, he almost gave up the idea. He doesn't know much about Tom, although he says he's been reading a Chicago newspaper for years just in the hope of seeing Daisy's name.

en: It was dark now, and as we dipped under a little bridge I put my arm around Jordan’s golden shoulder and drew her toward me and asked her to dinner. Suddenly I wasn’t thinking of Daisy and Gatsby any more, but of this clean, hard, limited person, who dealt in universal scepticism, and who leaned back jauntily just within the circle of my arm. A phrase began to beat in my ears with a sort of heady excitement: “There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy, and the tired.”
vi: Trời bây giờ đã tối hẳn, khi hai chúng tôi đi ngang dưới chân một chiếc cầu nhỏ, tôi đưa tay ôm choàng ngang đôi vai ngọc ngà của Jordan và kéo cô lại gần mình hơn, tôi mời Jordan đi ăn chiều. Đột nhiên tôi không còn nghĩ về Daisy hay Gatsby nữa, mà chỉ nghĩ về người con gái cân đối, rắn chắc này. Một câu nói bắt đầu cứ đập vào tai tôi bốc lên đầu đầy kích động: "Ở đây đang chỉ có một người được theo đuổi, một người đang theo đuổi, một người bận rộn và một người mệt mỏi."
tr: Hava artık kararmıştı, küçük bir köprünün altından geçerken, kolumu altın rengi omzuna dolayıp onu kendime doğru çektim ve beraber yemeğe gitmeyi önerdim. Birden Daisy de, Gatsby de uçup gitmişti aklımdan; o an tek düşünebildiğim, kolumun altında bana fütursuzca sokulmuş olan bu temiz, zorlu, kontrollü ve biraz da şüpheci kızdı. Kafamın içinde, baş döndürücü bir heyecanla şu sözler dönüp duruyordu, “Yalnızca kaçanlar ve kovalayanlar, meşguller ve bitkinler vardır.
es: Había oscurecido y, al pasar bajo un puentecillo, mi brazo rodeó el hombro dorado de Jordan, la atraje hacia mí y la invité a cenar. Ya no pensaba en Daisy ni en Gatsby, sino en aquella persona sana, difícil, concreta, que profesaba un escepticismo universal, y que echaba el cuerpo hacia atrás, satisfecha, dentro del círculo de mi brazo. Una frase empezó a martillearme los oídos en una especie de embriaguez: «Sólo existen los perseguidos y los perseguidores, los activos y los cansados».
vi_translation: It was now completely dark, as the two of us walked under the foot of a small bridge, I put my arm around Jordan's delicate shoulders and pulled her closer to me, I invited Jordan to dinner. Suddenly I no longer thought about Daisy or Gatsby, but only about this well-proportioned, firm girl. A phrase began to ring in my ears, rising to my head with excitement: "Here there is only one person being pursued, one person pursuing, one busy person, and one tired person."
tr_translation: The sky had already darkened, and as we passed under a small bridge, I wrapped my arm around her golden shoulder, pulling her close to me, and suggested we go out for dinner together. Suddenly, both Daisy and Gatsby had vanished from my mind; all I could think about at that moment was this clean, challenging, controlled, and slightly skeptical girl who had nestled against me so recklessly under my arm. In my head, these words kept spinning with dizzying excitement, “There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy, and the tired.”
es_translation: It had grown dark and, as we passed under a small bridge, my arm encircled Jordan's golden shoulder, I drew her towards me and invited her to dinner. I was no longer thinking about Daisy or Gatsby, but about that healthy, difficult, concrete person who professed a universal skepticism, and who leaned back, satisfied, within the circle of my arm. A phrase began to hammer in my ears in a kind of intoxication: "There are only the pursued and the pursuers, the active and the tired."

en: “And Daisy ought to have something in her life,” murmured Jordan to me.
vi: "Chị Daisy cũng nên có một cái gì đó cho đời mình." Jordan thì thầm bên tai tôi.
tr: “Daisy’nin hayatının biraz olsun renklenmesi lazım” dedi Jordan.
es: —Y Daisy debería tener algo en la vida —murmuró Jordan.
vi_translation: "Daisy ought to have something in her life as well." Jordan whispered in my ear.
tr_translation: “Daisy's life needs a little bit of color,” said Jordan.
es_translation: —And Daisy should have something in life —murmured Jordan.

en: “Does she want to see Gatsby?”
vi: "Daisy có muốn gặp Gatsby hay không?"
tr: “Gatsby’le görüşmek istiyor mu?
es: —¿Quiere ver a Gatsby?
vi_translation: "Does Daisy want to meet Gatsby?"
tr_translation: “Does he want to meet Gatsby?”
es_translation: —Do you want to see Gatsby?

en: “She’s not to know about it. Gatsby doesn’t want her to know. You’re just supposed to invite her to tea.”
vi: "Chị ấy không nên biết về chuyện này. Gatsby không muốn chị ấy niết. Anh chỉ làm bộ như mời chị ấy tới uống trà."
tr: “Onun bu buluşmadan haberi yok ki, Gatsby bilmesini istemiyor. Sana düşen sadece onu çaya davet etmek.
es: —No tiene que enterarse. Gatsby no quiere que sepa nada. Sólo tienes que invitarla a tomar el té.
vi_translation: "She shouldn't know about this. Gatsby doesn't want her to know. He just pretended to invite her for tea."
tr_translation: “She doesn't know about this meeting, Gatsby doesn't want her to know. Your only task is to invite her to tea.”
es_translation: —She doesn't have to find out. Gatsby doesn't want her to know anything. You just have to invite her for tea.

en: We passed a barrier of dark trees, and then the façade of Fifty-Ninth Street, a block of delicate pale light, beamed down into the park. Unlike Gatsby and Tom Buchanan, I had no girl whose disembodied face floated along the dark cornices and blinding signs, and so I drew up the girl beside me, tightening my arms. Her wan, scornful mouth smiled, and so I drew her up again closer, this time to my face.
vi: Chúng tôi đi ngang qua một hàng cây tối xậm màu ra tới mặt chính của đường Fifty Ninth, một khoảng bóng tối nhạt màu êm dịu chiếu xuống trong công viên. Không như Gatsby và Tom Buchanan, tôi không có bạn gái nào có khuôn mặt loáng thoáng lướt qua trên những gờ mái nhà tối sẫm, hay trên những bảng quảng cáo sáng chưng. Bởi vậy tôi kéo người con gái bên cạnh mình lại gần, hai tay xiết chặt lấy cô. Chiếc miệng mệt mỏi và khinh khỉnh của Jordan mỉm cười, và như thế tôi kéo cô lại gần hơn thêm, tới sát khuôn mặt của mình.
tr: Karanlık bir koruluğu aştığımızda, ön cephesinden dökülen solgun ışık huzmeleri parka kadar ulaşan, 59’uncu Cadde’yi görebiliyorduk. Gatsby’nin ya da Tom Buchanan’ınki gibi, yüzünün hayali karanlık pervazlarda ya da ışıldayan tabelalarda uçuşan bir sevgilim olmadığından, ben de yanımdaki kızı kendime çekerek onu sıkıca sardım. O solgun ve alaycı dudaklarında bir gülümseme belirince, bu defa yüzünü yüzüme yaklaştırarak, ona daha da sokuldum.
es: Dejamos atrás una barrera de árboles en penumbra y las fachadas de la calle Cincuenta y nueve, una franja de luz débil y pálida, brillaron sobre el parque. A diferencia de Gatsby y Tom Buchanan, yo no tenía una chica cuyos rasgos incorpóreos flotaran en las cornisas oscuras y los cegadores anuncios luminosos, así que atraje hacia mí a la chica que tenía al lado, estrechándola entre mis brazos. Su boca desdeñosa, triste, sonrió, así que la atraje más, hacia mi cara esta vez.
vi_translation: We walked past a row of dark trees to the main face of Fifty Ninth Street, a soft pale shadow cast down in the park. Unlike Gatsby and Tom Buchanan, I didn't have any girlfriends whose faces fleetingly passed over the dark eaves or brightly lit billboards. So I pulled the girl next to me closer, my hands tightening around her. Jordan's tired and disdainful mouth smiled, and so I pulled her even closer, right up to my face.
tr_translation: When we crossed a dark grove, we could see 59th Street, with pale beams of light spilling from its front facade reaching the park. Since I didn’t have a lover like Gatsby or Tom Buchanan, whose face would flit about in imaginary dark sills or glowing signs, I pulled the girl next to me closer and held her tightly. When a smile appeared on her pale and mocking lips, I drew even closer to her, bringing her face near mine.
es_translation: We left behind a barrier of trees in the twilight and the facades of Fifty-ninth Street, a strip of weak and pale light, shone over the park. Unlike Gatsby and Tom Buchanan, I didn't have a girl whose incorporeal features floated in the dark cornices and blinding neon signs, so I drew the girl next to me closer, holding her in my arms. Her disdainful, sad mouth smiled, so I drew her closer, towards my face this time.

en: When I came home to West Egg that night I was afraid for a moment that my house was on fire. Two o’clock and the whole corner of the peninsula was blazing with light, which fell unreal on the shrubbery and made thin elongating glints upon the roadside wires. Turning a corner, I saw that it was Gatsby’s house, lit from tower to cellar.
vi: Khi tôi quay về nhà ở West Egg tối hôm đó, trong một khoảng khắc tôi tưởng nhà mình đang bốc cháy. Lúc đó là hai giờ sáng, nguyên cả một góc bán đảo như đang rực lên trong ánh sáng. Ánh sáng rơi như hư ảo chùm lên những bụi cây và kéo dài ra thành những tia sáng lấp lánh trên những giây điện dọc đường. Lúc quẹo vào khúc quanh, tôi thấy đó chính là nhà của Gatsby, đèn bật sáng chưng từ đầu ngọn tháp tới xuống tầng hầm.
tr: O gece West Egg’e gelirken bir an için evimin yandığından korkmuştum. Gecenin ikisiydi ve yarımadanın bu köşesi çalılara ve yol kenarındaki elektrik tellerine eğreti bir dokunuşla düşen upuzun ışıklarla pırıl pırıl parlıyordu. Köşeyi dönünce Gatsby malikanesinin kulesinden mahzenine kadar ışığa bürünmüş olduğunu gördüm.
es: Cuando volví a West Egg aquella noche, temí por un momento que mi casa estuviera en llamas. Eran las dos y la punta de la península fulguraba con una luz que caía irreal sobre los setos y producía destellos alargados en los cables eléctricos de la carretera. Al doblar una esquina, vi que era la casa de Gatsby, iluminada de la torre al sótano.
vi_translation: When I returned home to West Egg that night, and for a moment I thought my house was on fire. It was two in the morning, and the entire corner of the peninsula seemed to be ablaze with light. The light fell like an illusion, enveloping the bushes and extending into sparkling rays along the electric wires on the road. As I turned the corner, I saw that it was Gatsby's house, lit up from the top of the tower down to the basement.
tr_translation: That night, as I was coming to West Egg, I was momentarily afraid that my house was on fire. It was two in the morning, and this corner of the peninsula was sparkling with long lights that fell with a makeshift touch on the bushes and the electric wires by the roadside. As I turned the corner, I saw that Gatsby's mansion was illuminated from its tower to its cellar.
es_translation: When I returned to West Egg that night, I feared for a moment that my house was on fire. It was two o'clock and the tip of the peninsula was glowing with a light that fell unreal over the hedges and produced elongated flashes on the road's electric cables. As I turned a corner, I saw that it was Gatsby's house, illuminated from the tower to the basement.

en: At first I thought it was another party, a wild rout that had resolved itself into “hide-and-go-seek” or “sardines-in-the-box” with all the house thrown open to the game. But there wasn’t a sound. Only wind in the trees, which blew the wires and made the lights go off and on again as if the house had winked into the darkness. As my taxi groaned away I saw Gatsby walking toward me across his lawn.
vi: Lúc đầu tôi tưởng nó là một buổi tiệc khác với đám người hỗn loạn điên cuồng đã tự biến dạng thành trò chơi "trốn tìm" hay trò "cá mòi trong hộp" và lấy nguyên cả căn nhà làm chỗ chơi. Thế nhưng tôi lại không nghe một âm thanh nào cả. Chỉ có tiếng gió thổi xào xạc trên các cành cây, đung đưa những sợi dây điện và làm những bóng đèn bật tắt nhấp nháy giống như căn nhà đang nháy mắt với bóng tối chung quanh. Khi chiếc xe tắc xi chở tôi về kẽo kẹt bỏ đi, tôi thấy Gatsby đang đi bộ ngang qua bãi cỏ về phía tôi.
tr: Önce evin her köşesi­ni ‘saklambaç’ ya da ‘sardalyeler kutuda’ gibi oyunlara açan, her za­manki çılgın partilerden birini veriyor sandım. Ama hiç ses yoktu. Yalnızca ağaçların arasında dolanan rüzgar duyuluyordu. Direklerdeki telleri sallıyor, ışıkları yakıp söndürüyordu. Ev gecenin içinde göz kırpıyormuş gibi görünüyordu. Geldi­ğim taksi uzaklaşırken Gatsby’nin kendi bahçesinden benimki­ne doğru yürüdüğünü gördüm.
es: Al principio pensé que se trataba de otra fiesta, una francachela descomunal y salvaje que había terminado con los invitados jugando al escondite por toda la casa. Pero no se oía un ruido. Sólo el viento en los árboles, el viento, que agitaba los cables y provocaba que las luces se apagaran y volvieran a encenderse como si la casa parpadeara en la oscuridad. Mientras mi taxi se alejaba gimiendo, vi que Gatsby se acercaba a través del césped.
vi_translation: At first, I thought it was another party with the chaotic, frenzied crowd that had turned into a game of "hide and seek" or "sardines in a can," using the entire house as the playground. However, I didn't hear a single sound. There was only the rustling sound of the wind blowing through the branches, swaying the power lines, and making the lights flicker on and off as if the house was winking at the surrounding darkness. As the taxi that brought me back creaked away, I saw Gatsby walking across the lawn towards me.
tr_translation: At first, I thought he was throwing one of his usual wild parties, opening every corner of the house to games like 'hide and seek' or 'sardines in a can.' But there was no sound. Only the wind rustling through the trees could be heard. It was shaking the wires on the poles and flickering the lights. The house seemed to be winking in the night. As the taxi I arrived in drove away, I saw Gatsby walking from his garden towards mine.
es_translation: At first, I thought it was another party, a colossal and wild binge that had ended with the guests playing hide and seek all over the house. But there wasn't a sound. Only the wind in the trees, the wind that shook the wires and caused the lights to go out and come back on as if the house were blinking in the dark. As my taxi groaned away, I saw Gatsby approaching across the lawn.

en: “Your place looks like the World’s Fair,” I said.
vi: "Nhà của anh trông giống như hội chợ thế giới." Tôi nói.
tr: “Evin panayır yerine dönmüş” dedim.
es: —Tu casa parece la Exposición Universal —dije.
vi_translation: "Your house looks like a world's fair." I said.
tr_translation: "The house has turned into a fairground," I said.
es_translation: —Your house looks like the World's Fair —I said.

en: “Does it?” He turned his eyes toward it absently. “I have been glancing into some of the rooms. Let’s go to Coney Island, old sport. In my car.”
vi: "Giống không?" Anh ta đưa mắt hướng nhìn nó một cách vô thần. "Tôi đang đi xem qua mấy căn phòng. Mình đi đảo Coney đi, anh bạn già. Đi xe tôi."
tr: “Öyle mi?” dedi dalgın gözlerle eve bakarken, “Odaların bazılarına göz atıyordum. Haydi Coney lsland’a gidelim ahbap. Benim arabayla.
es: —¿Sí? —se volvió a mirar, como ausente—. He estado echándoles un vistazo a algunas habitaciones. Vámonos a Caney Island, compañero. En mi coche.
vi_translation: "Does it look alike?" He looked at it with a blank stare. "I am just checking out some rooms." Let's go to Coney Island, old friend. Take my car."
tr_translation: “Is that so?” he said, looking at the house with absent eyes, “I was glancing into some of the rooms. Let's go to Coney Island, buddy. In my car.”
es_translation: —Yes? —he turned to look, as if absent—. I've been taking a look at some rooms. Let's go to Caney Island, buddy. In my car.

en: “It’s too late.”
vi: "Bây giờ trễ rồi."
tr: “Çok geç oldu.
es: —Es muy tarde.
vi_translation: "It's late now."
tr_translation: “It's very late.”
es_translation: —It's very late.

en: “Well, suppose we take a plunge in the swimming pool? I haven’t made use of it all summer.”
vi: "Như thế, hay là ta tắm ở hồ bơi? Nguyên cả mùa hè này tôi chưa dùng đến nó."
tr: “Peki, havuzda yüzmeye ne dersin? Bütün yaz ayağımı bile sokmadım.
es: —¿Y si nos damos un baño en la piscina? No la he usado en todo el verano.
vi_translation: "How about we swim in the pool? I haven't used it all summer."
tr_translation: “So, what do you say about swimming in the pool? I haven't even dipped my foot in all summer.”
es_translation: —How about we take a dip in the pool? I haven't used it all summer.

en: “I’ve got to go to bed.”
vi: "Tôi phải đi ngủ."
tr: “Hemen yatmam gerek.
es: —Tengo que acostarme.
vi_translation: "I have to go to sleep."
tr_translation: “I need to go to bed immediately.”
es_translation: —I have to go to bed.

en: “All right.”
vi: "Thôi cũng được."
tr: “Pekala.
es: —Muy bien.
vi_translation: "Fine, whatever."
tr_translation: “Alright.”
es_translation: —Very well.

en: He waited, looking at me with suppressed eagerness.
vi: Anh ta nhìn tôi chờ đợi, cố gắng đè nén sự nôn nóng.
tr: Heyecanını bastırmaya çalışarak yüzüme baktı. Biraz bekledi.
es: Esperó, mirándome, conteniendo la impaciencia.
vi_translation: He looked at me expectantly, trying to suppress his impatience.
tr_translation: He looked at my face, trying to suppress his excitement. He waited a bit.
es_translation: He waited, looking at me, holding back his impatience.

en: “I talked with Miss Baker,” I said after a moment. “I’m going to call up Daisy tomorrow and invite her over here to tea.”
vi: "Tôi đã nói chuyện với cô Baker rồi." Sau một lát, tôi nói. "Tôi sẽ gọi cho Daisy ngày mai và mời Daisy tới đây uống trà."
tr: “Bayan Baker’la konuştum” dedim bir süre sustuktan sonra, “Yarın Daisy’i arayıp buraya çaya çağıracağım.
es: —He hablado con miss Baker —dije al momento—. Mañana llamaré por teléfono a Daisy y la invitaré a tomar el té.
vi_translation: "I have talked to Ms. Baker already." After a moment, I said. "I will call Daisy tomorrow and invite her here for tea."
tr_translation: “I talked to Mrs. Baker,” I said after a while of silence, “Tomorrow I will call Daisy and invite her here for tea.”
es_translation: —I have spoken with Miss Baker —I said at once—. Tomorrow I will call Daisy and invite her to tea.

en: “Oh, that’s all right,” he said carelessly. “I don’t want to put you to any trouble.”
vi: "Ồ, vậy cũng được." Anh ta nói một cách hờ hững. "Tôi không muốn làm phiền đến anh."
tr: “Çok önemli değildi aslında” dedi hafife alıyormuş gibi görünmeye çalışarak “başını ağrıtmak istemem.
es: —Ah, perfecto —dijo, como si le resultara indiferente—. No quiero causarte ninguna molestia.
vi_translation: "Oh, that's fine." He said indifferently. "I don't want to bother you."
tr_translation: “It wasn't really that important,” he said, trying to appear as if he was downplaying it, “I don't want to bother you with it.”
es_translation: —Ah, perfect —he said, as if it didn't matter to him—. I don't want to cause you any trouble.

en: “What day would suit you?”
vi: "Ngày nào tiện cho anh?"
tr: “Senin için hangi gün uygun?
es: —¿Qué día te viene bien?
vi_translation: "Which day is convenient for you?" "Which day is more convenient for you?"
tr_translation: “Which day is suitable for you?”
es_translation: —What day works for you? —What day works for you?

en: “What day would suit you?” he corrected me quickly. “I don’t want to put you to any trouble, you see.”
vi: "Ngày nào tiện cho anh thì đúng hơn?" Gatsby nhanh chóng sửa lời tôi. "Tôi không muốn đặt anh vào tình thế khó khăn, anh biết đó."
tr: “Asıl senin için hangi gün uygun?” diye düzeltti. “Zahmet ver­mek istemediğimi biliyorsun.
es: —¿Qué día te viene bien a ti? —me corrigió inmediatamente—. No quiero causarte ninguna molestia, de verdad.
vi_translation: Gatsby quickly corrected me. "I don't want to put you in a difficult situation, you know."
tr_translation: “Which day is actually convenient for you?” he corrected. “You know I don't want to trouble you.”
es_translation: —he immediately corrected me—. I don't want to cause you any trouble, really.

en: “How about the day after tomorrow?”
vi: "Hay là ngày mốt?" Anh ta do dự đề nghị.
tr: “Öbür gün nasıl?
es: —¿Pasado mañana?
vi_translation: "How about the day after tomorrow?" he hesitantly suggested.
tr_translation: "How about the day after tomorrow?""
es_translation: —The day after tomorrow?

en: He considered for a moment. Then, with reluctance: “I want to get the grass cut,” he said.
vi: Sau đó, ngập ngừng "Tôi muốn bãi cỏ được cắt tỉa." Anh ta nói.
tr: Bir an düşündükten sonra, gönülsüzce. “Bu çimlerin kesilmesi gerek” dedi.
es: Lo pensó unos segundos. Y, poco convencido, dijo: —Habría que cortar el césped.
vi_translation: Then, hesitantly "I want the lawn to be mowed." He said.
tr_translation: After thinking for a moment, reluctantly. "These grasses need to be cut," he said.
es_translation: He thought about it for a few seconds. And, not very convinced, he said: —We should mow the lawn.

en: We both looked down at the grass—there was a sharp line where my ragged lawn ended and the darker, well-kept expanse of his began. I suspected that he meant my grass.
vi: Cả hai chúng tôi đều nhìn ra bãi cỏ. Có một đường lằn rõ rệt chia cắt bãi cỏ bờm sờm lởm chởm nhà tôi với bãi cỏ xanh rì cắt tỉa gọn gàng bên nhà anh. Tôi nghĩ rằng anh ta đang ám chỉ cỏ bên nhà tôi.
tr: İkimiz birden bahçeye baktık. Benim bakımsız çimlerimin hemen ardında onun koyu yeşil, bakımlı çimleri başlıyordu. Benimkileri kastettiğinden şüphelendim.
es: Miramos la hierba: una línea bien definida marcaba dónde acababa mi césped desigual, abandonado, y empezaba a extenderse el suyo, más oscuro, perfectamente cuidado. Sospeché que se refería a mi hierba.
vi_translation: Both of us looked out at the lawn. There was a distinct line dividing my shaggy, unkempt lawn from his neatly trimmed, lush green lawn. I thought he was implying something about the grass on my side.
tr_translation: We both looked at the garden. Right behind my neglected grass, his dark green, well-kept grass began. I suspected that he was referring to mine.
es_translation: We looked at the grass: a well-defined line marked where my uneven, neglected lawn ended, and his darker, perfectly maintained one began to spread. I suspected he was referring to my grass.

en: “There’s another little thing,” he said uncertainly, and hesitated.
vi: "Còn một chuyện nhỏ nhặt nữa." Gatsby ngập ngừng nói, không chắc chắn lắm.
tr: “Ufak bir nokta daha var” dedi.
es: —Hay otra cosa sin importancia —dijo, inseguro, titubeante.
vi_translation: "There's one more small matter." Gatsby hesitated, not very sure.
tr_translation: “There is one more small point,” he said.
es_translation: —There is another insignificant thing —he said, unsure, hesitant.

en: “Would you rather put it off for a few days?” I asked.
vi: "Hay là anh muốn dời lại thêm vài ngày nữa?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “İstersen birkaç gün sonra olsun.
es: —¿Prefieres que lo retrasemos unos días? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "Or do you want to postpone it a few more days?" I asked.
tr_translation: "If you want, it can be in a few days.""
es_translation: —Do you prefer that we delay it a few days? —I asked.

en: “Not very much.”
vi: "Không nhiều lắm."
tr: “Pek fazla sayılmaz.
es: —No mucho.
vi_translation: "Not much."
tr_translation: “Not too many.””
es_translation: —Not much.

en: This seemed to reassure him and he continued more confidently.
vi: Câu trả lời này như trấn an Gatsby và anh ta tiếp tục nói môt cách tự tin hơn. "Tôi cũng nghĩ như vậy.
tr: Bu, kendine olan güvenini yerine getirmişti. Artık daha kesin konuşuyordu, “Ben de öyle düşünmüştüm.
es: Esto pareció tranquilizarlo y continuó con más confianza.
vi_translation: This answer seemed to reassure Gatsby, and he continued to speak more confidently. "I think so too.
tr_translation: This had restored his self-confidence. Now he was speaking more decisively, "I thought so too.
es_translation: This seemed to calm him down, and he continued with more confidence.

en: “I thought you didn’t, if you’ll pardon my—you see, I carry on a little business on the side, a sort of side line, you understand. And I thought that if you don’t make very much—You’re selling bonds, aren’t you, old sport?”
vi: Nếu như anh thứ lỗi cho lời tôi, anh thấy đó, tôi có một số ít buôn bán lẻ, giống như loại buôn bán phụ. Và tôi nghĩ nếu như anh không kiếm được tiền nhiều lắm.. Anh đang buôn bán khổ phiếu phải không anh bạn già?"
tr: Kusura bakmazsan eğer... biliyor musun ufak sayılabilecek bir işle daha uğraşıyorum. İkinci bir uğraş yani, anlıyor musun? Madem kazancın az, ben... tahvil ve bono satıyordun değil mi ahbap?
es: —Era lo que pensaba, si puedes perdonar mi… Tengo, como complemento, un pequeño negocio, algo accesorio, ya sabes. Y he pensado que si tú no ganas mucho… Vendes bonos. ¿No es así, compañero?
vi_translation: If you forgive my words, you see, I have a small retail business, like a side business. And I think if you don't make much money... Are you trading stocks, old friend?"
tr_translation: If you don't mind... you know, I'm also dealing with a small job. A second occupation, you understand? Since your earnings are low, I... you were selling bonds and securities, right buddy?"
es_translation: —It was what I thought, if you can forgive my… I have, as a complement, a small business, something additional, you know. And I thought that if you don't earn much… You sell bonds. Isn't that right, buddy?

en: “Trying to.”
vi: "Cũng đang cố gắng."
tr: “Evet, satmaya çalışıyorum.
es: —Lo intento.
vi_translation: "Also trying."
tr_translation: “Yes, I am trying to sell it.”
es_translation: —I try.

en: “Well, this would interest you. It wouldn’t take up much of your time and you might pick up a nice bit of money. It happens to be a rather confidential sort of thing.”
vi: "Như thế thì việc này sẽ khiến anh thích thú. Nó sẽ không tốn nhiều thì giờ của anh và anh có thể kiếm được một món kha khá. Công việc làm ăn này hơi kín đáo một chút."
tr: “O zaman böyle bir iş ilgini çeker belki. Fazla zamanını almaz. Kazancı da iyidir. Yalnız biraz gizlilik ister.
es: —Bueno, esto podría interesarte. No te exigiría demasiado tiempo y podrías sacarle un buen dinero. Es algo confidencial.
vi_translation: "In that case, this will interest you. It won't take much of your time and you can make a decent amount." "This business is a bit discreet."
tr_translation: "Then maybe such a job would interest you. It won't take much of your time. The earnings are good too. It just requires a bit of secrecy."
es_translation: —Well, this might interest you. It wouldn't require too much of your time and you could make good money from it. It's something confidential.

en: I realize now that under different circumstances that conversation might have been one of the crises of my life. But, because the offer was obviously and tactlessly for a service to be rendered, I had no choice except to cut him off there.
vi: Tôi chợt nhận ra rằng ở trong một tình huống khác thì cuộc đối thoại này có thể đã là một trong những biến đổi cho đời tôi. Nhưng, bởi vì nó đã được đưa ra một cách rõ ràng và không khéo léo như để trả công, tôi không có lựa chọn nào hơn ngoại trừ cắt ngang câu chuyên ở đây.
tr: Şimdi düşündüğümde, başka şartlar altında o geceki konuşmanın hayatımın dönüm noktası olabileceğini anlıyorum. Ama önerisinin, yapacağım hizmetin karşılığı olduğunu öylesine beceriksizce belli etmişti ki sözünü derhal kesmekten başka yapacak şeyim yoktu.
es: Ahora me doy cuenta de que, en otras circunstancias, aquella conversación podría haber provocado una de las crisis de mi vida. Pero, dado que Gatsby hacía su oferta de un modo poco sutil y sin el menor tacto por un servicio que aún había que prestar, no tuve más remedio que cortarlo en seco.
vi_translation: I suddenly realized that in a different situation, this conversation could have been one of the turning points in my life. However, because it was presented so clearly and clumsily as if to repay a favor, I had no choice but to interrupt the story here.
tr_translation: Now that I think about it, I realize that under different circumstances, the conversation that night could have been a turning point in my life. But he had so clumsily made it clear that his proposal was a quid pro quo for the service I would provide that I had no choice but to immediately cut him off.
es_translation: Now I realize that, under different circumstances, that conversation could have caused one of the crises of my life. But, since Gatsby made his offer in a rather unsubtle way and without the slightest tact for a service that had yet to be rendered, I had no choice but to cut him off abruptly.

en: “I’ve got my hands full,” I said. “I’m much obliged but I couldn’t take on any more work.”
vi: "Hiện giờ tôi bận rộn lắm." Tôi trả lời. "Tôi rất cảm kích nhưng trong lúc này tôi không thể nhận thêm việc."
tr: “Çok yoğunum” dedim, “teşekkür ederim ama başka bir işle uğraşacak vaktim yok.
es: —Tengo demasiado trabajo —dije—. Te lo agradezco, pero no puedo aceptar más.
vi_translation: "I'm very busy right now." I replied. "I really appreciate it, but at this moment I can't take on any more work."
tr_translation: “I am very busy,” I said, “thank you, but I don't have time to deal with another task.”
es_translation: —I have too much work —I said—. I appreciate it, but I can't take on more.

en: “You wouldn’t have to do any business with Wolfshiem.” Evidently he thought that I was shying away from the “gonnegtion” mentioned at lunch, but I assured him he was wrong. He waited a moment longer, hoping I’d begin a conversation, but I was too absorbed to be responsive, so he went unwillingly home.
vi: "Anh không phải làm công việc gì với Wolfsheim đâu." Rõ ràng Gatsby cho rằng tôi đang ngại muốn lẩn tránh "giao tiếp" mà Wolfsheim đã nhắc tới trong bữa ăn trưa. Tôi trấn an Gatsby rằng không phải như thế. Gatsby chờ đợi một lúc lâu hơn, hy vọng tôi sẽ bắt đầu nói sang chuyện gì đó, thế nhưng tôi không còn tâm trí nào để truyện trò, cho nên anh ta đành miễn cưỡng ra về.
tr: “Wolfsheim’la çalışırsan bir işle uğraşmak zorunda kalmazsın. Sanırım o gün öğle yemeğinde konusu geçen bağlantıdan çekindiğimi düşünmüştü. Öyle olmadığı konusunda onu temin ettim. Yeni bir sohbet konusu açmam için biraz daha bekledi ama kafam öyle meşguldü ki konuşacak mecalim yoktu. Bunun üze­rine gönülsüzce evinin yolunu tuttu.
es: —No tendrías que tratar con Wolfshiem —evidentemente pensaba que yo, asustado, rehuía las «coneggsiones» mencionadas durante el almuerzo, pero le aseguré que se equivocaba. Esperó un momento, atento a que yo empezara alguna conversación, pero me costaba reaccionar, tan abstraído estaba, y Gatsby volvió a su casa de mala gana.
vi_translation: "You don't have to do any work with Wolfsheim." Clearly, Gatsby thought I was hesitant and wanted to avoid the "business" that Wolfsheim had mentioned during lunch. I reassured Gatsby that it wasn't the case. Gatsby waited a bit longer, hoping I would start talking about something else, but I was in no mood for conversation, so he reluctantly left.
tr_translation: “If you work with Wolfsheim, you won't have to bother with a job.” I think he thought I was apprehensive about the connection mentioned during lunch that day. I assured him that it wasn't the case. He waited a little longer for me to start a new conversation, but my mind was so occupied that I had no energy to talk. Upon this, he reluctantly headed home.
es_translation: —You wouldn't have to deal with Wolfshiem —he evidently thought that I, scared, was avoiding the "connections" mentioned during lunch, but I assured him he was mistaken. He waited a moment, attentive to me starting some conversation, but it was hard for me to react, so absorbed was I, and Gatsby reluctantly went back to his house.

en: The evening had made me lightheaded and happy; I think I walked into a deep sleep as I entered my front door. So I don’t know whether or not Gatsby went to Coney Island, or for how many hours he “glanced into rooms” while his house blazed gaudily on. I called up Daisy from the office next morning, and invited her to come to tea.
vi: Buổi tối hôm nay đã khiến cho đầu tôi lâng lâng hạnh phúc. Khi tôi vừa mở cánh cửa bước vào nhà trước, tôi tưởng rằng tôi đã chìm vào trong giấc ngủ say mất rồi. Bởi vậy tôi không biết Gatsby có đi đảo Coney hay không, hoặc anh ta phải tốn mất bao nhiêu tiếng đồng hồ để đi "nhìn liếc qua những gian phòng" trong căn nhà đang rực sáng của anh. Sáng hôm sau tôi gọi điện thoại cho Daisy và mời Daisy tới nhà uống trà.
tr: Akşam olanlar nedeniyle mutluydum. Hani neredeyse kapıdan içeri girer girmez derin bir uykuya daldım. O yüzden Gatsby, Coney Island’a gitti mi yoksa kalıp evinin tüm ışıklarını açarak ‘odaların bazılarını’ kontrole devam mı etti, bilemiyorum. Ertesi gün bürodan Daisy’i arayıp evimde çaya davet ettim.
es: La tarde había hecho que me sintiera irresponsable y feliz, y creo que, conforme entraba en mi casa, me sumergí en un sueño profundo. Así que no sé si Gatsby fue o no fue a Caney Island. O cuántas horas pasó «echándoles un vistazo a algunas habitaciones» mientras su casa fulguraba con ostentación. A la mañana siguiente llamé a Daisy desde la oficina y la invité a tomar el té.
vi_translation: This evening has made my head light with happiness. When I just opened the door and stepped into the front house, I thought I had already fallen into a deep sleep. Therefore, I didn't know whether Gatsby went to Coney Island or not, or how many hours he spent "glancing through the rooms" in his brightly lit house. The next morning, I called Daisy and invited her over for tea.
tr_translation: I was happy because of what happened in the evening. You know, I almost fell into a deep sleep as soon as I walked through the door. So I don't know if Gatsby went to Coney Island or stayed and continued to check 'some of the rooms' by turning on all the lights in his house. The next day, I called Daisy from the office and invited her to tea at my house.
es_translation: The afternoon had made me feel irresponsible and happy, and I believe that, as I entered my house, I sank into a deep sleep. So I don't know if Gatsby did or did not go to Caney Island. Or how many hours he spent "taking a look at some rooms" while his house gleamed with ostentation. The next morning I called Daisy from the office and invited her for tea.

en: “Don’t bring Tom,” I warned her.
vi: "Đừng dẫn Tom theo." Tôi dặn Daisy.
tr: “Tom’u getirme!” diye de uyardım.
es: —No traigas a Tom.
vi_translation: "Don't bring Tom along." I instructed Daisy.
tr_translation: "Don't bring Tom!" I also warned.
es_translation: —Don't bring Tom.

en: “What?”
vi: "Cái gì?"
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Cómo?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —How?

en: “Don’t bring Tom.”
vi: "Đừng dẫn Tom theo."
tr: “Tom’u getirme!
es: —Que no traigas a Tom.
vi_translation: "Don't bring Tom along."
tr_translation: “Don't bring Tom!”
es_translation: —Don't bring Tom.

en: “Who is ‘Tom’?” she asked innocently.
vi: "Tom là ai?" Daisy hỏi một cách ngây thơ.
tr: “Tom’u getirme! “Tom da kim?” dedi masum bir sesle.
es: —¿Quién es Tom? —preguntó inocentemente.
vi_translation: "Who is Tom?" Daisy asked innocently.
tr_translation: “Tom who?” he said with an innocent voice.
es_translation: "Who is Tom?" she asked innocently.

en: The day agreed upon was pouring rain. At eleven o’clock a man in a raincoat, dragging a lawn-mower, tapped at my front door and said that Mr. Gatsby had sent him over to cut my grass. This reminded me that I had forgotten to tell my Finn to come back, so I drove into West Egg Village to search for her among soggy whitewashed alleys and to buy some cups and lemons and flowers.
vi: Đến ngày hẹn thì trời đổ mưa như trút. Khoảng mười một giờ, một người đàn ông trong chiếc áo mưa kéo lê chiếc máy cắt cỏ đến gõ cửa và nói ông Gatsby gửi anh ta tới để cắt tỉa cỏ nhà tôi. Việc này khiến tôi sực nhớ tôi quên dặn chị Phần Lan lại giúp việc. Bởi vậy tôi lái xe vào làng West Egg giữa những ngõ hẻm lầy lội quét vôi trắng để kiếm chị ta và đồng thời để mua vài cái tách, mấy trái chanh và ít bông hoa.
tr: Kararlaştırılan gün bardaktan boşanırcasına yağmur ya­ğıyordu. Saat on birde yağmurluk giymiş, ardı sıra çim biçme makinesi çekiştiren adam ön kapıyı çaldı. Bay Gatsby’nin çim­leri kesmek için kendisini gönderdiğini söyleyince birden o gün Finli hizmetçimi çağırmayı unuttuğum aklıma geldi. Vakit kaybetmeden West Egg köyüne giderek beyaza boyalı evlerin dizili olduğu ıslak, dar sokaklarda ona bakındım. Sonra birkaç fincan, limon ve birkaç demet çiçek alıp eve döndüm.
es: El día convenido diluviaba. A las once un hombre con impermeable que arrastraba un cortacésped llamó a la puerta y me dijo que mister Gatsby lo mandaba a cortar la hierba. Eso me recordó que había olvidado decirle a mi asistenta finlandesa que viniera, así que fui en el coche a West Egg Village, a buscarla, por callejones blanqueados y empapados, y a comprar tazas, limones y flores.
vi_translation: On the appointed day, it poured rain. Around eleven o'clock, a man in a raincoat dragged a lawnmower to my door and said Mr. Gatsby had sent him to trim my lawn. This reminded me that I had forgotten to ask the Finnish woman to help with the chores. So I drove into the village of West Egg through the muddy, whitewashed alleys to find her and also to buy a few cups, some lemons, and a few flowers.
tr_translation: On the appointed day, it was raining cats and dogs. At eleven o'clock, a man wearing a raincoat and dragging a lawn mower behind him knocked on the front door. When he said that Mr. Gatsby had sent him to cut the grass, I suddenly remembered that I had forgotten to call my Finnish servant that day. Without wasting any time, I went to the village of West Egg and looked for him in the wet, narrow streets lined with white-painted houses. Then I bought a few cups, lemons, and a few bunches of flowers and returned home.
es_translation: The agreed day was pouring rain. At eleven, a man in a raincoat dragging a lawnmower knocked on the door and told me that Mr. Gatsby had sent him to cut the grass. That reminded me that I had forgotten to tell my Finnish maid to come, so I went by car to West Egg Village to look for her, through whitewashed and soaked alleys, and to buy cups, lemons, and flowers.

en: The flowers were unnecessary, for at two o’clock a greenhouse arrived from Gatsby’s, with innumerable receptacles to contain it. An hour later the front door opened nervously, and Gatsby in a white flannel suit, silver shirt, and gold-coloured tie, hurried in. He was pale, and there were dark signs of sleeplessness beneath his eyes.
vi: Thật ra mua hoa cũng không cần thiết, bởi vì khoảng hai giờ chiều, nguyên một vườn hoa trồng trong nhà được đưa từ nhà Gatsby sang nhà tôi với vô số những bình đựng để cắm. Rồi một tiếng đồng hồ sau, cánh cửa nhà tôi được mở ra một cách nóng nẩy, Gatsby xuất hiện trong bộ đồ vest nỉ màu trắng, áo sơ mi màu bạc, cà rà vạt màu vàng, vội vã bước vào. Anh ta trông xanh xao, đôi mắt mang những nét thâm quầng chứng tỏ mất ngủ.
tr: Saat iki gibi Gatsby’nin yolladığı, bir serayı dolduracak çeşitte bitki ve onları koymak için her boyda vazo kapıya gelince, çiçekleri boş yere aldığımı anladım. Bir saat sonra da beyaz flanel takımı, gümüş rengi gömleği ve altın sarısı kravatıyla eşikte kendisi belirdi. Telaşlıydı, renginin solgunluğu ve gözlerinin altındaki mor halkalar gecesinin uykusuz geçtiğini kanıtlıyordu.
es: Las flores no fueron necesarias, pues a las dos llegó de parte de Gatsby un auténtico invernadero con innumerables recipientes para contenerlo. Una hora después se abrió tímidamente la puerta, y Gatsby, con un traje de franela blanca, camisa plateada y corbata de color oro, entró de repente. Estaba pálido y bajo los ojos tenía sombras que indicaban la falta de sueño.
vi_translation: Actually, buying flowers was not necessary, because around two in the afternoon, an entire garden of flowers grown indoors was brought from Gatsby's house to mine with countless vases for arranging them. Then, an hour later, my door was opened hastily, and Gatsby appeared in a white flannel suit, a silver shirt, and a gold tie, rushing in. He looked pale, with dark circles under his eyes indicating sleeplessness.
tr_translation: At around two o'clock, when the flowers Gatsby had sent, enough to fill a greenhouse, and vases of every size to put them in, arrived at the door, I realized that I had bought the flowers in vain. An hour later, he appeared on the threshold in his white flannel suit, silver shirt, and gold-colored tie. He was anxious, the pallor of his complexion and the dark circles under his eyes proving that his night had been sleepless.
es_translation: The flowers were not necessary, for at two o'clock a genuine greenhouse arrived from Gatsby with countless containers to hold it. An hour later, the door timidly opened, and Gatsby, in a white flannel suit, silver shirt, and gold-colored tie, suddenly entered. He was pale and had shadows under his eyes that indicated a lack of sleep.

en: “Is everything all right?” he asked immediately.
vi: "Mọi việc chu toàn cả chứ?" Anh ta ngay lập tức hỏi.
tr: “Her şey yolunda mı?” diye sordu girer girmez.
es: —¿Está todo en orden? —preguntó enseguida.
vi_translation: "Is everything in order?" he immediately asked.
tr_translation: "Is everything alright?" he asked as soon as he entered.
es_translation: —Is everything alright? —he asked immediately.

en: “The grass looks fine, if that’s what you mean.”
vi: "Bãi cỏ nhìn đẹp rồi, nếu đó là ý anh muốn hỏi."
tr: “Onu soruyorsan, çimler harika oldu”
es: —La hierba tiene una pinta estupenda, si te refieres a eso.
vi_translation: "The lawn looks nice, if that's what you meant to ask."
tr_translation: "If you're asking about that, the grass turned out great"
es_translation: —The grass looks great, if that's what you mean.

en: “What grass?” he inquired blankly. “Oh, the grass in the yard.” He looked out the window at it, but, judging from his expression, I don’t believe he saw a thing.
vi: "Cỏ gì? Gatsby hỏi một cách ngơ ngác. "Ồ, cỏ ở ngoài sân." Qua cánh cửa sổ, Gatsy nhìn ra bãi cỏ, nhưng dựa vào nét mặf của anh, tôi tin rằng anh ta không nhìn thấy gì cả.
tr: “Ne çimi?” diye sordu şaşkın şaşkın, “Ha, şu ön bahçede­ki çimler.” görmek için pencereye yanaşıp baktı ama bir şey görmediği yüzünden belliydi.
es: —¿Qué hierba? —preguntó, como perdido—. Ah, la hierba del jardín —miró por la ventana, pero, a juzgar por su expresión, no creo que viera nada—.
vi_translation: "What grass?" Gatsby asked bewilderedly. "Oh, the grass in the yard." Through the window, Gatsby looked out at the lawn, but judging by his expression, I believed he saw nothing at all.
tr_translation: “What grass?” he asked in astonishment, “Oh, the grass in the front yard.” He moved closer to the window to see, but it was clear from his face that he didn't see anything.
es_translation: —What grass? —he asked, as if lost—. Ah, the garden grass —he looked out the window, but, judging by his expression, I don't think he saw anything—.

en: “Looks very good,” he remarked vaguely. “One of the papers said they thought the rain would stop about four. I think it was The Journal. Have you got everything you need in the shape of—of tea?”
vi: "Trông khá lắm." Gatsby nói một cách mơ hồ. "Một trong những tờ báo tiên đoán rằng trời sẽ tạnh mưa vào khoảng bốn giờ. Hình như là tờ Journal. Anh đã chuẩn bị tất cả mọi thứ cho... bữa trà chưa?"
tr: “Çok iyi görünüyor” dedi belli belirsiz, “gazetelerden birinde yağ­murun saat dört gibi kesileceği yazıyordu. Sanırım Journal’de gördüm. Çay için eksik bir şey kaldı mı?
es: Sí, excelente —observó, distraído—. En un periódico he leído que dejaría de llover a eso de las cuatro. Creo que era el Journal. ¿Tienes todo lo necesario para preparar…, para el té?
vi_translation: "Looks pretty good." Gatsby said vaguely. "One of the newspapers predicted that the rain would stop around four o'clock. It seems to be the Journal. Have you prepared everything for... the tea party?"
tr_translation: “It looks very good,” he said vaguely, “one of the newspapers mentioned that the rain would stop around four o'clock. I think I saw it in the Journal. Is there anything missing for tea?”
es_translation: Yes, excellent —he remarked, distracted—. I read in a newspaper that it would stop raining around four o'clock. I think it was the Journal. Do you have everything you need to prepare…, for tea?

en: I took him into the pantry, where he looked a little reproachfully at the Finn. Together we scrutinized the twelve lemon cakes from the delicatessen shop.
vi: Tôi đưa Gatsby vào trong nhà bếp, anh nhìn chị Phần Lan như có vẻ trách mắng. Chúng tôi chăm chút kỹ lưỡng lại tá bánh ngọt vị chanh mua về từ cửa hàng.
tr: Onu alıp mutfağa götürdüm. Gatsby Finli kadına soğuk bir bakış attıktan sonra birlikte pastacıdan aldığım on iki, limonlu keki inceledik.
es: Lo llevé a la cocina, donde miró con cierto rechazo a la finlandesa. Juntos examinamos los doce pasteles de limón de la tienda de delicatessen.
vi_translation: I took Gatsby into the kitchen, he looked at the Finnish woman as if reproaching her. We carefully tended to the lemon cakes bought from the store.
tr_translation: I took it to the kitchen. After giving the Finnish woman a cold look, Gatsby and I examined the twelve lemon cakes I bought from the pastry shop.
es_translation: I took him to the kitchen, where he looked at the Finnish woman with some disdain. Together we examined the twelve lemon pastries from the delicatessen shop.

en: “Will they do?” I asked.
vi: "Vậy được chưa?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “Eksik var mıymış?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Te parecen bien?
vi_translation: "Is that okay now?" I asked.
tr_translation: “Is there anything missing?” I asked.
es_translation: —Do they seem okay to you?

en: “Of course, of course! They’re fine!” and he added hollowly, “… old sport.”
vi: "Đương nhiên, đương nhiên! Khá lắm... anh bạn già."
tr: “Tamamdır, hepsi çok iyi” dedikten sonra utangaç bir sesle, “ahbap” diye de ekledi.
es: —¡Sí, por supuesto! ¡Estupendos! —y añadió, aunque sonó a falso—… compañero.
vi_translation: "Of course, of course! Well done... my old friend."
tr_translation: “Alright, everything is very good,” he said, then added in a shy voice, “buddy.”
es_translation: —Yes, of course! Wonderful! —and he added, though it sounded insincere—… comrade.

en: The rain cooled about half-past three to a damp mist, through which occasional thin drops swam like dew. Gatsby looked with vacant eyes through a copy of Clay’s Economics, starting at the Finnish tread that shook the kitchen floor, and peering towards the bleared windows from time to time as if a series of invisible but alarming happenings were taking place outside. Finally he got up and informed me, in an uncertain voice, that he was going home.
vi: Đến khoảng ba giờ rưỡi chiều thì mưa trở nên nhẹ hạt và chuyển sang thành cơn mưa bụi, mặc dù thỉnh thoảng cũng vẫn rơi những giọt mưa thánh thót như những giọt sương. Đôi mắt vô thần của Gatsby lướt nhìn thẩn thờ trên những trang sách quyển Kinh Tế Học của tác giả Clay. Anh ta bị làm cho giật mình khi chị Phần Lan bước những bước làm rung sàn bếp. Anh sau đó thường xuyên nhìn qua những ô cửa sổ lờ mờ hơi sương làm như bên ngoài đang diễn ra môt loạt những việc vô hình đáng lo ngại. Cuối cùng Gatsby đứng lên nói cho tôi hay bằng một giọng nghi ngại rằng anh ta đi về nhà.
tr: Saat üç buçuk gibi yağmur yerini ıslak bir pusa bırakmıştı. Arada bir de olsa çiğ tanelerine benzer küçük dam­laların düştüğü oluyordu. Gatsby boş bakışlarını Clay’in Ekonomi ki­tabında gezdirmekle meşguldü. Finli kadının mutfağı sarsan adımlarını her duyduğunda yerinden sıçrıyor, bazen de sanki dışarıda gözle görülmeyen endişe verici birtakım şeyler oluyormuş gibi cam­dan bakıyordu. Sonunda ayağa kalktı ve pek de emin ol­mayan bir sesle evine gideceğini söyledi.
es: La lluvia amainó hacia las tres y media y se convirtió en una bruma húmeda, en la que flotaba alguna que otra gota minúscula, como de rocío. Gatsby ojeaba, ausente, un ejemplar de la Economía de Clay, se sobresaltaba cuando los pasos de la finlandesa hacían temblar el suelo de la cocina, y de vez en cuando miraba las ventanas empañadas como si una serie de acontecimientos invisibles pero alarmantes estuvieran sucediendo fuera. Se levantó por fin y, con voz insegura, me informó de que se iba a casa.
vi_translation: By around half-past three in the afternoon, the rain became lighter and turned into a drizzle, although occasionally there were still drops falling like dew. Gatsby's godless eyes wandered absently over the pages of Clay's Economics book. He was startled when the Finnish woman stepped heavily, causing the kitchen floor to shake. He then frequently looked through the misty windows as if a series of invisible, worrying events were happening outside. Finally, Gatsby stood up and told me in a doubtful voice that he was going home.
tr_translation: Around half-past three, the rain had given way to a damp mist. Every now and then, small droplets resembling dew would fall. Gatsby was busy wandering his empty gaze over Clay's Economics book. Every time he heard the Finnish woman's footsteps shaking the kitchen, he would jump, and sometimes he would look out the window as if there were some invisible, worrying things happening outside. Finally, he stood up and said in a rather uncertain voice that he was going home.
es_translation: The rain eased off around half past three and turned into a humid mist, in which an occasional tiny drop, like dew, floated. Gatsby was absentmindedly leafing through a copy of Clay's Economics, startled whenever the Finnish woman's steps made the kitchen floor tremble, and occasionally looked at the fogged-up windows as if a series of invisible but alarming events were happening outside. He finally stood up and, with an uncertain voice, informed me that he was going home.

en: “Why’s that?”
vi: "Sao vậy?"
tr: “Neden peki?
es: —¿Y eso por qué?
vi_translation: "Why so?"
tr_translation: “Why then?”
es_translation: —And why is that?

en: “Nobody’s coming to tea. It’s too late!” He looked at his watch as if there was some pressing demand on his time elsewhere. “I can’t wait all day.”
vi: "Bây giờ đã trễ rồi, không có ai tới uống trà đâu." Gatsby nhìn đồng hồ của mình làm như có chuyện gì ở đâu đó đang cần tới anh. "Tôi không thể đợi cả ngày."
tr: “Kimsenin çaya falan geleceği yok. Vakit geç oldu!” Sanki başka bir yerde acele işi varmış gibi konuşuyordu, “Bütün gün burada bekleyecek değilim!” dedi.
es: —No vendrá nadie a tomar el té. ¡Es demasiado tarde! —miró el reloj como si su tiempo fuera requerido con urgencia en otro sitio—. No puedo esperar todo el día.
vi_translation: "It's late now, no one is coming for tea." Gatsby looked at his watch as if something somewhere needed his attention. "I can't wait all day."
tr_translation: “No one is coming for tea or anything. It's getting late!” He spoke as if he had urgent business elsewhere, “I'm not going to wait here all day!” he said.
es_translation: —No one will come to have tea. It's too late! —he looked at the clock as if his time were urgently required elsewhere—. I can't wait all day.

en: “Don’t be silly; it’s just two minutes to four.”
vi: "Đừng có ngớ ngẩn như vậy, bây giờ mới có bốn giờ kém hai phút."
tr: “Saçmalama daha dörde iki dakika var.
es: —No seas tonto; faltan dos minutos para las cuatro.
vi_translation: "Don't be so silly, it's only two minutes to four."
tr_translation: “Don't be ridiculous, there are still two minutes to four.”
es_translation: —Don't be silly; it's two minutes to four.

en: He sat down miserably, as if I had pushed him, and simultaneously there was the sound of a motor turning into my lane. We both jumped up, and, a little harrowed myself, I went out into the yard.
vi: Gatsby lại ngồi xuống một cách khổ sở làm như tôi ép anh ta ngồi. Ngay cùng lúc đó có tiếng xe chạy vào trong đường nhà tôi. Cả hai chúng tôi đều đứng bật dậy, ngay cả tôi lúc này cũng cảm thấy hồi hộp, tôi đi ra ngoài vườn.
tr: Onu göğsünden iterek zorla tutmuşum gibi mutsuz bir tavırla tekrar yerine oturdu. Tam o sırada kapıya yaklaşan bir motor sesi duy­duk. Yerimizden fırladık. Ben de ge­rilmiştim. Bahçeye doğru yürüdüm.
es: Se sentó, abatido, como si le hubiera empujado, y en ese momento se oyó el ruido de un motor que entraba en el camino de mi casa. Los dos nos pusimos en pie de un salto y yo, un poco angustiado también, salí al jardín.
vi_translation: Gatsby sat down again miserably as if I had forced him to sit. At that very moment, there was the sound of a car driving into my driveway. Both of us stood up abruptly, even I felt nervous at this point, and I went out into the garden.
tr_translation: He sat back down with an unhappy expression, as if I had pushed him by the chest and forcibly held him. Just then, we heard the sound of an approaching motor at the door. We jumped up from our seats. I was also tense. I walked towards the garden.
es_translation: He sat down, dejected, as if he had been pushed, and at that moment the sound of an engine entering the path to my house was heard. We both jumped to our feet and I, a little anxious as well, went out to the garden.

en: Under the dripping bare lilac-trees a large open car was coming up the drive. It stopped. Daisy’s face, tipped sideways beneath a three-cornered lavender hat, looked out at me with a bright ecstatic smile.
vi: Bên dưới những nhánh cây tử đinh hương trụi lá với những giọt nước mưa nhỏ giọt, một chiếc xe mui trần to lớn đang đi vào lối đi. Xe ngừng lại, Khuôn mặt của Daisy khuất dưới vành nón ba góc đội nghiêng màu tím hoa oản hương đang nhìn tôi với nụ cười tươi làm người ta say đắm.
tr: Üstü açık bir otomobil, sular damlayan leylak ağaçlarının altından geçerek kapıya yaklaşıyordu. Merdiven­lerin yakınında durdu. Üç köşeli eflatun bir şapkanın altından başını eğerek bana bakan Daisy’nin ışıltılı gülüşü göründü.
es: Bajo los lilos desnudos y goteantes subía por el camino un gran descapotable. Se detuvo. La cara de Daisy, ladeada bajo un tricornio de color lavanda, me miró con una sonrisa extasiada y luminosa.
vi_translation: Beneath the bare branches of the lilac trees with dripping raindrops, a large convertible car was making its way down the path. The car stopped, Daisy's face hidden under the tilted brim of a tricorn hat in lilac color, looking at me with a captivating smile.
tr_translation: An open-top car was approaching the door, passing under the dripping lilac trees. It stopped near the steps. The radiant smile of Daisy, who was looking at me from under a three-cornered purple hat, appeared.
es_translation: Under the bare and dripping lilacs, a large convertible was coming up the road. It stopped. Daisy's face, tilted under a lavender tricorn hat, looked at me with an ecstatic and radiant smile.

en: “Is this absolutely where you live, my dearest one?”
vi: "Đây chính là nơi anh ở đó à, người yêu quý nhất của em?"
tr: “Sen burada mı oturuyorsun cancağızım?” sesinin iç gıcıklayıcı titreşimleri yağmura karışıyordu.
es: —¿Aquí es donde vives, amor mío?
vi_translation: "Is this where you live, my dearest love?"
tr_translation: “Do you live here, my dear?”
es_translation: —Is this where you live, my love?

en: The exhilarating ripple of her voice was a wild tonic in the rain. I had to follow the sound of it for a moment, up and down, with my ear alone, before any words came through. A damp streak of hair lay like a dash of blue paint across her cheek, and her hand was wet with glistening drops as I took it to help her from the car.
vi: Giọng nói tươi vui róc rách của Daisy là một âm hưởng hoang dại giữa cơn mưa. Mất một lúc, tôi phải chú tâm lắng nghe âm thanh trầm bổng của chúng bằng thính tai trước khi hiểu được chúng. Một lọn tóc ướt nằm như vệt sơn xanh vắt ngang qua má Daisy. Bàn tay của nàng ướt những giọt mưa sáng long lanh khi tôi đỡ lấy nó để dìu Daisy ra khỏi xe.
tr: “Sen burada mı oturuyorsun cancağızım?” sesinin iç gıcıklayıcı titreşimleri yağmura karışıyordu. Bir an bu sesi dinlemekten başka bir şey yapmadan bekledim. Sesi alçalıp yükseliyor, yanağına yapışmış bir tutam saç, mavi bir fırça darbesini gibi duruyor, arabadan inmesine yardım etmek için tuttuğum ıslak eli parıltılar saçıyordu.
es: El susurro estimulante de su voz era bajo la lluvia un tónico fortísimo. Tuve que seguir la melodía un momento, arriba y abajo, sólo con el oído, antes de captar las palabras. Una veta de pelo mojado se le pegaba a la mejilla como una pincelada azul, y tenía la mano húmeda de gotas brillantes cuando se la cogí para ayudarla a apearse del coche.
vi_translation: Daisy's cheerful, babbling voice was a wild resonance amidst the rain. It took a moment for me to focus and listen to their melodious sound with keen ears before I could understand them. A wet lock of hair lay like a green streak of paint across Daisy's cheek. Her hand was wet with sparkling raindrops as I took it to help Daisy out of the car.
tr_translation: The tantalizing vibrations of her voice mingled with the rain. For a moment, I waited, doing nothing but listening to this voice. Her voice rose and fell, a strand of hair stuck to her cheek looked like a stroke of blue paint, and the wet hand I held to help her out of the car sparkled.
es_translation: The stimulating whisper of her voice was a very strong tonic in the rain. I had to follow the melody for a moment, up and down, just with my ear, before catching the words. A strand of wet hair stuck to her cheek like a blue brushstroke, and her hand was damp with bright droplets when I took it to help her get out of the car.

en: “Are you in love with me,” she said low in my ear, “or why did I have to come alone?”
vi: "Anh đang yêu em đó phải không?" Daisy thì thầm bên tai tôi, "nếu không tại sao dặn em đến có một mình?"
tr: “Yoksa bana aşık mısın?” diye fısıldadı kulağıma eğilerek, “Neden yalnız gelmemi istedin’’1’
es: —¿Te has enamorado de mí? —me dijo al oído—. Si no, ¿por qué tenía que venir sola?
vi_translation: "Are you in love with me?" Daisy whispered in my ear, "if not, why did you ask me to come alone?"
tr_translation: "Or are you in love with me?" he whispered in my ear, leaning in, "Why did you want me to come alone?"
es_translation: —Have you fallen in love with me? —she whispered in my ear—. If not, why did I have to come alone?

en: “That’s the secret of Castle Rackrent. Tell your chauffeur to go far away and spend an hour.”
vi: "Đó là chuyện bí mật của tòa lâu đài Rackrent. Em hãy nói với tài xế đi đâu đó xa xa khoảng một tiếng."
tr: “Bu Rackrent Şatosu’nun sırrı. Şoförüne buradan uzaklaşıp bir saat oyalanmasını söyle.
es: —Ése es el secreto del castillo de Rackrent[14]. Dile al chófer que se vaya y vuelva dentro de una hora.
vi_translation: "That is the secret of Rackrent Castle." "Tell the driver to go somewhere far away for about an hour."
tr_translation: "This is the secret of Rackrent Castle." "Tell your driver to leave and come back in an hour.""
