es_translation: —That is the secret of Rackrent Castle[14]. Tell the driver to leave and come back in an hour.

en: “Come back in an hour, Ferdie.” Then in a grave murmur: “His name is Ferdie.”
vi: "Anh Ferdie, đi đâu khoảng một giờ thì quay lại." Sau đó Daisy quay lại tôi nói bằng một giọng thỏ thẻ. "Tên của anh ta là Ferdie"
tr: “Bir saat sonra gel Ferdie” dedikten sonra yavaşça, “adı Ferdie’dir” diye de açıkladı.
es: —Vuelva dentro de una hora, Ferdie —y en un murmullo grave—. Se llama Ferdie.
vi_translation: "Brother Ferdie, go somewhere for about an hour and then come back." Then Daisy turned to me and whispered, "His name is Ferdie."
tr_translation: "Come in an hour, Ferdie," he said, then slowly added, "his name is Ferdie."
es_translation: —Come back in an hour, Ferdie —and in a grave murmur—. His name is Ferdie.

en: “Does the gasoline affect his nose?”
vi: "Xăng dầu có gây ảnh hưởng gì tới cái mũi của anh ta không?"
tr: “Burnu benzinden etkileniyor mu?
es: —¿La gasolina le afecta a la nariz?
vi_translation: "Does gasoline have any effect on his nose?"
tr_translation: “Is your nose affected by gasoline?”
es_translation: —Does gasoline affect your nose?

en: “I don’t think so,” she said innocently. “Why?”
vi: "Em không nghĩ như vậy" Daisy ngây thơ hỏi. "Tại sao?"
tr: “Sanmıyorum” dedi safça, “Neden sordun?
es: —No creo —dijo inocentemente—. ¿Por qué?
vi_translation: "I don't think so," Daisy asked innocently. "Why?"
tr_translation: "I don't think so," he said innocently, "Why did you ask?"
es_translation: —I don't think so —he said innocently—. Why?

en: We went in. To my overwhelming surprise the living-room was deserted.
vi: Chúng tôi đi vào trong nhà. Tôi vô cùng kinh ngạc thấy căn phòng khách trống trơn.
tr: İçeri girdiğimizde büyük bir şaşkınlıkla oturma odasının boş olduğunu gördüm.
es: Entramos. Para mi sorpresa y confusión no había nadie en el cuarto de estar.
vi_translation: We went inside the house. I was extremely surprised to see the living room completely empty.
tr_translation: When we entered, I saw with great astonishment that the living room was empty.
es_translation: We entered. To my surprise and confusion, there was no one in the living room.

en: “Well, that’s funny,” I exclaimed.
vi: "Chà, thật là quái lạ." Tôi thốt lên.
tr: “İşte bu çok komik” diye bağırdım.
es: —Bueno, esto sí que tiene gracia.
vi_translation: "Well, that's strange." I exclaimed.
tr_translation: “This is very funny,” I shouted.
es_translation: —Well, this is really funny.

en: “What’s funny?”
vi: "Cái gì quái lạ?"
tr: “Neymiş komik olan?
es: —¿Qué tiene gracia?
vi_translation: "What the heck?"
tr_translation: "What is supposed to be funny?""
es_translation: —What is funny?

en: She turned her head as there was a light dignified knocking at the front door. I went out and opened it. Gatsby, pale as death, with his hands plunged like weights in his coat pockets, was standing in a puddle of water glaring tragically into my eyes.
vi: Daisy ngoảnh đầu lại nhìn khi nghe có tiếng gõ nhẹ ngoài cửa trước. Tôi bước ra mở cửa. Gatsby, khuôn mặt trắng xanh như xác chết, hai tay buông thỏng trĩu nặng trong túi áo khoác đang đứng giữa một vũng nước trân trân nhìn thẳng vào mắt tôi.
tr: Kapının nazikçe vurulduğunu duy­an Daisy başını çevirdi. Gidip kapıyı açtım. Yüzü bir ölü gibi bembeyaz olan Gatsby karşımda elleri cepleri­nde, gözlerinde trajik bir öfkeyle ıslak zeminin üzerinde durmuş bana bakıyordu.
es: Volvió la cabeza a la vez que sonaban unos golpes suaves y solemnes en la puerta. Fui a abrir. Era Gatsby, pálido como la muerte; con las manos hundidas como pesas en los bolsillos de la chaqueta, sobre un charco de agua, me miraba trágicamente a los ojos.
vi_translation: Daisy turned her head when she heard a light knock on the front door. I stepped out to open the door. Gatsby, his face pale as a corpse, his hands hanging heavily in his coat pockets, stood in a puddle, staring straight into my eyes.
tr_translation: Hearing the door being gently knocked, Daisy turned her head. I went and opened the door. Standing in front of me, with his face as white as a ghost, Gatsby was looking at me with his hands in his pockets and a tragic anger in his eyes, standing on the wet ground.
es_translation: He turned his head just as some soft and solemn knocks sounded on the door. I went to open it. It was Gatsby, pale as death; with his hands sunk like weights in the pockets of his jacket, standing over a puddle of water, he looked tragically into my eyes.

en: With his hands still in his coat pockets he stalked by me into the hall, turned sharply as if he were on a wire, and disappeared into the living-room. It wasn’t a bit funny. Aware of the loud beating of my own heart I pulled the door to against the increasing rain.
vi: Với hai bàn tay vẫn thọc trong túi áo khoác, Gatsby len lén theo tôi bước vào trong hành lang, quẹo ngoắt người như đang đi trên dây và sau đó biến mất vào trong phòng khách. Cảnh tượng chẳng có gì là buồn cười. Tôi nghe trái tim mình đập thình thịch, tôi đưa tay đóng cánh cửa lại, ngoài kia cơn mưa càng lúc càng lớn hơn.
tr: Yanımdan hızla geçerek salona daldı oradan da ipteki bir cambaz gibi keskin bir manevra ile oturma odasına girip gözden kayboldu. Olanlar hiç de komik de­ğildi. Kendi kalbimin de hızla çarptığını duyar gibi oluyordum. Hızını artıran yağmuru dışarıda bırakarak kapıyı kapadım.
es: Con las manos todavía en los bolsillos de la chaqueta, cruzó a mi lado el recibidor majestuosamente, giró de pronto como si anduviera sobre un alambre, y desapareció en la sala de estar. No tenía ninguna gracia. Consciente de cómo me latía el corazón, le cerré la puerta a la lluvia, que iba en aumento.
vi_translation: With his hands still thrust in the pockets of his coat, Gatsby stealthily followed me into the hallway, making a sharp turn as if walking on a tightrope, and then disappeared into the living room. The scene was not at all funny. I heard my heart pounding, I reached out to close the door, and outside, the rain was getting heavier and heavier.
tr_translation: He quickly passed by me and dashed into the living room, then, like an acrobat on a tightrope, made a sharp maneuver into the sitting room and disappeared from sight. What happened was not funny at all. I felt as if I could hear my own heart beating rapidly. I closed the door, leaving the increasingly heavy rain outside.
es_translation: With his hands still in the pockets of his jacket, he majestically crossed the foyer beside me, suddenly turned as if walking on a tightrope, and disappeared into the living room. There was nothing graceful about it. Aware of how my heart was pounding, I closed the door to the increasing rain.

en: For half a minute there wasn’t a sound. Then from the living-room I heard a sort of choking murmur and part of a laugh, followed by Daisy’s voice on a clear artificial note:
vi: Trong khoảng khắc chừng nửa phút, tôi không nghe một tiếng động nào cả. Sau đó tôi nghe phát ra từ phòng khách tiếng gì đó vừa như rì rầm, vừa như nghẹn ngào, vừa như cười vui, sau đó là giọng của Daisy trong trẻo giả tạo.
tr: Yarım dakika kadar süren derin bir sessizlik oldu. Bir ara oturma odamdan bir takım tuhaf mırıltılar ve kısa süreli bir kahkaha yükseldi.
es: Durante unos segundos no se oyó un ruido. Luego me llegó del cuarto de estar una especie de murmullo ahogado, una risa interrumpida, y la voz de Daisy, clara y artificial.
vi_translation: In the span of about half a minute, I didn't hear a single sound. Then I heard something coming from the living room that sounded like a mix of murmuring, choking, and joyful laughter, followed by Daisy's artificially clear voice.
tr_translation: There was a deep silence that lasted for about half a minute. At one point, some strange murmurs and a short burst of laughter rose from my living room.
es_translation: For a few seconds, not a sound was heard. Then, from the living room, a sort of muffled murmur reached me, an interrupted laugh, and Daisy's voice, clear and artificial.

en: “I certainly am awfully glad to see you again.”
vi: "Em thật vui mừng khôn tả được gặp lại anh lần nữa."
tr: Sonra Daisy’nin son derece yapmacık bir tonla, “Seni tekrar gördüğüme ne kadar sevindim bilsen” dediğini duydum.
es: —Por supuesto que sí: me alegra muchísimo volver a verte.
vi_translation: "I am so indescribably happy to see you again."
tr_translation: Then I heard Daisy say in an extremely artificial tone, "You have no idea how glad I am to see you again."
es_translation: —Of course: I am very happy to see you again.

en: A pause; it endured horribly. I had nothing to do in the hall, so I went into the room.
vi: Sau đó lại là sự im lặng đến không thể nào chịu được. Tôi không có việc gì để làm trong hành lang nên đành phải bước vào bên trong.
tr: Bir sonraki sessizlik ise korkutucuydu ve hayli uzun sürdü. Salonda yapacak bir şey olmadığından içeri girdim.
es: Una pausa; se prolongó pavorosamente. No tenía nada que hacer en el recibidor, así que entré en la habitación.
vi_translation: Then there was an unbearable silence. I had nothing to do in the hallway, so I had to step inside.
tr_translation: The next silence was frightening and lasted quite a long time. Since there was nothing to do in the living room, I went inside.
es_translation: A pause; it was dreadfully prolonged. I had nothing to do in the foyer, so I entered the room.

en: Gatsby, his hands still in his pockets, was reclining against the mantelpiece in a strained counterfeit of perfect ease, even of boredom. His head leaned back so far that it rested against the face of a defunct mantelpiece clock, and from this position his distraught eyes stared down at Daisy, who was sitting, frightened but graceful, on the edge of a stiff chair.
vi: Gatsby, hai tay vẫn còn nằm trong túi áo, đang đứng dựa vào mặt lò sưởi với dáng điệu thanh thản buồn chán gượng ép hoàn toàn giả tạo. Đầu của anh ta ngửa ra phía sau quá xa tì cả vào mặt chiếc đồng hồ hư trên mặt lò sưởi. Ở tư thế này, đôi mắt cuồng quẫn của Gatsby nhìn chăm chăm vào Daisy lúc đó đang ngồi bên mép một chiếc ghế, dáng vẻ sợ hãi nhưng duyên dáng yêu kiều.
tr: Ellerini halen cebinde tutan Gatsby, sözümona rahat, zoraki bir tavırla şömineye dayanmış duruyor, biraz da sıkılmış gibi rol yapıyordu. Geriye o kadar eğilmişti ki başı, rafta duran bozuk saate dayanmıştı. Bu garip pozisyo­nu bozmadan delici bakışlarını, biraz ürkmüş olsa da zara­fetini koruyarak sert bir sandalyenin ucuna oturan Daisy’e dikmişti.
es: Gatsby, con las manos todavía en los bolsillos, se había apoyado en la repisa de la chimenea, en una imitación forzada de la naturalidad absoluta, incluso del aburrimiento. La cabeza se echaba hacia atrás de tal modo que descansaba en la esfera de un difunto reloj, y desde esa postura miraba con ojos de perturbado a Daisy, asustada pero muy elegante, sentada en el filo de una silla.
vi_translation: Gatsby, with both hands still in his pockets, was standing leaning against the fireplace with a completely artificial air of forced nonchalance. His head was tilted back too far, resting against the face of the broken clock on the mantelpiece. In this position, Gatsby's frantic eyes stared intently at Daisy, who was sitting on the edge of a chair, looking frightened but gracefully charming.
tr_translation: Gatsby, who still kept his hands in his pockets, was leaning against the fireplace with a supposedly relaxed, forced demeanor, pretending to be somewhat bored. He was leaning back so far that his head was resting on the broken clock on the mantle. Without breaking this awkward position, he fixed his piercing gaze on Daisy, who, though a bit frightened, maintained her grace as she sat on the edge of a hard chair.
es_translation: Gatsby, with his hands still in his pockets, had leaned against the mantelpiece in a forced imitation of absolute naturalness, even boredom. His head was thrown back in such a way that it rested on the face of a defunct clock, and from that position, he looked with disturbed eyes at Daisy, frightened but very elegant, sitting on the edge of a chair.

en: “We’ve met before,” muttered Gatsby. His eyes glanced momentarily at me, and his lips parted with an abortive attempt at a laugh. Luckily the clock took this moment to tilt dangerously at the pressure of his head, whereupon he turned and caught it with trembling fingers, and set it back in place. Then he sat down, rigidly, his elbow on the arm of the sofa and his chin in his hand.
vi: "Chúng tôi đã quen nhau từ trước." Gatsby nói khẽ. Đôi mắt của anh thoáng liếc nhìn tôi, đôi môi hé mở cố gắng để cười nhưng không cười được. May thay chiếc đồng hồ chọn ngay lúc đó để nghiêng đi xém đổ vì sức nặng của đầu anh ta. Gatsby quay lại đỡ lấy nó bằng những ngón tay run rẩy, rồi đặt nó trở lại chỗ cũ. Sau đó Gatsby ngồi xuống, người cứng ngắc, cùi chỏ đặt trên tay ghế dựa, hai tay chống cằm.
tr: “Biz önceden tanışıyoruz” diye mırıldandı Gatsby bir an bakışlarını bana çevirerek. Gülümsemeye çalışıyor ama beceremiyordu. Tam o sırada başını dayadığı saat devrilip de, düşme tehlikesi geçirince hızla döndü, titreyen par­maklarıyla onu tutup yerine koydu. Sonra dirseğini kanepenin koluna dayadı, elini de çenesine koyarak oturdu.
es: —Ya nos conocíamos —murmuró Gatsby. Me miró unos segundos, y los labios se abrieron en un fallido intento de risa. Por suerte el reloj aprovechó ese momento para inclinarse peligrosamente bajo la presión de la cabeza de Gatsby, que se volvió y lo atrapó con dedos temblorosos para devolverlo a su sitio. Luego se sentó, rígido, con el codo en el brazo del sofá y la barbilla en la mano.
vi_translation: "We knew each other from before." Gatsby said softly. His eyes glanced at me briefly, his lips parted trying to smile but couldn't. Fortunately, the clock chose that moment to tilt and almost fall due to the weight of his head. Gatsby turned back to catch it with trembling fingers, then placed it back in its original position. After that, Gatsby sat down, stiff, elbows on the armrest, hands supporting his chin.
tr_translation: "We have met before," murmured Gatsby, turning his gaze to me for a moment. He was trying to smile but couldn't manage it. Just then, as the clock he was leaning his head on toppled over and he faced the danger of it falling, he quickly turned and, with trembling fingers, caught it and put it back in place. Then he rested his elbow on the arm of the couch, placed his hand on his chin, and sat down.
es_translation: —We already knew each other —murmured Gatsby. He looked at me for a few seconds, and his lips parted in a failed attempt at laughter. Luckily, the clock took advantage of that moment to tilt dangerously under the pressure of Gatsby's head, who turned and caught it with trembling fingers to put it back in its place. Then he sat down, rigid, with his elbow on the arm of the sofa and his chin in his hand.

en: “I’m sorry about the clock,” he said.
vi: "Tôi xin lỗi chuyện cái đồng hồ." Anh ta nói.
tr: “Saat için üzgünüm” dedi.
es: —Siento lo del reloj —dijo.
vi_translation: "I'm sorry about the watch," he said.
tr_translation: “I am sorry about the time,” he said.
es_translation: —I'm sorry about the watch —he said.

en: My own face had now assumed a deep tropical burn. I couldn’t muster up a single commonplace out of the thousand in my head.
vi: Mặt của tôi bây giờ nóng ran. Tôi không thể gom góp được lấy một câu nói bình thường trong hàng ngàn câu trong đầu.
tr: Bu arada benim yüzüm tropikal güneş altında kalmış gibi kızarıp yanmaya başlamıştı. Kafamdan geçen binlerce cümleden birini bile seçip söyleyemiyordum.
es: La cara me ardía como si estuviéramos en los trópicos. No fui capaz de encontrar ni un solo lugar común de los mil que tengo en la cabeza.
vi_translation: My face is now burning hot. I can't piece together a single coherent sentence from the thousands in my head.
tr_translation: Meanwhile, my face had started to redden and burn as if it had been under a tropical sun. I couldn't pick and say even one of the thousands of sentences running through my head.
es_translation: My face was burning as if we were in the tropics. I wasn't able to find a single cliché out of the thousand I have in my head.

en: “It’s an old clock,” I told them idiotically.
vi: "Chỉ là chiếc đồng hồ cũ kỹ thôi mà." Tôi nói với họ một cách ngớ ngẩn.
tr: “Zaten eskiydi” dedim sonunda biraz ahmakça.
es: —Es un reloj viejo —dije estúpidamente.
vi_translation: "It's just a watch "It's just old." I told them foolishly.
tr_translation: “It was already old,” I said finally, somewhat foolishly.
es_translation: —It's an old watch —I said stupidly.

en: I think we all believed for a moment that it had smashed in pieces on the floor.
vi: Tôi nghĩ mọi người chúng tôi trong khoảng khắc đều cho rằng chiếc đồng hồ đã bị vờ tan ra từng mảnh ở trên sàn.
tr: Saat yere düşmüş de parçalara ayrılmış gibi davranıyorduk.
es: Creo que, por un momento, los tres pensamos que se había hecho pedazos contra el suelo.
vi_translation: I think all of us for a moment believed that the clock had shattered into pieces on the floor.
tr_translation: We were acting as if the clock had fallen to the ground and shattered into pieces.
es_translation: I think that, for a moment, the three of us thought that it had shattered against the ground.

en: “We haven’t met for many years,” said Daisy, her voice as matter-of-fact as it could ever be.
vi: "Tụi em đã không gặp nhau nhiều năm rồi." Daisy nói, giọng của nàng mang vẻ như bình thường.
tr: “Yıllar­dır görüşmemiştik” dedi Daisy sesini olabildiğince gerçeğine yakın tutmaya çalışarak.
es: —Hace muchos años que no nos vemos —dijo Daisy, con la voz más neutra posible.
vi_translation: "We haven't seen each other for many years." Daisy said, her voice sounding as if it were normal.
tr_translation: “We hadn't seen each other for years,” said Daisy, trying to keep her voice as close to the real thing as possible.
es_translation: —It's been many years since we last saw each other —said Daisy, with the most neutral voice possible.

en: “Five years next November.”
vi: "Tháng mười một tới là năm năm."
tr: “Kasımda beş yıl olacak.
es: —Cinco años el próximo noviembre.
vi_translation: "November coming will be five years."
tr_translation: “It will be five years in November.”
es_translation: —Five years next November.

en: The automatic quality of Gatsby’s answer set us all back at least another minute. I had them both on their feet with the desperate suggestion that they help me make tea in the kitchen when the demoniac Finn brought it in on a tray.
vi: Câu trả lời như cái máy của Gatsby lại khiến chúng tôi rơi vào trạng thái ngượng nghịu mất thêm một phút nữa. Tôi tìm cớ cho hai người họ đứng lên bằng cách đề nghị cả hai vào bếp giúp tôi pha trà, thế nhưng ngay lúc đó chị Phần Lan bị quỷ ám đã bưng khay trà lên.
tr: Gatsby’nin fazla düşünmeden verdiği bu yanıt hepimizin en az bir dakika daha susmasına ne­den oldu. Çayı hazırlamaya mutfağa gelmeleri için yaptığım çaresiz öneri üzerine ikisi birden ayağa fırlamıştı ki, Finli çılgın yardımcım elinde tepsiyle içeri daldı.
es: La respuesta automática de Gatsby nos paralizó un minuto más por lo menos. Los había hecho levantarse con la sugerencia desesperada de que me ayudaran a preparar el té en la cocina cuando la finlandesa del demonio lo trajo en una bandeja.
vi_translation: Gatsby's mechanical response made us fall into an awkward silence for another minute. I found an excuse for the two of them to stand up by suggesting they help me make tea in the kitchen, but at that moment, the possessed Finnish woman brought up the tea tray.
tr_translation: Gatsby's hasty response caused all of us to remain silent for at least another minute. Upon my desperate suggestion that they come to the kitchen to prepare tea, both of them jumped to their feet, just as my crazy Finnish helper burst in with a tray in hand.
es_translation: Gatsby's automatic response paralyzed us for at least another minute. He had made them get up with the desperate suggestion that they help me prepare the tea in the kitchen when the devilish Finnish woman brought it on a tray.

en: Amid the welcome confusion of cups and cakes a certain physical decency established itself. Gatsby got himself into a shadow and, while Daisy and I talked, looked conscientiously from one to the other of us with tense, unhappy eyes. However, as calmness wasn’t an end in itself, I made an excuse at the first possible moment, and got to my feet.
vi: Nhờ lăng xăng tiếp nhận những tách trà và những miếng bánh mọi người đã lấy được sự bình tĩnh. Trong lúc Daisy và tôi đang trò chuyện, Gatsby rút mình vào im lặng, chăm chú hết nhìn người này đến người kia bằng đôi mắt căng thẳng buồn bã. Tuy nhiên, sự trầm tĩnh không phải là mục đích, ngay khi vừa khi có dịp, tôi vội cáo lỗi đứng lên.
tr: Fincan ve kekleri dağıtırken hepimizi saran telaş yerini nezakete bırakmıştı. Kuytuya çekilen Gatsby, ben Daisy ile konuşurken yüzünde gergin, mutsuz bakışlarını birimizden ötekine dolaştırıp duruyordu. Bu durgun havanın çözüm getirmeyeceğini tahmin ettiğimden, fırsatını bulur bulmaz dışarı çıkmak için izin istedim.
es: Entre la oportuna confusión de tazas y pasteles se estableció cierta cordialidad física. Gatsby se retiró a la sombra y, mientras Daisy y yo hablábamos, nos miraba alternativamente a uno y a otro, a fondo, con ojos llenos de tensión e infelicidad. Pero, puesto que la serenidad no era un fin en sí mismo, me excusé en cuanto pude y me levanté.
vi_translation: Thanks to bustling around with the tea cups and the cakes, everyone managed to regain their composure. While Daisy and I were chatting, Gatsby withdrew into silence, attentively watching one person after another with tense, sad eyes. However, tranquility was not the goal; as soon as I had the chance, I hastily excused myself and stood up.
tr_translation: The anxiety that enveloped us while distributing the cups and cakes had given way to politeness. Gatsby, who had withdrawn into a corner, kept shifting his tense, unhappy gaze from one of us to the other as I spoke with Daisy. Since I anticipated that this stagnant atmosphere would not bring any resolution, I asked for permission to step outside as soon as I found the opportunity.
es_translation: Amid the timely confusion of cups and cakes, a certain physical cordiality was established. Gatsby withdrew into the shade and, while Daisy and I talked, he alternately looked at each of us deeply, with eyes full of tension and unhappiness. But, since serenity was not an end in itself, I excused myself as soon as I could and stood up.

en: “Where are you going?” demanded Gatsby in immediate alarm.
vi: "Anh định đi đâu đó?" Gatsby lên tiếng hỏi tỏ ra lo lắng.
tr: “Nereye gidiyorsun?” diye sordu Gatsby, birden paniğe kapılmıştı.
es: —¿Adónde vas? —preguntó Gatsby, alarmado.
vi_translation: "Where are you planning to go?" Gatsby asked, sounding worried.
tr_translation: "Where are you going?" asked Gatsby, suddenly panicking.
es_translation: —Where are you going? —asked Gatsby, alarmed.

en: “I’ll be back.”
vi: "Tôi sẽ quay lại ngay."
tr: “Hemen döneceğim.
es: —Volveré.
vi_translation: "I will be right back."
tr_translation: “I will be right back.”
es_translation: —I will return.

en: “I’ve got to speak to you about something before you go.”
vi: "Tôi muốn nói chuyện với anh vài việc trước khi anh đi."
tr: “Gitmeden seninle bir şey konuşmak istiyorum.
es: —Tengo que hablar contigo antes de que te vayas.
vi_translation: "I want to talk to you about a few things before you go."
tr_translation: "I want to talk to you about something before you leave.""
es_translation: —I need to talk to you before you leave.

en: He followed me wildly into the kitchen, closed the door, and whispered: “Oh, God!” in a miserable way.
vi: Gatsby theo tôi vào trong nhà bếp, đóng cửa lại và thì thầm:
tr: Peşimden, delirmiş gibi mutfağa gelip kapıyı kapattı. “Of, Tanrım” diye fısıldadı acı içinde.
es: Me siguió a la cocina, descompuesto, cerró la puerta, y murmuró totalmente abatido: —Dios mío.
vi_translation: Gatsby took me into the kitchen, closed the door, and whispered:
tr_translation: He came after me, like a madman, into the kitchen and closed the door. “Oh, God,” he whispered in pain.
es_translation: He followed me to the kitchen, distraught, closed the door, and murmured completely dejected: —My God.

en: “This is a terrible mistake,” he said, shaking his head from side to side, “a terrible, terrible mistake.”
vi: "Đây là một việc làm quá sai lầm." Gatsby nói, lắc đầu tới lui. "Một sai lầm khủng khiếp, khủng khiếp."
tr: “Bu büyük bir hata” dedi başını iki yana sal­layarak, “hem de çok büyük!
es: —Ha sido un error terrible —dijo, negando con la cabeza—, un error terrible, terrible.
vi_translation: Gatsby said, shaking his head back and forth. "A terrible, terrible mistake."
tr_translation: “This is a big mistake,” he said, shaking his head from side to side, “a very big one!”
es_translation: —It has been a terrible mistake —he said, shaking his head—, a terrible, terrible mistake.

en: “You’re just embarrassed, that’s all,” and luckily I added: “Daisy’s embarrassed too.”
vi: "Tại vì anh quá xúc động, chỉ vậy thôi." May là sau đó tôi nói thêm "Daisy cũng xúc động nữa."
tr: “Biraz çekindin hepsi bu” dedim, neyse ki, “Daisy de çekiniyor görmüyor musun?” diye de ekledim.
es: —Te sientes violento, eso es todo —y por suerte añadí—. Daisy también se siente violenta.
vi_translation: "Because you were too emotional, that's all." Luckily, I added, "Daisy was emotional too."
tr_translation: “You were just a bit shy, that's all,” I said, thankfully adding, “Can't you see that Daisy is shy too?”
es_translation: —You feel awkward, that's all —and luckily I added—. Daisy feels awkward too.

en: “She’s embarrassed?” he repeated incredulously.
vi: "Cô ấy cũng xúc động sao?" Gatsby lập lại lời tôi một cách hoài nghi.
tr: “Demek o da çekiniyor?” diye tekrarladı, inanamıyordu. “Elbette.
es: —¿Se siente violenta? —repitió, incrédulo.
vi_translation: "Was she moved too?" Gatsby repeated my words skeptically.
tr_translation: “So, he is afraid too?” he repeated, unable to believe it. “Of course.
es_translation: —Do you feel violent? —he repeated, incredulous.

en: “Just as much as you are.”
vi: "Chẳng khác gì anh."
tr: Senin kadar o da çekiniyor.
es: —Tanto como tú.
vi_translation: "No different from you."
tr_translation: He is as shy as you are.”
es_translation: —As much as you.

en: “Don’t talk so loud.”
vi: "Đừng nói lớn tiếng quá."
tr: “Bağırarak konuşma.
es: —No hables tan alto.
vi_translation: "Don't speak too loudly."
tr_translation: “Don't speak loudly.”
es_translation: —Don't speak so loudly.

en: “You’re acting like a little boy,” I broke out impatiently. “Not only that, but you’re rude. Daisy’s sitting in there all alone.”
vi: "Anh đang xử sự như trẻ con," Tôi nói một cách thiếu nhẫn nại. "Không những thế, anh còn bất lịch sự nữa. Daisy đang ngồi ở ngoài kia có một mình."
tr: “Çocuk gibi davranıyorsun” dedim, sabrım tükenerek, “sadece bu da değil. Onu içerde yalnız bırakarak kabalık ediyorsun.
es: —Te estás portando como un niño —corté, impaciente—. No sólo eso: te estás portando como un maleducado. Ahí está Daisy, sola.
vi_translation: "You are acting like a child," I said impatiently. "Not only that, but you are also being rude." "Daisy is sitting out there all alone."
tr_translation: “You are acting like a child,” I said, my patience wearing thin, “and that's not all. By leaving him alone inside, you are being rude.”
es_translation: —You are acting like a child —I cut in, impatiently—. Not only that: you are acting like a rude person. There is Daisy, alone.

en: He raised his hand to stop my words, looked at me with unforgettable reproach, and, opening the door cautiously, went back into the other room.
vi: Gatsby giơ tay ngăn tôi ngừng nói. Anh nhìn tôi bằng cái nhìn xấu hổ không thể quên, rồi cẩn trọng mở cửa quay trở lại phòng khách.
tr: Daha fazla söylenmemem için elini kal­dırdı. Yüzüme sitemle baktı ve kapıyı dikkatle açıp odaya döndü. Arka kapıdan çıkıp, ön tarafa dolandım.
es: Levantó la mano para detener mis palabras, me lanzó una inolvidable mirada de reproche, y, abriendo la puerta con mucho cuidado, volvió a la otra habitación.
vi_translation: Gatsby raised his hand to stop me from speaking. He looked at me with an unforgettable look of shame, then carefully opened the door and went back to the living room.
tr_translation: He raised his hand to stop me from saying more. He looked at me reproachfully, carefully opened the door, and returned to the room. I went out the back door and circled around to the front.
es_translation: He raised his hand to stop my words, gave me an unforgettable look of reproach, and, opening the door very carefully, went back to the other room.

en: I walked out the back way—just as Gatsby had when he had made his nervous circuit of the house half an hour before—and ran for a huge black knotted tree, whose massed leaves made a fabric against the rain. Once more it was pouring, and my irregular lawn, well-shaved by Gatsby’s gardener, abounded in small muddy swamps and prehistoric marshes. There was nothing to look at from under the tree except Gatsby’s enormous house, so I stared at it, like Kant at his church steeple, for half an hour. A brewer had built it early in the “period” craze, a decade before, and there was a story that he’d agreed to pay five years’ taxes on all the neighbouring cottages if the owners would have their roofs thatched with straw. Perhaps their refusal took the heart out of his plan to Found a Family—he went into an immediate decline. His children sold his house with the black wreath still on the door. Americans, while willing, even eager, to be serfs, have always been obstinate about being peasantry.
vi: Tôi đi ra khỏi nhà bằng lối sau, y như Gatsby đã làm khoảng nửa tiếng trước đây khi anh bối rối đi vòng quanh nhà. Tôi chạy nhanh ra đứng núp dưới gốc một cây đen đủi lớn có nhiều mấu mắt, những tàng lá xum xuê của cây tạo thành cái mái che mưa cho tôi. Thế rồi trời lại đổ mưa như trút xuống khu vườn lởm chởm của tôi đã được anh làm vườn của Gatsby cắt xén một cách đều đặn. Bãi cỏ giờ đây loang lỗ những vũng nước và những vũng bùn lầy trông như mặt đất trong thời tiền sử. Đứng từ dưới gốc cây chẳng có gì để mà ngắm ngoại trừ căn nhà đồ sộ của Gatsby, do đó tôi cứ nhìn trừng vào nó cả nửa tiếng đồng hồ y như Kant đang nhìn gác chuông nhà thờ của mình. Một ông chủ nấu rượu đã xây lên nó một thập niên trước trong thời gian đang thịnh hành mốt xây nhà theo kiến trúc cổ. Theo như chuyện kể lại thì ông ta đã bằng lòng đóng thuế thổ trạch cho tất cả căn nhà lân cận trong vòng năm năm nếu như chủ nhà chịu lợp nhà mình bằng rơm. Có lễ sự từ chối của những người này đã làm ông thất vọng không còn thiết tha tới đồ án của mình nữa. Sức khỏe của ông ta ngay lập tức bị sa sút trầm trọng. Con cháu của ông sau đó đã bán căn nhà khi mà vòng hoa tang đen vẫn còn treo trước cửa. Người Mỹ, trong khi thỉnh thoảng vẫn có thể cúi đầu chịu làm nô lệ, nhưng lúc nào cũng cứng đầu bướng bỉnh không muốn làm nông dân.
tr: Yarım saat önce Gatsby de aynı şeyi yapıp yağmurda koşarak yarım daire çizmişti. Ön bahçedeki, kara gövdesi yumrularla dolu, koca yaprakları yağmur damlalarına direnen ağacın altına sığındım. Yağmur hızını artırmış, Gatsby’nin bahçıvanının kısacık kes­tiği çimlerle örtülü bakımsız bahçemde minik göl ve ba­taklıklar oluşmuştu. Ağacın altından görebildiğim tek yer Gatsby’nin ihtişamlı malikanesiydi. Kilisenin çan kulesine bakan Kant gibi, yarım saat boyunca gözümü oraya diktim. Binayı on yıl önce bir bira imalatçısı ‘dönemin’ modasına uygun şekilde yaptırmıştı. Hakkındaki bir söylentiye göre, çevredeki kulübelerin sahipleri damlarını samanla kaplamayı kabul ederlerse bir yıl süreyle hepsinin vergilerini üstleneceğine söz vermişti. Mahalle halkının, bu aile olma planına pek sıcak bakmaması kalbini kırmış olmalı ki aniden sağlığı bozulmuş, çocukları da kapıya asılan siyah çelengin indirilmesini bile beklemeden malikaneyi satmışlardı. Amerikalıların ara sıra toprak kölesi olmayı istedikleri olur, ama köylü sınıfından olmaya karşı hep direnmişlerdir.
es: Yo salí por la puerta de atrás —el mismo camino que Gatsby, nervioso, había tomado media hora antes para dar la vuelta a la casa— y corrí hacia un inmenso y nudoso árbol negro cuyas hojas frondosas tejían una pantalla contra la lluvia. Otra vez diluviaba, y mi césped desigual, recién afeitado por el jardinero de Gatsby, abundaba en minúsculos pantanos enfangados y ciénagas prehistóricas. No había nada que mirar desde el pie del árbol, excepto la enorme casa de Gatsby, así que me dediqué a mirarla, como Kant el campanario de su iglesia, durante media hora. Un fabricante de cerveza la había construido al principio de la moda de la «arquitectura de época», diez años antes, y contaban que se había comprometido a pagar durante cinco años los impuestos de las casas de campo de todo el vecindario si los propietarios hacían los tejados de paja. Puede que el rechazo general disuadiera al cervecero de su plan de Fundar una Familia: inmediatamente empezó la decadencia. Sus hijos vendieron la casa cuando la corona fúnebre aún colgaba de la puerta. Los americanos, dispuestos a ser siervos e incluso impacientes por serlo, siempre se han mostrado reacios a ser gente de campo.
vi_translation: I went out of the house through the back way, just as Gatsby had done about half an hour earlier when he was nervously pacing around the house. I quickly ran to hide under a large, gnarled tree, whose lush foliage formed a rain shelter for me. Then the sky poured rain down onto my rugged garden, which Gatsby's gardener had meticulously trimmed. The lawn was now pockmarked with puddles and muddy patches, looking like prehistoric terrain. Standing under the tree, there was nothing to look at except Gatsby's grand house, so I stared at it for half an hour, just like Kant gazing at his church steeple. A bootlegger had built it a decade ago during the trend of constructing houses in classical architecture. According to the story, he had agreed to pay property taxes for all the neighboring houses for five years if the owners would thatch their roofs. Perhaps the refusal of these people had disappointed him to the point of losing interest in his project. His health immediately deteriorated severely. His descendants then sold the house while the mourning wreath was still hanging on the door. Americans, while occasionally willing to bow down as slaves, are always stubbornly unwilling to be farmers.
tr_translation: Half an hour earlier, Gatsby had done the same thing, running in a semicircle in the rain. I took shelter under the tree in the front yard, its black trunk full of knots, and its large leaves resisting the raindrops. The rain had intensified, creating small ponds and swamps in my neglected garden covered with the short grass cut by Gatsby's gardener. The only place I could see from under the tree was Gatsby's magnificent mansion. Like Kant gazing at the church bell tower, I stared at it for half an hour. The building had been constructed ten years ago by a beer manufacturer in accordance with the 'period' fashion. According to a rumor, he had promised to cover the taxes for a year for the owners of the surrounding cottages if they agreed to thatch their roofs. The neighborhood's lack of enthusiasm for this family plan must have broken his heart, as his health suddenly deteriorated, and his children sold the mansion without even waiting for the black wreath on the door to be taken down. Americans occasionally desire to be bound to the land, but they have always resisted being part of the peasant class.
es_translation: I went out through the back door—the same path that Gatsby, nervous, had taken half an hour earlier to go around the house—and ran towards an immense and gnarled black tree whose leafy branches wove a screen against the rain. It was pouring again, and my uneven lawn, freshly mowed by Gatsby's gardener, was teeming with tiny muddy swamps and prehistoric marshes. There was nothing to look at from the base of the tree except Gatsby's enormous house, so I dedicated myself to looking at it, like Kant at the steeple of his church, for half an hour. A brewer had built it at the beginning of the "period architecture" fashion, ten years earlier, and it was said that he had committed to paying the taxes of all the neighboring country houses for five years if the owners thatched their roofs. Perhaps the general rejection dissuaded the brewer from his plan to Found a Family: the decline began immediately. His children sold the house while the funeral wreath still hung on the door. Americans, willing to be servants and even eager to be so, have always been reluctant to be country folk.

en: After half an hour, the sun shone again, and the grocer’s automobile rounded Gatsby’s drive with the raw material for his servants’ dinner—I felt sure he wouldn’t eat a spoonful. A maid began opening the upper windows of his house, appeared momentarily in each, and, leaning from the large central bay, spat meditatively into the garden. It was time I went back. While the rain continued it had seemed like the murmur of their voices, rising and swelling a little now and then with gusts of emotion. But in the new silence I felt that silence had fallen within the house too.
vi: Khoảng nửa giờ sau, mặt trời bắt đầu chiếu sáng trở lại. Chiếc xe giao thực phẩm chạy vòng vào sân nhà của Gatsby để giao hàng cho người làm nấu bữa chiều, nhưng tôi tin chắc Gatsy sẽ không ăn tới một muỗng. Một cô người hầu bắt đầu đi mở những cánh cửa sổ trên lầu nhà Gatsby, bóng dáng cô thấp thoáng qua mỗi cửa sổ, cô sau đó bước tới một khung cửa lớn ở ngay giữa rồi chồm người ra ngoài khạc nhổ một cách điềm tĩnh xuống khu vườn bên dưới. Đã đến lúc tôi phải quay vào nhà. Lúc trời còn mưa, tiếng mưa rơi nghe như tiếng rì rầm của hai người họ, thỉnh thoảng cất cao và vọng lên tràn đầy những xúc động. Thế nhưng giờ đây tôi lại cảm nhận được một sự im lặng mới, và sự im lặng này dường như đang phủ kín căn nhà.
tr: Yarım saat sonra güneş çıkınca, hizmetçilerin akşam yemeklerini -Gatsby’nin bunlardan bir kaşık bile yemediğinden eminim- taşıyan bakkalın arabası malikanenin arka bahçesinde belirdi. Hizmetçi kadın üst kattaki camları açtı. Her pencerede bir an görünüp sonra kayboluyordu. Ortadaki büyük pencereye geldiğinde başını çıkarıp bahçeye tükürdü. Geri dönme vakti gelmişti. Yağmur yağarken evdeki, heyecan arttıkça ara­da bir yükselip alçalan mırıldanmaları duyar gibi oluyordum. Ama o yeni sessizlik evi de içine almış gibiydi.
es: Media hora después, el sol volvió a brillar, y el automóvil del tendero tomó el camino de la casa de Gatsby con las materias primas para la cena de la servidumbre: estaba seguro de que Gatsby no comería nada. Una criada empezó a abrir las ventanas de la planta alta de la casa, apareció un instante en cada una, y, asomándose al amplio mirador principal, escupió meditativamente en el jardín. Era hora de volver. La lluvia, mientras duró, parecía el murmullo de las voces de Gatsby y Daisy, elevándose, creciendo de vez en cuando en ráfagas de emoción. Pero ahora, en el silencio nuevo, sentí que el silencio también había caído sobre la casa.
vi_translation: About half an hour later, the sun began to shine again. The food delivery truck drove into Gatsby's yard to deliver goods for the cook to prepare dinner, but I was certain Gatsby wouldn't eat a spoonful. A maid began to open the windows on the upper floor of Gatsby's house, her figure flickering through each window, then she stepped to a large central window and calmly leaned out to spit into the garden below. It was time for me to go back inside. When it was still raining, the sound of the rain was like the murmur of the two of them, occasionally rising and echoing full of emotion. But now I felt a new silence, and this silence seemed to envelop the house.
tr_translation: Half an hour later, when the sun came out, the grocery wagon carrying the servants' dinner - I'm sure Gatsby didn't eat a spoonful of it - appeared in the back yard of the mansion. The maid opened the windows upstairs. She appeared at each window for a moment and then disappeared. When she reached the large window in the middle, she stuck her head out and spat into the garden. It was time to return. While it was raining, I felt as if I could hear the murmurs at home rising and falling with the increasing excitement. But that new silence seemed to have enveloped the house as well.
es_translation: Half an hour later, the sun began to shine again, and the grocer's car took the road to Gatsby's house with the raw materials for the servants' dinner: he was sure Gatsby wouldn't eat anything. A maid began to open the windows on the upper floor of the house, appeared for a moment at each one, and, leaning out of the wide main balcony, spat meditatively into the garden. It was time to go back. The rain, while it lasted, seemed like the murmur of Gatsby and Daisy's voices, rising, growing occasionally in bursts of emotion. But now, in the new silence, I felt that silence had also fallen over the house.

en: I went in—after making every possible noise in the kitchen, short of pushing over the stove—but I don’t believe they heard a sound. They were sitting at either end of the couch, looking at each other as if some question had been asked, or was in the air, and every vestige of embarrassment was gone. Daisy’s face was smeared with tears, and when I came in she jumped up and began wiping at it with her handkerchief before a mirror. But there was a change in Gatsby that was simply confounding. He literally glowed; without a word or a gesture of exultation a new well-being radiated from him and filled the little room.
vi: Tôi bước vào trong nhà, cố gắng làm đủ mọi cách để gây tiếng động trong bếp, xém chút nữa thì lật nhào cả chiếc lò, thế nhưng tôi tin rằng hai người họ không hề nghe thấy gì. Hai người họ đang ngồi bên hai đầu của chiếc ghế sa-lông, mắt nhìn nhau dáng vẻ như đã hỏi nhau, hay còn đang hỏi nhau điều gì đó, mọi dấu tích của sự lúng túng ngượng nghịu đã không còn. Khuôn mặt của Daisy hoen đầy nước mắt, khi thấy tôi bước vào Daisy đứng bật dậy rồi bắt đầu lấy khăn tay lau nước mắt trước tấm gương. Thế nhưng ở Gatsby đã biểu hiện một sự thay đổi đáng kinh ngạc. Anh trông rạng rỡ, tuy không nói một lời hay tỏ một cử chỉ hân hoan nào, từ con người anh vẫn tỏa ra một niềm sung sướng rạng ngời tràn khắp căn phòng.
tr: Mutfaktaki fırını yere atmak dışında her türlü gürültüyü yapmaya özen göstererek içeri girdim. Ama ses filan duymadıklarına emindim. Kanepenin iki ucuna oturmuş, biri soru sormuş da diğeri yanıtını bekliyormuş ya da soru havada dolaşıyormuş gibi birbirlerinin yüzüne bakıyorlardı. Başlangıçtaki çekingenlik gitmişti. Daisy’nin yanaklarında gözyaşlarının izi duruyordu. Ben girince yerinden fırlayıp ayna karşısında onları silme­ye başladı. Gatsby’de gördüğüm değişikliğe ise inanamadım. Kımıldamadan, konuşmadan öylece dururken bile kelimenin tam anlamıyla parlıyor, ondan fışkıran aydınlık ve mutluluk küçük odayı dolduruyordu.
es: Entré —después de hacer todo el ruido posible en la cocina, salvo derribar la hornilla—, pero no creo que oyeran nada. Estaban sentados en los dos extremos del sofá, mirándose como si esperaran la respuesta a una pregunta, o flotara una pregunta en el aire, y todo vestigio de incomodidad había desaparecido. La cara de Daisy estaba llena de lágrimas, y cuando entré se levantó de un salto y empezó a secárselas con el pañuelo ante un espejo. Pero en Gatsby se había producido un cambio que era sencillamente desconcertante. Resplandecía literalmente. Sin una palabra o un gesto de alegría, irradiaba un nuevo bienestar que colmaba el cuarto.
vi_translation: I stepped into the house, trying every possible way to make noise in the kitchen, almost toppling the stove, but I believe they didn't hear anything. The two of them were sitting at opposite ends of the sofa, looking at each other as if they had asked or were still asking each other something, with all traces of awkwardness gone. Daisy's face was streaked with tears, and when she saw me enter, she stood up abruptly and began to wipe her tears with a handkerchief in front of the mirror. However, there was an astonishing change in Gatsby. He looked radiant, though he didn't say a word or make any joyful gesture, a bright happiness emanated from him, filling the entire room.
tr_translation: I entered the room, making every kind of noise except throwing the oven to the floor. But I was sure they hadn't heard anything. They were sitting at opposite ends of the couch, looking at each other as if one had asked a question and the other was waiting for an answer, or as if the question was still hanging in the air. The initial shyness had disappeared. The traces of tears were still on Daisy's cheeks. When I entered, she jumped up and started wiping them off in front of the mirror. I couldn't believe the change I saw in Gatsby. Even while standing still and silent, he was literally glowing, and the light and happiness emanating from him filled the small room.
es_translation: I entered —after making all the noise possible in the kitchen, short of knocking over the stove—, but I don't think they heard anything. They were sitting at the two ends of the sofa, looking at each other as if waiting for the answer to a question, or as if a question floated in the air, and all traces of discomfort had disappeared. Daisy's face was full of tears, and when I entered, she jumped up and started drying them with a handkerchief in front of a mirror. But in Gatsby, there had been a change that was simply bewildering. He literally glowed. Without a word or gesture of joy, he radiated a new well-being that filled the room.

en: “Oh, hello, old sport,” he said, as if he hadn’t seen me for years. I thought for a moment he was going to shake hands.
vi: "Ô, chào anh bạn già." Gatsby nói làm như thể anh ta nhiều năm rồi chưa gặp tôi. Trong giây lát tôi còn tưởng anh ta sẽ đưa tay ra bắt tay tôi nữa.
tr: “Vay, merhaba ahbap” dedi sanki yıllardır görüşmemişiz gibi. Bir an elimi bile sıkacağını düşündüm.
es: —Ah, hola, compañero —dijo, como si no me viera desde hacía años. Pensé por un momento que iba a darme la mano.
vi_translation: "Oh, hello old friend." Gatsby said as if he hadn't seen me for many years. For a moment, I even thought he would reach out to shake my hand.
tr_translation: "Hey, hello buddy," he said as if we hadn't seen each other in years. For a moment, I even thought he would shake my hand.
es_translation: —Ah, hello, friend —he said, as if he hadn't seen me in years. I thought for a moment that he was going to shake my hand.

en: “It’s stopped raining.”
vi: "Trời tạnh mưa rồi."
tr: “Yağmur dindi” dedim.
es: —Ha dejado de llover.
vi_translation: "The rain has stopped."
tr_translation: “The rain has stopped,” I said.
es_translation: —It has stopped raining.

en: “Has it?” When he realized what I was talking about, that there were twinkle-bells of sunshine in the room, he smiled like a weather man, like an ecstatic patron of recurrent light, and repeated the news to Daisy. “What do you think of that? It’s stopped raining.”
vi: "Trời tạnh mưa rồi." "Vậy sao?" Khi Gatsby nhận thức ra được tôi vừa nói gì thì cũng là lúc những tia nắng lấp lánh tươi vui đã nhảy múa khắp căn phòng. Anh ta mỉm cười như một nhà khí tượng gia, như một người khách quen đầy say mê khi thấy ánh nắng trở lại. Anh ta lập lại tin tức này đến cho Daisy. "Em nghĩ sao? Trời đã tạnh mưa rồi."
tr: “Yağmur dindi” dedim. “Öyle mi?” Neden bahsettiğimi anlayıp, odaya sızan güneşi de görünce, bir meteoroloji uzmanı ya da giren ışınların coşku dolu efendisiymiş gibi gülümseyerek haberi Daisy’e iletti. “Ne dersin buna? Yağmur dinmiş
es: —Ha dejado de llover. —¿Sí? —cuando entendió lo que yo acababa de decirle, que campanillas de sol centelleaban en la habitación, sonrió como un meteorólogo, como el patrocinador extasiado de la luz que volvía, y repitió la novedad a Daisy—. ¿Qué te parece? Ha dejado de llover.
vi_translation: "Is that so?" When Gatsby realized what I had just said, the cheerful, sparkling rays of sunlight were already dancing throughout the room. He smiled like a meteorologist, like an enthusiastic regular guest upon seeing the sunlight return. He repeated this news to Daisy. "What do you think? The rain has stopped."
tr_translation: “Is that so?” Understanding what I meant and seeing the sun streaming into the room, he smiled as if he were a meteorologist or the exuberant master of the entering rays and conveyed the news to Daisy. “What do you say to this? The rain has stopped”
es_translation: —Yes? —when he understood what I had just told him, that little bells of sunlight were sparkling in the room, he smiled like a meteorologist, like the ecstatic sponsor of the returning light, and repeated the news to Daisy—. What do you think? It has stopped raining.

en: “I’m glad, Jay.” Her throat, full of aching, grieving beauty, told only of her unexpected joy.
vi: "Em vui lắm, Jay." Cổ họng của Daisy tràn đầy nét đẹp nhức nhối đau thương chỉ để nói lên những niềm vui bất ngờ.
tr: “Buna çok sevindim Jay” derken kederli gü­zellikteki sesi beklenmedik bir mutluluğun izleriyle doluydu.
es: —Me alegro, Jay —su garganta, llena de una belleza triste y dolorida, sólo hablaba de su felicidad inesperada.
vi_translation: "I'm very happy, Jay." Daisy's throat was filled with a poignant beauty just to express unexpected joys.
tr_translation: "I'm very happy about this, Jay," she said, her sorrowful yet beautiful voice filled with traces of unexpected happiness.
es_translation: —I'm glad, Jay —her throat, filled with a sad and aching beauty, spoke only of her unexpected happiness.

en: “I want you and Daisy to come over to my house,” he said, “I’d like to show her around.”
vi: "Tôi muốn mời anh và Daisy sang thăm nhà tôi." Gatsby nói. "Tôi muốn đưa Daisy đi thăm viếng quanh nhà."
tr: “Sen ve Daisy’nin bana gelmenizi istiyorum. Ona evimi göstereceğim” dedi Gatsby.
es: —Quiero que me acompañéis a casa. Me gustaría enseñársela a Daisy.
vi_translation: "I want to invite you and Daisy to visit my house," Gatsby said. "I want to take Daisy around the house."
tr_translation: “I want you and Daisy to come to my place. I will show her my house,” said Gatsby.
es_translation: —I want you to come home with me. I would like to show it to Daisy.

en: “You’re sure you want me to come?”
vi: "Anh có thật sự muốn tôi đi không?"
tr: “Gelmemi istediğinden emin misin?
es: —¿Estás seguro de que quieres que vaya yo?
vi_translation: "Do you really want me to leave?"
tr_translation: “Are you sure you want me to come?”
es_translation: —Are you sure you want me to go?

en: “Absolutely, old sport.”
vi: "Chắc chắn muốn mà, anh bạn già."
tr: “Elbette ahbap.
es: —Absolutamente, compañero.
vi_translation: "Definitely want to, old friend."
tr_translation: “Of course, buddy.”
es_translation: —Absolutely, comrade.

en: Daisy went upstairs to wash her face—too late I thought with humiliation of my towels—while Gatsby and I waited on the lawn.
vi: Daisy lên lầu để rửa mặt trong khi Gatsby và tôi đứng đợi ngoài bãi cỏ. Trễ mất rồi, tôi cảm thấy xấu hổ khi nghĩ đến những chiếc khăn lau mặt của tôi trong phòng tắm.
tr: Daisy yüzünü yıkamak için üst kata çıkmıştı. Bir an havlularımın durumunu düşünüp utandım ama artık çok geçti. Gatsby ile bahçede beklemeye koyulduk.
es: Daisy subió a lavarse la cara —y demasiado tarde me acordé, con humillación, de mis toallas— mientras Gatsby y yo esperábamos en el césped.
vi_translation: Daisy went upstairs to wash her face while Gatsby and I stood waiting on the lawn. Too late, I felt embarrassed thinking about my face towels in the bathroom.
tr_translation: Daisy had gone upstairs to wash her face. For a moment, I felt embarrassed thinking about the state of my towels, but it was too late now. We started waiting in the garden with Gatsby.
es_translation: Daisy went up to wash her face —and too late I remembered, with humiliation, my towels— while Gatsby and I waited on the lawn.

en: “My house looks well, doesn’t it?” he demanded. “See how the whole front of it catches the light.”
vi: "Nhà tôi trông đẹp lắm, phải không?" Gatsby hỏi. "Nhìn coi nguyên mặt tiền của nó đều được ánh sáng chiếu."
tr: “Evim güzel görünüyor, değil mi?” diye sordu, “Ön tarafı ne güzel güneş alıyor bak.
es: —Mi casa está bien, ¿verdad? —me preguntó—. Fíjate en cómo da la luz en la fachada.
vi_translation: "My house looks very beautiful, doesn't it?" Gatsby asked. "Look, the entire facade is illuminated."
tr_translation: “My house looks beautiful, doesn't it?” she asked, “Look how nicely the front gets sunlight.”
es_translation: —My house is nice, right? —he asked me—. Look at how the light hits the facade.

en: I agreed that it was splendid.
vi: Tôi đồng ý căn nhà quả thật là lộng lẫy.
tr: Muhteşem olduğunu onayladım.
es: Reconocí que era espléndida.
vi_translation: I agree the house is indeed magnificent.
tr_translation: I confirmed that it was magnificent.
es_translation: I recognized that it was splendid.

en: “Yes.” His eyes went over it, every arched door and square tower. “It took me just three years to earn the money that bought it.”
vi: "Đúng vậy." Cặp mắt của Gatsby nhìn lướt qua căn nhà, qua từng cánh cửa hình vòng cung đến đỉnh tháp vuông. "Tôi chỉ mất có ba năm để kiếm đủ tiền mua nó."
tr: “Evet” dedi gözlerini evin kemerli kapılarında ve köşeli kule­lerinde dolaştırırken, “onu almak için gerekli parayı yalnızca üç yılda kazandım.
es: —Sí —la recorrió con la mirada, deteniéndose en el arco de cada puerta, en la solidez de cada torre—. Tardé tres años en ganar el dinero para comprarla.
vi_translation: "That's right." Gatsby's eyes glanced over the house, through each arched door to the square tower peak. "It only took me three years to make enough money to buy it."
tr_translation: “Yes,” he said, letting his eyes wander over the arched doors and angular towers of the house, “I earned the money needed to buy it in just three years.”
es_translation: —Yes —he scanned it with his eyes, lingering on the arch of each door, on the solidity of each tower—. It took me three years to earn the money to buy it.

en: “I thought you inherited your money.”
vi: "Tôi tưởng tiền của anh là từ thừa hưởng di sản?"
tr: “Sana miras kaldığını sanıyordum.
es: —Creía que habías heredado tu dinero.
vi_translation: "I thought your money was inherited?"
tr_translation: “I thought you had inherited it.”
es_translation: —I thought you had inherited your money.

en: “I did, old sport,” he said automatically, “but I lost most of it in the big panic—the panic of the war.”
vi: "Đúng vậy, anh bạn già." Gatsby trả lời một cách máy móc. "Thế nhưng tôi đã bị mất tất cả trong thời khủng hoảng, thời khủng hoảng chiến tranh."
tr: “Evet doğru ahbap” dedi hiç duraksamadan, “ama büyük panik sırasında önemli bir bölümünü kaybettim o paranın. Savaş öncesindeki panikten bahsediyorum.
es: —Y lo heredé, compañero —dijo inmediatamente—, pero perdí casi todo en el gran pánico…, el pánico de la guerra.
vi_translation: "That's right, old sport." Gatsby replied mechanically. "But I lost everything during the crisis, the war crisis."
tr_translation: “Yes, that's right, buddy,” he said without hesitation, “but I lost a significant portion of that money during the great panic. I'm talking about the panic before the war.”
es_translation: —And I inherited it, my friend —he said immediately—, but I lost almost everything in the great panic..., the panic of the war.

en: I think he hardly knew what he was saying, for when I asked him what business he was in he answered: “That’s my affair,” before he realized that it wasn’t an appropriate reply.
vi: Tôi nghĩ thật ra anh ta không biết mình đang nói gì, bởi vì khi tôi hỏi anh làm ngành nghề gì thì anh trả lời "Đó là chuyện riêng của tôi" trước khi nhận thức được rằng câu trả lời của mình là không thích hợp.
tr: Sanırım söylediklerinin pek farkında değildi, çünkü ne iş yaptığını sorduğumda, “O benim bileceğim şey” dedi. Yersiz bir cevap verdiğini düşünmemişti.
es: Pensé que no sabía muy bien lo que decía, porque cuando le pregunté a qué tipo de negocios se dedicaba, me contestó: «Eso es asunto mío», antes de darse cuenta de que no era una respuesta adecuada.
vi_translation: I think he actually doesn't know what he's talking about, because when I asked him what his profession was, he answered "That's my personal business" before realizing that his answer was inappropriate.
tr_translation: I think he wasn't really aware of what he was saying, because when I asked what he did for a living, he said, "That's something for me to know." He didn't think he had given an inappropriate answer.
es_translation: I thought he didn't really know what he was saying, because when I asked him what kind of business he was in, he replied, "That's my business," before realizing that it wasn't an appropriate answer.

en: “Oh, I’ve been in several things,” he corrected himself. “I was in the drug business and then I was in the oil business. But I’m not in either one now.” He looked at me with more attention. “Do you mean you’ve been thinking over what I proposed the other night?”
vi: "Ồ, tôi làm nhiều ngành nghề." Gatsby sửa lời. "Tôi đã từng làm ngành thuốc men sau đó sang ngành dầu hỏa. Nhưng bây giờ thì tôi bỏ cả hai rồi." Anh ta nhìn tôi chăm chú hơn. "Có phải ý của anh muốn nói anh đang cân nhắc chuyện tôi đề nghị tối hôm nọ?"
tr: “Pek çok iş yaptığım söylenebilir” diyerek hatasını düzelt­meye çalıştı. “Önce ilaç işindeydim, sonra petrole girdim. Şu sıralar ikisini de bırakmış bulunuyorum.” Yüzüme dik­katle baktı. “Geçen akşamki önerimi düşündüğünü mü söylemeye çalışıyorsun yoksa?
es: —Ah, me he metido en varias cosas —corrigió—. Me he dedicado al negocio de los drugstores y al del petróleo. Pero he dejado los dos —me miró con más atención—. ¿Quieres decir que has pensado lo que te propuse la otra noche?
vi_translation: "Oh, I have worked in many professions." Gatsby corrected. "I used to work in the pharmaceutical industry and then moved to the oil industry. But now I have left both." He looked at me more intently. "Are you implying that you are considering the proposal I made the other night?"
tr_translation: “It can be said that I have done a lot of work,” he tried to correct his mistake. “First, I was in the pharmaceutical business, then I got into oil. These days, I have quit both.” He looked at my face carefully. “Are you trying to say that you have thought about my suggestion from the other night?”
es_translation: —Ah, I have gotten into various things —he corrected—. I have dedicated myself to the drugstore business and to the oil business. But I have left both —he looked at me more attentively—. Do you mean that you have thought about what I proposed to you the other night?

en: Before I could answer, Daisy came out of the house and two rows of brass buttons on her dress gleamed in the sunlight.
vi: Trước khi tôi kịp trả lời thì Daisy đã bước từ trong nhà ra, hai hàng nút đồng trên áo sáng lấp lánh dưới ánh mặt trời.
tr: Yanıt vermeme vakit kalmadan Daisy çıkageldi. Elbisesinde­ki iki sıra pirinç düğme güneşte parlıyordu.
es: Antes de que pudiera responderle, Daisy salió de la casa y dos filas de botones de latón brillaron al sol.
vi_translation: Before I could answer, Daisy had already stepped out of the house, the rows of brass buttons on her shirt sparkling under the sunlight.
tr_translation: Before I had time to respond, Daisy appeared. The two rows of brass buttons on her dress were shining in the sun.
es_translation: Before he could answer her, Daisy came out of the house and two rows of brass buttons shone in the sun.

en: “That huge place there?” she cried pointing.
vi: "Căn nhà đồ sộ ĐÓ phải không?" Daisy reo to chỉ về hướng căn nhà.
tr: “Şu koca binadan mı bahsediyorsun?” diye bağırdı eliyle malikaneyi göstererek.
es: —¿Esa enorme casa de ahí? —exclamó, señalando con el dedo.
vi_translation: "Is THAT the huge house?" Daisy exclaimed, pointing towards the house.
tr_translation: “Are you talking about that huge building?” he shouted, pointing at the mansion with his hand.
es_translation: —That enormous house over there? —he exclaimed, pointing with his finger.

en: “Do you like it?”
vi: "Em thích nó không?"
tr: “Beğendin mi? “Bayıldım!
es: —¿Te gusta?
vi_translation: "Do you like it?"
tr_translation: “Did you like it?” “I loved it!
es_translation: —Do you like it?

en: “I love it, but I don’t see how you live there all alone.”
vi: "Em thích nhưng không hiểu làm sao anh có thể ở đó một mình."
tr: Ama orada tek başına nasıl yaşadığını pek anla­madım.
es: —Me encanta, pero no sé cómo puedes vivir ahí completamente solo.
vi_translation: "I like it but I don't understand how you can be there alone."
tr_translation: But I didn't quite understand how you lived there alone.”
es_translation: —I love it, but I don't know how you can live there completely alone.

en: “I keep it always full of interesting people, night and day. People who do interesting things. Celebrated people.”
vi: "Anh lúc nào cũng mời những người đáng thú vị đến đầy nhà, cả ngày lẫn đêm. Những người đã làm lên những chuyện đáng chú ý. Những nhân vật nổi tiếng."
tr: “İçini sabah akşam bir sürü ilginç insanla dolduruyorum. İl­ginç işler yapan ilginç insanlar, ünlü yüzler.
es: —La tengo siempre llena de gente interesante, día y noche. Gente que hace cosas interesantes. Gente famosa.
vi_translation: "You always invite interesting people to the house, day and night. People who have done remarkable things. Famous personalities."
tr_translation: “I fill it with a lot of interesting people morning and evening. Interesting people doing interesting jobs, famous faces.”
es_translation: —I always have it full of interesting people, day and night. People who do interesting things. Famous people.

en: Instead of taking the shortcut along the Sound we went down to the road and entered by the big postern. With enchanting murmurs Daisy admired this aspect or that of the feudal silhouette against the sky, admired the gardens, the sparkling odour of jonquils and the frothy odour of hawthorn and plum blossoms and the pale gold odour of kiss-me-at-the-gate. It was strange to reach the marble steps and find no stir of bright dresses in and out the door, and hear no sound but bird voices in the trees.
vi: Thay vì đi tắt dọc theo bờ vịnh, chúng tôi đi ra ngoài đường rồi vào bằng cổng chính. Với giọng nói thì thầm đầy mê hoặc, Daisy khen ngợi hết vẻ này đến nét kia của căn nhà lúc đó đang đứng sừng sững nghiêng bóng trên nền trời. Nàng khen khu vườn với mùi thơm nồng nàn lấp lánh của những bông thủy tiên trường thọ, mùi thơm sắc sảo sủi bọt của những bông táo gai bông mận, và mùi thơm vàng nhạt của bông kiss-me-at-the-gate. Một điều lạ lùng, khi bước tới những bậc cửa đá hoa cương chúng tôi không hề thấy những tà áo sặc sỡ đong đưa dập dìu ra vào cửa, cũng không hề nghe một tiếng động nào ngoại trừ tiếng chim hót trên những cành cây.
tr: Boğaz boyunca uzanan kestirme yoldan gideceğimiz yerde, ana yola inerek malikanenin büyük ön kapısından girdik. Daisy o büyüleyici sesiyle evin sağını solunu ya da göğe yükselen feodal siluetini övüyordu. Bahçelere, fulyaların keskin, alıç ve erik çiçeklerinin köpüksü ve hanımelinin soluk sarı kokusuna hayran kalmıştı. Mermer merdivenlere vardığımızda renga­renk elbiseler içindeki kadınları içeri girip çıkarken görmemek ve ağaçlardaki kuşların sesinden başka ses duy­mamak tuhafıma gitmişti.
es: En lugar de tomar el atajo de la costa bajamos a la carretera y entramos por la gran cancela. Con susurros encantadores Daisy admiró este o aquel aspecto de la silueta feudal con el cielo como fondo, admiró los jardines, el olor chispeante de los junquillos, el burbujeante olor de los espinos y de los ciruelos en flor, y el pálido olor a oro de la milamores. Era extraño llegar a la escalinata de mármol y no encontrar un revuelo de vestidos radiantes, entrando y saliendo de la casa, y sólo oír el canto de los pájaros en los árboles.
vi_translation: Instead of taking a shortcut along the bay shore, we went out onto the road and then entered through the main gate. With a mesmerizing whisper, Daisy praised every feature of the house, which stood towering and casting its shadow against the sky. She admired the garden with the rich, sparkling scent of perennial daffodils, the sharp, effervescent aroma of hawthorn and plum blossoms, and the pale yellow fragrance of kiss-me-at-the-gate flowers. Strangely, as we approached the granite steps, we did not see the colorful dresses fluttering in and out of the door, nor did we hear any sound except for the chirping of birds on the branches.
tr_translation: Instead of taking the shortcut along the Bosphorus, we went down to the main road and entered through the grand front gate of the mansion. Daisy was praising the right and left sides of the house or its feudal silhouette rising to the sky with her enchanting voice. She was captivated by the gardens, the sharp scent of jonquils, the foamy scent of hawthorn and plum blossoms, and the pale yellow fragrance of honeysuckle. When we reached the marble stairs, it struck me as odd not to see women in colorful dresses going in and out and to hear nothing but the sound of birds in the trees.
es_translation: Instead of taking the coastal shortcut, we went down to the road and entered through the large gate. With charming whispers, Daisy admired this or that aspect of the feudal silhouette against the sky, admired the gardens, the sparkling scent of the daffodils, the bubbling scent of the hawthorns and the blooming plum trees, and the pale golden scent of the honeysuckle. It was strange to arrive at the marble staircase and not find a flurry of radiant dresses, coming in and out of the house, and only hear the song of the birds in the trees.

en: And inside, as we wandered through Marie Antoinette music-rooms and Restoration Salons, I felt that there were guests concealed behind every couch and table, under orders to be breathlessly silent until we had passed through. As Gatsby closed the door of “the Merton College Library” I could have sworn I heard the owl-eyed man break into ghostly laughter.
vi: Vào trong nhà khi chúng tôi đi ngang qua những phòng âm nhạc trang hoàng theo kiểu của hoàng hậu Marie Antoinette và những phòng khách trang hoàng theo kiểu thời phục hưng của Anh, tôi cảm thấy dường như có những người khách đang ẩn núp phía sau mỗi chiếc ghế dựa, sau mỗi chiếc bàn, họ như đang tuân theo lệnh phải nín thở giữ im lặng cho tới khi chúng tôi đi qua khỏi. Khi Gatsby đóng cửa của căn phòng thư viện "the Merton College Library", tôi thề tôi đã nghe tiếng của ông mắt cú vọ bật lên cười một cách ma quái.
tr: İçerde, Marie Antoinette tarzı döşenmiş müzik odalarını ve 17 ve 18’inci yüzyıldan kalma antikalarla bezenmiş salonları gezerken de her koltuk ya da masanın arkasında gizlenen konuklar olduğu ve biz oradan uzaklaşıncaya kadar sessizce bekledikleri duygusuna kapılmıştım. Gatsby, ‘Merton Üniversite Kütüphanesi’nin kapısını kapatırken de baykuş gözlünün hayaletinin arkamızdan bir kahkaha patlattığını duyar gibi oldum.
es: Y dentro, mientras recorríamos salas de música a la María Antonieta y salones estilo Restauración, tuve la sensación de que había invitados escondidos detrás de cada sofá y cada mesa, con órdenes de guardar silencio, de ni respirar siquiera, hasta que hubiéramos pasado. Cuando Gatsby cerró la puerta de la «Merton College Library», hubiera jurado que oí la risa espectral del hombre de los ojos de búho.
vi_translation: As we entered the house and passed through the music rooms decorated in the style of Queen Marie Antoinette and the living rooms decorated in the English Renaissance style, I felt as if there were guests hiding behind each chair, behind each table, as if they were following orders to hold their breath and remain silent until we passed by. When Gatsby closed the door of the library room "the Merton College Library," I swear I heard the voice of the owl-eyed man let out a ghostly laugh.
tr_translation: Inside, while wandering through the music rooms furnished in Marie Antoinette style and the salons adorned with antiques from the 17th and 18th centuries, I had the feeling that guests were hiding behind every chair or table and silently waiting until we moved away. When Gatsby closed the door of the 'Merton University Library,' I almost heard the ghost of the owl-eyed man laughing behind us.
es_translation: And inside, as we walked through music rooms à la Marie Antoinette and Restoration-style salons, I had the feeling that there were guests hidden behind every sofa and every table, with orders to keep silent, not even to breathe, until we had passed. When Gatsby closed the door of the "Merton College Library," I could have sworn I heard the spectral laughter of the man with owl eyes.

en: We went upstairs, through period bedrooms swathed in rose and lavender silk and vivid with new flowers, through dressing-rooms and poolrooms, and bathrooms with sunken baths—intruding into one chamber where a dishevelled man in pyjamas was doing liver exercises on the floor. It was Mr. Klipspringer, the “boarder.” I had seen him wandering hungrily about the beach that morning. Finally we came to Gatsby’s own apartment, a bedroom and a bath, and an Adam’s study, where we sat down and drank a glass of some Chartreuse he took from a cupboard in the wall.
vi: Chúng tôi đi lên lầu, ngang qua những phòng ngủ trang hoàng theo thời xưa có trải lụa hồng, lụa tím và trưng bày sặc sỡ những bông hoa tươi mới hái. Ngang qua những phòng trang điểm, những phòng đánh banh bi-da và những phòng tắm với bồn tắm xây chìm dưới thấp, chúng tôi vô tình đi vào trong một phòng nơi có một người khách mặc quần áo ngủ tóc tai bù xù đang tập những động tác thể dục chữa bịnh gan ở dưới sàn. Đó là Klipspringer, người "ở trọ". Tôi đã từng gặp anh ta đói khát đi lang thang ngoài biển mỗi buổi sáng. Cuối cùng, chúng tôi đến phòng riêng của Gatsby, gồm một phòng ngủ, một phòng tắm, một phòng làm việc trang trí kiểu Adam. Chúng tôi ngồi lại phòng làm việc uống một ly rượu Chartreuse mà Gatsby vừa lấy ra từ trong kệ trên tường.
tr: Üst kata çıktık. Çeşitli dönem tarzlarında döşenmiş, gül ve leylak rengi ipeklerle kaplı, taze çiçek­lerle süslenmiş yatak odalarından ve soyunma odalarından, bilar­do salonlarından, gömme küvetli banyolardan geçtik. Odalardan birine girdiğimizde saçı sakalı karışmış pijamalı bir adam jimnastik hareketleri yapıyordu. ‘Pansiyoner’ olduğu söylenen Bay Klipspringer’dı bu. Sabah, yüzünde açlığını belli eden bir ifadeyle plajda dolanırken görmüştüm onu. Nihayet Gatsby’nin özel dairesine vardık. İçinde yatak odası, klasik İskoç tarzı döşenmiş bir banyo, James ve Robert Adam stili bir çalışma odası vardı. Orada oturup duvardaki bir dolaptan çıkardığı Chartreuse’den birer kadeh içtik.
es: Subimos a la segunda planta, pasamos por dormitorios de época tapizados en seda rosa y color lavanda y vivificados por flores frescas, y vestidores y salas de billar, y cuartos de baño con bañeras empotradas en el suelo, y aparecimos sin permiso en una habitación donde un hombre en pijama, tumbado y despeinado hacía ejercicios para el hígado. Era mister Klipspringer, el Interno. Esa mañana lo había visto deambular angustiado por la playa. Llegamos por fin al apartamento de Gatsby, un dormitorio con cuarto de baño, y un estudio estilo Adam, donde nos sentamos y bebimos un Chartreuse que guardaba en una alacena.
vi_translation: We went upstairs, passing by bedrooms decorated in an old-fashioned style with pink silk, purple silk, and vibrantly displayed freshly picked flowers. Passing by the dressing rooms, billiard rooms, and bathrooms with sunken tubs, we inadvertently entered a room where a guest in pajamas with disheveled hair was performing liver exercises on the floor. It was Klipspringer, the "boarder." I had seen him wandering hungrily by the sea every morning. Finally, we reached Gatsby's private quarters, which included a bedroom, a bathroom, and a study decorated in the Adam style. We sat in the study and drank a glass of Chartreuse that Gatsby had just taken from a shelf on the wall.
tr_translation: We went upstairs. We passed through bedrooms and dressing rooms furnished in various period styles, covered with rose and lilac-colored silks, decorated with fresh flowers, billiard rooms, and bathrooms with built-in tubs. When we entered one of the rooms, a man with disheveled hair and beard, wearing pajamas, was doing gymnastics exercises. This was Mr. Klipspringer, who was said to be a 'boarder.' I had seen him in the morning, wandering on the beach with a look on his face that revealed his hunger. Finally, we arrived at Gatsby's private suite. Inside, there was a bedroom, a bathroom furnished in classic Scottish style, and a study in the style of James and Robert Adam. We sat there and drank a glass of Chartreuse that he took out from a cupboard in the wall.
es_translation: We went up to the second floor, passed through period bedrooms upholstered in pink and lavender silk and enlivened by fresh flowers, and dressing rooms and billiard rooms, and bathrooms with sunken bathtubs, and we appeared uninvited in a room where a man in pajamas, lying down and disheveled, was doing liver exercises. It was Mr. Klipspringer, the Boarder. That morning I had seen him wandering anxiously along the beach. We finally arrived at Gatsby's apartment, a bedroom with a bathroom, and an Adam-style study, where we sat and drank a Chartreuse that he kept in a cupboard.

en: He hadn’t once ceased looking at Daisy, and I think he revalued everything in his house according to the measure of response it drew from her well-loved eyes. Sometimes too, he stared around at his possessions in a dazed way, as though in her actual and astounding presence none of it was any longer real. Once he nearly toppled down a flight of stairs.
vi: Gatsby không hề rời mắt nhìn Daisy, tôi nghĩ anh ta đang trị giá tất cả mọi vật trong nhà mình dựa theo phản ứng từ trong ánh mắt đáng yêu của nàng. Đôi khi, anh cũng ngây người nhìn chăm những vật sở hữu của mình làm như trước sự hiện diện đầy hiện thực và đầy kinh ngạc của Daisy thì những thứ đó không còn là thực nữa. Có một lần, anh đã xém ngã cả xuống cầu thang.
tr: Gatsby bir an için bile gözlerini Daisy’den ayırmamıştı. Evindeki her şeyi onun güzel gözlerinde gördüğü tepkiye bakarak yeniden değerlendiriyor olmalıydı. Bazen evdeki eşyalara, Daisy’nin etkileyici varlığının yanında hiçbiri gerçek değilmiş gibi bakıyordu. Merdivenlerden inerken bir kez de tökezlemişti. Az kaldı yuvarlanıyordu.
es: No había dejado de mirar a Daisy ni un momento, y creo que volvió a calcular el valor de todo lo que había en la casa según la reacción que provocaba en sus ojos bienamados. Y, a veces, miraba sus posesiones como aturdido, como si ante la presencia material y prodigiosa de Daisy nada fuera ya real. Estuvo a punto de caerse por las escaleras.
vi_translation: Gatsby never took his eyes off Daisy; I think he was valuing everything in his house based on the reaction in her lovely eyes. Sometimes, he would also stare blankly at his possessions, as if in the very real and astonishing presence of Daisy, those things ceased to be real. Once, he almost fell down the stairs.
tr_translation: Gatsby had not taken his eyes off Daisy for even a moment. He must have been reevaluating everything in his house based on the reaction he saw in her beautiful eyes. Sometimes he looked at the items in the house as if none of them were real compared to Daisy's captivating presence. He had stumbled once while coming down the stairs. He almost fell.
es_translation: He hadn't stopped looking at Daisy for a moment, and I think he recalculated the value of everything in the house based on the reaction it provoked in her beloved eyes. And sometimes, he looked at his possessions as if dazed, as if in the material and wondrous presence of Daisy, nothing was real anymore. He almost fell down the stairs.

en: His bedroom was the simplest room of all—except where the dresser was garnished with a toilet set of pure dull gold. Daisy took the brush with delight, and smoothed her hair, whereupon Gatsby sat down and shaded his eyes and began to laugh.
vi: So sánh với các căn phòng khác, căn phòng của Gatsby là giản dị nhất, ngoại trừ chiếc bàn gương có để một bộ trang điểm bằng vàng đục. Daisy thích thú cầm chiếc lược lên chải tóc. Nhân đó Gatsby ngồi xuống đưa tay che mắt và phá lên cười.
tr: En yalın döşenmiş yer, yatak odasıydı. Tuvalet masasının üzerindeki takımlar dışında her şey matlaştırılmış saf altındandı. Daisy oradan bir fırça alıp saçlarını düzeltmeye kalkınca Gatsby bir iskemleye oturup elini gözlerine siper ederek gülmeye başladı.
es: Su dormitorio era el más sencillo, salvo por un juego de tocador de oro puro mate que adornaba la cómoda. Daisy cogió el cepillo con deleite, y se alisó el pelo, ante lo cual Gatsby se sentó, se llevó la mano a los ojos y se echó a reír.
vi_translation: Compared to the other rooms, Gatsby's room was the simplest, except for the mirrored table with a gold-plated grooming set. Daisy delightedly picked up the comb and brushed her hair. At that moment, Gatsby sat down, covered his eyes with his hand, and burst out laughing.
tr_translation: The most simply furnished place was the bedroom. Except for the sets on the dressing table, everything was made of matte pure gold. When Daisy picked up a brush from there and started to fix her hair, Gatsby sat on a chair and began to laugh, shielding his eyes with his hand.
es_translation: His bedroom was the simplest, except for a set of pure matte gold dresser accessories that adorned the dresser. Daisy picked up the brush with delight and smoothed her hair, at which Gatsby sat down, put his hand to his eyes, and burst out laughing.

en: “It’s the funniest thing, old sport,” he said hilariously. “I can’t—When I try to—”
vi: "Cái này là buồn cười nhất, anh bạn già." Gatsby nói nắc nẻ. "Tôi không thể... Khi tôi cố..."
tr: “Bu gördüğüm en komik şey, ahbap” dedi peş peşe kahkahalar atarken, “istesem de engel olamıyorum...
es: —Es lo más divertido, compañero —dijo, riendo—. No puedo… Cuando intento…
vi_translation: "This is the funniest thing, old chap." Gatsby chuckled. "I can't... When I try..."
tr_translation: "This is the funniest thing I've ever seen, buddy," he said while laughing consecutively, "I can't stop it even if I wanted to..."
es_translation: —It's the most fun, buddy —he said, laughing—. I can't... When I try to...

en: He had passed visibly through two states and was entering upon a third. After his embarrassment and his unreasoning joy he was consumed with wonder at her presence. He had been full of the idea so long, dreamed it right through to the end, waited with his teeth set, so to speak, at an inconceivable pitch of intensity. Now, in the reaction, he was running down like an over-wound clock.
vi: Gatsby rõ ràng đã trải qua hai giai đoạn và bây giờ anh đang đi vào giai đoạn thứ ba. Sau lung túng ngượng ngập và tiếp đó là niềm vui không sao diễn tả được, anh bây giờ đang tận hưởng cái cảm giác diệu kỳ có được từ sự hiện diện của Daisy. Gatsby chờ đợi ngày này đã quá lâu, mơ về nó, hay có thể nói là nghiến răng chờ đợi nó với sự căng thẳng ở mức độ không sao tưởng tượng nổi. Vậy mà giờ đây, khi đối diện với nó, anh lại giống như một chiếc đồng hồ chết bị lên dây thiều quá độ. Sau một phút trấn tỉnh lại, Gatsby mở
tr: O gün gözle görülür iki aşamayı geçmiş, artık üçüncüye girmek üzereydi. Çekingenlikle başlayıp nedensiz bir neşeye geçmişti.
