After only two weeks, Gatsby became disheartened by the school's cruel indifference to the drumbeat of his destiny, or to what is generally called destiny, and by the contempt he faced for the janitorial work he did to make ends meet. Thus, Gatsby drifted to Lake Superior. On the day Dan Cody's yacht anchored in the shallow waters along the lake's shore, Gatsby had still not found anything for himself.
tr_translation: A few months earlier, driven by an instinct that could be considered a herald of future fame and fortune, he had enrolled at St. Olaf Lutheran College in southern Minnesota. However, he left this school after only two weeks, disillusioned by the indifferent drumbeats of fate, and even fate itself, and because he hated the janitorial job he took to pay for school expenses. He returned to Lake Superior, and from that day on, he searched for work until he saw Dan Cody's yacht anchored in shallow waters.
es_translation: The instinct for future glory had led him months earlier to Saint Olaf, the small Lutheran College, in southern Minnesota. He endured two weeks, demoralized by the fierce indifference of the place towards the drums of his destiny, towards destiny itself, and hating the janitorial work with which he was going to pay for his stay. He returned to Lake Superior, and was still looking for something to do the day Dan Cody's yacht dropped anchor in the shallows off the coast.

en: To young Gatz, resting on his oars and looking up at the railed deck, that yacht represented all the beauty and glamour in the world. I suppose he smiled at Cody—he had probably discovered that people liked him when he smiled. At any rate Cody asked him a few questions (one of them elicited the brand new name) and found that he was quick and extravagantly ambitious. A few days later he took him to Duluth and bought him a blue coat, six pairs of white duck trousers, and a yachting cap. And when the Tuolomee left for the West Indies and the Barbary Coast, Gatsby left too.
vi: Đối với chàng thanh niên James Gatz, lúc đó đang tỳ tay lên hai mái chèo ngước nhìn lên bong thuyền, thì chiếc du thuyền đã như đại diện cho tất cả những nét đẹp và vẻ quyến rũ của thế giới. Tôi đoán anh ta đã mỉm cười với Cody, anh ta hẳn đã khám phá ra được là anh sẽ được người ta yêu thích nếu anh cười với họ. Bất kỳ ra sao, Cody đã hỏi anh vài câu hỏi (một trong những câu hỏi đã khiến cái tên mới toanh được sinh ra) và đã khám phá ra rằng anh thanh niên này rất nhanh nhẹn và đầy hoài bão ngông cuồng. Vài ngày sau, Cody dẫn Gatsby tới Duluth và mua cho anh một chiếc áo khoác màu xanh dương mới, sáu chiếc quần trắng tinh và một chiếc mũ thủy thủ. Thế là khi chiếc du thuyền TUOLOMEE rời bến để đi tới Tây Ấn và bờ biển Barbary thì Gatsby cũng đi theo.
tr: Bu yat, kürekleri bırakarak parmaklıkla çevrilmiş güver­tesine bakmakta olan Gatz için dünyadaki bütün güzelliklerin ve şatafatın da simgesiydi; istediğini alması için başını kaldırıp da adama gülümsemesi yetmiş olmalıydı –gülümseyişinin insanları etkilediğini zaten uzun zaman önce keşfetmişti. Cody ona bazı sorular yöneltmiş, bu sorulardan birine verdiği yanıt ise o günden sonra kullanacağı yeni ismi olmuştu. Cody çocuktaki zekayı ve hırsı hemen fark etmişti. Birkaç gün sonra, Gatz’i Duluth’a götürüp ona mavi bir ceket, altı adet beyaz pantolon ve bir de yatçı şapkası aldı. Çok geçmeden Tuolomee, Batı Hint Adalarına, Barbary Sahillerine doğru yola koyulduğunda, güvertesinde Gatsby de vardı.
es: Para el joven Gatz, que se apoyaba en los remos y miraba hacia cubierta, el yate representaba toda la belleza, todo el glamour del mundo. Supongo que le sonrió a Cody: probablemente había descubierto que cuando sonreía le caía bien a la gente. El caso es que Cody le hizo unas cuantas preguntas (de una de esas preguntas salió el nuevo nombre) y descubrió que era listo y ambicioso hasta la extravagancia. Pocos días después lo llevó a Duluth y le compró una chaqueta azul, seis pares de pantalones de dril blanco y una gorra de marino. Y cuando el Tuolomee zarpó hacia las Indias Occidentales y las costas de Berbería, Gatsby zarpó también.
vi_translation: For the young man James Gatz, who was then leaning on two oars looking up at the deck, the yacht represented all the beauty and allure of the world. I guess he smiled at Cody; he must have discovered that people would like him if he smiled at them. In any case, Cody asked him a few questions (one of which led to the birth of a brand new name) and discovered that this young man was very quick-witted and full of wild ambitions. A few days later, Cody took Gatsby to Duluth and bought him a new blue coat, six pristine white pants, and a sailor hat. So when the yacht TUOLOMEE set sail for the West Indies and the Barbary Coast, Gatsby went along.
tr_translation: This yacht, by letting go of the oars and looking at the deck surrounded by railings, was a symbol of all the beauty and splendor in the world for Gatz; it must have been enough for him to lift his head and smile at the man to get what he wanted – he had discovered long ago that his smile had an effect on people. Cody asked him some questions, and the answer he gave to one of these questions became the new name he would use from that day forward. Cody immediately noticed the intelligence and ambition in the boy. A few days later, he took Gatz to Duluth and bought him a blue jacket, six white trousers, and a yachtsman's cap. Before long, when the Tuolomee set sail for the West Indies and the Barbary Coast, Gatsby was on its deck.
es_translation: For the young Gatz, who leaned on the oars and looked toward the deck, the yacht represented all the beauty, all the glamour of the world. I suppose he smiled at Cody: he had probably discovered that when he smiled, people liked him. The fact is that Cody asked him a few questions (from one of those questions came the new name) and discovered that he was smart and ambitious to the point of extravagance. A few days later, he took him to Duluth and bought him a blue jacket, six pairs of white drill trousers, and a sailor's cap. And when the Tuolomee set sail for the West Indies and the Barbary Coast, Gatsby set sail too.

en: I remember the portrait of him up in Gatsby’s bedroom, a grey, florid man with a hard, empty face—the pioneer debauchee, who during one phase of American life brought back to the Eastern seaboard the savage violence of the frontier brothel and saloon. It was indirectly due to Cody that Gatsby drank so little. Sometimes in the course of gay parties women used to rub champagne into his hair; for himself he formed the habit of letting liquor alone.
vi: Tôi nhớ đã từng thấy bức chân dung của Cody treo trong phòng ngủ của Gatsby, một người đàn ông mái tóc muối tiêu, khuôn mặt hồng hào, cứng cỏi trống vắng, một con người chuyên đi lùng kiếm khai phá, với đời sống ăn chơi trác táng, người mà trong một giai đoạn của xã hội người dân Hoa Kỳ đã mang lại cho những vùng ven biển miền đông sự hung bạo man rợ của những nhà chứa điếm và những quán rượu nơi biên phòng. Chính Cody đã trở thành người gián tiếp khiến cho Gatsby không uống rượu nhiều lắm. Trong những bữa tiệc từng bừng náo nhiệt, những phụ nữ thường lấy rượu đổ lên tóc của của anh bởi vì anh đã tự tạo cho mình thói quen không uống rượu.
tr: Kır saçlı, sert fakat ifadesiz yüzlü ve al yanaklı bu gösterişli adamın Gatsby’nin yatak odasında asılı olan o portresi hala gözümün önündedir. O, zevk düşkünlüğüyle nam salmış; Amerikan yaşantısının bir döneminde, vahşi sınır bölgelerinin genelev ve batakhanelerin zorbalıklarını doğu kıyılarındaki balara yeniden getirmiş olan uslanmaz bir hovardaydı. İçkiyle arasının iyi olmayışına da, dolaylı olarak Cody vesile olmuştu. Bazen o çılgın partilerde, kadınlar saçlarına şampanya boca ettiğinden, Gatsby sonraları içkiden uzak durmayı tercih etmişti.
es: Recuerdo su retrato en el dormitorio de Gatsby, un hombre saludable, con el pelo gris y expresión dura, vacía: el pionero disipado que durante una fase de la vida de los Estados Unidos de América devolvió a la costa este la violencia salvaje de los burdeles y los tugurios de la frontera. A Cody se debía indirectamente que Gatsby apenas bebiera. Alguna vez, en las fiestas, las mujeres le echaban champagne en el pelo. Él tenía como costumbre no probar el alcohol.
vi_translation: I remember seeing Cody's portrait hanging in Gatsby's bedroom, a man with salt-and-pepper hair, a ruddy, stern, empty face, a man who roamed and explored, living a life of debauchery, who, in a certain era of American society, brought the savage brutality of brothels and frontier saloons to the eastern seaboard. It was Cody who indirectly caused Gatsby not to drink much. At the raucous parties, women would often pour alcohol over his hair because he had made it a habit not to drink.
tr_translation: The portrait of this impressive man with gray hair, a stern but expressionless face, and rosy cheeks still lingers in my mind, hanging in Gatsby's bedroom. He was an incorrigible rake, known for his hedonism; in a period of American life, he had brought the brutalities of brothels and gambling dens from the wild frontier regions back to the balls on the eastern shores. Indirectly, it was Cody who caused Gatsby's aversion to alcohol. Sometimes at those wild parties, when women poured champagne over their hair, Gatsby later chose to stay away from alcohol.
es_translation: I remember his portrait in Gatsby's bedroom, a healthy man, with gray hair and a hard, empty expression: the dissipated pioneer who, during a phase of American life, brought back to the East Coast the wild violence of the brothels and slums of the frontier. It was indirectly due to Cody that Gatsby hardly drank. Sometimes, at parties, women would pour champagne on his hair. He had a habit of not touching alcohol.

en: And it was from Cody that he inherited money—a legacy of twenty-five thousand dollars. He didn’t get it. He never understood the legal device that was used against him, but what remained of the millions went intact to Ella Kaye. He was left with his singularly appropriate education; the vague contour of Jay Gatsby had filled out to the substantiality of a man.
vi: Cody có để di sản lại cho Gatsby - hai mươi lăm ngàn đô. Thế nhưng anh ta đã không được nhận. Gatsby không bao giờ hiểu được cái thủ đoạn pháp luật gì đã được sử dụng để cản trở, thế nhưng tất cả những triệu đồng còn lại đều hoàn toàn rơi vào tay của Ella Kaye. Gatsby chỉ còn được hưởng duy nhất cái vốn liếng kinh nghiệm học được từ Cody. Từ nó những đặc điểm mơ hồ của một anh chàng Jay Gatsby đã được tô đậm bồi đắp thành những thực chất của một người đàn ông Mãi về sau này Gatsby mới kể cho tôi nghe chuyện này.
tr: Meşhur mirasa gelince, Cody’den Gatsby’e altı üstü yirmi beş bin dolarlık kalmış ancak o, bu parayı bile alamamıştı. Avukatların nasıl bir dolap çevirerek mirasa dokunmasını önlediklerini hiç öğrenememişti. Cody’nin milyonları, Gatsby onlara elini dahi süremeden, olduğu gibi Ella Kaye’e devredilmişti. Onun payına ise görüp geçirdikleri kalmış, bu süre zarfında ise silik dış hatları sağlamlık ve kuvvetle dolarak, ortaya bir erkek çıkmıştı.
es: Y de Cody heredó el dinero: veinticinco mil dólares que jamás recibió. Nunca entendió a qué artimaña legal recurrieron contra él, pero lo que quedaba de los millones acabó íntegro en manos de Ella Kaye. A Gatsby le quedó su educación, tan apropiada, tan singular: el vago perfil de Jay Gatsby adquirió la consistencia de un hombre.
vi_translation: Cody left a legacy for Gatsby - twenty-five thousand dollars. However, he never received it. Gatsby never understood what legal maneuver was used to prevent him from getting it, but all the remaining millions completely fell into the hands of Ella Kaye. Gatsby was left with only the capital of experience he had learned from Cody. From it, the vague characteristics of a young Jay Gatsby were solidified and developed into the real substance of a man. It was much later that Gatsby told me this story.
tr_translation: As for the famous inheritance, all that was left from Cody to Gatsby was a mere twenty-five thousand dollars, but he couldn't even get that money. He never learned how the lawyers had schemed to prevent him from touching the inheritance. Cody's millions were transferred as they were to Ella Kaye, without Gatsby even laying a hand on them. What remained for him were the experiences he had gone through, and during this time, his vague outlines filled with solidity and strength, emerging as a man.
es_translation: And from Cody he inherited the money: twenty-five thousand dollars that he never received. He never understood what legal trickery was used against him, but what remained of the millions ended up entirely in the hands of Ella Kaye. Gatsby was left with his education, so appropriate, so unique: the vague outline of Jay Gatsby took on the substance of a man.

en: He told me all this very much later, but I’ve put it down here with the idea of exploding those first wild rumours about his antecedents, which weren’t even faintly true. Moreover he told it to me at a time of confusion, when I had reached the point of believing everything and nothing about him. So I take advantage of this short halt, while Gatsby, so to speak, caught his breath, to clear this set of misconceptions away.
vi: Tôi viết xuống những điều này ở đây với ý định để phá tan những lời đồn đại điên rồ không có chút gì là sự thật về quá khứ của anh. Hơn thế nữa, Gatsby đã kể nó cho tôi nghe ở vào thời điểm tôi còn đang hỗn lộn hoang mang, khi mà tôi đang ở vào cái chỗ tin vào hết mọi thứ nghe được về anh ta, không xót thứ gì. Do đó tôi đã lợi dụng lúc đang gián đoạn này, có thể nói rằng lúc Gatsby đang ngừng nghỉ xả hơi, để xua tan đi tất cả những nhận thức sai lầm về anh ta.
tr: Tüm bunları bana çok sonra anlatmıştı, yine de ataları hakkındaki gerçeklerle yakından uzaktan ilgisi olmayan dedikoduları çürütmek adına bunları anlatmayı uygun buldum. Üstelik bunları anlattığı o zamanlarda, kafam allak bullak olmuş, neye inanacağımı şaşıracak noktaya gelmiştim. Bu nedenle, yanlış anlamaları düzeltmek için, Gatsby’nin bir anlığına soluklandığı bu duraksamadan faydalanayım istedim.
es: Todo esto me lo contó mucho más tarde, pero lo escribo ahora con la idea de desmentir aquellos primeros rumores disparatados sobre sus antecedentes, que no eran ni remotamente verdad. Me lo contó además en un momento de confusión, cuando yo había llegado a creérmelo todo y a no creerme nada sobre él. Así que aprovecho esta breve interrupción, mientras Gatsby, por decirlo así, recobraba el aliento, para disipar toda esa serie de ideas falsas.
vi_translation: I write these things down here with the intention of dispelling the crazy rumors that have no truth about his past. Moreover, Gatsby told it to me at a time when I was still confused and bewildered, when I was in a place where I believed everything I heard about him, without exception. Therefore, I took advantage of this interruption, so to speak, when Gatsby was taking a break, to dispel all the misconceptions about him.
tr_translation: He had told me all of this much later, yet I found it appropriate to recount these to dispel the rumors that had nothing to do with the truths about his ancestors. Moreover, at the times he was telling me these, my mind was in turmoil, and I had reached a point where I was confused about what to believe. Therefore, to correct misunderstandings, I wanted to take advantage of this pause where Gatsby had momentarily caught his breath.
es_translation: He told me all this much later, but I write it now with the idea of dispelling those initial absurd rumors about his background, which were not remotely true. He also told me this at a moment of confusion, when I had come to believe everything and nothing about him. So I take advantage of this brief interruption, while Gatsby, so to speak, was catching his breath, to dispel all those false ideas.

en: It was a halt, too, in my association with his affairs. For several weeks I didn’t see him or hear his voice on the phone—mostly I was in New York, trotting around with Jordan and trying to ingratiate myself with her senile aunt—but finally I went over to his house one Sunday afternoon. I hadn’t been there two minutes when somebody brought Tom Buchanan in for a drink. I was startled, naturally, but the really surprising thing was that it hadn’t happened before.
vi: Lúc đó cũng là sự gián đoạn về liên hệ giữa tôi và đời sống của anh. Nhiều tuần, tôi đã không gặp hay nghe anh gọi điện thoại. Phần nhiều là vì tôi ở bên New York bận rộn cặp kè với Jordan và cố lấy lòng người dì suy lão của nàng. Thế nhưng cuối cùng một buổi chiều Chúa Nhật tôi đã ghé sang nhà Gatsby. Tôi tới đó chưa được hai phút thì có người dẫn Tom Buchana vào nhà anh chơi. Đương nhiên tôi vô cùng kinh ngạc, nhưng cái kinh ngạc thật sự chính là việc mãi đến bây giờ việc này mới xẩy ra.
tr: Aslında, aramızdaki ilişkide de bir duraksama olmuştu. Onu birkaç hafta süreyle ne görmüş, ne de onunla telefonla konuşmuştum. O zamanı çoğunlukla Jordan’ın peşi sıra New York’a giderek ve bunak teyzesinin gözüne girmeye çalışmakla geçiriyordum. Nihayet bir pazar günü öğleden sonra onu evinde ziyaret ettim, gireli daha iki dakika bile olmamıştı ki, birkaç kişi damladı. Tom Buchanan da bir şeyler içmek maksadıyla bu konukların peşine takılmıştı. Haliyle rahatsız olmuştum; bir yandan da bunun daha önce gerçekleşmemiş oluşuna şaşırmaktan kendimi alamıyordum.
es: Hubo también una interrupción en mis relaciones con él. Durante algunas semanas dejamos de vernos y de hablar por teléfono —la mayor parte del tiempo la pasaba en Nueva York, dando vueltas con Jordan e intentando congraciarme con su tía, un vejestorio—, pero fui por fin a su casa un domingo por la tarde. No llevaba allí ni dos minutos cuando alguien apareció con Tom Buchanan, a tomar una copa. Me sobresalté, como es natural, aunque lo verdaderamente asombroso es que aquello no hubiera pasado antes.
vi_translation: At that time, there was also a disruption in the connection between me and his life. For many weeks, I had neither seen nor heard him call. Mostly because I was in New York, busy hanging out with Jordan and trying to win over her elderly aunt. However, one Sunday afternoon, I finally dropped by Gatsby's house. I had been there for less than two minutes when someone brought Tom Buchanan into his house. Of course, I was extremely surprised, but the real surprise was that it had taken this long for it to happen.
tr_translation: Actually, there had been a pause in our relationship as well. I had neither seen him nor spoken to him on the phone for a few weeks. I was mostly spending that time by following Jordan to New York and trying to get into the good graces of her senile aunt. Finally, one Sunday afternoon, I visited him at his home; I had barely been there for two minutes when a few people dropped by. Tom Buchanan had also tagged along with these guests to have a drink. Naturally, I was uncomfortable; on the other hand, I couldn't help but be surprised that this hadn't happened before.
es_translation: There was also an interruption in my relations with him. For several weeks we stopped seeing each other and talking on the phone —he spent most of the time in New York, hanging out with Jordan and trying to ingratiate himself with her aunt, an old hag—, but I finally went to his house one Sunday afternoon. I hadn't been there for even two minutes when someone appeared with Tom Buchanan, to have a drink. I was startled, naturally, though the truly astonishing thing is that it hadn't happened before.

en: They were a party of three on horseback—Tom and a man named Sloane and a pretty woman in a brown riding-habit, who had been there previously.
vi: Bọn họ gồm ba người, cùng cưỡi ngựa. Tom cùng với một anh chàng tên Sloan và một phụ nữ xinh đẹp mặc trang phục cỡi ngựa màu nâu, trước đây đã có từng tới đây.
tr: Tom, Sloan adında biri ve üzerinde kahverengi binici kıyafeti olan alımlı bir kadından oluşan bu üç kişilik bu grup; atla gezinti yaparlarken uğramıştı. Kadının buraya daha önce de gelmişliği vardı.
es: Eran tres, a caballo: Tom, un tal Sloane y una mujer muy agradable, con un traje de amazona marrón, que ya conocía la casa.
vi_translation: There were three of them, all riding horses. Tom, along with a guy named Sloan and a beautiful woman dressed in brown riding attire, had been here before.
tr_translation: This group of three, consisting of Tom, someone named Sloan, and an attractive woman in a brown riding outfit, had stopped by while they were out for a ride. The woman had been here before.
es_translation: There were three of them, on horseback: Tom, a certain Sloane, and a very pleasant woman in a brown riding habit, who already knew the house.

en: “I’m delighted to see you,” said Gatsby, standing on his porch. “I’m delighted that you dropped in.”
vi: "Mời các vị vào." Gatsby đứng trước hiên nhà lên tiếng chào. "Tôi rất vui mừng được mọi người ghé thăm."
tr: “Uğramanıza çok memnun oldum,” dedi Gatsby, verandasında onların karşılarken, “ne hoş sürpriz, iyi ki geldiniz.
es: —Estoy encantado de verles —dijo Gatsby, de pie en el porche—. Estoy encantado de que hayan venido.
vi_translation: "Please come in." Gatsby stood on the porch and greeted. "I am very pleased to have everyone visit."
tr_translation: “I am very pleased that you stopped by,” said Gatsby, welcoming them on his porch, “what a nice surprise, I'm glad you came.”
es_translation: —I am delighted to see you —said Gatsby, standing on the porch—. I am delighted that you have come.

en: “Sit right down. Have a cigarette or a cigar.” He walked around the room quickly, ringing bells. “I’ll have something to drink for you in just a minute.”
vi: "Xin mời ngồi. Xin mời dùng thuốc lá hay xì gà." Gatsby đi nhanh chung quanh phòng, rung chuông. "Tôi sẽ cho người mang thức uống lên ngay."
tr: “Lütfen buyurun, lütfen. Sigara mı puro mu alırsınız?” Odada gezinirken hizmetkarların ziline birkaç kez basmayı da ihmal etmedi, “Viskileri hemen hazırlatırım.
es: —Siéntense. Cojan un cigarrillo o un puro —se movió deprisa por la habitación, pulsando timbres—. En un momento estarán listas las bebidas.
vi_translation: "Please have a seat." "Please help yourself to a cigarette or a cigar." Gatsby quickly moved around the room, ringing a bell. "I will have someone bring up drinks right away."
tr_translation: “Please, come in, please. Would you like a cigarette or a cigar?” While walking around the room, he didn't forget to press the servant's bell a few times, “I'll have the whiskeys prepared right away.”
es_translation: —Sit down. Take a cigarette or a cigar —he moved quickly around the room, pressing buzzers—. The drinks will be ready in a moment.

en: He was profoundly affected by the fact that Tom was there. But he would be uneasy anyhow until he had given them something, realizing in a vague way that that was all they came for. Mr. Sloane wanted nothing. A lemonade? No, thanks. A little champagne? Nothing at all, thanks… I’m sorry—
vi: Rõ ràng Gatsby đã bị mất bình tĩnh nghiêm trọng trước sự xuất hiện của Tom. Anh ta sẽ tiếp tục cảm thấy lúng túng cho đến khi anh có được thứ gì đó đưa ra mời khách, lờ mờ nghĩ rằng đó là lý do tại sao họ đến đây. Anh chàng Sloan không muốn uống gì cả. Nước chanh? Không, cám ơn. Một chút Champagne? Không cần thứ nào cả. Cám ơn, xin lỗi....
tr: Tom’un gelişi karşısında aslında sarsılmıştı, yine de onlara ikramda bulunmazsa rahat edemeyecekti. Emin olmasa da, oraya sırf içki için geldiklerini tahmin edebiliyordu. Yine de Bay Sloane bir şey almadı. “Limonata? “Hayır, te­şekkürler. “Biraz şampanya alın hiç değilse? “Çok teşekkür ede­rim, almayayım.
es: La presencia de Tom Buchanan lo afectaba profundamente. Pero se sentiría incómodo de todas formas hasta que no les sirviera algo, pues en el fondo se daba cuenta de que ése era el único motivo por el que habían ido a su casa. Mister Sloane no quería nada. ¿Limonada? No, gracias. ¿Un poco de champagne? Nada en absoluto, gracias… Lo siento.
vi_translation: Clearly, Gatsby had lost his composure significantly at Tom's appearance. He would continue to feel awkward until he could offer something to the guests, vaguely thinking that was the reason they came here. Mr. Sloan didn't want anything to drink. Lemonade? No, thank you. A little Champagne? None at all. Thank you, sorry....
tr_translation: She was actually shaken by Tom's arrival, yet she wouldn't be comfortable if she didn't offer them something. Even though she wasn't sure, she could guess that they came there just for the drinks. Still, Mr. Sloane didn't take anything. "Lemonade?" “No, thank you.” “At least have some champagne?” “Thank you very much, I will not take it.””
es_translation: The presence of Tom Buchanan affected him deeply. But he would feel uncomfortable anyway until he served them something, because deep down he realized that was the only reason they had come to his house. Mister Sloane didn't want anything. Lemonade? No, thank you. A little champagne? Nothing at all, thank you... I'm sorry.

en: “Did you have a nice ride?”
vi: "Mọi người đi cưỡi ngựa có vui không?"
tr: “Gezinti nasıldı?
es: —¿Qué tal el paseo?
vi_translation: "Did everyone have fun riding horses?"
tr_translation: "How was the walk?"
es_translation: —How was the walk?

en: “Very good roads around here.”
vi: "Đường xá ở đây cũng tốt lắm chứ."
tr: “Bu taraftaki yollar çok iyi.
es: —Por aquí los caminos son buenos.
vi_translation: "The roads here are quite good."
tr_translation: "The roads on this side are very good."
es_translation: —Around here the roads are good.

en: “I suppose the automobiles—”
vi: "Tôi cho rằng những chiếc xe..."
tr: “Ben otomobil tercih ediyorum - ”
es: —Supongo que los automóviles…
vi_translation: "I think that the cars..."
tr_translation: "I prefer the car - "
es_translation: —I suppose that automobiles...

en: “Yeah.”
vi: "Dà."
tr: “Anlıyorum.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: "Yes."
tr_translation: “I understand.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: Moved by an irresistible impulse, Gatsby turned to Tom, who had accepted the introduction as a stranger.
vi: Không cưỡng nổi thôi thúc, Gatsby quay sang Tom, người đã để cho được giới thiệu như là một người chưa bao giờ gặp mặt.
tr: Sonunda Gatsby, bir yabancıymış gibi kendisiyle tanıştırılmış olan ve sessizce oturan Tom’a dönüp kendini zorlayarak:
es: Obedeciendo a un impulso irresistible. Gatsby se volvió hacia Tom, que había reaccionado a la presentación como si no lo conociera.
vi_translation: Unable to resist the urge, Gatsby turned to Tom, who had allowed himself to be introduced as someone who had never met before.
tr_translation: Finally, Gatsby, turning to Tom who had been introduced to him as if he were a stranger and was sitting silently, forced himself to say:
es_translation: Obeying an irresistible impulse. Gatsby turned to Tom, who had reacted to the introduction as if he didn't know him.

en: “I believe we’ve met somewhere before, Mr. Buchanan.”
vi: "Anh Buchanan, tôi tin rằng chúng ta đã gặp nhau ở đâu rồi."
tr: “Yanılmıyorsam,” diyebildi, “sizinle daha önce tanışmıştık Bay Buchanan.
es: —Creo que ya nos conocíamos, mister Buchanan.
vi_translation: "Mr. Buchanan, I believe we have met somewhere before."
tr_translation: “If I'm not mistaken,” he managed to say, “we've met before, Mr. Buchanan.”
es_translation: —I believe we already knew each other, Mr. Buchanan.

en: “Oh, yes,” said Tom, gruffly polite, but obviously not remembering. “So we did. I remember very well.”
vi: "Ồ, đúng vậy." Tom trả lời cộc lốc nhưng lịch sự, rõ ràng là anh ta không hề nhớ gì. "Chúng ta quả có gặp nhau, tôi còn nhớ rất rõ."
tr: “Ah, tabi” dedi Tom, nazik lakin huzursuz bir tavırla; anımsamadığı açıktı, “Evet ya, haklısınız, çok iyi hatırlıyorum.
es: —Ah, sí —dijo Tom, brusco y correcto, aunque era obvio que no se acordaba—. Sí, lo recuerdo perfectamente.
vi_translation: "Oh, that's right." Tom replied curtly but politely, clearly not remembering anything. "We did meet, I remember very well."
tr_translation: “Ah, of course,” said Tom, with a polite but uneasy manner; it was clear he did not remember, “Yes, you are right, I remember very well.”
es_translation: —Ah, yes —said Tom, brusque and correct, although it was obvious he didn't remember—. Yes, I remember perfectly.

en: “About two weeks ago.”
vi: "Vào khoảng hai tuần trước."
tr: “İki hafta kadar önceydi.
es: —Hace unas dos semanas.
vi_translation: "About two weeks ago."
tr_translation: “It was about two weeks ago.”
es_translation: —About two weeks ago.

en: “That’s right. You were with Nick here.”
vi: "Ồ đúng như vậy. Gặp anh và Nick."
tr: “İki hafta kadar önceydi. “Tamam, bizim Nick’le beraberdiniz.
es: —Es verdad. Usted estaba con Nick.
vi_translation: "Oh, that's right. Meeting you and Nick."
tr_translation: “It was about two weeks ago.” “Okay, you were with our Nick.”
es_translation: —It's true. You were with Nick.

en: “I know your wife,” continued Gatsby, almost aggressively.
vi: "Tôi quen vợ của anh." Gatsby tiếp tục nói gần như công kích.
tr: “Eşinizi de tanırım” deyiverdi Gatsby bir anda, meydan okurcasına.
es: —Conozco a su mujer —continuó Gatsby, casi con agresividad.
vi_translation: "I know your wife." Gatsby continued speaking almost aggressively.
tr_translation: "I know your wife too," Gatsby blurted out suddenly, defiantly.
es_translation: —I know his wife —continued Gatsby, almost aggressively.

en: “That so?”
vi: "Vậy sao?"
tr: “Sahi mi?
es: —¿Sí?
vi_translation: "Is that so?"
tr_translation: "Really?""
es_translation: —Yes?

en: “You live near here, Nick?”
vi: "Anh sống ở gần đây hả Nick?"
tr: Tom bana dönüp, “Civarda mı oturuyorsun Nick?” diye sordu,
es: —¿Vives cerca, Nick?
vi_translation: "Do you live nearby, Nick?"
tr_translation: Tom turned to me and asked, "Do you live nearby, Nick?"
es_translation: —Do you live nearby, Nick?

en: “Next door.”
vi: "Nhà cạnh bên."
tr: “Hemen bitişikte.
es: —En la casa de al lado.
vi_translation: "The house next door."
tr_translation: "Right next door.""
es_translation: —In the house next door.

en: “That so?”
vi: "Vậy sao?"
tr: “Ya, öyle mi?
es: —¿Sí?
vi_translation: "Really?"
tr_translation: “Oh, really?”
es_translation: —Yes?

en: Mr. Sloane didn’t enter into the conversation, but lounged back haughtily in his chair; the woman said nothing either—until unexpectedly, after two highballs, she became cordial.
vi: Sloane không tham dự vào câu chuyện, nhưng nằm ngửa trên ghế của mình dáng điệu kiêu kỳ. Người phụ nữ kia cũng không nói năng gì cho đến khi ly rượu whiskey sô đa thứ hai thì cô ta đột nhiên lên tiếng thân mật. Cô ta nói:
tr: Küstahça bir koltuğa kurulmuş olan Bay Sloane sohbete katılmıyordu. Kadın da pek bir şey söylemiyordu. Ancak ikinci kadehinden sonra samimileşiverdi.
es: Mister Sloane no participaba en la conversación, sino que se retrepaba en la silla con arrogancia; la mujer tampoco hablaba, hasta que inesperadamente, después de dos whiskys con soda, se volvió cordial.
vi_translation: Sloane did not participate in the conversation, but lay back in his chair with an arrogant demeanor. The other woman also did not say anything until her second glass of whiskey soda, when she suddenly spoke up in a friendly manner. She said:
tr_translation: Mr. Sloane, who had arrogantly settled into a chair, was not participating in the conversation. The woman wasn't saying much either. However, after her second glass, she suddenly became more friendly.
es_translation: Mister Sloane did not participate in the conversation; instead, he leaned back in his chair arrogantly. The woman also did not speak, until unexpectedly, after two whiskies with soda, she became cordial.

en: “We’ll all come over to your next party, Mr. Gatsby,” she suggested. “What do you say?”
vi: "Tất cả chúng tôi sẽ đến tham dự bữa tiệc tới của anh, anh Gatsby. Anh nghĩ sao?"
tr: “Bir sonraki partinize hep birlikte gelelim diyorum Bay Gatsby. Siz ne der­siniz?
es: —Vendremos a su próxima fiesta, mister Gatsby —sugirió—. ¿Qué me dice?
vi_translation: "We will all be attending your next party, Mr. Gatsby. What do you think?"
tr_translation: "I suggest we all come together to your next party, Mr. Gatsby. What do you say?"
es_translation: —We will come to your next party, Mister Gatsby —he suggested—. What do you say?

en: “Certainly; I’d be delighted to have you.”
vi: "Chắc chắn, tôi rất vui nếu mọi người đến tham dự."
tr: “Buyurun elbette, çok memnun olurum.
es: —De acuerdo, será un placer tenerlos aquí.
vi_translation: "Certainly, I would be very happy if everyone came to attend."
tr_translation: "Of course, please go ahead, I would be very pleased."
es_translation: —Alright, it will be a pleasure to have you here.

en: “Be ver’ nice,” said Mr. Sloane, without gratitude. “Well—think ought to be starting home.”
vi: "Quý quá." Sloan nói nhưng không có vẻ gì là cảm kích. "Thôi chúng ta ra về thôi."
tr: “Çok naziksiniz, ne iyi olur,” dedi Bay Sloane, ancak pek de minnettar gö­rünmüyordu, “Eh, artık kalksak ya? “Rica ederim, bu ne acele?” diye ısrar etti Gatsby; kendimi biraz olsun toplamış, artık Tom’u daha iyi tanımak istiyordu, “Neden akşam yemeğine kalmıyorsunuz?
es: —Será muy agradable —dijo mister Sloane sin la menor gratitud—. Bueno, creo que debemos irnos ya a casa.
vi_translation: "Precious." Sloan said but did not seem appreciative. "Let's just go home."
tr_translation: "You are very kind, that would be great," said Mr. Sloane, but he didn't seem very grateful, "Well, shall we get going now?" “You're welcome, what's the rush?” insisted Gatsby; he had somewhat composed himself and now wanted to get to know Tom better, “Why don't you stay for dinner?
es_translation: —It will be very pleasant —said Mr. Sloane without the slightest gratitude—. Well, I think we should go home now.

en: “Please don’t hurry,” Gatsby urged them. He had control of himself now, and he wanted to see more of Tom. “Why don’t you—why don’t you stay for supper? I wouldn’t be surprised if some other people dropped in from New York.”
vi: "Không cần gì phải vội." Gatsby nài. Anh ta đã lấy được tự chủ và muốn được đối diện với Tom lâu hơn. "Hay là - Hay là mọi người ở lại dùng bữa chiều đi. Chắc thế nào cũng có ai đó ghé đến chơi từ New York."
tr: “Rica ederim, bu ne acele?” diye ısrar etti Gatsby; kendimi biraz olsun toplamış, artık Tom’u daha iyi tanımak istiyordu, “Neden akşam yemeğine kalmıyorsunuz? New York’tan başka konuklar da gelecektir muhakkak.
es: —Por favor, no hay prisa —dijo Gatsby con calor. Había recuperado el control de sí mismo y quería seguir hablando con Tom—. ¿Por qué… por qué no se quedan a cenar? No me sorprendería que se dejara caer por aquí alguna gente de Nueva York.
vi_translation: "No need to hurry." Gatsby pleaded. He had regained his composure and wanted to face Tom a bit longer. "Or - Or why don't you all stay for dinner. Surely someone will drop by from New York."
tr_translation: “You're welcome, what's the rush?” insisted Gatsby; he had somewhat composed himself and now wanted to get to know Tom better, “Why don't you stay for dinner? There will surely be other guests coming from New York as well.”
es_translation: —Please, there's no rush —said Gatsby warmly. He had regained control of himself and wanted to keep talking to Tom—. Why… why don't you stay for dinner? I wouldn't be surprised if some people from New York dropped by.

en: “You come to supper with me,” said the lady enthusiastically. “Both of you.”
vi: "Hay là anh đến dùng bữa ở nhà TÔI. Cả hai anh." người phụ nữ mời một cách sốt sắng.
tr: “Siz benimle yemeğe gelseniz ya? Her ikiniz de,” dedi hanımefendi büyük bir içtenlikle, beni de kastederek.
es: —No. Ustedes se vienen a cenar conmigo —dijo la señora con entusiasmo—. Los dos.
vi_translation: "How about you come have a meal at MY house? Both of you." the woman invited eagerly.
tr_translation: “Why don't you come to dinner with me? Both of you,” the lady said sincerely, referring to me as well.
es_translation: —No. You are coming to have dinner with me —said the lady enthusiastically—. Both of you.

en: “Come along,” he said—but to her only.
vi: "Vậy thì đi." Anh ta nói nhưng lời nói chỉ dành cho người phụ nữ.
tr: O esnada Bay Sloane ayağa kalktı, “Artık gide­lim” dedi kadına.
es: —Vamos —dijo, pero sólo a ella.
vi_translation: "Then let's go." He said, but the words were meant only for the woman.
tr_translation: At that moment, Mr. Sloane stood up, “Let's go now,” he said to the woman.
es_translation: —Let's go —he said, but only to her.

en: “I mean it,” she insisted. “I’d love to have you. Lots of room.”
vi: "Tôi thật lòng." Người phụ nữ nài. "Tôi rất mừng được các anh đến nhà. Nhà tôi rộng lắm."
tr: “Gelmenizi çok isterim,” diye ısrar etti kadın, “ciddi söylüyorum, masada çok yerimiz var.
es: —Hablo en serio —insistió la señora—. Me encantaría que nos acompañaran. Hay sitio de sobra.
vi_translation: "I truly mean it." The woman pleaded. "I am very glad you came to my house. My house is very spacious."
tr_translation: “I would really like you to come,” insisted the woman, “I’m serious, we have plenty of room at the table.”
es_translation: —I'm serious —insisted the lady—. I would love for you to join us. There is plenty of room.

en: Gatsby looked at me questioningly. He wanted to go and he didn’t see that Mr. Sloane had determined he shouldn’t.
vi: Gatsby nhìn tôi dò hỏi. Anh ta muốn đi nhưng anh lại không nhận ra rằng anh chàng Sloan như khăng khăng không muốn anh đi.
tr: Gatsby soran bakışlarla bana baktı; davete gitmek istediği belliydi ancak Bay Sloane’nın bundan hiç memnun olmayacağını anlamamıştı.
es: Gatsby me miró, interrogándome. Quería ir y no había entendido que mister Sloane había decidido que no fuera.
vi_translation: Gatsby looked at me inquiringly. He wanted to go, but he didn't realize that Sloan was insistent on not wanting him to go.
tr_translation: Gatsby looked at me with questioning eyes; it was clear that he wanted to go to the invitation, but he hadn't realized that Mr. Sloane would not be pleased about it at all.
es_translation: Gatsby looked at me, questioning me. He wanted to go and had not understood that Mr. Sloane had decided he should not go.

en: “I’m afraid I won’t be able to,” I said.
vi: "Tôi ngại rằng tôi không thể đi được." Tôi trả lời.
tr: “Korkarım ben size katılamayacağım,” dedim.
es: —Me temo que no puedo acompañarles —dije.
vi_translation: "I'm afraid I can't go." I replied.
tr_translation: “I'm afraid I won't be able to join you,” I said.
es_translation: —I'm afraid I can't accompany you —I said.

en: “Well, you come,” she urged, concentrating on Gatsby.
vi: "Nếu vậy thì anh đi." Người phụ nữ nài, chuyên chú vào Gatsby.
tr: “Bari siz gelin” diye Gatsby’e dönerek ısrarını yineledi kadın.
es: —Bueno, pues viene usted —insistió ella, concentrándose en Gatsby.
vi_translation: "If that's the case, then you go." The woman pleaded, focusing intently on Gatsby.
tr_translation: “You should come,” the woman insisted, turning to Gatsby.
es_translation: —Well, then you are coming —she insisted, focusing on Gatsby.

en: Mr. Sloane murmured something close to her ear.
vi: Anh chàng Sloan thì thầm gì đó vào tai người phụ nữ.
tr: Bay Sloane kulağına eğilip bir şeyler homurdandıktan sonra kadın yüksek sesle yanıtladı: “Hemen çıkarsak yetişiriz!
es: Mister Sloane le murmuró algo al oído.
vi_translation: The guy Sloan whispered something into the woman's ear.
tr_translation: After Mr. Sloane leaned in and mumbled something into her ear, the woman responded loudly: "If we leave immediately, we can make it!"
es_translation: Mister Sloane whispered something in his ear.

en: “We won’t be late if we start now,” she insisted aloud.
vi: "Nếu không khởi hành bây giờ chúng ta sẽ trễ mất." Cô ta cương quyết.
tr: Bay Sloane kulağına eğilip bir şeyler homurdandıktan sonra kadın yüksek sesle yanıtladı: “Hemen çıkarsak yetişiriz!
es: —No llegaremos tarde si nos vamos ahora mismo —contestó ella en voz alta.
vi_translation: "If we don't leave now, we will be late." She insisted.
tr_translation: After Mr. Sloane leaned in and mumbled something into her ear, the woman responded loudly: "If we leave immediately, we can make it!"
es_translation: —We won't be late if we leave right now —she replied loudly.

en: “I haven’t got a horse,” said Gatsby. “I used to ride in the army, but I’ve never bought a horse. I’ll have to follow you in my car. Excuse me for just a minute.”
vi: "Tôi chưa mua ngựa." Gatsby nói. "Lúc còn ở quân đội tôi cũng có cưỡi ngựa, nhưng tôi chưa mua một con nào cho mình. Tôi sẽ phải lái xe theo sau các vị. Xin phép cho tao vài phút chuẩn bị."
tr: ‘Benim atım yok” dedi Gatsby, “Ordudayken binmişliğim vardır ancak hiç at almadım. Yine de peşinizden otomobille gelebilirim. Bana bir dakika verin lütfen,” diyerek salondan ayrıldı.
es: —No tengo caballo —dijo Gatsby—. Montaba en el ejército, pero nunca he comprado un caballo. Los seguiré en el coche. Discúlpenme un momento.
vi_translation: "I haven't bought a horse yet." Gatsby said. "When I was in the army, I also rode horses, but I never bought one for myself. I'll have to drive behind you all. Give me a few minutes to get ready."
tr_translation: "I don't have a horse," said Gatsby, "I have ridden while I was in the army, but I never bought a horse. Still, I can follow you by car. Please give me a minute," he said, leaving the room.
es_translation: —I don't have a horse —said Gatsby—. I rode in the army, but I have never bought a horse. I will follow you in the car. Excuse me for a moment.

en: The rest of us walked out on the porch, where Sloane and the lady began an impassioned conversation aside.
vi: Tất cả chúng tôi bước ra ngoài hiên nhà, Sloan và người phụ nữ k éo nhau sang một bên nói chuyện một cách sôi nổi.
tr: Biz de verandaya çıktık; Sloane ila kadın bir kenara çekilip hararetli bir konuşmaya daldılar.
es: Los demás salimos al porche, donde Sloane y la señora se apartaron para iniciar una apasionada conversación.
vi_translation: We all stepped out onto the porch, Sloan and the woman k pulled each other aside and talked animatedly.
tr_translation: We also went out to the veranda; Sloane and the woman withdrew to a corner and engaged in an intense conversation.
es_translation: The rest of us went out to the porch, where Sloane and the lady stepped aside to start an impassioned conversation.

en: “My God, I believe the man’s coming,” said Tom. “Doesn’t he know she doesn’t want him?”
vi: "Trời ơi, tôi tin rằng hắn ta sẽ đi." Tom nói. "Bộ hắn ta không biết cô ta không muốn hắn đi theo à."
tr: O esnada Tom; “Adamın sahiden geldiğine inanamıyorum,” dedi, “kadının istemediğini anlamıyor mu?
es: —Dios mío, creo que ese tipo se viene —dijo Tom—. ¿No se da cuenta de que ella no quiere que venga?
vi_translation: "Oh my God, I believe he will go," Tom said. "Doesn't he know she doesn't want him to follow her?"
tr_translation: At that moment, Tom said, "I can't believe the man actually came. Doesn't he understand that the woman doesn't want him?"
es_translation: —My God, I think that guy is coming —said Tom—. Doesn't he realize that she doesn't want him to come?

en: “She says she does want him.”
vi: "Nhưng cô ấy nói cô ấy muốn anh ta tham dự mà."
tr: “İyi de kadın kendi ağzıyla söyledi istediğini.
es: —Ella dice que quiere que vaya.
vi_translation: "But she said she wanted him to attend."
tr_translation: “But the woman said with her own mouth what she wanted.”
es_translation: —She says she wants me to go.

en: “She has a big dinner party and he won’t know a soul there.” He frowned. “I wonder where in the devil he met Daisy. By God, I may be old-fashioned in my ideas, but women run around too much these days to suit me. They meet all kinds of crazy fish.”
vi: "Cô ta đãi một bữa tiệc rất lớn và anh ta sẽ không biết lấy một mạng nào ở đó." Tom nhăn mặt. "Tôi tự hỏi anh chàng này đã từng quen Daisy ở cái chỗ quái quỷ nào. Đối với thượng đế, tôi có thể là một người hủ lậu, thế nhưng loại phụ nữ giao thiệp nhiều ngày nay không thích hợp với tôi. Họ quen đủ loại hạng người."
tr: “Bu geceki büyük bir ziyafet; konukların hiçbirini tanımaz ki,” ardından kaşlarını çatarak devam etti, “Daisy ile nerede tanışmış ki bu? Geri kafalı diyebilirsin ama bana kalırsa, günümüzde kadınlar ortalıkta fazla dolaşıyor. Sonra sağda solda böyle zıpçıktılarla tanışıyorlar.
es: —Da una gran cena en la que ese Gatsby no va a conocer a nadie —arrugó la frente—. Quisiera saber dónde diablos conoció a Daisy. Por Dios, puede que mis ideas ya no estén de moda, pero, para mi gusto, las mujeres de hoy andan demasiado sueltas. Y tropiezan con toda clase de chiflados.
vi_translation: "She threw a very large party and he wouldn't know a single soul there." Tom frowned. "I wonder where this guy ever met Daisy in the first place." For God's sake, I might be an old-fashioned person, but the type of women who socialize a lot these days don't suit me. They know all kinds of people."
tr_translation: “Tonight is a big feast; he doesn't know any of the guests,” he continued, frowning, “Where did he meet Daisy?” You might call me old-fashioned, but in my opinion, women these days are out and about too much. Then they end up meeting such rascals here and there.”
es_translation: —He gives a big party where that Gatsby won't know anyone —he frowned—. I wonder where the hell he met Daisy. For God's sake, maybe my ideas are out of fashion, but, in my opinion, today's women are too loose. And they run into all kinds of lunatics.

en: Suddenly Mr. Sloane and the lady walked down the steps and mounted their horses.
vi: Đột nhiên Sloan và người phụ nữ bước xuống những bậc thềm và lên ngựa.
tr: Derken kadınla Bay Sloane merdivenleri inip atlarına atladılar.
es: De repente mister Sloane y la señora bajaron la escalera y montaron en sus caballos.
vi_translation: Suddenly, Sloan and the woman stepped down the stairs and mounted their horses.
tr_translation: Then the woman and Mr. Sloane went down the stairs and mounted their horses.
es_translation: Suddenly, Mr. Sloane and the lady came down the stairs and mounted their horses.

en: “Come on,” said Mr. Sloane to Tom, “we’re late. We’ve got to go.” And then to me: “Tell him we couldn’t wait, will you?”
vi: "Đi thôi." Sloan nói với Tom. "Chúng ta trễ rồi. Chúng ta phải đi thôi." Sau đó hắn quay qua tôi. "Anh làm ơn nhắn với anh ta chúng tôi không thể chờ, có được không?"
tr: Sloane “Hadi, acele et!” diye seslendi Tom’a, “Çok geciktik, artık çıkmalıyız.” Sonra bana döndü ve “Kendisine acelemiz olduğunu, bekleyemediğimizi iletin lütfen, olur mu?” dedi.
es: —Vamos —dijo mister Sloane a Tom—, llegamos tarde. Tenemos que irnos —y a mí—. Dígale que no hemos podido esperar, por favor.
vi_translation: "Let's go." Sloan said to Tom. "We are late." "We have to go now." Then he turned to me. "Could you please tell him that we can't wait, okay?"
tr_translation: Sloane called out to Tom, "Come on, hurry up! We're very late, we must leave now." Then he turned to me and said, "Please tell him that we're in a hurry and can't wait, okay?"
es_translation: —Let's go —Mr. Sloane said to Tom—, we are late. We have to leave —and to me—. Tell him that we couldn't wait, please.

en: Tom and I shook hands, the rest of us exchanged a cool nod, and they trotted quickly down the drive, disappearing under the August foliage just as Gatsby, with hat and light overcoat in hand, came out the front door.
vi: Tom và tôi bắt tay chào, hai người còn lại và tôi chỉ gật đầu chào nhau lạnh lẽo. Sau đó bọn họ phóng ngựa đi ra đường, biến mất dưới những tàn cây lá mùa tháng tám, vừa khi Gatsby bước ra tới cửa trên tay cầm nón và áo khoác.
tr: Tom’la el sıkışarak, diğerleriyle ise soğuk bir jestle vedalaştık. Konuklar atlarını araba yolundan aşağıya hızla sürerek, ağaçların arasında henüz gözden kaybolmuştu ki Gatsby elinde şapka ve pardösüsüyle kapıda belirdi.
es: Tom y yo nos estrechamos la mano; con los otros intercambié un frío saludo con la cabeza, y desaparecieron al trote, camino abajo, entre el follaje de agosto, en el momento en que Gatsby salía por la puerta principal con el sombrero y un abrigo ligero en la mano.
vi_translation: Tom and I shook hands in greeting, while the other two and I merely nodded at each other coldly. After that, they rode their horses out onto the road, disappearing under the August foliage, just as Gatsby stepped out the door holding his hat and coat.
tr_translation: We shook hands with Tom and bid farewell to the others with a cold gesture. The guests had just disappeared among the trees, riding their horses swiftly down the driveway, when Gatsby appeared at the door with his hat and overcoat in hand.
es_translation: Tom and I shook hands; with the others, I exchanged a cold nod, and they disappeared at a trot, down the road, among the August foliage, just as Gatsby was coming out the front door with a hat and a light coat in hand.

en: Tom was evidently perturbed at Daisy’s running around alone, for on the following Saturday night he came with her to Gatsby’s party. Perhaps his presence gave the evening its peculiar quality of oppressiveness—it stands out in my memory from Gatsby’s other parties that summer. There were the same people, or at least the same sort of people, the same profusion of champagne, the same many-coloured, many-keyed commotion, but I felt an unpleasantness in the air, a pervading harshness that hadn’t been there before. Or perhaps I had merely grown used to it, grown to accept West Egg as a world complete in itself, with its own standards and its own great figures, second to nothing because it had no consciousness of being so, and now I was looking at it again, through Daisy’s eyes. It is invariably saddening to look through new eyes at things upon which you have expended your own powers of adjustment.
vi: Tom rõ ràng bắt đầu lo sợ chuyện Daisy đi ra ngoài một mình giao thiệp thường xuyên, bởi vì tối thứ Bẩy sau đó anh ta đi cùng với vợ đến dự tiệc ở nhà Gatsby. Có lẽ sự hiện diện của anh ta đã tạo cho buổi tối đó một không khí ngột ngạt sao đó khiến cho ký ức của tôi đặc biết nhớ về nó hơn tất cả những bữa tiệc khác mùa hè năm đó. Cũng vẫn là những khách khứa thường tới, hay ít ra cũng cùng một loại người như vậy. Vẫn ê hề rượu champagne, vẫn những màu sắc đó, vẫn những náo động rối loạn lệ thường, thế nhưng tôi cảm thấy có sự khó chịu ở trong không gian, một sự gay gắt lan tràn chưa từng có trước kia. Hay có lẽ bởi vì tôi đã trở nên quen thuộc với nó, đã trở nên chấp nhận West Egg như là một thế giới trọn vẹn với những phép tắc riêng của nó, với những nhân vật tên tuổi riêng của nó không thua kém bất cứ nơi nào vì chính nó không cảm thấy nó thua kém. Giờ đây tôi lại nhận thấy nó như vậy qua đôi mắt của Daisy. Không có gì buồn bằng khi ta nhìn qua cặp mắt mới những gì mà mình đã hết sức sử dụng sức mạnh của mình để hoàn chỉnh nó.
tr: Tom, Daisy’nin tek başına gezip tozmasından işkillenmiş olacaktı ki, Gatsby’nin cumartesi gecesi verdiği partiye birlikte geldiler, O gece ortamdaki fark edi­len o tuhaf gerginliğin sebebi muhtemelen Tom’du. Gatsby’nin o yaz vermiş olduğu onca partiden, bu sözünü ettiğim gerginlikten olsa gerek, ak­lımda bir tek bu kalmıştır. Her zamanki insanlar gelmişti – ya da daha doğrusu gelenler bilindik tipteki kişilerdi – yine şampanyamız bol, yine partiye renkli ve gürültülü bir kargaşa hakimdi; ancak ortamda daha öncekilerde hissetmediğim tatsız bir hava, bir türlü serbest kalmayan bir gerilim hakimdi. Belki de kendine has ölçütleri ve tipleriyle, kendi dışındakileri önemsemediklerinden dış dünyaya rahatlıkla meydan okuyabilen West Egg’i, kendi içinde bir dünya olarak görmeye başlayarak bu partilere alışmıştım. O gece partideki herkese ve her şeye Daisy’nin gözünden bakıyordum. Kendi değer yargılarımıza aykırı bulduğumuz şeyleri, yeni bir bakış açısından görmek insanı her zaman üzüyordu.
es: A Tom lo perturbaba evidentemente que Daisy saliera sola, y el sábado siguiente, por la noche, la acompañó a la fiesta de Gatsby. Puede que su presencia le diera una especial sensación de opresión a la velada: aquella fiesta la recuerdo entre todas las que Gatsby dio aquel verano. Había la misma gente, o por lo menos el mismo tipo de gente, la misma abundancia de champagne, el mismo bullicio de voces y colores, pero yo percibía algo desagradable en el aire, una aspereza en todo que antes no existía. O puede que simplemente me hubiera acostumbrado a aceptar West Egg como un mundo completo en sí mismo, con sus propias normas y sus propias grandes figuras, no inferior a nada porque no tenía conciencia de serlo, y ahora lo estaba viendo de nuevo, a través de los ojos de Daisy. Es inevitablemente triste mirar con nuevos ojos cosas a las que ya hemos aplicado nuestra propia capacidad de enfoque.
vi_translation: Tom clearly began to fear Daisy going out alone frequently, because the following Saturday night he went with his wife to attend a party at Gatsby's house. Perhaps his presence gave that evening a stifling atmosphere that made my memory of it stand out more than all the other parties that summer. It was still the usual guests, or at least the same type of people. There was still an abundance of champagne, the same colors, the usual chaotic noise, yet I felt an unease in the air, a sharpness spreading that had never been there before. Or perhaps because I had become familiar with it, had come to accept West Egg as a complete world with its own rules, with its own notable characters, not inferior to anywhere else because it did not feel inferior. Now I saw it again through Daisy's eyes. There is nothing sadder than seeing through new eyes what you have used all your strength to perfect.
tr_translation: Tom must have been suspicious of Daisy wandering around alone, as they came together to Gatsby's party on Saturday night. The reason for the strange tension noticeable that night was probably Tom. Out of all the parties Gatsby threw that summer, this is the only one that remains in my mind, likely due to that tension I mentioned. The usual people had come – or rather, the people who came were of the usual type – once again we had plenty of champagne, and once again the party was dominated by a colorful and noisy chaos; however, there was an unpleasant atmosphere, a tension that never quite released, which I hadn't felt at the previous ones. Perhaps I had grown accustomed to these parties by starting to see West Egg, with its unique standards and types, as a world of its own that could easily defy the outside world because it didn't care about anything beyond itself. That night, I was looking at everyone and everything at the party through Daisy's eyes. Seeing things that we find contrary to our own values from a new perspective always saddened me.
es_translation: It evidently disturbed Tom that Daisy went out alone, and the following Saturday night, he accompanied her to Gatsby's party. His presence might have given the evening a special sense of oppression: I remember that party among all the ones Gatsby threw that summer. There were the same people, or at least the same type of people, the same abundance of champagne, the same bustle of voices and colors, but I sensed something unpleasant in the air, a harshness in everything that hadn't existed before. Or maybe I had simply become accustomed to accepting West Egg as a complete world in itself, with its own rules and its own great figures, not inferior to anything because it had no consciousness of being so, and now I was seeing it again, through Daisy's eyes. It is inevitably sad to look at things with new eyes to which we have already applied our own capacity for focus.

en: They arrived at twilight, and, as we strolled out among the sparkling hundreds, Daisy’s voice was playing murmurous tricks in her throat.
vi: Vợ chồng họ đến vào lúc trời chạng vạng, và trong lúc chúng tôi đang thả bộ giữa hàng trăm khách khứa đang sôi sục, giọng nói của Daisy nổi lên róch rách thì thầm từ trong cuống họng.
tr: Daisy ve Tom geldiğinde güneş batmak üzereydi. O renkli kalabalığın arasında hep birlikte dolaşırken, Daisy harika sesiyle cıvıldayarak bir şeyler anlatıyordu.
es: Llegaron al anochecer, y, mientras paseábamos entre cientos de seres resplandecientes, la voz susurrante de Daisy hacía travesuras en su garganta.
vi_translation: They arrived at twilight, and while we were strolling among hundreds of excited guests, Daisy's voice emerged, gurgling in a whisper from her throat.
tr_translation: When Daisy and Tom arrived, the sun was about to set. As they wandered together among the colorful crowd, Daisy was chirping something with her wonderful voice.
es_translation: They arrived at dusk, and, as we walked among hundreds of glowing beings, Daisy's whispering voice played tricks in her throat.

en: “These things excite me so,” she whispered. “If you want to kiss me any time during the evening, Nick, just let me know and I’ll be glad to arrange it for you. Just mention my name. Or present a green card. I’m giving out green—”
vi: "Những thứ ở đây làm em háo hức quá". Daisy thì thầm. "Nếu như anh muốn hôn em bất cứ lúc nào tối hôm nay, Nick, cứ việc cho em hay và em sẽ sắp xếp cho anh. Chỉ cần gọi tên em, hay là đưa ra tấm thẻ màu xanh. Bây giờ em phát cho anh tấm thẻ xanh...."
tr: “Böylesi yerler beni öylesine heyecanlandırıyor ki” diye fısıldadı, “gecenin bir vakti beni öpmek istersen söylemekten çekinme Nick, bir çaresini buluruz. İsmimi söylemen kafi veya şu yeşil kartı göster…
es: —Estas cosas me emocionan tanto… —murmuró—. Si quieres besarme durante la fiesta, Nick, dímelo y lo solucionaré encantada. Basta con que pronuncies mi nombre. O con que presentes una tarjeta verde. Voy a repartir tarje…
vi_translation: "The things here make me so excited." Daisy whispered. "If you want to kiss me at any time tonight, Nick, just let me know and I'll arrange it for you. Just call my name, or show the green card. Now I'm giving you the green card...."
tr_translation: “Places like this excite me so much,” she whispered, “if you want to kiss me in the middle of the night, don't hesitate to tell me, Nick, we'll find a way. Just saying my name is enough or showing this green card...”
es_translation: —These things excite me so much… —she murmured—. If you want to kiss me during the party, Nick, just tell me and I'll be happy to make it happen. All you have to do is say my name. Or present a green card. I'm going to hand out cards…

en: “Look around,” suggested Gatsby.
vi: "Hãy nhìn quanh đây." Gatsby đề nghị.
tr: “Etrafına baksana şöyle bir,” dedi Gatsby Tom’a.
es: —Mirad a vuestro alrededor —sugirió Gatsby.
vi_translation: "Look around here." Gatsby suggested.
tr_translation: “Just take a look around,” Gatsby said to Tom.
es_translation: —Look around you —suggested Gatsby.

en: “I’m looking around. I’m having a marvellous—”
vi: "Em đang nhìn đây. Em thấy quá tuyệt diệu...."
tr: “Etrafına baksana şöyle bir,” dedi Gatsby Tom’a. “Bakıyorum zaten, çok da eğleniyorum.
es: —Estoy mirando. Lo estoy pasando maravillosa…
vi_translation: "I'm looking." "I see, it's wonderful...."
tr_translation: “Just take a look around,” Gatsby said to Tom. “I am already watching, and I am having a lot of fun.”
es_translation: —I am looking. I am having a wonderful time…

en: “You must see the faces of many people you’ve heard about.”
vi: "Các vị sẽ thấy rất nhiều khuôn mặt của những người tên tuổi đã từng nghe nhắc tới."
tr: “Tanıdığın birçok ünlü göreceksin” “
es: —Veréis en persona a mucha gente de la que habéis oído hablar.
vi_translation: "You will see many faces of famous people you have heard of."
tr_translation: "You will see many celebrities you know"
es_translation: —You will see in person many people you have heard about.

en: “We don’t go around very much,” he said; “in fact, I was just thinking I don’t know a soul here.”
vi: "Chúng tôi không đi lại nhiều lắm." Tom nói. "Thật ra, tôi chẳng hề quen một ai ở đây."
tr: Kendini beğenmiş bakışlarını çevresinde şöyle bir gezdirdikten sonra, “Geceleri çok çıkmayız ki” dedi, “itiraf etmeliyim ki, sen sorduğunda ben de bir kişiyi bile tanımadığımı düşünüyordum.
es: —No salimos mucho —dijo—; de hecho estaba pensando que no conozco a nadie.
vi_translation: "In fact, I don't know anyone here."
tr_translation: After casting his conceited glances around, he said, "We don't go out much at night," and added, "I must admit, when you asked, I also thought I didn't know a single person.""
es_translation: —We don't go out much —he said—; in fact, I was thinking that I don't know anyone.

en: “Perhaps you know that lady.” Gatsby indicated a gorgeous, scarcely human orchid of a woman who sat in state under a white-plum tree. Tom and Daisy stared, with that peculiarly unreal feeling that accompanies the recognition of a hitherto ghostly celebrity of the movies.
vi: "Có lẽ anh quen cô đó." Gatsby chỉ một phụ nữ lộng lẫy xinh đẹp như hoa lan hơn là người, đang ngồi bất động dưới tàng cây mận trắng. Tom và Dasy nhìn chằm chằm với một cảm giác khác biệt có được khi ta nhận ra một nhân vật tên tuổi ở trong phim ảnh mà ta chưa được gặp mặt bao giờ.
tr: “Şu hanımı tanırsın muhakkak,” dedi Gatsby, çiçek açmış bir erik ağacının altında, insandan çok bir orkideyi anımsatarak ihtişamla oturan, son derece alımlı bir kadını göstermişti. Ancak filmlerde görebildikleri bir yıldızı, karşılarında kanlı canlı görmek, herkes gibi Tom ile Daisy’i de heyecanlandırmıştı.
es: —Quizá conozca a esa señora —Gatsby señalaba a una magnífica mujer orquídea, apenas humana, sentada con dignidad regia bajo un ciruelo blanco. Tom y Daisy la miraron sorprendidos, con esa peculiar sensación de irrealidad que nos acompaña cuando reconocemos a una celebridad del cine, fantasmal hasta ese momento.
vi_translation: "Maybe you know her." Gatsby pointed to a woman, more dazzling and beautiful like an orchid than a person, sitting motionless under the white plum tree. Tom and Daisy stared with a different feeling that one gets when recognizing a famous character from the movies whom they have never met before.
tr_translation: “You surely know this lady,” said Gatsby, pointing to an extremely attractive woman sitting majestically under a blossoming plum tree, resembling an orchid more than a human. Seeing a star they could only see in movies, alive and in person, had excited Tom and Daisy just like everyone else.
es_translation: —Perhaps I know that lady —Gatsby pointed to a magnificent orchid-like woman, barely human, sitting with regal dignity under a white plum tree. Tom and Daisy looked at her surprised, with that peculiar feeling of unreality that accompanies us when we recognize a movie celebrity, ghostly until that moment.

en: “She’s lovely,” said Daisy.
vi: "Cô ta xinh đẹp quá." Daisy nói.
tr: “Çok güzel bir kadın,” dedi Daisy
es: —Es preciosa —dijo Daisy.
vi_translation: "She is so beautiful." Daisy said.
tr_translation: “A very beautiful woman,” said Daisy
es_translation: —It's beautiful —said Daisy.

en: “The man bending over her is her director.”
vi: "Người cúi mình bên cạnh cô ta là đạo diễn,"
tr: “Yanında, ona doğru eğilmiş olan adam da yönetmenidir,”
es: —El hombre que ahora se inclina sobre ella es su director.
vi_translation: "The person bending down next to her is the director,"
tr_translation: “The man next to her, leaning towards her, is also the director,”
es_translation: —The man who is now leaning over her is her director.

en: He took them ceremoniously from group to group:
vi: Gatsby kiểu cách đưa họ đi chào giới thiệu tới từng nhóm người một.
tr: Daha sonra bir merasim havasında, onları o grup senin bu grup benim, dolaştırmaya başladı.
es: Gatsby los llevó ceremoniosamente de grupo en grupo:
vi_translation: Gatsby stylishly introduced them to each group one by one.
tr_translation: Later, in a ceremonial manner, he began to parade them around, from one group to another.
es_translation: Gatsby ceremoniously led them from group to group:

en: “Mrs. Buchanan… and Mr. Buchanan—” After an instant’s hesitation he added: “the polo player.”
vi: "Bà Buchanan... Ông Buchanan..."Sau một phút ngập ngừng anh ta nói thêm. "Nhà chơi môn polo."
tr: “Bayan Buchanan, bu Bay Buchanan” dedikten sonra biraz duraksadı, “Bay Buchanan meşhur bir polo oyuncusudur.
es: —Mistress Buchanan… y mister Buchanan —después de vacilar unos segundos añadió—. El jugador de polo.
vi_translation: "Mrs. Buchanan... Mr. Buchanan..."After a moment of hesitation, he added. "The house plays polo."
tr_translation: “This is Mr. Buchanan, Mr. Buchanan,” he paused for a moment, “Mr. Buchanan is a famous polo player.”
es_translation: —Mistress Buchanan… and Mister Buchanan —after hesitating for a few seconds, he added—. The polo player.

en: “Oh no,” objected Tom quickly, “not me.”
vi: "Ô, không đâu, không phải tôi," Tom phản đối lại.
tr: Tom itiraz ederek araya girdi “Şaka yapıyor, değilim.”.
es: —No —protestó Tom—, yo no.
vi_translation: "Oh, no, it's not me," Tom protested.
tr_translation: Tom interrupted by objecting, "He's joking, I'm not."
es_translation: —No —protested Tom—, not me.

en: But evidently the sound of it pleased Gatsby for Tom remained “the polo player” for the rest of the evening.
vi: Thế nhưng rõ ràng lời giới thiệu như vậy khiến Gatsby hài long, bởi vì Tom cứ tiếp tục được giới thiệu là thủ môn polo cho đến hết buổi tối.
tr: Gatsby bu takdim biçiminden hoşlanmış olmalıydı ki, o gece Tom herkese, ‘meşhur polo oyuncusu’ olarak tanıştırılmıştı.
es: Pero era evidente que el sonido de aquellas palabras le había gustado a Gatsby, y Tom siguió siendo «el jugador de polo» toda la noche.
vi_translation: However, it was clear that such an introduction pleased Gatsby, because Tom continued to be introduced as the polo player for the rest of the evening.
tr_translation: Gatsby must have liked this manner of introduction, for that night Tom was introduced to everyone as the 'famous polo player.'
es_translation: But it was evident that the sound of those words had pleased Gatsby, and Tom remained "the polo player" all night.

en: “I’ve never met so many celebrities,” Daisy exclaimed. “I liked that man—what was his name?—with the sort of blue nose.”
vi: "Em chưa bao giờ được gặp nhiều người danh tiếng đến như vậy." Daisy tuyên bố. "Em thích cái ông đó, tên ông ta là gì nhỉ? Cái ông có cái mũi giống như màu xanh."
tr: “Bu kadar çok ünlüyü hiç bir arada görmemiştim’ diye bağırdı Daisy heyecanla, “Şuradaki adamı pek beğendim - adı neydi ki? Hani şu mavimsi burunlu...
es: —Nunca había visto a tantas celebridades —exclamó Daisy—. Era simpático ese hombre… ¿Cómo se llama? El de la nariz como azul.
vi_translation: "I have never met so many famous people before." Daisy declared. "I like that man, what is his name again? The man with the nose that looks like it's blue."
tr_translation: "I have never seen so many celebrities together," Daisy shouted excitedly, "I really liked that man over there - what was his name? You know, the one with the bluish nose..."
es_translation: —I had never seen so many celebrities —exclaimed Daisy—. That man was nice… What’s his name? The one with the nose like blue.

en: Gatsby identified him, adding that he was a small producer.
vi: Gatsby giới thiệu tên người đàn ông, nói thêm ông ta là một nhà sản xuất nhỏ.
tr: Gatsby adamın kimliğini açıkladıktan sonra, küçük çap­ta bir yapımcı olduğunu da ekledi.
es: Gatsby le dijo quién era y añadió que se trataba de un pequeño productor.
vi_translation: Gatsby introduced the man's name, adding that he was a small producer.
tr_translation: After Gatsby revealed the man's identity, he also added that he was a small-scale producer.
es_translation: Gatsby told him who he was and added that he was a small producer.

en: “Well, I liked him anyhow.”
vi: "Em vẫn thích ông ta."
tr: “Her neyse, adamı beğendim işte.
es: —Bueno, pues me cae simpático de todas formas.
vi_translation: "I still like him."
tr_translation: “Anyway, I liked the man.”
es_translation: —Well, I like him anyway.

en: “I’d a little rather not be the polo player,” said Tom pleasantly, “I’d rather look at all these famous people in—in oblivion.”
vi: "Tôi không muốn bị làm thủ môn polo nữa. Tôi thà ngồi nhìn hết những người danh tiếng để cho mình được chìm vào trong quên lãng." Tom khôi hài.
tr: Tom gülerek araya girdi, “Ben de meşhur bir polo oyuncusu olmayı artık bıraksam iyi olacak,” dedi. “Tüm bu ünlülerle karşı daha kayıtsız olmayı tercih ederim.
es: —Casi preferiría no ser el jugador de polo —dijo Tom, contento—. Me gustaría ver a toda esa gente famosa… de incógnito.
vi_translation: "I don't want to be a polo goalie anymore. I'd rather sit and watch all the famous people and let myself fade into oblivion." Tom joked.
tr_translation: Tom interrupted with a laugh, "I guess I should give up on becoming a famous polo player," he said. "I would prefer to be more indifferent towards all these celebrities."
es_translation: —I would almost prefer not to be the polo player —said Tom, content—. I would like to see all those famous people… incognito.

en: Daisy and Gatsby danced. I remember being surprised by his graceful, conservative foxtrot—I had never seen him dance before. Then they sauntered over to my house and sat on the steps for half an hour, while at her request I remained watchfully in the garden. “In case there’s a fire or a flood,” she explained, “or any act of God.”
vi: Daisy và Gatsby bước ra khiêu vũ. Tôi nhớ rằng tôi đã ngạc nhiên vì cách nhảy cổ điển thanh nhã của anh trong điệu fox-trot. Trước đó tôi chưa từng thấy anh khiêu vũ. Sau đó hai người họ đi thơ thẩn sang nhà tôi và ngồi ở bậc cửa khoảng nửa tiếng trong khi tôi được Daisy giao cho nhiệm vụ canh chừng trong vườn "trong trường hợp có hỏa hoạn, nước lụt, hay thiên tai" Daisy giải thích.
tr: Daisy ile Gatsby dans ettiler. Gatsby’nin Fokstrot esnasında yaptığı o zarif, ancak gösterişsiz figürler beni hayrete düşürmüştü; daha önce onu hiç dans ederken görmemiştim. Derken bahçeden süzülerek benim evimin bahçesine geçtiler ve kapının önündeki merdivenlerde ya­rım saat kadar oturdular. Ben de Daisy’nin ricası üzerine bahçede gözcülük yaptım; “Ne bileyim işte, sel gelir, yangın çıkar…” diye izah etmişti Daisy ricasının gerekçesini “Dünyanın bin bir türlü hali var, öyle değil mi?
es: Daisy y Gatsby bailaron. Recuerdo que me sorprendió la manera graciosa, conservadora, con que Gatsby bailaba el fox-trot: nunca lo había visto bailar. Y luego fueron dando un paseo hasta mi casa y pasaron media hora sentados en los escalones, mientras que, por deseo de Daisy, yo vigilaba en el jardín. «Por si hay un incendio o una inundación», me explicó, «o en caso de fuerza mayor».
vi_translation: Daisy and Gatsby stepped out to dance. I remember being surprised by his elegant classical style in the fox-trot. Before that, I had never seen him dance. Afterwards, the two of them wandered over to my house and sat on the steps for about half an hour while I was assigned by Daisy to keep watch in the garden "in case of fire, flood, or disaster," Daisy explained.
tr_translation: Daisy and Gatsby danced. Gatsby's elegant yet unpretentious moves during the Foxtrot had astonished me; I had never seen him dance before. Then they slipped through the garden into the garden of my house and sat on the steps in front of the door for about half an hour. At Daisy's request, I kept watch in the garden; she had explained the reason for her request by saying, "You never know, a flood might come, a fire might break out... The world is full of all sorts of possibilities, isn't it?"
es_translation: Daisy and Gatsby danced. I remember being surprised by the graceful, conservative way Gatsby danced the fox-trot: I had never seen him dance before. And then they took a walk to my house and spent half an hour sitting on the steps, while, at Daisy's request, I kept watch in the garden. «In case of fire or flood,» she explained, «or in case of force majeure».

en: Tom appeared from his oblivion as we were sitting down to supper together. “Do you mind if I eat with some people over here?” he said. “A fellow’s getting off some funny stuff.”
vi: Tom xuất hiện từ trong 'quên lãng' khi chúng tôi đang ngồi ăn."Em có phiền gì không nếu anh sang ăn với mấy người bên kia? Cái anh chàng đó nói chuyện buồn cười lắm" Tom hỏi.
tr: Tom’un kayıtsızlı­ğı geçmiş gibiydi, diğer konuklarla yemeğe otururken “Ben şuradaki grupla yesem gücenmezsiniz değil mi?” diye sordu, “İçlerinde biri var, adamda ne komik öyküler var bir duysanız!
es: Tom salió de su incógnito cuando los tres nos sentábamos a cenar. —¿Os importa que cene con aquella gente de allí? —dijo—. Un tipo está contando cosas muy divertidas.
vi_translation: Tom appeared from 'oblivion' while we were sitting and eating. "Do you mind if I go over and eat with those people over there?" "That guy over there is really funny," Tom asked. "You just go."
tr_translation: Tom's indifference seemed to have passed, as he sat down to eat with the other guests and asked, "You don't mind if I eat with that group over there, do you? There's someone among them, you should hear the funny stories he has!"
es_translation: Tom came out of his disguise when the three of us sat down to dinner. —Do you mind if I have dinner with those people over there? —he said—. A guy is telling very funny stories.

en: “Go ahead,” answered Daisy genially, “and if you want to take down any addresses here’s my little gold pencil.”… She looked around after a moment and told me the girl was “common but pretty,” and I knew that except for the half-hour she’d been alone with Gatsby she wasn’t having a good time.
vi: "Anh cứ đi đi." Daisy ân cần trả lời. "Nếu như anh cần viết lại địa chỉ của ai thì lấy chiếc viết chì bằng vàng này của em mà dùng." Daisy nhìn chung quang một lát và nói với tôi rằng cô gái ở kia "không có gì đặc sắc nhưng xinh đẹp." Tôi biết chắc rằng ngoại trừ nửa giờ đồng hồ được ở bên cạnh Gatsby riêng rẽ, Daisy hoàn toàn không thấy gì vui vẻ gì mấy.
tr: Daisy, “Tabi git sen,” dedi güler yüzle, “birinin adresini alacak olursun, dur sana küçük altın dolma kalemimi de ve­reyim. Kocası uzaklaşınca bana dönerek “kız biraz bayağı olsa da güzel” deyiverdi. Gatsby ile baş başa geçirdiği o yarım saatin dışında pek eğlenmediğini anlamıştım.
es: —Adelante, ve —respondió Daisy, feliz—, y si quieres apuntar alguna dirección, aquí tienes mi lápiz de oro. Un momento después se volvió a mirar y me dijo que la chica era «vulgar pero bonita», y me di cuenta de que, aparte de la media hora a solas con Gatsby, no lo estaba pasando bien.
vi_translation: Daisy replied kindly. "If you need to write down someone's address, use this gold pencil of mine." Daisy looked around for a moment and told me that the girl over there "isn't anything special but is pretty." I was certain that except for the half hour she spent alone with Gatsby, Daisy didn't find much joy in anything.
tr_translation: Daisy said with a smile, "Of course, go ahead, you might need to take someone's address, let me give you my small gold fountain pen too."" When her husband walked away, she turned to me and said, "The girl is a bit vulgar, but she's beautiful." I realized that, apart from the half hour she spent alone with Gatsby, she didn't have much fun.
es_translation: —Go ahead, go —replied Daisy, happily—, and if you want to write down any address, here is my gold pencil. A moment later, he turned to look at me and said that the girl was "vulgar but pretty," and I realized that, apart from the half hour alone with Gatsby, he was not having a good time.

en: We were at a particularly tipsy table. That was my fault—Gatsby had been called to the phone, and I’d enjoyed these same people only two weeks before. But what had amused me then turned septic on the air now.
vi: Chúng tôi ngồi ở chiếc bàn mà ai cũng chuếnh choáng say cả rồi. Đó cũng là do lỗi của tôi. Gatsby đang bận nói chuyện điện thoại, còn tôi thì thích nói chuyện với những người mà tôi đã gặp qua rồi hai tuần trước đó. Thế nhưng cái mà tôi tưởng sẽ làm cho tôi được vui vẻ hóa ra lại làm ô nhiễm không khí.
tr: Bizim masadaki herkes çakırkeyifti, bunun sorumlusu da bendim zira o masaya gitmek benim önerimdi. Gatsby bir ara telefona çağrıldı, bense daha iki hafta önce beraber eğlendiğim bu kişilere bakıp; o zaman hoşuma giden şeylerin şimdi nasıl da canımı sıktığını düşünüyordum.
es: Compartíamos mesa con un grupo especialmente borracho. La culpa era mía. A Gatsby lo habían llamado por teléfono, y yo lo había pasado bien con aquella gente hacía sólo dos semanas. Pero lo que entonces me había divertido, ahora se envenenaba en el aire.
vi_translation: We were sitting at a table where everyone was already quite tipsy. That was also my fault. Gatsby was busy talking on the phone, while I preferred to chat with people I had met two weeks before. However, what I thought would make me happy ended up polluting the atmosphere.
tr_translation: Everyone at our table was tipsy, and I was responsible for it because it was my suggestion to go to that table. Gatsby was called to the phone at one point, and I was looking at these people I had fun with just two weeks ago, thinking about how the things I liked then were now bothering me.
es_translation: We shared a table with an especially drunk group. It was my fault. Gatsby had been called on the phone, and I had had a good time with those people just two weeks ago. But what had amused me then was now poisoned in the air.

en: “How do you feel, Miss Baedeker?”
vi: "Cô có khỏe không, cô Baedeker?"
tr: “Sağlığınız kötü değil ya Bayan Baedeker?
es: —¿Cómo está, miss Baedeker?
vi_translation: "How are you, Ms. Baedeker?"
tr_translation: “Your health isn't bad, is it, Mrs. Baedeker?”
es_translation: —How are you, Miss Baedeker?

en: The girl addressed was trying, unsuccessfully, to slump against my shoulder. At this inquiry she sat up and opened her eyes.
vi: Người thiếu nữ tôi chào hỏi đang cố dựa gục lên vai tôi, nhưng không thành công. Nghe tôi chào hỏi cô ta ngồi gượng dậy, mở to mắt.
tr: Bu sorunun muhatabı olan kız, başını epeydir omzuma yaslanmaya çalışıyordu. İsmini duyunca başını kaldırıp gözlerini açmıştı, “Ne?
es: La chica a la que le hablaban intentaba sin éxito recostarse en mi hombro. Al oír la pregunta, se puso derecha y abrió los ojos.
vi_translation: The young woman I greeted was trying to lean on my shoulder, but she couldn't. Hearing my greeting, she sat up, opening her eyes wide.
tr_translation: The girl who was the subject of this question had been trying to rest her head on my shoulder for quite some time. When she heard her name, she lifted her head and opened her eyes, "What?"
es_translation: The girl they were talking to was unsuccessfully trying to lean on my shoulder. Upon hearing the question, she straightened up and opened her eyes.

en: A massive and lethargic woman, who had been urging Daisy to play golf with her at the local club tomorrow, spoke in Miss Baedeker’s defence:
vi: Một bà to lớn đồ sộ và lờ đờ, đã từng nài Daisy đi chơi golf với bà ta vào ngày mai ở một câu lạc bộ, lên tiếng bào chữa cho cô Baedeker.
tr: Daisy’e sonraki gün şehir kulübünde golf oynamaları üzerine ısrar eden, iri yapılı hımbıl bir kadın Bayan Baedeker adına yanıtladı, “Meraklanmayın, birazdan kendine gelir.
es: Una mujer imponente y letárgica, que le había estado pidiendo a Daisy que jugara al golf con ella al día siguiente en el club local, asumió la defensa de miss Baedeker.
vi_translation: A large and sluggish woman, who had once urged Daisy to play golf with her at a club the next day, spoke up in defense of Miss Baedeker.
tr_translation: She answered on behalf of Mrs. Baedeker, a large, sluggish woman who insisted on playing golf at the city club the next day, "Don't worry, she'll come around soon.
