es_translation: A commanding and lethargic woman, who had been asking Daisy to play golf with her the next day at the local club, took up the defense of Miss Baedeker.

en: “Oh, she’s all right now. When she’s had five or six cocktails she always starts screaming like that. I tell her she ought to leave it alone.”
vi: "Ô, cô ấy không sao đâu. Khi cô ta uống năm hay sáu ly cocktails vào thì cô sẽ luôn la hét như thế. Tôi đã bảo cô ta từ nay đừng đụng vào rượu nữa."
tr: Ne zaman beş altı kokteyl devirse, böyle oluyor. Oysa kendisine içkiyi bırakmasını kaç defa tembihledim.
es: —Ya está perfectamente. En cuanto se toma cinco o seis cócteles se pone siempre a gritar de esa forma. Le he dicho que debería dejarlo.
vi_translation: "Oh, she's fine. When she drinks five or six cocktails, she always screams like that. I've told her not to touch alcohol anymore."
tr_translation: Whenever she downs five or six cocktails, this happens. Yet, I've told her countless times to quit drinking."
es_translation: —He's perfectly fine now. As soon as he has five or six cocktails, he always starts shouting like that. I've told him he should stop.

en: “I do leave it alone,” affirmed the accused hollowly.
vi: "Tôi đâu có đụng vào đâu." Người vừa được bào chữa quả quyết xác nhận bằng giọng lè nhè.
tr: “Ben artık içmiyorum ki,” diye kendisini savunacak oldu kız.
es: —Lo he dejado —afirmó la acusada con voz cavernosa.
vi_translation: "I didn't touch anything." The recently defended person asserted with a slurred voice.
tr_translation: "But I don't drink anymore," the girl defended herself.
es_translation: —I have left him —affirmed the accused with a cavernous voice.

en: “We heard you yelling, so I said to Doc Civet here: ‘There’s somebody that needs your help, Doc.’ ”
vi: "Tôi nghe cô la lối, cho nên tôi nói với bác sĩ Civet ở đây. "Có người cần anh giúp, bác sĩ."
tr: “Tabi canım, feryatlarını duyunca durumu Doktor Civet’e bile bildirdim,”
es: —La hemos oído gritar, así que le dije al doctor Civet, aquí presente: «Hay alguien que necesita su ayuda, doctor».
vi_translation: "I heard you shouting, so I spoke to Dr. Civet here. "Someone needs your help, doctor."
tr_translation: "Of course, my dear, when I heard your cries, I even reported the situation to Doctor Civet,"
es_translation: —We heard her scream, so I said to Dr. Civet, who is present here: "There is someone who needs your help, doctor."

en: “She’s much obliged, I’m sure,” said another friend, without gratitude, “but you got her dress all wet when you stuck her head in the pool.”
vi: "Tôi chắc rằng cô ấy cảm kích lắm." Một người bạn khác nói, nhưng không có vẻ gì là mang ơn cả. "Thế nhưng anh ta đã làm cho áo của cô ấy ướt hết khi cô dìm đầu cô ấy xuống hồ nước."
tr: “Size müteşekkir olduğundan eminim ancak,” diye araya girdi başka biri, “yine de keşke başını havuza daldırmasaydınız, kızcağızın canım elbisesi sırılsıklam olmuş.
es: —Y ella le está muy agradecida, estoy segura —dijo otra de las amigas, sin la menor gratitud—, pero usted le ha mojado todo el vestido cuando le ha metido la cabeza en el estanque.
vi_translation: "I'm sure she was very appreciative." Another friend said, but there was no sign of gratitude. "However, he got her clothes all wet when he dunked her head into the lake."
tr_translation: “I am sure she is grateful to you, but,” another person interrupted, “I still wish you hadn't dipped her head into the pool, the poor girl's lovely dress is soaking wet.”
es_translation: —And she is very grateful to you, I am sure —said another of the friends, without the slightest gratitude—, but you have soaked her entire dress when you dunked her head in the pond.

en: “Anything I hate is to get my head stuck in a pool,” mumbled Miss Baedeker. “They almost drowned me once over in New Jersey.”
vi: "Tôi ghét nhất là bị dìm đầu xuống hồ bơi. Có lần người ta xém nhận chết tôi ở New Jersey."
tr: “Gerçekten nefret ettiğim bir şey varsa, o da kafamın havuza batırılmasıdır!” diye ho­murdandı Bayan Baedeker, “Bir defasında New Jersey’de beni az daha boğuyorlardı.
es: —Si hay algo que no soporto es meter la cabeza en un estanque —musitó miss Baedeker—. Estuvieron a punto de ahogarme en Nueva Jersey.
vi_translation: "What I hate the most is being dunked in the pool. There was a time when people almost drowned me in New Jersey."
tr_translation: “If there is one thing I truly hate, it is having my head dunked in the pool!” grumbled Mrs. Baedeker, “One time in New Jersey, they almost drowned me.”
es_translation: —If there is something I can't stand, it's sticking my head in a pond —muttered Miss Baedeker—. They almost drowned me in New Jersey.

en: “Then you ought to leave it alone,” countered Doctor Civet.
vi: "Nếu nói như vậy thì cô đừng đụng tới rượu nữa." Bác sĩ Civet tấn công.
tr: “O zaman siz de kati suretle bırakacaksınız alkolü” demeye yeltendi Doktor.
es: —Ya ve que debería dejarlo —replicó el doctor Civet.
vi_translation: "If that's the case, then don't touch alcohol anymore." Dr. Civet attacked.
tr_translation: "Then you will absolutely have to quit alcohol as well," the Doctor attempted to say. “You should look at yourself first!”
es_translation: —You see, you should give it up —replied Dr. Civet.

en: “Speak for yourself!” cried Miss Baedeker violently. “Your hand shakes. I wouldn’t let you operate on me!”
vi: "Nhìn lại anh đi." Cô Baedeker la to dữ tợn. "Tay anh đang rung cả lên. Tôi chẳng dám để cho anh giải phẫu tôi."
tr: “Sen asıl kendine bak!” diye çıkıştı Bayan Baedeker. “Senin ellerin titriyor be adam! Ameliyat olmam gerekse hayatta senin yapmana razı gelmezdim.
es: —¡Mira quién habla! —gritó con violencia miss Baedeker—. ¡Le tiemblan las manos! ¡Nunca dejaría que usted me operara!
vi_translation: "Look at yourself." Ms. Baedeker shouted fiercely. "Your hands are shaking all over. I wouldn't dare let you operate on me."
tr_translation: Mrs. Baedeker retorted. “Your hands are shaking, man! If I needed surgery, I would never agree to let you do it.”
es_translation: —Look who's talking! —Miss Baedeker shouted violently—. Your hands are shaking! I would never let you operate on me!

en: It was like that. Almost the last thing I remember was standing with Daisy and watching the moving-picture director and his Star. They were still under the white-plum tree and their faces were touching except for a pale, thin ray of moonlight between. It occurred to me that he had been very slowly bending toward her all evening to attain this proximity, and even while I watched I saw him stoop one ultimate degree and kiss at her cheek.
vi: Đại khái là như thế. Hầu như việc cuối cùng mà tôi nhớ được là đứng cạnh Daisy quan sát nhà đạo diễn phim và ngôi sao điện ảnh của ông ta. Hai người họ vẫn ngồi dưới tàng cây mận trắng, hai khuôn mặt của họ kề sát vào nhau chỉ cách một lớp mỏng ánh trăng nhợt nhạt. Tôi chợt nhận ra rằng nguyên cả buổi tối nay ông ta cứ từ từ chầm chậm nghiêng người về phía cô ta để mà có được cái khoảng cách gần gũi này. Trong lúc đang quan sát, tôi thấy ông ta cúi xuống thêm một mức cuối cùng và rồi đã hôn lên được trên má cô ta.
tr: Tantana böyle sürüp gitti. Son anımsadığım, Daisy ile yan yana, sinema yönetmeniyle meşhur yıldızını izliyor oluşumuz. Hala o erik ağacının altındaydılar, yüzleri artık birbirlerine o denli yaklaşmıştı ki, cılız ay ışığı aralarından ancak sızabiliyordu. Muhtemelen adam bu duruma gelebilmek için gece boyunca ağır ağır kadına sokuldu, diye düşünmekten kendi­mizi alamamıştık. Biz öylece dikilmiş onları izlerken yönetmen bir mili­metre daha yaklaşmış ve nihayet kadını yanağından öpüvermişti.
es: Así estaba la cosa. Casi lo último que recuerdo es que fui con Daisy a mirar al director de cine y a su estrella. Seguían bajo el ciruelo blanco y entre sus caras, que se rozaban, sólo había un rayo de luna pálido y delgadísimo. Se me ocurrió que el director se había ido inclinando muy despacio sobre la estrella toda la noche hasta alcanzar esta proximidad, y entonces, mientras los miraba, vi que descendía un último grado y la besaba en la mejilla.
vi_translation: Roughly speaking, that's how it was. Almost the last thing I remember is standing next to Daisy, watching the film director and his movie star. The two of them were still sitting under the white plum tree, their faces close together, separated only by a thin layer of pale moonlight. I suddenly realized that the whole evening he had been slowly and gradually leaning towards her to achieve this close distance. While observing, I saw him lean down one final time and then kiss her on the cheek.
tr_translation: So it went on like this. The last thing I remember is watching the famous star with the film director, side by side with Daisy. They were still under that plum tree, their faces now so close to each other that the faint moonlight could barely seep through. We couldn't help but think that the man had slowly inched closer to the woman throughout the night to reach this point. As we stood there watching them, the director moved a millimeter closer and finally kissed the woman on the cheek.
es_translation: That's how things were. Almost the last thing I remember is that I went with Daisy to watch the film director and his star. They were still under the white plum tree and between their faces, which were touching, there was only a pale and very thin moonbeam. It occurred to me that the director had been slowly leaning towards the star all night until he reached this proximity, and then, while I was watching them, I saw him descend one last degree and kiss her on the cheek.

en: “I like her,” said Daisy, “I think she’s lovely.”
vi: "Em thích cô đó. Cô ta rất xinh đẹp." Daisy nói.
tr: “Çok beğeniyorum bu kadını” dedi Daisy, “Şahane!”
es: —Me gusta —dijo Daisy—. Me parece preciosa.
vi_translation: "I like her." "She is very beautiful," Daisy said.
tr_translation: “I like this woman very much,” said Daisy, “Magnificent!”
es_translation: —I like it —said Daisy—. I think it's beautiful.

en: But the rest offended her—and inarguably because it wasn’t a gesture but an emotion. She was appalled by West Egg, this unprecedented “place” that Broadway had begotten upon a Long Island fishing village—appalled by its raw vigour that chafed under the old euphemisms and by the too obtrusive fate that herded its inhabitants along a shortcut from nothing to nothing. She saw something awful in the very simplicity she failed to understand.
vi: Thế nhưng mọi thứ khác còn lại thì lại làm Daisy chướng mắt khó chịu không sao giải thích được, bởi vì nó có được không phải từ thái độ hay cử chỉ mà là từ cảm giác. Daisy bị West Egg, một nơi chưa từng ở đâu có, làm cho hoảng sợ, một nơi mà xã hội Broadway đã tạo lập ra nó từ một khu làng đánh cá trên đảo Long Island. Daisy kinh sợ cái sức sống thô thiển đầy mộc mạc của nó đã làm trêu tức người ta qua những cổ ngữ đã được nói trại đi, và bởi cái hoàn cảnh quá chướng mắt đã lùa những người dân cư của nó đi dọc theo con đường tắt để đi từ một nơi không có gì đến một nơi không có gì. Daisy đã thấy được những điểm kinh tởm đáng sợ ở trong cái đời sống đơn giản mộc mạc mà nàng không sao hiểu được.
tr: Ancak bu kadın haricindeki her şey sinirine dokunmuştu, rahatsızlığını davranışlarından ziyade duygularına yansıtıyor olması, bunu tartışmayı da olanaksızlaştırıyordu. Broadway’in, Long Island’ın bu balıkçı kasabasından türetmiş olduğu West Egg’den, bu eşine rastlanmaz ‘yerden’ tiksinmişti. O eski edebi kelamların ardındaki çiğ canlılık ve tüm bu insanları bir hiçlikten diğer bir hiçliğe en kısa yoldan sürükleyen bu yılışık kader karşısında dehşete düşmüştü. Bu basitliğin ardında, ne olduğunu kavramakta zorlandığı, korkunç bir şeyler görüyordu.
es: Pero todo lo demás la ofendía, y sin discusión, porque no se trataba de una pose, sino de un sentimiento. Le repugnaba West Egg, esa «sucursal» sin precedentes que Broadway había engendrado en una aldea de pescadores de Long Island: le repugnaba su vigor obsceno, que pujaba impaciente bajo los viejos eufemismos, y le repugnaba el destino desvergonzado que había reunido a sus habitantes en aquel atajo entre la nada y la nada. Veía algo terrible en aquella simplicidad que no podía entender.
vi_translation: However, everything else made Daisy inexplicably uncomfortable and annoyed, not because of attitude or gestures, but because of a feeling. Daisy was terrified by West Egg, a place like no other, created by the Broadway society from a fishing village on Long Island. Daisy was frightened by its crude and rustic vitality that provoked people through distorted ancient words, and by the overly offensive circumstances that drove its inhabitants along a shortcut from nowhere to nowhere. Daisy saw terrifying and disgusting points in the simple and rustic life that she could not understand.
tr_translation: However, everything except this woman had gotten on his nerves; the fact that he reflected his discomfort in his emotions rather than his actions made it impossible to argue about it. He had been disgusted by West Egg, this unparalleled 'place' that Broadway had derived from this fishing village of Long Island. He was horrified by the raw vitality behind those old literary words and this slimy fate that drove all these people from one nothingness to another in the shortest way possible. Behind this simplicity, he saw something terrible that he struggled to comprehend.
es_translation: But everything else offended her, and without discussion, because it was not a pose, but a feeling. She was repulsed by West Egg, that unprecedented "branch" that Broadway had spawned in a Long Island fishing village: she was repulsed by its obscene vigor, which impatiently pushed beneath the old euphemisms, and she was repulsed by the shameless fate that had gathered its inhabitants in that shortcut between nothing and nothing. She saw something terrible in that simplicity that she could not understand.

en: I sat on the front steps with them while they waited for their car. It was dark here in front; only the bright door sent ten square feet of light volleying out into the soft black morning. Sometimes a shadow moved against a dressing-room blind above, gave way to another shadow, an indefinite procession of shadows, who rouged and powdered in an invisible glass.
vi: Tôi ngồi trên bậc cửa trước với hai vợ chồng Tom và Daisy một lát trong khi họ chờ lấy xe. Trước nhà tối lắm, chỉ có khoảng mười thước ánh sáng được hắt ra từ chiếc cửa rọi vào trong bóng đêm. Thỉnh thoảng bóng người đang di động chiếu hắt lên trên tấm mành ở căn phòng trang điểm phía trên lầu, nhường chỗ cho một chiếc bóng khác, quá trình những chiếc bóng thay đổi cứ như vậy diễn ra cho những người đến soi nhồi phấn lại trước một tấm gương vô hình.
tr: Arabalarını beklerken onlarla beraber merdivenlerin dibine oturmuştum: Karanlıktı, açık sokak kapısından saçılan parlak ışık sabahın tatlı alacakaranlığında yalnızca birkaç metrekarelik alanı aydınlatmıştı. Ara sıra, giyinme odasının kapalı perdesine bir gölge vuruyor, sonra yerini, görünmez bir aynada pudrasını ve rujunu tazeleyen bir başka gölgeye bırakıyordu.
es: Me senté en los escalones de la entrada mientras esperaban el coche. Estábamos a oscuras: sólo la puerta iluminada proyectaba unos metros cuadrados de luz sobre el amanecer tenebroso y suave. A veces una sombra se movía detrás de la persiana de uno de los vestidores de arriba, dejaba paso a otra sombra, a una incierta procesión de sombras, que se pintaban los labios y se empolvaban ante un espejo invisible.
vi_translation: I sat on the front steps with Tom and Daisy for a while as they waited for their car. The front of the house was very dark, with only about ten yards of light cast from the doorway into the darkness. Occasionally, a moving shadow would be cast on the curtain in the upstairs dressing room, replaced by another shadow, the process of changing shadows continuing for those who came to powder themselves before an invisible mirror.
tr_translation: While waiting for their cars, I had sat down with them at the bottom of the stairs: It was dark, the bright light spilling from the open street door illuminated only a few square meters in the sweet twilight of the morning. From time to time, a shadow would fall on the closed curtain of the dressing room, then it would be replaced by another shadow, freshening its powder and lipstick in an invisible mirror.
es_translation: I sat on the entrance steps while they waited for the car. We were in the dark: only the illuminated door cast a few square meters of light over the dark and soft dawn. Sometimes a shadow moved behind the blind of one of the upstairs dressing rooms, giving way to another shadow, to an uncertain procession of shadows, who painted their lips and powdered themselves before an invisible mirror.

en: “Who is this Gatsby anyhow?” demanded Tom suddenly. “Some big bootlegger?”
vi: "Gatsby này là ai?" Tom đột ngột hỏi. "Có phải là một tên buôn lậu nào đó không?"
tr: “Bu Gatsby denilen adam kimin nesi?” diye sordu Tom aniden, “İçki kaçakçısı mı?
es: —Pero ¿ese Gatsby quién es? —soltó Tom de repente—. ¿Un traficante de licores a lo grande?
vi_translation: "Who is this Gatsby?" Tom suddenly asked. "Is he some kind of bootlegger?"
tr_translation: “Who is this Gatsby character?” Tom asked suddenly, “Is he a bootlegger?”
es_translation: —But who is this Gatsby? —Tom suddenly blurted out—. A big-time bootlegger?

en: “Where’d you hear that?” I inquired.
vi: "Anh nghe được ở đâu như vậy?" Tôi gạn hỏi.
tr: “Bunu da nerden duydun?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Dónde has oído eso? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "Where did you hear that?" I probed.
tr_translation: "Where did you hear this from?" I asked.
es_translation: —Where did you hear that? —I asked.

en: “I didn’t hear it. I imagined it. A lot of these newly rich people are just big bootleggers, you know.”
vi: "Tôi không nghe được ở đâu cả. Tôi chỉ tưởng tượng ra thôi. Có rất nhiều những người mới trở nên giàu có đều là dân buôn lậu, anh biết đó."
tr: “Bunu da nerden duydun?” diye sordum. “Kimseden duymadım, ama besbelli. Bu yeni zenginlerin çoğunun içki kaçakçısı olduğunu sen de bilirsin,”
es: —No lo he oído. Me lo he imaginado. Casi todos estos nuevos ricos son traficantes a lo grande, ya sabes.
vi_translation: "I didn't hear it anywhere. I just imagined it. There are many people who have recently become wealthy who are smugglers, you know."
tr_translation: "Where did you hear this from?" I asked. “I haven't heard it from anyone, but it's obvious. You know that most of these new rich people are bootleggers,”
es_translation: —I haven't heard it. I've imagined it. Almost all these new rich people are big-time traffickers, you know.

en: “Not Gatsby,” I said shortly.
vi: "Không phải Gatsby." Tôi nói ngắn gọn.
tr: “Gatsby değil” dedim kısaca.
es: —Gatsby no —respondí escuetamente.
vi_translation: "Not Gatsby." I said briefly.
tr_translation: "Not Gatsby," I said briefly.
es_translation: —Gatsby no —I replied curtly.

en: He was silent for a moment. The pebbles of the drive crunched under his feet.
vi: Tom im lặng một lát. Những viên đá cuội trên con đường kêu lào xào dưới chân anh ta.
tr: Cevap vermedi, yola döşenmiş çakıllar ayaklarının altında çatırdıyordu.
es: Tom guardó silencio un instante. La grava del camino crujía bajo sus pies.
vi_translation: Tom was silent for a moment. The pebbles on the road crunched under his feet.
tr_translation: He did not answer, the gravel laid on the road was crunching under his feet.
es_translation: Tom remained silent for a moment. The gravel on the path crunched under his feet.

en: “Well, he certainly must have strained himself to get this menagerie together.”
vi: "Thế thì anh ta nhất định đã phải cố gắng khổ sở lắm mới có thể thu thập được những bầy thú trong gánh xiệc này lại."
tr: “Öyle de, bu yabani hayvan sürüsünü toplamak için çok uğraşmış olmalı.
es: —Bueno, debe de haberle costado lo suyo montar este zoológico.
vi_translation: "Then he must have struggled a lot to be able to gather the animals in this circus troupe."
tr_translation: “So, he must have worked very hard to gather this herd of wild animals.”
es_translation: —Well, it must have cost him quite a bit to set up this zoo.

en: “At least they are more interesting than the people we know,” she said with an effort.
vi: "Ít ra bọn họ đáng lý thú hơn những người chúng ta quen." Daisy cố gắng nói.
tr: Rüzgar yakasındaki gri kürkü hafifçe dalgalandırırken Daisy; “En azından bizim çevremizdekilerden daha ilginç tipler” dedi, kendini zorlayarak.
es: —Por lo menos son más interesantes que la gente que conocemos —dijo con esfuerzo.
vi_translation: "At least they ought to be more interesting than the people we know." Daisy tried to say.
tr_translation: As the wind gently fluttered the gray fur on her collar, Daisy said, forcing herself, "At least they're more interesting than the people around us."
es_translation: —At least they are more interesting than the people we know —he said with effort.

en: “You didn’t look so interested.”
vi: "Nhưng trông em không có vẻ gì là thích thú cả."
tr: “Ama çok da ilgili görünmüyordun.
es: —Tú no demostrabas demasiado interés —respondió Tom.
vi_translation: "But you don't seem to be enjoying it at all."
tr_translation: “But you didn't seem very interested.”
es_translation: —You didn't show too much interest —replied Tom.

en: “Well, I was.”
vi: "Thật ra em có."
tr: “Yo, ilgimi çektiler.
es: —Pues lo tenía.
vi_translation: "Actually, I do."
tr_translation: “Yes, they caught my attention.”
es_translation: —Well, he had it.

en: “Did you notice Daisy’s face when that girl asked her to put her under a cold shower?”
vi: "Anh có để ý thấy khuôn mặt của Daisy khi cái cô gái đó nhờ Daisy đưa cô ta đi đứng dưới vòi nước lạnh không?"
tr: Tom gülerek bana döndü, “O kız Daisy’den kendisini soğuk duşun altına sokmasını istediği zaman Daisy’nin suratındaki ifadeyi gördün mü?
es: —¿Te diste cuenta de la cara de Daisy cuando esa chica le pidió que la duchara con agua fría?
vi_translation: "Did you notice Daisy's face when that girl asked her to stand under the cold water?"
tr_translation: Tom turned to me laughing, "Did you see the look on Daisy's face when that girl asked her to put herself under a cold shower?"
es_translation: —Did you notice Daisy's face when that girl asked her to shower her with cold water?

en: Daisy began to sing with the music in a husky, rhythmic whisper, bringing out a meaning in each word that it had never had before and would never have again. When the melody rose her voice broke up sweetly, following it, in a way contralto voices have, and each change tipped out a little of her warm human magic upon the air.
vi: Daisy bắt đầu hát khe khẽ một điệu nhạc với giọng trầm trầm nhịp nhàng làm nổi lên ý nghĩa của mỗi lời ca, như nó chưa từng bao giờ được như vậy trước đây và sẽ không bao giờ được sau này. Khi nốt nhạc lên cao giọng nàng cũng vút lên theo nó vỡ vụn ra ngọt ngào đúng điệu như những giọng hát nữ giọng trầm. Cứ mỗi lần thay đổi giọng như vậy nàng lại rót ra một chút tình người ấm áp đầy ma lực vào trong không gian.
tr: Daisy, kısık ve ritmik bir fısıltıyla, her sözcüğüne o zamana kadar taşımadığı, bir daha da taşımayacağı, yeni anlamlar kazandırarak, bir şarkı mırıldanmaya başlamıştı. Melodi yükseldiğinde sesi bozuluyor, sonra kontralto seslere özgü bir tarzda devam ederek, her değişen notayı, ruhunun sıcacık büyüsünü de ekleyerek, usulce bırakıveriyordu.
es: Daisy empezó a cantar, a acompañar la música con un susurro rítmico y ronco, y de cada palabra extraía un significado que nunca había tenido y que jamás volvería a tener. Cuando la melodía subió unos tonos, la voz se le quebró suavemente al seguirla, como suele ocurrirles a las voces de contralto, y cada cambio derramaba en el aire un poco de su magia humana y cálida.
vi_translation: Daisy began to softly sing a tune with a deep, rhythmic voice that brought out the meaning of each lyric, as it had never done before and would never do again. When the note rose high, her voice soared with it, breaking sweetly in perfect harmony like those of contralto singers. Each time she changed her voice like that, she poured a bit of warm, enchanting humanity into the space.
tr_translation: Daisy, in a low and rhythmic whisper, began to hum a song, imbuing each word with new meanings that it had never carried before and would never carry again. When the melody rose, her voice would falter, then continue in a manner typical of contralto voices, gently releasing each changing note, adding the warm magic of her soul.
es_translation: Daisy began to sing, to accompany the music with a rhythmic and husky whisper, and from each word she extracted a meaning that it had never had and would never have again. When the melody rose a few tones, her voice broke softly as she followed it, as often happens with contralto voices, and each change spilled a bit of her warm, human magic into the air.

en: “Lots of people come who haven’t been invited,” she said suddenly. “That girl hadn’t been invited. They simply force their way in and he’s too polite to object.”
vi: "Có rất nhiều người không được mời cũng cứ tới." Daisy đột nhiên nói. "Cô gái đó cũng không được mời. Bọn họ cứ tự tiện mà tới và anh ấy quá lịch sự không hề phản đối."
tr: “İnsanların çoğu davetsiz geliyor,” dedi birden, “o kız da onlardandı. Çat kapı geliveriyorlar, o da nezaketinden hiçbirini geri çevirmiyor.
es: —Viene mucha gente que no ha sido invitada —dijo de pronto—. Esa chica no estaba invitada. Se cuelan, y él es demasiado educado para protestar.
vi_translation: "There are many people who weren't invited but still came." Daisy suddenly said. "That girl wasn't invited either. They just came on their own and he was too polite to object."
tr_translation: “Most people come uninvited,” he suddenly said, “that girl was one of them. They just show up without warning, and out of politeness, he doesn't turn any of them away.”
es_translation: —A lot of people who haven't been invited are coming —he said suddenly—. That girl wasn't invited. They sneak in, and he is too polite to protest.

en: “I’d like to know who he is and what he does,” insisted Tom. “And I think I’ll make a point of finding out.”
vi: "Anh muốn biết anh ta là ai và làm nghề gì." Tom nhất định muốn biết.
tr: “Kim olduğunu ve ne iş yaptığını gerçekten merak ettim,” diye ısrar etti Tom “ve sanırım bunu bir şekilde öğreneceğim.
es: —Me gustaría saber quién es y qué hace —insistió Tom—. Y creo que me voy a preocupar de descubrirlo.
vi_translation: "He wants to know who he is and what he does." Tom was determined to find out.
tr_translation: “I really wondered who he was and what he did,” insisted Tom, “and I think I will find out somehow.”
es_translation: —I would like to know who he is and what he does —insisted Tom—. And I think I'm going to make it my business to find out.

en: “I can tell you right now,” she answered. “He owned some drugstores, a lot of drugstores. He built them up himself.”
vi: "Và anh nhất định sẽ tìm ra câu trả lời." "Em có thể nói cho anh biết ngay bây giờ." Daisy trả lời. "Anh ấy làm chủ vài tiệm thuốc, phải nói là rất nhiều tiệm thuốc. Chính tay anh ta gây dựng lên từ đầu."
tr: “Hemen aydınlatayım seni,” diye yanıt verdi Daisy, “İlaç işinde, daha doğrusu ilaç-marketler zinciri var. Hepsini tek başına yapmış.
es: —Te lo digo yo ahora mismo —contestó Daisy—. Es dueño de varios drugstores, de muchos drugstores. Los ha montado él.
vi_translation: "And he is determined to get the answer." "You can tell me right now," Daisy replied. "He owns several pharmacies, to be precise, a lot of pharmacies. He built them from scratch with his own hands."
tr_translation: “Let me enlighten you right away,” Daisy replied, “He is in the pharmaceutical business, or rather, he has a chain of pharmaceutical markets. He did it all by himself.”
es_translation: —I'm telling you right now —replied Daisy—. He owns several drugstores, many drugstores. He set them up himself.

en: The dilatory limousine came rolling up the drive.
vi: Chiếc xe limousine đến trễ lăn bánh vào trong sân.
tr: Geciken otomobil sonunda ağır ağır yaklaştı.
es: La limusina tan esperada subía ya por el camino.
vi_translation: The limousine, arriving late, rolled into the yard.
tr_translation: The delayed car finally approached slowly.
es_translation: The long-awaited limousine was already coming up the road.

en: “Good night, Nick,” said Daisy.
vi: "Tạm biệt anh, Nick." Daisy nói.
tr: “İyi geceler” dedi Daisy.
es: —Buenas noches, Nick —dijo Daisy.
vi_translation: "Goodbye, Nick." Daisy said.
tr_translation: “Good night,” said Daisy.
es_translation: —Good evening, Nick —said Daisy.

en: Her glance left me and sought the lighted top of the steps, where “Three O’Clock in the Morning,” a neat, sad little waltz of that year, was drifting out the open door. After all, in the very casualness of Gatsby’s party there were romantic possibilities totally absent from her world. What was it up there in the song that seemed to be calling her back inside? What would happen now in the dim, incalculable hours? Perhaps some unbelievable guest would arrive, a person infinitely rare and to be marvelled at, some authentically radiant young girl who with one fresh glance at Gatsby, one moment of magical encounter, would blot out those five years of unwavering devotion.
vi: Đôi mắt của Daisy rời khỏi tôi để nhìn lên những bậc thềm sáng ánh đèn cao nhất, nơi cánh cửa mở đang vọng ra tiếng nhạc trầm buồn của bài THREE O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING. Cuối cùng, trong bữa tiệc tự nhiên không trịnh trọng này của Gatsby đã chứa đựng cái lãng mạn, một thứ hoàn toàn thiếu vắng trong thế giới của nàng. Có một cái gì ở trong tiếng nhạc trên cao đó dường như đang mời mọc Daisy quay trở lại? Chuyện gì sẽ xẩy ra trong những khoẳnh khắc tối mờ không lường trước? Có lẽ sẽ có người khách bất ngờ đến muộn, một người hoàn toàn hiếm hoi khác thường, cô gái trẻ lộng lẫy với cái liếc nhìn tươi mát tới Gatsby, một giây phút gặp gỡ kỳ diệu, nó sẽ xóa mất đi cái năm năm hết lòng chung thủy kia.
tr: Bakışlarını benden çevirip yılın sevilen şarkılarından olan ‘Sabahın Tam Üçü” isimli güzel ve kısa valsın melodilerinin geldiği, ardımızdaki açık kapıya baktı. Her şeye rağmen, Gatsby’nin bu gelişigüzel partilerinde, Daisy’nin dünyasın­da olmayan romantik olasılıklar da vardı. Şarkıda onu geri çağıran neydi? Bu karanlık, hesap edilemez saatlerde neler olacaktı? Belki de, gencecik, göz kamaştırıcı ve hatta baş döndürücü güzellikte bir kadın çıkagelecek ve canlı bakışlarını Gatsby’e çevirecekti ve; anın büyüsüne kapıldıklarında ise, kim bilir belki de beş yıldır hiç eksilmemiş olan sadakati ve bağımlılığı bir anda uçup gidecekti.
es: Su mirada me abandonó para buscar lo más alto de la escalinata iluminada, donde Las tres de la mañana[19], un vals triste, estupendo e insignificante de aquel año salía por la puerta abierta. Después de todo, el azar de las fiestas de Gatsby entrañaba posibilidades románticas totalmente desconocidas en su mundo. ¿Qué había en aquella canción que parecía llamarla, pedirle que volviera a entrar en la casa? ¿Qué pasaría ahora, en las horas turbias e imprevisibles? Quizá se presentara algún invitado increíble, una persona infinitamente rara ante la que maravillarse, alguna chica radiante de verdad, que con una sola mirada a Gatsby, en un encuentro mágico e instantáneo, aniquilaría aquellos cinco años de devoción inquebrantable.
vi_translation: Daisy's eyes left me to look up at the highest steps illuminated by bright lights, where the open door echoed the melancholic music of the song THREE O'CLOCK IN THE MORNING. Finally, in Gatsby's naturally unceremonious party, there was a touch of romance, something entirely absent in her world. Was there something in the high music that seemed to be inviting Daisy to return? What would happen in those unforeseen dark moments? Perhaps a guest would unexpectedly arrive late, an extraordinarily rare person, a young, dazzling girl with a fresh glance at Gatsby, a magical moment of encounter that would erase those five years of devoted fidelity.
tr_translation: She turned her gaze away from me and looked at the open door behind us, from which the melodies of the beautiful and short waltz, “Three in the Morning,” one of the beloved songs of the year, were coming. Despite everything, there were romantic possibilities at Gatsby’s casual parties that did not exist in Daisy’s world. What was calling her back in the song? What would happen in these dark, unpredictable hours? Perhaps a very young, dazzling, and even dizzyingly beautiful woman would appear and turn her lively gaze towards Gatsby; and, caught up in the magic of the moment, who knows, perhaps the loyalty and dependency that had not diminished for five years would suddenly vanish.
es_translation: Her gaze left me to seek the highest point of the illuminated staircase, where Las tres de la mañana[19], a sad, wonderful, and insignificant waltz from that year, was coming out through the open door. After all, the randomness of Gatsby's parties entailed romantic possibilities completely unknown in her world. What was in that song that seemed to call her, to ask her to re-enter the house? What would happen now, in the murky and unpredictable hours? Perhaps some incredible guest would appear, an infinitely rare person to marvel at, some truly radiant girl, who with a single glance at Gatsby, in a magical and instantaneous encounter, would annihilate those five years of unwavering devotion.

en: I stayed late that night. Gatsby asked me to wait until he was free, and I lingered in the garden until the inevitable swimming party had run up, chilled and exalted, from the black beach, until the lights were extinguished in the guestrooms overhead. When he came down the steps at last the tanned skin was drawn unusually tight on his face, and his eyes were bright and tired.
vi: Đêm đó tôi ở lại trễ. Gatsby yêu cầu tôi ở lại cho đến khi anh ta được rảnh rỗi. Tôi nán lại ở ngoài vườn cho tới khi những đám người tắm biển quen thuộc hàng ngày đều đã chạy cả lên từ bãi biển tối đen, lạnh run hớn hở, và cho tới khi đèn trong các gian phòng ngủ của khách đã được tắt đi. Cuối cùng, Gatsby bước xuống những bực thềm, làn da rám nắng căng khác thường trên khuôn mặt, đôi mắt sáng ngời nhưng mệt mỏi.
tr: O gece geç saatlere kadar kaldım. Gatsby misafirleri el ayak çekene kadar beklememi iste­mişti. Ben de karanlık plajdaki kaçınılmaz yüzme partisinin, konukların donmuş bir vaziyette eve koşmalarıyla sonlanıncaya ve tüm misafir odalarının ışıkları sönünceye dek bahçede oyalandım. Sonunda yanıma geldiğinde yüzünün güneş yanığı teni alışılmadık biçimde gerilmiş, ışıltılı gözleri ise yorgundu.
es: Aquella noche me quedé hasta muy tarde. Gatsby me pidió que esperara a que lo dejaran libre, y vagabundeé por el jardín hasta que el inevitable grupo de bañistas, helado y exaltado, llegó corriendo de la playa a oscuras, hasta que en la planta de arriba se apagaron las luces de las habitaciones para invitados. Cuando Gatsby bajó por fin las escaleras, tenía la piel bronceada más tensa que nunca, y los ojos brillantes y cansados.
vi_translation: That night I stayed late. Gatsby asked me to stay until he was free. I lingered in the garden until the familiar groups of daily bathers had all run up from the dark, chilly beach, exhilarated, and until the lights in the guest bedrooms had been turned off. Finally, Gatsby stepped down the stairs, his unusually taut tanned skin on his face, his eyes bright but weary.
tr_translation: I stayed until late that night. Gatsby had asked me to wait until the guests had left. So I lingered in the garden until the inevitable swimming party on the dark beach ended with the guests running home in a frozen state and all the lights in the guest rooms went out. When he finally came to me, his sunburned face was unusually tense, and his sparkling eyes were tired.
es_translation: That night I stayed up very late. Gatsby asked me to wait until he was free, and I wandered around the garden until the inevitable group of bathers, cold and exhilarated, came running from the dark beach, until the lights in the guest rooms upstairs went out. When Gatsby finally came down the stairs, his tanned skin was tighter than ever, and his eyes were bright and tired.

en: “She didn’t like it,” he said immediately.
vi: "Cô ấy không thích." Gatsby nói ngay
tr: Derken: “Hoşuna gitmedi,” dedi.
es: —No le ha gustado nada —dijo inmediatamente.
vi_translation: "She doesn't like it." Gatsby said immediately
tr_translation: Then: “He didn't like it,” he said.
es_translation: —He didn't like it at all —he said immediately.

en: “Of course she did.”
vi: "Đương nhiên thích mà."
tr: “Tabii ki hoşlandı.
es: —Claro que le ha gustado.
vi_translation: "Of course I like it."
tr_translation: “Of course, he liked it.”
es_translation: —Of course he liked it.

en: “She didn’t like it,” he insisted. “She didn’t have a good time.”
vi: "Cô ấy không thích." Gatsby quả quyết. "Cô ấy không được vui lắm."
tr: “Hayır, hiç beğenmedi,” diye ısrar etti, “zaten eğlenmedi de.
es: —No le ha gustado nada —insistió—. No se lo ha pasado bien.
vi_translation: "She doesn't like it." Gatsby asserted. "She is not very happy."
tr_translation: “No, he didn't like it at all,” he insisted, “he didn't have any fun either.”
es_translation: —He didn't like it at all —he insisted—. He didn't have a good time.

en: He was silent, and I guessed at his unutterable depression.
vi: Gatsby trở nên im lặng, tôi đoán anh ta đang có nỗi chán nản không thốt nên lời.
tr: Sonra sustu, içini kaplamış olan hüznü hissedebiliyordum.
es: Calló, y me imaginé su desaliento indecible.
vi_translation: Gatsby became silent, I guessed he was experiencing an unspeakable despondency.
tr_translation: Then he/she fell silent, I could feel the sadness that had enveloped him/her.
es_translation: He fell silent, and I imagined his indescribable dismay.

en: “I feel far away from her,” he said. “It’s hard to make her understand.”
vi: "Tôi cảm thấy rất xa cách với cô ấy." Gatsby nó. "Khó làm cho cô ấy hiểu."
tr: “Ondan çok uzak hissediyorum kendimi” dedi, “ona anlatabilmek zor.
es: —Me siento muy lejos de ella —dijo—. Es difícil hacérselo entender.
vi_translation: "I feel very distant from her," Gatsby said. "It's hard to make her understand."
tr_translation: “I feel very distant from him,” she said, “it's hard to explain to him.”
es_translation: —I feel very far from her —he said—. It's hard to make her understand.

en: “You mean about the dance?”
vi: "Ý anh muốn nói bài khiêu vũ?"
tr: “Dansı mı kastediyorsun?
es: —¿Te refieres al baile?
vi_translation: "Do you mean the dance performance?"
tr_translation: “Are you referring to the dance?”
es_translation: —Are you referring to the dance?

en: “The dance?” He dismissed all the dances he had given with a snap of his fingers. “Old sport, the dance is unimportant.”
vi: "Bài khiêu vũ?" Gatsby dẹp bỏ tất cả những bài khiêu vũ anh đã tổ chức chỉ với một cái búng tay. "Anh bạn già, khiêu vũ không phải là cái quan trọng."
tr: “Dans mı?” Parmağını şaklatıp dans ilgili her şeyi kafasından attı, “Hayır ahbap, dans hiç mühim değil,”
es: —¿El baile? —liquidó todos los bailes que había organizado con un chasquido de dedos—. Compañero, el baile no tiene importancia.
vi_translation: "The dance parties?" Gatsby dismissed all the dance parties he had organized with just a snap of his fingers. "Old sport, the dance parties aren't what matter."
tr_translation: “Dance?” He snapped his fingers and dismissed everything related to dance from his mind, “No buddy, dance is not important at all,”
es_translation: —The dance? —he dismissed all the dances he had organized with a snap of his fingers—. Comrade, the dance is not important.

en: He wanted nothing less of Daisy than that she should go to Tom and say: “I never loved you.” After she had obliterated four years with that sentence they could decide upon the more practical measures to be taken. One of them was that, after she was free, they were to go back to Louisville and be married from her house—just as if it were five years ago.
vi: Gatsby không muốn gì hơn là muốn Daisy nói với Tom: "Em chưa bao giờ yêu anh." Sau khi Daisy đã xóa bỏ bốn năm với Tom bằng câu nói đó, lúc đó hai người họ sẽ có thể đi tới một quyết định để giải quyết thỏa đáng. Một trong những giải quyết đó là, sau khi nàng đã được tự do, nàng sẽ quay trở lại Louisville và làm đám cưới lại từ nhà của mình, như năm năm về trước.
tr: Daisy’nin Tom’un karşısına çıkıp “Seni aslında hiç sevmedim” demesinden daha azına razı değildi. Bu cümlesiyle onunla geçen dört yılı sildikten sonra daha elverişli çözümlerden birinde karar kılacaklardı. Mesela, Daisy özgürlüğüne kavuştuktan son­ra Louisville’e gidip orada evlenebilirlerdi; tıpkı beş yıl önce planladıkları gibi, Daisy kendi evinden evlenip çıkabilirdi.
es: Quería, nada menos, que Daisy fuera a Tom y le dijera: «Nunca te he querido». Cuando ella hubiera borrado cuatro años con esa frase, decidirían las medidas más prácticas que debían tomar. Una era que, en cuanto Daisy fuera libre, volverían a Louisville y se casarían, saliendo de la casa de la novia, tal como si fuera cinco años antes.
vi_translation: Gatsby wanted nothing more than for Daisy to say to Tom: "I never loved you." After Daisy erased four years with Tom with that statement, the two of them would be able to come to a decision to resolve matters satisfactorily. One of those resolutions was that, once she was free, she would return to Louisville and get married again from her own home, just as she had five years earlier.
tr_translation: He was not willing to settle for anything less than Daisy confronting Tom and saying, "I never loved you." After erasing the four years spent with him with this sentence, they would decide on one of the more convenient solutions. For instance, after Daisy gained her freedom, they could go to Louisville and get married there; just as they had planned five years ago, Daisy could get married from her own home.
es_translation: He wanted nothing less than for Daisy to go to Tom and say, "I never loved you." When she had erased four years with that phrase, they would decide the most practical steps to take. One was that, as soon as Daisy was free, they would return to Louisville and get married, leaving from the bride's house, just as if it were five years ago.

en: “And she doesn’t understand,” he said. “She used to be able to understand. We’d sit for hours—”
vi: "Cô ấy không hiểu. Lúc trước cô ấy thường hiểu. Chúng tôi thường ngồi với nhau hàng nhiều giờ..."
tr: “Ama o bunları anlayamıyor” dedi, “eskiden böyle değildi, saatlerce oturup-
es: —Y ella no lo entiende —dijo Gatsby—. Antes lo entendía todo. Pasábamos horas y horas…
vi_translation: "She doesn't understand. She used to understand before. We used to sit together for many hours..."
tr_translation: “But she can't understand these,” he said, “it wasn't like this before, we used to sit for hours-”
es_translation: —And she doesn't understand it —said Gatsby—. She used to understand everything. We would spend hours and hours...

en: He broke off and began to walk up and down a desolate path of fruit rinds and discarded favours and crushed flowers.
vi: Gatsby im lặng, rồi bước qua lại trên khoảng đất tiêu điều ngổn ngang những vỏ trái cây và những cành hoa dập nát.
tr: Devamını getiremedi, meyve kabuklarının atılmış olduğu, ezilmiş çiçeklerle kirlenmiş yolda bir ileri bir geri gidip gelmeye başladı.
es: Se interrumpió y empezó a pasear, arriba y abajo, por un sendero desolado de cáscaras de fruta, favores negados y flores aplastadas.
vi_translation: Gatsby was silent, then paced back and forth on the desolate ground littered with fruit peels and crushed flower branches.
tr_translation: He couldn't continue, and started pacing back and forth on the road littered with discarded fruit peels and crushed flowers.
es_translation: He stopped and began to pace up and down a desolate path of fruit peels, denied favors, and crushed flowers.

en: “I wouldn’t ask too much of her,” I ventured. “You can’t repeat the past.”
vi: "Nếu là tôi thì tôi sẽ không đòi hỏi gì nhiều quá ở Daisy." Tôi đánh bạo. "Anh không thể lập lại những gì trong quá khứ."
tr: “Yerinde olsam çok fazla beklentiye girmezdim” dedim cesa­retimi toplayarak, “geçmiş, geçmişte kalmıştır, geri getiremezsin.
es: —Yo no le pediría demasiado —me atreví a decirle—. No podemos repetir el pasado.
vi_translation: "If it were me, I wouldn't ask too much of Daisy." I ventured. "You can't repeat the past."
tr_translation: “If I were you, I wouldn't get my hopes up too much,” I said, gathering my courage, “the past is in the past, you can't bring it back.”
es_translation: —I wouldn't ask too much of her —I dared to say to him—. We can't repeat the past.

en: “Can’t repeat the past?” he cried incredulously. “Why of course you can!”
vi: "Không thể lập lại những việc trong quá khứ?" Gatsby kêu lên ngờ vực. "Đương nhiên là có thể."
tr: “Geri getiremez miyiz!” diye çıkıştı kuşkuyla, “Hayır, tabii ki yapabiliriz.
es: —¿No podemos repetir el pasado? —exclamó, incrédulo—. ¡Claro que podemos!
vi_translation: "Can't repeat the past?" Gatsby exclaimed incredulously. "Of course you can."
tr_translation: “Can't we bring it back!” he exclaimed with suspicion, “No, of course we can.”
es_translation: —Can't we repeat the past? —he exclaimed, incredulous—. Of course we can!

en: He looked around him wildly, as if the past were lurking here in the shadow of his house, just out of reach of his hand.
vi: Gatsby nhìn chung quanh mình một cách ngớ ngác làm như cái quá khứ đang ẩn náu rình mò đâu đây trong bóng tối của căn nhà, ngoài vòng tay với của anh.
tr: Sanki o geçmiş evinin karanlık bir kuytusunda gizlenmiş de uzansa dokunacakmış gibi, çevresini çılgın bakışlarla süzdü, “Bunu yapacağım, her şeyi eski haline döndüreceğim,” dedi, inançla başını sallayarak, “Bunu o da görecek!
es: Miró a todas partes, frenético, como si el pasado se escondiera entre las sombras de la casa, casi al alcance de la mano.
vi_translation: Gatsby looked around himself in a bewildered manner, as if the past were lurking somewhere in the shadows of the house, just out of his reach.
tr_translation: As if it were hidden in a dark corner of his past home, he scanned his surroundings with wild eyes, as if reaching out would touch it, "I will do this, I will restore everything to its former state," he said, nodding his head with conviction, "He will see this too!"
es_translation: He looked everywhere, frantic, as if the past were hiding among the shadows of the house, almost within reach.

en: “I’m going to fix everything just the way it was before,” he said, nodding determinedly. “She’ll see.”
vi: "Tôi sẽ chỉnh đốn hết mọi thứ lại làm cho chúng giống như ngày xưa." Gatsy gật mạnh đầu nói một cách kiên quyết. "Cô ấy sẽ thấy."
tr: Sanki o geçmiş evinin karanlık bir kuytusunda gizlenmiş de uzansa dokunacakmış gibi, çevresini çılgın bakışlarla süzdü, “Bunu yapacağım, her şeyi eski haline döndüreceğim,” dedi, inançla başını sallayarak, “Bunu o da görecek!
es: —Voy a devolver cada cosa a su sitio, tal como estaba antes —dijo, y asintió con la cabeza, muy decidido—. Daisy lo verá.
vi_translation: "I will straighten everything out and make them like they were in the past." Gatsby nodded firmly and said resolutely. "She will see."
tr_translation: As if it were hidden in a dark corner of his past home, he scanned his surroundings with wild eyes, as if reaching out would touch it, "I will do this, I will restore everything to its former state," he said, nodding his head with conviction, "He will see this too!"
es_translation: "I am going to return everything to its place, just as it was before," he said, nodding his head very decisively. Daisy will see it.

en: He talked a lot about the past, and I gathered that he wanted to recover something, some idea of himself perhaps, that had gone into loving Daisy. His life had been confused and disordered since then, but if he could once return to a certain starting place and go over it all slowly, he could find out what that thing was…
vi: Gatsby kể rất nhiều về quá khứ, tôi nhận ra anh dường như đang muốn tìm lại một cái gì đó, có lẽ là những suy nghĩ cho riêng bản thân, những thứ mà anh đã đánh mất từ khi yêu Daisy. Cuộc đời của anh ta đã trở nên lẫn lộn và lộn xộn từ thủa đó, nếu anh có thể quay trở về một thời điểm bắt đầu nào đó trong quá khứ và để nó trôi qua đi một cách thật chậm, anh có thể khám phá ra cái đó là cái gì........
tr: Sonra, uzun süre geçmişten konuştu; sanki kendisiyle, Daisy’e aşıkken gitmesiyle ilgili bir şeyleri onarmaya çalışmak istiyordu. Sonraki hayatı düzensiz ve karmakarışıktı; Ancak geçmişte belirli bir zamana kadar geri dönüp, sonra tüm o günlerin üzerinden yavaş yavaş, yeniden ilerlerse aradığını bulacağından ümitliydi.
es: Habló mucho del pasado, y llegué a la conclusión de que quería recuperar algo, cierta idea de sí mismo, quizá, que dependía de su amor a Daisy. Había llevado desde entonces una vida confusa y desordenada, pero si podía volver al punto de partida y revisarlo todo despacio, descubriría qué era lo que buscaba.
vi_translation: Gatsby talked a lot about the past, I realized he seemed to be trying to find something, perhaps thoughts for himself, things he had lost since loving Daisy. His life had become confused and chaotic since then, if he could go back to some starting point in the past and let it pass by slowly, he might discover what that something was........
tr_translation: Then, he talked about the past for a long time; it was as if he wanted to fix something about himself, related to leaving when he was in love with Daisy. His later life was disordered and chaotic; however, he was hopeful that if he could go back to a certain time in the past and then slowly move forward through all those days again, he would find what he was looking for.
es_translation: He spoke a lot about the past, and I came to the conclusion that he wanted to recover something, a certain idea of himself, perhaps, that depended on his love for Daisy. Since then, he had led a confused and disordered life, but if he could go back to the starting point and review everything slowly, he would discover what he was looking for.

en: … One autumn night, five years before, they had been walking down the street when the leaves were falling, and they came to a place where there were no trees and the sidewalk was white with moonlight. They stopped here and turned toward each other. Now it was a cool night with that mysterious excitement in it which comes at the two changes of the year. The quiet lights in the houses were humming out into the darkness and there was a stir and bustle among the stars. Out of the corner of his eye Gatsby saw that the blocks of the sidewalks really formed a ladder and mounted to a secret place above the trees—he could climb to it, if he climbed alone, and once there he could suck on the pap of life, gulp down the incomparable milk of wonder.
vi: Một đêm mùa thu năm năm về trước, hai người họ đã sóng bước trên đường phố dưới những hàng cây lá rụng. Họ bước tới một chỗ không có cây và cả hè đường bừng sáng dưới ánh trăng. Họ đã ngừng lại ở đó đối diện nhau. Buổi tối mát lạnh chứa đựng những xao xuyến đầy bí ẩn mỗi năm chỉ đến hai lần vào lúc giao mùa. Ánh đèn êm ả từ những căn nhà mơn man tỏa ra ngoài bóng tối và có gì đó như lay động, như xôn xao giữa những vì sao. Qua khoé mắt của mình, Gatsby nhìn thấy những những viên đá lát hè đường đang chuyển mình xếp lên nhau biến thành chiếc thang dựng leo lên tới một chỗ bí mật nào đó trên đỉnh những ngọn cây. Nếu như một mình, anh có thể trèo lên nó. Một khi đã lên tới nơi, anh có thể mút lấy cái núm vú của cuộc đời và nuốt chửng từng ngụm lớn dòng sữa diệu kỳ vô sánh.
tr: Beş yıl önce, yaprakların döküldüğü bir sonbahar gecesinde, sokaklarda gezinirken ağaçsız bir caddeye gelip, ay ışığının aydınlattığı bir kaldırımda durmuşlardı. Dönüp birbirlerinin yüzüne bakmışlardı. Yılda İki kez, ancak mevsimler dönerken karşılaşılan, o gizemli coşku serin geceye hakim olmuştu. Evlerin pencerelerindeki cılız ışıklar gecenin karanlığına süzülürken, yıldızlar sanki telaş içinde, durmaksızın kıpırdanıyordu; Gatsby gözünün ucuyla baktığında, gerçekten de kaldırım taşlarından oluşan bir merdivenin, ağaçların tepesindeki gizli bir diyara doğru tırmandığını görmüştü. Oraya bir tırmanabilseydi, zirvede onu bekleyen yaşamın özünü içine çekip, mucizelerin eşsiz sütünden de yudumlayabilirdi.
es: … Una noche de otoño, cinco años antes, paseaban por la calle, y caían las hojas, y llegaron a un sitio donde no había árboles y la acera era blanca a la luz de la luna. Se pararon allí y se miraron. Ya hacía frío y la noche tenía esa emoción misteriosa que se siente en los cambios de estación. Las luces silenciosas de las casas vibraban en la oscuridad y había un temblor, una agitación entre las estrellas. De reojo vio Gatsby que los adoquines de la acera formaban un camino que se elevaba hasta un lugar secreto, más allá de las copas de los árboles. Si subía solo, lo subiría, y una vez arriba podría mamar de la ubre de la vida, tragar la leche incomparable de la maravilla.
vi_translation: One autumn night five years ago, the two of them walked side by side on the street under the falling leaves. They walked to a place without trees and the whole sidewalk lit up under the moonlight. They stopped there facing each other. The cool evening contained mysterious stirrings that came only twice a year at the change of seasons. The gentle light from the houses softly spread out into the darkness, and there was something like a tremor, like a stir among the stars. Out of the corner of his eye, Gatsby saw the paving stones of the sidewalk shifting, stacking up to form a ladder reaching to some secret place atop the trees. If he were alone, he could climb it. Once at the top, he could suck on the nipple of life and gulp down great draughts of its incomparable milk.
tr_translation: Five years ago, on an autumn night when the leaves were falling, while wandering the streets, they came to a treeless avenue and stopped on a sidewalk illuminated by the moonlight. They turned and looked into each other's faces. That mysterious excitement, encountered only twice a year when the seasons change, had dominated the cool night. As the faint lights in the windows of the houses filtered into the darkness of the night, the stars seemed to be in a hurry, constantly twinkling; when Gatsby glanced out of the corner of his eye, he had indeed seen a staircase made of cobblestones climbing towards a hidden realm at the tops of the trees. If he could have climbed there, he could have absorbed the essence of life waiting for him at the peak and sipped the unique milk of miracles.
es_translation: … One autumn night, five years before, they were walking down the street, and the leaves were falling, and they reached a place where there were no trees and the sidewalk was white in the moonlight. They stopped there and looked at each other. It was already cold and the night had that mysterious emotion that is felt during the changes of season. The silent lights of the houses vibrated in the darkness and there was a tremor, an agitation among the stars. Out of the corner of his eye, Gatsby saw that the cobblestones of the sidewalk formed a path that rose to a secret place, beyond the treetops. If he climbed it alone, he would climb it, and once at the top, he could suckle from the udder of life, swallow the incomparable milk of wonder.

en: His heart beat faster as Daisy’s white face came up to his own. He knew that when he kissed this girl, and forever wed his unutterable visions to her perishable breath, his mind would never romp again like the mind of God. So he waited, listening for a moment longer to the tuning-fork that had been struck upon a star. Then he kissed her. At his lips’ touch she blossomed for him like a flower and the incarnation was complete.
vi: Tim của Gatsby đập càng lúc càng nhanh khi khuôn mặt trắng ngần của Daisy cúi sát lại gần mặt mình. Gatsby biết rằng khi anh ta cúi hôn người con gái này thì mãi mãi những viễn ảnh không thể nói thành lời của anh sẽ gắn liền với hơi thở dễ tàn rụi của nàng. Tâm trí của anh sẽ không bao giờ được thanh thản như tâm trí của thượng đế. Bởi vậy anh đã ngừng lại chờ đợi, lắng nghe thêm một chút lâu hơn tiếng chiếc âm thoa gõ nhẹ lên trên các vì sao. Và rồi anh cũng đã hôn Daisy. Khi đôi môi của anh khẽ chạm thì Daisy hé nở ra như một đóa hoa và thế là sự hóa thân đã thành trọn vẹn.
tr: Daisy’nin aydınlık yüzü kendisininkine yaklaşırken, kalbi delicesine çarpıyordu. Onu öpüp de o tarifsiz düşlerini onun fani nefesine teslim ettikten sonra, zihnindekiler bir daha asla, Tanrı’nın zihnindekiler gibi coşup oynamayacaktı, Bir diyapazonun bir yıldıza vuran sesini dinleyerek bu düşüncelerle bir an bekledi. Sonra onu öptü. Dudakları kavuştuğu anda, kız onun için bir çiçek gibi açmış ve yaradılış tamamlanmıştı.
es: Su corazón latía cada vez más deprisa mientras la cara blanca de Daisy se acercaba a la suya. Sabía que, cuando besara a aquella chica y uniera para siempre sus visiones inexpresables a su aliento perecedero, su mente no volvería jamás a volar como la mente de Dios. Así que esperó, y oyó unos segundos más el diapasón que acababa de golpear contra una estrella. Luego la besó. Y, al roce de sus labios, ella se abrió como una flor y la encarnación fue completa.
vi_translation: Gatsby's heart beat faster and faster as Daisy's pale face drew closer to his. Gatsby knew that when he kissed this girl, the ineffable visions he had would forever be entwined with her perishable breath. His mind would never be as serene as the mind of God. So he paused, waiting, listening a little longer to the tuning fork that had been struck upon a star. And then he kissed Daisy. At the touch of his lips, Daisy blossomed for him like a flower and the incarnation was complete.
tr_translation: As Daisy's radiant face approached his, his heart was pounding wildly. After kissing her and surrendering his indescribable dreams to her mortal breath, his thoughts would never again surge and play like those in God's mind. Listening to the sound of a tuning fork striking a star, he waited with these thoughts for a moment. Then he kissed her. At the moment their lips met, the girl blossomed for him like a flower, and creation was complete.
es_translation: His heart was beating faster and faster as Daisy's pale face came closer to his. He knew that, when he kissed that girl and forever bound his ineffable visions to her perishable breath, his mind would never again soar like the mind of God. So he waited, and for a few more seconds heard the tuning fork that had just struck a star. Then he kissed her. And at the touch of his lips, she blossomed like a flower and the incarnation was complete.

en: Through all he said, even through his appalling sentimentality, I was reminded of something—an elusive rhythm, a fragment of lost words, that I had heard somewhere a long time ago. For a moment a phrase tried to take shape in my mouth and my lips parted like a dumb man’s, as though there was more struggling upon them than a wisp of startled air. But they made no sound, and what I had almost remembered was uncommunicable forever.
vi: Qua tất cả những gì Gatsby nói, dù là chỉ qua cái tính đa cảm ủy mị của anh, làm tôi tự nhiên nhớ lại cái gì đó - như là một nhịp điệu đã bị lãng quên hoặc dăm ba chữ trong một câu nói mà tôi nghe được từ thủa xa xưa. Trong chốc lát, những câu nói này bắt đầu hình thành trong miệng tôi và môi của tôi hé mở ra như một thằng ngốc, giống như là một cuộc vật lộn với chúng hơn là một làn làn hơi thở run rẩy. Thế nhưng chúng không tạo nên âm thanh nào, và cái mà tôi nhớ ra gần được hết đã không bao giờ được nói ra.
tr: Ürkütücü duygusallığına rağmen, o bunları anlatırken bir şeyleri anımsamıştım; kim bilir ne vakit duymuş olduğum, çıkaramadığım bir melodi ile kayıp birkaç sözcük… Bir an ağzımın içinde bir sözcük biçimlenecek oldu. Sanki dilimin ucunda, ona dokunan bir tutam havadan fazlası varmışçasına, bir dilsiz misali beyhude kıpırdandı dudaklarım. Hayal meyal anımsadığım o sözcükler, söylenemeden kalakaldı.
es: Todo lo que dijo, incluido su espantoso sentimentalismo, me recordaba algo: un ritmo esquivo, un fragmento de palabras olvidadas que había oído no sé dónde, hacía mucho. Una frase trató de tomar forma en mi boca y mis labios se abrieron como los de un mudo, como si se les resistiera algo más que un asustado soplo de aire. Pero no emitieron ningún sonido, y lo que había estado a punto de recordar se convirtió en incomunicable para siempre.
vi_translation: Through everything Gatsby said, even through his sentimental and mawkish nature, it naturally reminded me of something - like a forgotten rhythm or a few words in a sentence I had heard from long ago. For a moment, these words began to form in my mouth and my lips parted like an idiot, as if struggling with them rather than a trembling breath. Yet they made no sound, and what I almost remembered was never spoken.
tr_translation: Despite its eerie sentimentality, as he was recounting these, I remembered something; a melody I had heard who knows when, and a few lost words I couldn't place... For a moment, a word began to form in my mouth. As if there was more than just a wisp of air touching my tongue, my lips moved in vain like a mute person. The words I vaguely remembered remained unsaid.
es_translation: Everything he said, including his dreadful sentimentality, reminded me of something: an elusive rhythm, a fragment of forgotten words that I had heard somewhere, a long time ago. A phrase tried to take shape in my mouth and my lips opened like those of a mute, as if something more than a frightened breath of air resisted them. But they made no sound, and what I had been about to remember became incommunicable forever.

en: “Is Mr. Gatsby sick?”
vi: "Bộ ông Gatsby bị bịnh hả?"
tr: ÇN “Bay Gatsby rahatsız mı?
es: —¿Está enfermo mister Gatsby?
vi_translation: "Is Mr. Gatsby sick?"
tr_translation: Translator's Note “Is Mr. Gatsby uncomfortable?”
es_translation: —Is Mr. Gatsby sick?

en: “Nope.” After a pause he added “sir” in a dilatory, grudging way.
vi: "Không." Sau khi ngừng một chút anh ta miễn cưỡng nói thêm hai chữ "Thưa ông" bằng một giọng hằn học.
tr: “Yo, hayır” dedikten sonra biraz zorla da olsa, “efendim” söz­cüğünü ekledi.
es: —De eso nada —después de una pausa, resistiéndose y a regañadientes, añadió «señor».
vi_translation: "No." After a brief pause, he reluctantly added the words "Sir" in a resentful tone.
tr_translation: After saying "No," he added the word "sir" with some difficulty.
es_translation: —None of that —after a pause, resisting and reluctantly, he added "sir."

en: “I hadn’t seen him around, and I was rather worried. Tell him Mr. Carraway came over.”
vi: "Độ này tôi không thấy anh ta cho nên cảm thấy hơi lo lắng. Nhờ ông nhắn lại có anh Carraway sang thăm."
tr: “Epeydir görünmedi de, merak ettim. Bay Carraway’in geldiğini söylersin.
es: —No lo veo por aquí, y estaba preocupado. Dígale que ha venido mister Carraway.
vi_translation: "Lately, I haven't seen him, so I feel a bit worried. Please tell Mr. Carraway to come visit."
tr_translation: “He hasn't been seen for a while, so I got worried. You say Mr. Carraway has arrived.”
es_translation: —I don't see him around here, and I was worried. Tell him that Mr. Carraway has come.

en: “Who?” he demanded rudely.
vi: "Ai?" Ông ta hỏi lại một cách bất lịch sự.
tr: “Kim?” diye sordu kaba bir tavırla.
es: —¿Quién? —preguntó, grosero.
vi_translation: "Who?" he asked rudely.
tr_translation: "Kim?" he asked in a rough manner.
es_translation: —Who? —he asked, rudely.

en: “Carraway. All right, I’ll tell him.”
vi: "Carraway.
tr: “Carraway. Tamam, peki söylerim.
es: —Carraway. Muy bien, se lo diré.
vi_translation: "Carraway." "Alright. I will leave a message."
tr_translation: “Carraway. Alright, okay, I'll tell him.”
es_translation: —Carraway. Very well, I will tell him.

en: Abruptly he slammed the door.
vi: Được rồi. Tôi sẽ nhắn lại." Ông ta đột ngột đóng sầm cửa.
tr: Kapıyı sertçe yüzüme kapattı.
es: Y sin más pegó un portazo.
vi_translation: He abruptly slammed the door shut.
tr_translation: He slammed the door in my face.
es_translation: And without another word, he slammed the door.

en: My Finn informed me that Gatsby had dismissed every servant in his house a week ago and replaced them with half a dozen others, who never went into West Egg village to be bribed by the tradesmen, but ordered moderate supplies over the telephone. The grocery boy reported that the kitchen looked like a pigsty, and the general opinion in the village was that the new people weren’t servants at all.
vi: Chị người làm Phần Lan của tôi cho hay rằng khoảng một tuần trước đây Gatsby đã cho sa thải hết những người làm trong nhà và thay vào đó khoảng một chục người khác. Những người này chưa từng bao giờ tới West Egg cho nên những người giao bán hàng khó có thể dụ dỗ hay hối lộ họ. Họ gọi mua rất nhiều thực phẩm qua điện thoại. Thằng bé giao hàng kể lại rằng nhà bếp giờ trông giống như chuồng heo, và những người khác trong làng đều cùng cho rằng tất cả những người làm mới này không phải ai cũng là người làm.
tr: Benim Finli, Gatsby’nin bir hafta evvel evde çalışan tüm hizmetlilere yol verdiğini, yerlerine aldığı altı kişinin West Egg esnafından rüşvet almamak için köye inmeyip telefonla makul miktarda yiyecek ve içecek ısmarladıklarını söyledi. Bakkalın çırağından mutfağın ahıra döndüğünü duyduğunu, ayrıca çevrede, yeni gelenlerin pek de hizmetçiye benzemediği fikrinin hakim olduğunu da eklemişti.
es: Mi finlandesa me informó de que Gatsby había despedido a todos los criados de la casa hacía una semana y los había sustituido por otros, que no iban ya al West Egg Village a que los tenderos los sobornaran, sino que hacían por teléfono pedidos muy moderados. El chico de la tienda de comestibles contaba que la cocina parecía una pocilga, y en el pueblo se había generalizado la opinión de que los recién llegados no eran criados en absoluto.
vi_translation: My Finnish housekeeper informed me that about a week ago, Gatsby had fired all the household staff and replaced them with about a dozen others. These people had never been to West Egg before, so the delivery men found it difficult to bribe or persuade them. They ordered a lot of food over the phone. The delivery boy reported that the kitchen now looked like a pigsty, and others in the village agreed that not all of these new workers were actually household staff.
tr_translation: My Finnish, that Gatsby had dismissed all the servants working at home a week ago, and that the six people he had hired in their place did not go down to the village to avoid taking bribes from the West Egg tradesmen, instead ordering a reasonable amount of food and drink by phone. She had heard from the grocer's apprentice that the kitchen had turned into a stable, and also added that the prevailing opinion in the neighborhood was that the newcomers did not quite resemble servants.
es_translation: My Finnish woman informed me that Gatsby had fired all the servants in the house a week ago and had replaced them with others, who no longer went to West Egg Village to be bribed by the shopkeepers, but instead made very modest orders by phone. The grocery store boy said that the kitchen looked like a pigsty, and the general opinion in the town was that the newcomers were not servants at all.

en: Next day Gatsby called me on the phone.
vi: Ngày hôm sau Gatsby gọi điện thoại cho tôi
tr: Ertesi gün Gatsby beni aradı.
es: Al día siguiente Gatsby me llamó por teléfono.
vi_translation: The next day Gatsby called me on the phone
tr_translation: The next day, Gatsby called me.
es_translation: The next day Gatsby called me on the phone.

en: “Going away?” I inquired.
vi: "Anh đi xa à?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “Bir yere mi gidiyorsun?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Te vas? —le pregunté.
vi_translation: "Are you going far?" I asked.
tr_translation: "Are you going somewhere?" I asked.
es_translation: —Are you leaving? —I asked him.

en: “No, old sport.”
vi: "Không phải vậy anh bạn già."
tr: “Hayır ahbap.
es: —No, compañero.
vi_translation: "It's not like that, old friend."
tr_translation: “No, buddy.”
es_translation: —No, comrade.

en: “I hear you fired all your servants.”
vi: "Tôi nghe nói anh đã sa thải hết những người giúp việc."
tr: “Hizmetçilerini işten çıkardığını duydum.
es: —Me han dicho que has despedido al servicio.
vi_translation: "I heard that you fired all the helpers."
tr_translation: “I heard that he fired his servants.”
es_translation: —I have been told that you have dismissed the service.

en: “I wanted somebody who wouldn’t gossip. Daisy comes over quite often—in the afternoons.”
vi: "Tôi muốn mướn những người làm không nhiều chuyện. Daisy đến đây thường xuyên, vào những buổi chiều."
tr: “Dedikodu yapmayacak kişiler istedim. Daisy öğleden sonraları, sık sık geli­yor malum.
es: —Necesitaba a gente que no anduviera con chismes. Daisy viene muy a menudo… por las tardes.
vi_translation: "I want to hire people who don't make much fuss." "Daisy comes here often, in the afternoons."
tr_translation: “I wanted people who wouldn't gossip. Daisy often comes in the afternoons, you know.”
es_translation: —I needed people who wouldn't gossip. Daisy comes very often... in the afternoons.

en: So the whole caravansary had fallen in like a card house at the disapproval in her eyes.
vi: Thì ra là vậy, nguyên cả căn nhà trọ này đã sụp đổ như một căn nhà xây bằng những lá bài chỉ vì ánh mắt không vừa lòng của người đẹp.
tr: Daisy’nin gözlerinde gördüğü hoşnutsuzluk yüzünden o koca kervansaray iskambil kağıdından yapılma evler gibi yıkılmıştı demek!
es: Daisy viene muy a menudo… por las tardes. Así que todo el caravanserrallo se había venido abajo como un castillo de naipes por una mirada de desaprobación de Daisy.
vi_translation: So that's how it is, the entire boarding house collapsed like a house built of cards just because of the displeased look from the beautiful woman.
tr_translation: So, the grand caravanserai had collapsed like houses made of playing cards because of the displeasure he saw in Daisy's eyes!
es_translation: So the entire caravanserai had come crashing down like a house of cards due to a disapproving look from Daisy.

en: “They’re some people Wolfshiem wanted to do something for. They’re all brothers and sisters. They used to run a small hotel.”
vi: "Họ là những người mà Wolfsheim muốn giúp đỡ. Tất cả bọn họ là anh chị em, lúc trước có điều hành một khách sạn nhỏ."
tr: “Yeni gelenler, Wolfsheim’in yardım etmek istediği bir aile aslında. Hepsi kardeş. Eskiden küçük bir otel işletiyorlarmış.
es: —Son gente a la que Wolfshiem quería ayudar. Son todos hermanos y hermanas. Llevaban un pequeño hotel.
vi_translation: "They are the people whom Wolfsheim wants to help. All of them are siblings, who used to run a small hotel."
tr_translation: "The newcomers are actually a family that Wolfsheim wants to help. They are all siblings. They used to run a small hotel."
es_translation: —They are people whom Wolfshiem wanted to help. They are all brothers and sisters. They ran a small hotel.

en: “I see.”
vi: "Vậy à."
tr: “Anladım.
es: —Ya.
vi_translation: "Is that so."
tr_translation: “I understand.”
es_translation: —Okay.

en: He was calling up at Daisy’s request—would I come to lunch at her house tomorrow? Miss Baker would be there. Half an hour later Daisy herself telephoned and seemed relieved to find that I was coming. Something was up. And yet I couldn’t believe that they would choose this occasion for a scene—especially for the rather harrowing scene that Gatsby had outlined in the garden.
vi: Gatsby gọi cho tôi, theo lời yêu cầu của Daisy, hỏi tôi có muốn tới nhà Daisy ngày hôm sau. Baker cũng sẽ có mặt ở đó. Nửa tiếng sau chính Daisy gọi điện thoại mời tôi và cảm thấy an lòng biết rằng tôi sẽ đến thăm. Tôi đoán sẽ có chuyện gì đây, nhưng tôi lại không thể tin được rằng họ có thể chọn lựa thời điểm này để gây chuyện, đặc biệt là chuyện rầy rà mà Gatsby đã phác họa cho tôi hay lúc ở ngoài vườn.
tr: Beni aramasını Daisy’nin rica ettiğini söyledi. Yarın Buchanan’lardaki öğle yemeğine gelir miydim? Bayan Baker da ora­da olacaktı. Yarım saat sonra Daisy de aradı. Geleceğimi duyunca çok sevindi. Bir şeyler dönüyordu. Ama olay çı­kartmak için o günü beklediklerini, hele Gatsby’nin o gece bahçede açıkladığı o garip planı uygulayacaklarını hiç sanmıyordum.
es: Daisy le había pedido que me llamara: ¿podía ir a comer mañana a casa de los Buchanan? Miss Baker también estaría allí. Media hora más tarde me llamó la propia Daisy y pareció aliviada cuando supo que iría. Algo iba a pasar, y, sin embargo, no creía que eligieran aquella ocasión para montar una escena: especialmente la escena horrorosa que Gatsby había ensayado en el jardín.
vi_translation: Gatsby called me, at Daisy's request, asking if I wanted to come to Daisy's house the next day. Baker would also be there. Half an hour later, Daisy herself called to invite me and felt reassured knowing that I would visit. I guessed something was up, but I couldn't believe they would choose this time to cause trouble, especially the kind of trouble Gatsby had outlined to me while we were in the garden.
tr_translation: He said that Daisy had asked him to call me. Would I come to lunch at the Buchanans' tomorrow? Miss Baker would also be there. Half an hour later, Daisy called as well. She was very happy to hear that I would come. Something was going on. But I didn't think they were waiting for that day to cause a scene, especially to carry out that strange plan Gatsby had explained in the garden that night.
es_translation: Daisy had asked her to call me: could I go to lunch tomorrow at the Buchanans' house? Miss Baker would also be there. Half an hour later, Daisy herself called me and seemed relieved when she found out I would go. Something was going to happen, and yet, I didn't think they would choose that occasion to create a scene: especially the horrible scene that Gatsby had rehearsed in the garden.

en: The next day was broiling, almost the last, certainly the warmest, of the summer. As my train emerged from the tunnel into sunlight, only the hot whistles of the National Biscuit Company broke the simmering hush at noon. The straw seats of the car hovered on the edge of combustion; the woman next to me perspired delicately for a while into her white shirtwaist, and then, as her newspaper dampened under her fingers, lapsed despairingly into deep heat with a desolate cry. Her pocketbook slapped to the floor.
vi: Ngày hôm sau trời nóng như lửa, có lẽ là ngày cuối cùng và cũng là ngày nóng nhất của mùa hè. Khi chuyến xe lửa tôi tôi vượt qua khỏi con đường hầm ra ngoài vùng ánh sáng, chẳng có gì ngoài những tiếng còi nóng bỏng của công ty National Biscuit phá tan bầu không khí nóng hừng hực đầy im lặng. Những chiếc ghế ngồi nhồi rơm trên toa xe gần như muốn bốc thành lửa. Người đàn bà ngồi cạnh tôi đổ đầy mồ hôi quanh vùng chiếc áo sơ mi trắng, sau đó, khi những trang báo mà bà ta đang đọc đã trở nên thẫm ướt dưới những ngón tay thì bà ta bật lên một tiếng than thở giữa cái nóng đầy hành hạ. Quyển sổ tay của bà ta rơi phật xuống sàn tàu.
tr: Ertesi gün hava öyle sıcaktı ki her yer kavruluyordu. Yazın kesinlikle en sıcak, belki de son sıcak günüydü. Bindiğim banli­yö treni tünelden geçip aydınlığa çıktığında, öğlen güneşinin dayanılmaz sıcaklığını yaran tek şey Ulusal Bisküvi Şirketi­‘nin fabrika bacasından çıkan keskin düdük sesiydi. Bulun­duğum vagonun hasır oturakları sıcaktan ateş gibi yanı­yordu. Yanımda oturan kadın beyaz bluzunun altında bir süre nazikçe terledikten sonra, parmaklarının arasındaki gazete sırılsıklam olunca umarsız bir çığlıkla aşırı sıcağa kendini teslim etti. Bu esnada da el çantasını yere düşürünce “Kahretsin!” diye bağırdı.
es: El día siguiente fue abrasador, casi el último del verano y sin duda el más caluroso. Cuando mi tren emergió del túnel, a la luz del sol, sólo la cálida sirena de la National Biscuit Company rompía el silencio hirviente del mediodía. Los asientos del tren se acercaban al punto de ignición; la mujer de al lado manchaba delicadamente de sudor su blusa blanca y luego, cuando el periódico se humedeció al tacto de sus dedos, se abandonó al calor insoportable con desesperación y un quejido desolado. El bolso se le cayó al suelo.
vi_translation: The next day was scorching hot, perhaps the last and hottest day of summer. When my train passed through the tunnel into the light, there was nothing but the scorching whistles of the National Biscuit Company shattering the sweltering, silent atmosphere. The straw-stuffed seats in the carriage seemed almost ready to catch fire. The woman sitting next to me was drenched in sweat around her white shirt, and then, when the pages of the newspaper she was reading became damp under her fingers, she let out a sigh amidst the oppressive heat. Her notebook fell with a thud to the floor of the train.
tr_translation: The next day, the weather was so hot that everywhere was scorching. It was definitely the hottest day of the summer, perhaps the last hot day. When the suburban train I was on emerged from the tunnel into the light, the only thing piercing the unbearable heat of the midday sun was the sharp whistle sound from the factory chimney of the National Biscuit Company. The wicker seats of the carriage I was in were burning hot from the heat. After sweating gently for a while under her white blouse, the woman sitting next to me surrendered to the extreme heat with a desperate cry when the newspaper between her fingers became soaking wet. At that moment, when she dropped her handbag to the ground, she shouted, "Damn it!"
es_translation: The next day was scorching, almost the last of summer and undoubtedly the hottest. When my train emerged from the tunnel, into the sunlight, only the warm siren of the National Biscuit Company broke the boiling silence of noon. The seats of the train were nearing the ignition point; the woman next to me delicately stained her white blouse with sweat and then, when the newspaper became damp at the touch of her fingers, she surrendered to the unbearable heat with despair and a desolate moan. Her purse fell to the floor.

en: I picked it up with a weary bend and handed it back to her, holding it at arm’s length and by the extreme tip of the corners to indicate that I had no designs upon it—but everyone near by, including the woman, suspected me just the same.
vi: Tôi mệt mỏi cúi xuống nhặt quyển sổ lên đưa lại cho bà ta, cầm nó một chút xíu ở bên góc và giữ một khoảng cách một cánh tay để chứng tỏ rằng tôi không có hiểm ý gì, thế nhưng những người chung quanh, kể cả người đàn bà đều nhìn tôi với nét nghi ngờ.
tr: Yorgun ve halsizdim ama eğilip çantayı yerden aldım, kadına uzattım. Kötü bir niyetim olmadığını göstermek için parmaklarımın ucuyla, kendimden uzak tutmaya özen göstermiştim. Ama yakınımızdaki herkes, kadın da dahil, gözlerini kuşkuyla bana dikmişti.
es: Lo recogí con una inclinación cansada y se lo devolví, sujetándolo por una esquina, por la punta, y alargando el brazo, para dejar claro que mi gesto no escondía segundas intenciones, pero todos los que estaban cerca, incluida la mujer, sospecharon de mí lo mismo.
vi_translation: I wearily bent down to pick up the notebook and handed it back to her, holding it slightly by the corner and keeping an arm's length distance to show that I had no ill intentions, yet the people around, including the woman, looked at me with suspicion.
