tr_translation: I was tired and exhausted, but I bent down, picked up the bag from the ground, and handed it to the woman. To show that I had no bad intentions, I had made sure to hold it by the fingertips, keeping it away from myself. But everyone around us, including the woman, had their eyes fixed on me with suspicion.
es_translation: I picked it up with a tired inclination and returned it to him, holding it by a corner, by the tip, and extending my arm to make it clear that my gesture did not hide any ulterior motives, but everyone nearby, including the woman, suspected the same of me.

en: “Hot!” said the conductor to familiar faces. “Some weather!… Hot!… Hot!… Hot!… Is it hot enough for you? Is it hot? Is it… ?”
vi: "Nóng quá!" Người xoát vé nói với những khuôn mặt quen thuộc. "Trời gì mà nóng quá, nóng! nóng! nóng! Nóng như vậy còn chưa đủ sao? Nóng quá phải không? Phải không...?"
tr: “Sıcak!” diye söylendi kondüktör tanıdık yüzlere bakarak, “Ne hava ama!Sıcak!Sıcak!... Sıcak! Size de sıcak geli­yor mu? Sıcak mı? Sıcak...
es: —¡Qué calor! —decía el revisor ante las caras que le resultaban conocidas—. ¡Qué tiempo! Qué calor, qué calor. ¿Les parece poco? ¿No tienen calor?
vi_translation: "It's so hot!" The ticket inspector said to the familiar faces. "Why is it so hot, hot! hot! hot! Isn't it hot enough already? It's so hot, isn't it? Isn't it...?"
tr_translation: “Hot!” muttered the conductor, looking at familiar faces, “What weather! Hot! Hot!... Hot! Does it feel hot to you too? Hot? Hot...”
es_translation: —What heat! —said the conductor in front of the faces that seemed familiar to him—. What weather! What heat, what heat. Do you think it's not much? Aren't you hot?

en: My commutation ticket came back to me with a dark stain from his hand. That anyone should care in this heat whose flushed lips he kissed, whose head made damp the pyjama pocket over his heart!
vi: Chiếc vé xe lửa của tôi được trả lại có dính dấu tay dơ của ông ta. Trong cái nóng kinh hoàng này có ai thèm để ý xem đôi môi đỏ hồng nào mình đã hôn hay cái đầu của ai dựa ướt đẫm chiếc ngực túi áo ngủ của mình.
tr: Biletimi geri verdiğinde üzerine parmak izinin çıktığını gördüm. Bu sıcakta insan kimin dudaklarını öptüğünü ya da pijamasının göğüs cebine kimin başını yasladığını umursar mı sizce!
es: Me devolvió el bono del tren con una mancha oscura que había dejado su mano. ¿Cómo podía importarle a nadie, con semejante calor, qué labios febriles besaba, o qué cabeza le humedecía el bolsillo del pijama, sobre el corazón?
vi_translation: My train ticket was returned with his dirty fingerprints on it. In this dreadful heat, who cares to notice which rosy lips they have kissed or whose head is drenched on their pajama chest pocket.
tr_translation: When he returned my ticket, I saw that his fingerprint was on it. In this heat, do you think anyone cares whose lips they've kissed or whose head they've rested on the chest pocket of their pajamas!
es_translation: He returned the train voucher to me with a dark stain that his hand had left. How could anyone care, in such heat, whose feverish lips they kissed, or whose head dampened the pocket of their pajamas, over their heart?

en: … Through the hall of the Buchanans’ house blew a faint wind, carrying the sound of the telephone bell out to Gatsby and me as we waited at the door.
vi: Một làn gió mát thổi xuyên qua tiền sảnh nhà Buchanan mang vọng theo tiếng điện thoại reo tới chỗ tôi và Gatsby lúc đó đang đứng đợi ở cửa.
tr: …Gatsby ile birlikte Buchanan’ların açık kapısı önünde beklerken salondan gelen hafif bir esinti, çalan telefonun zilinin sesini bize kadar getirdi.
es: Pero en el vestíbulo de la casa de los Buchanan soplaba una brisa suave, que llevó el sonido del teléfono hasta la puerta, donde esperábamos Gatsby y yo.
vi_translation: .... A cool breeze blew through the Buchanan's front hall, carrying the sound of a ringing phone to where Gatsby and I were standing, waiting at the door.
tr_translation: …While waiting with Gatsby in front of the open door of the Buchanans, a gentle breeze from the living room brought the sound of the ringing telephone to us.
es_translation: But in the vestibule of the Buchanan house, a gentle breeze blew, carrying the sound of the telephone to the door where Gatsby and I were waiting.

en: “The master’s body?” roared the butler into the mouthpiece. “I’m sorry, madame, but we can’t furnish it—it’s far too hot to touch this noon!”
vi: Người quản gia nói rống to lên vào trong ống nghe. "Tôi xin lỗi, thưa bà, nhưng chúng tôi không thể hoàn tất được - chiều nay trời nóng khủng khiếp không đụng vào được."
tr: “Beyefendinin vücudu mu dediniz?” diye bağırıyordu uşak ahizeye, “üzgünüm bayan ama bugün yapamayız, şu an öğle vakti ve sıcaktan hiçbir şeye dokunamıyoruz! ”6 6 Yazar cümlede trendeki sıcakla ilgili düşüncelerinin devamını uşağa söyleterek, okuyucuyu bu hayaline ortak ediyor. Daha sonraki satırda ise uşağın telefondaki gerçek konuşmasını aktarıyor. ÇN
es: —¡El cadáver del señor! —rugió el mayordomo al aparato—. Lo lamento, señora, pero no se lo podemos entregar. ¡Está demasiado caliente para tocarlo en pleno mediodía!
vi_translation: The butler shouted loudly into the receiver. "I'm sorry, madam, but we can't get it done - this afternoon is unbearably hot and we can't touch it."
tr_translation: “Did you say the gentleman's body?” the servant was shouting into the receiver, “I'm sorry ma'am, but we can't do it today, it's noon right now and we can't touch anything because of the heat!” 6 The author continues his thoughts about the heat in the train by having the servant express them, thus sharing this imagination with the reader. In the next line, he conveys the servant's real conversation on the phone. Translator's Note
es_translation: —The master's corpse! —roared the butler into the device—. I'm sorry, madam, but we cannot deliver it to you. It's too hot to touch it at midday!

en: What he really said was: “Yes… Yes… I’ll see.”
vi: Thật ra những gì anh ta nói chỉ là: "Dạ... dạ.... để tôi coi."
tr: Gerçekte ise, “Evet...,evet... anlıyorum” diyordu.
es: Lo que de verdad dijo fue: —Sí. Sí. Voy a ver.
vi_translation: Actually, what he said was just: "Yes... yes... let me see."
tr_translation: In reality, he was saying, "Yes... yes... I understand."
es_translation: What he really said was: —Yes. Yes. I'm going to see.

en: He set down the receiver and came toward us, glistening slightly, to take our stiff straw hats.
vi: Anh ta bỏ ống nghe xuống và bước ra gặp chúng tôi, đỡ lấy những chiếc nón rơm cứng ngắc của hai chúng tôi.
tr: Ahizeyi yerine koyduktan sonra hasır şapkalarımızı almak üzere yanımıza geldiğinde yüzü ter içindeydi.
es: Colgó y se acercó a nosotros, brillando de sudor, para coger nuestros sombreros de paja.
vi_translation: He put down the receiver and came out to meet us, taking our stiff straw hats.
tr_translation: When he came over to get our straw hats after putting the receiver back, his face was covered in sweat.
es_translation: He hung up and approached us, shining with sweat, to take our straw hats.

en: “Madame expects you in the salon!” he cried, needlessly indicating the direction. In this heat every extra gesture was an affront to the common store of life.
vi: "Bà chủ đang đợi hai ông ở trong nhà!" Anh ta nói lớn không buồn chỉ phương hướng. Ở trong cái nóng khủng khiếp này làm bất cứ thêm một cử chỉ nào cũng là một điều lăng nhục cho vốn dự trữ sức sống của mọi người.
tr: “Hanımefendi salonda bekliyor” dedi yersiz bir jestle yönümüzü gösterirken. Bu sıcakta fazladan yapılan her jest yaşam enerjisine bir hakaret gibiydi.
es: —¡Madame les espera en el salón! —gritó y, sin necesidad, nos señaló el camino. Con aquel calor cada gesto superfluo era una ofensa contra las normales reservas de vida.
vi_translation: "The hostess is waiting for you two inside!" he shouted without bothering to point the way. In this terrible heat, making any additional gesture is an insult to everyone's reserve of vitality.
tr_translation: “The lady is waiting in the living room,” he said, pointing us in the direction with an unnecessary gesture. In this heat, every extra gesture felt like an insult to one's life energy.
es_translation: —Madame is waiting for you in the living room! —she shouted and, unnecessarily, pointed the way for us. With that heat, every superfluous gesture was an offense against the normal reserves of life.

en: The room, shadowed well with awnings, was dark and cool. Daisy and Jordan lay upon an enormous couch, like silver idols weighing down their own white dresses against the singing breeze of the fans.
vi: Căn phòng được che mát bởi những mái hiên bằng vải bạt nên hơi tối và mát mẻ. Daisy và Jordan đang nằm trên chiếc ghế dựa khổng lồ, trông giống như hai tượng thần bằng bạc nằm chặn lên chiếc áo đầm trắng của họ để khỏi bị gió từ những chiếc quạt vi vu thổi bay.
tr: Panjurları sıkıca kapatılmış olan salon loş ve serindi. Daisy ve Jordan beyaz elbiseleriyle büyükçe bir kanepeye uzanmış, vantilatörlerin vızıldayan esintisine kendilerini bırakmışlardı. Gümüş heykellere benziyorlardı.
es: La habitación, a la sombra de los toldos, era oscura y fresca. Daisy y Jordan estaban echadas en un sofá enorme, como ídolos de plata que con su peso sujetaran sus vestidos blancos frente a la brisa cantarina de los ventiladores.
vi_translation: The room was shaded by canvas awnings, making it somewhat dark and cool. Daisy and Jordan were lying on a huge couch, looking like two silver idols resting on their white dresses to keep them from being blown away by the gentle breeze of the fans.
tr_translation: The living room, with its shutters tightly closed, was dim and cool. Daisy and Jordan, in their white dresses, were sprawled on a large couch, surrendering themselves to the buzzing breeze of the fans. They looked like silver statues.
es_translation: The room, in the shade of the awnings, was dark and cool. Daisy and Jordan were lying on a huge sofa, like silver idols whose weight held down their white dresses against the singing breeze of the fans.

en: “We can’t move,” they said together.
vi: "Tụi em không cử động nổi." Cà hai cùng lên tiếng một lần.
tr: “Kımıldayamıyoruz” diye bağırdılar ikisi bir ağızdan.
es: —No podemos movernos —dijeron al unísono.
vi_translation: "We can't move." Both of them spoke at once.
tr_translation: "We can't move," they shouted in unison.
es_translation: —We can't move —they said in unison.

en: Jordan’s fingers, powdered white over their tan, rested for a moment in mine.
vi: Những ngón tay đã được đánh phấn trắng trên làn da sạm nắng của Jordan để nghẹ lên trên những ngón tay của tôi
tr: Jordan terlememesi için pudraladığı bronz elini bir an için avucuma koydu.
es: Los dedos de Jordan, con polvos blanqueadores sobre el bronceado, descansaron un momento en los míos.
vi_translation: The fingers, powdered white on Jordan's sun-tanned skin, pressed lightly against my fingers
tr_translation: Jordan placed his bronze hand, which he had powdered to prevent sweating, in my palm for a moment.
es_translation: Jordan's fingers, with whitening powders over the tan, rested for a moment on mine.

en: “And Mr. Thomas Buchanan, the athlete?” I inquired.
vi: "Còn anh Thomas Buchanan nhà lực sĩ đâu rồi?" Tôi hỏi.
tr: “Ünlü atlet Bay Thomas Buchanan nerdeler?” diye sordum.
es: —¿Y mister Tom Buchanan, el atleta? —pregunté.
vi_translation: "And where is the athlete Thomas Buchanan?" I asked.
tr_translation: "Where is the famous athlete Mr. Thomas Buchanan?" I asked.
es_translation: —And Mr. Tom Buchanan, the athlete? —I asked.

en: Simultaneously I heard his voice, gruff, muffled, husky, at the hall telephone.
vi: Ngay khi đó tôi nghe giọng nói của Tom, cộc cằn thô lỗ, nghèn nghẹn, khàn khàn đang nói điện thoại trong h ành lang.
tr: Aynı anda Tom’un içeride telefonla konuşan boğuk ve kısık sesini duyduk.
es: Simultáneamente oí la voz de Tom, malhumorada, apagada, ronca, en el teléfono del vestíbulo.
vi_translation: Right then I heard Tom's voice, rough and rude, hoarse and raspy, talking on the phone in the h hallway.
tr_translation: At the same time, we heard Tom's muffled and low voice talking on the phone inside.
es_translation: Simultaneously I heard Tom's voice, grumpy, muffled, hoarse, on the lobby phone.

en: Gatsby stood in the centre of the crimson carpet and gazed around with fascinated eyes. Daisy watched him and laughed, her sweet, exciting laugh; a tiny gust of powder rose from her bosom into the air.
vi: Gatsby đứng ngay giữa chiếc thảm đỏ thẫm chăm chăm nhìn chung quanh bằng đôi mắt say mê. Daisy ngắm nhìn anh ta và bật cười, tiếng cười đầy ngọt ngào vui tươi. Một chút bụi phấn từ trên ngực của nàng bay lên trong không gian.
tr: Gatsby kırmızı halının ortasında durmuş, büyülenmiş gibi etrafına bakınıyordu. Daisy ona bakıp o tatlı, heyecan veren kahkahalarından birini atarken, göğsünden yükselen ince bir pudra tozu havaya karıştı.
es: Gatsby, de pie en el centro de la alfombra carmesí, miraba todo con ojos fascinados. Daisy, observándolo, se rió, con su risa dulce y excitante: una ráfaga mínima de polvos rosa se alzó de su pecho.
vi_translation: Gatsby stood right in the middle of the deep red carpet, gazing around with passionate eyes. Daisy looked at him and burst into laughter, a sound full of sweet joy. A bit of powder dust from her chest floated up into the air.
tr_translation: Gatsby was standing in the middle of the red carpet, looking around as if mesmerized. As Daisy looked at him and let out one of her sweet, thrilling laughs, a fine puff of powder rose from her chest and mingled with the air.
es_translation: Gatsby, standing in the center of the crimson carpet, looked at everything with fascinated eyes. Daisy, watching him, laughed with her sweet and exciting laugh: a tiny puff of pink powder rose from her chest.

en: “The rumour is,” whispered Jordan, “that that’s Tom’s girl on the telephone.”
vi: "Theo như đồn đại," Jordan thì thầm, "thì người trong điện thoại là cô bồ của Tom."
tr: “Sürekli arayan kişinin Tom’un kız arkadaşı olduğu söyleniyor” diye fısıldadı Jordan kulağıma.
es: —Corre el rumor —murmuró Jordan— de que la que está al teléfono es la chica de Tom.
vi_translation: "According to the rumors," Jordan whispered, "the person on the phone is Tom's mistress."
tr_translation: “The person who keeps calling is said to be Tom's girlfriend,” Jordan whispered in my ear.
es_translation: —There's a rumor —murmured Jordan— that the one on the phone is Tom's girl.

en: We were silent. The voice in the hall rose high with annoyance: “Very well, then, I won’t sell you the car at all… I’m under no obligations to you at all… and as for your bothering me about it at lunch time, I won’t stand that at all!”
vi: Tất cả chúng tôi đều im lặng. Tiếng nói từ trong hành lang cất cao hơn mang đầy vẻ bực bôi. "Nếu như thế tôi sẽ không bán cho anh chiếc xe nữa. Tôi không bị ràng buộc gì phải bán nó cho anh cả... Về chuyện anh gọi quấy rầy tôi trong giờ ăn trưa như thế này thì tôi không thể chịu được."
tr: Hepimiz susmuş bekliyorduk. Holden gelen ses öfkeyle yük­seldi. “Tamam öyleyse, ben de o arabayı sana satmayaca­ğım… bunu yapmak zorunda değilim... ayrıca bu ko­nuda beni yemek vakti rahatsız etmene de katlanmayacağım!
es: Guardamos silencio. La voz del vestíbulo se elevó irritada: —Muy bien, entonces. No le vendo el coche, de ninguna forma… No tengo ningún compromiso con usted… ¡Y no tolero, de ninguna forma, que me moleste a la hora de comer!
vi_translation: We were all silent. The voice from the hallway rose louder, full of irritation. "If that's the case, I won't sell you the car anymore. I'm not obligated to sell it to you... Regarding you calling and disturbing me during lunch like this, I can't tolerate it."
tr_translation: We were all silently waiting. The voice coming from the hallway rose in anger. “Alright then, I won't sell you that car either...I don't have to do this... and I won't tolerate you bothering me about it during meal time!”
es_translation: We remained silent. The voice from the lobby rose irritably: —Very well, then. I am not selling you the car, in any way... I have no commitment to you... And I do not tolerate, in any way, being disturbed during my meal!

en: “Holding down the receiver,” said Daisy cynically.
vi: "Thì bỏ ống nghe xuống đi." Daisy nói một cách nghi ngờ.
tr: “Ahizenin ağzını kapatıyor” diyerek alay etti Daisy.
es: —Tiene tapado el micrófono del teléfono —dijo Daisy cínicamente.
vi_translation: "Then put the receiver down." Daisy said suspiciously.
tr_translation: "Shutting the mouth of the fool," Daisy mocked.
es_translation: —You have the phone microphone covered —said Daisy cynically.

en: “No, he’s not,” I assured her. “It’s a bona-fide deal. I happen to know about it.”
vi: "Không, anh ta không có đâu." Tôi trấn an nàng. "Đây là một việc buôn bán chân thật. Tôi tình cờ biết được chuyện này."
tr: “Hayır yapmıyor” diye güvence verdim, “bu gerçek bir iş görüşmesi, benim de haberim var.
es: —No —le aseguré—. Está negociando de verdad. Conozco el asunto.
vi_translation: "No, he doesn't have it." I reassured her. "This is an honest business. I happened to know about this."
tr_translation: "No, he isn't," I assured, "this is a real job interview, I am aware of it too."
es_translation: —No —I assured him—. He is genuinely negotiating. I know the matter.

en: Tom flung open the door, blocked out its space for a moment with his thick body, and hurried into the room.
vi: Tom mở tông cánh cửa đi vào, trong khoảng khắc, tấm thân to lớn chắn ngang cả khoảng không gian nơi khung cửa, rồi sau đó vội vã đi vào phòn
tr: Kapıyı hışımla açan Tom, kalın gövdesiyle bir an eşikte dur­duktan sonra hızla odaya daldı.
es: Tom abrió de golpe la puerta, la bloqueó unos segundos con su cuerpo abundante y entró atropelladamente en la habitación.
vi_translation: Tom opened the door and walked in. For a moment, his large frame blocked the entire doorway, then he hurried into the room.
tr_translation: Tom, who opened the door with a rush, stood at the threshold for a moment with his thick body, then quickly entered the room.
es_translation: Tom suddenly opened the door, blocked it for a few seconds with his ample body, and rushed into the room.

en: “Mr. Gatsby!” He put out his broad, flat hand with well-concealed dislike. “I’m glad to see you, sir… Nick…”
vi: "Chào anh Gatsby!" Tom giơ bàn tay bè rộng ra chào khéo léo che dấu vẻ ghét bỏ. "Tôi vui mừng được gặp anh, thưa anh.... Chào Nick."
tr: “Bay Gatsby” diyerek iri, yassı elini uzattı. Ondan pek de hoşlanmadığını iyi gizliyordu, “sizi gördüğüme sevindim bayım... Nick, merhaba...
es: —¡Mister Gatsby! —le tendió la mano, ancha y abierta, con fastidio bien disimulado—. Me alegro de verlo… Nick…
vi_translation: "Hello Gatsby!" Tom extended his broad hand in greeting, skillfully masking his disdain. "I am pleased to meet you, sir.... Hello Nick."
tr_translation: “Mr. Gatsby,” he said, extending his large, flat hand. He was good at hiding that he didn't quite like him, “I'm glad to see you, sir... Nick, hello...”
es_translation: —Mr. Gatsby! —he extended his hand, broad and open, with well-disguised annoyance—. I'm glad to see you… Nick…

en: “Make us a cold drink,” cried Daisy.
vi: "Làm cho mọi người nước gì lạnh uống đi." Daisy nói to.
tr: “Bize içecek soğuk bir şeyler hazırlasana” diye seslendi Daisy.
es: —Prepáranos algo frío para beber —ordenó Daisy.
vi_translation: "Make everyone a cold drink." Daisy said loudly.
tr_translation: "Why don't you prepare us something cold to drink?" Daisy called out.
es_translation: "Prepare us something cold to drink," ordered Daisy.

en: As he left the room again she got up and went over to Gatsby and pulled his face down, kissing him on the mouth.
vi: Khi Tom rời khỏi phòng, Daisy đứng lên đi lại phía Gatsby, kéo khuôn mặt của anh xuống và hôn lên môi.
tr: Tom odadan çıkınca da ayağa kalkıp Gatsby’nin yanına git­ti, yüzünü onunkine yaklaştırarak dudağından öptü.
es: Se levantó cuando Tom salió de la habitación, se acercó a Gatsby, le hizo inclinar la cabeza y lo besó en la boca.
vi_translation: When Tom left the room, Daisy stood up, walked over to Gatsby, pulled his face down, and kissed him on the lips.
tr_translation: When Tom left the room, she stood up and went to Gatsby, bringing her face close to his and kissed him on the lips.
es_translation: She stood up when Tom left the room, approached Gatsby, made him tilt his head, and kissed him on the mouth.

en: “You know I love you,” she murmured.
vi: "Anh biết em yêu anh phải không." Daisy thì thầm.
tr: “Seni sevdiği­mi biliyorsun” diye mırıldandı.
es: —Sabes que te quiero —murmuró.
vi_translation: "You know I love you, don't you." Daisy whispered.
tr_translation: "You know that I love you," she murmured.
es_translation: —You know I love you —he murmured.

en: “You forget there’s a lady present,” said Jordan.
vi: "Chị quên rằng ở đây đang có sự hiện diện của một phụ nữ đó nghe." Jordan nói.
tr: “Burada bir kadın olduğunu unutuyorsun” dedi Jordan.
es: —Olvidas que hay una señora presente —dijo Jordan.
vi_translation: "You forget that there is a woman present here." Jordan said.
tr_translation: “You forget that there is a woman here,” said Jordan.
es_translation: —You forget that there is a lady present —said Jordan.

en: Daisy looked around doubtfully.
vi: Daisy nhìn quanh ra vẻ như ngờ vực.
tr: Daisy iki yana kuşkuyla baktı.
es: Daisy miró a su alrededor, dubitativa.
vi_translation: Daisy looked around with a doubtful expression.
tr_translation: Daisy looked around suspiciously.
es_translation: Daisy looked around, hesitant.

en: “You kiss Nick too.”
vi: "Em cũng hôn Nick vậy."
tr: “Sen de Nick’i öp o zaman” dedi.
es: —Besa tú a Nick.
vi_translation: "I also kissed Nick."
tr_translation: "Then you kiss Nick too," he said.
es_translation: —You kiss Nick.

en: “What a low, vulgar girl!”
vi: "Đúng thật là một cô gái thấp hèn thô tục làm sao."
tr: “Ne bayağı, ne basit bir kız bu.
es: —¡Qué chica tan grosera y tan vulgar!
vi_translation: "Indeed, she is such a lowly and vulgar girl." "You are so reckless!"
tr_translation: “She is neither vulgar nor simple.”
es_translation: —What a rude and vulgar girl! —I don't care!

en: “I don’t care!” cried Daisy, and began to clog on the brick fireplace. Then she remembered the heat and sat down guiltily on the couch just as a freshly laundered nurse leading a little girl came into the room.
vi: "Chị bất cần!" Daisy nói to, đứng che mặt chiếc lò sưởi gạch. Sau đó chợt nhớ tới cái nóng, Daisy ngồi xuống lại một cách hối hận vừa khi một người vú em ăn mặc tươm tất dẫn một đứa bé gái vào trong phòng.
tr: “Umurumda değil” diye bağırdı Daisy, tuğla şömi­nenin önünde bir süre beklerken. Sonra hava­nın ne kadar sıcak olduğunu hatırlayıp yüzünde suçlu bir ifadeyle yeniden kanepeye oturduğu sırada ütülü üniformasıyla bir dadı yanında küçük bir kızla içeri girdi.
es: —¡No me importa! —gritó Daisy y se puso a bailotear sobre los ladrillos de la chimenea. Luego se acordó del calor y se sentó en el sofá con aire de culpa en el instante en que una niñera muy limpia y recién planchada entró en la habitación con una niña.
vi_translation: Daisy shouted, standing in front of the brick fireplace. Then suddenly remembering the heat, Daisy sat back down regretfully just as a neatly dressed nanny led a little girl into the room.
tr_translation: “I don't care,” shouted Daisy, as she stood in front of the brick fireplace for a while. Then, remembering how hot it was, she sat back down on the couch with a guilty expression on her face, as a nanny in a pressed uniform entered with a little girl.
es_translation: —shouted Daisy and started to dance on the chimney bricks. Then he remembered the heat and sat on the sofa with a guilty look just as a very clean and freshly ironed nanny entered the room with a little girl.

en: “Bles-sed pre-cious,” she crooned, holding out her arms. “Come to your own mother that loves you.”
vi: "Con gái cưng của mẹ." Daisy nựng và ôm con gái vào lòng. "Đến đây mẹ thương con."
tr: “Kıymetlim benim” diyerek kollarını açtı Daisy, “hadi seni seven annene gel.
es: —¡Ben-di-ta pre-cio-si-dad! —tarareó Daisy, tendiéndole los brazos—. Ven con tu madre que te adora.
vi_translation: "Mommy's little girl." Daisy cuddled and hugged her daughter. "Come here, let mommy love you."
tr_translation: "My precious," Daisy said, opening her arms, "come to your loving mother."
es_translation: —Bless-ed pre-cious-ness! —hummed Daisy, extending her arms—. Come to your mother who adores you.

en: The child, relinquished by the nurse, rushed across the room and rooted shyly into her mother’s dress.
vi: Đứa trẻ rời tay người vú nuôi, chạy ào ngang căn phòng rồi thẹn thùng rúc vào trong áo mẹ.
tr: Dadısının elini bırakan çocuk koşarak annesine gitti, elbisesinin dibinde utanarak durdu.
es: La niña, libre de la niñera, atravesó corriendo la habitación y se cogió tímidamente del vestido de su madre.
vi_translation: The child left the nanny's hand, dashed across the room, and then shyly nestled into its mother's clothes.
tr_translation: The child, who let go of the nanny's hand, ran to his mother and stood by her dress, shyly.
es_translation: The girl, free from the nanny, ran across the room and timidly grabbed her mother's dress.

en: “The bles-sed pre-cious! Did mother get powder on your old yellowy hair? Stand up now, and say—How-de-do.”
vi: "Bé cưng của mẹ! Mẹ đã rắc phấn vào mái tóc vàng của con chưa? Đứng lên nào, con nói chào khách đi."
tr: “Kıymetlim benim, annen o sarı saçlarına pudra mı bu­laştırmış? Hadi kalk ve ‘nasılsınız’ diye sor misafirlere.
es: —¡Mi bendita preciosidad! ¿Te ha llenado mamá de polvos tu precioso pelo rubio? Ponte derecha y di: ¿Cómo estáis?
vi_translation: "Mommy's darling! Have I sprinkled powder on your golden hair yet? Stand up, say hello to the guests."
tr_translation: “My precious, has your mother sprinkled powder on your blonde hair? Come on, get up and ask the guests 'how are you'.”
es_translation: —My blessed precious one! Did mommy fill your precious blonde hair with powder? Stand up straight and say: How are you?

en: Gatsby and I in turn leaned down and took the small reluctant hand. Afterward he kept looking at the child with surprise. I don’t think he had ever really believed in its existence before.
vi: Gatsby và tôi cúi xuống nắm lấy bàn tay nhỏ nhắn rụt rè của đứa bé. Sau đó anh ta cứ nhìn đứa bé mãi với vẻ ngạc nhiên. Tôi cho rằng anh ta chưa bao giờ thực sự nghĩ rằng đứa bé là tồn tại trên đời.
tr: Gatsby ve ben eğilip küçük kızın gönülsüzce uzattığı minik eli sıktık. Gatsby gözlerini kızdan ayırmadan, şaşkın bakışlarla onu süzmekteydi. Sanırım o ana kadar onun varlığına gerçekten inanmamıştı.
es: Gatsby y yo nos inclinamos a coger la mano pequeñísima y reacia. Después Gatsby siguió mirando a la niña con sorpresa. Pienso que hasta entonces no había creído de verdad en su existencia.
vi_translation: Gatsby and I bent down to take the child's small, timid hand. After that, he kept looking at the child with a look of surprise. I suppose he had never really thought that the child actually existed.
tr_translation: Gatsby and I bent down and shook the little hand that the reluctant girl extended. Gatsby, without taking his eyes off the girl, was gazing at her with astonished looks. I think until that moment, he hadn't really believed in her existence.
es_translation: Gatsby and I leaned down to take the tiny and reluctant hand. Then Gatsby continued to look at the child with surprise. I think that until then he had not truly believed in her existence.

en: “I got dressed before luncheon,” said the child, turning eagerly to Daisy.
vi: "Con đã thay quần áo từ trước bữa ăn trưa." Đứa bé vội vàng quay lại nói với mẹ.
tr: “Yemek için üstümü değişirdim” dedi çocuk heyecanla annesine bakarak.
es: —Me he vestido para la comida —dijo la niña, volviéndose hacia Daisy con impaciencia.
vi_translation: "I already changed my clothes before lunch." The child hurriedly turned back and said to the mother.
tr_translation: "I would change my clothes for dinner," said the child excitedly, looking at his mother.
es_translation: —I dressed up for the meal —said the girl, turning towards Daisy with impatience.

en: “That’s because your mother wanted to show you off.” Her face bent into the single wrinkle of the small white neck. “You dream, you. You absolute little dream.”
vi: "Bởi vì mẹ muốn đem con ra khoe." Khuôn mặt của Daisy cúi xuống vùi vào trong chiếc cổ nhỏ trắng một ngấn của con. "Bé của mẹ. Con đúng là xinh như mộng."
tr: “Çünkü annen seni herkese göstermek istiyor” dedi kızın minik, beyaz boynundaki tek çizgiye yüzünü yaklaştırarak. “Rüyalarımın meleğisin sen. Rüyamsın sen benim.
es: —Porque tu madre quería presumir de ti —la cara de Daisy se acercó a la única arruga del pequeño cuello blanco—. Eres un sueño, eres un sueño muy pequeño.
vi_translation: "Because mommy wants to show you off." Daisy's face lowered, burying into the small, white, chubby neck of her child. "My baby. You are truly as beautiful as a dream."
tr_translation: “Because your mother wants to show you off to everyone,” he said, bringing his face closer to the single line on the girl's tiny, white neck. “You are the angel of my dreams. You are my dream.”
es_translation: —Because your mother wanted to show you off —Daisy's face moved closer to the only wrinkle on the small white collar—. You are a dream, you are a very small dream.

en: “Yes,” admitted the child calmly. “Aunt Jordan’s got on a white dress too.”
vi: "Dạ." Đứa bé trả lời một cách nhẹ nhàng êm ả. "Dì Jordan cũng mặc một chiếc đầm trắng."
tr: “Evet” dedi çocuk sakin sesiyle, “Jordan teyzenin elbisesi de beyaz.
es: —Sí —admitió la niña, tranquila—. También la tía Jordan lleva un vestido blanco.
vi_translation: "Yes." The child answered softly and gently. "Aunt Jordan is also wearing a white dress."
tr_translation: “Yes,” said the child in a calm voice, “Aunt Jordan's dress is also white.”
es_translation: —Yes —admitted the girl, calmly—. Aunt Jordan is also wearing a white dress.

en: “How do you like mother’s friends?” Daisy turned her around so that she faced Gatsby. “Do you think they’re pretty?”
vi: "Con có thích những bạn của mẹ không?" Daisy quay người lại đối diện với Gatsby. "Con có nghĩ họ xinh không?"
tr: “Annenin arkadaşlarını nasıl buldun bakalım?” Daisy küçüğü omuzlarından tutup yüzünü Gatsby’e çevirdi. “Beğendin mi?
es: —¿Qué te parecen los amigos de mamá? —Daisy le dio la vuelta para que mirara a Gatsby—. ¿Crees que son guapos?
vi_translation: "Do you like Mommy's friends?" Daisy turned around to face Gatsby. "Do you think they are pretty?"
tr_translation: "So, how did you find mommy's friends?" Daisy took the little one by the shoulders and turned her face towards Gatsby. "Did you like them?"
es_translation: —What do you think of mom's friends? —Daisy turned her around to look at Gatsby—. Do you think they are handsome?

en: “Where’s Daddy?”
vi: "Ba đâu?"
tr: “Babam nerede?
es: —¿Dónde está papá?
vi_translation: "Where's Dad?"
tr_translation: "Where is my father?"
es_translation: —Where is dad?

en: “She doesn’t look like her father,” explained Daisy. “She looks like me. She’s got my hair and shape of the face.”
vi: "Con bé không giống cha của nó." Daisy giải thích. "Nó giống em. Nó giống em ở mái tóc và khuôn mặt."
tr: “Babasına hiç benzemiyor” diye açıkladı Daisy, “Tıpkı bana benziyor. Özellikle de saçlarını ve yüz biçimini benden almış.
es: —No se parece a su padre —explicó Daisy—. Se parece a mí. Tiene mi pelo y la forma de mi cara.
vi_translation: "The girl doesn't look like her father," Daisy explained. "She looks like me. She looks like me in her hair and face."
tr_translation: “He doesn't look like his father at all,” Daisy explained, “He looks just like me. Especially, he got his hair and face shape from me.”
es_translation: —He doesn't look like his father —explained Daisy—. He looks like me. He has my hair and the shape of my face.

en: Daisy sat back upon the couch. The nurse took a step forward and held out her hand.
vi: Daisy ngồi xuống chiếc ghế dựa. Người vú em bước tới dơ tay ra đón đứa bé.
tr: Daisy tekrar yerine oturunca dadı bir adım ilerleyerek elini uzattı.
es: Daisy se retrepó en el sofá. La niñera dio un paso y tendió la mano hacia la niña.
vi_translation: Daisy sat down on the chair. The nanny stepped forward and reached out to take the baby.
tr_translation: When Daisy sat back down, the nanny stepped forward and extended her hand.
es_translation: Daisy climbed onto the sofa. The nanny took a step and reached out her hand towards the girl.

en: “Come, Pammy.”
vi: "Tới đây, Pammy."
tr: “Gel Pammy.
es: —Vamos, Pammy.
vi_translation: "Come here, Pammy."
tr_translation: "Come, Pammy.""
es_translation: —Let's go, Pammy.

en: “Goodbye, sweetheart!”
vi: "Chào con gái cưng của mẹ!"
tr: “Bay bay canım.
es: —¡Adiós, tesoro!
vi_translation: "Hello, my dear daughter!"
tr_translation: “Bye bye, my dear.”
es_translation: —Goodbye, treasure!

en: With a reluctant backward glance the well-disciplined child held to her nurse’s hand and was pulled out the door, just as Tom came back, preceding four gin rickeys that clicked full of ice.
vi: Với một cái liếc nhìn quay lại đầy luyến tiếc, đứa bé biết vâng lời nắm lấy tay người vú nuôi và bị lôi ra khỏi cửa vừa đúng lúc Tom quay lại mang theo bốn ly rượu gin pha chanh đầy đá cục va chạm vào nhau lách cách.
tr: Terbiyeli küçük kız, arkasına bir kez baktıktan sonra gönülsüzce dadısının elini tuttu. Kadın onu kapıya götürürken, Tom uşağın taşıdığı içi buz dolu dört uzun bardağın önü sıra içeri girdi.
es: Volviéndose a mirar, la niña, reacia, muy bien educada, cogió la mano de la niñera, que se la llevó, en el momento en que Tom volvía con cuatro ginebras con soda y zumo de lima que tintineaban llenas de hielo.
vi_translation: With a regretful glance back, the obedient child took the nanny's hand and was pulled out of the door just as Tom returned with four glasses of gin and tonic filled with clinking ice cubes.
tr_translation: The well-mannered little girl, after looking back once, reluctantly took her nanny's hand. As the woman led her to the door, Tom entered following the servant who was carrying four tall glasses filled with ice.
es_translation: Turning to look, the girl, reluctant, very well-mannered, took the nanny's hand, who led her away, just as Tom returned with four gin and sodas with lime juice, clinking with ice.

en: Gatsby took up his drink.
vi: Gatsby đón lấy ly rượu của mình.
tr: Gatsby İçkisini aldı.
es: Gatsby cogió su vaso.
vi_translation: Gatsby took his glass of wine.
tr_translation: Gatsby took his drink.
es_translation: Gatsby picked up his glass.

en: “They certainly look cool,” he said, with visible tension.
vi: "Nhìn đúng thấy mát lạnh." Gatsby nói dáng điệu hiện rõ nét căng thẳng.
tr: “Gerçekten soğuk görünüyor” dedi bariz bir tedirginlikle..
es: —Parecen fríos de verdad —dijo, visiblemente tenso.
vi_translation: "It looks cool." Gatsby said, his demeanor clearly showing tension.
tr_translation: “It really looks cold,” he said with obvious unease.
es_translation: —They seem really cold —he said, visibly tense.

en: We drank in long, greedy swallows.
vi: Chúng tôi ừng ực uống những ngụm dài.
tr: İri yudumlarla içkileri hızla içmeye başladık.
es: Dimos tragos largos y ávidos.
vi_translation: We gulped down long sips.
tr_translation: We started drinking the beverages quickly with large gulps.
es_translation: We gave long and eager speeches.

en: “I read somewhere that the sun’s getting hotter every year,” said Tom genially. “It seems that pretty soon the earth’s going to fall into the sun—or wait a minute—it’s just the opposite—the sun’s getting colder every year.
vi: "Tôi đã từng đọc ở đâu đó nói rằng mỗi năm mặt trời mỗi trở nên nóng hơn." Tom nói một cách thân mật. "Như vậy chẳng sớm muộn gì trái đất sẽ bị rơi vào trong mặt trời - khoan đã - hình như là ngược lại - mặt trời mỗi năm mỗi trở bên lạnh hơn."
tr: “Bir yerlerde güneşin her yıl biraz daha ısındığını okumuştum” dedi Tom kibar bir ev sahibi edasıyla, “dünya yakında güneşin içine düşecekmiş –dur bir dakika- galiba tam tersiydi. Yani güneş her yıl biraz daha soğuyormuş” dedi
es: —He leído no sé dónde que el sol se calienta más cada año —dijo Tom, muy simpático—. Parece que muy pronto la tierra caerá en el sol, o, esperad un momento, no, es exactamente al revés: el sol se enfría más cada año.
vi_translation: "I once read somewhere that each year the sun becomes hotter." Tom said intimately. "So sooner or later the earth will fall into the sun - wait - it seems to be the opposite - the sun becomes colder each year."
tr_translation: “I read somewhere that the sun gets a little hotter every year,” said Tom with the air of a polite host, “the world will soon fall into the sun – wait a minute – I think it was the other way around. That is, the sun gets a little colder every year,” he said
es_translation: —I read somewhere that the sun gets hotter every year —said Tom, very amiably—. It seems that very soon the earth will fall into the sun, or, wait a moment, no, it's exactly the opposite: the sun gets cooler every year.

en: “Come outside,” he suggested to Gatsby, “I’d like you to have a look at the place.”
vi: "Ra đây." Tom đề nghị với Gatsby. "Tôi muốn anh ra xem ngoài này."
tr: “Dışarı gelin” diye öneride bulundu Gatsby’e “Etrafı görmenizi istiyorum.
es: Venga —le sugirió a Gatsby—. Me gustaría que viera la casa.
vi_translation: "Come here." Tom suggested to Gatsby. "I want you to come out and see this."
tr_translation: "Come outside," he suggested to Gatsby, "I want you to see the surroundings."
es_translation: Come on —he suggested to Gatsby—. I would like you to see the house.

en: I went with them out to the veranda. On the green Sound, stagnant in the heat, one small sail crawled slowly toward the fresher sea. Gatsby’s eyes followed it momentarily; he raised his hand and pointed across the bay.
vi: Tôi đi với họ ra ngoài hành lang. Phía ngoài eo biển màu xanh lục mặt nước như ứ đọng trong cái nóng, một cánh thuyền buồm nho nhỏ đang trườn mình chậm chạp về phía ngoài biển xa tươi mát. Gatsby hướng mắt nhìn theo cánh buồm một lát, sau đó anh giơ tay chỉ về phía bên kia vịnh.
tr: Ben de onlarla birlikte verandaya çıktım. Boğazın yeşil sularında, sıcağın altında bir yelkenli daha taze sulara doğru ağır ağır süzülüyordu. Onu bir süre gözleriyle izleyen Gatsby, elini uzatıp karşı kıyıyı gösterdi.
es: Salí con ellos a la galería. Sobre el estrecho, verde, estancado en el calor, una vela minúscula se deslizaba muy despacio hacia aguas más frías. Los ojos de Gatsby la siguieron un momento; levantó la mano y señaló la otra orilla de la bahía.
vi_translation: I went with them out into the hallway. Outside, the green strait's water seemed stagnant in the heat, a small sailboat slowly gliding towards the refreshing open sea. Gatsby watched the sail for a moment, then he raised his hand to point across the bay.
tr_translation: I also stepped out onto the veranda with them. In the green waters of the Bosphorus, under the heat, a sailboat was slowly gliding towards fresher waters. Gatsby, who watched it with his eyes for a while, reached out his hand and pointed to the opposite shore.
es_translation: I went out with them to the gallery. Over the narrow, green, heat-stagnant strait, a tiny sail was gliding very slowly towards cooler waters. Gatsby's eyes followed it for a moment; he raised his hand and pointed to the other shore of the bay.

en: “I’m right across from you.”
vi: "Nhà tôi ở ngang nhà anh phía bên kia."
tr: “Ben de tam karşınızda oturuyorum.
es: —Vivo exactamente enfrente de su casa.
vi_translation: "My house is across from your house on the other side."
tr_translation: “I am sitting right in front of you.”
es_translation: —I live exactly in front of your house.

en: “So you are.”
vi: "Vậy sao."
tr: “Evet öyleymiş.
es: —Ya.
vi_translation: "Is that so."
tr_translation: “Yes, it seems so.”
es_translation: —Okay.

en: Our eyes lifted over the rose-beds and the hot lawn and the weedy refuse of the dog-days alongshore. Slowly the white wings of the boat moved against the blue cool limit of the sky. Ahead lay the scalloped ocean and the abounding blessed isles.
vi: Mắt chúng tôi lướt nhìn trên những luống hoa hồng, ngang qua bãi cỏ nóng rực và đám cỏ quen chịu nóng hè mọc dọc theo bờ nước. Những cánh buồm trắng của chiếc thuyền di chuyển chậm chạp về phía đường ranh giới mát mẻ của bầu trời. Phía trước là đại dương hình vỏ sò và những hòn đảo may mắn.
tr: Gözlerimiz gül yatakları, güneşte kavrulan çimenler ve kıyı boyunca uzayıp giden yazın sıcak günlerinden kalma atıklarda dolaştı. Teknenin beyaz kanatları gökyüzü çizgisini bölerek uzaklaşıyordu. Daha ilerde ise çırpıntılı okyanus ve irili ufaklı bir sürü ada uzanıyordu.
es: Miramos más allá de los macizos de rosas y el césped caliente y los desechos de algas que dejaban a lo largo de la costa los días irrespirables. Las alas del barco se movían despacio contra el límite frío y azul del cielo. Ante nosotros se extendía el océano ondulado y las islas benditas y abundantes.
vi_translation: Our eyes glanced over the rose beds, across the blazing lawn, and the grass accustomed to summer heat growing along the water's edge. The white sails of the boat moved slowly towards the cool boundary of the sky. Ahead was the shell-shaped ocean and the fortunate islands.
tr_translation: Our eyes wandered over rose beds, grass scorched by the sun, and debris left from the hot days of summer stretching along the shore. The white wings of the boat were receding, dividing the skyline. Further ahead lay the choppy ocean and a multitude of islands, big and small.
es_translation: We looked beyond the rose bushes, the warm lawn, and the algae debris left along the coast on the stifling days. The wings of the ship moved slowly against the cold blue edge of the sky. Before us stretched the undulating ocean and the blessed and abundant islands.

en: “There’s sport for you,” said Tom, nodding. “I’d like to be out there with him for about an hour.”
vi: "Đó là môn thể thao thú vị." Tom gật gù nói. "Tôi muốn được ra ngoài đó chơi với nó khoảng một giờ."
tr: “İşte size gerçek spor” dedi Tom, başıyla onaylayarak, “bir saat için bile olsa, orada o adamın yanında olmayı isterdim doğrusu.
es: —Eso sí que es deporte —dijo Tom, asintiendo con la cabeza—. Me gustaría pasar una hora en ese barco.
vi_translation: "It's an interesting sport," Tom nodded and said. "I want to go out there and play with it for about an hour."
tr_translation: “This is real sport for you,” said Tom, nodding his head, “I would have liked to be there next to that man, even if only for an hour.”
es_translation: —Now that's a sport —said Tom, nodding his head—. I would like to spend an hour on that boat.

en: We had luncheon in the dining-room, darkened too against the heat, and drank down nervous gaiety with the cold ale.
vi: Chúng tôi ăn trưa ở trong phòng ăn đã được làm cho tối đi để chốn nóng, và uống dìm đi nỗi hoan hỉ nỗi bồn chồn qua những ly bia mát lạnh.
tr: Öğle yemeğini salonda yedik. Serin kalması için perdeler sıkıca örtüldüğünde ortam loştu. Gergin bir neşe içinde biralarımızı yudumluyorduk.
es: Almorzamos en el comedor, en sombra, contra el calor, y bebimos alegría nerviosa con la cerveza fría.
vi_translation: We had lunch in the dining room, which had been darkened to escape the heat, and drank away our joy and restlessness with cold beers.
tr_translation: We ate lunch in the living room. The room was dim when the curtains were tightly drawn to keep it cool. We were sipping our beers in a tense cheerfulness.
es_translation: We had lunch in the dining room, in the shade, against the heat, and drank nervous joy with the cold beer.

en: “What’ll we do with ourselves this afternoon?” cried Daisy, “and the day after that, and the next thirty years?”
vi: "Chiều nay chúng ta làm gì đây cho qua giờ?" Daisy nói to. "Rồi ngày hôm sau nữa, và còn ba mươi năm kế tiếp nữa."
tr: “Öğleden sonra ne yapmak istersiniz?” diye bağırdı Daisy, “Ya da yarın veya öbür gün, hatta önümüzdeki otuz yıl boyunca.
es: —¿Qué vamos a hacer esta tarde? —exclamó Daisy—. ¿Y mañana, y en los próximos treinta años?[21]
vi_translation: "What should we do this afternoon to pass the time?" Daisy said loudly. "And then the day after that, and the next thirty years."
tr_translation: “What would you like to do this afternoon?” shouted Daisy, “Or tomorrow or the day after, or even for the next thirty years.”
es_translation: —What are we going to do this afternoon? —exclaimed Daisy—. And tomorrow, and in the next thirty years?[21]

en: “Don’t be morbid,” Jordan said. “Life starts all over again when it gets crisp in the fall.”
vi: "Đừng suy nghĩ không lành mạnh như vậy." Jordan nói. "Đời sống sẽ bắt đầu lại từ đầu khi trời vào thu mát mẻ."
tr: “Saçmalama” dedi Jordan, “sonbaharda havalar serinle­yince hayat yeniden başlar nasıl olsa.
es: —No seas morbosa —dijo Jordan—. La vida vuelve a empezar cuando refresca en otoño.
vi_translation: "Don't think in such an unhealthy way," Jordan said. "Life will start anew when the cool autumn arrives."
tr_translation: “Don't be ridiculous,” said Jordan, “life starts anew when the weather cools down in the fall anyway.”
es_translation: —Don't be morbid —said Jordan—. Life starts over when it gets cool in the fall.

en: Her voice struggled on through the heat, beating against it, moulding its senselessness into forms.
vi: Giọng nói của Daisy như đang vật lộn với cái nóng, như đánh đập nó, đúc nặn cái vô cảm giác của nó thành những hình thể.
tr: Sesi sıcağı zorlayarak içinden geçiyor, onu yeniden şekillendiriyordu.
es: Su voz luchaba y se estrellaba contra el calor, dándole forma a la falta de sentido de aquel clima.
vi_translation: Daisy's voice seemed to be struggling with the heat, as if beating it, molding its insensitivity into shapes.
tr_translation: The sound was forcing its way through the heat, reshaping it.
es_translation: His voice struggled and crashed against the heat, giving shape to the senselessness of that climate.

en: “I’ve heard of making a garage out of a stable,” Tom was saying to Gatsby, “but I’m the first man who ever made a stable out of a garage.”
vi: "Tôi nghe nói người ta lấy chuồng ngựa để làm nhà đậu xe." Lúc đó Tom đang nói chuyện với Gatsby. "Nhưng tôi là người đầu tiên lấy nhà đậu xe ra làm chuồng ngựa."
tr: “Ahırı bozdurup garaj yaptıranları duymuştum” diyordu Tom, Gatsby’e, “ama garajı bozdurup ahıra çevirten ilk kişi benim.
es: —Tengo noticia de cuadras convertidas en garajes —le decía Tom a Gatsby—, pero soy el primero que ha convertido un garaje en una cuadra.
vi_translation: "I heard that people use horse stables to make garages." At that moment, Tom was talking to Gatsby. "But I am the first person to use a garage as a horse stable."
tr_translation: "I had heard of people converting barns into garages," Tom was saying to Gatsby, "but I am the first person to convert a garage into a barn."
es_translation: —I have heard of stables being turned into garages —Tom was saying to Gatsby—, but I am the first to have turned a garage into a stable.

en: “Who wants to go to town?” demanded Daisy insistently. Gatsby’s eyes floated toward her. “Ah,” she cried, “you look so cool.”
vi: "Ai có muốn đi ra phố không?" Daisy cứ tiếp tục hỏi, không bỏ ý định. Cặp mắt của Gatsby buông thả lững lờ về phía Daisy. "A" Daisy la to. "Anh nhìn trông mát mẻ quá"
tr: “Kim şehre gitmek ister’” diyordu Daisy inatla. Gatsby’nin bakışları o yana kayınca da, “Çok iyi görünüyorsun” diye devam etti.
es: —¿Quién quiere ir a la ciudad? —preguntó Daisy insistentemente. La mirada de Gatsby voló hacia ella—. Ah —exclamó Daisy—, parece que no tienes calor.
vi_translation: "Does anyone want to go out to the street?" Daisy kept asking, not giving up on the idea. Gatsby's eyes lazily drifted towards Daisy. "Ah," Daisy shouted. "You look so cool,"
tr_translation: “Who wants to go to the city?” Daisy was saying stubbornly. When Gatsby's gaze shifted that way, she continued, “You look very good.”
es_translation: —Who wants to go to the city? —asked Daisy insistently. Gatsby's gaze flew towards her—. Ah —exclaimed Daisy—, it seems you're not hot.

en: Their eyes met, and they stared together at each other, alone in space. With an effort she glanced down at the table.
vi: Đôi mắt của họ chạm nhìn nhau và rồi cả hai cùng nhìn nhau đắm đuối làm như trong khoảng không gian này chỉ còn hai người họ tồn tại. Bằng một cố gắng, Daisy đưa mắt rời lảng nhìn xuống bàn.
tr: Gözleri kavuştu ve evrende yalnız ikisi varmış gibi birbirleri­ne uzun uzun baktılar. Sonra Daisy büyük bir gayretle gözlerini masaya çevirdi.
es: Sus ojos se encontraron y los dos se miraron, solos en el espacio. Con esfuerzo, Daisy bajó la vista hacia la mesa.
vi_translation: Their eyes met and then they gazed at each other passionately as if in this space only the two of them existed. With an effort, Daisy averted her gaze and looked down at the table.
tr_translation: Their eyes met and they looked at each other for a long time as if they were the only two in the universe. Then Daisy, with great effort, turned her eyes to the table.
es_translation: Their eyes met and they looked at each other, alone in the space. With effort, Daisy lowered her gaze to the table.

en: “You always look so cool,” she repeated.
vi: "Anh nhìn trông mát mẻ quá." Daisy lập lại.
tr: “Zaten her zaman iyi görünürsün” diyerek tekrarladı söylediğini.
es: —Parece que nunca tienes calor —repitió.
vi_translation: "You look so cool." Daisy repeated.
tr_translation: “You always look good anyway,” he repeated what he said.
es_translation: —It seems like you're never hot —he repeated.

en: She had told him that she loved him, and Tom Buchanan saw. He was astounded. His mouth opened a little, and he looked at Gatsby, and then back at Daisy as if he had just recognized her as someone he knew a long time ago.
vi: Dáng điệu của Daisy đã bày tỏ cho Gatsby biết rằng nàng yêu Gatsby. Tom đã chứng kiến được tất cả. Anh ta trở nên sững sờ, miệng hé mở, hết nhìn Gatsy rồi lại quay sang nhìn Daisy làm như thể anh mới nhận ra nàng là một người anh ta đã từng quen lâu lắm.
tr: Tam onu sevdiğini söylerken Tom Buchanan onları gördü. Şaşırmış, donakalmıştı! Ağ­zını açıp önce Gatsby’e sonra bir kez daha Daisy’e baktı. Çok eskiden tanıdığı birini yeniden görmüş gibiydi.
es: Le había dicho que lo quería, y Tom Buchanan lo vio. Estaba atónito. Se le entreabrió la boca, y miró a Gatsby, y luego a Daisy, como si acabara de reconocer a una amiga de hacía mucho tiempo.
vi_translation: Daisy's demeanor revealed to Gatsby that she loved him. Tom witnessed everything. He became stunned, mouth agape, looking from Gatsby to Daisy as if he had just realized she was someone he had known long ago.
tr_translation: Tom Buchanan saw them just as she was saying she loved him. He was surprised, stunned! He opened his mouth and looked first at Gatsby, then once more at Daisy. It was as if he had seen someone he knew from long ago.
es_translation: She had told him that she loved him, and Tom Buchanan saw it. He was astonished. His mouth fell open slightly, and he looked at Gatsby, and then at Daisy, as if he had just recognized an old friend.

en: “You resemble the advertisement of the man,” she went on innocently. “You know the advertisement of the man—”
vi: "Anh trông giống như một người trong quảng cáo," Daisy vô tình tiếp tục nói. "Anh có biết cái quảng cáo của anh chàng....."
tr: “Şu rek­lamdaki adama benziyorsun” diye devam etti Daisy masumca, “bilirsin işte, şu reklamlarda oynayan adam.
es: —Te pareces al hombre del anuncio —continúo Daisy con inocencia—. Ya sabes, el anuncio del hombre…
vi_translation: "You look like someone in an advertisement," Daisy continued to say unintentionally. "Do you know the advertisement of that guy....."
tr_translation: “You look like the man in that advertisement,” Daisy continued innocently, “you know, the man who acts in those commercials.”
es_translation: —You look like the man from the ad —Daisy continued innocently—. You know, the ad with the man…

en: “All right,” broke in Tom quickly, “I’m perfectly willing to go to town. Come on—we’re all going to town.”
vi: "Được rồi." Tom nhanh chóng cắt ngang. "Anh thật sự cũng muốn đi ra phố. Đi đi, tất cả chúng ta cùng đi."
tr: “Tamam” diyerek araya girdi Tom aniden, “ben de şehre gitmek istiyorum. Hadi hep beraber gidiyoruz.
es: —Muy bien —la interrumpió Tom inmediatamente—. Estoy dispuesto a ir a la ciudad, por supuesto. Venga, nos vamos todos a la ciudad.
vi_translation: "Alright." Tom quickly interrupted. "I really want to go out to the street too. Let's go, all of us together."
tr_translation: “Okay,” Tom suddenly interrupted, “I want to go to the city too. Let's all go together.”
es_translation: —Very well —Tom interrupted her immediately—. I am willing to go to the city, of course. Come on, we are all going to the city.

en: He got up, his eyes still flashing between Gatsby and his wife. No one moved.
vi: Tom đứng lên cặp mắt sáng quắc đảo nhìn qua lại giữa Gatsby và vợ. Không ai nhúc nhích.
tr: Ayağa kalktı. Bakışları hala Daisy ile Gatsby arasında gidip geliyordu. Kimse yerinden kımıldamamıştı.
es: Se levantó, y sus ojos relampagueaban entre Gatsby y su mujer. Nadie se movió.
vi_translation: Tom stood up, his eyes flashing as he looked back and forth between Gatsby and his wife. No one moved.
tr_translation: He stood up. His gaze was still shifting between Daisy and Gatsby. No one had moved from their place.
es_translation: He stood up, and his eyes flashed between Gatsby and his wife. Nobody moved.

en: “Come on!” His temper cracked a little. “What’s the matter, anyhow? If we’re going to town, let’s start.”
vi: "Đi thôi." Tom bất đầu nổi nóng. "Chuyện gì đây? Nếu muốn đi ra phố thì đi ngay thôi."
tr: “Hadisenize!” bir an öfkesine yenik düşer gibi oldu, “Neyiniz var? Şehre gideceksek yola koyulalım.
es: —¡Venga! —estaba empezando a perder la paciencia—. ¿Qué pasa ahora? Si vamos a ir a la ciudad, ¡en marcha!
vi_translation: "Let's go." Tom started to get angry. "What's going on here?" "If you want to go downtown, then let's go right away."
tr_translation: “What is wrong with you!” he almost succumbed to his anger for a moment, “What is your problem? If we are going to the city, let's get going.”
es_translation: —Come on! —he was starting to lose his patience—. What is it now? If we're going to the city, let's get moving!

en: His hand, trembling with his effort at self-control, bore to his lips the last of his glass of ale. Daisy’s voice got us to our feet and out on to the blazing gravel drive.
vi: Bàn tay của Tom, đang run lên vì cố gắng tự chủ, nâng ly lên môi nốc cạn những giọt bia cuối. Giọng nói của Daisy lôi cuốn chúng tôi đứng lên và bước ra lối đi trải sỏi dưới nắng chói chang.
tr: Sinirlerine hakim olmak için harcadığı çaba yüzünden titre­yen eliyle bira bardağını dudaklarına götürdü. Daisy’nin sesi hepimizi yerimizden kaldırdı ve güneşten kavrulan çakıl döşeli yola adım attık.
es: La mano, que le temblaba por el esfuerzo de controlarse, le acercó a los labios los restos del vaso de cerveza. La voz de Daisy nos obligó a levantarnos y a salir al incandescente camino de grava.
vi_translation: Tom's hand, trembling with the effort of self-control, lifted the glass to his lips and drained the last drops of beer. Daisy's voice compelled us to stand up and walk out onto the gravel path under the blazing sun.
tr_translation: With a trembling hand, caused by the effort to control his nerves, he brought the beer glass to his lips. Daisy's voice made all of us get up from our seats, and we stepped onto the sun-scorched gravel path.
es_translation: The hand, trembling from the effort of self-control, brought the remnants of the beer glass to his lips. Daisy's voice forced us to get up and step out onto the incandescent gravel path.

en: “Are we just going to go?” she objected. “Like this? Aren’t we going to let anyone smoke a cigarette first?”
vi: "Chúng ta cứ vầy mà đi sao?" Daisy phản đối. "Không để ai hút điếu thuốc nào cả à?"
tr: “Hemen mi gidiyoruz?” diyerek karşı çıktı, “Bu şekilde mi yani? Bir sigara bile içemiyor muyuz?
es: —¿Ya nos vamos? —objetó—. ¿Así? ¿No podemos ni fumarnos un cigarrillo antes?
vi_translation: "Are we just going to go like this?" Daisy objected. "Not letting anyone smoke a cigarette at all?"
tr_translation: “Are we leaving right away?” he objected, “Like this, I mean? Can't we even smoke a cigarette?”
es_translation: "Are we leaving already?" he objected. "Like this? Can't we at least smoke a cigarette first?"

en: “Everybody smoked all through lunch.”
vi: "Ai cũng đã hút thuốc suốt bữa ăn trưa rồi."
tr: “Yemekte içen içti zaten.
es: —Todo el mundo ha fumado en la comida.
vi_translation: "Everyone has already smoked throughout lunch."
tr_translation: "Those who wanted to drink already did so during the meal.""
es_translation: —Everyone smoked during the meal.

en: “Oh, let’s have fun,” she begged him. “It’s too hot to fuss.”
vi: "Thôi mà, để đi chơi cho thoải mái." Daisy nài nỉ chồng.
tr: “Aman bırak da eğlenelim” diye ricada bulundu Daisy, “Hava huysuzluk etmek için fazla sıcak.
es: —Ay, vamos a divertirnos —imploró Daisy—. Hace demasiado calor para pelearse.
vi_translation: "Come on, let's go out and have some fun." Daisy pleaded with her husband. "It's already so hot, why get worked up?"
tr_translation: “Come on, let’s have some fun,” Daisy pleaded, “It’s too hot to be cranky.”
es_translation: —Oh, let's have fun —implored Daisy—. It's too hot to fight.

en: “Have it your own way,” she said. “Come on, Jordan.”
vi: "Thôi, thế thì tùy ý anh." Daisy nói. "Đi thôi Jordan."
tr: “Nasıl istersen” dedi Daisy, “hadi gel Jordan”
es: —Lo que tú mandes —dijo Daisy—. Vamos, Jordan.
vi_translation: "Well, then it's up to you." Daisy said. "Let's go, Jordan."
tr_translation: "As you wish," said Daisy, "come on, Jordan."
es_translation: —Whatever you say —said Daisy—. Let's go, Jordan.

en: They went upstairs to get ready while we three men stood there shuffling the hot pebbles with our feet. A silver curve of the moon hovered already in the western sky. Gatsby started to speak, changed his mind, but not before Tom wheeled and faced him expectantly.
vi: Hai người phụ nữ lên lầu để thay y phục trong khi ba người đàn ông tiếp tục đứng đó đưa chân xáo trộn những viên sỏi nóng bỏng dưới chân. Mảnh trăng bạc cong tròn đã treo lơ lửng trên mảng trời phía tây. Gatsby định lên tiếng nói, sau đó lại đổi ý, thế nhưng Tom đã xoay người lại nhìn thẳng vào mặt anh ta dáng điệu chờ đợi.
tr: Biz üç erkek orada dikilip ayakkabılarımızın burnuyla sıcak çakıl taşlarını itip dururken onlar hazırlanmak için yukarı çıktılar. Daha şimdiden ayın gümüş kıvrımı batıda görünür ol­muştu. Gatsby bir şey söylemek üzereyken fikrini değiştirip sustu ama Tom bir anda dönüp onu öyle görmüş ve beklentiye girmişti.
es: Subieron a arreglarse mientras los tres hombres arrastrábamos los pies por las piedras calientes. La curva plateada de la luna flotaba ya en el cielo, al oeste. Gatsby fue a hablar y cambió de idea, pero no antes de que Tom se volviera a mirarlo, expectante.
vi_translation: Two women went upstairs to change clothes while three men continued to stand there, shuffling the hot pebbles beneath their feet. A crescent silver moon hung suspended in the western sky. Gatsby intended to speak, then changed his mind, but Tom had already turned around and was looking directly at him with an expectant expression.
tr_translation: While we three men stood there, kicking the warm pebbles with the tips of our shoes, they went upstairs to get ready. Already, the silver crescent of the moon had become visible in the west. Gatsby was about to say something but changed his mind and remained silent, yet Tom suddenly turned and saw him, becoming expectant.
es_translation: They went up to get ready while the three of us men dragged our feet over the hot stones. The silver curve of the moon was already floating in the sky, to the west. Gatsby went to speak and changed his mind, but not before Tom turned to look at him, expectant.

en: “Have you got your stables here?” asked Gatsby with an effort.
vi: Gatsby đành gắng gượng hỏi. "Chuồng ngựa của anh ở đây à
tr: “Burada da ahırınız var mı?” diye sordu Gatsby kendini zorlayarak.
es: —¿Tiene aquí las cuadras? —preguntó Gatsby, haciendo un esfuerzo.
vi_translation: Gatsby reluctantly asked. "Is your stable here?"
tr_translation: "Do you have a stable here as well?" Gatsby asked, forcing himself.
es_translation: —Do you have the stables here? —asked Gatsby, making an effort.

en: “About a quarter of a mile down the road.”
vi: "Ở cuối đường cách đây khoảng một phần tư dặm."
tr: “Beş altı yüz metre kadar ilerde, yolun biraz aşağısında.
es: —A unos cuatrocientos metros carretera abajo.
vi_translation: "At the end of the road about a quarter of a mile away."
tr_translation: “About five or six hundred meters ahead, a little down the road.”
es_translation: —About four hundred meters down the road.

en: A pause.
vi: Im lặng.
tr: Sessizlik.
es: Pausa.
vi_translation: Silence.
tr_translation: Silence.
es_translation: Pause.

en: “I don’t see the idea of going to town,” broke out Tom savagely. “Women get these notions in their heads—”
vi: "Tôi không hiểu tại sao lại phải ra phố." Tom bật thốt một cách gay gắt. "Đàn bà hay nghĩ ra những trò vớ vẩn."
tr: “Ne halt etmeye şehre iniyoruz, bilmiyorum” dedi Tom birden hışımla, “Kadınlar hep böyle garip fikirler atar ortaya işte”
es: —No entiendo la idea de ir a la ciudad —saltó, feroz, Tom—. Las mujeres tienen unas ocurrencias…
vi_translation: "I don't understand why we have to go downtown." Tom blurted out sharply. "Women always come up with silly things."
tr_translation: "Why are we going to the city, I don't know," Tom suddenly said angrily, "Women always come up with such strange ideas."
es_translation: —I don't understand the idea of going to the city —Tom burst out, fiercely—. Women have some crazy ideas…

en: “Shall we take anything to drink?” called Daisy from an upper window.
vi: "Mình có nên mang theo thứ gì để uống không?" Daisy gọi vọng xuống từ trên cửa sổ.
tr: “İçecek bir şeyler alsak mı?” diye seslendi Daisy üst kat penceresinden.
es: —¿Nos llevamos algo para beber? —preguntó Daisy desde una ventana de la planta de arriba.
vi_translation: "Should I bring something to drink?" Daisy called down from the window.
tr_translation: "Shall we get something to drink?" Daisy called out from the upstairs window.
es_translation: —Shall we bring something to drink? —asked Daisy from an upstairs window.

en: “I’ll get some whisky,” answered Tom. He went inside.
vi: "Anh sẽ vào lấy ít Whiskey." Tom trả lời rồi bước vào trong nhà.
tr: “Ben bir viski alayım” diye yanıt verdi Tom ve içeri girdi.
es: —Voy a coger whisky —respondió Tom. Entró en la casa.
vi_translation: "I'll go get some whiskey." Tom replied and then stepped into the house.
tr_translation: “I’ll have a whiskey,” Tom replied and walked inside.
es_translation: —I'm going to get whisky —replied Tom. He entered the house.

en: Gatsby turned to me rigidly:
vi: Gatsby quay sang tôi dáng điệu cứng ngắc.
tr: Gatsby birden dönüp bana baktı.
es: Gatsby se volvió hacia mí, rígido.
vi_translation: Gatsby turned to me with a stiff demeanor.
tr_translation: Gatsby suddenly turned and looked at me.
es_translation: Gatsby turned towards me, rigid.

en: “I can’t say anything in his house, old sport.”
vi: "Ở trong căn nhà này tôi không thể nói được gì được, anh bạn già"
tr: “O adamın evin­deyken bir şey söyleyemem ahbap.
es: —No puedo hablar en casa del marido, compañero.
vi_translation: "In this house, I can't say anything, old friend"
tr_translation: "I can't say anything while at that man's house, buddy."
es_translation: —I can't speak in the husband's house, comrade.

en: “She’s got an indiscreet voice,” I remarked. “It’s full of—” I hesitated.
vi: "Daisy có một giọng nói hớ hên, không thận trọng." Tôi nhận xét. "Giọng nói của Daisy chứa đầy..." Tôi ngập ngừng.
tr: “Şu Daisy boşboğazın biri” dedim tereddüt içinde “Sesinde...
es: —Daisy tiene una voz indiscreta —señalé—. Está llena de… —dudé.
vi_translation: "Daisy has a careless, imprudent voice." I remarked. "Daisy's voice is full of..." I hesitated.
tr_translation: “That Daisy is a blabbermouth,” I said hesitantly, “In her voice...”
es_translation: —Daisy has an indiscreet voice —I pointed out—. It's full of… —I hesitated.

en: “Her voice is full of money,” he said suddenly.
vi: "Giọng của nàng mang đầy tính chất tiền bạc." Gatsy đột ngột tiếp lời.
tr: “Sesinde para şıkırtısı var” diye cümlemi tamamladı bir­denbire.
es: —Es una voz llena de dinero —dijo Gatsby de repente.
vi_translation: "Her voice is full of money." Gatsby suddenly continued.
tr_translation: “There is a sound of money clinking in your voice,” he suddenly completed my sentence.
es_translation: —It's a voice full of money —said Gatsby suddenly.

en: Tom came out of the house wrapping a quart bottle in a towel, followed by Daisy and Jordan wearing small tight hats of metallic cloth and carrying light capes over their arms.
vi: Tom bước từ trong nhà ra tay cầm chai rượu cuộn trong chiếc khăn, theo sau là Daisy và Jordan đầu đội hai chiếc nón nhỏ vải kim loại may sát đầu, trên cánh tay cầm khoác hai chiếc áo choàng nhẹ.
tr: Tom elindeki litrelik şişeyi havluya sararak evden çıkıyordu, Daisy ve Jordan ise başlarında pırıltılı, minik şapkalar, kollarında ince yazlık pelerinleriyle onun arkasından.
es: Tom salió de la casa con una botella envuelta en una toalla, seguido de Daisy y Jordan, que se habían puesto unos sombreritos de un tejido metálico y llevaban en el brazo unas capas ligeras.
vi_translation: Tom stepped out of the house with a bottle of wine wrapped in a towel, followed by Daisy and Jordan, each wearing a small metallic fabric hat that fit snugly on their heads, and carrying two light cloaks on their arms.
tr_translation: Tom was leaving the house, wrapping the liter bottle in a towel, while Daisy and Jordan followed him with sparkling little hats on their heads and thin summer capes on their arms.
es_translation: Tom left the house with a bottle wrapped in a towel, followed by Daisy and Jordan, who had put on little hats made of a metallic fabric and were carrying light capes on their arms.

en: “Shall we all go in my car?” suggested Gatsby. He felt the hot, green leather of the seat. “I ought to have left it in the shade.”
vi: "Tất cả đi xe tôi?" Gatsby đề nghị, đưa tay sờ chiếc ghế da màu xanh lá cây nóng bỏng. "Đáng ra tôi nên đậu xe ở trong bóng mát."
tr: “Hepimiz benim arabaya binelim mi?” diye sordu Gatsby, ısınmış, yeşil deri koltuklara dokunurken. “Keşke gölgede bıraksaymışım.
es: —¿Vamos todos en mi coche? —sugirió Gatsby. Palpó el asiento de piel verde, muy caliente—. Debería haberlo dejado a la sombra.
vi_translation: "Everyone ride in my car?" Gatsby suggested, touching the scorching green leather seat. "I should have parked in the shade."
tr_translation: “Shall we all get into my car?” asked Gatsby, while touching the warmed, green leather seats. “I wish I had left it in the shade.”
es_translation: —Shall we all go in my car? —suggested Gatsby. He felt the very hot green leather seat—. I should have left it in the shade.

en: “Is it standard shift?” demanded Tom.
vi: "Cần số tay xe của anh có phải là loại phổ thông không?" Tom hỏi.
tr: “Standart vites mi?” dedi Tom.
es: —¿El cambio de marchas es normal? —preguntó Tom.
vi_translation: "Is your car's manual transmission the standard type?" Tom asked.
tr_translation: “Manual transmission?” said Tom.
es_translation: —Is the gear shifting normal? —asked Tom.

en: “Yes.”
vi: "Đúng vậy."
tr: “Evet.
es: —Sí.
vi_translation: "That's right."
tr_translation: “Yes.”
es_translation: —Yes.

en: “Well, you take my coupé and let me drive your car to town.”
vi: "Như vậy, anh lái chiếc xe hai chỗ của tôi, để tôi lái xe của anh."
tr: “Sen benim spor arabayı al, ben de seninkini.
es: —Entonces coja mi cupé y déjeme que conduzca su coche hasta la ciudad.
vi_translation: "So, you drive my two-seater car, and I'll drive your car."
tr_translation: "You take my sports car, and I'll take yours."
es_translation: —Then take my coupe and let me drive your car to the city.

en: The suggestion was distasteful to Gatsby.
vi: Lời đề nghị khiến Gatsby khó chịu, anh phản đối.
tr: Gatsby bu öneriden pek hoşlanmamıştı.
es: A Gatsby no le gustó la sugerencia.
vi_translation: The suggestion made Gatsby uncomfortable, and he objected.
tr_translation: Gatsby was not very pleased with this suggestion.
es_translation: Gatsby did not like the suggestion.

en: “I don’t think there’s much gas,” he objected.
vi: "Tôi nghĩ xe tôi không còn nhiều xăng lắm."
tr: “Fazla benzini olmayabilir” diyerek karşı çıkmaya çalıştı.
es: —Creo que no tiene suficiente gasolina.
vi_translation: "I think my car doesn't have much gas left."
tr_translation: “He might not have much gas,” he tried to argue.
es_translation: —I think it doesn't have enough gasoline.

en: “Plenty of gas,” said Tom boisterously. He looked at the gauge. “And if it runs out I can stop at a drugstore. You can buy anything at a drugstore nowadays.”
vi: "Còn nhiều xăng." Tom nói oang oang rồi nhìn vào kim chỉ xăng. "Nếu như nó hết xăng tôi có thể ngừng ở tiệm thuốc nào đó. Thời buổi bây giờ ở mấy tiệm thuốc mua gì cũng có."
tr: “Fazla benzini olmayabilir” diyerek karşı çıkmaya çalıştı. “Bunda benzin çok” dedi Tom göstergeye göz atarak, “biterse senin eczanelerden birinden alırız nasıl olsa. Bugünlerde eczanelerde her şey satılıyor.
es: —Hay de sobra —dijo Tom, impetuoso. Miró el indicador—. Y si se acaba, puedo parar en un drugstore. Hoy día puedes comprar cualquier cosa en un drugstore.
vi_translation: "There's still plenty of gas." Tom said loudly and then looked at the fuel gauge. "If it runs out of gas, I can stop at some drugstore." "Nowadays, you can buy anything at drugstores."
tr_translation: “He might not have much gas,” he tried to argue. "There's plenty of gas," said Tom, glancing at the gauge, "if it runs out, we'll get some from one of your pharmacies anyway. These days, everything is sold in pharmacies."
es_translation: —There's plenty —said Tom, impetuously. He looked at the gauge—. And if it runs out, I can stop at a drugstore. These days you can buy anything at a drugstore.

en: A pause followed this apparently pointless remark. Daisy looked at Tom frowning, and an indefinable expression, at once definitely unfamiliar and vaguely recognizable, as if I had only heard it described in words, passed over Gatsby’s face.
vi: Mọi người im lặng sau lời nhận xét lạc lõng vô ý nghĩa này. Daisy nhìn Tom nhăn mặt và trên khuôn mặt của Gatsby thoáng hiện vẻ mặt khó tả, vẻ mặt mà tôi dứt khoát vừa như chưa từng thấy nhưng cũng vừa như mang máng quen thuộc, giống như là tôi chỉ được nghe diễn tà bằng lời.
tr: Bu gereksiz bilgilendirmenin ardından derin bir sessizlik ol­du. Daisy kaşlarını çatıp Tom’a baktı. Gatsby’nin yüzünden ise, aynı anda hem bildik hem de tanınmaz, sanki yalnızca kelimelerde anlatıldığını duyduğum tarifsiz bir ifade gelip geçti.
es: Un silencio siguió a esta observación, aparentemente sin segundas intenciones. Daisy miró a Tom frunciendo las cejas, y una expresión indefinible, a la vez irremediablemente extraña y vagamente reconocible, como si yo sólo hubiera oído las palabras que la describían, pasó par la cara de Gatsby.
vi_translation: Everyone fell silent after this meaningless and out-of-place comment. Daisy looked at Tom with a frown, and on Gatsby's face there was a fleeting, indescribable expression, an expression that I was certain I had never seen before but also vaguely familiar, as if I had only heard it described in words.
tr_translation: After this unnecessary information, there was a deep silence. Daisy frowned and looked at Tom. On Gatsby's face, there passed an indescribable expression that seemed both familiar and unrecognizable at the same time, as if I had only heard it described in words.
es_translation: A silence followed this remark, seemingly without any ulterior motives. Daisy looked at Tom with furrowed brows, and an indefinable expression, at once irremediably strange and vaguely recognizable, as if I had only heard the words that described it, passed over Gatsby's face.

en: “Come on, Daisy,” said Tom, pressing her with his hand toward Gatsby’s car. “I’ll take you in this circus wagon.”
vi: "Đi Daisy." Tom nói, lấy tay đẩy Daisy đi về phía xe của Gatsby. "Anh sẽ trở em đi bằng chiếc xe của gánh xiệc dạo này."
tr: “Haydi gel Daisy” dedi Tom, karısını Gatsby’nin arabasına doğru iterek, “seni şu sirk arabasıyla ben götüreceğim,”
es: —Vamos, Daisy —dijo Tom, empujándola hacia el coche de Gatsby—. Te llevaré en este carromato de circo.
vi_translation: "Go Daisy." Tom said, using his hand to push Daisy towards Gatsby's car. "I will take you home in this circus wagon."
tr_translation: "Come on, Daisy," said Tom, pushing his wife towards Gatsby's car, "I'll take you in that circus wagon."
es_translation: —Let's go, Daisy —said Tom, pushing her towards Gatsby's car—. I'll take you in this circus wagon.

en: He opened the door, but she moved out from the circle of his arm.
vi: Tom mở cửa xe, nhưng Daisy lùi tránh ra khỏi cánh tay của anh ta.
tr: Arabanın kapısını açmış bekliyordu ama Daisy geri çekile­rek kolundan kurtuldu.
es: Abrió la puerta, pero Daisy eludió el círculo de su brazo.
vi_translation: Tom opened the car door, but Daisy backed away from his arm.
tr_translation: He had opened the car door and was waiting, but Daisy pulled back and freed herself from his arm.
es_translation: He opened the door, but Daisy dodged the circle of his arm.

en: “You take Nick and Jordan. We’ll follow you in the coupé.”
vi: "Anh chở Nick và Jordan đi. Hai chúng tôi sẽ đi theo sau bằng chiếc xe cup này."
tr: “Sen Nick ile Jordan’ı al. Biz küçük arabayla arkadan gelelim.
es: —Lleva a Nick y Jordan. Nosotros te seguiremos en el cupé.
vi_translation: "I'll drive Nick and Jordan." "The two of us will follow behind on this scooter."
tr_translation: "Take Nick and Jordan with you." "We'll follow behind in the small car."”
es_translation: —Take Nick and Jordan. We will follow you in the coupe.

en: She walked close to Gatsby, touching his coat with her hand. Jordan and Tom and I got into the front seat of Gatsby’s car, Tom pushed the unfamiliar gears tentatively, and we shot off into the oppressive heat, leaving them out of sight behind.
vi: Daisy bước lại gần Gatsby, đưa tay đặt nhẹ lên áo khoác của Gatsby. Jordan, Tom và tôi bưóc vào băng ghế trên của xe của Gatsby. Tom tần ngần đưa tay kéo chiếc cần số xe không quen thuộc, rồi chúng tôi phóng vụt đi vào trong cơn nóng ngột ngạt, bỏ lại mất hút hai người kia lại phía sau lưng.
tr: Gatsby’nin yanına sokulup ceketine dokundu. Jordan, Tom ve ben Gatsby’nin arabasının ön koltuğuna yerleştik. Tom bil­mediği vitesi ileri taktı ve onları gözden kaybedecek kadar geride bırakarak hızla bunaltıcı sıcağın içine daldık.
es: Se acercó a Gatsby y le tocó la chaqueta. Jordan, Tom y yo nos sentamos en el coche de Gatsby, los tres delante. Tom tanteó el embrague y la palanca de cambios que no conocía y salimos disparados hacia el calor oprimente, perdiendo de vista a los que quedaban atrás.
vi_translation: Daisy walked closer to Gatsby, gently placing her hand on Gatsby's coat. Jordan, Tom, and I stepped into the upper bench seat of Gatsby's car. Tom hesitantly reached out to pull the unfamiliar gear shift, and then we sped off into the stifling heat, leaving the other two behind.
tr_translation: He approached Gatsby and touched his jacket. Jordan, Tom, and I settled into the front seat of Gatsby's car. Tom engaged an unfamiliar gear and we sped into the oppressive heat, leaving them far behind and out of sight.
es_translation: He approached Gatsby and touched his jacket. Jordan, Tom, and I sat in Gatsby's car, all three of us in the front. Tom fumbled with the unfamiliar clutch and gear shift, and we shot off into the oppressive heat, losing sight of those left behind.

en: “See what?”
vi: "Thấy cái gì?"
tr: “Neyi gördük mü?
es: —¿En qué?
vi_translation: "See what?"
tr_translation: “What did we see?”
es_translation: —In what?

en: He looked at me keenly, realizing that Jordan and I must have known all along.
vi: Tom ném cho tôi một cái nhìn sắc bén, anh chợt nhận thức ra rằng cả tôi và Jordan chắc chắn đã biết hết mọi chuyện từ lâu rồi.
tr: Dönüp sert sert yüzüme baktı. Jordan’la benim durumu bildiğimizi o an anlamıştı.
es: Me miró con intensidad, dándose cuenta de que Jordan y yo lo sabíamos todo.
vi_translation: Tom threw me a sharp look, suddenly realizing that both Jordan and I had certainly known everything for a long time.
tr_translation: He turned and looked at my face sternly. At that moment, he realized that Jordan and I knew the situation.
es_translation: He looked at me intently, realizing that Jordan and I knew everything.

en: “You think I’m pretty dumb, don’t you?” he suggested. “Perhaps I am, but I have a—almost a second sight, sometimes, that tells me what to do. Maybe you don’t believe that, but science—”
vi: "Mấy người tưởng tôi ngốc lắm phải không?" Tom hỏi. "Có thể tôi ngốc, nhưng tôi có một thứ đôi khi coi gần như là cặp mắt thứ hai, nó cho tôi hay tôi nên làm gì. Có thể mấy người không tin tôi, thế nhưng khoa học..."
tr: “Ahmak olduğumu mu sanıyorsunuz yoksa?” diye gürledi “bel­ki biraz öyleyimdir. Ama ara sıra bana yol gösteren bir altıncı hissim var. Siz inanmayabilirsiniz fakat bilim...
es: —Creéis que soy imbécil, ¿no? —sugirió—. A lo mejor lo soy, pero tengo… A veces tengo un instinto especial que me dice lo que debo hacer. Puede que no lo creáis, pero la ciencia…
vi_translation: "You all think I'm very stupid, don't you?" Tom asked. "Maybe I'm stupid, but I have something that sometimes acts almost like a second pair of eyes, it tells me what I should do. Maybe you all don't believe me, but science..."
tr_translation: “Do you think I'm a fool?” he roared, “maybe I am a bit. But I have a sixth sense that guides me from time to time. You may not believe it, but science...”
es_translation: —You think I'm an idiot, don't you? —he suggested—. Maybe I am, but I have... Sometimes I have a special instinct that tells me what I should do. You might not believe it, but science...

en: He paused. The immediate contingency overtook him, pulled him back from the edge of theoretical abyss.
vi: Tom ngừng lại. Cái sự hiển nhiên trước mặt ngay lập tức chiếm cứ lấy anh, lôi kéo anh ra khỏi ven bờ vực thằm không thực tế.
tr: Sustu. Aklına gelen ihtimal, kıyısına kadar geldiği bilimsel varsayımların derinliğinden çekip almıştı onu.
es: Calló. La situación de emergencia inmediata se le impuso, apartándolo del borde del abismo teórico.
vi_translation: Tom stopped. The obviousness in front of him immediately took hold of him, pulling him away from the edge of the unrealistic abyss.
tr_translation: He fell silent. The possibility that came to his mind had pulled him out from the depths of the scientific assumptions he had approached.
es_translation: He fell silent. The immediate emergency situation imposed itself on him, pulling him away from the edge of the theoretical abyss.

en: “I’ve made a small investigation of this fellow,” he continued. “I could have gone deeper if I’d known—”
vi: "Tôi đã làm một điều tra nho nhỏ về tên này." Tom tiếp tục. "Đáng lẽ ra tôi có thể điều tra kỹ hơn nếu như tôi biết..."
tr: “O he­rif hakkında ufak bir araştırma yaptım” diye de­vam etti, “Durumu bilseydim araştırmayı derinleştirirdim elbette...
