es: —He hecho una pequeña investigación sobre el tipo ese —continuó—. Y, si hubiera sabido, habría profundizado más.
vi_translation: "I did a little investigation on this guy." Tom continued. "I could have investigated more thoroughly if I had known..."
tr_translation: "I did a little research on that sheriff," he continued, "If I had known the situation, I would have certainly deepened the research..."
es_translation: —I did a little research on that guy —he continued—. And, if I had known, I would have delved deeper.

en: “Do you mean you’ve been to a medium?” inquired Jordan humorously.
vi: "Có phải ý anh là anh đã đến tìm một bà đồng cốt?" Jordan hỏi một cách khôi hài.
tr: “Yani medyuma falan mı gittim diyorsun” diye işi şaka­ya vurmaya çalıştı Jordan.
es: —¿Quieres decir que has ido a una médium? —preguntó Jordan de broma.
vi_translation: "Do you mean you went to see a fortune teller?" Jordan asked humorously.
tr_translation: “So, you're saying I went to a psychic or something?” Jordan tried to make a joke out of it.
es_translation: —Do you mean you've been to a medium? —Jordan asked jokingly.

en: “What?” Confused, he stared at us as we laughed. “A medium?”
vi: "Cái gì? Bà đồng cốt làm gì?" Tom ngơ ngác, anh nhìn chằm chằm hai đứa chúng tôi trong khi chúng tôi đang phá lên cười.
tr: “Ne?” diye sordu biz kahkaha atarken, “Medyum mu?
es: —¿Cómo? —nos miraba confundido mientras reíamos—. ¿Una médium?
vi_translation: "What? A fortune teller? What for?"
tr_translation: “What?” he asked while we were laughing, “A medium?”
es_translation: —What? —he looked at us confused while we laughed—. A medium?

en: “About Gatsby! No, I haven’t. I said I’d been making a small investigation of his past.”
vi: "Để hỏi về Gatsby." "Hỏi bà đồng về Gatsby! Không, không phải vậy. Tôi nói rằng tôi đã làm một cuộc điều tra nhỏ về quá khứ của hắn ta."
tr: “Gatsby için mi? Hayır gitmedim. Sadece geçmişini biraz araştırdım demek istiyorum.
es: —A preguntarle por Gatsby. —¡Gatsby! No, no he ido. He dicho que he hecho una pequeña investigación sobre su pasado.
vi_translation: "To ask about Gatsby." "Ask the fortune teller about Gatsby! No, that's not it. I said that I had done a little investigation into his past."
tr_translation: “For Gatsby? No, I didn't go. I just mean I did a little research on his past.”
es_translation: —Gatsby! No, I haven't gone. I said that I did a little research on his past.

en: “And you found he was an Oxford man,” said Jordan helpfully.
vi: "Và anh đã tìm ra được rằng anh ta là dân Oxford." Jordan gợi ý.
tr: “Herhalde Oxford’da okuduğunu öğrendin” dedi yardımse­ver Jordan.
es: —Y has descubierto que estudió en Oxford —dijo Jordan, colaborando.
vi_translation: "And he found out that he was from Oxford," Jordan suggested.
tr_translation: “I suppose you learned that he went to Oxford,” said the helpful Jordan.
es_translation: —And you discovered that he studied at Oxford —said Jordan, contributing.

en: “An Oxford man!” He was incredulous. “Like hell he is! He wears a pink suit.”
vi: "Dân Oxford!" Tom nói giọng đầy ngờ vực. "Còn lâu. Hắn ta mặc đồ vest màu hồng."
tr: “Oxford’da mı okumuş?” kulaklarına inanamıyordu, “Yok daha neler! Adam pembe takım elbise giyiyor!
es: —Y has descubierto que estudió en Oxford —dijo Jordan, colaborando. —¡Oxford! —exclamó, incrédulo—. ¡Qué estupidez! ¡Y lleva un traje rosa!
vi_translation: "Oxford people!" Tom said with a tone full of doubt. "Not even close." He was wearing a pink suit."
tr_translation: “Did he study at Oxford?” He couldn't believe his ears, “No way! The man wears a pink suit!”
es_translation: —And you discovered that he studied at Oxford —said Jordan, contributing. —Oxford! —he exclaimed, incredulous—. What nonsense! And he's wearing a pink suit!

en: “Nevertheless he’s an Oxford man.”
vi: "Dù sao đi nữa anh ta vẫn là cựu sinh viên Oxford."
tr: “Yine de okumuş işte.
es: —Pero ha estudiado en Oxford.
vi_translation: "After all, he is still an Oxford alumnus." "There is an Oxford in the state of New Mexico."
tr_translation: “Still, he read it.”
es_translation: —But he has studied at Oxford.

en: “Listen, Tom. If you’re such a snob, why did you invite him to lunch?” demanded Jordan crossly.
vi: "Oxford ở tiểu bang New Mexico thì có." Tom khịt mũi một cách khinh bỉ. "Hay là ở một nơi nào tương tự." "Nghe đây Tom. Nếu anh hợm hĩnh khinh người như vậy tại sao lại còn mời anh ta đến ăn trưa?" Jordan bực mình hạch hỏi "Tại vì Daisy mời hắn ta.
tr: “Pekala Tom. O kadar küçümsediğin birini yemeğe neden çağırdın öyleyse?” dedi Jordan birden öfkelenerek.
es: —Dime, Tom. Si eres tan esnob, ¿por qué lo has invitado a comer? —preguntó Jordan de mal humor.
vi_translation: "Or somewhere similar." "Listen here, Tom. If you're so arrogant and condescending, why did you invite him to lunch?" Jordan asked irritably. "Because Daisy invited him.
tr_translation: "Alright, Tom. Why did you invite someone you look down on so much to dinner, then?" said Jordan, suddenly getting angry.
es_translation: —Tell me, Tom. If you're such a snob, why did you invite him to lunch? —asked Jordan moodily.

en: “Daisy invited him; she knew him before we were married—God knows where!”
vi: Cô ấy quen biết với hắn ta trước khi chúng tôi lấy nhau. Có chúa mới biết họ quen nhau ở đâu."
tr: “Daisy çağırdı. Evlenmeden önce onu tanıyormuş. Tanrı bilir nereden!
es: —Lo ha invitado Daisy: lo conoció antes de casarnos. ¡Dios sabe dónde!
vi_translation: She knew him before we got married. God knows where they met."
tr_translation: “Daisy called. She knew him before they got married. God knows from where!”
es_translation: —Daisy invited him: she knew him before we got married. God knows where!

en: We were all irritable now with the fading ale, and aware of it we drove for a while in silence. Then as Doctor T. J. Eckleburg’s faded eyes came into sight down the road, I remembered Gatsby’s caution about gasoline.
vi: Men rượu trong người đã tan khiến mọi người chúng tôi đều trở nên dễ cáu kỉnh. Nhận thức được điều này, chúng tôi cố giữ im lặng để xe chạy một lúc lâu. Khi cặp mắt phai mờ của bác sĩ nhãn khoa T. J. Eckleburg hiện ra ở cuối con đường, tôi chợt nhớ ra lời nhắc nhở của Gatsby về xăng.
tr: Biraların etkisi azaldıkça hırçınlaşıyorduk. Üstelik bunun da farkındaydık. Bir süre konuşmadan yolumuza devam ettik. Dok­tor T. J. Eckleburg’un solgun gözleri yolun başında aniden karşı­mıza çıkınca, Gatsby’nin benzinin az olduğunu söyledi­ğini anımsadım.
es: Ahora los tres estábamos irritables porque pasaban los efectos de la cerveza y, dándonos cuenta, viajamos un rato en silencio. Cuando aparecieron al fondo de la carretera los ojos descoloridos del doctor T. J. Eckleburg, recordé el aviso de Gatsby sobre la gasolina.
vi_translation: The alcohol in our bodies had dissipated, making all of us become easily irritable. Aware of this, we tried to keep silent as the car drove for a long while. When the faded eyes of ophthalmologist T. J. Eckleburg appeared at the end of the road, I suddenly remembered Gatsby's reminder about the gasoline.
tr_translation: As the effects of the beers diminished, we were becoming more irritable. Moreover, we were aware of this. We continued on our way for a while without speaking. Doctor T. J. When the pale eyes of Eckleburg suddenly appeared at the beginning of the road, I remembered Gatsby saying that his gas was running low.
es_translation: Now the three of us were irritable because the effects of the beer were wearing off and, realizing this, we traveled in silence for a while. When the faded eyes of Doctor T. J. Eckleburg appeared at the end of the road, I remembered Gatsby's warning about the gasoline.

en: “We’ve got enough to get us to town,” said Tom.
vi: "Mình vẫn còn đủ xăng chạy tới phố." Tom nói.
tr: “Şehre kadar götürür” dedi Tom.
es: —Tenemos suficiente para llegar a la ciudad —dijo Tom.
vi_translation: "We still have enough gas to get to town," Tom said.
tr_translation: “He will take you to the city,” said Tom.
es_translation: —We have enough to reach the city —said Tom.

en: “But there’s a garage right here,” objected Jordan. “I don’t want to get stalled in this baking heat.”
vi: "Thế nhưng có một tiệm sửa xe ngay ở đây." Jordan phản đối.
tr: “Şurada bir tamirhane var” dedi Jordan, “Bu sıcakta yolda kalıp pişmek istemem.
es: —Pero hay ahí mismo una estación de servicio —objetó Jordan—. No quiero quedarme parada en este horno.
vi_translation: "But there's a repair shop right here." Jordan protested. "I don't want the car to break down in this scorching heat."
tr_translation: "There is a repair shop over there," said Jordan, "I don't want to be stranded and roast in this heat."
es_translation: —But there is a service station right there —objected Jordan—. I don't want to stay stuck in this oven.

en: Tom threw on both brakes impatiently, and we slid to an abrupt dusty stop under Wilson’s sign. After a moment the proprietor emerged from the interior of his establishment and gazed hollow-eyed at the car.
vi: "Em không muốn xe bị chết máy giữa cái nóng nung người này." Tom đưa chân đạp cả hai hai thắng xe một cách nóng nảy, chiếc xe lê bánh tung bụi mịt mờ rồi đậu thắng gấp ngay dưới tấm bảng hiệu của Wilson. Sau một lát sau, người chủ tiệm xuất hiện từ trong ra đưa cặp mắt trũng sâu hoắm nhìn chằm chằm chiếc xe.
tr: Tom sabırsızlıkla frenlerin ikisine birden basınca, araba ka­yarak Wilson’un Yeri yazısının tam altındaki tozlu çukurun yakınında durdu. Bir dakika sonra dükkan sahibi içerden çıkıp gözle­rini kısarak arabaya baktı.
es: Tom, impaciente, usó los dos frenos a la vez y nos deslizamos hasta un rincón árido y polvoriento bajo el letrero donde se leía Wilson. Al cabo de unos segundos el propietario surgió del interior del garaje y lanzó una mirada vacía al coche.
vi_translation: Tom impatiently slammed both brakes, the car skidded to a dusty halt right under Wilson's sign. After a moment, the shop owner emerged, his deep-set eyes staring intently at the car.
tr_translation: When Tom impatiently pressed both brakes, the car skidded and stopped near the dusty pit right under the sign that read Wilson's Place. A minute later, the shop owner came out from inside and squinted at the car.
es_translation: Tom, impatient, used both brakes at once and we skidded to a dusty, barren corner under the sign that read Wilson. After a few seconds, the owner emerged from inside the garage and gave the car a blank stare.

en: “Let’s have some gas!” cried Tom roughly. “What do you think we stopped for—to admire the view?”
vi: "Đổ xăng cho đi." Tom nói to một cách thô lỗ. "Anh nghĩ chúng tôi ngừng xe ở đây để làm gì? Để mà ngắm cảnh ở đây à."
tr: “Biraz benzim alalım” diye seslendi Tom kabaca, “Ne diye durduk sanıyorsun, manzara için mi?
es: —¡Gasolina! —gritó Tom, brutal—. ¿Para qué cree que hemos parado? ¿Para admirar el paisaje?
vi_translation: "Fill up the gas and let's go." Tom said loudly in a rude manner. "What do you think we stopped the car here for? To enjoy the scenery here?"
tr_translation: "Let's get some gas," Tom called out roughly, "Why do you think we stopped, for the scenery?"
es_translation: —Gasoline! —Tom shouted, brutally—. What do you think we stopped for? To admire the scenery?

en: “I’m sick,” said Wilson without moving. “Been sick all day.”
vi: "Tôi đang bịnh." Wilson nói không nhích người. "Bịnh cả ngày nay rồi."
tr: “Çok hastayım” dedi Wilson yerinden kımıldamadan, “Bü­tün gün hastaydım.
es: —Estoy enfermo —dijo Wilson sin moverse—. Llevo enfermo todo el día.
vi_translation: "I'm sick." Wilson said without moving. "I've been sick all day."
tr_translation: "I am very sick," said Wilson without moving, "I have been sick all day."
es_translation: —I am sick —said Wilson without moving—. I've been sick all day.

en: “What’s the matter?”
vi: "Sao vậy?"
tr: “Neyin var?
es: —¿Qué le pasa?
vi_translation: "What's wrong?"
tr_translation: "What's wrong?""
es_translation: —What's wrong with him?

en: “I’m all run down.”
vi: "Tôi mất hết cả sức lực."
tr: “Çok halsizim.
es: —Estoy agotado.
vi_translation: "I have lost all my strength."
tr_translation: "I am very exhausted.""
es_translation: —I am exhausted.

en: “Well, shall I help myself?” Tom demanded. “You sounded well enough on the phone.”
vi: "Thế thì tôi phải tự mình làm đấy à?" Tom nói. "Anh lúc nẫy nói chuyện điện thoại nghe khỏe lắm mà."
tr: “Ne yani depoyu kendim mi doldurayım?” diye sordu Tom “Telefonda sesin hiç hastaymış gibi gelmiyordu.
es: —Bueno, ¿me sirvo yo? —preguntó Tom—. Por teléfono parecía estar perfectamente.
vi_translation: "So I have to do it myself?" Tom said. "You sounded very energetic on the phone earlier."
tr_translation: “What, do you expect me to fill the tank myself?” asked Tom. “You didn't sound sick at all on the phone.”
es_translation: —Well, shall I help myself? —asked Tom—. Over the phone, he seemed perfectly fine.

en: With an effort Wilson left the shade and support of the doorway and, breathing hard, unscrewed the cap of the tank. In the sunlight his face was green.
vi: Cố gắng hết mình, Wilson bước ra khỏi bóng râm và cánh cửa anh đang dựa người, vừa thở hổn hển nặng nề vừa mở nắp bình xăng. Dưới ánh nắng mặt trời, khuôn mặt của anh ta trông xanh dờn.
tr: Wilson, kapı ağzındaki gölgelik yerden, binbir gayretle güçbela nefes alarak geldi. Benzin deposunun kapa­ğını açarken yüzünün yemyeşil olduğunu fark ettim.
es: Wilson dejó con esfuerzo la sombra y el apoyo de la puerta y, respirando con dificultad, quitó el tapón del depósito. A la luz del sol tenía la cara verde.
vi_translation: Trying his best, Wilson stepped out of the shadow and the door he was leaning on, gasping heavily as he opened the fuel tank cap. Under the sunlight, his face looked pale.
tr_translation: Wilson came from the shaded area at the doorway, struggling to breathe with great effort. As he opened the gas tank cap, I noticed that his face was completely green.
es_translation: Wilson, with effort, left the shadow and support of the door and, breathing with difficulty, removed the cap from the tank. In the sunlight, his face was green.

en: “I didn’t mean to interrupt your lunch,” he said. “But I need money pretty bad, and I was wondering what you were going to do with your old car.”
vi: "Tôi không có ý quấy rầy bữa ăn trưa của anh." Wilson nói. "Thế nhưng tôi thúc bách cần tiền gấp, và không biết anh đang định làm gì với chiếc xe cũ của anh."
tr: “Yemeğin ortasında aramak istemezdim ama paraya çok ihtiyacım var. O yüzden eski arabanızı ne yapacağınızı öğrenmeye çalışı­yordum.
es: —No era mi intención molestarlo durante el almuerzo —dijo—. Pero necesito dinero rápido y quería saber qué piensa hacer con su coche viejo.
vi_translation: "I don't mean to disturb your lunch." Wilson said. "However, I am in urgent need of money and I don't know what you plan to do with your old car."
tr_translation: "I didn't want to call in the middle of your meal, but I really need money. That's why I was trying to find out what you were going to do with your old car."
es_translation: —It was not my intention to bother you during lunch —he said—. But I need money quickly and wanted to know what you plan to do with your old car.

en: “How do you like this one?” inquired Tom. “I bought it last week.”
vi: "Anh có thích chiếc xe này không?" Tom hỏi. "Tôi mới mua nó tuần rồi."
tr: “Bunu nasıl buldun? Daha geçen hafta aldım.
es: —¿Le gusta éste? —preguntó Tom—. Lo compré la semana pasada.
vi_translation: "Do you like this car?" Tom asked. "I just bought it last week."
tr_translation: “How did you find this? I just got it last week.”
es_translation: —Do you like this one? —asked Tom—. I bought it last week.

en: “It’s a nice yellow one,” said Wilson, as he strained at the handle.
vi: "Chiếc xe màu vàng này đẹp lắm." Wilson vừa nói vừa kéo cần xăng.
tr: “Güzel. Renginin sarı olması da hoş” dedi adam, benzini doldurmaya çalışırken.
es: —Es estupendo, amarillo —dijo Wilson, mientras se afanaba con la manivela del surtidor.
vi_translation: "This yellow car is very beautiful," Wilson said as he pulled the fuel lever.
tr_translation: "Beautiful." "The fact that it's yellow is also nice," said the man, while trying to fill up the gas.
es_translation: —It's great, yellow —said Wilson, as he busied himself with the pump handle.

en: “Like to buy it?”
vi: " Muốn mua nó không?"
tr: “Almak ister misin peki?
es: —¿Quiere comprarlo?
vi_translation: "Do you want to buy it?"
tr_translation: “Do you want to take it then?”
es_translation: —Do you want to buy it?

en: “Big chance,” Wilson smiled faintly. “No, but I could make some money on the other.”
vi: "Khó có cơ hội lắm." Wilson mỉm cười một cách yếu ớt. "Thế nhưng tôi có thể kiếm được chút lời nếu mua được chiếc kia."
tr: “İyi olurdu” dedi gülümsemeye çalışarak, “ama istemem. Belki ötekinden biraz kar edebilirim.
es: —Es demasiado —Wilson sonrió débilmente—. No, pero al otro podría sacarle algún dinero.
vi_translation: "It's very unlikely." Wilson smiled weakly. "But I could make a little profit if I manage to buy that one."
tr_translation: “It would be nice,” he said, trying to smile, “but I don't want it. Maybe I can make a little profit from the other one.”
es_translation: —It's too much —Wilson smiled weakly—. No, but I could get some money out of the other one.

en: “What do you want money for, all of a sudden?”
vi: "Sao bỗng dưng anh lại cần tiền như vậy?"
tr: “Birdenbire neden para gerekti sana?
es: —¿Y para qué necesita dinero con tanta urgencia?
vi_translation: "Why do you suddenly need money like that?"
tr_translation: “Why do you suddenly need money?”
es_translation: —And why do you need money so urgently?

en: “I’ve been here too long. I want to get away. My wife and I want to go West.”
vi: "Tôi ở đây cũng khá lâu rồi. Tôi muốn dọn đi nơi khác. Vợ tôi và tôi muốn dọn về miền Tây."
tr: “Çok uzun zamandır buradayım. Uzaklara gitmek istiyorum artık. Karım da ben de Batıya gitmek istiyoruz.
es: —Llevo aquí demasiado tiempo. Quiero irme. Mi mujer y yo queremos irnos al Oeste.
vi_translation: "I have been here for quite a long time. I want to move somewhere else. My wife and I want to move to the West."
tr_translation: “I have been here for a very long time. I want to go far away now. My wife and I both want to go West.”
es_translation: —I've been here too long. I want to leave. My wife and I want to go to the West.

en: “Your wife does,” exclaimed Tom, startled.
vi: "Vợ của anh muốn dọn đi à." Tom sửng sốt.
tr: “Karın mı?” diye bağırdı Tom şaşkınlıkla.
es: —Su mujer quiere irse —exclamó Tom, muy sorprendido.
vi_translation: "Your wife wants to move out?" Tom was astonished.
tr_translation: “Your wife?” Tom shouted in astonishment.
es_translation: —His wife wants to leave —exclaimed Tom, very surprised.

en: “She’s been talking about it for ten years.” He rested for a moment against the pump, shading his eyes. “And now she’s going whether she wants to or not. I’m going to get her away.”
vi: "Cô ấy nói về chuyện này đến cả mười năm nay." Wilson đứng dựa cột xăng để nghỉ một lát, lấy tay che mắt khỏi nắng. "Bây giờ có muốn hay không muốn cô ấy cũng phải đi. Tôi sẽ lôi cô ấy đi."
tr: “On senedir bundan bahsedip duruyor” dedi elini gözlerine siper ederek benzin pompasına dayandı, “şimdi istese de istemese de gideceğiz. Onu buralardan götüreceğim.
es: —Lleva hablando de eso diez años —se apoyó un instante en el surtidor, protegiéndose los ojos del sol—. Y ahora se va a ir quiera o no quiera. Me la pienso llevar.
vi_translation: "She has been talking about this for ten years." Wilson stood leaning against the gas pump to rest for a moment, shading his eyes from the sun. "Now, whether she wants to or not, she has to go. I will drag her away."
tr_translation: “He has been talking about this for ten years,” he said, shielding his eyes with his hand as he leaned against the gas pump, “now, whether he wants to or not, we will go. I will take him away from here.”
es_translation: —He has been talking about that for ten years —he leaned on the pump for a moment, shielding his eyes from the sun—. And now he is going to leave whether he wants to or not. I'm planning to take her with me.

en: The coupé flashed by us with a flurry of dust and the flash of a waving hand.
vi: Chiếc xe cup chạy loáng qua chúng tôi tung đám bụi mù và chớp nhoáng bàn tay vẫy chào.
tr: Tom’un spor arabası yanımızdan bir toz bulutu bırakarak geçerken içindekiler el sallamayı ihmal etmediler.
es: El cupé nos pasó a toda velocidad con un torbellino de polvo y el centelleo de una mano que saludó.
vi_translation: The cup motorbike sped past us, kicking up a cloud of dust and a fleeting wave of a hand.
tr_translation: Tom's sports car passed by us leaving a cloud of dust, and the people inside did not forget to wave.
es_translation: The coupe sped past us with a whirlwind of dust and the glint of a waving hand.

en: “What do I owe you?” demanded Tom harshly.
vi: "Bao nhiêu tiền đây?" Tom hỏi vội vã.
tr: “Borcum ne kadar?” diye sordu Tom sert bir sesle.
es: —¿Cuánto le debo? —preguntó Tom con voz desagradable.
vi_translation: "How much money is this?" Tom asked hurriedly.
tr_translation: “How much is my debt?” Tom asked in a harsh voice.
es_translation: —How much do I owe you? —asked Tom in an unpleasant voice.

en: “I just got wised up to something funny the last two days,” remarked Wilson. “That’s why I want to get away. That’s why I been bothering you about the car.”
vi: "Mới hai ngày nay tôi khám phá ra một chuyện đáng nghi ngờ." Wilson kể lể." Đó là lý do tại sao tôi muốn dọn đi. Đó là lý do tại sao tôi làm phiền anh về chuyện chiếc xe."
tr: “İki gün kadar önce arkamdan tuhaf şeyler çevrildiğini anladım” dedi adam, “Onun için buradan uzaklaşmak istiyorum. Eski arabanı ne yapacağını ondan bilmek istedim.
es: —He notado algo raro estos últimos días —señaló Wilson—. Por eso me quiero ir. Y por eso lo he molestado con lo del coche.
vi_translation: "Just two days ago, I discovered something suspicious," Wilson recounted. "That's why I want to move out." "That's why I bothered you about the car."
tr_translation: “I realized about two days ago that strange things were happening behind my back,” said the man, “That's why I want to get away from here. I wanted to know from him what you would do with your old car.”
es_translation: —I have noticed something strange these past few days —pointed out Wilson—. That's why I want to leave. And that's why I bothered you about the car.

en: “What do I owe you?”
vi: "Bao nhiêu tiền đây?"
tr: “Borcum ne kadar?
es: —¿Cuánto le debo?
vi_translation: "How much money is this?"
tr_translation: “How much do I owe you?”
es_translation: —How much do I owe you?

en: “Dollar twenty.”
vi: "Một đồng hai."
tr: “Bir dolar, yirmi sent.
es: —Un dólar veinte.
vi_translation: "One dong two."
tr_translation: “One dollar, twenty cents.”
es_translation: —One dollar twenty.

en: The relentless beating heat was beginning to confuse me and I had a bad moment there before I realized that so far his suspicions hadn’t alighted on Tom. He had discovered that Myrtle had some sort of life apart from him in another world, and the shock had made him physically sick. I stared at him and then at Tom, who had made a parallel discovery less than an hour before—and it occurred to me that there was no difference between men, in intelligence or race, so profound as the difference between the sick and the well. Wilson was so sick that he looked guilty, unforgivably guilty—as if he had just got some poor girl with child.
vi: Cơn nóng như hừng hực tàn bạo làm cho đầu óc tôi mụ lẫn, tôi cảm thấy khó chịu mãi một lúc cho tới khi tôi chợt nhận thức ra rằng sự nghi ngờ của Wilson chưa hướng về Tom. Wilson đã khám phá ra rằng đời sống của Myrtle có phần nào đã tách rời ra cuộc đời của anh ta, để ngã vào một thế giới khác. Chính cú xốc này đã làm cho anh ta trở nên bịnh hoạn kiệt sức. Tôi nhìn chừng Wilson rồi lại quay sang nhìn chừng Tom. Cũng như Wilson, Tom cũng chỉ vừa khám phá ra điều tương tự mới chỉ cách đây một giờ. Điều này khiến tôi nghĩ ra rằng giữa con người không có điều khác biệt về mặt trí tuệ hay nòi giống, không giống như sự khác biệt rõ ràng giữa người bịnh và người khỏe. Wilson bịnh nặng quá, bịnh đến nỗi anh ta trông giống như đang mang tội, một tội không thể tha thứ được, tội như là anh ta đã khiến cho một cô gái khốn khổ nào đó có con.
tr: Acımasızca vuran sıcak dalgası aklımı bulandırmış olmalı. Çünkü ada­m konuşurken, Tom’dan kuşkulanmadığını anlayana dek içimi sürekli bir korku sarmıştı. Myrtle’ın bambaşka bir dünyada bambaşka bir hayatı olduğunu anlamıştı ve bunu öğrenmenin sarsıntısıyla hasta düşmüştü. Önce ona, sonra benzer bir olayı bir saat kadar önce yaşayan Tom’a baktım. Bir­den hastalık ve sıhhat haricinde erkekler arasında ne zeka ne de ırk olarak herhangi bir fark bulunmadığı geldi aklıma. Wilson o kadar hastaydı ki, asla affedilemeyecek bir kabahat işlemiş gibi davranıyordu. Genç bir kızı baş­tan çıkarıp hamile bırakmıştı sanki.
es: El calor despiadado empezaba a aturdirme y me sentí mal unos segundos hasta que comprendí que Wilson no sospechaba de Tom. Había descubierto que Myrtle llevaba algún tipo de vida al margen del matrimonio, en otro mundo, y el golpe lo había puesto físicamente enfermo. Miré a Wilson y luego a Tom, que había hecho un descubrimiento paralelo una hora antes, y se me ocurrió que no existe diferencia entre los hombres, ni de inteligencia ni de raza, tan profunda como la diferencia entre los enfermos y los sanos. Wilson estaba tan enfermo que parecía culpable, imperdonablemente culpable, como si acabara de dejar embarazada a una pobre chica.
vi_translation: The oppressive heat made my mind numb, and I felt uncomfortable for a while until I suddenly realized that Wilson's suspicion was not directed at Tom. Wilson had discovered that Myrtle's life had somewhat diverged from his own, leading her into another world. This shock had made him sick and exhausted. I looked at Wilson and then turned to look at Tom. Like Wilson, Tom had only just discovered the same thing an hour ago. This made me think that there is no intellectual or racial difference between people, unlike the clear difference between the sick and the healthy. Wilson was so sick that he looked as if he were bearing an unforgivable sin, a sin like having made some poor girl pregnant.
tr_translation: The relentless heatwave must have clouded my mind. Because while the man was talking, a constant fear gripped me until I realized he wasn't suspicious of Tom. He had understood that Myrtle had a completely different life in a completely different world, and he had fallen ill from the shock of learning this. I looked first at him, then at Tom, who had experienced a similar event about an hour earlier. Suddenly, it occurred to me that apart from illness and health, there was no difference between men in terms of intelligence or race. Wilson was so sick that he acted as if he had committed an unforgivable crime. It was as if he had seduced a young girl and gotten her pregnant.
es_translation: The relentless heat began to daze me, and I felt unwell for a few seconds until I realized that Wilson did not suspect Tom. He had discovered that Myrtle was leading some kind of life outside of their marriage, in another world, and the shock had made him physically ill. I looked at Wilson and then at Tom, who had made a parallel discovery an hour earlier, and it occurred to me that there is no difference between men, neither in intelligence nor in race, as profound as the difference between the sick and the healthy. Wilson was so sick that he seemed guilty, unforgivably guilty, as if he had just gotten a poor girl pregnant.

en: “I’ll let you have that car,” said Tom. “I’ll send it over tomorrow afternoon.”
vi: "Tôi sẽ bán cho anh chiếc xe đó." Tom nói. "Tôi sẽ cho người đưa nó sang cho anh chiều ngày mai."
tr: “Arabayı sana vereceğim” dedi Tom, “Yarın gönderirim”
es: —Le venderé el coche —dijo Tom—. Se lo mandaré mañana por la tarde.
vi_translation: "I will sell you that car," Tom said. "I will have someone deliver it to you tomorrow afternoon."
tr_translation: “I will give you the car,” said Tom, “I will send it tomorrow.”
es_translation: —I will sell him the car —said Tom—. I will send it to him tomorrow afternoon.

en: That locality was always vaguely disquieting, even in the broad glare of afternoon, and now I turned my head as though I had been warned of something behind. Over the ash-heaps the giant eyes of Doctor T. J. Eckleburg kept their vigil, but I perceived, after a moment, that other eyes were regarding us with peculiar intensity from less than twenty feet away.
vi: Nơi chốn này hình như luôn luôn gây cho người ta cái cảm giác băn khoăn lo lắng mơ hồ, dù rằng nó đang ở vào giữa buổi chiều nắng chói lòa. Tôi quay đầu nhìn lại linh cảm như đang có chuyện gì xẩy ra phía sau lưng. Phía bên kia những gò tro, đôi cặp mắt khổng lồ của bác sĩ T. J. Eckleburg đang canh trừng cảnh giác. Thế nhưng sau một lát tôi nhận thấy rằng cách chúng tôi chừng hai mươi thước có một cặp mắt khác đang lom lom quan sát chúng tôi một cách khác thường.
tr: Bulunduğumuz yer, öğle vakti, gün ışığında bile insanın içini ürpertiyor, huzursuz ediyordu. Arkamda bir şeyler varmış duygusuna kapılarak dönüp baktım. Kül ve toz yığınlarının üzerinden bakan Doktor T. J. Eckleburg’un gözleri her za­manki gibi üzerimizdeydi elbette. Ama bir-iki metre ötedeki bir çift gözün daha bizi dikkatle izlediği de kesindi.
es: Aquel sitio tenía siempre algo inquietante, incluso a la luz clara de la tarde, y volví la cabeza como si me hubieran avisado de que algo acechaba a mi espalda. Sobre los montones de ceniza los ojos gigantescos del doctor T. J. Eckleburg seguían vigilantes, pero, al cabo de un momento, me di cuenta de que otros ojos nos miraban con especial intensidad a menos de seis metros de distancia.
vi_translation: This place always seems to give people a vague feeling of anxiety and worry, even though it is in the middle of a bright sunny afternoon. I turned my head back, sensing as if something was happening behind me. On the other side of the ash heaps, the giant eyes of Dr. T. J. Eckleburg were watchfully guarding. However, after a moment, I noticed that about twenty meters away from us, another pair of eyes was staring at us unusually intently.
tr_translation: The place we were in, even at noon, in daylight, was chilling and unsettling. Feeling as if there was something behind me, I turned and looked back. Doctor T. J. Eckleburg's eyes were, of course, always upon us. But it was certain that another pair of eyes a few meters away was also watching us closely.
es_translation: That place always had something unsettling, even in the clear light of the afternoon, and I turned my head as if I had been warned that something was lurking behind me. Over the heaps of ash, the gigantic eyes of Doctor T. J. Eckleburg remained vigilant, but after a moment, I realized that other eyes were watching us with special intensity from less than six meters away.

en: In one of the windows over the garage the curtains had been moved aside a little, and Myrtle Wilson was peering down at the car. So engrossed was she that she had no consciousness of being observed, and one emotion after another crept into her face like objects into a slowly developing picture. Her expression was curiously familiar—it was an expression I had often seen on women’s faces, but on Myrtle Wilson’s face it seemed purposeless and inexplicable until I realized that her eyes, wide with jealous terror, were fixed not on Tom, but on Jordan Baker, whom she took to be his wife.
vi: Ở trong một những chiếc cửa sổ trên lầu nhà sửa xe, tấm màn cửa được vén mở một chút, Myrtle Wilson đang nhô đầu hé nhìn xuống chiếc xe. Cô ta quá chăm chú nhìn đến nỗi không nhận ra được rằng mình đang bị người khác quan sát. Những cảm xúc khác nhau thay phiên hiện lên trên khuôn mặt của cô ta giống như một tấm hình đang được tráng rửa chầm chậm nổi ra hình. Vẻ mặt của Myrtle mang nét tò mò quen thuộc, nó là nét mặt mà tôi thường trông thấy được trên khuôn măt những phụ nữ. Thế nhưng ở Myrtle, vẻ đó trông như không xác định được và không thể giải thích được, cho tới khi tôi nhận thức ra được rằng cặp mắt của cô ta đang mở rộng mang đầy nét kinh hoàng ghen tuông không phải đang nhìn dán chặt vào Tom, mà là vào Jordan Baker, người mà Myrtle lầm tưởng là vợ Tom.
tr: Tamirhanenin üst katındaki pencerelerden birinin perdesi hafifçe aralanmıştı. Myrtle Wilson camın önünde durmuş arabayı inceliyordu. Öyle dalmıştı ki birinin de kendisine baktığını fark etmedi bile. Yüzü art arda değişip duran an­lamlara bürünüyor, banyo edilen bir fotoğraf gibi çeşitli evrelerden geçiyordu. Bunlar bana hiç de yabancı değildi. Kadınların yüzünde sık sık görülen bir ifadeydi. Ne gibi bir açıklaması olabileceğini düşünürken birden korku, dehşet ve kıskançlık saçan gözlerini Tom’a değil de karısı sandığı Jordan’a dikmiş olduğunu fark ettim.
es: En una de las ventanas de la planta superior del garaje las cortinas se habían movido, entreabriéndose, y Myrtle Wilson miraba hacia el coche. Estaba tan absorta que no era consciente de que la observaban, y una emoción tras otra aparecían en su cara como objetos en una foto que se va revelando despacio. Su expresión era curiosamente familiar: era una expresión que yo había visto muchas veces en caras de mujeres, pero que en la cara de Myrtle parecía gratuita e inexplicable hasta que descubrí que sus ojos, de par en par por el terror de los celos, no se clavaban en Tom, sino en Jordan Baker, a la que había tomado por su mujer.
vi_translation: In one of the upstairs windows of the garage, the curtain was slightly drawn back, and Myrtle Wilson was peeking down at the car. She was so engrossed in looking that she didn't realize she was being watched. Various emotions flitted across her face like a photograph slowly developing. Myrtle's expression bore a familiar curiosity, the kind I often saw on the faces of women. But in Myrtle, that look seemed undefined and inexplicable, until I realized that her eyes, wide with a horrified jealousy, were not fixed on Tom, but on Jordan Baker, whom Myrtle mistakenly thought was Tom's wife.
tr_translation: The curtain of one of the windows on the upper floor of the garage was slightly parted. Myrtle Wilson was standing by the window, examining the car. She was so engrossed that she didn't even notice someone was watching her. Her face was taking on a series of changing expressions, passing through various phases like a developing photograph. These were not unfamiliar to me at all. It was an expression often seen on women's faces. While pondering what kind of explanation there could be, I suddenly realized that her eyes, radiating fear, horror, and jealousy, were fixed not on Tom but on Jordan, whom she mistook for his wife.
es_translation: In one of the windows on the upper floor of the garage, the curtains had moved, parting slightly, and Myrtle Wilson was looking towards the car. She was so absorbed that she was unaware she was being watched, and one emotion after another appeared on her face like objects in a photo that slowly develops. Her expression was curiously familiar: it was an expression I had seen many times on women's faces, but on Myrtle's face, it seemed gratuitous and inexplicable until I discovered that her eyes, wide open with the terror of jealousy, were not fixed on Tom, but on Jordan Baker, whom she had mistaken for his wife.

en: There is no confusion like the confusion of a simple mind, and as we drove away Tom was feeling the hot whips of panic. His wife and his mistress, until an hour ago secure and inviolate, were slipping precipitately from his control. Instinct made him step on the accelerator with the double purpose of overtaking Daisy and leaving Wilson behind, and we sped along toward Astoria at fifty miles an hour, until, among the spidery girders of the elevated, we came in sight of the easygoing blue coupé.
vi: Không có sự hoang mang nào có thể so sánh với sự hoang mang của một người nông cạn. Khi chúng tôi lái xe rời khỏi nơi đó, Tom có cảm giác như anh đang bị những ngọn roi nóng bỏng của cơn hốt hoảng quất lên người. Trước đây một giờ, thì cả vợ lẫn người tình còn đang đang vững chắc bất khả xâm phạm thuộc về anh. Giờ đây cả hai người họ đang mau chóng tuột ra khỏi vòng kiềm chế của anh. Phản xạ tự nhiên khiến Tom đạp chân mạnh vào bàn đạp tăng vận tốc với hai mục đích, vừa để đuổi kịp Daisy vừa để bỏ lại Wilson lại sau lưng. Và như thế xe chúng tôi lao nhanh với vận tốc năm mươi lăm dặm một giờ về phía Astoria, cho tới khi tới những thanh rầm cầu dăng ngang như màng nhện trên cao thì bóng chiếc xe màu xanh dương đang nhẩn nha chạy trên đường đã hiện ra.
tr: Bayağı bir aklın karışması kadar rahat­sız edici bir şey olamaz. Yeniden yola koyulduğumuzda Tom kaygıların pençesinde kıvranıyor, kırbaçlanıyormuş gibi acı çekiyordu. Bir saat içersinde, avucunda duran iki kadın, hem karısı hem de metresi aynı anda uçup gitmişlerdi. İçgüdüleri Daisy’e yetişmesini ve Wilson’dan uzaklaşmasını söyledikçe gaz pedalına daha kuvvetle basıyordu. Astoria’ya doğru saatte yüz kilometre hızla giderken önce demiryolu köprüsünün örümcek ağına benzeyen putrellerini, sonra da yavaş seyreden mavi spor arabayı gördük.
es: No hay confusión parecida a la confusión de una mente simple y, mientras nos alejábamos, Tom sentía los latigazos del pánico. Su mujer y su amante, hasta hacía una hora seguras y sin mancha, escapaban precipitadamente de su control. El instinto lo llevaba a pisar el acelerador con el doble propósito de adelantar a Daisy y dejar atrás a Wilson, y corrimos hacia Astoria a ochenta kilómetros por hora hasta que, entre los pilares como patas de araña del tren elevado, vimos el cupé azul que circulaba sin prisa.
vi_translation: There is no confusion that can compare to the confusion of a shallow person. As we drove away from that place, Tom felt as if he were being lashed by the scorching whips of panic. An hour ago, both his wife and his lover were securely and inviolably his. Now, both of them were quickly slipping out of his control. Instinctively, Tom pressed hard on the accelerator pedal with two purposes: to catch up with Daisy and to leave Wilson behind. And so our car sped at fifty-five miles per hour towards Astoria, until the web-like girders of the bridge loomed overhead and the silhouette of the blue car leisurely driving on the road appeared.
tr_translation: There is nothing as disturbing as a mind that is quite confused. When we set off again, Tom was writhing in the grip of worries, suffering as if he were being whipped. Within an hour, the two women in his grasp, both his wife and his mistress, had flown away at the same time. As his instincts told him to catch up with Daisy and get away from Wilson, he pressed the gas pedal harder. While driving towards Astoria at a speed of one hundred kilometers per hour, we first saw the spider-web-like girders of the railway bridge, and then the slow-moving blue sports car.
es_translation: There is no confusion like the confusion of a simple mind, and as we drove away, Tom felt the lashes of panic. His wife and his lover, secure and unblemished until an hour ago, were precipitously escaping his control. Instinct drove him to press the accelerator with the dual purpose of overtaking Daisy and leaving Wilson behind, and we sped towards Astoria at eighty kilometers per hour until, between the spider-leg-like pillars of the elevated train, we saw the blue coupe leisurely driving along.

en: “Those big movies around Fiftieth Street are cool,” suggested Jordan. “I love New York on summer afternoons when everyone’s away. There’s something very sensuous about it—overripe, as if all sorts of funny fruits were going to fall into your hands.”
vi: "Những rạp chiếu phim lớn ở quanh đường Fifty mát lắm." Jordan đề nghị. "Em thích New York vào những chiều mùa hè khi mọi người đều bỏ đi cả. Ở nó có một cái gì đó rất nhục cảm, chín muồi, giống như đủ loại trái cây kỳ lạ đang rơi vào tay mình."
tr: “50. Cadde’deki sinema salonları çok serin olur” diyerek ortaya bir fikir attı Jordan, “Yaz günleri öğle­den sonralarını çok seviyorum. Herkes bir yerlere dağılmış, New York boşalmış oluyor. Bu bana çok erotik gelir. Sanki her çeşit geçkin, eğlenceli meyve avuçlarımın içine düşecekmiş gibi hissederim.
es: —Los cines grandes de la calle Cincuenta están refrigerados —sugirió Jordan—. Me encanta Nueva York en las tardes de verano cuando no hay nadie. Tienen algo muy sensual, como de fruta madura, como si fueran a caernos en las manos todo tipo de frutas exóticas.
vi_translation: "The big movie theaters around Fifty Street are really cool." Jordan suggested. "I like New York in the summer afternoons when everyone has left. There is something very sensual, ripe about it, like all kinds of exotic fruits falling into your hands."
tr_translation: "50. Jordan threw out an idea, saying, "The movie theaters on the Avenue are very cool. I love the afternoons of summer days. Everyone has scattered somewhere, and New York becomes empty. This feels very erotic to me. I feel as if all kinds of ripe, fun fruits are about to fall into my hands."
es_translation: —The big theaters on Fifty Street are air-conditioned —suggested Jordan—. I love New York in the summer afternoons when there's no one around. They have something very sensual, like ripe fruit, as if all kinds of exotic fruits were about to fall into our hands.

en: The word “sensuous” had the effect of further disquieting Tom, but before he could invent a protest the coupé came to a stop, and Daisy signalled us to draw up alongside.
vi: Cái từ nhục cảm càng khiến Tom thêm bồn chồn, thế nhưng trước khi Tom kịp nghĩ ra lời gì đó để bác lại thì chiếc xe cup đã ngừng lại, Daisy đưa dấu ra hiệu cho chúng tôi tiến lại gần bên hông.
tr: ‘Erotik’ kelimesi Tom’u büsbütün rahatsız etmişti. Karşı çıkmak üzereyken önümüzdekiler durdu. Daisy kenara çekmemizi işaret etti.
es: La palabra «sensual» tuvo el efecto de inquietar aún más a Tom, pero antes de que pudiera inventar una protesta el cupé se detuvo, y Daisy nos indicó que paráramos a su lado.
vi_translation: The word sensuality made Tom even more restless, but before he could think of something to refute it, the scooter had already stopped, and Daisy signaled for us to move closer to the side.
tr_translation: The word 'Erotic' had completely unsettled Tom. Just as he was about to object, those in front of us stopped. Daisy signaled us to pull over.
es_translation: The word "sensual" had the effect of unsettling Tom even more, but before he could come up with a protest, the coupe stopped, and Daisy signaled us to stop beside her.

en: “Where are we going?” she cried.
vi: "Chúng ta đi đâu đây?" Daisy la to.
tr: “Nereye gidiyoruz?” diye bağırdı.
es: —¿Adónde vamos? —gritó.
vi_translation: "Where are we going?" Daisy shouted.
tr_translation: “Where are we going?” he shouted.
es_translation: —Where are we going? —he shouted.

en: “How about the movies?”
vi: "Hay là đi xem phim?"
tr: “Sinemaya ne dersiniz?
es: —¿Nos metemos en un cine?
vi_translation: "How about going to the movies?"
tr_translation: “What do you say to the movies?”
es_translation: —Shall we go into a movie theater?

en: “It’s so hot,” she complained. “You go. We’ll ride around and meet you after.” With an effort her wit rose faintly. “We’ll meet you on some corner. I’ll be the man smoking two cigarettes.”
vi: "Trời nóng lắm." Daisy phàn nàn. "Mấy người đi đi. Hai đứa chúng tôi sẽ chạy vòng quanh và sẽ gặp lại mọi người sau." Daisy cố gắng lên giọng dí dỏm một cách tẻ nhạt. "Hai chúng em hẹn gặp mọi người ở góc đường nào đó.
tr: “Çok sıcak” diye yakındı, “Siz gidin, biz arabayla biraz dolaşır, sonra sizinle bir köşede buluşuruz.” kendini zorlayarak nükteli konuştu, “köşeye çekeriz mesela, ben de aynı anda iki sigara içen adam rolü yaparım.
es: —Hace demasiado calor —se quejó Daisy—. Meteos vosotros. Nosotros daremos una vuelta y luego os veremos —con un esfuerzo su ingenio levantó ligeramente el vuelo—. Nos encontraremos en cualquier esquina. Yo seré el hombre que esté fumando dos cigarrillos.
vi_translation: "It's very hot." Daisy complained. "You all go ahead. The two of us will run around and meet everyone later." Daisy tried to sound humorously dull. "We'll meet everyone at some street corner. I'll pretend to be the man smoking two cigarettes."
tr_translation: “It's very hot,” he complained, “You go ahead, we'll drive around a bit, then meet you at a corner.” He forced himself to speak wittily, “We'll pull over to the side, for example, and I'll play the role of a man smoking two cigarettes at the same time.”
es_translation: —It's too hot —complained Daisy—. You all go ahead. We'll take a walk and then we'll see you —with an effort, her wit lifted slightly—. We'll meet at any corner. I'll be the man smoking two cigarettes.

en: “We can’t argue about it here,” Tom said impatiently, as a truck gave out a cursing whistle behind us. “You follow me to the south side of Central Park, in front of the Plaza.”
vi: Em sẽ giả làm người đàn ông hút hai điếu thuốc." "Chúng ta không thể bàn cãi ở đây." Tom nóng nảy nói khi một người chiếc xe tải phía sau chúng tôi bấm còi chửi rủa. "Hai người đi theo tôi tới phía nam của công viên Central Park, ngay trước cửa khách sạn Plaza."
tr: “Bunları burada tartış­mayalım” dedi Tom sabırsızlanarak. Arkamızda bekleyen kamyon şoförü küfür eder gibi kornaya basıyordu. “Central Park’ın güney çıkışına ka­dar peşimden ayrılmayın, Plaza’nın önünde durup konuşalım.
es: —Aquí no podemos hablarlo —dijo Tom con impaciencia, y en ese momento, detrás de nosotros, un camión pitó irritado—. Seguidme hasta la zona sur de Central Park, frente al Plaza.
vi_translation: "We can't argue here." Tom said impatiently as a truck behind us honked angrily. "You two follow me to the south side of Central Park, right in front of the Plaza Hotel."
tr_translation: "Let's not discuss these here," said Tom impatiently. The truck driver waiting behind us was honking as if he were swearing. “Do not leave my side until we reach the south exit of Central Park, let's stop and talk in front of the Plaza.”
es_translation: —We can't talk about it here —said Tom impatiently, and at that moment, behind us, a truck honked angrily—. Follow me to the south side of Central Park, in front of the Plaza.

en: Several times he turned his head and looked back for their car, and if the traffic delayed them he slowed up until they came into sight. I think he was afraid they would dart down a side-street and out of his life forever.
vi: Chốc chốc, Tom lại ngoái đầu nhìn xe hai người họ đang chạy phía sau, và nếu như dòng xe cộ có làm cho xe hai người họ bị tụt lại, anh ta lại lái xe chậm lại cho tới khi bóng chiếc xe của họ hiện ra trong tầm mắt. Tôi nghĩ rằng Tom đang sợ hai người họ sẽ phóng qua một con đường khác và biến mất khỏi cuộc đời của anh ta mãi mãi.
tr: Yoldayken birkaç kez arkaya bakıp gelip gel­mediklerini kontrol etti. Trafiğe takılıp geciktiklerinde yavaşlayıp bekledi. Belki de yandaki caddelerden birine aniden sapa­rak hayatından çıkıp gideceklerinden korkuyordu.
es: Varias veces Tom se volvió a mirar su coche, y cuando el tráfico los obligaba a rezagarse disminuía la velocidad hasta que volvía a verlos. Creo que temía que tomaran una calle lateral y salieran de su vida para siempre.
vi_translation: Every now and then, Tom would turn his head to look at their car following behind, and if the traffic caused their car to fall behind, he would slow down until their car came back into view. I think Tom was afraid they would take another road and disappear from his life forever.
tr_translation: While on the road, he looked back several times to check if they were coming. When they were delayed by traffic, he slowed down and waited. Perhaps he was afraid they would suddenly turn onto one of the side streets and disappear from his life.
es_translation: Several times Tom turned to look at his car, and when the traffic forced them to fall behind, he slowed down until he could see them again. I think he feared they would take a side street and disappear from his life forever.

en: But they didn’t. And we all took the less explicable step of engaging the parlour of a suite in the Plaza Hotel.
vi: Thế nhưng họ đã không làm như vậy và rồi chúng tôi tất cả đều chọn một quyết định ít phải giải thích là mướn một căn phòng rộng có nhiều gian ở trong khách sạn Plaza.
tr: Ama yapmadılar. Ve açıklanması zor bir adım atarak, Plaza Otel’de süit bir oda tutulmasına karar verdik.
es: Pero no lo hicieron. Y todos acabamos dando un paso mucho menos explicable: alquilamos el salón de una suite en el Hotel Plaza.
vi_translation: However, they did not do so, and then we all made a decision that required less explanation: renting a large room with many compartments in the Plaza Hotel.
tr_translation: But they didn't do it. And taking a step that is hard to explain, we decided to book a suite at the Plaza Hotel.
es_translation: But they didn't do it. And we all ended up taking a much less explainable step: we rented the lounge of a suite at the Plaza Hotel.

en: The prolonged and tumultuous argument that ended by herding us into that room eludes me, though I have a sharp physical memory that, in the course of it, my underwear kept climbing like a damp snake around my legs and intermittent beads of sweat raced cool across my back. The notion originated with Daisy’s suggestion that we hire five bathrooms and take cold baths, and then assumed more tangible form as “a place to have a mint julep.” Each of us said over and over that it was a “crazy idea”—we all talked at once to a baffled clerk and thought, or pretended to think, that we were being very funny…
vi: Tôi không còn nhớ gì về cuộc tranh luận kéo dài và huyên náo ồn ào cuối cùng đã được chấm dứt bằng cái lùa chúng tôi vào trong căn phòng đó. Thế nhưng tôi vẫn còn nhớ như in rằng trong cái tình huống đó chiếc quần lót của tôi cứ như một con rắn ẩm ướt bò chung quanh hai chân tôi và những hạt mồ hôi lăn dài mát lạnh dọc theo lưng. Trước tiên Daisy đề nghị mướn một căn phòng có năm phòng tắm để chúng tôi tắm cho mát. Rồi sau đó lời đề nghị được đổi sang một cách thiết thực hơn là "một nơi để uống rượu pha bạc hà". Mỗi người chúng tôi đều lập đi lập lại cho đó là một ý kiến điên rồ. Chúng tôi cùng đồng loạt nói với người nhân viên khách sạn đang bị rối loạn và rồi tự cho rằng, hay giả bộ nghĩ rằng, cả bọn chúng tôi đang làm khôi hài.
tr: Hepimi­zin bir odaya tıkılmasıyla sonuçlanan o uzun ve fırtınalı tartış­madan aklımda kalan, o sırada iç çamaşırımın ıslak bir yılan gi­bi bacaklarıma dolanması ve sırtımdan aşağıya ter damlacıklarının ağır ağır akması gibi bir takım fi­ziksel olaylardı. Aslında Daisy başta beş banyolu bir oda kirala­yıp soğuk duş almamı önermiş, sonra fikir biraz daha gelişip daha makul bir kıvama gelmiş, ‘Buzlu nane li­körü kokteyli içecek bir yer’ bulmaya doğru ilerlemişti. Hep bir ağızdan bunun ‘çılgın bir fikir’ olduğunu söyleyip duruyor, şaşkınlık içindeki resepsiyon görevlisine aynı anda bir şeyler anlatıyor, komik hallerde olduğumuzu düşünüyor, ya da düşünüyormuş gibi yapıyorduk.
es: Se me ha olvidado la larga y tumultuosa discusión que acabó reuniéndonos en aquella habitación, aunque conservo un recuerdo físico y claro de que, en el curso del debate, los calzoncillos insistían en trepar por mis piernas como una serpiente y de que gotas frías de sudor me corrían intermitentemente por la espalda. La idea nació de la sugerencia de Daisy de que alquiláramos cinco cuartos de baño y tomáramos baños fríos, y luego asumió la forma más tangible de «buscar un sitio donde bebernos un julepe de menta». Todos repetimos y repetimos que era «un disparate», y todos hablamos a la vez con un conserje perplejo y pensamos, o fingimos pensar, que éramos muy divertidos…
vi_translation: I no longer remember anything about the long and noisy debate that finally ended with us being herded into that room. However, I still vividly remember that in that situation, my underwear felt like a wet snake crawling around my legs and the cool sweat beads rolling down my back. First, Daisy suggested renting a room with five bathrooms so we could cool off with a bath. Then the suggestion was changed to a more practical one: "a place to drink mint juleps." Each of us repeatedly said that it was a crazy idea. We all simultaneously told the confused hotel staff and then assumed, or pretended to think, that we were all being humorous.
tr_translation: What remained in my mind from that long and stormy argument, which resulted in all of us being confined to a room, were some physical events such as my underwear wrapping around my legs like a wet snake and the sweat droplets slowly trickling down my back. In fact, Daisy initially suggested renting a room with five bathrooms and taking a cold shower, then the idea developed a bit more and became more reasonable, progressing towards finding a place to drink an 'Iced Mint Liqueur Cocktail.' We kept saying in unison that it was a 'crazy idea,' explaining something to the bewildered receptionist all at once, thinking we were in funny situations, or pretending to think so.
es_translation: I have forgotten the long and tumultuous discussion that ended up bringing us together in that room, although I retain a physical and clear memory that, during the course of the debate, my underwear kept insisting on climbing up my legs like a snake and that cold drops of sweat intermittently ran down my back. The idea was born from Daisy's suggestion that we rent five bathrooms and take cold baths, and then it took the more tangible form of "finding a place to drink a mint julep." We all repeated and repeated that it was "nonsense," and we all talked at the same time to a perplexed concierge and thought, or pretended to think, that we were very funny...

en: The room was large and stifling, and, though it was already four o’clock, opening the windows admitted only a gust of hot shrubbery from the Park. Daisy went to the mirror and stood with her back to us, fixing her hair.
vi: Căn phòng rất rộng nhưng ngột ngạt khó thở. Mặc dù trời đã là bốn giờ chiều, có mở banh cửa sổ ra cũng chỉ đón được một cơn gió nóng từ những lùm cây nóng từ công viên. Daisy bước tới tấm kiếng để sửa tóc, lưng quay về phía chúng tôi,
tr: Oda geniş ama bunaltıcıydı. Saat dört olduğu halde pencereleri açmak bile işe yaramamış, aksine parktaki ağaçlardan yükselen sıcak da içeriye dolmuştu. Daisy aynanın karşısına geçip saçlarını düzeltmeye koyuldu.
es: En la habitación, muy amplia, hacía un calor agobiante y, aunque eran ya las cuatro, al abrir las ventanas apenas si entró el soplo caliente de los árboles del parque. Daisy se acercó al espejo y, dándonos la espalda, se arregló el pelo.
vi_translation: The room was very spacious but suffocatingly stuffy. Although it was already four in the afternoon, even with the windows wide open, only a hot breeze from the scorching park trees could be felt. Daisy stepped towards the mirror to fix her hair, her back turned towards us,
tr_translation: The room was spacious but stifling. Even though it was four o'clock, opening the windows hadn't helped; on the contrary, the heat rising from the trees in the park had filled the room. Daisy stood in front of the mirror and began to fix her hair.
es_translation: In the room, which was very spacious, it was unbearably hot and, although it was already four o'clock, when the windows were opened, barely a warm breeze from the park's trees came in. Daisy approached the mirror and, with her back to us, fixed her hair.

en: “It’s a swell suite,” whispered Jordan respectfully, and everyone laughed.
vi: "Căn phòng này sang trọng lắm chứ." Jordan thì thào một cách kính trọng và thế là cả bọn chúng tôi phá lên cười.
tr: “Muhteşem bir süit” dedi Jordan saygıyla. Bunun üzerine hepimiz kahkahayı bastık.
es: —Es una suite muy chic —murmuró Jordan muy seria, y todos nos reímos.
vi_translation: "This room is really luxurious." Jordan whispered respectfully and then we all burst out laughing.
tr_translation: “A magnificent suite,” said Jordan respectfully. Upon this, we all burst into laughter.
es_translation: —It's a very chic suite —Jordan murmured very seriously, and we all laughed.

en: “Open another window,” commanded Daisy, without turning around.
vi: "Mở thêm một cửa sổ nữa đi." Daisy nói, không quay mình lại.
tr: “Bir cam daha açın” dedi Daisy arkasına bakmadan.
es: —Abrid otra ventana —ordenó Daisy, sin volverse.
vi_translation: "Open another window." Daisy said, not turning around.
tr_translation: "Open another window," Daisy said without looking back.
es_translation: —Open another window —ordered Daisy, without turning around.

en: “There aren’t any more.”
vi: "Đâu còn cái nào mà mở"
tr: “Başka pencere yok ki “
es: —No hay más.
vi_translation: "There isn't any left to open"
tr_translation: "There is no other window."
es_translation: —There is no more.

en: “Well, we’d better telephone for an axe—”
vi: "Như thế thì mình phải gọi điện thoại cho gọi mang lên đây cái rìu."
tr: “O zaman bir balta isteyelim...
es: —Muy bien, entonces pediremos por teléfono un hacha.
vi_translation: "In that case, I have to call to have them bring up the axe."
tr_translation: “Then let's ask for an axe...”
es_translation: —Very well, then we will order an axe by phone.

en: “The thing to do is to forget about the heat,” said Tom impatiently. “You make it ten times worse by crabbing about it.”
vi: "Tốt hơn là quên đi cái nóng đi." Tom nói một cách thiếu kiên nhẫn. "Em làm cho nó tệ hơn thêm cả mười lần nếu như cứ chê bai phàn nàn như vậy."
tr: “En iyisi sıcağı kafamızdan çıkarıp atmak” dedi Tom, yine sabırsızlanmıştı, “Siz böyle konuştukça büsbütün kötüleşiyor.
es: —Lo que hay que hacer es olvidar el calor —dijo Tom impaciente—. Lo multiplicáis por diez protestando.
vi_translation: "It's better to forget about the heat." Tom said impatiently. "You make it ten times worse by complaining like that."
tr_translation: "The best thing is to get the heat out of our heads," said Tom, who was impatient again, "The more you talk like this, the worse it gets."
es_translation: —What you need to do is forget about the heat —said Tom impatiently—. You multiply it by ten by complaining.

en: He unrolled the bottle of whisky from the towel and put it on the table.
vi: Tom mở chiếc khăn lấy chai rượu ra và đặt nó lên bàn.
tr: Havluya sardığı viskiyi açtı ve şişeyi masaya koydu.
es: Desenvolvió de la toalla la botella de whisky y la puso en la mesa.
vi_translation: Tom unwrapped the bottle of wine and placed it on the table.
tr_translation: He unwrapped the whiskey from the towel and placed the bottle on the table.
es_translation: He unwrapped the bottle of whisky from the towel and placed it on the table.

en: “Why not let her alone, old sport?” remarked Gatsby. “You’re the one that wanted to come to town.”
vi: "Sao không để cho cô ấy được yên, anh bạn già?" Gatsby phê bình. "Chính anh là người muốn ra phố mà."
tr: “Neden kızı rahat bırakmıyorsun ahbap” dedi Gatsby, “şehre gelmeyi isteyen sendin.
es: —¿Por qué no deja en paz a Daisy, compañero? Es usted el que quería venir a la ciudad.
vi_translation: "Why don't you leave her alone, old sport?" Gatsby criticized. "You're the one who wanted to go to town."
tr_translation: “Why don't you leave the girl alone, buddy,” said Gatsby, “you were the one who wanted to come to the city.”
es_translation: —Why don't you leave Daisy alone, buddy? You are the one who wanted to come to the city.

en: There was a moment of silence. The telephone book slipped from its nail and splashed to the floor, whereupon Jordan whispered, “Excuse me”—but this time no one laughed.
vi: Một thoáng trôi qua trong im lặng. Quyển sổ niêm giám điện thoại xúc ra khỏi đinh cột và rơi mạnh xuống sàn nhà. Jordan thì thào. "Xin lỗi." Thế nhưng lần này không ai cười cả.
tr: Bir anda odaya sessizlik çöktü. O sırada, duvardaki bir çivide asılı duran kalın telefon rehberi yerinden kurtu­lup düşünce Jordan yine yavaşça “Pardon” dedi. Bu kez kimse gülmedi.
es: Hubo un momento de silencio. La guía de teléfonos se desprendió del clavo y se estrelló contra el suelo, y Jordan murmuró «Perdónenme», pero esta vez no se rió nadie.
vi_translation: A moment passed in silence. The phone directory book slipped off the nail and fell heavily to the floor. Jordan whispered. "Sorry." But this time, no one laughed.
tr_translation: Suddenly, silence fell over the room. At that moment, when the thick phone directory hanging on a nail on the wall came loose and fell, Jordan slowly said "Sorry" again. This time, no one laughed.
es_translation: There was a moment of silence. The phone book came off the nail and crashed to the floor, and Jordan murmured "Forgive me," but this time no one laughed.

en: “I’ll pick it up,” I offered.
vi: "Để tôi nhặt lên cho." Tôi nói.
tr: “Ben kaldırırım” dedim.
es: —Voy a cogerla —me ofrecí.
vi_translation: "Let me pick it up for you." I said.
tr_translation: "I'll lift it," I said.
es_translation: —I'm going to get it —I offered.

en: “I’ve got it.” Gatsby examined the parted string, muttered “Hum!” in an interested way, and tossed the book on a chair.
vi: "Tôi nhặt rồi." Gatsby nói, đưa mắt xem xét sợi dây bị đứt, miệng lầm bầm "Hừm" với vẻ chăm chú rồi sau đó ném quyển sách lên trên một chiếc ghế.
tr: “Ben kaldırırım” dedim. “Ben aldım bile” dedi Gatsby. İncelmiş ipi inceledi, bilgiç bir ta­vırla “Hımm” dedi ve rehberi koltuklardan birine fırlattı.
es: —Ya le he cogido —Gatsby examinó el cordel roto, soltó un «Hum» interrogativo y la dejó en una silla.
vi_translation: "I picked it up already." Gatsby said, examining the broken string with a focused look, muttering "Hmm" and then throwing the book onto a chair.
tr_translation: "I'll lift it," I said. "I already bought it," said Gatsby. He examined the thinned rope, said "Hmm" with a knowledgeable attitude, and tossed the guide onto one of the chairs.
es_translation: —I've got it now —Gatsby examined the broken string, let out an interrogative "Hmm" and placed it on a chair.

en: “That’s a great expression of yours, isn’t it?” said Tom sharply.
vi: "Đó là cách anh hay thích nói nhất đó phải không?" Tom nói một cách đột ngột.
tr: “Bu hitap şeklini de en çok sende duydum!” dedi Tom sert bir sesle.
es: —Ésa es una de sus grandes expresiones, ¿no? —dijo Tom, cortante.
vi_translation: "Isn't that the way you like to talk the most?" Tom said abruptly.
tr_translation: “I’ve heard this way of addressing most often from you!” said Tom in a harsh voice.
es_translation: —That's one of his great expressions, isn't it? —said Tom, sharply.

en: “What is?”
vi: "Cái gì?"
tr: “Hangisini?
es: —¿Cuál?
vi_translation: "What?"
tr_translation: “Which one?”
es_translation: —Which one?

en: “All this ‘old sport’ business. Where’d you pick that up?”
vi: "Mấy cái từ 'anh bạn già'. Anh đã lượm được nó ở đây ra vậy?"
tr: “Şu ‘ahbap’ lafını. Nereden yapıştı diline?
es: —Eso de «compañero». ¿De dónde la ha sacado?
vi_translation: "Those words 'old buddy'. Where did you pick them up from here?"
tr_translation: “That word 'buddy.' Where did it stick to your tongue from?”
es_translation: —That "comrade" thing. Where did you get it from?

en: “Now see here, Tom,” said Daisy, turning around from the mirror, “if you’re going to make personal remarks I won’t stay here a minute. Call up and order some ice for the mint julep.”
vi: "Thôi mà Tom." Daisy nói, quay người lại từ tấm kiếng. "Nếu như anh còn tiếp tục nói những lời châm chọc cá nhân như vậy, em sẽ không ở lại đây đến một phút. Gọi người mang đá lên đây cho vào rượu đi."
tr: “Şunu iyi bil ki Tom” dedi Daisy aynaya arkasını dönerek, “kişisel çekişmelerle uğraşıp duracaksanız burada bir dakika bile durmam. Resepsiyonu ara ve likörler için biraz buz iste.
es: —Préstame atención, Tom —dijo Daisy, dejando de mirarse al espejo—, si vas a hacer alusiones personales no me quedaré aquí ni un minuto. Llama y pide hielo para el julepe de menta.
vi_translation: "Come on, Tom." Daisy said, turning away from the mirror. "If If you continue to make such personal jabs, I won't stay here for another minute. Call someone to bring up some ice for the drinks."
tr_translation: "Know this well, Tom," said Daisy, turning her back to the mirror, "if you're going to keep dealing with personal conflicts, I won't stay here for even a minute. Call reception and ask for some ice for the liquors."
es_translation: —Pay attention to me, Tom —said Daisy, stopping looking at herself in the mirror—, if you're going to make personal remarks, I won't stay here for even a minute. Call and ask for ice for the mint julep.

en: As Tom took up the receiver the compressed heat exploded into sound and we were listening to the portentous chords of Mendelssohn’s Wedding March from the ballroom below.
vi: Khi Tom nhấc máy điện thoại thì cái nóng đang bị dồn nén đã nổ tung lên thành tiếng. Chúng tôi cùng lắng nghe được tiếng nhạc dạo khúc nhạc cưới của Mendelssohn vọng sang từ căn phòng khiêu vũ ở lầu dưới.
tr: Tom ahizeyi kaldıracakken boğucu sıcağa, sesler de eklendi. Hep birlikte alt kattaki balo sa­lonundan yükselen Mendelssohn’un Düğün Marşı’nın malum melodisini dinlemeye koyulduk.
es: Cuando Tom levantó el auricular el calor comprimido estalló en sonidos y oímos los acordes portentosos de la Marcha nupcial de Mendelssohn, procedentes de la planta de abajo, del salón de baile.
vi_translation: When Tom picked up the phone, the pent-up heat exploded into sound. We could hear the prelude of Mendelssohn's wedding march drifting from the ballroom downstairs.
tr_translation: Just as Tom was about to lift the receiver, the stifling heat was joined by voices. We all began to listen to the familiar melody of Mendelssohn's Wedding March rising from the ballroom downstairs.
es_translation: When Tom picked up the receiver, the compressed heat burst into sounds, and we heard the mighty chords of Mendelssohn's Wedding March coming from downstairs, from the ballroom.

en: “Imagine marrying anybody in this heat!” cried Jordan dismally.
vi: "Cứ tưởng tượng phải làm đám cưới trong cái nóng như thế này." Jordan nói to một cách buồn nản.
tr: “Bu sıcakta evlendiğinizi düşünün” dedi Jordan kederli bir tavırla.
es: —Imaginaos casarse con este calor —dijo Jordan con tono sombrío.
vi_translation: "Just imagine having to get married in this kind of heat." Jordan said loudly in a dejected manner.
tr_translation: "Imagine getting married in this heat," said Jordan with a sorrowful tone.
es_translation: —Imagine getting married in this heat —said Jordan in a somber tone.

en: “Still—I was married in the middle of June,” Daisy remembered. “Louisville in June! Somebody fainted. Who was it fainted, Tom?”
vi: "Có sao đâu. Chị đã làm đám cưới vào giữa tháng Sáu." Daisy nhớ lại. "Chao ơi, Thành phố Louisville vào tháng Sáu. Có người nào đó bị xỉu. Ai bị xỉu vậy Tom."
tr: “Ben de…Haziran ortasında ev­lenmiştim zaten” diye hatırladı Daisy, “Haziranda Louisville! Düşü­nebiliyor musun? Biri bayılmıştı. Kimdi o bayılan Tom?
es: —Calla, que yo me casé en pleno mes de junio —recordó Daisy—. ¡Louisville en junio! Uno se desmayó. ¿Quién se desmayó, Tom?
vi_translation: "It's okay. I got married in the middle of June." Daisy recalled. "Oh dear, Louisville in June. Someone fainted. Who fainted, Tom?"
tr_translation: “I also… got married in mid-June,” Daisy remembered, “June in Louisville! Can you imagine? Someone had fainted. Who was it that fainted, Tom?”
es_translation: —Hush, I got married in the middle of June —recalled Daisy—. Louisville in June! Someone fainted. Who fainted, Tom?

en: “Biloxi,” he answered shortly.
vi: "Biloxi." Tom trả lời ngắn gọn.
tr: “Biloxi!” dedi Tom kısaca.
es: —Biloxi —respondió, seco.
vi_translation: "Biloxi." Tom answered briefly.
tr_translation: “Biloxi!” said Tom briefly.
es_translation: —Biloxi —he responded, curtly.

en: “A man named Biloxi. ‘Blocks’ Biloxi, and he made boxes—that’s a fact—and he was from Biloxi, Tennessee.”
vi: "Một anh tên Biloxi. Anh chàng "blocks" Biloxi và anh ta làm thùng. Đó quả là sự thật, anh ta đến từ Biloxi tiểu bang Tennessee."
tr: “Evet, Biloxi denen adam. ‘blokçu’ Biloxi. Kutu imalatçısıydı –bu kesinlikle doğru- ve Tennesessee’nin Biloxi köyündendi.
es: —Uno que se llamaba Biloxi, «Blocks» Biloxi, fabricante de cajas (esto es auténtico), y era de Biloxi, en Tennessee.
vi_translation: "A guy named Biloxi. The guy 'blocks' Biloxi and he makes barrels. It's true, he comes from Biloxi, Tennessee."
tr_translation: “Yes, the man called Biloxi. ‘blocker’ Biloxi. He was a box manufacturer –that’s absolutely true- and he was from the village of Biloxi in Tennessee.”
es_translation: —One who was called Biloxi, "Blocks" Biloxi, a box manufacturer (this is authentic), and he was from Biloxi, in Tennessee.

en: “They carried him into my house,” appended Jordan, “because we lived just two doors from the church. And he stayed three weeks, until Daddy told him he had to get out. The day after he left Daddy died.” After a moment she added as if she might have sounded irreverent, “There wasn’t any connection.”
vi: "Người ta khiêng anh ta sang nhà của em." Jordan tiếp lời. "Bởi vì nhà em chỉ cách nhà thờ có hai căn. Anh ta đã ở lại nhà em đến ba tuần, cho tới khi ba em phải đuổi anh ta ra. Một ngày sau khi anh ta rời khỏi thì ba của em qua đời." Sau một lát, Jordan giải thích thêm vào. "Hai chuyện không liên quan gì đến nhau."
tr: “Onu bizim eve taşımışlardı” diye ekledi Jordan, “ev kiliseye çok yakındı. Arada sadece iki bina vardı. Adam üç hafta bizde kaldı. Sonunda babam artık gitmesi gerektiğini söylemeye mecbur oldu. O gittikten bir gün sonra babam öl­dü.” Biraz durdu. “Arada bir bağlantı yoktu elbette.
es: —Lo llevaron a mi casa —dijo Jordan— porque vivíamos a dos pasos de la iglesia. Y se quedó tres semanas, hasta que papá le dijo que se fuera. Al día siguiente papá murió —al cabo de unos segundos añadió—. No hay relación entre las dos cosas.
vi_translation: "They carried him to your house." Jordan continued. "Because your house is only two doors away from the church." He stayed at your house for three weeks, until your father had to kick him out. One day after he left, your father passed away." After a moment, Jordan added. "The two events are unrelated."
tr_translation: “They had moved him to our house,” Jordan added, “the house was very close to the church. There were only two buildings in between. The man stayed with us for three weeks. In the end, my father had to tell him that he needed to leave. One day after he left, my father died.” He paused for a moment. “There was no connection, of course.”
es_translation: —They took him to my house —said Jordan— because we lived two steps away from the church. And he stayed for three weeks, until my father told him to leave. The next day my father died —after a few seconds he added—. There is no relation between the two events.

en: “I used to know a Bill Biloxi from Memphis,” I remarked.
vi: Lúc trước tôi có biết một người tên là Bill Biloxi ở Menphis." Tôi nhận xét,.
tr: “Ben de Memphis’den Bill Biloxi adında birini tanıyorum” dedim.
es: —Yo conocía a un tal Bill Biloxi, de Memphis —señalé.
vi_translation: Previously, I knew a person named Bill Biloxi in Memphis," I remarked.
tr_translation: "I also know someone named Bill Biloxi from Memphis," I said.
es_translation: —I knew a certain Bill Biloxi, from Memphis —I pointed out.

en: “That was his cousin. I knew his whole family history before he left. He gave me an aluminium putter that I use today.”
vi: "Anh chàng đó là anh em họ. Em biết lịch sử của nguyên giòng họ anh ta trước khi anh ta bỏ đi. Anh ta đã tặng cho em thanh đánh golf bằng nhôm mà em còn dùng mãi đến hôm nay."
tr: “Bizim Biloxi’nin kuzeni olmalı. Adam gitmeden önce aile­sinin tüm hayat hikayesini öğrenmiştim. Bana o zaman verdiği alüminyum golf sopasını hala kullanıyorum. ” dedi Jordan.
es: —Era su primo. Me contó toda la historia de la familia antes de irse. Me regaló un putter de aluminio que uso todavía.
vi_translation: "That guy is a cousin. I know the history of his entire family before he left. He gave me an aluminum golf club that I still use to this day."
tr_translation: “He must be our cousin from Biloxi. Before the man left, I had learned his entire family's life story. I still use the aluminum golf club he gave me back then.” said Jordan.
es_translation: —He was her cousin. He told me the whole family history before leaving. He gave me an aluminum putter that I still use.

en: The music had died down as the ceremony began and now a long cheer floated in at the window, followed by intermittent cries of “Yea—ea—ea!” and finally by a burst of jazz as the dancing began.
vi: Tiếng nhạc đã chìm lắng xuống khi buổi lễ cưới bắt đầu, tiếng hoan hô chúc mừng vang dậy lềnh bềnh trôi vào trong cửa sổ, theo sau là những tiếng la to đứt đoạn "Yea -ea-ea", và cuối cùng òa vỡ thành tiếng nhạc jazz khi buổi khiêu vũ bắt đầu.
tr: Nikah töreni başlayınca aşağıda müzik kesildi. Biraz sonra pencereden içeri uzun süren alkış sesleri doldu. Arada bir. ‘Evet. Eveet!’ şeklinde bağrışmalar duyulurken aniden patlayıveren bir caz şarkısı dansın başlayacağının da habercisiydi.
es: La música se había extinguido cuando empezó la ceremonia y en aquel momento nos llegó por la ventana una larga ovación, seguida por gritos intermitentes de «Sí, Sí, Sí», y, por fin, una explosión de jazz que marcó el comienzo del baile.
vi_translation: The music had quieted down as the wedding ceremony began, the cheers of congratulations floated in through the windows, followed by intermittent shouts of "Yea-ea-ea", and finally burst into jazz music as the dance began.
tr_translation: When the wedding ceremony began, the music downstairs stopped. A little later, long-lasting applause sounds filled the room through the window. Occasionally. 'Yes. Yeees!' shouts were heard, and suddenly a jazz song bursting out was also a sign that the dance was about to begin.
es_translation: The music had died down when the ceremony began, and at that moment a long ovation reached us through the window, followed by intermittent shouts of "Yes, Yes, Yes," and finally, an explosion of jazz that marked the beginning of the dance.

en: “We’re getting old,” said Daisy. “If we were young we’d rise and dance.”
vi: "Chúng ta đã trở nên già cả rồi. Nếu như còn trẻ chúng ta đã đứng lên khiêu vũ ngay rồi." Daisy nói.
tr: “Yaşlanıyoruz” dedi Daisy. “Genç olsak hemen kalkıp dans ederdik.
es: —Nos estamos haciendo viejos —dijo Daisy—. Si fuéramos jóvenes, nos levantaríamos y nos pondríamos a bailar.
vi_translation: "We have become old. If we were still young, we would have stood up and danced right away," Daisy said.
tr_translation: “We're getting old,” said Daisy. “If we were young, we would immediately get up and dance.”
es_translation: —We are getting old —said Daisy—. If we were young, we would get up and start dancing.

en: “Remember Biloxi,” Jordan warned her. “Where’d you know him, Tom?”
vi: "Nhớ gương anh chàng Biloxi đấy." Jordan khuyến cáo Daisy. "Anh quen với anh ấy ở đâu Tom?"
tr: “Sen Biloxi’yi düşün!” diye uyardı Jordan. “Onu nerden tanıyordun Tom?
es: —Acuérdate de Biloxi —la previno Jordan—. ¿Dónde lo conociste, Tom?
vi_translation: "Remember the example of that Biloxi guy." Jordan advised Daisy. "Where did you meet him, Tom?"
tr_translation: "Think about Biloxi!" Jordan warned. "How did you know him, Tom?"
es_translation: —Remember Biloxi —Jordan warned her—. Where did you meet him, Tom?

en: “Biloxi?” He concentrated with an effort. “I didn’t know him. He was a friend of Daisy’s.”
vi: "Biloxi?" Tom cố gắng moi trí nhớ. "Tôi không biết anh ta. Anh ta là bạn của Daisy."
tr: “Biloxi’yi mi?” hatırlamaya çalışıyordu, “Ben onu tanımıyordum. Daisy’nin bir arkadaşıydı.
es: —¿Biloxi? —hizo un esfuerzo para concentrarse—. Yo no lo conocía. Era amigo de Daisy.
vi_translation: "Biloxi?" Tom tried to recall. "I don't know him." "He is a friend of Daisy's."
tr_translation: “Biloxi?” he was trying to remember, “I didn't know him. He was a friend of Daisy's.”
es_translation: —Biloxi? —he made an effort to concentrate—. I didn't know him. He was a friend of Daisy's.

en: “He was not,” she denied. “I’d never seen him before. He came down in the private car.”
vi: "Anh ta không phải bạn em." Daisy bác lại. "Em chưa từng gặp anh ta trước đó. Anh ta đi xe riêng đến."
tr: “Hayır değildi” diye karşı çıktı Daisy. “Onu ilk defa orada görmüştüm. Zaten kendi arabasıyla gelmişti.
es: —No —dijo Daisy—. Yo no lo había visto en mi vida. Llegó en uno de los vagones alquilados.
vi_translation: "He is not my friend," Daisy retorted. "I have never met him before. He came in his own car."
tr_translation: “No, it wasn't,” Daisy objected. “I saw him there for the first time. He had already come in his own car.”
es_translation: —No —said Daisy—. I had never seen him in my life. He arrived in one of the rented carriages.

en: “Well, he said he knew you. He said he was raised in Louisville. Asa Bird brought him around at the last minute and asked if we had room for him.”
vi: "Thế à, anh ta nói anh ta biết em. Anh ta nói anh ta lớn lên ở Louisville. Asa Bird đưa anh ta đi chung quanh và vào phút cuối thì hỏi nếu chúng ta có chỗ cho anh ta ở."
tr: “Her neyse. Adam seni tanıdığını söylemişti. Louisville’de büyümüş. Asa Bird onu son anda getirip fazladan yeri­miz olup olmadığını sordu.
es: —Bueno, él dijo que te conocía. Decía que se había criado en Louisville. Asa Bird nos lo trajo a última hora y preguntó si teníamos sitio para él.
vi_translation: "Really, he said he knows you. He said he grew up in Louisville. Asa Bird showed him around and at the last minute asked if we had a place for him to stay."
tr_translation: "Anyway. The man said he knew you. He grew up in Louisville. Asa Bird brought him at the last minute and asked if we had any extra space."
es_translation: —Well, he said he knew you. He said he had grown up in Louisville. Asa Bird brought him to us at the last minute and asked if we had room for him.

en: “He was probably bumming his way home. He told me he was president of your class at Yale.”
vi: "Có lẽ anh ta đang kiếm đường quay về nhà. Anh ta nói với em rằng anh ta là lớp trưởng của anh ở Yale."
tr: “Herhalde otostopla evine gitmeye çalışan biriydi. Bana Yale’deyken sizin sınıf temsilciniz ol­duğunu söylemişti” dedi Jordan gülümseyerek.
es: —Probablemente quería volver a casa de gorra. Me dijo que era presidente de vuestro curso en Yale.
vi_translation: "Perhaps he is trying to find his way back home." "He told me that he was your class president at Yale."
tr_translation: “He was probably someone trying to hitchhike home. He told me he was your class representative at Yale,” said Jordan with a smile.
es_translation: —He probably wanted to hitch a ride home. He told me he was the president of your class at Yale.

en: Tom and I looked at each other blankly.
vi: Anh ta nói với em rằng anh ta là lớp trưởng của anh ở Yale."
tr: Tom’la şaşkın şaşkın bakıştık.
es: Tom y yo nos miramos sin entender.
vi_translation: "He told me that he was your class president at Yale."
tr_translation: Tom and I exchanged bewildered glances.
es_translation: Tom and I looked at each other without understanding.

en: “Biloxi?”
vi: "Biloxi?"
tr: “Biloxi?
es: —¿Biloxi?
vi_translation: "Biloxi?" "Biloxi?"
tr_translation: “Biloxi?”
es_translation: —Biloxi?

en: “First place, we didn’t have any president—”
vi: "Biloxi?" Cả tôi và Tom nhìn nhau ngơ ngác. "Trước hết, chúng tôi không có lớp trưởng nào cả.."
tr: “İyi de bizde sınıf temsilcisi yok ki...
es: —En primer lugar, no teníamos presidente.
vi_translation: Both Tom and I looked at each other in confusion. "First of all, we don't have a class monitor at all.."
