tr_translation: “But we don't have a class representative...”
es_translation: —First of all, we didn't have a president.

en: Gatsby’s foot beat a short, restless tattoo and Tom eyed him suddenly.
vi: Gatsby bồn chồn gõ chân liên tục những nhịp ngắn và Tom đột nhiên hướng mắt về phía anh ta.
tr: Gatsby’nin sabırsızlanarak ayağıyla tempo tutmaya başla­ması üzerine Tom birden ona döndü.
es: El pie de Gatsby golpeaba ritmicamente el suelo, nervioso, y Tom lo miró de repente.
vi_translation: Gatsby nervously tapped his foot repeatedly in short rhythms, and Tom suddenly turned his eyes towards him.
tr_translation: Upon Gatsby impatiently starting to tap his foot, Tom suddenly turned to him.
es_translation: Gatsby's foot was tapping rhythmically on the floor, nervously, and Tom suddenly looked at him.

en: “By the way, Mr. Gatsby, I understand you’re an Oxford man.”
vi: "Nhân đây xin hỏi, anh Gatsby, tôi nghe nói anh là cựu sinh viên Oxford."
tr: “Bu arada Bay Gatsby sizin Oxford’da okuduğunuzu duydum” dedi.
es: —Por cierto, mister Gatsby, tengo entendido que es usted antiguo alumno de Oxford.
vi_translation: "By the way, may I ask, Mr. Gatsby, I heard that you are a former Oxford student."
tr_translation: "By the way, Mr. Gatsby, I heard you went to Oxford," he said.
es_translation: —By the way, Mr. Gatsby, I understand that you are a former Oxford student.

en: “Not exactly.”
vi: "Cũng không hẳn như vậy."
tr: “Tam olarak öyle değil.
es: —No exactamente.
vi_translation: "It's not exactly like that."
tr_translation: “Not exactly like that.”
es_translation: —Not exactly.

en: “Oh, yes, I understand you went to Oxford.”
vi: "Đúng mà, tôi nghe nói and đã từng học ở Oxford."
tr: “Yine de Oxford’a gitmişsiniz.
es: —Sí, tengo entendido que fue a Oxford.
vi_translation: "It's true, I heard that you studied at Oxford."
tr_translation: “Still, you went to Oxford.”
es_translation: —Yes, I understand that he went to Oxford.

en: “Yes—I went there.”
vi: "Có tôi có học ở đó."
tr: “Evet bu doğru.
es: —Sí, fui a Oxford.
vi_translation: "Yes, I studied there."
tr_translation: “Yes, that's true.”
es_translation: —Yes, I went to Oxford.

en: A pause. Then Tom’s voice, incredulous and insulting:
vi: Bầu không gian rơi vào trong im lặng. Sau đó giọng của Tom cất lên một cách đầy nghi ngờ và nhục mạ.
tr: Sessizlik. Sonra Tom şüphe ve aşağılama dolu bir sesle; “Herhalde Biloxi Yale’deyken siz de Oxford’daydınız” dedi.
es: Pausa. Y luego la voz de Tom, incrédula e insultante.
vi_translation: The atmosphere fell into silence. Then Tom's voice rose, full of suspicion and insult.
tr_translation: Silence. Then Tom, with a voice full of doubt and disdain, said, "I suppose you were at Oxford while Biloxi was at Yale."
es_translation: Pause. And then Tom's voice, incredulous and insulting.

en: Another pause. A waiter knocked and came in with crushed mint and ice but the silence was unbroken by his “thank you” and the soft closing of the door. This tremendous detail was to be cleared up at last.
vi: Tiếp sau lời nói đó lại là sự im lặng. Người bồi gõ cửa mang vào phòng bạc hà và đá nhưng câu nói cám ơn của anh ta và tiếng đóng cửa nhẹ cũng không phá tan được sự im lặng của căn phòng. Cái chi tiết khủng khiếp này cuối cùng cũng đã được sáng tỏ.
tr: Yine sessizlik. Oda servisi için gelen garson elinde nane likörü, soda ve kırılmış buzla kapıyı çalıp içeri girdi. Ama ne ‘teşekkür ederim’ deyişi, ne de çıkarken kapıyı arkasından yavaşça kapatması sessizliği bozmadı. Bu muazzam ayrıntının nihayet açıklığa kavuşturulması gerekti.
es: Otra pausa. Un camarero llamó a la puerta con menta y hielo picados pero ni su «gracias» ni la puerta que se cerró suavemente rompieron el silencio. Aquel detalle extraordinario iba a aclararse por fin.
vi_translation: Following those words was silence again. The waiter knocked on the door and brought in mint and ice, but his thank you and the soft closing of the door couldn't break the silence in the room. This terrible detail had finally come to light.
tr_translation: Again, silence. The waiter who came for room service entered with mint liqueur, soda, and crushed ice in hand. But neither his saying 'thank you' nor his slowly closing the door behind him as he left broke the silence. This tremendous detail finally needed to be clarified.
es_translation: Another pause. A waiter knocked on the door with mint and crushed ice, but neither his "thank you" nor the door closing softly broke the silence. That extraordinary detail was finally going to be clarified.

en: “I told you I went there,” said Gatsby.
vi: "Tôi đã nói với anh tôi đã có học ở đó." Gatsby nói.
tr: “Sana oraya gittiğimi söyledim” dedi Gatsby.
es: —Ya le he dicho que estuve en Oxford.
vi_translation: "I told you I had studied there." Gatsby said.
tr_translation: "I told you I went there," said Gatsby.
es_translation: —I already told you that I was in Oxford.

en: “I heard you, but I’d like to know when.”
vi: "Tôi đã có nghe anh nói, nhưng tôi muốn được biết là trong khoảng thời gian nào."
tr: “Seni duydum. Ben zamanını öğrenmek istiyorum.
es: —Lo he oído, pero me gustaría saber cuándo.
vi_translation: "I have heard you speak, but I want to know during what time period."
tr_translation: “I heard you. I want to know the time.”
es_translation: —I have heard it, but I would like to know when.

en: “It was in nineteen-nineteen, I only stayed five months. That’s why I can’t really call myself an Oxford man.”
vi: "Tôi đi học ở đó năm một ngàn chín trăm mười chín. Tôi chỉ học ở đó có năm tháng thôi. Đó là lý do tại sao tôi không thể thực sự gọi mình là cựu sinh viên Oxford."
tr: “1919’da. Orada sadece beş ay kaldım. Bu yüzden kendimi gerçek bir Oxford’lu saymam.
es: —Fue en 1919. Sólo estuve cinco meses. Por eso no puedo considerarme antiguo alumno de Oxford.
vi_translation: "I went to school there in nineteen nineteen. I only studied there for five months. That's why I can't really call myself an Oxford alumnus."
tr_translation: "In 1919." "I stayed there for only five months." "Therefore, I do not consider myself a true Oxfordian."
es_translation: —It was in 1919. I was only there for five months. That's why I can't consider myself an alumnus of Oxford.

en: Tom glanced around to see if we mirrored his unbelief. But we were all looking at Gatsby.
vi: Tom đưa mắt liếc nhìn chung quanh để thăm dò xem chúng tôi có ngỡ ngàng như anh ta không. Nhưng lúc đó mọi người chúng tôi đều đang nhìn Gatsby.
tr: Tom bizim de kendisi gibi görmek için sağa sola baktı. Bizler ise Gatsby’e bakıyorduk.
es: Tom echó un vistazo a su alrededor para ver si, como un espejo, reflejábamos su incredulidad. Pero nosotros mirábamos a Gatsby.
vi_translation: Tom glanced around to see if we were as astonished as he was. But at that moment, all of us were looking at Gatsby.
tr_translation: Tom looked around to see if he could spot himself. We, on the other hand, were looking at Gatsby.
es_translation: Tom glanced around to see if, like a mirror, we reflected his disbelief. But we were looking at Gatsby.

en: “It was an opportunity they gave to some of the officers after the armistice,” he continued. “We could go to any of the universities in England or France.”
vi: "Đó là cơ hội mà chính quyền ban tặng cho các sĩ quan sau trận Armistice." Gatsby tiếp tục. "Chúng tôi có thể tham gia bất cứ trường đại học nào ở Anh hay Pháp."
tr: “Ateşkesten sonra bazı subaylara böyle bir hak tanınmıştı” diye devam etti “istersek İngiltere veya Fransa’daki üniversitelerden herhangi birine gidebiliyorduk.
es: —Fue una oportunidad que se les dio a algunos oficiales después del armisticio —continuó—. Podíamos ir a cualquier universidad de Inglaterra o Francia.
vi_translation: "That was the opportunity that the government granted to officers after the Armistice." Gatsby continued. "We could attend any university in England or France."
tr_translation: "After the ceasefire, some officers were granted such a right," he continued, "we could go to any university in England or France if we wanted.""
es_translation: —It was an opportunity given to some officers after the armistice —he continued—. We could go to any university in England or France.

en: I wanted to get up and slap him on the back. I had one of those renewals of complete faith in him that I’d experienced before.
vi: Lúc đó tôi muốn đứng lên để vỗ vào lưng Gatsby. Tôi đã hoàn toàn lấy lại niềm tin với anh như tôi đã từng có lần trải qua trước đây.
tr: Ayağa kalkıp omzuna dostane bir şaplak atmamak için kendimi zor tutuyordum. Daha önce de başıma gelen yine olmuş, Gatsby’e karşı güvenim tazelenmişti.
es: Me dieron ganas de levantarme y darle una palmada en la espalda. Sentí uno de esos renacimientos de absoluta confianza en él que ya había experimentado otras veces.
vi_translation: At that moment, I wanted to stand up and pat Gatsby on the back. I had completely regained my faith in him as I had once experienced before.
tr_translation: I was struggling to resist the urge to stand up and give him a friendly slap on the shoulder. What had happened before had happened again, and my trust in Gatsby was renewed.
es_translation: I felt like getting up and giving him a pat on the back. I felt one of those renewals of absolute confidence in him that I had experienced before.

en: Daisy rose, smiling faintly, and went to the table.
vi: Daisy đứng lên mỉm cười thật nhẹ và đi đến bên bàn.
tr: Daisy kalktı, dudaklarında hafif bir gülümsemeyle masaya doğru yürüdü.
es: Daisy se levantó, sonriendo débilmente, y se acercó a la mesa.
vi_translation: Daisy stood up, smiled gently, and walked to the table.
tr_translation: Daisy stood up and walked towards the table with a slight smile on her lips.
es_translation: Daisy stood up, smiling faintly, and approached the table.

en: “Open the whisky, Tom,” she ordered, “and I’ll make you a mint julep. Then you won’t seem so stupid to yourself… Look at the mint!”
vi: "Khui rượu whiskey đi Tom." Daisy sai. "Em sẽ làm cho anh một ly rượu whisky bạc hà. Sau đó anh sẽ không còn ngốc nghếch nữa... Nhìn đống bạc hà này."
tr: “Viskiyi açsana Tom” diye buyurdu, “Ben de nane kokteylini hazırlayayım. O zaman kendini bu denli aptal hissetmezsin belki! Ne kadar likör koyayım?
es: —Abre el whisky, Tom —ordenó—. Y te prepararé un julepe de menta. Luego no te sentirás tan estúpido… Dime cuánta menta te pongo.
vi_translation: "Open the whiskey, Tom," Daisy ordered. "I'll make you a mint julep. Then you won't be foolish anymore... Look at this pile of mint."
tr_translation: "Open the whiskey, Tom," he ordered, "I'll prepare the mint cocktail. Then maybe you won't feel so stupid! How much liqueur should I put?"
es_translation: —Open the whiskey, Tom —he ordered—. And I'll make you a mint julep. Then you won't feel so stupid... Tell me how much mint to put in.

en: “Wait a minute,” snapped Tom, “I want to ask Mr. Gatsby one more question.”
vi: "Khoan đã." Tom nổi cáu. "Anh muốn hỏi anh Gatsby thêm một câu nữa."
tr: “Bekle bir dakika” diye tersledi Tom. “Bay Gatsby’e bir soru daha sormak istiyorum.”
es: —Espera un segundo —la interrumpió Tom, violento—. Quiero hacerle a mister Gatsby una pregunta más.
vi_translation: "Wait a minute." Tom snapped.
tr_translation: "Wait a minute," Tom snapped. "I want to ask Mr. Gatsby one more question."
es_translation: —Wait a second —Tom interrupted her, violently—. I want to ask Mr. Gatsby one more question.

en: “What kind of a row are you trying to cause in my house anyhow?”
vi: "Anh đang tính khấy động gì trong gia đình của tôi."
tr: “Benim yuvamda ne tür bir huzursuzluk çıkarmaya çalışıyorsun sen söylesene!
es: —¿Qué tipo de conflicto está usted intentando provocar en mi casa?
vi_translation: "What are you planning to stir up in my family."
tr_translation: “What kind of trouble are you trying to stir up in my home, tell me!”
es_translation: —What kind of conflict are you trying to provoke in my house?

en: They were out in the open at last and Gatsby was content.
vi: Cuối cùng thì cái gì muốn nói đã được nói ra, nó khiến Gatsby hài lòng.
tr: Nihayet her şey ortaya dökülüvermişti ve Gatsby bundan memnundu.
es: Por fin hablaban abiertamente y Gatsby parecía satisfecho.
vi_translation: In the end, what needed to be said was said, and it made Gatsby happy.
tr_translation: Finally, everything had come to light, and Gatsby was pleased with it.
es_translation: At last they were speaking openly and Gatsby seemed satisfied.

en: “He isn’t causing a row,” Daisy looked desperately from one to the other. “You’re causing a row. Please have a little self-control.”
vi: "Anh ấy đâu có khuấy động gì." Daisy nhìn khẩn khoản hết hết từ người này đến người kia. "Anh mới là người sinh sự. Làm ơn giữ tự chủ được không"
tr: “Huzursuzluk çıkardığı filan yok” dedi Daisy, umutsuzca birin­den ötekine bakarak, “Onu çıkaran sensin. Lütfen kendini hakim ol biraz.
es: —No está provocando ningún conflicto —Daisy miró con desesperación a uno y a otro—. Lo estás provocando tú. Por favor, contrólate un poco.
vi_translation: "He didn't cause any trouble." Daisy looked pleadingly from one person to another. "You're the one causing the scene. Please keep your composure, can't you?"
tr_translation: “She isn't causing any trouble,” said Daisy, looking desperately from one to the other, “You are the one causing it. Please control yourself a bit.”
es_translation: —He is not causing any conflict —Daisy looked at one and the other in desperation—. You are the one causing it. Please, control yourself a little.

en: “Self-control!” repeated Tom incredulously. “I suppose the latest thing is to sit back and let Mr. Nobody from Nowhere make love to your wife. Well, if that’s the idea you can count me out… Nowadays people begin by sneering at family life and family institutions, and next they’ll throw everything overboard and have intermarriage between black and white.”
vi: "Tự chủ!" Tom lập lại một cách hoài nghi. "Chẳng lẽ anh cứ ngồi để chờ cho một ngài không có thớ gì không biết từ đâu ra đến làm tình với vợ mình. Chà, nếu như đó là ý tưởng mà em muốn anh phải làm. Bây giờ người ta bắt đầu cười nhạo báng đời sống gia đình và thể chế gia đình, sau này người ta sẽ sẽ tung hê tất cả và chấp nhận cho người da trắng và da đen lấy lẫn nhau mất thôi."
tr: “Kendime hakim olayım demek!” diye tekrarladı Tom, öfkeden köpürerek, “Ne yani, Bay Ne İdüğü Belirsiz karıma kur yaparken, oturup ona müsaade mi edecektim. Böyle düşünüyorsan beni bu oyuna katmayın... Zaten şu günlerde in­sanlar evlilik müessesesini ve aile yaşantısını iyiden iyiye hor görmeye başlamış. Yakında her şeyi bir kenara itecekler hatta siyahlarla beyazlar evlenecek.
es: —¡Que me controle! —repitió Tom, incrédulo—. Supongo que la última moda es sentarte y dejar que un don Nadie de No sé dónde enamore a tu mujer. Bueno, si la idea es ésa, no contéis conmigo… Hoy día se empieza por despreciar la vida de familia y la institución familiar, y el siguiente paso será tirar todo por la borda y permitir los matrimonios entre blancos y negros.
vi_translation: "Self-control!" Tom repeated skeptically. "Do you mean to say that I should just sit and wait for some insignificant man from who knows where to come and sleep with my wife? Well, if that's the idea you want me to follow. Now people are starting to mock family life and the institution of family, and later they will throw everything away and accept white and black people marrying each other."
tr_translation: “Saying I should control myself!” repeated Tom, foaming with rage, “What, while Mr. Nobody is flirting with my wife, I should just sit and allow it? If that's what you think, don't include me in this game... These days, people have started to thoroughly despise the institution of marriage and family life. Soon they will push everything aside, even blacks and whites will marry.”
es_translation: —Control me! —repeated Tom, incredulous—. I suppose the latest trend is to sit back and let some Nobody from I don't know where fall in love with your wife. Well, if that's the idea, don't count on me… These days, it starts with despising family life and the family institution, and the next step will be throwing everything overboard and allowing marriages between whites and blacks.

en: Flushed with his impassioned gibberish, he saw himself standing alone on the last barrier of civilization.
vi: Với những lời nói lắp bắp hàm hồ đầy kích động này, Tom đã tự đẩy mình trơ trọi về phía ranh giới cuối cùng của nền văn minh.
tr: Savunduğu saçmalıkların ateşiyle kıpkırmızı olmuş, kendini medeniyetin yıkılmayan son kalesi ilan etmişti.
es: En la euforia de sus apasionados despropósitos, ya se veía defendiendo solo la última barrera de la civilización.
vi_translation: With these incoherent and agitated stammering words, Tom had pushed himself to the very edge of civilization.
tr_translation: He had declared himself the unyielding last bastion of civilization, flushed red with the fervor of the nonsense he defended.
es_translation: In the euphoria of his passionate absurdities, he already saw himself defending the last barrier of civilization alone.

en: “We’re all white here,” murmured Jordan.
vi: "Tất cả chúng ta đều là dân da trắng." Jordan thì thào.
tr: “Zaten hepimiz beyazız” diye mırıldandı Jordan.
es: —Aquí todos somos blancos —murmuró Jordan.
vi_translation: "We are all white people." Jordan whispered.
tr_translation: "We're all white anyway," Jordan muttered.
es_translation: —Here we are all white —murmured Jordan.

en: “I know I’m not very popular. I don’t give big parties. I suppose you’ve got to make your house into a pigsty in order to have any friends—in the modern world.”
vi: "Tôi biết tôi không được nhiều người hâm mộ, tôi không đãi đằng những bữa tiệc lớn. Phải biến căn nhà của mình thành cái chuồng heo để mà mong kiếm được bạn bè - trong cái thế giới hiện đại này..."
tr: “Pek popüler biri olmadığımı biliyorum. Büyük partiler vermiyorum belki. Modern dünyada kendi­ne bir yer edinmek istiyorsan evini bir mezbeleye çevirmen gerekiyor galiba.
es: —Sé que no resulto demasiado simpático. No doy grandes fiestas. Supongo que tienes que convertir tu casa en una pocilga para tener amigos… en el mundo moderno.
vi_translation: "I know I'm not liked by many, I don't throw big parties. Do I have to turn my house into a pigsty just to hope for friends - in this modern world..."
tr_translation: “I know I'm not very popular. Maybe I don't throw big parties. If you want to find a place for yourself in the modern world, it seems you need to turn your home into a mess.”
es_translation: —I know I'm not very likable. I don't throw big parties. I suppose you have to turn your house into a pigsty to have friends… in the modern world.

en: Angry as I was, as we all were, I was tempted to laugh whenever he opened his mouth. The transition from libertine to prig was so complete.
vi: Giống như tôi, tất cả mọi người trong căn phòng đều cảm thấy tức giận. Thế nhưng tôi lại lại muốn phá lên cười mỗi lần Tom mở miệng. Anh ta đã hoàn toàn hoán chuyển từ một kẻ ăn chơi sang thành một kẻ lên mặt dạy đời.
tr: İçim öfkeyle dolmasına karşın - hepimiz aynı durumdaydık - Tom ne zaman ağzını açsa gülmemek için kendimi zor tutu­yordum. Hovardalıktan tutuculuğa geçiş aşamasını tamamlamak üzereydi.
es: Aunque me había puesto de mal humor —como todos—, sentía verdaderas tentaciones de reírme cada vez que Tom abría la boca. Su transición de libertino a mojigato había sido perfecta.
vi_translation: Just like me, everyone in the room felt angry. However, I wanted to burst out laughing every time Tom opened his mouth. He had completely transformed from a playboy into a self-righteous preacher.
tr_translation: Despite being filled with anger - we were all in the same situation - I struggled to keep myself from laughing whenever Tom opened his mouth. He was about to complete the transition from being a libertine to being conservative.
es_translation: Although it had put me in a bad mood —like everyone else—, I felt true temptations to laugh every time Tom opened his mouth. His transition from libertine to prude had been perfect.

en: “I’ve got something to tell you, old sport—” began Gatsby. But Daisy guessed at his intention.
vi: "Tôi có chuyện cần phải nói với chính ANH, anh bạn già.." Gatsby bắt đầu, thế nhưng Daisy đã đoán được chủ định của Gatsby.
tr: “Benim de sana söyleyeceklerim var ahbap” diye söze başladı Gatsby. Daisy niyetini anladı.
es: —Tengo algo que decirle, compañero —empezó Gatsby. Pero Daisy le adivinó la intención.
vi_translation: "I have something I need to say to YOU, old sport.." Gatsby began, but Daisy had already guessed Gatsby's intention.
tr_translation: “I have things to say to you too, buddy,” Gatsby began. Daisy understood his intention.
es_translation: —I have something to tell you, comrade —Gatsby began. But Daisy guessed his intention.

en: “Please don’t!” she interrupted helplessly. “Please let’s all go home. Why don’t we all go home?”
vi: "Xin đừng!". Daisy cắt ngang một cách khẩn khoản. "Chúng ta đi về đi. Tại sao chúng ta không ra về?"
tr: Çaresizlik içinde “Yapma lütfen” diyerek araya girdi. “Lütfen artık eve gidelim. Neden hemen evlere dağılmıyoruz?
es: —¡Basta, por favor! —lo interrumpió con un gesto de impotencia—. Por favor, vámonos a casa. ¿Por qué no nos vamos todos a casa?
vi_translation: "Please don't!". Daisy interrupted urgently. "Let's go home. Why don't we leave?"
tr_translation: In desperation, she interrupted, saying, “Please don't.” “Please, let's go home now. Why don't we disperse to our homes immediately?”
es_translation: —Enough, please! —he interrupted him with a gesture of helplessness—. Please, let's go home. Why don't we all go home?

en: “That’s a good idea,” I got up. “Come on, Tom. Nobody wants a drink.”
vi: "Ý kiến hay đó." Tôi đứng lên. "Đi thôi Tom. Không ai muốn uống nữa rồi."
tr: “İyi fikir” diyerek ayağa kalktım. “Haydi gel Tom, kimse içki istemiyor zaten.
es: —Es una buena idea —me levanté—. Vamos, Tom. A nadie le apetece una copa.
vi_translation: "That's a good idea." I stood up. "Let's go, Tom. No one wants to drink anymore."
tr_translation: “Good idea,” I said, standing up. "Come on, Tom, nobody wants a drink anyway."
es_translation: —It's a good idea —I stood up—. Let's go, Tom. No one feels like having a drink.

en: “I want to know what Mr. Gatsby has to tell me.”
vi: "Tôi muốn nghe xem anh Gatsby có điều gì cần nói với tôi."
tr: “Bay Gatsby ne söyleyeceğinizi merak ettim.
es: —Quiero saber lo que mister Gatsby tiene que decirme.
vi_translation: "I want to hear what Mr. Gatsby has to say to me."
tr_translation: “Mr. Gatsby, I wondered what you would say.”
es_translation: —I want to know what mister Gatsby has to say to me.

en: “Your wife doesn’t love you,” said Gatsby. “She’s never loved you. She loves me.”
vi: "Vợ của anh không yêu anh." Gatsby nói. "Cô ấy chưa bao giờ yêu anh. Cô ấy yêu tôi."
tr: “Bay Gatsby ne söyleyeceğinizi merak ettim. “Karın seni sevmiyor. Asla da sevmedi, onun sevdi­ği kişi benim.
es: —Su mujer no lo quiere —dijo Gatsby—. Nunca lo ha querido. Me quiere a mí.
vi_translation: "Your wife doesn't love you," Gatsby said. "She never loved you. She loves me."
tr_translation: “Mr. Gatsby, I wondered what you would say.” "Your wife doesn't love you. She never did, the person she loves is me."
es_translation: —His wife doesn't love him —said Gatsby—. She never loved him. She loves me.

en: “You must be crazy!” exclaimed Tom automatically.
vi: "Anh đúng là điên rồ!" Tom la to như một cái máy.
tr: “Sen delirmişsin!” diye bağırdı Tom aniden.
es: —¡Usted debe de estar loco! —exclamó Tom automáticamente.
vi_translation: "You are truly crazy!" Tom shouted like a machine.
tr_translation: "You've gone mad!" Tom suddenly shouted.
es_translation: —You must be crazy! —exclaimed Tom automatically.

en: Gatsby sprang to his feet, vivid with excitement.
vi: Gatsby đứng bật lên, xúc động mãnh liệt.
tr: Heyecandan titreyen Gatsby ayağa fırlamıştı.
es: Gatsby se puso en pie de un salto, tenso por la emoción.
vi_translation: Gatsby stood up abruptly, intensely emotional.
tr_translation: Gatsby, trembling with excitement, had jumped to his feet.
es_translation: Gatsby jumped to his feet, tense with emotion.

en: “She never loved you, do you hear?” he cried. “She only married you because I was poor and she was tired of waiting for me. It was a terrible mistake, but in her heart she never loved anyone except me!”
vi: "Cô ấy chưa bao giờ yêu anh, anh nghe chưa?" Gatsby nói to. " Cô ấy lấy anh chỉ vì tôi nghèo và vì cô ấy đã mệt mỏi vì chờ đợi tôi. Đó là một sai lầm to lớn, thế nhưng trong trái tim của cô ta cô ta chưa hề yêu ai ngoại trừ tôi."
tr: “O seni hiç sevmedi, duyuyor musun?” dedi haykırarak, “Ben beş parasızdım ve o da beklemekten bıkmıştı. Seninle o yüzden evlendi. Korkunç bir hataydı bu. O asla benden başkasını sevmedi.
es: —Nunca lo ha querido, ¿lo oye? —gritó—. Sólo se casó con usted porque yo era pobre y estaba cansada de esperarme. Fue un terrible error, pero en su corazón nunca ha querido a nadie, sólo a mí.
vi_translation: "She never loved you, do you hear?" Gatsby said loudly. "She married you only because I was poor and because she was tired of waiting for me. It was a colossal mistake, but in her heart, she has never loved anyone except me."
tr_translation: “She never loved you, do you hear me?” he shouted, “I was penniless and she was tired of waiting. That's why she married you. It was a terrible mistake. She never loved anyone but me.”
es_translation: —She has never loved you, do you hear? —he shouted—. She only married you because I was poor and she was tired of waiting for me. It was a terrible mistake, but in her heart, she has never loved anyone, only me.

en: At this point Jordan and I tried to go, but Tom and Gatsby insisted with competitive firmness that we remain—as though neither of them had anything to conceal and it would be a privilege to partake vicariously of their emotions.
vi: Vào đến thời điểm này cả Jordan và tôi đều muốn rời khỏi nơi đó thế nhưng Tom và Gatsby không kém gì nhau cương quyết giữ chúng tôi lại, làm như hai người họ không có gì cần phải dấu diếm và cho rằng được tham sự chia sẻ những xúc cảm của họ là một đặc quyền.
tr: Tam o anda Jordan ve ben gitmek üzere kalktık. Ama hem Tom, hem de Gatsby birbirleriyle yarışırcasına kalmamız için ısrar ettiler. İkisi de, saklayacak bir şeyleri yokmuş, duygularını açığa çıkarmalarını seyredip heyecanla­rını paylaşmak bir ayrıcalıkmış gibi davranıyordu.
es: En ese momento Jordan y yo intentamos irnos, pero Tom y Gatsby, compitiendo en firmeza, insistieron en que nos quedáramos, como si ninguno de los dos tuviera nada que esconder y fuera un privilegio compartir indirectamente sus emociones.
vi_translation: By this time, both Jordan and I wanted to leave that place, but Tom and Gatsby were equally determined to keep us there, as if they had nothing to hide and considered it a privilege to share their emotions with us.
tr_translation: At that moment, Jordan and I got up to leave. But both Tom and Gatsby insisted that we stay, as if they were competing with each other. Both of them acted as if they had nothing to hide, as if it were a privilege to watch them reveal their feelings and share in their excitement.
es_translation: At that moment, Jordan and I tried to leave, but Tom and Gatsby, competing in firmness, insisted that we stay, as if neither of them had anything to hide and it was a privilege to indirectly share their emotions.

en: “Sit down, Daisy,” Tom’s voice groped unsuccessfully for the paternal note. “What’s been going on? I want to hear all about it.”
vi: "Ngồi xuống, Daisy." Tom ra lịnh với giọng kẻ trên, nhưng không thành công. "Chuyện xẩy ra sao sao? Tôi muốn được nghe hết tất cả."
tr: “Otur Daisy” dedi Tom. Sesine otoriter bir hava ver­meye uğraşıyor pek de başarılı olamıyordu. “Neler oluyor? Her şeyi bilmek istiyorum.
es: —Siéntate, Daisy —Tom buscaba, sin éxito, un tono paternal—. ¿Qué ha pasado? Quiero saberlo todo.
vi_translation: "Sit down, Daisy." Tom commanded with a superior tone, but it was unsuccessful. "What happened? I want to hear everything."
tr_translation: "Sit down, Daisy," said Tom. He was trying to give his voice an authoritative tone but wasn't very successful. “What is happening? I want to know everything.”
es_translation: —Sit down, Daisy —Tom was trying, unsuccessfully, to find a paternal tone—. What happened? I want to know everything.

en: “I told you what’s been going on,” said Gatsby. “Going on for five years—and you didn’t know.”
vi: "Tôi đã kể cho anh nghe chuyện gì đã xẩy ra." Gatsby nói. "Chuyện xẩy ra đã năm năm rồi mà anh chẳng biết gì cả."
tr: “Neler olduğunu sana söyledim” dedi Gatsby, “Beş yıllık bir şeyden bahsediyorum ve senin bilmediğin pek çok şeyden.
es: —Ya le he dicho lo que ha pasado —dijo Gatsby—. Durante cinco años… Y usted no lo sabía.
vi_translation: "I told you what happened." Gatsby said. "It happened five years ago and you knew nothing about it."
tr_translation: “I told you what happened,” said Gatsby, “I’m talking about something that spans five years and many things you don’t know about.”
es_translation: —I have already told you what happened —said Gatsby—. For five years… And you didn't know.

en: Tom turned to Daisy sharply.
vi: Tom quay ngoắt về phía Daisy.
tr: Tom birden Daisy’e döndü.
es: Tom, cortante, se volvió hacia Gatsby.
vi_translation: Tom turned abruptly towards Daisy.
tr_translation: Tom suddenly turned to Daisy.
es_translation: Tom, cuttingly, turned towards Gatsby.

en: “You’ve been seeing this fellow for five years?”
vi: "Em gặp gỡ qua lại với tên này đã năm năm rồi à
tr: “Bu herifle beş yıl­dır görüşüyor muydun?
es: —¿Llevas cinco años viendo a este tipo?
vi_translation: "You've been seeing this guy for five years already?" "It wasn't about meeting each other."
tr_translation: “Have you been seeing this guy for five years?”
es_translation: —Have you been seeing this guy for five years?

en: “Not seeing,” said Gatsby. “No, we couldn’t meet. But both of us loved each other all that time, old sport, and you didn’t know. I used to laugh sometimes”—but there was no laughter in his eyes—“to think that you didn’t know.”
vi: "Không phải qua lại gặp gỡ." Gatsby giải thích. "Không, chúng tôi không hề gặp nhau. Thế nhưng trong lòng chúng tôi lúc nào cũng yêu nhau. Anh bạn già. Anh đã không biết được điều này. Tôi đã nhiều lần thường cười khi nghĩ rằng anh không hề biết gì cả." Thế nhưng trong cặp mắt Gatsby không có cái gì gọi là cười cả.
tr: “Hayır görüşmüyordu” dedi Gatsby, “Görüşemiyorduk. Ama birbirimizi seviyorduk ahbap ve sen bunu bilmiyordun. Ba­zen düşünür ve gülerdim” konuşurken gözleri gülmü­yordu, “bilmiyor oluşun komik gelirdi bana.
es: —Viendo, no —dijo Gatsby—. No, no podíamos. Pero nos hemos querido durante todo ese tiempo, compañero, y usted no lo sabía. A veces me reía —pero no había risa en sus ojos— al pensar que usted no lo sabía.
vi_translation: Gatsby explained. "No, we never met. But in our hearts, we always loved each other. Old sport. You didn't know this. I often laughed thinking that you didn't know anything." But there was nothing resembling a laugh in Gatsby's eyes.
tr_translation: “No, we weren't meeting,” said Gatsby, “We couldn't meet. But we loved each other, buddy, and you didn't know that. Sometimes I would think and laugh,” his eyes weren't smiling as he spoke, “it would seem funny to me that you didn't know.”
es_translation: —Seeing, no —said Gatsby—. No, we couldn't. But we have loved each other all this time, old sport, and you didn't know it. Sometimes I laughed —but there was no laughter in his eyes— thinking that you didn't know it.

en: “You’re crazy!” he exploded. “I can’t speak about what happened five years ago, because I didn’t know Daisy then—and I’ll be damned if I see how you got within a mile of her unless you brought the groceries to the back door. But all the rest of that’s a God damned lie. Daisy loved me when she married me and she loves me now.”
vi: "Anh đúng là điên khùng!" Tom đùng đùng. "Tôi không đụng vào những chuyện đã xẩy ra năm năm về trước bởi vì lúc đó tôi chưa quen Daisy. Và tôi cũng muốn biết anh làm cách nào để lại gần vợ tôi trong vòng một dặm trừ khi anh là thằng giao thực phẩm đi vào bằng cửa sau. Thế nhưng tất cả mọi chuyện còn lại đều là láo. Daisy đã yêu tôi khi cô ấy lấy tôi và cô ấy bây giờ vẫn yêu tôi."
tr: “Delirmişsin sen!” diye patladı, “Beş yıl önce neler olduğu konusunda hiçbir şey söyleyemem çünkü o zaman Daisy’i tanımıyordum. Ayrıca o dönem yanına –tabii eğer bakkal siparişlerini arka kapıdan getiren sen değilsen- nasıl bir kilometreden fazla yaklaşabildiğini de aklım almıyor. Geri kalanların hepsi koca bir yalan. Daisy benimle sevdiği için evlendi ve hala da seviyor.
es: ¡Está usted loco! —estalló—. No puedo hablar de lo que pasó hace cinco años, porque entonces yo no conocía a Daisy. Pero que me condene si entiendo cómo pudo usted acercarse a menos de un kilómetro de Daisy a no ser que llevara los ultramarinos a la puerta de servicio. Todo lo demás es una maldita mentira. Daisy me quería cuando se casó conmigo y me sigue queriendo.
vi_translation: "You are truly insane!" Tom fumed. "I don't touch on things that happened five years ago because I didn't know Daisy back then. And I also want to know how you got close to my wife within a mile unless you were the food delivery guy coming in through the back door. But everything else is a lie. Daisy loved me when she married me and she still loves me now."
tr_translation: “You’re crazy!” he burst out, “I can’t say anything about what happened five years ago because I didn’t know Daisy then. Besides, I can’t fathom how you could have gotten within a mile of her during that time – unless, of course, you were the one delivering the grocery orders through the back door. The rest is all a big lie. Daisy married me because she loved me and she still does.”
es_translation: You're crazy! —he burst out—. I can't talk about what happened five years ago, because I didn't know Daisy then. But damn me if I understand how you could get within a kilometer of Daisy unless you were delivering groceries to the service door. Everything else is a damn lie. Daisy loved me when she married me and she still loves me.

en: “No,” said Gatsby, shaking his head.
vi: "Không đúng." Gatsby lắc đầu nói.
tr: “Hayır” dedi Gatsby başını iki yana sallayarak.
es: —No —dijo Gatsby, moviendo la cabeza.
vi_translation: "Not true." Gatsby shook his head and said.
tr_translation: "No," said Gatsby, shaking his head from side to side.
es_translation: —No —said Gatsby, shaking his head.

en: “She does, though. The trouble is that sometimes she gets foolish ideas in her head and doesn’t know what she’s doing.” He nodded sagely. “And what’s more, I love Daisy too. Once in a while I go off on a spree and make a fool of myself, but I always come back, and in my heart I love her all the time.”
vi: "Cô ấy có. Có điều là đôi khi cô ấy nẩy ra trong đầu những suy nghĩ ngu muội và không biết mình đang làm gì." Tom gục gặc đầu nghiêm trang. "Còn nữa, tôi cũng yêu Daisy. Đôi khi tôi cũng ngu xuẩn đi ra ngoài theo bạn bè vui chơi, thế nhưng tôi luôn luôn quay về lại. Trong trái tim của tôi, tôi lúc nào cũng yêu cô ấy."
tr: “Evet seviyor. Bazen kafası saçma sa­pan şeylere takılır ve ne yapacağını bilemez. Hepsi bu.” sonra büyük bir ciddiyetle ekledi, “ben de onu seviyorum elbette. Arada bir yoldan çıkıp aptallıklar yaptığım olur ama her zaman ona geri dönmüşümdür. Kalbimin derinliklerinde duyduğum aşk hiç eksilmemiştir.
es: —Me quiere, a pesar de todo. El problema es que a veces se le meten en la cabeza tonterías y no sabe lo que hace —Tom asintió como un sabio—. Y, lo que es más, yo también quiero a Daisy. De vez en cuando me pego una juerga y me porto como un idiota, pero vuelvo siempre y, en lo más profundo de mi corazón, nunca he dejado de quererla.
vi_translation: "She does. It's just that sometimes she gets foolish thoughts in her head and doesn't know what she's doing." Tom nodded solemnly. "Besides, I also love Daisy. Sometimes I foolishly go out with friends to have fun, but I always come back. In my heart, I always love her."
tr_translation: “Yes, he loves. Sometimes his mind gets stuck on silly things and he doesn't know what to do. That's all.” Then he added with great seriousness, “of course, I love him too. Sometimes I stray and do foolish things, but I have always returned to him. The love I feel in the depths of my heart has never diminished.”
es_translation: —She loves me, despite everything. The problem is that sometimes she gets silly ideas in her head and doesn't know what she's doing —Tom nodded wisely—. And, what's more, I also love Daisy. Every now and then I go on a spree and act like an idiot, but I always come back and, deep down in my heart, I've never stopped loving her.

en: “You’re revolting,” said Daisy. She turned to me, and her voice, dropping an octave lower, filled the room with thrilling scorn: “Do you know why we left Chicago? I’m surprised that they didn’t treat you to the story of that little spree.”
vi: "Anh đang tự hối." Daisy nói. Nàng quay sang tôi, giọng trầm hẳn xuống làm tràn đầy căn phòng với những cảm xúc khinh bỉ. "Anh có biết tại sao chúng em rời khỏi Chicago không? Em ngạc nhiên bọn họ đã không đãi cho anh nghe cái câu chuyện bọn họ đi ăn chơi đó."
tr: “İğrençsin sen” dedi Daisy, sonra bana döndü ve öfkeden bir oktav aşağı düşen sitem dolu sesi odada çınladı. “Chica­go’yu neden terk ettik biliyor musun? Seni o küçük ‘yo­ldan çıkma’ hikayesine nasıl dahil etmediler şaşıyorum.
es: —Eres repugnante —dijo Daisy. Se volvió hacia mí, y su voz, descendiendo una octava, llenó la habitación de emoción y desprecio—. ¿No sabes por qué nos fuimos de Chicago? Me asombra que no te hayan contado la historia de esa juerga.
vi_translation: "He's repenting." Daisy said. She turned to me, her voice dropping, filling the room with feelings of contempt. "Do you know why we left Chicago?" I'm surprised they haven't told you the story of their escapades."
tr_translation: "You are disgusting," said Daisy, then she turned to me and her voice, laden with reproach and dropping an octave in anger, resonated in the room. "Do you know why we left Chicago? I wonder how they didn't involve you in that little 'going astray' story."
es_translation: —You are disgusting —said Daisy. She turned to me, and her voice, dropping an octave, filled the room with emotion and disdain—. Don't you know why we left Chicago? I'm amazed that they haven't told you the story of that spree.

en: Gatsby walked over and stood beside her.
vi: Gatsby bước tới đứng cạnh bên Daisy nói một cách thiết tha.
tr: Gatsby yerinden kalkıp ona doğru birkaç adım attı.
es: Gatsby dio unos pasos y se puso a su lado.
vi_translation: Gatsby stepped forward to stand next to Daisy and spoke passionately.
tr_translation: Gatsby got up from his seat and took a few steps toward her.
es_translation: Gatsby took a few steps and stood by her side.

en: “Daisy, that’s all over now,” he said earnestly. “It doesn’t matter any more. Just tell him the truth—that you never loved him—and it’s all wiped out forever.”
vi: "Daisy, tất cả mọi chuyện coi như đã xong rồi, không còn là vấn đề nữa. Hãy nói cho anh ta nghe sự thật, sự thật là em chưa bao giờ yêu anh ta và tất cả chúng đã bị xóa sạch."
tr: “O iş bitti artık Daisy” dedi içtenlikle, “hiçbir önemi yok. Ona gerçeği söyle. Hiç sevmediğini anlat. Her şey sonsuza dek açıklığa kavuşsun.
es: —Daisy, todo eso ha terminado —dijo con pasión—. Ya no importa. Dile la verdad, que nunca lo has querido, y todo habrá acabado para siempre.
vi_translation: "Daisy, everything is over, it's no longer an issue. Tell him the truth, the truth that you never loved him and that everything has been erased."
tr_translation: “It's over now, Daisy,” he said sincerely, “it doesn't matter at all. Tell him the truth. Explain that you never loved him. Let everything be clarified forever.”
es_translation: —Daisy, all of that is over —he said passionately—. It doesn't matter anymore. Tell him the truth, that you never loved him, and everything will be over forever.

en: She looked at him blindly. “Why—how could I love him—possibly?”
vi: Daisy nhìn Gatsy thất một cách thất thần. "Làm sao - Làm sao em có thể yêu anh ấy được?"
tr: Daisy görmeyen gözlerle ona baktı. “Onu nasıl sevebi­lirim? Bu nasıl mümkün olur?” dedi.
es: Daisy lo miró sin verlo. —Pero ¿cómo, cómo habría podido quererlo?
vi_translation: Daisy looked at Gatsby in a daze. "How - How could you love him?"
tr_translation: Daisy looked at him with unseeing eyes. “How can I love him? How is this possible?” she said.
es_translation: Daisy looked at him without seeing him. —But how, how could I have wanted it?

en: “You never loved him.”
vi: "Em đã chưa từng bao giờ yêu anh ta."
tr: “Onu asla sevmedin.
es: —Nunca lo has querido.
vi_translation: "I have never loved him."
tr_translation: “You never loved him.”
es_translation: —You have never loved him.

en: She hesitated. Her eyes fell on Jordan and me with a sort of appeal, as though she realized at last what she was doing—and as though she had never, all along, intended doing anything at all. But it was done now. It was too late.
vi: Daisy ngập ngừng. Đôi mắt của nàng hướng nhìn Jordan và tôi như khẩn khoản, như thể cuối cùng rồi nàng đã nhận thức được chuyện mình đang làm, như thể từ trước tới nay nàng chưa hề có ý định làm bất cứ chuyện gì. Thế nhưng bây giờ câu chuyện đã diễn ra, đã quá trễ.
tr: Daisy tereddüt içindeydi. Yardım ister gibi bir bana bir Jordan’a baktı. Sanki yaptıklarının farkına yeni varıyormuş gibiydi. Ve sanki bunları yapmayı pek de istememiş gibi. Ama olan olmuştu bir kere. Artık çok geçti.
es: Daisy dudó. Nos miró a Jordan y a mí como suplicando, como si por fin se diera cuenta de lo que estaba haciendo, y como si nunca, durante todo aquel tiempo, hubiera tenido la menor intención de hacer nada. Pero ya estaba hecho. Era demasiado tarde.
vi_translation: Daisy hesitated. Her eyes looked at Jordan and me imploringly, as if she had finally realized what she was doing, as if she had never intended to do anything until now. But now the story had unfolded, it was too late.
tr_translation: Daisy was in hesitation. She looked at me and then at Jordan as if asking for help. It was as if she was just realizing what she had done. And as if she hadn't really wanted to do them. But what was done was done. It was too late now.
es_translation: Daisy hesitated. She looked at Jordan and me as if pleading, as if she finally realized what she was doing, and as if she had never, during all that time, had the slightest intention of doing anything. But it was already done. It was too late.

en: “I never loved him,” she said, with perceptible reluctance.
vi: "Em chưa hề bao giờ yêu anh ta." Daisy nói với vẻ miễn cưỡng rõ rệt.
tr: “Onu hiç sevmedim” sözleri döküldü ağzından istemeden.
es: —Nunca lo he querido —dijo con evidente reticencia.
vi_translation: "I have never loved him." Daisy said with evident reluctance.
tr_translation: “I never liked him,” the words slipped out of her mouth unintentionally.
es_translation: —I have never wanted it —he said with evident reluctance.

en: “Not at Kapiolani?” demanded Tom suddenly.
vi: "Ngay cả khi ở Kapiolani?" Tom hỏi đột ngột.
tr: “Kapiolani’deyken de mi?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Ni siquiera en Kapiolani? —preguntó Tom de repente. —No.
vi_translation: "Even at Kapiolani?" Tom asked abruptly.
tr_translation: "Even when you were in Kapiolani?" he asked.
es_translation: —Not even in Kapiolani? —asked Tom suddenly.

en: “No.”
vi: "Không."
tr: “Hayır.
es: —No.
vi_translation: "No."
tr_translation: “No.”
es_translation: —No.

en: From the ballroom beneath, muffled and suffocating chords were drifting up on hot waves of air.
vi: Từ căn phòng khiêu vũ dưới lầu dưới, những hợp âm nghe như nghẹt nghẹt tắc thở đang dập dờn nương theo làn không khí nóng bay vọng lên.
tr: Alttaki balo salonundan yükselen boğucu ses­ler, sıcak hava dalgalarının üzerinden bize ulaşmaya devam ediyordu.
es: Del salón de baile, entre oleadas de aire caliente, nos llegaban acordes apagados y sofocantes.
vi_translation: From the ballroom downstairs, the chords, sounding like they were suffocating, floated up with the hot air.
tr_translation: The suffocating sounds rising from the ballroom below continued to reach us over the waves of hot air.
es_translation: From the ballroom, amidst waves of hot air, muffled and stifling chords reached us.

en: “Not that day I carried you down from the Punch Bowl to keep your shoes dry?” There was a husky tenderness in his tone… “Daisy?”
vi: "Kể cả cái ngày anh anh bồng em từ trên con thuyền Punch Bowl xuống để giữ cho giày em được khô? Hả Daisy?" Giọng nói của Tom mang chút trầm buồn dịu dàng. "Xin đừng!".
tr: “Peki ya yağmurda ayakkabılarının ıslanmaması için seni kollarımda taşıdığım o gün?” sesi yumuşak ve sevecendi, “Ha, Daisy?
es: —¿Ni el día que te llevé en brazos desde el Punch Bowl para que no se te mojaran los zapatos, Daisy? —había una ternura ronca en su tono.
vi_translation: "Including the day you carried me off the Punch Bowl to keep my shoes dry? Right, Daisy?" Tom's voice carried a gentle, melancholic tone. "Please don't!".
tr_translation: “Well, what about that day when I carried you in my arms so your shoes wouldn't get wet in the rain?” the voice was soft and affectionate, “Huh, Daisy?”
es_translation: —Not even the day I carried you in my arms from the Punch Bowl so your shoes wouldn't get wet, Daisy? —there was a hoarse tenderness in his tone.

en: “Please don’t.” Her voice was cold, but the rancour was gone from it. She looked at Gatsby. “There, Jay,” she said—but her hand as she tried to light a cigarette was trembling. Suddenly she threw the cigarette and the burning match on the carpet.
vi: "Xin đừng!". Giọng của Daisy tuy lạnh lùng nhưng chất ác cảm đã tan biến. Daisy ngước nhìn Gatsby. "Jay". Daisy nói bàn tay run rẩy đưa lên mồi thuốc lá. Đột nhiên Daisy ném điếu thuốc đang cháy xuống dưới thảm.
tr: “Peki ya yağmurda ayakkabılarının ıslanmaması için seni kollarımda taşıdığım o gün?” sesi yumuşak ve sevecendi, “Ha, Daisy? “Lütfen yapma” derken Daisy’nin sesi buz gibiydi ama kini biriz azalmış gibiydi. Gatsby’e baktı, “yaptım işte Jay” dedi. Sigara­sını yakmaya çalışan eli titriyordu. Birden sigarayı da yanan kibriti de halının üzerine fırlattı.
es: —Por favor, basta —la voz sonó fría, pero el rencor había desaparecido. Miró a Gatsby—. Ya ves, Jay —dijo, pero le temblaba la mano cuando intentó encender un cigarrillo. De pronto tiró el cigarrillo y la cerilla encendida a la alfombra—.
vi_translation: "Please don't!". Daisy's voice, though cold, had lost its tone of hostility. Daisy looked up at Gatsby. "Jay". Daisy said, her trembling hand reaching up to light a cigarette. Suddenly, Daisy threw the burning cigarette onto the carpet.
tr_translation: “Well, what about that day when I carried you in my arms so your shoes wouldn't get wet in the rain?” the voice was soft and affectionate, “Huh, Daisy?” "Please don't," Daisy's voice was icy, but her resentment seemed slightly diminished. She looked at Gatsby, "I did it, Jay," she said. Her hand, trying to light a cigarette, was trembling. Suddenly, she threw both the cigarette and the lit match onto the carpet.
es_translation: —Please, stop —the voice sounded cold, but the resentment had disappeared. She looked at Gatsby—. You see, Jay —she said, but her hand trembled when she tried to light a cigarette. Suddenly, she threw the cigarette and the lit match onto the carpet—.

en: “Oh, you want too much!” she cried to Gatsby. “I love you now—isn’t that enough? I can’t help what’s past.” She began to sob helplessly. “I did love him once—but I loved you too.”
vi: "Anh đòi hỏi nhiều quá!" Daisy nói to với Gatsby. "Bây giờ em yêu anh, không phải như vậy là đủ rồi sao. Em không thể làm gì với những chuyện đã qua rồi trong quá khứ." Daisy khóc nức nở. " Em một lần đã từng yêu anh ta - nhưng em cũng đã yêu cả anh nữa."
tr: “Ama sen de çok şey istiyorsun!” diye bağırdı, “Seni seviyorum işte, bu yet­mez mi? Geçmişi silemem ki! Ağlamaya başlamıştı. “Bir zamanlar onu sevmiştim. Ama seni de sevdim.
es: ¡Pides demasiado! —le gritó a Gatsby—. Te quiero, ¿no es suficiente? No puedo borrar el pasado —empezó a sollozar sin poder contenerse—. Lo he querido, pero también te quería a ti.
vi_translation: "You ask for too much!" Daisy said loudly to Gatsby. "I love you now, isn't that enough." "I can't do anything about the past." Daisy sobbed. "I once loved him - but I also loved you."
tr_translation: “But you want too much!” he shouted, “I love you, isn't that enough? I can't erase the past!” She had started crying. “Once upon a time, I loved him. But I loved you too.”
es_translation: You ask too much! —she shouted at Gatsby—. I love you, isn't that enough? I can't erase the past —she began to sob uncontrollably—. I loved him, but I also loved you.

en: Gatsby’s eyes opened and closed.
vi: Cặp mắt của Gatsby mở ra rồi khép lại.
tr: Gatsby gözlerini açıp kapattı.
es: Los ojos de Gatsby se abrieron y se cerraron.
vi_translation: Gatsby's eyes opened and then closed.
tr_translation: Gatsby blinked his eyes.
es_translation: Gatsby's eyes opened and closed.

en: “You loved me too?” he repeated.
vi: Anh lập lại. "Em CŨNG yêu anh luôn phải không?"
tr: “Beni de sevdin demek” diye tekrarladı.
es: —¿También me querías a mí? —repitió.
vi_translation: He repeated. "You love me too, don't you?"
tr_translation: “So, you loved me too,” he repeated.
es_translation: —Did you also love me? —he repeated.

en: “Even that’s a lie,” said Tom savagely. “She didn’t know you were alive. Why—there’s things between Daisy and me that you’ll never know, things that neither of us can ever forget.”
vi: "Ngay cả nếu như đó chỉ là một lời gian dối." Tom nói một can tàn nhẫn. "Cô ấy không biết rằng anh vẫn còn sống. Tại sao? Có những chuyện xẩy ra giữa tôi và Daisy mà anh k hông bao giờ biết được. Có những chuyện mà cả hai chúng tôi sẽ không bao giờ quên được."
tr: “O bile yalan” dedi Tom ölkeyle, “Senin yaşadığının bile farkında değildi o. Karımla aramızda öyle şeyler var ki, bir tekini bile anlayamazsın. İkimizin de asla unutamayacağı şeyler.
es: —Incluso eso es mentira —dijo Tom despiadadamente—. Ni siquiera sabía si usted seguía vivo. Hay cosas entre Daisy y yo que usted no conocerá jamás, cosas que ninguno de los dos olvidará nunca.
vi_translation: "Even if it was just a lie." Tom said cruelly. "She doesn't know that you're still alive. Why? There are things that happened between Daisy and me that you k We will never know. There are things that neither of us will ever forget."
tr_translation: “That's a lie,” said Tom bitterly, “He wasn't even aware that you existed. There are things between my wife and me that you couldn't understand even one of them. Things that neither of us will ever forget.”
es_translation: —Even that is a lie —said Tom ruthlessly—. I didn't even know if you were still alive. There are things between Daisy and me that you will never know, things that neither of us will ever forget.

en: The words seemed to bite physically into Gatsby.
vi: Những lời nói này dường như đã xâu xé cơ thể của Gatsby.
tr: Kelimeler Gatsby’nin bedeninde yaralar açıyordu sanki.
es: Las palabras parecían morder en el cuerpo de Gatsby.
vi_translation: These words seemed to have torn Gatsby's body apart.
tr_translation: It was as if the words were wounding Gatsby's body.
es_translation: The words seemed to bite into Gatsby's body.

en: “I want to speak to Daisy alone,” he insisted. “She’s all excited now—”
vi: "Tôi muốn nói chuyện riêng với Daisy. Cô ấy bây giờ đang xúc động." Gatsy cương quyết.
tr: “Daisy ile yalnız konuşmak istiyorum” diye ısrar etti, “şu an çok endişeli...
es: —Quiero hablar a solas con Daisy —insistió—. Ahora está demasiado alterada…
vi_translation: "I want to speak privately with Daisy. She is emotional right now." Gatsby insisted.
tr_translation: "I want to talk to Daisy alone," he insisted, "she is very worried right now..."
es_translation: —I want to speak alone with Daisy —he insisted—. She is too upset right now…

en: “Even alone I can’t say I never loved Tom,” she admitted in a pitiful voice. “It wouldn’t be true.”
vi: "Ngay cả khi chỉ có hai đứa mình, em cũng không thể nói rằng em chưa từng yêu Tom. Điều đó không đúng sự thật" Daisy thú nhận một cách khổ sở.
tr: “Yalnız da olsak Tom’u hiç sevmediğimi söyleyemem” dedi Daisy. Sesi acı doluydu. “Gerçek olmaz bu.
es: —Ni siquiera a solas puedo decir que nunca he querido a Tom —admitió Daisy con la voz quebrada—. No sería verdad.
vi_translation: "Even if it's just the two of us, I can't say that I never loved Tom. That wouldn't be true," Daisy confessed miserably.
tr_translation: “Even if we are alone, I can't say that I never loved Tom,” said Daisy. Her voice was full of pain. "This can't be real."
es_translation: —Not even when I'm alone can I say that I never loved Tom —admitted Daisy with a broken voice—. It wouldn't be true.

en: “Of course it wouldn’t,” agreed Tom.
vi: "Đương nhiên là không đúng rồi." Tom tán thành.
tr: “Tabii olmaz” diye onay verdi Tom.
es: —Por supuesto que no —convino Tom.
vi_translation: "Of course, that's not right." Tom agreed.
tr_translation: "Of course not," Tom agreed.
es_translation: —Of course not —agreed Tom.

en: She turned to her husband.
vi: Daisy quay đầu lại nhìn chồng.
tr: “Tüm bunlar umurunda sanki” dedi Daisy kocasına dönerek.
es: Daisy se volvió hacia su marido.
vi_translation: Daisy turned her head to look at her husband.
tr_translation: "As if he cares about any of this," said Daisy, turning to her husband.
es_translation: Daisy turned to her husband.

en: “As if it mattered to you,” she said.
vi: "Anh làm như điều đó là quan trọng đối với anh."
tr: “Tüm bunlar umurunda sanki” dedi Daisy kocasına dönerek.
es: —Como si eso te importara —dijo.
vi_translation: "You act as if that matters to you."
tr_translation: "As if he cares about any of this," said Daisy, turning to her husband.
es_translation: —As if you cared —he said.

en: “Of course it matters. I’m going to take better care of you from now on.”
vi: "Đương nhiên là quan trọng. Từ nay về sau anh hứa sẽ chăm sóc em tốt hơn."
tr: “Elbette umurumda. Bundan sonra sana çok daha iyi bakacağım.
es: —Por supuesto que me importa. Voy a cuidar mejor de ti de ahora en adelante.
vi_translation: "Of course it's important. From now on, I promise to take better care of you."
tr_translation: "Of course I care. From now on, I will take much better care of you."
es_translation: —Of course I care. I'm going to take better care of you from now on.

en: “You don’t understand,” said Gatsby, with a touch of panic. “You’re not going to take care of her any more.”
vi: "Thật ra anh không hiểu. Anh sẽ không còn được chăm sóc cho Daisy nữa." Gatsby nói giọng biểu hiện sự hoảng hốt.
tr: “Anlamadın galiba” derken Gatsby’nin sesinde hafif bir panik seziliyordu, “ona artık sen bakmayacaksın.
es: —No ha comprendido usted —dijo Gatsby con una sombra de pánico—. No volverá a cuidar de ella.
vi_translation: "Actually, you don't understand. You won't be able to take care of Daisy anymore." Gatsby said, his voice showing signs of panic.
tr_translation: "I guess you didn't understand," Gatsby's voice had a slight hint of panic, "you won't be taking care of her anymore."
es_translation: —You haven't understood —said Gatsby with a shadow of panic—. She will not take care of her again.

en: “I’m not?” Tom opened his eyes wide and laughed. He could afford to control himself now. “Why’s that?”
vi: "Tôi không được?" Tom trợn tròn mắt rồi phá lên cười. Bây giờ anh ta đã lấy lại được tự chủ. "Tại sao vậy?"
tr: “Öyle mi?” dedi Tom. Gözlerini fal taşı gibi açıp kah­kaha atmıştı, “Nedenmiş o? “Senden ayrılıyor.
es: —¿No? —Tom abrió los ojos de par en par y se echó a reír. Ya no tenía problemas para controlarse—. ¿Y eso por qué?
vi_translation: "I can't?" Tom's eyes widened and then he burst out laughing. Now he had regained his composure. "Why is that?"
tr_translation: “Is that so?” said Tom. He opened his eyes wide and laughed, "Why is that?" “He is leaving you.”
es_translation: —No? —Tom opened his eyes wide and burst out laughing. He no longer had trouble controlling himself—. And why is that?

en: “Daisy’s leaving you.”
vi: "Bởi vì Daisy sẽ bỏ anh."
tr: “Senden ayrılıyor.
es: —Daisy va a dejarlo.
vi_translation: "Because Daisy will leave you."
tr_translation: “He is leaving you.”
es_translation: —Daisy is going to leave him.

en: “Nonsense.”
vi: "Vô lý."
tr: “Saçmalık.
es: —Tonterías.
vi_translation: "Nonsense."
tr_translation: “Nonsense.”
es_translation: —Nonsense.

en: “I am, though,” she said with a visible effort.
vi: "Đúng như thế." Daisy nói bằng một sự cố gắng rõ rệt.
tr: “Evet öyle” dedi Daisy, gözle görülür bir çaba harcayarak.
es: —Pues es verdad —dijo ella con evidente esfuerzo.
vi_translation: "That's right." Daisy said with a noticeable effort.
tr_translation: “Yes, it is,” said Daisy, making a visible effort.
es_translation: —Well, it's true —she said with evident effort.

en: “She’s not leaving me!” Tom’s words suddenly leaned down over Gatsby. “Certainly not for a common swindler who’d have to steal the ring he put on her finger.”
vi: "Cô ấy sẽ không rời bỏ tôi!" Những lời nói của Tom đột ngột ngả về hướng Gatsby. " Chắc chắn là cô ấy sẽ không rời bỏ tôi để đi theo một tên lừa bịp, người sẽ phải đi ăn cắp cả nhẫn cưới để đeo cho cô ấy."
tr: “Beni bırakmayacak.” Tom’un sözleri Gatsby’nin cesaretini kırıyordu, “Parmağına takacağın nikah yüzüğünü bile çalmak zorunda olan senin gibi adi bir dolandırıcı için bunu asla yapmaz.
es: —¡Ella no va a dejarme! —las palabras de Tom cayeron súbitamente sobre Gatsby—. Y, desde luego, no por un vulgar estafador que tendría que robar el anillo que le pusiera en el dedo.
vi_translation: "She will not leave me!" Tom's words suddenly turned towards Gatsby. "Surely she will not leave me to follow a fraud, who would have to steal even a wedding ring to put on her finger."
tr_translation: “She won't leave me.” Tom's words were disheartening Gatsby, “She would never do that for a lowly swindler like you who even had to steal the wedding ring you put on her finger.”
es_translation: —She is not going to leave me! —Tom's words suddenly fell upon Gatsby—. And, of course, not for a common swindler who would have to steal the ring he put on her finger.

en: “I won’t stand this!” cried Daisy. “Oh, please let’s get out.”
vi: "Em không thể chịu đựng nữa rồi. Làm ơi đi, chúng ta hãy rời khỏi đây đi." Daisy nói to.
tr: “Dayanamıyorum” diye haykırdı Daisy, “Lütfen buradan gidelim artık!
es: —¡Esto es insoportable! —gritó Daisy—. ¡Vámonos, por favor!
vi_translation: "I can't take it anymore. Please, let's get out of here." Daisy said loudly.
tr_translation: “I can't stand it,” cried Daisy, “Please, let's get out of here already!”
es_translation: —This is unbearable! —shouted Daisy—. Let's go, please!

en: “Who are you, anyhow?” broke out Tom. “You’re one of that bunch that hangs around with Meyer Wolfshiem—that much I happen to know. I’ve made a little investigation into your affairs—and I’ll carry it further tomorrow.”
vi: "Anh nghĩ anh là ai?" Tom cười phá lên. "Anh chỉ là một trong những tên bám theo Meyer Wolfsheim, tôi đã biết rõ cả rồi. Tôi đã cho người điều tra những công việc anh làm và ngay mai tôi sẽ tiếp tục điều tra thêm nữa."
tr: “Sen kimsin be!” diye bağırıyordu Tom, “altı üstü Meyer Wolfsheim’ın çevresinde dolanan güruhtan birisin işte. Şimdilik bu kadar biliyorum. Hakkında ufak da olsa bir soruşturma yaptım. Yarın daha fazlasını da öğreneceğim.
es: —Porque ¿quién es usted a fin de cuentas? —remató Tom—. Uno de la pandilla que rodea a Meyer Wolfshiem, por lo que he podido saber. He investigado un poco en sus asuntos, y mañana seguiré.
vi_translation: "Who do you think you are?" Tom burst out laughing. "You're just one of those guys who hang around Meyer Wolfsheim, I already know everything. I've had people investigate your activities and tomorrow I'll continue to investigate further."
tr_translation: “Who do you think you are!” Tom was shouting, “you’re just one of those people hanging around Meyer Wolfsheim.” “That’s all I know for now.” “I’ve done a little investigation on you.” “Tomorrow I’ll learn more.””
es_translation: —Because who are you after all? —Tom concluded—. One of the gang that surrounds Meyer Wolfshiem, from what I have been able to find out. I've looked into your affairs a bit, and tomorrow I will continue.

en: “You can suit yourself about that, old sport,” said Gatsby steadily.
vi: "Anh cứ việc tự tiện, anh bạn già." Gatsby điềm tĩnh nói.
tr: “Canın nasıl isterse ahbap” dedi Gatsby hiç duraksamadan.
es: —Puede hacer al respecto lo que crea conveniente, compañero —dijo Gatsby con serenidad.
vi_translation: "Feel free to make yourself at home, old sport." Gatsby calmly said.
tr_translation: "As you wish, buddy," said Gatsby without hesitation.
es_translation: —You can do whatever you think is appropriate about it, comrade —said Gatsby calmly.

en: “I found out what your ‘drugstores’ were.” He turned to us and spoke rapidly. “He and this Wolfshiem bought up a lot of side-street drugstores here and in Chicago and sold grain alcohol over the counter. That’s one of his little stunts. I picked him for a bootlegger the first time I saw him, and I wasn’t far wrong.”
vi: "Tôi đã khám phá ra được những tiệm thuốc của anh ta thật sự là làm gì." Tom quay lại phía chúng tôi nói vội vàng. "Anh ta và cái tên Wolfsheim này đã mua rất nhiều hàng loạt những tiệm thuốc dọc đường ở đây và ở thành phố Chicago để bán rượu lậu. Cái đó mới chỉ là một trong những việc làm vặt của anh ta thôi. Tôi đã đoán ra ngay anh ta là một tên buôn lậu ngay từ lần đầu tiên tôi gặp anh ta. Và tôi đã không quá sai phải không?"
tr: “Senin şu eczanelerinde neler olup bittiğini de biliyorum.” Sonra bize döndü. “Bu ikisi New York ve Chicago’da cadde üzerinde bir sürü dükkan açıp piyasaya tonlarca tahıl alkolü satmışlar. Marifetlerinden yalnızca biri bu. Görür görmez içki kaçakçısı olduğundan şüphelenmiştim zaten. Yanılmamışım.
es: —He descubierto lo que eran sus drugstores —se dirigió a nosotros, hablando muy rápido—. Él y ese Wolfshiem compraron un montón de drugstores en callejuelas de aquí y de Chicago y se dedicaron a vender licor de contrabando. Ése es uno de sus trucos. Me pareció un contrabandista de alcohol la primera vez que lo vi, y no me equivoqué demasiado.
vi_translation: "I have discovered what his pharmacies are really doing." Tom turned back to us and said hurriedly. "He and this guy Wolfsheim bought up a lot of drugstores here and in Chicago to sell bootleg liquor. That was just one of his small-time operations. I guessed right away that he was a bootlegger the first time I met him. And I wasn't too wrong, was I?"
tr_translation: "I also know what's going on in your pharmacies." Then he turned to us. "These two have opened a bunch of stores on the streets of New York and Chicago and sold tons of grain alcohol on the market. That's just one of their tricks. I suspected he was a bootlegger the moment I saw him. I wasn't wrong."
es_translation: —I have discovered what their drugstores were —he addressed us, speaking very quickly—. He and that Wolfshiem bought a bunch of drugstores in alleys here and in Chicago and dedicated themselves to selling bootleg liquor. That is one of their tricks. He seemed like a bootlegger to me the first time I saw him, and I wasn't too far off.

en: “What about it?” said Gatsby politely. “I guess your friend Walter Chase wasn’t too proud to come in on it.”
vi: "Như vậy thì sao?" Gatsby nói một cách hòa nhã. "Tôi đoán người bạn Walter Chase của anh đã không phải quá kiêu hãnh để tham gia vào làm công việc này."
tr: “Öyle olsa ne çıkar? dedi Gatsby nezaketini bozmadan “Dostun Walter Chase de o işe bulaştı ama sonra pişman oldu.
es: —¿Y qué? —dijo Gatsby con mucha corrección—. Creo que a su amigo Walter Chase el orgullo no le impidió participar en el negocio.
vi_translation: "So what?" Gatsby said politely. "I guess your friend Walter Chase wasn't too proud to get involved in this work."
tr_translation: “So what if it is? said Gatsby without breaking his politeness. “Your friend Walter Chase got involved in that too but later regretted it.”
es_translation: —And what? —said Gatsby with great correctness—. I believe that pride did not prevent your friend Walter Chase from participating in the business.

en: “And you left him in the lurch, didn’t you? You let him go to jail for a month over in New Jersey. God! You ought to hear Walter on the subject of you.”
vi: "Và các anh đã bỏ rơi anh ta trong lúc hoạn nạn, phải không? Các anh đã để cho anh ta bị vào tù mất một tháng ở New Jersey. Chao ơi! Anh nên nghe Walter kể chuyện về anh ra sao."
tr: “Zor duruma düşer düşmez sen de onu başından attın. New Jersey hapishanesinde bir ay yatmasına ses çıkarmadın. Tan­rım! Walter’ın senin için neler söylediğini bir duysan.
es: —Y usted lo dejó en la estacada, ¿no? Dejó que pasara un mes en la cárcel de Nueva Jersey. ¡Santo Dios! Tendría que oír lo que Walter dice de usted.
vi_translation: "And you abandoned him in his time of need, didn't you? You let him go to jail for a month in New Jersey. Oh my! You should hear Walter tell stories about you."
tr_translation: “As soon as he fell into a difficult situation, you abandoned him. You didn't say a word about him spending a month in a New Jersey prison. My God! If only you could hear what Walter says about you.”
es_translation: —And you left him in the lurch, didn't you? You let him spend a month in the New Jersey jail. Good heavens! You should hear what Walter says about you.

en: “He came to us dead broke. He was very glad to pick up some money, old sport.”
vi: "Lúc anh ta đến kiếm chúng tôi thì anh ta không còn đến một đồng. Anh ta đã kiếm được một chút tiền là mừng lắm rồi, anh bạn già."
tr: “Adam beş parasızken bize yanaştı. Biraz para kazanmak da epey hoşuna gitmişti ahbap.
es: —Vino a nosotros sin un centavo. Se puso muy contento de llevarse algún dinero, compañero.
vi_translation: "When he came to find us, he didn't have a penny left. He had earned a little money and was already very happy, old friend."
tr_translation: “The man approached us when he was penniless. He quite enjoyed earning some money, my friend.”
es_translation: —He came to us without a cent. He was very happy to take some money with him, comrade.

en: “Don’t you call me ‘old sport’!” cried Tom. Gatsby said nothing. “Walter could have you up on the betting laws too, but Wolfshiem scared him into shutting his mouth.”
vi: "Đừng gọi tôi là 'anh bạn già'!" Tom nói to. Gatsby không trả lời. "Walter có thể đưa các anh vào tù về tội đánh cá độ. Thế nhưng Wolfsheim đã hăm dọa anh ta bắt anh ta ngậm miệng."
tr: “Bana ‘ahbap’ deyip durma” diye haykırdı Tom. Gatsby bir şey söylemedi. “Walter bahis oynattığın için başını derde sokacaktı ama Wolfsheim onu tehdit ederek çenesini tutmasını sağladı.
es: —¡No me llame compañero! —gritó Tom. Gatsby no dijo nada—. Walter podría haberlos denunciado por el asunto de las apuestas, pero Wolfshiem le metió miedo para que cerrara la boca.
vi_translation: "Don't call me 'old buddy'!" Tom shouted. Gatsby did not reply. "Walter can put you guys in jail for illegal betting. But Wolfsheim threatened him to keep his mouth shut."
tr_translation: "Stop calling me 'buddy'," Tom shouted. Gatsby didn't say anything. “Walter was going to get into trouble for running bets, but Wolfsheim threatened him to keep his mouth shut.”
es_translation: —Don't call me comrade! —shouted Tom. Gatsby said nothing—. Walter could have reported them for the betting affair, but Wolfshiem scared him into keeping his mouth shut.

en: That unfamiliar yet recognizable look was back again in Gatsby’s face.
vi: Nét mặt không thường thấy nhưng lại dễ nhận ra của Gatsby lại hiện ra trên khuôn mặt của anh.
tr: Gatsby’nin yüzünde yine o alışılmadık ama bildik ifade belirmişti.
es: La cara de Gatsby había recuperado esa expresión suya, extraña y, sin embargo, reconocible.
vi_translation: The unusual but easily recognizable expression of Gatsby appeared on his face again.
tr_translation: That unusual but familiar expression had appeared on Gatsby's face again.
es_translation: Gatsby's face had regained that expression of his, strange and yet recognizable.

en: “That drugstore business was just small change,” continued Tom slowly, “but you’ve got something on now that Walter’s afraid to tell me about.”
vi: "Cái trò ở ở mấy tiệm thuốc chỉ là chuyện vặt. Các anh còn đang dính vào làm một việc gì khác nữa mà Walter còn sợ chưa dám hé lộ nói cho tôi hay."
tr: “Aslında, o eczane işi devede kulaktı” diye konuş­masını sürdürüyordu Tom, “şimdi ne tür bir iş peşindeysen Wolfsheim bana bile söylemekten kaçındı.
es: —El negocio de los drugstores sólo era calderilla —continuó Tom despacio—, pero ahora lleva entre manos algo de lo que Walter no se atreve a hablarme.
vi_translation: "The business at the drugstores is just a trivial matter. You guys are involved in something else that Walter is still too afraid to reveal to me."
tr_translation: “Actually, that pharmacy business was just a drop in the ocean,” Tom continued, “now, whatever kind of business you're after, Wolfsheim even avoided telling me.”
es_translation: —The drugstore business was just small change —Tom continued slowly—, but now he's got something going on that Walter doesn't dare to tell me about.

en: I glanced at Daisy, who was staring terrified between Gatsby and her husband, and at Jordan, who had begun to balance an invisible but absorbing object on the tip of her chin. Then I turned back to Gatsby—and was startled at his expression. He looked—and this is said in all contempt for the babbled slander of his garden—as if he had “killed a man.” For a moment the set of his face could be described in just that fantastic way.
vi: Tôi liếc mắt nhìn Daisy lúc đó đang sợ hãi đứng nhìn vào khoảng giữa Gatsby và chồng. Rồi tôi nhìn sang Jordan, lúc đó đang chơi trò cân bằng một vật vô hình nào đó ở trên cằm của mình. Khi tôi quay lại nhìn Gatsby, tôi cảm thấy ngạc nhiên vì sắc mặt của anh. Anh ta nhìn giống như "vừa mới giết người" - nếu nói theo như những lời vu khống nhảm nhí ở trong vườn nhà anh ta mà tôi đã nghe được một cách khinh miệt. Khi vẻ mặt đó đã biến đi, Gatsby bắt đầu giải thích với Daisy một cách đầy kích động.
tr: Daisy’e baktım. Dehşet dolu gözlerle bir Gatsby’e bir kocasına bakıyordu. Jordan ise tüm dikkatini çenesinde duran hayali cismi dengelemeye vermişti. Bakışlarımı yeniden Gatsby’e çevirdiğimde yüzünde gördüğüm ifade karşısında şaşırıp kaldım. Partilerden birinde bahçede dolanan bir dedikoducunun kullandığı de­yimi kullanayım o halde; ‘birini öldürmüş’ gibiydi. Bir an için yü­zünde gördüğüm şey ancak böyle fantastik bir şekilde tanımlanabilirdi. Yüzü değişti.
es: Observé a Daisy, que clavaba los ojos, aterrada, en Gatsby o en su marido, y a Jordan, que había empezado a mantener en equilibrio sobre el mentón un objeto invisible pero absorbente. Luego me volví hacia Gatsby y me asustó su expresión. Parecía —y lo digo con absoluto desprecio hacia las calumnias que se oían en su jardín— haber matado a alguien. Por un momento la expresión de su cara habría podido ser descrita de ese modo fantástico.
vi_translation: I glanced at Daisy, who was fearfully standing and looking between Gatsby and her husband. Then I looked over at Jordan, who was balancing some invisible object on her chin. When I turned back to look at Gatsby, I was surprised by his expression. He looked like he had "just killed someone" - to use the absurd slanders I had heard with disdain in his garden. When that expression had faded away, Gatsby began to explain to Daisy in an agitated manner.
tr_translation: I looked at Daisy. She was looking at Gatsby and then at her husband with eyes full of terror. Jordan, on the other hand, was focusing all her attention on balancing an imaginary object on her chin. When I turned my gaze back to Gatsby, I was stunned by the expression I saw on his face. Let me use the phrase that a gossiping guest at one of the parties used; 'he looked like he had killed someone.' For a moment, what I saw on his face could only be described in such a fantastical way. His face changed.
es_translation: I observed Daisy, who was staring, terrified, at Gatsby or her husband, and Jordan, who had started to balance an invisible but absorbing object on her chin. Then I turned to Gatsby and was frightened by his expression. He seemed —and I say this with absolute contempt for the slanders heard in his garden— to have killed someone. For a moment, the expression on his face could have been described in that fantastic way.

en: It passed, and he began to talk excitedly to Daisy, denying everything, defending his name against accusations that had not been made. But with every word she was drawing further and further into herself, so he gave that up, and only the dead dream fought on as the afternoon slipped away, trying to touch what was no longer tangible, struggling unhappily, undespairingly, toward that lost voice across the room.
vi: Anh bác bỏ mọi thứ và biện hộ bào chữa cho thanh danh của mình trước những điều vu khống vừa được nhắc tới. Thế nhưng càng nói thì Daisy càng co rút tránh né, cho nên cuối cùng Gatsby đành phải chịu thua, chỉ còn giấc mơ đang dẫy chết của anh là vẫn còn tiếp tục vùng vẫy ráng giữ lại cái buổi chiều tàn đang bắt đầu dần qua, cố đụng vào cái mà đối với anh đã không còn là hiện thực, vùng vẫy một cách đau khổ, không thất vọng về phía cái giọng nói đang mất đi ở phía bên kia căn phòng.
tr: Heyecan içinde Daisy ile konuşmaya başladı. Her şeyi inkar ediyor, suçlanmadığı konularda bile kendini temize çıkarmak için büyük çaba göste­riyordu. Ama ağzından çıkan her kelime ile Daisy gittikçe daha fazla çekiliyordu içine. Ve sonunda vazgeçti. Geriye yalnızca, ilerleyen zamanla birlikte, elinden artık kayıp gitmiş olana dokunmaya çalışan, odanın diğer ucundaki yitik sese doğru mutsuzca, umutsuzca çabalayan ölü hayalinin savaşı kaldı.
es: Pasó ese momento, y Gatsby empezó a hablar con Daisy muy nervioso, negándolo todo, defendiendo su nombre de acusaciones que nadie había hecho. Pero a cada palabra ella iba refugiándose más en sí misma, y Gatsby se rindió, y sólo el sueño muerto siguió su combate mientras la tarde se desvanecía, tratando de alcanzar lo que ya no era tangible, peleando sin fortuna y sin desesperar, buscando la voz perdida al fondo de la habitación.
vi_translation: He dismissed everything and defended his reputation against the slanders that had just been mentioned. However, the more he spoke, the more Daisy recoiled, so in the end, Gatsby had to give up. Only his dying dream continued to struggle, trying to hold onto the fading afternoon, desperately reaching for what was no longer real to him, struggling painfully, not despairing towards the voice that was fading away on the other side of the room.
tr_translation: He started talking to Daisy excitedly. He was denying everything, making great efforts to clear himself even on matters he wasn't accused of. But with every word that came out of his mouth, Daisy retreated further into herself. And finally, he gave up. All that was left was the struggle of a dead dream, desperately and hopelessly trying to touch what had already slipped away with the passing time, towards the lost voice at the other end of the room.
es_translation: That moment passed, and Gatsby began to speak to Daisy very nervously, denying everything, defending his name from accusations that no one had made. But with each word, she retreated further into herself, and Gatsby gave up, and only the dead dream continued its struggle as the afternoon faded, trying to reach what was no longer tangible, fighting without luck and without despair, searching for the lost voice at the back of the room.

en: The voice begged again to go.
vi: Cái giọng nói đó lại nài nĩ muốn về.
tr: O ses bir kez daha gitmek için yalvardı.
es: La voz volvió a suplicar que nos fuéramos.
vi_translation: That voice pleaded to return once more.
tr_translation: The voice pleaded once more to leave.
es_translation: The voice pleaded again for us to leave.

en: “Please, Tom! I can’t stand this any more.”
vi: "LÀM ƠN đi Tom! Em không thể chịu được nữa rồi."
tr: “Lütfen Tom! Daha fazla dayanamayacağım” diye konuştu
es: —¡Por favor, Tom! No aguanto más.
vi_translation: "PLEASE, Tom! I can't take it anymore."
tr_translation: “Please Tom! I can't take it anymore,” she said
es_translation: —Please, Tom! I can't take it anymore.

en: Her frightened eyes told that whatever intentions, whatever courage she had had, were definitely gone.
vi: Đôi mắt đầy hoảng sợ của Daisy cho thấy rằng tất cả những chủ định, hay tất cả những sự dũng cảm mà nàng đã có đều cũng không còn.
tr: Daisy’nin dehşet dolu gözleri, yapmayı istediklerinin ve tüm cesaretinin bir daha gelmemek üzere uçup gittiğini anlatıyordu.
es: Sus ojos asustados decían que todo su valor y todos sus propósitos, hubieran sido los que hubieran sido, habían desaparecido definitivamente.
vi_translation: Daisy's eyes, full of fear, showed that all her intentions or all the courage she once had were now gone.
tr_translation: Daisy's eyes filled with horror told that everything she wanted to do and all her courage had flown away never to return.
es_translation: Her frightened eyes said that all her courage and all her intentions, whatever they might have been, had disappeared definitively.

en: “You two start on home, Daisy,” said Tom. “In Mr. Gatsby’s car.”
vi: "Daisy, hai người đi về nhà đi, đi bằng xe của Gatsby." Tom nói.
tr: “Siz ikiniz yine Bay Gatsby’nin arabasına binin” dedi Tom.
es: —Volved a casa los dos, Daisy —dijo Tom—. En el coche de mister Gatsby.
vi_translation: "Daisy, you two go home, go by Gatsby's car."
tr_translation: "You two get into Mr. Gatsby's car again," said Tom.
es_translation: —Go home with him, Daisy —said Tom—. In Mr. Gatsby's car.

en: She looked at Tom, alarmed now, but he insisted with magnanimous scorn.
vi: "Daisy, hai người đi về nhà đi, đi bằng xe của Gatsby." Tom nói. Daisy nhìn Tom lo lắng, thế nhưng anh ta vẫn nằng nặc nói với giọng điệu ra vẻ khinh miệt cao thượng.
tr: Kadın panik içinde ona baktı, ancak kocası onu küçümseyerek ısrar etti.
es: Daisy miró a Tom, alarmada, pero él insistió con magnánimo desprecio:
vi_translation: Tom said. Daisy looked at Tom worriedly, yet he still insisted on speaking with a tone of lofty contempt.
tr_translation: The woman looked at him in panic, but her husband insisted disdainfully.
es_translation: Daisy looked at Tom, alarmed, but he insisted with magnanimous disdain:

en: “Go on. He won’t annoy you. I think he realizes that his presumptuous little flirtation is over.”
vi: "Đi đi. Anh ta sẽ không làm phiền em đâu. Anh nghĩ anh ta đã nhận thức được rằng cái chuyện tán tỉnh lăng nhăng nhỏ nhặt của anh ta đã bị chấm dứt rồi."
tr: “Haydi git. Seni artık rahatsız etmez. O haddini bilmez flört döneminin kapandığını anlamıştır sanırım.
es: —Adelante. No te molestará. Creo que se ha dado cuenta de que su flirteo ridículo y presuntuoso se ha acabado.
vi_translation: "Go ahead. He won't bother you anymore. I think he has realized that his petty flirtations have come to an end."
tr_translation: “Go on, leave. He won't bother you anymore. I think he has realized that the period of his inappropriate flirting is over.”
es_translation: —Come in. It won't bother you. I think he has realized that his ridiculous and presumptuous flirting is over.

en: They were gone, without a word, snapped out, made accidental, isolated, like ghosts, even from our pity.
