vi: Hai người họ bước ra về, không nói lấy một lời, tan biến nhanh, không phụ thuộc, cách biệt, như những bóng ma ngay trước lòng thương hại của chúng tôi.
tr: İkisi de tek kelime etmeden, parçalanmış, rastgele yapıştırılmış, merhametimizden bile yoksun bırakılmış halde, hayaletler gibi çıkıp gittiler.
es: Se fueron, sin una palabra, excluidos, convertidos en algo insignificante, aislados, como fantasmas, al margen, incluso, de nuestra piedad.
vi_translation: The two of them walked away without saying a word, disappearing quickly, independent, separate, like ghosts right before our pity.
tr_translation: Both of them left like ghosts, without saying a single word, shattered, randomly pieced together, and deprived even of our mercy.
es_translation: They left, without a word, excluded, turned into something insignificant, isolated, like ghosts, on the fringes, even, of our pity.

en: After a moment Tom got up and began wrapping the unopened bottle of whisky in the towel.
vi: Một lát sau Tom đứng lên và bắt đầu cuộn những chai rượu chưa khui lại vào trong chiếc khăn.
tr: Onlar çıktıktan sonra Tom ayağa kalktı, yanında getirdiği açılmamış viski şişesini tekrar havluya sararken bize, “Bundan biraz ister misin Nick? Jordan?” diye sordu
es: Unos minutos después Tom se levantó y empezó a envolver en la toalla la botella de whisky sin abrir.
vi_translation: A moment later, Tom stood up and began wrapping the unopened bottles of wine back into the cloth.
tr_translation: After they left, Tom stood up and, while wrapping the unopened whiskey bottle he had brought with him back in the towel, asked us, "Would you like some of this, Nick? Jordan?"
es_translation: A few minutes later, Tom got up and started wrapping the unopened bottle of whiskey in the towel.

en: I didn’t answer.
vi: Tôi không trả lời.
tr: Yanıt vermedim.
es: No contesté.
vi_translation: I did not answer.
tr_translation: I did not respond.
es_translation: I didn't answer.

en: “Nick?” He asked again.
vi: "Nick?" Anh ta hỏi thêm một lần nữa.
tr: “Nick?” dedi yeniden.
es: —¿Nick? —me preguntó otra vez.
vi_translation: "Nick?" he asked once again.
tr_translation: “Nick?” she said again.
es_translation: —Nick? —she asked me again.

en: “What?”
vi: "Chuyện gì?"
tr: “Ne?
es: —¿Qué?
vi_translation: "What's going on?"
tr_translation: “What?”
es_translation: —What?

en: “Want any?”
vi: "Muốn một chút không?"
tr: “İstiyor musun? “Hayır.
es: —¿Quieres? —No.
vi_translation: "Want a little?"
tr_translation: "Do you want it?" “No.
es_translation: —Do you want? —No.

en: “No… I just remembered that today’s my birthday.”
vi: "Không... Tôi mới sực nhớ ra hôm nay là sinh nhật của tôi."
tr: Biliyor musun şu an doğum günüm oldu­ğunu hatırladım.
es: Acabo de acordarme de que hoy es mi cumpleaños.
vi_translation: "No..." "I just remembered that today is my birthday."
tr_translation: You know, I just remembered that today is my birthday.”
es_translation: I just remembered that today is my birthday.

en: I was thirty. Before me stretched the portentous, menacing road of a new decade.
vi: Tôi được ba mươi tuổi. Phía trước mặt tôi là một con đường trải dài đầy trông gai đe dọa của một thập niên mới.
tr: Otuz olmuştum. Önümde yepyeni, tehlike ve macera dolu bir dönem uzanıyordu.
es: Cumplía treinta. Ante mí se extendía el camino portentoso y amenazador de una nueva década.
vi_translation: I am thirty years old. In front of me is a long road full of the threatening challenges of a new decade.
tr_translation: I had turned thirty. A brand new period full of danger and adventure lay ahead of me.
es_translation: I was turning thirty. Before me stretched the wondrous and threatening path of a new decade.

en: It was seven o’clock when we got into the coupé with him and started for Long Island. Tom talked incessantly, exulting and laughing, but his voice was as remote from Jordan and me as the foreign clamour on the sidewalk or the tumult of the elevated overhead. Human sympathy has its limits, and we were content to let all their tragic arguments fade with the city lights behind. Thirty—the promise of a decade of loneliness, a thinning list of single men to know, a thinning briefcase of enthusiasm, thinning hair. But there was Jordan beside me, who, unlike Daisy, was too wise ever to carry well-forgotten dreams from age to age. As we passed over the dark bridge her wan face fell lazily against my coat’s shoulder and the formidable stroke of thirty died away with the reassuring pressure of her hand.
vi: Khi chúng tôi bước vào trong chiếc xe hai chỗ của anh ta để khởi hành về Long Island thì đã là bẩy giờ tối. Tom nói chuyện hỉ hả và cười đùa một cách không ngừng. Thế nhưng từ chỗ của Jordan và tôi, giọng của anh ta nghe dường như xa xôi, nó giống như tiếng la hét xa lạ ở bên hè phố hay tiếng ồn ào náo động nghe vọng được từ trên cao. Sự thương cảm của con người ta cũng có giới hạn, chúng tôi đã hoan hỉ để cho những sự tranh cãi đau buồn của họ mờ nhạt đi theo cùng với những ánh đèn đường bỏ lại sau lưng. Ba mươi tuổi, một hứa hẹn của một thập niên đầy cô đơn, của một danh sách ngắn dần những người bạn thanh niên còn độc thân, của chiếc cặp đựng nỗi nhiệt tình mỏng dần và của tóc thưa thớt dần. Thế nhưng tôi còn có Jordan ở cạnh bên tôi, không giống như Daisy, người con gái này khôn ngoan hơn, sẽ không bao giờ mang theo mình những giấc mơ đã bị lãng quên từ thời này qua thời khác. Khi xe chúng tôi chạy ngang qua chiếc cầu tối thẫm, khuôn mặt uể oải mệt mỏi của Jordan dựa lên trên vai áo khoác của tôi một cách lười biếng. Và rồi tiếng chuông khủng khiếp đánh báo tuổi ba mươi của tôi cũng đã bị dập chết khi bàn tay của Jordan nắm chặt lấy tôi như cam kết.
tr: Tom’un spor arabasına binip Long Island’a doğru yola çıktığımızda saat yediydi. Sürekli konuşuyor, bir şey­ler anlatıp gülüyordu ama aslında, kaldırımdaki yayaların uğul­tusu ve üstümüzden geçen demiryolundaki trenlerin gürültüsü kadar uzaktı bizden. İnsanın hoşgörüsünün sınırları vardır. Jordan da, ben de onların içler acısı tartışmalarını kentin ışıklarıyla birlikte arkamızda bırakmıştık. Otuzlu yaşlar! Yalnızlık­tan başka bir şey getirmeyen, tanıdığınız bekar erkek sayısının, çalışma arzunuzun ve saçlarınızın gittikçe azaldığı bir on yıl… Ama yanımda, yitirdiği hayalleri Daisy gibi yıllar yılı içinde taşı­mayacak kadar akıllı bir kız olan Jordan vardı. Aydınlatılmamış bir köprüden geçerken başını usulca omzuma dayadı. Otuz yaşın verdiği tüm o bunalım ve korkular avucumda duran eliyle elimi sıkar sıkmaz uçup gitti.
es: Eran las siete cuando nos subimos en el cupé con Tom y salimos hacia Long Island. Tom no paraba de hablar y reír, exultante, pero su voz nos parecía tan remota a Jordan y a mí como el clamar de los extraños en las aceras o el estrépito del tren elevado sobre nuestras cabezas. La compasión tiene sus límites, y nos alegrábamos de que las trágicas discusiones ajenas quedaran atrás y se desvanecieran como las luces de la ciudad. Treinta años: la promesa de una década de soledad, una lista menguante de solteros por conocer, una reserva menguante de entusiasmo, pelo menguante. Pero a mi lado estaba Jordan, que, a diferencia de Daisy, era demasiado lista para arrastrar de una época a otra sueños olvidados. Mientras atravesábamos el puente en penumbra su cara se apoyó pálida y perezosa en la hombrera de mi chaqueta y la presión tranquilizadora de su mano fue calmando el formidable golpe de los treinta años.
vi_translation: When we got into his two-seater car to head to Long Island, it was already seven in the evening. Tom talked cheerfully and laughed continuously. However, from where Jordan and I were sitting, his voice seemed distant, like the strange shouting on the sidewalk or the bustling noise heard from above. Human compassion has its limits; we were happy to let their sorrowful arguments fade away along with the streetlights left behind. Thirty years old, a promise of a decade full of loneliness, of a dwindling list of single young friends, of a briefcase holding thinning enthusiasm, and of thinning hair. But I still had Jordan beside me; unlike Daisy, this girl was wiser and would never carry with her the forgotten dreams from time to time. As our car crossed the dark bridge, Jordan's weary, tired face lazily rested on my coat shoulder. And then the dreadful bell toll marking my thirtieth year was silenced when Jordan's hand gripped mine as a promise.
tr_translation: It was seven o'clock when we got into Tom's sports car and set off towards Long Island. He kept talking, telling stories and laughing, but in reality, he was as distant from us as the hum of pedestrians on the sidewalk and the noise of trains passing over the railway above us. There are limits to human tolerance. Both Jordan and I had left their pathetic arguments behind us along with the city lights. The thirties! A decade that brings nothing but loneliness, where the number of single men you know, your desire to work, and your hair all steadily decrease... But beside me was Jordan, a girl smart enough not to carry her lost dreams within her for years like Daisy. As we crossed an unlit bridge, she gently rested her head on my shoulder. All the turmoil and fears of being thirty vanished the moment she squeezed my hand with hers that lay in my palm.
es_translation: It was seven o'clock when we got into the coupe with Tom and headed towards Long Island. Tom didn't stop talking and laughing, exuberant, but his voice seemed as distant to Jordan and me as the clamor of strangers on the sidewalks or the clatter of the elevated train above our heads. Compassion has its limits, and we were glad that the tragic arguments of others were left behind and faded away like the city lights. Thirty years: the promise of a decade of loneliness, a dwindling list of bachelors to meet, a dwindling reserve of enthusiasm, dwindling hair. But beside me was Jordan, who, unlike Daisy, was too smart to drag forgotten dreams from one era to another. As we crossed the dimly lit bridge, her pale and lazy face rested on the shoulder of my jacket and the reassuring pressure of her hand calmed the formidable blow of thirty years.

en: So we drove on toward death through the cooling twilight.
vi: Và như thế, chúng tôi lái xe đi về hướng thần chết, xuyên qua bóng tối chập choạng đang dịu mát dần.
tr: Serinlemeye başlayan akşamın alacakaranlığında hızla ölüme doğru ilerliyorduk.
es: Así seguimos el viaje hacia la muerte a través del atardecer, que empezaba a refrescar.
vi_translation: And so, we drove towards the direction of death, through the gradually cooling twilight darkness.
tr_translation: In the twilight of the evening that was starting to cool, we were rapidly heading towards death.
es_translation: Thus we continued the journey towards death through the evening, which was beginning to cool down.

en: The young Greek, Michaelis, who ran the coffee joint beside the ash-heaps was the principal witness at the inquest. He had slept through the heat until after five, when he strolled over to the garage, and found George Wilson sick in his office—really sick, pale as his own pale hair and shaking all over. Michaelis advised him to go to bed, but Wilson refused, saying that he’d miss a lot of business if he did. While his neighbour was trying to persuade him a violent racket broke out overhead.
vi: Anh thanh niên Hy Lạp, Michaelis, làm chủ quán cà phê ngay sát bên hông những gò tro là nhân chứng chính yếu của cuộc điều tra. Anh ta đã ngủ suốt lúc trời nóng mãi cho tới năm giờ chiều. Khi anh ta tản bộ tới tiệm sửa xe anh ta gặp Wilson đang bịnh ngồi trong văn phòng. Wilson rất bịnh, khuôn mặt nhợt nhạt như mái tóc nhợt nhạt của anh ta, toàn thân run bần bật. Michaelis khuyên Wilson nên lên giường nghỉ thế nhưng Wilson từ chối, nói rằng làm như vậy anh sẽ mất nhiều khách. Trong khi người hàng xóm đang cố gắng thuyết phục Wilson thì vọng từ trên lầu xuống những tiếng đập phá ồn ào.
tr: Kül yığınlarının yanındaki kahveyi işleten Yunan genç Michaelis soruşturma sırasında dinlenen en önemli tanıktı. O sıcak günü saat beşe kadar uyuyarak geçirmiş, sonra tamirhaneye gitmiş, George Wilson’un çok hasta olduğu­nu görmüştü. Adamcağız berbat durumdaydı. Yüzü, saçları kadar sarıymış ve her yanı titriyormuş. Michaelis yukarı çıkıp yatmasını teklif etmiş ama Wilson kabul etmemiş. Gelen gidenle ilgilenemeyeceği için zarar edeceğini söyle­miş. Michaelis onu razı etmeye çalışırken yukarıdan kor­kunç bir gürültü duyulmuş.
es: Michaelis, el joven griego que regentaba el café que había junto a los montones de cenizas, fue el principal testigo de la investigación. Se había dormido por el calor hasta después de las cinco, luego había dado un paseo hasta el garaje y había encontrado a George Wilson, enfermo en su oficina, verdaderamente enfermo, pálido como su pelo descolorido, y tiritando, temblando. Michaelis le aconsejó que se acostara, pero Wilson no quiso, diciendo que si lo hacía perdería mucho dinero. Mientras su vecino intentaba convencerlo, arriba estalló un violento alboroto.
vi_translation: The young Greek man, Michaelis, who owned a café right next to the ash heaps, was the primary witness of the investigation. He had slept through the heat until five in the afternoon. When he walked to the garage, he found Wilson, who was ill, sitting in the office. Wilson was very ill, his face as pale as his pale hair, his whole body trembling. Michaelis advised Wilson to go to bed and rest, but Wilson refused, saying that doing so would cause him to lose many customers. While the neighbor was trying to persuade Wilson, loud crashing noises came from upstairs.
tr_translation: The Greek young man Michaelis, who ran the coffee shop next to the piles of ash, was the most important witness heard during the investigation. He had spent that hot day sleeping until five o'clock, then went to the repair shop and saw that George Wilson was very sick. The poor man was in terrible condition. His face was as yellow as his hair and he was trembling all over. Michaelis suggested that he go upstairs and lie down, but Wilson refused. He said he would lose money because he couldn't attend to the comings and goings. While Michaelis was trying to persuade him, a terrible noise was heard from upstairs.
es_translation: Michaelis, the young Greek who ran the café next to the heaps of ashes, was the main witness in the investigation. He had fallen asleep due to the heat until after five, then he had taken a walk to the garage and found George Wilson, sick in his office, truly sick, pale like his faded hair, and shivering, trembling. Michaelis advised him to lie down, but Wilson refused, saying that if he did, he would lose a lot of money. While his neighbor tried to convince him, a violent commotion broke out upstairs.

en: “I’ve got my wife locked in up there,” explained Wilson calmly. “She’s going to stay there till the day after tomorrow, and then we’re going to move away.”
vi: "Tôi nhốt vợ của tôi ở trên đó." Wilson trầm tĩnh giải thích. "Tôi tính nhốt cô ta ở trên đó cho tới ngày mốt, sau đó chúng tôi sẽ lên đường dọn đi xa khỏi đây."
tr: “Karımı odaya kilitledim de!” diye açıklamış Wilson sakin bir sesle, “ertesi güne kadar orada kalacak. Sonra da buradan gideceğiz.
es: —Tengo encerrada a mi mujer —explicó Wilson muy tranquilo—. Va a estar ahí hasta pasado mañana. Y ese día nos vamos.
vi_translation: "I locked my wife up there." Wilson calmly explained. "I plan to keep her up there until the day after tomorrow, then we will move far away from here."
tr_translation: “I locked my wife in the room!” Wilson explained in a calm voice, “she will stay there until the next day. Then we will leave this place.”
es_translation: —I have my wife locked up —explained Wilson very calmly—. She will be there until the day after tomorrow. And that day we are leaving.

en: Michaelis was astonished; they had been neighbours for four years, and Wilson had never seemed faintly capable of such a statement. Generally he was one of these worn-out men: when he wasn’t working, he sat on a chair in the doorway and stared at the people and the cars that passed along the road. When anyone spoke to him he invariably laughed in an agreeable, colourless way. He was his wife’s man and not his own.
vi: Michaelis kinh ngạc, họ làm hàng xóm với nhau đã được bốn năm và dường như Wilson chưa bao giờ có khả năng tuyên bố một câu như vậy. Nói chung anh ta là loại người đàn ông bạc nhược, nếu anh ta không làm việc thì anh ta cũng ngồi trên chiếc ghế ở cửa ra vào để nhìn sững vào người và xe qua lại trên đường. Khi nào có ai đó đến chuyện trò thì anh ta lại cười nụ cười lấy lòng nhạt nhẽo cố định. Wilson là loại người nhu nhược sợ vợ.
tr: Michaelis şaşkınmış. Dört yıllık komşunun böyle bir şey yapmak şöyle dursun, söyleyecek bir insan bile olmadığını sanıyormuş. Çalışmadığı zamanlarda kapı önündeki iskemlesine oturup, gelip geçeni seyreden o bezgin adamlardan biriymiş çünkü. Bir şey söylendiğinde hep ruhsuz ve sakin gülüşüyle yanıt verir­miş. Evde baskın olan o değil, karısıymış.
es: Michaelis se quedó asombrado; eran vecinos desde hacía cuatro años, y nunca había creído a Wilson capaz de decir algo como lo que acababa de decir. Habitualmente era uno de esos hombres derrotados: cuando no trabajaba se quedaba sentado en una silla, a la entrada, y miraba a la gente y a los coches que pasaban por la carretera. Si alguien le hablaba, se reía siempre de un modo agradable y cándido. Era de su mujer, no de sí mismo.
vi_translation: Michaelis was astonished; they had been neighbors for four years, and it seemed Wilson had never had the ability to make such a statement. Generally, he was the type of weak-willed man who, if he wasn't working, would sit on the chair at the doorway staring blankly at the people and cars passing by on the street. Whenever someone came to chat, he would give them a fixed, insipid, ingratiating smile. Wilson was the type of man who was weak and afraid of his wife.
tr_translation: Michaelis was astonished. He thought that a neighbor of four years wouldn't even be capable of saying, let alone doing, such a thing. Because he was one of those weary men who would sit on the chair in front of the door and watch people pass by when he wasn't working. Whenever something was said, he would always respond with his soulless and calm smile. It wasn't him who was dominant at home, but his wife.
es_translation: Michaelis was astonished; they had been neighbors for four years, and he had never believed Wilson capable of saying something like what he had just said. Usually, he was one of those defeated men: when he wasn't working, he would sit in a chair at the entrance and watch the people and cars passing by on the road. If someone spoke to him, he would always laugh in a pleasant and naive way. It was about his wife, not about himself.

en: So naturally Michaelis tried to find out what had happened, but Wilson wouldn’t say a word—instead he began to throw curious, suspicious glances at his visitor and ask him what he’d been doing at certain times on certain days. Just as the latter was getting uneasy, some workmen came past the door bound for his restaurant, and Michaelis took the opportunity to get away, intending to come back later. But he didn’t. He supposed he forgot to, that’s all. When he came outside again, a little after seven, he was reminded of the conversation because he heard Mrs. Wilson’s voice, loud and scolding, downstairs in the garage.
vi: Wilson là loại người nhu nhược sợ vợ. Đương nhiên Michaelis cố tìm hiểu xem chuyện gì đã xẩy ra. Thế nhưng Wilson không hề tiết lộ một tiếng, thay vào đó anh ta bắt đầu ném những tia nhìn tò mò nghi ngờ về hướng người hàng xóm của mình và hỏi xem Michaelis đã làm gì, lúc nào trong ngày nào. Khi Michaelis bắt đầu cảm thấy khó chịu thì có vài người thợ đi ngang cửa về hướng tiệm ăn của anh ta. Michaelis nhân cơ hội này bỏ ra về, nhưng mang ý định sẽ quay trở lại. Thế nhưng Michaeilis đã không quay trở lại. Có lẽ anh ta đã quên mất, chỉ vậy thôi. Khi anh ta bước ra ngoài cửa lần nữa, lúc đó khoảng hơn bẩy giờ một chút, anh nghe được tiếng của vợ Wilson quát tháo la mắng ở dưới nhà tiệm sửa xe, nó khiến anh ta sực nhớ lại mảnh đối thoại trước đó với Wilson.
tr: Michaelis aralarında ne geçtiğini öğrenmeye çalışmış haliyle. Ama ağzından tek kelime alamamış. Aksine Wilson merak ve şüpheyle ona bakıp garip sorular sormaya girişmiş. Belli bazı gün ve saatlerde nerede olduğunu ve neler yaptığını sorup duruyormuş. Bu kuşkulu sorgulamadan sıkıldığı halde öfkesine yenik düşmemeye çalışan Michaelis birkaç isçinin lokantasına doğru gittiğini görünce birazdan geleceğini söyleyerek oradan kaçmış. Bir daha da dönmemiş. Herhalde unutup gitmiş. Ama akşamüzeri saat yedi sularında dükkanının önüne çıktığında Wilson’la aralarında geçen konuşma aklına gelmiş. Çünkü öfkeden çılgına dönmüş Bayan Wilson’un kocasını fena halde azarladığını işitmiş.
es: Y, como es natural, Michaelis intentó averiguar qué había sucedido, pero Wilson no decía una palabra y lanzaba sobre su vecino extrañas miradas recelosas y le preguntaba qué había hecho a determinadas horas determinados días. Michaelis empezaba a sentirse molesto cuando pasaron unos trabajadores por la puerta camino del restaurante y aprovechó la oportunidad para irse, con la intención de volver más tarde. Pero no volvió. Cree que se le olvidó. Cuando volvió a salir, poco después de las siete, recordó la conversación porque oyó los gritos indignados de mistress Wilson en la planta baja del garaje.
vi_translation: Of course, Michaelis tried to understand what had happened. However, Wilson did not reveal a word; instead, he started casting suspicious and curious glances towards his neighbor and asked what Michaelis had been doing and at what time on which day. When Michaelis began to feel uncomfortable, a few workers passed by the door heading towards his restaurant. Michaelis took this opportunity to leave, but with the intention of returning. However, Michaelis did not return. Perhaps he simply forgot, that's all. When he stepped outside the door again, it was just past seven o'clock, and he heard Wilson's wife shouting and yelling downstairs at the garage, which reminded him of the earlier conversation with Wilson.
tr_translation: Michaelis naturally tried to find out what had happened between them. But he couldn't get a single word out of him. On the contrary, Wilson looked at him with curiosity and suspicion and started asking strange questions. He kept asking where he was and what he was doing at certain days and times. Although he was tired of this suspicious interrogation, Michaelis, trying not to succumb to his anger, said he would be back soon and escaped when he saw a few workers heading towards a diner. He never returned. He probably forgot all about it. But when he stepped out in front of his shop around seven in the evening, he remembered the conversation he had with Wilson. Because he heard Mrs. Wilson, who had gone mad with rage, severely scolding her husband.
es_translation: And, naturally, Michaelis tried to find out what had happened, but Wilson didn't say a word and cast strange suspicious glances at his neighbor, asking him what he had done at certain hours on certain days. Michaelis was starting to feel annoyed when some workers passed by the door on their way to the restaurant, and he took the opportunity to leave, intending to return later. But he did not return. He thinks he forgot. When he went out again, shortly after seven, he remembered the conversation because he heard Mistress Wilson's indignant shouts on the ground floor of the garage.

en: “Beat me!” he heard her cry. “Throw me down and beat me, you dirty little coward!”
vi: "Đánh tôi đi!" Michaeilis nghe Myrtle la khóc. "Cứ đè tôi xuống mà đánh tôi đi, đồ hèn hạ đê tiện."
tr: “Hadi vur bana” diye bağırıyormuş kadın, “Yerlerde sürükle. Hadi vur da göreyim. Seni ödlek herif!
es: —¡Pégame! —la oyó gritar—. ¡Tírame al suelo y pégame, cobarde asqueroso, miserable!
vi_translation: "Hit me!" Michaelis heard Myrtle crying. "Just pin me down and hit me, you despicable coward."
tr_translation: “Come on, hit me,” the woman was shouting, “Drag me on the ground. Come on, hit me, let's see. You cowardly man!”
es_translation: —Hit me! —he heard her scream—. Throw me to the ground and hit me, you disgusting coward, miserable!

en: A moment later she rushed out into the dusk, waving her hands and shouting—before he could move from his door the business was over.
vi: Khoảng một lát sau, vợ Wilson chạy nhanh ra ngoài vào trong vùng bóng tối, hai tay giơ lên vừa vẫy vừa gọi. Trước khi Michaelis có dịp đi ra khỏi cửa thì chuyện xẩy ra đã xong rồi.
tr: Bir dakika sonra ise kadın kollarını çılgınca sallayıp bağırarak dışarı fırlamış. Adam dükkanından koşup yetişinceye kadar da zaten her şey olup bitmiş.
es: Un momento después se lanzó a la oscuridad de la calle, agitando los brazos y chillando, y antes de que Michaelis pudiera moverse de su puerta todo había terminado.
vi_translation: A moment later, Wilson's wife ran quickly outside into the darkness, waving her hands and calling out. Before Michaelis had a chance to step out the door, it was all over.
tr_translation: One minute later, the woman ran outside, wildly waving her arms and shouting. By the time the man ran from his shop and reached her, everything had already happened.
es_translation: A moment later, she rushed into the darkness of the street, waving her arms and screaming, and before Michaelis could move from his door, it was all over.

en: The “death car” as the newspapers called it, didn’t stop; it came out of the gathering darkness, wavered tragically for a moment, and then disappeared around the next bend. Mavro Michaelis wasn’t even sure of its colour—he told the first policeman that it was light green. The other car, the one going toward New York, came to rest a hundred yards beyond, and its driver hurried back to where Myrtle Wilson, her life violently extinguished, knelt in the road and mingled her thick dark blood with the dust.
vi: "Chiếc xe tử thần." Như những tờ báo đặt tên cho, đã không chịu ngừng, nó phóng ra từ trong bóng tối đang ghép màu, chao động qua lại một cách bi thảm, sau đó biến mất hút khi chạy ngang qua khúc đường quẹo. Michaeils nhìn không chắc lắm màu của chiếc xe, anh ta tường thuật cho người cảng sát đến nơi đầu tiên rằng chiếc xe màu xanh lá cây. Một chiếc xe khác, đang đi về hướng New York, chạy qua khỏi chừng hơn một trăm thước thì ngừng lại, người tài xế chạy vội tới thi thể của Myrtle, lúc đó sự sống đã bị thê thảm dập tắt, nằm quỵ trên mặt đường, trên vũng máu đặc đậm màu hoàn lẫn với lớp bụi đường.
tr: Gazetelerde ‘ölüm aracı’ olarak geçen otomobil, olayın ardından hız kesmeden yoluna devam etmiş. Birkaç metre sonra ne yapacağını bilmez halde duraklar gibi olmuş. Sonra az ilerdeki yola saparak çökmekte olan karanlığa karışıp gözden kaybolmuş. Michaelis arabanın rengini pek seçememiş. Polise verdiği ilk ifadede açık yeşil olduğunu söylemiş. New York yönüne gitmekle olan diğer otomobil birkaç metre ötede durmuş. Sürücüsü, hayatı vahşi bir ölümle son bulan, yolun ortasında diz çökmüş, koyu renkteki kanı toza bulanmış Myrtle Wilson’a doğru koşmuş.
es: El «coche de la muerte», como lo llamaron los periódicos, no paró; salió de la noche cada vez más cerrada, titubeó trágicamente un instante y desapareció en la curva más próxima. Michaelis no estaba seguro del color: al primer policía le dijo que era verde claro. Otro coche, que iba en dirección a Nueva York, se detuvo casi cien metros más allá y su conductor se apresuró a volver donde Myrtle Wilson, después de perder la vida violentamente, había quedado de rodillas en la carretera y mezclaba su sangre espesa y oscura con el polvo.
vi_translation: "The Death Car," as the newspapers dubbed it, did not stop; it shot out from the blending darkness, swerving tragically back and forth, then disappeared as it sped past the curve in the road. Michaeils was not very sure about the color of the car; he reported to the first arriving police officer that the car was green. Another car, heading towards New York, stopped after about a hundred yards, and the driver hurried to Myrtle's body, where life had been tragically snuffed out, lying crumpled on the road, in a pool of thick, dark blood mixed with the dust of the road.
tr_translation: The car, referred to as the ‘death vehicle’ in the newspapers, continued on its way without slowing down after the incident. A few meters later, it seemed to hesitate, not knowing what to do. Then it turned onto a nearby road, blending into the encroaching darkness and disappearing from sight. Michaelis couldn’t quite make out the color of the car. In his initial statement to the police, he said it was light green. The other car heading towards New York had stopped a few meters away. Its driver ran towards Myrtle Wilson, who had met a brutal end in the middle of the road, her dark blood mingling with the dust.
es_translation: The "death car," as the newspapers called it, did not stop; it emerged from the increasingly dark night, tragically hesitated for a moment, and disappeared around the nearest curve. Michaelis was not sure of the color: he told the first policeman that it was light green. Another car, heading towards New York, stopped almost a hundred meters further on, and its driver hurried back to where Myrtle Wilson, after violently losing her life, had ended up kneeling on the road, mixing her thick, dark blood with the dust.

en: Michaelis and this man reached her first, but when they had torn open her shirtwaist, still damp with perspiration, they saw that her left breast was swinging loose like a flap, and there was no need to listen for the heart beneath. The mouth was wide open and ripped a little at the corners, as though she had choked a little in giving up the tremendous vitality she had stored so long.
vi: Michaelis và người đàn ông này là hai người đầu tiên tới bên xác Myrtle, nhưng khi hai người họ xé ngực áo vẫn còn ướt đẫm mồ hôi của cô ta, họ thấy ngực bên trái của cô ta đã rách toang ra trông như chiếc cánh, không cần phải lắng nghe hơi thở dưới lồng ngực. Chiếc miệng mở há hốc, rách hai bên mép, làm như cô ta đã bị mắc ngẹn khi thở trút ra ngoài cái sức sống mãnh liệt mà cô ta đã tàng trữ trong mình từ bao lâu nay.
tr: Kadına ilk ulaşanlar Michaelis ile o adam olmuş. Myrtle’nin ter nedeniyle hala ıslak olan bluzunu yırttıklarında sol göğsünün parçalanıp bir kanat gibi sağa sola sallandığını görmüş. Kalbin atıp atmadığını dinlemeye gerek yokmuş. Açık duran ağzının kenarları, sanki yıllardır bedeninde taşıdığı o büyük enerjinin çıkıp gitmesini durdurmaya çabalarken zorlanmış gibi yırtılmış.
es: Ese hombre y Michaelis llegaron los primeros, pero cuando le rompieron y abrieron la blusa, todavía húmeda de sudor, vieron que el pecho izquierdo, suelto, se movía como un colgajo, y no era necesario intentar oír los latidos del corazón. La boca se le había abierto de par en par, con las comisuras ligeramente desgarradas, como si le hubiera resultado traumático liberar la tremenda vitalidad que había acumulado durante tanto tiempo.
vi_translation: Michaelis and this man were the first two to reach Myrtle's body, but when they tore open her sweat-drenched shirt, they saw that her left chest had been torn open like a wing, making it unnecessary to listen for breath beneath her ribcage. Her mouth was wide open, torn at the corners, as if she had choked while expelling the fierce vitality she had stored within herself for so long.
tr_translation: The first to reach the woman were Michaelis and that man. When they tore Myrtle's blouse, still wet with sweat, they saw her left breast torn and flapping like a wing. There was no need to listen to see if her heart was beating. The corners of her open mouth were torn, as if struggling to stop the great energy she had carried in her body for years from escaping.
es_translation: That man and Michaelis arrived first, but when they tore open her blouse, still damp with sweat, they saw that her left breast, loose, moved like a flap, and it was unnecessary to try to hear the heartbeat. Her mouth had opened wide, with the corners slightly torn, as if it had been traumatic for her to release the tremendous vitality she had accumulated for so long.

en: We saw the three or four automobiles and the crowd when we were still some distance away.
vi: Chúng tôi trông thấy có khoảng ba hay bốn chiếc xe đang đậu và một đám đông khi chúng tôi vẫn còn cách một khoảng xa.
tr: Olay yerine yaklaşırken yolun kenarına park etmiş üç dört otomobili ve toplanan kalabalığı hemen fark ettik.
es: Vimos a los tres o cuatro automóviles y al grupo de gente cuando todavía estábamos a cierta distancia.
vi_translation: We saw about three or four cars parked and a crowd when we were still some distance away.
tr_translation: As we approached the scene, we immediately noticed three or four cars parked on the side of the road and the gathered crowd.
es_translation: We saw the three or four cars and the group of people when we were still at a certain distance.

en: “Wreck!” said Tom. “That’s good. Wilson’ll have a little business at last.”
vi: "Đụng xe." Tom nói. "Như vậy tốt lắm. Cuối cùng Wilson sẽ có chút việc để làm."
tr: “Enkaz var” dedi Tom, “Wilson’a iş çıkmış bari neyse.
es: —¡Un accidente! —dijo Tom—. Eso es bueno. Por fin Wilson tendrá algo de trabajo.
vi_translation: "Car crash." Tom said. "That's good." "Finally, Wilson will have something to do."
tr_translation: “There is rubble,” said Tom, “at least Wilson has some work to do.”
es_translation: —An accident! —said Tom—. That's good. Finally, Wilson will have some work.

en: He slowed down, but still without any intention of stopping, until, as we came nearer, the hushed, intent faces of the people at the garage door made him automatically put on the brakes.
vi: Tom cho xe chạy chậm lại nhưng không có ý định ngừng cho tới khi chúng tôi tiến lại gần hơn, những khuôn mặt đầy im lặng căng thẳng của những người đứng ở cửa tiệm sửa xe lập tức khiến anh ta đạp thắng.
tr: Yavaşlamıştık ama tamirhanenin kapısında duranların sessizliği ve yüzlerindeki ifadeyi fark edene kadar Tom’un durmaya pek niyeti yoktu. Durumu görür görmez frene bastı.
es: Disminuyó la velocidad, aunque aún no tenía intención de detenerse, hasta que, más cerca, las caras enmudecidas y reconcentradas de la gente en la puerta del garaje lo obligaron a frenar automáticamente.
vi_translation: Tom slowed the car down but had no intention of stopping until we got closer; the tense, silent faces of the people standing at the garage door immediately made him hit the brakes.
tr_translation: We had slowed down, but Tom had no intention of stopping until he noticed the silence and the expressions on the faces of those standing at the door of the repair shop. As soon as he saw the situation, he hit the brakes.
es_translation: He slowed down, although he still had no intention of stopping, until, closer, the muted and concentrated faces of the people at the garage door forced him to brake automatically.

en: “We’ll take a look,” he said doubtfully, “just a look.”
vi: "Chúng ta vào xem thử," Tom nói giọng nghi ngờ. "Chỉ nhìn thôi."
tr: “Gidip bir bakalım” dedi biraz duraksayarak “hemen döneriz.
es: —Vamos a echar un vistazo —dijo, inseguro—, sólo un vistazo.
vi_translation: "Let's go in and take a look," Tom said doubtfully. "Just to look."
tr_translation: "Let's go and see," he said, pausing a little, "we'll be right back."
es_translation: —Let's take a look —he said, unsure—, just a look.

en: I became aware now of a hollow, wailing sound which issued incessantly from the garage, a sound which as we got out of the coupé and walked toward the door resolved itself into the words “Oh, my God!” uttered over and over in a gasping moan.
vi: Tôi bắt đầu nhận ra âm thanh than khóc ồm ồm không dứt phát ra từ tiệm sửa xe, khi chúng tôi bước ra khỏi chiếc xe c úp để đi về phía cánh cửa thì âm thanh này biến trở thành những lời rên rỉ hổn hển "Trời ơi" lập đi lập lại.
tr: Tamirhanede yankılanan ağlamaya benzer bir ses geliyordu kulağıma. Arabadan inip kapıya doğru yürürken, hiç kesilmeyen iniltiler sürekli yinelenen “Aman Tanrım!” sözcüklerine dönüştü.
es: Tomé conciencia en ese momento de un sonido sordo y quejumbroso que brotaba sin cesar del garaje, un sonido que, cuando nos bajamos del cupé y nos acercábamos a la puerta, se convirtió en las palabras «Dios mío, Dios mío», susurradas una y otra vez en una especie de estertor.
vi_translation: I began to notice the continuous, hoarse sound of crying coming from the repair shop as we stepped out of the car as I moved towards the door, this sound transformed into gasping moans of "Oh my God" repeated over and over.
tr_translation: I could hear a sound similar to crying echoing in the workshop. As I got out of the car and walked towards the door, the incessant moans turned into the repeatedly uttered words "Oh my God!"
es_translation: I became aware at that moment of a dull, plaintive sound that was incessantly emanating from the garage, a sound that, as we got out of the coupe and approached the door, turned into the words "My God, my God," whispered over and over in a kind of death rattle.

en: “There’s some bad trouble here,” said Tom excitedly.
vi: "Có chuyện không lành xẩy ra ở đây." Tom kích động.
tr: “Burada kötü şeyler olmuş!” dedi Tom heyecan içinde.
es: —Aquí ha pasado algo grave —dijo Tom, preocupado.
vi_translation: "Something bad is happening here." Tom said excitedly.
tr_translation: "Bad things have happened here!" said Tom excitedly.
es_translation: —Something serious has happened here —said Tom, worried.

en: He reached up on tiptoes and peered over a circle of heads into the garage, which was lit only by a yellow light in a swinging metal basket overhead. Then he made a harsh sound in his throat, and with a violent thrusting movement of his powerful arms pushed his way through.
vi: Anh ta nhón chân nhìn qua đầu đám đông vào trong tiệm sửa xe, lúc đó chỉ được thắp sáng bằng ánh đèn vàng heo hắt đặt bên trong chiếc rổ kẽm treo tòng teng trên đầu. Tom thốt lên một tiếng cục cằn trong cổ họng và hùng hổ dùng hai cánh tay lực lưỡng của mình gạt mạnh đám đông dạt sang để bước tới.
tr: Parmak uçlarında yükselerek insan başlarından oluşan daire üzerinden, sarkıtılmış tel bir sepet içindeki sarı ışıkla aydınlatılan tamirhaneye baktı. Göğsünün derinliklerinden acı dolu bir ses çıkardı ve güçlü kollarıyla kalabalığı sağa sola iterek içeri daldı.
es: Se puso de puntillas para mirar por encima de un círculo de cabezas el interior del garaje, iluminado por una solitaria luz amarilla que, protegida por una rejilla metálica, pendía del techo. Su garganta emitió entonces un sonido ronco y, a empujones, se abrió paso con la potencia de sus brazos.
vi_translation: He stood on tiptoe to look over the heads of the crowd into the repair shop, which was only dimly lit by a yellow light placed inside a zinc basket hanging loosely overhead. Tom let out a gruff sound from his throat and forcefully used his muscular arms to push the crowd aside to step forward.
tr_translation: He looked at the workshop illuminated by the yellow light inside a hanging wire basket, rising on his tiptoes over the circle of human heads. He let out a painful sound from the depths of his chest and pushed the crowd aside with his strong arms, diving inside.
es_translation: She stood on tiptoe to look over a circle of heads into the garage's interior, illuminated by a solitary yellow light that, protected by a metal grille, hung from the ceiling. Her throat then emitted a hoarse sound, and, shoving, she made her way through with the strength of her arms.

en: The circle closed up again with a running murmur of expostulation; it was a minute before I could see anything at all. Then new arrivals deranged the line, and Jordan and I were pushed suddenly inside.
vi: Vòng tròn đám đông lại đóng khép lại ngay lập tức với những tiếng xì xào phê bình nhận xét, phải mất đến khoảng một phút tôi mới có thể nhìn thấy rõ mọi việc. Sau đó những người mới tới lại làm xáo trộn đám người, tôi và Jordan đột nhiên bị đẩy vào bên trong.
tr: O geçtikten sonra, insanlar eleştiri dolu homurtularla eski yerlerini aldıkları için benim bir şeyler görebilmem zaman aldı. Ancak etraftan gelenlerle birlikte ortalık ha­reketlenince Jordan’la kendimizi içeri itilmiş bulduk.
es: El círculo volvió a cerrarse entre un enérgico murmullo de protesta y por un momento no pude ver nada. Luego llegó más gente, se rompió la fila y, de pronto, a Jordan y a mí nos empujaron al interior.
vi_translation: The circle of the crowd immediately closed up again with murmurs of criticism and comments, and it took me about a minute to see everything clearly. Then the newcomers disturbed the crowd again, and Jordan and I were suddenly pushed inside.
tr_translation: After he passed, it took me some time to see anything because people had resumed their old places with murmurs full of criticism. However, as the surroundings became more lively with the newcomers, Jordan and I found ourselves pushed inside.
es_translation: The circle closed again with an energetic murmur of protest and for a moment I couldn't see anything. Then more people arrived, the line broke, and suddenly, Jordan and I were pushed inside.

en: Myrtle Wilson’s body, wrapped in a blanket, and then in another blanket, as though she suffered from a chill in the hot night, lay on a worktable by the wall, and Tom, with his back to us, was bending over it, motionless. Next to him stood a motorcycle policeman taking down names with much sweat and correction in a little book. At first I couldn’t find the source of the high, groaning words that echoed clamorously through the bare garage—then I saw Wilson standing on the raised threshold of his office, swaying back and forth and holding to the doorposts with both hands. Some man was talking to him in a low voice and attempting, from time to time, to lay a hand on his shoulder, but Wilson neither heard nor saw. His eyes would drop slowly from the swinging light to the laden table by the wall, and then jerk back to the light again, and he gave out incessantly his high, horrible call:
vi: Xác của Myrthle Wilson được gói bên trong một tấm mền, bên ngoài gói thêm một tấm mền khác làm như cô ta đang trải qua một cơn lạnh trong một buổi tối nóng nực. Xác được đặt lên trên chiếc bàn làm việc ở cạnh tường. Tom lúc đó đang quay lưng lại phía chúng tôi, cúi người tới phía trước, không di động. Bên cạnh anh ta là một cảnh sát lái xe mô tô đang ghi tên vào trong một quyển sồ nhỏ một cách cực khổ, mồ hôi đầm đìa gạch xóa tới lui. Lúc đầu tôi không làm sao xác định được những tiếng rên rỉ cao bổng lúc đó đang vang vọng ầm ĩ trong cái nhà xe trống là của ai, sau đó tôi mới nhận ra Wilson đang đứng trên bậc cử gian phòng giấy của mình, lắc lư qua lại, cả hai tay đang cầm nắm lấy trụ cửa. Một người đàn ông nào đó đang nói chuyện nhỏ giọng với Wilson và thỉnh thoảng đưa tay đặt lên vai anh ta, thế nhưng Wilson dường như không hề nghe hay thấy gì cả. Cặp mắt của anh ta cứ chậm rãi đảo nhìn hết nhìn từ chiếc đèn đong đưa cho tới chiếc bàn nặng trĩu bên cạnh tường sau đó lại quay về chiếc đèn, anh ta không ngớt thốt lên những tiếng kêu la lanh lảnh thê lương:
tr: Myrtie Wilson’un cesedi, sıcak geceye rağmen üşüyormuş gi­bi iki kat battaniyeye sarılmış, duvara dayalı bü­yük tezgahın üzerinde yatıyor, arkası bize dönük olan Tom ise onun üzerine eğilmiş öylece duruyordu. Yanındaki motosikletli polis ter içinde elindeki deftere birtakım notlar alıyor, yanlış yazdıklarını düzeltmek için büyük çaba har­cıyordu. İlk girdiğimde eşyasız, çıplak tamirhanede yankılanan ağıtların kaynağını bulamamıştım. Sonra yazıhane olarak kullanılan yerin yüksek eşiğinde kapının iki yanına tutu­narak ileri geri sallanıp duran Wilson’u gördüm. Yanında, onu teselli etmeye çalışan ve arada elini omzuna koyan bir adam duruyordu. Wilson onu ne görüyor, ne de duyuyordu. Gözlerini tepedeki lambadan duvar dibindeki masaya çeviriyor, sonra birden yine lambaya bakıyor, o korkunç inlemesi ortalığı çınlatıyordu.
es: El cuerpo de Myrtle Wilson, cubierto por una manta sobre la que habían echado otra manta, como si hubiera sentido frío aquella noche de calor, yacía sobre una mesa de trabajo, junto a la pared, y Tom, dándonos la espalda, se inclinaba sobre él, inmóvil. A su lado un policía de tráfico, sudando y corrigiendo mucho, apuntaba nombres en un cuaderno. Al principio no podía localizar la fuente de las palabras y los gemidos agudos que resonaban clamorosamente en el garaje sin muebles, y luego vi a Wilson, en el umbral de su oficina, de pie en el único escalón, bamboleándose, agarrado a las jambas de la puerta con las dos manos. Un hombre le hablaba en voz baja y, de vez en cuando, intentaba ponerle una mano en el hombro, pero Wilson ni oía ni veía. Bajaba muy despacio los ojos, de la luz que pendía del techo a la mesa y su carga junto a la pared, para volver con un espasmo a la luz, sin dejar de emitir nunca su grito agudo y terrible:
vi_translation: The body of Myrtle Wilson was wrapped inside a blanket, with an additional blanket outside, as if she were experiencing a chill on a hot evening. The body was placed on the work table by the wall. Tom was then turning his back to us, leaning forward, motionless. Beside him was a motorcycle policeman, laboriously writing a name into a small notebook, sweating profusely and crossing out repeatedly. At first, I couldn't identify whose high-pitched groans were echoing loudly in the empty garage, but then I realized Wilson was standing on the step of his office, swaying back and forth, gripping the doorpost with both hands. A man was speaking softly to Wilson and occasionally placing a hand on his shoulder, but Wilson seemed neither to hear nor see anything. His eyes slowly roved from the swaying lamp to the heavy table by the wall and then back to the lamp, continuously uttering shrill, mournful cries:
tr_translation: Myrtie Wilson's body, wrapped in two blankets as if she were cold despite the warm night, was lying on the large counter against the wall, and Tom, who had his back to us, was leaning over her, standing still. The motorcycle policeman next to him was taking notes in his notebook, sweating profusely and making a great effort to correct his mistakes. When I first entered, I couldn't find the source of the wailing that echoed in the empty, bare repair shop. Then I saw Wilson, swaying back and forth, holding onto either side of the door at the high threshold of the place used as an office. Next to him stood a man trying to console him, occasionally placing his hand on Wilson's shoulder. Wilson neither saw nor heard him. He would shift his gaze from the lamp above to the table against the wall, then suddenly look back at the lamp again, his terrible moaning echoing through the place.
es_translation: The body of Myrtle Wilson, covered by a blanket over which another blanket had been thrown, as if she had felt cold that hot night, lay on a worktable, next to the wall, and Tom, with his back to us, was leaning over it, motionless. Beside him, a traffic policeman, sweating and making many corrections, was jotting down names in a notebook. At first, I couldn't locate the source of the words and the sharp wails that echoed loudly in the unfurnished garage, and then I saw Wilson, in the doorway of his office, standing on the only step, swaying, clutching the door jambs with both hands. A man was speaking to him in a low voice and, from time to time, tried to put a hand on his shoulder, but Wilson neither heard nor saw. He very slowly lowered his eyes, from the light hanging from the ceiling to the table and its burden next to the wall, only to return with a spasm to the light, without ever ceasing his sharp and terrible cry:

en: “Oh, my Ga-od! Oh, my Ga-od! Oh, Ga-od! Oh, my Ga-od!”
vi: "Trời ơi, ối trờ.... i ơi! ối trờ.... i ơi! ối trờ.... i ơi!"
tr: Durmadan ‘Ah. Tanrım! Aman Tanrım! Ah Tanrım! Tanrım!’ diyordu.
es: —¡Dios mío! ¡Dios mío! ¡Dios mío!
vi_translation: "Oh my God, oh my.... God! oh my.... God! oh my.... God!"
tr_translation: He kept saying, 'Oh. God! Oh my God! Oh God! God!’
es_translation: —My God! My God! My God!

en: Presently Tom lifted his head with a jerk and, after staring around the garage with glazed eyes, addressed a mumbled incoherent remark to the policeman.
vi: Ngay lúc đó Tom quay ngoắt ngửng đầu lên, nhìn chòng chọc chung quanh nhà xe bằng đôi mắt đờ đẫn sau đó lầm bầm nói gì đó với người cảnh sát nghe không rõ.
tr: Bir ara Tom başını kaldırıp donuk bakışlarını etrafta dolaş­tırdı. Sonra polise dönerek bir şeyler geveledi.
es: De pronto, como sobresaltado, Tom levantó la cabeza y, después de recorrer el garaje con una mirada vidriosa, le masculló algo incoherente al policía.
vi_translation: At that moment, Tom abruptly lifted his head, staring around the garage with vacant eyes, then mumbled something to the police officer that was inaudible.
tr_translation: At one point, Tom lifted his head and cast his vacant gaze around. Then he turned to the police and mumbled something.
es_translation: Suddenly, as if startled, Tom lifted his head and, after scanning the garage with a glassy gaze, mumbled something incoherent to the policeman.

en: “M-a-v—” the policeman was saying, “—o—”
vi: "M-a-y." Người cảnh sát nói, "-o
tr: “M-a-v”, diyordu polis. “o…
es: —Eme, a, uve… —decía el policía en ese momento—, o…
vi_translation: "M-a-y." The policeman said, "-o-"
tr_translation: “M-a-v,” said the policeman. “h…”
es_translation: —E, m, a, v... —said the policeman at that moment—, o...

en: “No, r—” corrected the man, “M-a-v-r-o—”
vi: "Không, r-" người cảnh sát nói sửa lại, "M-a-v-r-o-"
tr: “o… “Hayır, arada ‘r’ var” diye düzeltti biri, “M-a-v-r-o-”
es: —No, erre… —corrigió el hombre—. Eme, a, uve, erre, o…
vi_translation: "No, r-" the police officer corrected himself, "M-a-v-r-o-"
tr_translation: "No, there's an 'r' in between," someone corrected, "M-a-v-r-o-"
es_translation: —No, it's erre… —corrected the man—. E, m, a, r, r, o…

en: “Listen to me!” muttered Tom fiercely.
vi: "Nghe tôi hỏi đây!" Tom càu nhàu một cách hung dữ.
tr: “Beni dinleyin” dedi Tom öfkeyle.
es: —¡Présteme atención! —murmuró Tom, feroz.
vi_translation: "Listen to me!" Tom growled fiercely.
tr_translation: "Listen to me," said Tom angrily.
es_translation: —Pay attention to me! —murmured Tom, fiercely.

en: “r—” said the policeman, “o—”
vi: "r" người cảnh sát nói, "o-"
tr: “-r” dedi polis, “o”
es: —erre… —dijo el policía—, o…
vi_translation: "r" the policeman said, "o-"
tr_translation: “-r” said the police, “o”
es_translation: —uh… —said the policeman—, or…

en: “g—” He looked up as Tom’s broad hand fell sharply on his shoulder. “What you want, fella?”
vi: "g-" Anh ta ngẩng nhìn lên khi bàn tay to bè của Tom đặt mạnh trên vai của anh ta. "Anh cần gì, anh bạn?" "Chuyện gì đã xẩy ra?
tr: “g” diyordu Tom’un koca eli omzuna indiğinde. “Siz ne istiyorsunuz bayım?
es: —ge… —alzó la mirada cuando la ancha mano de Tom cayó de repente sobre su hombro—. ¿Qué quiere, amigo?
vi_translation: "W-" He looked up when Tom's large hand clapped heavily on his shoulder. "What do you need, buddy?" "What happened?"
tr_translation: “G” he said as Tom's big hand landed on his shoulder. “What do you want, sir?”
es_translation: —Wh… —he looked up when Tom's broad hand suddenly fell on his shoulder—. What do you want, friend?

en: “What happened?—that’s what I want to know.”
vi: Đó là cái tôi muốn biết."
tr: “Ne oldu? Onu bilmek istiyorum.
es: —¿Qué ha pasado? Eso es lo quiero saber.
vi_translation: "That's what I want to know."
tr_translation: "What happened? I want to know that."
es_translation: —What happened? That's what I want to know.

en: “Auto hit her. Ins’antly killed.”
vi: "Xe đụng cô ta. Chết ngay tức khắc."
tr: “Araba çarpmış. Anında ölmüş.
es: —La pilló un coche. La mató en el acto.
vi_translation: "The car hit her. She died instantly."
tr_translation: “A car hit him. He died instantly.”
es_translation: —A car hit her. It killed her instantly.

en: “Instantly killed,” repeated Tom, staring.
vi: "Chết ngay tức khắc." Tom lập lại, mắt nhìn trừng trừng.
tr: Anında ölmüş. “Anında ölmüş” dedi Tom, masaya bakarak.
es: —La mató en el acto —repitió Tom, con la mirada perdida.
vi_translation: "Instant death." Tom repeated, staring intently.
tr_translation: “He died instantly,” said Tom, looking at the table.
es_translation: —He killed her on the spot —repeated Tom, with a distant look.

en: “She ran out ina road. Son-of-a-bitch didn’t even stopus car.”
vi: "Cô ta chạy ra ngoài đường, Tên khốn nạn không hề ngừng xe lại."
tr: “Kadın aniden yola fırlamış. Çarpan o… çocuğu durmadan çekip gitmiş.
es: —Salió corriendo a la carretera. Ese hijo de puta ni siquiera paró el coche.
vi_translation: "She ran out onto the street, The bastard didn't stop the car at all."
tr_translation: “The woman suddenly jumped onto the road. The one who hit… pulled the child and left without stopping.”
es_translation: —He ran out onto the road. That son of a bitch didn't even stop the car.

en: “There was two cars,” said Michaelis, “one comin’, one goin’, see?”
vi: "Có hai chiếc xe tất cả." Michaelis nói. "Một chiếc chạy tới một chiếc chạy đi, hiểu chứ?"
tr: “İki araba vardı” diyordu Michaelis, “Biri geliyor öteki gidiyordu, anladınız mı?
es: —Había dos coches —dijo Michaelis—. Uno que iba y otro que venía, ¿me entiende?
vi_translation: "There were two cars in all." Michaelis said. "One coming, one going, understand?"
tr_translation: “There were two cars,” said Michaelis, “One was coming and the other was going, do you understand?”
es_translation: —There were two cars —said Michaelis—. One was going and the other was coming, do you understand?

en: “Going where?” asked the policeman keenly.
vi: "Chạy đi đâu?" Người cảnh sát hỏi một cách sôi nổi.
tr: “Nereye gidiyorlardı?” dedi polis ilgiyle.
es: —¿Qué iba adónde? —preguntó el policía con mucho interés.
vi_translation: "Where are you running to?" the police officer asked enthusiastically.
tr_translation: “Where were they going?” said the police with interest.
es_translation: —Where was I going? —asked the police officer with great interest.

en: “One goin’ each way. Well, she”—his hand rose toward the blankets but stopped halfway and fell to his side—“she ran out there an’ the one comin’ from N’York knock right into her, goin’ thirty or forty miles an hour.”
vi: "Mỗi chiếc đi mỗi hướng. Cô ta.." Michaelis giơ tay chỉ về hướng chiếc mền thế nhưng cánh tay mới giơ được nửa đường thì buông thỏng xuống bên hông. "Cô ta chạy ra ngoài. Chiếc xe chạy từ hướng New York tới đụng ngay vào cô ta, chiếc xe lúc đó chạy khoảng ba mươi hay bốn mươi dặm một giờ."
tr: “İkisi ayrı yöne gidiyordu. Kadın…” eliyle battaniye yığınını gösterecekken vazgeçti, “garajdan fırladı ve New York yönünden gelen araba ona çarptı. Elli ya da altmışla gidiyordu.
es: —Cada uno en una dirección. Bueno, ella… —la mano se levantó hacia las mantas pero se detuvo a medio camino y volvió a caer a lo largo del costado—. Ella salió corriendo y el coche que venía de Nueva York le dio de lleno. Iba a cincuenta o sesenta kilómetros por hora.
vi_translation: "Each one went in a different direction." “She...” Michaelis raised his hand to point towards the blanket, but his arm fell to his side halfway through the motion. "She ran outside." "The car coming from New York hit her, it was going about thirty or forty miles an hour at the time."
tr_translation: “They were going in separate directions. The woman…” she was about to point to the pile of blankets but changed her mind, “darted out of the garage and the car coming from the direction of New York hit her. It was going at fifty or sixty.”
es_translation: —Each one in a different direction. Well, she… —the hand lifted towards the blankets but stopped halfway and fell back to her side—. She ran out and the car coming from New York hit her directly. It was going fifty or sixty kilometers per hour.

en: “What’s the name of this place here?” demanded the officer.
vi: "Chỗ này có tên là gì?" Viên cảnh sát hỏi.
tr: “Buranın adı ne?” diye sordu Polis.
es: —¿Cómo se llama este sitio? —preguntó el agente.
vi_translation: "What is this place called?" the police officer asked.
tr_translation: "What is this place called?" asked the Police.
es_translation: —What is this place called? —asked the agent.

en: “Hasn’t got any name.”
vi: "Không có tên gì cả."
tr: “Adı filan yok”
es: —No tiene nombre.
vi_translation: "No name at all."
tr_translation: "It has no name"
es_translation: —It has no name.

en: A pale well-dressed negro stepped near.
vi: Một người da đen ăn mặc chỉnh tề xanh xao bước lại gần.
tr: Soluk tenli, iyi giyimli bir zenci yanlarına sokuldu.
es: Se acercó un negro pálido, bien vestido.
vi_translation: A well-dressed black man, looking pale, approached.
tr_translation: A pale-skinned, well-dressed black man approached them.
es_translation: A pale black man, well-dressed, approached.

en: “It was a yellow car,” he said, “big yellow car. New.”
vi: Anh ta nói. "Chiếc xe màu vàng. Chiếc xe bự màu vàng. Còn mới.
tr: “Sarı bir otomobildi” dedi. “Kocaman sarı bir araba. Yepyeni.
es: —Era un coche amarillo —dijo—, amarillo y grande. Nuevo.
vi_translation: He spoke. "The yellow car. The big yellow car. Still new. "
tr_translation: “It was a yellow car,” he said. “A huge yellow car. Brand new.”
es_translation: —It was a yellow car —he said—, yellow and big. New.

en: “See the accident?” asked the policeman.
vi: "Có chứng kiến tai nạn không?" Người cảnh sát hỏi.
tr: “Kazayı gördün mü?” diye sordu polis.
es: —¿Vio usted el accidente? —preguntó el policía.
vi_translation: "Did you witness the accident?" the police officer asked.
tr_translation: "Did you see the accident?" asked the police.
es_translation: —Did you see the accident? —asked the police officer.

en: “No, but the car passed me down the road, going faster’n forty. Going fifty, sixty.”
vi: "Không, nhưng chiếc xe chạy ngang qua tôi khúc cuối đường, chạy nhanh hơn bốn mươi dặm. Khoảng năm mươi, sáu mươi."
tr: “Hayır, ama yolun aşağısında yanımdan hızla geçti. Elli altmış filan değil yetmiş-seksen kilometre vardı hızı.
es: —No, pero el coche pasó a mi lado en la carretera. Iba a más de sesenta. Iba a ochenta o noventa.
vi_translation: "No, but the car passed by me at the end of the road, going faster than forty miles. Around fifty, sixty."
tr_translation: “No, but it sped past me down the road. It wasn't fifty or sixty, it was seventy or eighty kilometers per hour.”
es_translation: —No, but the car passed by me on the road. It was going over sixty. It was going eighty or ninety.

en: “Come here and let’s have your name. Look out now. I want to get his name.”
vi: "Mời qua đây để tôi ghi tên anh. Tránh ra. Tôi muốn ghi tên anh ta."
tr: “Şöyle gelin, adınızı alayım. Dikkatli olun. Adamın adını öğrenmeye çalışıyorum.
es: —Venga y dígame su nombre. Ahora, silencio. Quiero apuntar su nombre.
vi_translation: "Come over here so I can write down your name." "Move aside." "I want to write down his name."
tr_translation: "Come this way, let me take your name. Be careful. I'm trying to learn the man's name."
es_translation: —Come and tell me your name. Now, silence. I want to write down your name.

en: Some words of this conversation must have reached Wilson, swaying in the office door, for suddenly a new theme found voice among his grasping cries:
vi: Chắc hẳn phần nào những lời đối thoại này đã lọt vào tai Wilson lúc đó đang lắc lư phía sau cánh cửa của phòng giấy, bởi vì ngay sau đó giọng than khóc của anh đã bắt đầu mang giọng điệu mới.
tr: Bu konuşmada geçen bazı sözler yazıhanenin kapısında sallanıp duran Wilson’un kulağına gitmiş olmalıydı. Ağıtı kesti.
es: Algunas palabras de la conversación debieron de llegarle a Wilson, que se bamboleaba en la puerta de la oficina, porque de repente un nuevo tema cobró voz entre sus gritos gemebundos.
vi_translation: Surely some of these conversations must have reached Wilson's ears as he was swaying behind the office door, because right after that his crying took on a new tone.
tr_translation: Some of the words spoken in this conversation must have reached Wilson's ears, who was hanging around the office door. He stopped his lament.
es_translation: Some words from the conversation must have reached Wilson, who was swaying in the office doorway, because suddenly a new topic found voice among his moaning shouts.

en: “You don’t have to tell me what kind of car it was! I know what kind of car it was!”
vi: "Không cần nói cho tôi xe đó là loại xe gì. Bởi vì tôi biết nó là loại xe gì."
tr: “Nasıl bir araba olduğunu söylemene gerek yok. Ben biliyorum onu!” diye seslendi.
es: —¡No hace falta que me diga cómo era el coche! ¡Sé cómo era!
vi_translation: "No need to tell me what kind of car that is. Because I know what kind of car it is."
tr_translation: "You don't need to tell me what kind of car it is. I know it!" he shouted.
es_translation: —You don't need to tell me what the car was like! I know what it was like!

en: Watching Tom, I saw the wad of muscle back of his shoulder tighten under his coat. He walked quickly over to Wilson and, standing in front of him, seized him firmly by the upper arms.
vi: Quan sát Tom, tôi thấy mảng bắp thịt phía sau của anh ta đang gồng cứng lên dưới lớp áo khoác. Anh ta bước nhanh tới phía Wilson, đứng chắn ngay trước mặt Wilson, dùng hai cánh tay xiết chặt lấy anh ta.
tr: Tom’a baktım, ceketinin altından sırt kaslarının gerildiği belli oluyordu. Wilson’un yanına gidip adamı kollarının üst kısmından sımsıkı kavradı.
es: Miré a Tom y vi que se le tensaban bajo la chaqueta los músculos de la espalda. Fue hacia donde estaba Wilson y, deteniéndose ante él, lo cogió con fuerza por los brazos.
vi_translation: Observing Tom, I noticed the muscles on his back tensing up under his coat. He quickly walked towards Wilson, stood right in front of him, and wrapped his arms tightly around him.
tr_translation: I looked at Tom, it was evident that his back muscles were tensed under his jacket. He went over to Wilson and grabbed the man tightly by his upper arms.
es_translation: I looked at Tom and saw the muscles in his back tense under his jacket. He went towards where Wilson was and, stopping in front of him, grabbed him firmly by the arms.

en: “You’ve got to pull yourself together,” he said with soothing gruffness.
vi: "Anh cần phải trấn tỉnh lại." Tom nói bằng giọng vỗ về thô lỗ.
tr: “Kendini toplamalısın!” derken sesi hem sert, hem de yatıştırıcıydı.
es: —Tiene que sobreponerse —dijo con brusquedad, para tranquilizarlo.
vi_translation: "You need to calm down." Tom said in a rough soothing voice.
tr_translation: "You need to pull yourself together!" he said, his voice both stern and soothing.
es_translation: —You have to get a grip —he said brusquely, to reassure him.

en: Wilson’s eyes fell upon Tom; he started up on his tiptoes and then would have collapsed to his knees had not Tom held him upright.
vi: Đôi mắt của Wilson nhận ra Tom, anh ta đứng nhướng người lên trên những ngón chân nhưng sau đó lại sụm xuống đầu gối nếu như Tom không đỡ anh ta đứng thẳng.
tr: Wilson başını kaldırıp baktı, parmaklarının ucunda yükselmeye çalıştı. Tom tutmasa dizleri bükülecek, düşecekti.
es: Los ojos de Wilson repararon en Tom. Se levantó sobre la punta de los pies y, si Tom no lo hubiera sujetado, se habría desplomado de rodillas.
vi_translation: Wilson's eyes recognized Tom, he stood up on his tiptoes but then collapsed to his knees if Tom hadn't supported him to stand upright.
tr_translation: Wilson lifted his head and tried to rise on his tiptoes. If Tom hadn't held him, his knees would have buckled, and he would have fallen.
es_translation: Wilson's eyes fixed on Tom. He rose up on his tiptoes, and if Tom hadn't caught him, he would have collapsed to his knees.

en: “Listen,” said Tom, shaking him a little. “I just got here a minute ago, from New York. I was bringing you that coupé we’ve been talking about. That yellow car I was driving this afternoon wasn’t mine—do you hear? I haven’t seen it all afternoon.”
vi: "Nghe đây" Tom nói, lay Wilson một chút. "Tôi mới từ New York tới đây chừng một phút. Tôi mang cho anh chiếc xe cúp mà chúng ta đã thảo luận. Chiếc xe màu vàng mà tôi lái chiều nay không phải của tôi. Anh có nghe tôi nói không? Tôi đã không nhìn thấy nó nguyên cả chiều nay rồi."
tr: “Dinle beni!” dedi Tom onu sarsarak, “New York’tan az evvel geldim. Sana söz verdiğim spor arabayı getiriyordum. Bugün öğlen kullandığım o sarı otomobil benim değildi. Anlıyor musun? Onu saatlerdir görmedim.
es: —Oiga —dijo Tom, zarandeándolo—. Acabo de llegar de Nueva York hace un momento. Le traía el cupé del que habíamos hablado. El coche amarillo que yo conducía esta tarde no es mío. ¿Me oye? No lo he visto en toda la tarde.
vi_translation: "Listen here," Tom said, shaking Wilson a little. "I just got here from New York about a minute ago. I brought you the coupe we discussed. The yellow car I was driving this afternoon isn't mine. Did you hear what I said? I haven't seen it all afternoon."
tr_translation: “Listen to me!” said Tom, shaking her, “I just came from New York. I was bringing you the sports car I promised. The yellow car I was driving this afternoon wasn't mine. Do you understand? I haven't seen it for hours.”
es_translation: —Listen —said Tom, shaking him—. I just arrived from New York a moment ago. I brought the coupe we had talked about. The yellow car I was driving this afternoon is not mine. Do you hear me? I haven't seen you all afternoon.

en: Only the negro and I were near enough to hear what he said, but the policeman caught something in the tone and looked over with truculent eyes.
vi: Chỉ có anh chàng da đen và tôi đứng gần để có thể nghe được những gì Tom nói, nhưng người cảnh sát hình như đã đoán được gì đó qua giọng nói nên dõi mắt nhìn với cặp mắt hung hăng.
tr: Söylediklerini yalnız ben ve o iyi giyimli zenci duymuştuk. Ama polis Tom’un ses tonunda kuşku uyandıran bir şeyler keş­fetmiş olmalı ki sert bakışlarını bize doğru çevirdi.
es: El negro y yo éramos los únicos que estábamos lo suficientemente cerca para oír lo que decía Tom, pero el policía captó algo en el tono de la voz y nos miró con ojos hostiles.
vi_translation: Only the black guy and I stood close enough to hear what Tom was saying, but the policeman seemed to have guessed something from the tone of voice and watched with aggressive eyes.
tr_translation: Only I and that well-dressed black man had heard what he said. But the police must have discovered something suspicious in Tom's tone of voice, as they turned their stern gaze towards us.
es_translation: The black man and I were the only ones close enough to hear what Tom was saying, but the policeman caught something in the tone of his voice and looked at us with hostile eyes.

en: “What’s all that?” he demanded.
vi: "Chuyện gì thế?" Anh ta hỏi.
tr: “Orada neler oluyor?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Qué pasa ahí? —preguntó.
vi_translation: "What's going on?" he asked.
tr_translation: “What is happening there?” he asked.
es_translation: —What's going on there? —he asked.

en: “I’m a friend of his.” Tom turned his head but kept his hands firm on Wilson’s body. “He says he knows the car that did it… It was a yellow car.”
vi: "Tôi là bạn của anh ta." Tom quay đầu lại trả lời nhưng hai tay vẫn nắm chặt lấy Wilson. "Anh ta nói anh ta biết chiếc xe đã gây ra tai nạn. Nó là chiếc xe màu vàng."
tr: “Orada neler oluyor?” diye sordu. Tom başını çevirdi ama ellerini Wilson’un bedenin­den ayırmadı. “Ben bu adamın yakın arkadaşıyım. Kazayı ya­pan otomobili gördüğünü söylüyor da... sarı bir arabaymış.
es: —Soy amigo suyo —Tom volvió la cabeza, pero sus manos siguieron sosteniendo con firmeza el cuerpo de Wilson—. Dice que conoce el coche del accidente… Ha sido un coche amarillo.
vi_translation: "I am his friend." Tom turned his head to answer but his hands still tightly gripped Wilson. "He said he knew the car that caused the accident. It was a yellow car."
tr_translation: “What is happening there?” he asked. Tom turned his head but did not take his hands off Wilson's body. “I am a close friend of this man. He says he saw the car that caused the accident... it was a yellow car.”
es_translation: —I am his friend —Tom turned his head, but his hands continued to firmly hold Wilson's body—. He says he knows the car from the accident… It was a yellow car.

en: Some dim impulse moved the policeman to look suspiciously at Tom.
vi: Hơi có một chút thúc đẩy trong lòng, người cảnh sát nhìn Tom một cách nghi ngờ.
tr: Polis anlaşılması güç bir dürtüyle Tom’a kuşku içinde baktı.
es: Por algún instinto indeterminado el policía consideró sospechoso a Tom.
vi_translation: A slight urge arose in his heart, and the police officer looked at Tom suspiciously.
tr_translation: The police looked at Tom with suspicion, driven by an impulse that was hard to understand.
es_translation: By some indeterminate instinct, the police officer considered Tom suspicious.

en: “And what colour’s your car?”
vi: "Còn xe của anh là màu gì?"
tr: “Araban ne renk?” diye sordu.
es: —¿Y de qué color es su coche?
vi_translation: "And what color is your car?"
tr_translation: "What color is your car?" he asked.
es_translation: —And what color is his car?

en: “It’s a blue car, a coupé.”
vi: "Màu xanh dương, loại xe cúp."
tr: “Mavi, mavi spor.
es: —Azul. Es un cupé.
vi_translation: "Blue color, type of cub bike."
tr_translation: “Blue, blue sport.”
es_translation: —Blue. It's a coupe.

en: “We’ve come straight from New York,” I said.
vi: "Chúng tôi đi từ New York tới." Tôi nói.
tr: “New York’tan henüz geldik” dedim.
es: —Hemos llegado directamente de Nueva York —dije.
vi_translation: "We traveled from New York." I said.
tr_translation: "We just arrived from New York," I said.
es_translation: —We have come directly from New York —I said.

en: Someone who had been driving a little behind us confirmed this, and the policeman turned away.
vi: Có ai đó đã từng đi sau xe chúng tôi xác nhận điều này, và thế là người cảnh sát quay đi.
tr: Yolda arkamızdan gelen arabalardan birinin bunu doğrulaması üzerine, polis yanımızdan uzaklaştı.
es: Uno que durante un tramo nos había seguido con su coche confirmó lo que yo decía, y el policía dio media vuelta.
vi_translation: Someone who had been driving behind our car confirmed this, and so the police officer turned away.
tr_translation: Upon one of the cars behind us on the road confirming this, the police moved away from us.
es_translation: One person who had followed us with his car for a while confirmed what I was saying, and the police officer turned around.

en: Picking up Wilson like a doll, Tom carried him into the office, set him down in a chair, and came back.
vi: "Bây giờ, nếu anh để cho tôi ghi lại cái tên cho đúng..." Vác Wilson lên như một con búp bê, Tom khiêng anh ta vào trong văn phòng, đặt anh ta ngồi xuống ghế, rồi quay ra.
tr: Wilson’u bir bebek gibi kucaklayıp kaldırarak yazıhanesine sokan Tom, onu bir iskemleye oturtup yanımıza geldi.
es: Cogiendo a Wilson como a un muñeco, Tom lo metió en la oficina, lo sentó en una silla y volvió.
vi_translation: Wilson was lifted like a doll, Tom carried him into the office, sat him down on a chair, then turned around and left.
tr_translation: Tom, who lifted Wilson like a baby and carried him into the office, sat him down on a chair and came over to us.
es_translation: Grabbing Wilson like a doll, Tom put him in the office, sat him in a chair, and returned.

en: “If somebody’ll come here and sit with him,” he snapped authoritatively. He watched while the two men standing closest glanced at each other and went unwillingly into the room. Then Tom shut the door on them and came down the single step, his eyes avoiding the table. As he passed close to me he whispered: “Let’s get out.”
vi: "Nếu có ai tới đây ngồi với anh ta." Tom nói như ra lịnh. Tom đưa mắt nhìn khi hai người đàn ông đang đứng gần đó nhất liếc mắt nhìn nhay rồi miễn cưỡng bước vào trong phòng. Tom khép cửa phòng lại sau lưng họ rồi bước xuống một bậc, cặp mắt của anh nhìn về hướng chiếc bàn. Khi đi gần đến tôi anh thì thào "Đi ra thôi."
tr: “Birisi şuraya gelip adamcağızın yanına otursun” dedi buyurgan bir sesle. En yakındaki iki adam birbirlerinin yüzüne bakıp isteksiz adımlarla içeriye yöneldiler. Onlar kapıdan girinceye kadar da bakışlarını üstlerinden ayırmadı bizimki. Sonra aradaki kapıyı kapayıp masaya bakmamaya çalışarak bir çırpıda yanımıza geldi. “Haydi çıkalım buradan” diye fısıldadı yanımdan geçerken.
es: —Por favor, que alguien venga a hacerle compañía —soltó con verdadera autoridad. Se mantuvo vigilante hasta que los dos hombres que estaban más cerca intercambiaron una mirada y entraron de mala gana en el cuarto. Tom cerró entonces la puerta, bajó el único escalón y evitó mirar hacia la mesa del garaje. Cuando pasó a mi lado, murmuró: —Vámonos.
vi_translation: "If someone comes here to sit with him." Tom said as if giving an order. Tom glanced as the two men standing closest exchanged looks and then reluctantly stepped into the room. Tom closed the door behind them and then stepped down a level, his eyes directed towards the table. As he got closer to me, he whispered, "Let's go."
tr_translation: “Someone come here and sit next to the poor man,” he said in an authoritative voice. The two men closest to each other looked at each other's faces and reluctantly headed inside. Our guy didn't take his eyes off them until they entered through the door. Then he closed the door in between and came to us in one swift move, trying not to look at the table. "Let's get out of here," he whispered as he passed by me.
es_translation: —Please, someone come and keep him company —he commanded with genuine authority. He remained vigilant until the two men who were closest exchanged a look and reluctantly entered the room. Tom then closed the door, stepped down the single step, and avoided looking toward the garage table. When he passed by me, he murmured: —Let's go.

en: Self-consciously, with his authoritative arms breaking the way, we pushed through the still gathering crowd, passing a hurried doctor, case in hand, who had been sent for in wild hope half an hour ago.
vi: Ngượng ngùng lúng túng, với đôi cánh tay đầy quyền uy khua dạt mở đường của Tom, chúng tôi lách qua đáng đông vẫn đông người, ngang qua một bác sĩ đang bước đi hối hả, trên tay cầm đồ nghề được cho gọi tới vào khoảng nửa giờ trước với hy họng hão huyền.
tr: Güçlü kollarıyla önümüz sıra yol açarak, birikmeye devam eden kalabalığı yararken elinde çantasıyla hızla içeri giren, yarım saat önce umutsuz bir çabayla çağrılmış, doktorun yanından geçti.
es: Tímidamente, pero con la autoridad de los brazos de Tom para abrirnos paso, avanzamos a través del grupo de gente, que seguía aumentando, y dejamos atrás a un médico que llegaba a toda prisa con su maletín en la mano, y al que habían llamado media hora antes en un arranque de disparatada esperanza.
vi_translation: Embarrassed and awkward, with Tom's authoritative arms clearing the way, we squeezed through the still-crowded throng, passing by a doctor hurrying along, carrying his tools, having been called about half an hour earlier with vain hopes.
tr_translation: As he made his way through the ever-growing crowd with his strong arms, clearing a path ahead of us, he quickly entered with his bag in hand, passing by the doctor who had been summoned in a desperate attempt half an hour earlier.
es_translation: Timidly, but with the authority of Tom's arms to clear the way, we advanced through the group of people, which continued to grow, and left behind a doctor who was arriving in a hurry with his briefcase in hand, and who had been called half an hour earlier in a burst of wild hope.

en: Tom drove slowly until we were beyond the bend—then his foot came down hard, and the coupé raced along through the night. In a little while I heard a low husky sob, and saw that the tears were overflowing down his face.
vi: Tom lái xe một cách chậm chạp cho tới khi chúng tôi qua khỏi con đường vòng, sau đó anh ta đưa chân nhấn mạnh tăng tốc độ, chiếc xe cúp lao đi vào trong bóng đêm. Sau một lát tôi nghe tiếng sụt sùi thấp khàn khàn và tôi trông thấy những giọt lệ đang rơi dàn dụa trên khuôn mặt của Tom.
tr: Az ilerdeki dönemece varıncaya kadar yavaş gittik. Sonra Tom aniden gaza bastı ve araba karanlığın içinden ok gibi fırladı. Bastırmaya çalıştığı hıçkırıklarını duyunca gözyaşlarının yanaklarından aşağıya doğru süzüldüğünü gördüm.
es: Tom condujo despacio hasta que pasamos la curva. Entonces pisó a fondo el acelerador y el cupé se adentró en la noche a toda velocidad. Poco después oí un sollozo ronco, contenido, y vi que las lágrimas le corrían por la cara.
vi_translation: Tom drove slowly until we passed the roundabout, then he pressed the accelerator hard, and the car sped into the darkness. After a while, I heard a low, muffled sobbing sound and saw tears streaming down Tom's face.
tr_translation: We went slowly until we reached the upcoming bend. Then Tom suddenly stepped on the gas and the car shot forward like an arrow through the darkness. When I heard the sobs she was trying to suppress, I saw tears streaming down her cheeks.
es_translation: Tom drove slowly until we passed the curve. Then he floored the accelerator and the coupe sped into the night at full speed. Shortly after, I heard a rough, stifled sob, and saw tears streaming down his face.

en: “The God damned coward!” he whimpered. “He didn’t even stop his car.”
vi: "Tên hèn hạ khốn nạn!" Tom thút thít. "Hắn không thèm ngừng xe."
tr: “Kahrolası ödlek!” diye söyleniyordu hırsla, “Durup bakmamış bile.
es: —¡Maldito cobarde hijo de puta! —gimoteó—. Ni siquiera paró.
vi_translation: "You despicable coward!" Tom sobbed. "He didn't even stop the car."
tr_translation: “Damn coward!” he muttered angrily, “He didn't even stop to look.”
es_translation: —Damn cowardly son of a bitch! —he whimpered—. He didn't even stop.

en: The Buchanans’ house floated suddenly toward us through the dark rustling trees. Tom stopped beside the porch and looked up at the second floor, where two windows bloomed with light among the vines.
vi: Căn nhà của gia đình Buchanan đột nhiên trôi về phía chúng tôi qua bóng đen xào xạc của những hàng cây tối đen. Tom ngừng xe bên cạnh hiên nhà và ngước nhìn lên lầu hai nơi hai chiếc cửa sổ đang rực sáng ánh đèn giữa những hàng dây leo.
tr: Buchanan’ların malikanesi, karanlık ağaç gövdeleri ara­sından aniden beliriverdi. Tom taraçada durup yukarıya baktı. İkinci kattaki iki pencereden saçılan ışık, sarmaşıkların arasından süzülüyordu.
es: La casa de los Buchanan flotó de improviso hacia nosotros a través del rumor y la oscuridad de los árboles. Tom se detuvo ante el porche y miró a la segunda planta, donde dos ventanas se abrían iluminadas entre las enredaderas.
vi_translation: The Buchanan family's house suddenly drifted towards us through the rustling shadows of the dark trees. Tom stopped the car beside the porch and looked up at the second floor where two windows were brightly lit amidst the vines.
tr_translation: The Buchanan's mansion suddenly appeared through the dark tree trunks. Tom stood on the terrace and looked up. Light streaming from two windows on the second floor filtered through the ivy.
es_translation: The Buchanan's house suddenly floated towards us through the murmur and darkness of the trees. Tom stopped in front of the porch and looked up at the second floor, where two windows opened illuminated among the vines.

en: “Daisy’s home,” he said. As we got out of the car he glanced at me and frowned slightly.
